Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Florist”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: I am from NY and was planning a destination wedding in Hawaii on a beach near the Turtle Bay Resort. My wedding coordinator recommended using the Florist at Turtle Bay since we would be a lot closer to the hotel to pick up our flowers instead of using a florist in Honolulu. I was a little hesitant ordering my bouquet without having a meeting to pick out what I would like, but after talking with Liz I felt very comfortable and confidant I made the right choice. Liz took the time to email and call me to discuss what I was looking for, she gave me several suggestions and recommendations that helped me decide exactly what I wanted. She was so sweet and helpful I could not asked for a better long distance experiance! I just had my wedding last week and was very satisfied with the end result. It was a pleasure working with Liz, she made the preparation for my special day easy and stress free! I would definately recommending with with Liz at the Turtle Bay Florist!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii heaven”
Reviews.Author: CaliTica
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay resort is a beautiful peaceful place to relax. The staff is professional and the restaurants are really good. The drinks aren't too expensive like at the Waikiki hotels. The beaches are nice and the sand is soft. Olas is a great place to have a romantic dinner and there's plenty of space to take a long walk. It was great

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: tandempsz
Reviews.Content: There's hardly a more beautiful setting than the tip of the North Shore where Turtle Bay Resort is located. It's as beautiful as I remembered it from a visit about 20 years ago. Unfortunately, the room where my sister and I stayed doesn't seem to have been updated in those two decades. The lighting was poor, and the cabinets in the spacious bathroom dinged and chipped. Unfortunately, the phone in the room was not working when we checked in. Neither was the one near the elevator that we needed to use to call security when a balky lock kept me shivering in the AC in the hallway in my wet bathing suit. The view from our balcony was sensational, however, and we had a great lunch at the beachfront restaurant Ola and a great dinner at 21 Degrees north.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise awaits!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtooshort
Reviews.Content: My wife and went to TBR for our honeymoon for one week in august. The hotel is on the north side of the island, secluded from all the craziness of Honolulu and Waikiki beach. We rented a car, which I would strongly recommend, so moving around wasn't a problem at all. There is a good transit system, however, for less than $200 a week for a car rental, to us it was a no brainer. The hotel is nice, well kept and cared for. A bit updated, but the views....wow...the views. I would't care if I'd slept on the floor, the views and the beaches around the complex are absolutely stunning. Miles and miles of sandy beaches, with not a soul in site. That's why we chose this place. The restaurants are a bit pricey, so if you're on a budget, Costco or Walmart should be on your first stop. We stocked our fridge with breakfast stuff and booze, and we were good to go. Go figure, we're in the middle of the Pacific and still way cheaper than B.C.. For lunch, if you don't want to stay in the resort, the shrimp trucks are a good alternative. Just a short drive from the hotel, there's lots to choose from.If you're into golfing, then this is the definitely the place for you. Two courses to choose from, with incredible scenery. Night life is almost non-existent on the resort. There is a decent pub/bar/nightclub-The Surfer. The Polynesian cultural centre is only a 20 min drive, and IT'S A MUST. If you're planning to drive or transit it to Honolulu or Waikiki Beach, plan around rush hour, otherwise you'll be spending a good part of your well deserved vacation in traffic. Overall, if the resort has any issues, which by the way I had none, all you have to do is just look outside your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: xzander1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort on honeymoon and were there for ten days in all. The resort has a couple of golf courses but there is thankfully far more to this place than just golf. The local beaches and the facilities on site are second to none and you may find yourself staying there for days on end without needing or wanting to see the outside world. There are a huge amount of things to do here, even if you’re not a golfer, with horse riding, helicopter rides, a spa, gym and surf lessons available. I’m sure I’ve missed a bunch of stuff out but I just listed the things we did. The food is great – all the restaurants are worth trying at least once but I would especially recommend Lei Lei’s next to the golf course for the tremendous food and friendly service. Ola is also quite incredible. The pool is really nice and the staff serving drinks and food were all really friendly and welcoming. Everyone seemed keen to put themselves out for us no matter how small the request. Prices - to my eyes - were reasonable, although we were paying with sterling which may have skewed my perspective. Our room was large, luxurious and spotless. At no point did we feel anything other than pampered and comfortable. Our view out to sea truly was beautiful – we got a grandstand view of some spectacular sunsets and also some incredible rainbows when the weather got unpredictable. It’s an ideal location from which to explore the northern coast of the island – Honolulu and Waikiki are over an hours’ drive though. It really is a quite remote location and all the famous beaches for surfing are nearby. We had an amazing time at this luxurious resort. Hawai’I was probably a once-in-a-lifetime thing for us but we would recommend Turtle Bay to anyone considering visiting it.

Reviews.Title: “Getting away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: vacationhereIcome
Reviews.Content: We split our visit to Oahu between the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and the North Shore. After being in Waikiki for the first half of our trip, it was great to escape for total relaxation at Turtle Bay. Our experience at this resort was quite good, but you have to go in knowing what to expect. If you are expecting modern luxury with 5-star attentive service, this is not the place for you. If you are looking to relax in "old" Hawaii with a laid back atmosphere in a beautifully peaceful setting, then Turtle Bay is the right choice. Upon arriving at the resort, the bell hops just sort of stood around and waved from their station. No warm aloha greeting to speak of. Check-in was just as cold. We've been more warmly and enthusiastically greeted at a standard Doubletree than we were here. A little disappointing and not what one would expect from a beach resort. We were given our keys and told where to park (the cottages have their own parking area) and off we went to schlep our own luggage and find our way to the cottage. Things changed for the better when our "personal" concierge arrived a few minutes after we settled in. He greeted us with some fruit and cold bottles of water, we chatted a bit and he shared some of the available amenities and history of the area. It's just too bad that the service wasn't more at this level from start to finish. Mostly the service was hit or miss during our stay depending on who you encountered. The cottages are set off from the main resort area and are definitely worth the extra cost. The rooms are certainly in need of some updating, but were still clean and comfortable, providing all of the amenities one would expect from a resort. The restroom had two sinks and a separate shower and soaking tub. There was plenty of counter space for two people. There is a sitting area leading to the lanai that is set a few steps down from where the beds are. It has a small sofa, coffee table, refrigerator, and a desk. The cottages are set just off of the water with a grassy area that leads right to them from the beach. We had a splendid view of the ocean and could enjoy this right from the room or from the lanai. My favorite spot was the hammock that hung just a few steps from our lanai. Housekeeping did a great job at cleaning the rooms, and they were always very friendly. The breakfast buffet was outstanding with offerings such as the standard breakfast fare/omlet station, fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, a variety of juices, along with some Japanese selections too. For those looking for a lighter breakfast, there is also a small coffee bar near the main lobby that offers a different selection of coffees, tea, cold cereal, pastries, and other snacks. We had all of our meals at the resort. Everything else was good, nothing great, just good. We also dined at the table from our lanai on our last night there. What a way to remember the North Shore - taking in the sunset while enjoying a meal just steps from the ocean. The spa services were pretty good, but not what I was expecting of a resort. It felt more like a salon type spa more than a beach resort spa. The massage was enjoyable, but nothing exceptional about the experience overall. Now the beach, oh the beach... Although somewhat small, it was near perfect. There were plenty of chairs and umbrellas and since it is within a small bay, it was perfect for swimming and snorkeling. We loved the beach and preferred it over the pool which was crowded and had lots of children running around. However, the pool bar is a great place to enjoy some drinks and lunch. It was fun to eat and watch as surfers bravely went up against the ominous waves on their boards. The grounds throughout were lush and well maintained. Breathtaking views can be had from almost anywhere you stand. There are plenty of places to stroll around and enjoy the natural beauty of the area. I would recommend taking the walk just south of the resort that goes past the horse corrals. It is a nature path along the shore that is just wonderful. We regretted not taking the horseback riding tour that is offered. Perhaps next time. We did do the helicopter tour that circled the entire island. This tour is available right from the hotel and is a short golf cart ride to the other side of the resort nearest the villas. The pilot was very professional and we enjoyed amazing views as we flew over the island. Overall, we enjoyed Turtle Bay and would definitely return with the hopes that some of the employees are better trained in providing resort quality service. This didn't really detract from our stay, but was slightly disappointing given the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area and great location”
Reviews.Author: weenone
Reviews.Content: This resort is fairly upscale, although older and the rooms (especially the bathrooms) need a little updating. It's a great resort unless you are super picky. The closet had a strong moldy odor so we didn't use it. That aside, we (2 adults, 2 kids) really enjoyed staying there. The pools are awesome and not at all crowded. Also great is the cove for swimming and a little snorkeling. We saw sea turtles at two locations on the resort. I recommend renting a car so you can see other area beaches and Haleiwa, a historic town just down the road. There is also a fruit stand on the road between the resort and Haleiwa that had great sliced mango and bags of assorted sliced fruit - I got to try fruit I normally wouldn't have. I also recommend eating at Ola, which is located on the beach. Their prices were more reasonable than other restaurants at the resort and the food and service were great. Also, shop at the store located on the pool level. I thought it would be expensive so avoided it at first, but when I did stop in I realized I'd been paying way too much in Haleiwa. The prices are great and they also sell alcohol so you don't have to hang out in the bars if you want a drink. In all, it was a fantastic trip. We all enjoyed the resort and fell in love with the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Queiter, Quirky side of the island!”
Reviews.Author: NWGAL61
Reviews.Content: The drive from the airport to the resort was stunning oceanfront, beautiful trees & a whole lot of nature.The resort is a beautifully landscaped chunk of the quiet side of the island. Check in was pretty quick & parking was relatively close. Our studio was perfect for 2 people, nice kitchenette. Our views were great from the room although the "deck" was a mere three feet by 2 feet. No furniture out there as there was not room. We tried all the food on site & really didn't think any of them were terrific! The beach was not crowded & many were snorkeling to look at the sea life.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Saved Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Gerard D
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon was heading towards disaster when we checked into the Hilton Hawaiian Village (see review). Seeking a quiet, laid back alternative, I frantically called Turtle Bay and explained our situation to Kristen at the front desk. Kristen got us a room, albeit a double queen bed, and said she would hold our room till we got there. So we packed our suitcases (again) and headed North to Kahuka. We made it in under an hour and Kristen was there to greet us with open arms. Not only did she have a room held, but she managed to get us an ocean view room with a king sized bed...in less than an hour. She also promised to send up a bottle of champagne since it was our honeymoon. Compared to the service we were shown at the Hilton, this was a breath of fresh air. Since we arrived in the middle of night, we had no idea what the location looked like or what views we had. The room was large, had two sinks and a shower/tub. We had a good sized balcony where we heard the sound of the ocean. Each room has sliding doors that lead to your balcony. You also have the option to leave the door open and pull back these large wooden shutters. It was nice to sleep with doors open each night. When morning broke we were treated with gorgeous views of the ocean and perfect sunset photo ops. We were extremely happy with the pool, the nearby beaches and the food. The restaurants on the grounds are a bit pricey but thats expected for resort eats. There's plenty to do and see on TB property. Miles of hiking trails along the coast, horseback riding...etc. Hawaii's infamous shrimpmtrucks are about a mile away and made for some reasonably priced dining. Upon checkout, we told the front desk we had an extremely late flight. Theynallowed us to check out later in the day and even gave us use of a hospitality room so we could freshen up after utiling the beach and pool on our last day. If you want a quiet place to go on Oahu than Turtle Bay is for you. If you want hoards of people and hour long waits for elevators, towels and pools, then go to that other place in Waikiki

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: OatmealCeiling
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Turtle Bay and I love the North Shore. The location of the resort is fantastic and we had beautiful views of the ocean. It's a great break from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki if you're visiting Oahu. I thought the staff was friendly and courteous but I would say it was very good, not excellent. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was also very spacious, with 2 separate vanities. On my last visit, we had a beach cottage and we loved it. There is plenty to do in the area and Haleiwa is a short (20 min in no traffic) drive away so it's really worth it for the peace, tranquility and a taste of the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Great destination to escape to”
Reviews.Author: leeandtony
Reviews.Content: A wonderful balance of resort facilities (large pool, bar, supplies shop, golf course, restaurants) while still remote from the hustle and bustle of city life. Lagoon wonderfully safe snorkling space for families. Bikes for rent. Scrubland paths to wander through. Rockpools. Expansive beaches either side of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: city2country
Reviews.Content: We spent last week here for our 20th anniversary. The lobby is nothing less than breathtaking and upon arrival, I knew I had made the right choice about staying here. Check in was friendly and quick and since an upgrade wasn't available, she said she'd give us the best room she had. We were on the 5th floor with no view obstruction overlooking the pool and ocean. It was truly beautiful. The room was in definetely need of a face lift - but I had read other reviews and was prepared for that that. The tiles were chipping in the bathroom and the paint really needs to be freshened up in the rest of the room, but otherwise it was fine. The safe was a nice size and the HUGE closet was a bonus! We ended up eating at the resort more than we expected to, due to the prices, but the food was exceptional and therefore, paying those prices didn't bother me too much. For breakfast we stuck with Lei-Lei's. It was cheap, fast, and everyone was so friendly. We weren't at the resort enough to enjoy all the amenities they have to offer, but we did do the 1 hr helicopter ride and it was amazing! Highly recommend it and Josh, the pilot, was great. The only other thing we were disappointed about, other than the rooms needing updated, was the parking situation. I would think that if you are paying to stay at such a place, there should be reserved parking for us whether you are staying at the hotel, villa or cottage. Just because we were staying at the hotel, we didn't have a reserved spot and ended up parking WAAAY at the end of the resort every day - regardless of the time we got back there. Bottom line - this is a wonderful place, with friendly staff. I would DEFINETELY come back here, but would probably stay at a villa or cottage instead - in fact, we hope to bring the whole family back next year. Maholo, for a great time Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Breath Taking Uplift”
Reviews.Author: ipudah
Reviews.Content: I remember when this hotel was called the Kuilima, and it was the nicest resort on this side of the island. It was jammed packed, and we visited every summer for 6 years. It was a vacation away from home, with our family of 40. The memories we had are stilled treasured. Just this Labor Day Weekend it was our time to return except to a different resort with some of the familiar setting, but it had a new look that was inviting with every turn as you walked through the hotel. The ocean was the setting and surrounded by nothing but gorgeous breath taking views, it had us from the first glance. We dined to our hearts content from breakfast all the way up to dinner. We enjoyed the new night club that is the rage since it got built. What an attraction for this side of the island. The stables are still there, and the ride on the horse is not only serene, but the views as you gallop, " Awesome"! Kuilima was known for their Cabanas, and now we have cottages. The shops are a piece of work, because it caters to everyone, including children and babies. It was such a beautiful weekend, one that I shall remember for a long time to come. Are we returning ABSOLUTELY! This weekend was a surprise from my Hubby, what a Priceless gift he gave to me. What was the hit, there is a florist in the resort, and waiting for me when we checked in was a large basket of Roses, talk about a special message through flowers, it doesn't get any better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pints1ze
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Beach cottage for 5 nights in mid August. The room was very large with nice vaulted ceiling, big bed, nice bathroom with large tub and separate shower. Opposite the entrance are huge windows/sliding doors that give a wonderful view of the ocean. Everything was clean, and the maid and concierge staff did a great job. When we first arrived, we parked in the Beach cottage lot, left our bags, and went in search of our room; discovering we were pretty far from the lot - luckily our concierge arrived right behind us with a welcome basket and offered to grab our bags from our car. Thank you Jeremy!! We ate at Leonardo's. Hang Ten, and Ola's - and all were good. Hang Ten was very nice for just being very convenient - sitting down, enjoying a cocktail and grabbing a bite, listening to some live music or just watching the sunset or surfers. Our stay was amazing and I'm already looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “RELAX.....”
Reviews.Author: Love A
Reviews.Content: We were taking a drive around the island and stopped at Turtle Bay....layed by the pool and relaxed, had a mai tai and got in the pool and the hot tub before we headed back to Honolulu.....I kept thinking...I wish I could stay here for a week. I had dreams of reading books, playing in the ocean and the pool and doing a whole lot of nothing....don't get me wrong, Haliewa is right down the road as well as other places to venture out, but when I was here, I didn't want to go anywhere else. Service was great and they had no problem that we were just stopping by...I was there 22 years ago and it has only gotten better. Highly recommend if you want to get away from it all.....

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel and much to offer”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location and site. Rooms (spacious) with awesome view of ocean. Many activities to offer with variety of shops within hotel. Bed sheets and covers of finest quality, and a very comfortable sleep. Two side by side rooms with separate lavatories which were very convenient. If money is concern, food is very pricey. Food offsite 10 miles away. The staff was friendly and always accommodating. The only thing I would change would be to locate the coffee table somewhere in the bedroom, and not within the bathroom area. If money had not been an issue, I could easily spend my entire vacation at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thatch124
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Beach cottage for 5 nights during our honeymoon in June and can only offer praise to the wonderful turtle bay resort. Having read previous reviews (and as it was our honeymoon) we splashed on a Beach cottage, and if you're after a once in a lifetime trip then this is the room for you!! we arrived to a huge room just in time to sit on our patio and watch the sun set. The bathroom, bed and sitting area were all huge, we had a fridge in the room for all of the necessities (separate to the room service fridge), everything was impeccably clean and the view was to die for. Unfortunately the weather wasn't the greatest when we visited so we didn't get chance to take advantage of the pool and beach as much as we would have liked, however when we did the pool was big, plenty of loungers and had enough shallow and deep to keep everyone happy. We ate at Leanardo's which we wouldn't particular recommend, the same restaurant for the buffet breakfast which was ok but well over priced. We loved our meals on the beach at Ola's (expensive but great food) and Lei Leis, but our favourite during our stay was the Hang Ten snack bar which served great food and cocktails perfect to accompany that sunset (also watched a great fire show at Hang Ten which was free) We also took advantage of horse riding at the resort which was fun, watched paddle board racing, and enjoyed the hammocks outside our door on numerous occasions. All in all a wonderful stay and perfect location to relax after a few nights in Waikiki, would love to return one day!!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: stuart1023
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Turtle Bay and we were in the cottages again. They are a bit off the main area at the hotel, but very quiet and private. We used the beach and the pool. My only issue is that the pool is filled with children - so if you are an adult swimmer who like to do laps or swim for exercise - this pool isn't best. The beach area is wonderful and you can snorkel on premises. Perhaps the best off the road snorkeling is just down the road at Shark's Cove. We ate several times at the hotel and food and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone here - wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: pollyuae
Reviews.Content: i was really impressed with the resort - all rooms have sea view and although the rooms are basic - stayed in a deluxe room which i think means higher floor - the rooms have everything you need to enjoy your stay and are clean and comfortable. Snorkelling in the cove was great- particularly for beginners - and the beach was very popular with locals as well as hotel guests- but not too busy. Prices at restaurants were moderate but the quality and service was excellent . Am already planning our next trips and was sad to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - A Week in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: cheval54
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in paradise at the Turtle Bay Resort in Oahu (North Shore). Our vacation was originally planned for Maui, however I was able to purchase a direct flight to Oahu at a great price and decided to change islands at the last minute. All I knew was that I wanted to be away from the crowds of Honolulu. After reading many of the reviews for Turtle Bay on Trip Advisor, some good, some not; I booked a week at Turtle Bay in an oceanfront deluxe room (5th floor) with amazing views. Yes, the room needs a new coat of paint, and new furnishings; however, we were only in the room to sleep and shower, the rest of the time was spent by the pool, snorkeling, dining, using the fitness center, going to the spa, finding turtles on the beach, walking, and just being in total awe of the natural beauty of the resort and the north shore area. This is a 5 star resort for the friendliness of the staff, wonderful restaurants, and beautiful grounds; we will definitely go back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Kay W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful sea views in every direction. The hotel is large but felt much quieter than the one we stayed in in Waikiki. This made it feel more relaxing and calm. We did not have to queue for breakfast or checking in here and there were plenty of sun loungers. The rooms were large and not exactly luxurious, but perfectly adequate. My husband loved the golf course but you need to wear a collared polo type tshirt which he found out rather late!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort. Great views.”
Reviews.Author: Anibas44
Reviews.Content: Everything was as you see on the site. Check-in and customer service was great. Everyone was friendly - very welcoming to kids. We did the breakfast buffet which was amazing each day. Only small observation about the rooms. The view is great but you can tell they are getting a little worn around the seams. Some updating for the price you pay per room is probably a good idea soon. I would suggest self parking instead of valet to save money (parking lot is not far away). Shrimp trucks are also a great stop.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of updating/renovations”
Reviews.Author: TheMariasMA
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I will begin with the positives. The view from out ocean-facing room was absolutely breathtaking and we really enjoyed the very private balconies (no neighbors peeking in and not facing any other rooms) which helped us enjoy the extraordinary view. The beach area was pleasant and well-maintained despite being open to the public. The snorkeling experience there was enjoyable, although nothing compares to snorkeling in Kauai! These were the redeeming factors of our stay at Turtle Bay, however that was not enough to encourage us to return there in the future. The room was simply unacceptably outdated for a five-star resort. In fact, it was comparable to a motel room and often felt like one during our four-day stay there! I would not recommend this place for honeymooners who want a luxurious room to stay in- or to anyone who feels a nice washroom is essential for a restful stay, like ourselves. The bathroom was truly disappointing, from the old shower/tub to the tacky old yellow kleenex box and soap plate which looked as though they came from my grandmother's basement! I would recommend Turtle Bay Resort update their rooms soon otherwise they will be losing a lot more money than they would renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, good restaurants, excellent service..disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_travlr
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in the hotel portion of the resort do not set your expectations very high on the quality of the room. You will be highly disappointed when you check in. We stayed in a king ocean view, and while the view was breathtaking, the room itself was very dated and dreary. For a $300 room I would expect there to be some touched up paint..some wall decor, and maybe some furniture to fill the room?? Oh and maybe working amenities such as safe and refrigerator. If it wasn't for the location views and great service we would have checked right out b4 putting our bags down.

Reviews.Title: “Being away from it all”
Reviews.Author: Ellisu
Reviews.Content: Simply put, if your looking for relaxation and being away from the city life this is the place to stay. And don't complain about the drive to get there or the speed limits along the way. Instead, enjoy the peacefulness and admire the beauty of the drive and once you arrive, you will be in paradise. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa and it was just as peaceful there as it was at the hotel. We did not use the facilites, as we were adventuring out all day, but we we did have access to our own pool at the villa or we could have went to the hotel one which im sure was too busy! This is our 2nd time there and whenever we go to Oahu, we will continue to stay here each visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location”
Reviews.Author: europeanadventures
Reviews.Content: Stunning location, but all reviews about the resort needing a facelift are spot on. The rooms are spacious and we had a beautiful view over the pool & ocean but out bathroom was in desperate need of some TLC. We didnt eat in any of the resturants as they also all looked tired so you'll need a car to get around although plenty of great places to eat but not within walking distance. definitely worth spending time on the north shore of Oahu rather than just Wakiki.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, bring lots of money or a car or both!”
Reviews.Author: Nitepainter
Reviews.Content: We started out 30th anniversary here for three nights before flying on onver to Maui to meet the rest of the family. It's remote location and no$12 shuttle service means you have to rent a car to get there which adds $25 per night parking. It is truly beautiful and our room on the 6th floor had a balcony and a unmatched view of the sunset each night. If pounding surf keeps you up, close the glass door but we loved it. The rooms were clean, well kept and very comfortable. You can do anything you pretty much want to do at the resort but all of it comes with a price tag, and most of it is very expensive. We love Segways, they have them but compaired to tours in major citys that last 3 hours and cost around $70, here it was just 90 minutes for $100. I wanted to treat my wife to a spa treatment but with prices starting at $160, she would not hear of it. Happy hour does exsist but the island drinks are not included and are around $10 to $12 and something like a cheeseberger by the pool is $16. Coffee in the lobby each morning is there but at $3.50 a cup. It's a resort, it's Hawaii and it's expensive but if you want cheap, stay in the city at a motel. I'm not complaining, just be ready for lots of add on expenses. The on site restraunts are very good and again very expensive. It didn't matter as we just jumped in the car and within a couple of miles either way down the highway found some really great local places that were really fun. We had the buffet breakfast one morning and it was really good but it's inside, not all that special and to be honest, I've had better ones at resorts on Maui for the same price. The grounds were beautiful, we saw two weddings while we were there and what a wonderful place to get married. I don't know if we will ever go back, we had a great time but found we are not true resort people. Maybe if they had some kind of all inclusive deal or a much lower price but again, the place is great, maybe it's just not our kind of great. Nothing to do with this resort but locals on the North Shore are all in all very nice but they do have more than their share of "Locals" who make sure you know they are local and can make your trip less than wonderful. They'll have a nack for spotting rental cars and will break in and steal anything they can or just vandalize for the fun of it. I love the folks in Hawaii and again, not all the people on the North Shore are this way but I found far more of them here than on any other island.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to be around a ton of people.”
Reviews.Author: reiglet
Reviews.Content: ....but if you want to experience all of the beauty that Oahu has to offer, and don't want to be on over-crowded dirty beaches, this is where you want to be. My husband and I stayed here when we got married and couldn't have asked for a more relaxing wonderful place to stay. Our lanai was perfect overlooking the pool area and the ocean. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Poolside drinks were expensive (but fun!) and there is a limit on how many drinks you can buy at a time. Get a six-pack and take it to your room....or do what we did...go to walmart, buy a blender, get some mixers and alcohol and play bartender in your room. we had pina coladas all week - and with the fresh pineapple available at many roadside vendors you can't go wrong. THe beaches on the resort are beautiful and never crowded. At the time of our stay, (August 2009) the resort charged you for parking each day if you had a car but it wasn't unrealistic and we just figured it into the cost of our trip. Renting a car on the island is a must if you want to experience the island. We absolutely loved it....and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable First Trip to Turtle Bay - Would Do Again!”
Reviews.Author: AtomicCKR
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I’ve ever visited the Islands much less Turtle Bay Resort, and we really enjoyed ourselves! The staff here was very friendly, the rooms were clean and the amenities were absolutely beautiful. I can say without question that the surrounding area was the most naturally beautiful I’ve ever experienced. I’m hard-pressed to think of an occasion at turtle bay when we didn’t receive exceptional service. The only time was perhaps when we went for our guided horse ride and the folks were scrambling a bit because of staffing/booking/late-arrival issues. Even despite the delays, it was an incredible experience I won’t soon forget. We upgraded to a third floor room on the property’s west side which included a full deck and an ocean view where we could see the magnificent sunsets. I was a little turned-off by the roof located two floors below and which extends out several hundred square feet. For aesthetic purposes, it’s covered with volcanic red rock, but it was also littered with cups and cans, champagne corks and other debris. One important benefit to our room location, however, was that it was well insulated from ground noise. We were situated away from the pools and restaurant, and foot traffic, but we were still able to hear the ocean off in the distance. The walls were well insulated, almost concrete-like, but you could hear luggage and chairs in the floor above us. One other huge plus to our room was the quiet air conditioner! No window/wall mounted unit that clunks in the middle of the night. That drives me nuts! Nothing here is cheap, so prepare yourself. The convenience of room charges may result in sticker shock at the time of check out - so consider yourself warned. That said, though, I think it was fair value for a first trip. I would definitely stay here again, and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this place to close friends and family. If your budget allows, it might be well worth booking one of their beach cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Rooms were a little outdated”
Reviews.Author: GeoffShiv
Reviews.Content: We arrived here with some pretty high expectations but then again when something is classed as a 'resort' and when the prices are as expensive as they are you would expect it. The rooms are outdated. You can tell they have tried to update them but most of the bathroom looks like it is from the 1960's. The room was still fully functional, but you still see the rust in several places. The location is great. If you can steer yourself away from the resort and take the walking tracks to the other bays you will see plenty of turtles and get a good work out. If you have a car, make sure you drive around to the local areas and have a look too. The superette to the east of the resort makes some pretty damn good poke! Overall we were happy with our stay but it is more money than I would have liked to have paid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: ehsun18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights as part of our Honeymoon in April. Hotel is in a beautiful location with a great beach. Room was a good size with a sea view. Lovely to fall asleep to the sound of waves. Would recommend hiring a car as we didn't and travelling everywhere by bus can become a little tedious! Restaurants we found to be overpriced and the breakfast buffet was far to expensive for us to even entertain the idea. Charging $3 for a small bottle of water in the room is daylight robbery when you can buy a huge bottle in the local shop for 99c. We enjoyed the surfer bar and the concierge was very helpful in organising trips for us. Would have been nice if they had recognised we were on our honeymoon in some way as other hotels on our trip did. The local town of Haleiwa is lovely and we ended up eating here most days as the restaurants were a lot better value than in the resort. Tip: organise an airport transfer before u travel.... We were advised by our travel agent to just get a taxi at the airport which was a very scary experience after the driver had no idea where the hotel was, got completely lost and still charged us a fortune!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: esbee9
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five day stay at Turtle Bay. The rooms are beautiful and the resort is amazing! If you don't like crowds, this would be the place. Several onsite activities. Great snorkeling for beginners. Saw turtles! Husband and daughter enjoyed a round of golf. And the Mai Tais at Hang Ten should not be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: bhcsballmel
Reviews.Content: I just want to start off by saying I do a lot of researching before going on vacation, and I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews but this resort came highly recommended by a friend. We had a wonderful time at turtle bay! We booked a basic ocean view room that was on the lowest floor intending to upgrade but the hotel was at 90% capacity ( although didnt seem it) so weren't able to, but I actually liked being closer to the water. I thought not having a balcony would be an issue, but they have huge glass door that opens and you can listen to the waves and the view was amazing! The rooms were remodeled and were nice, the bathroom was a little dated but not dirty or anything. A few people mentioned the smell was musty but we didn't experience that at all. The beds were comfortable, we couldnt sleep late though due to the wood blinds didnt block the sun, i would definitely bring eye wear if thats a problem for you. Every room has an ocean view and we loved ths fact. It was also cool to see the surfers and i definitely would have learned had i not been pregnant. We rented a car at thrifty and was really cheap for the week ($197 without insurance), we got a dodge caliber and was perfect for the week. The north shore is far away from everything so you definitely have to rent a car for the best experience. We enjoyed being away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and turtle bay was very relaxed, more romantic, and felt secluded. I would recommend taking the ocean view highway route on the way to the resort and around the island, the ocean views never get old. FYI speeds here are very slow, we Dallas drivers had a hard time with this (35 mph). We never ate the resort buffet because didn't want to spend $25 bucks a person per day on breakfast, instead went most days to the fresh fruit stand a mile or so down the road. The fruit is. Fresh, cut up, cheap and amazing! Also tried Teds bakery and the donuts and pastries were pretty awesome, plus they have hot food to order and Prices were also reasonable. We did eat at the surfer bar the first night we were there and was decent, but 20 bucks for a personable pizza was high, I got the sushi which was good. Thy have karaoke in the bar which was entertaining. I would recommend the lai making at the resort, beautiful flowers, 5 bucks a person but you have to sign up in advance. I did get a prenatal massage which was not worth the $180 I paid for it. It was decent, but not as good as expected. We did take the nature trail and, although didn't see any turtles, had a great morning walk and enjoyed our little private beach. One of the excursions we did was the Mai Tai sunset cruise which was very reasonable (35 pp) and all you can drink Mai tais on tap which my husband took advantage of. We got great pictures of diamond head on the cruise. Our FAVORITE thing to do was the Chiefs Luau at Sea Life park! It is definitely worth the money and the chief makes everyone feel welcome, gets the crowd engaged. I would get there early so you can take advantage of the free extras, we got sidetracked and was late taking pictures of the amazing cliffs on the way there. I cannot say enough about the chief and the fire show was AMAZING!!! We also went to pearl harbor which was a good experience but takes all day, we did a lot of sight seeing, went to Waikiki a few days which is busy but good shopping. We also went to waimena falls which is $7 pp to get in, water really cold, but the waterfall was beautiful. The overall experience was a fabulous one and I would have to say the views on this island were amazing and my husband and I actually discussed moving there simply for this beautiful lanscape.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: eternalgringo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay resort in late 2009 (a little late on the review - sorry!) The location was stunning, fantastic beaches and not far from the lovely little village of Haleiwa. The resort is a great place to relax and enjoy the sun & surf. Service was good, rooms are a decent size with great views over the water. Not the best value for money, but probably one of the nicest resorts on this part of the island. I'd recommend taking a drive to Waimea falls and checking out the beautiful North Shore beaches

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as you'd like it to be”
Reviews.Author: neptunes_queen
Reviews.Content: Arrived using a Luxury Link deal for a junior suite. Turned out room was not available and they 'upgraded' us to an Ali'i suite. Sounded great! Room was large, 2200 sq ft but desperately in need of some TLC. Walls marked, rugs stained, shower door handle loose, bar area warped and dirty. By 8:30 am of the second morning, housekeeping and the front desk called several times to ask if they could help us move. After the second call, started to feel harried. Paid the bellman to move us by 9 to our new room a jr. suite...smelled of mildew/mold upon entry. Room is a very nice size, 750 sq ft, and view is great. The bathroom however...I have seen much better in holiday inn express! Outdated, dirty, chipped tile, plywood cabinets warped and stained, lighting horrific. I get that there are few to no choices on the north shore but it doesn't mean that people have like it. This resort could be so much better. Did get a chance to check out the cottages, much nicer overall. Clean, spacious, no smell, bathroom very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Snorkeling!”
Reviews.Author: rcmati
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Turtle Bay and had a fantastic time! The room was very clean, staff super friendly, and restaurants delicious! Things that were not great? - Half the staff could not tell us where the Adventure Center at Turtle Bay was... - Our ocean front king room was a bit bare. It looked like they pulled furniture out of it or something. The space was great, but it seemed odd. - Pricey Things that were great? -Snorkeling was fantastic! Saw lots of fish and coral! Not too crowded either! -Food was very good - pretty good service and made to order dishes were correct -Bed was comfy and shower/bathroom very clean -Pool was beautiful, very clean and well kept -Beaches were GORGEOUS and so picture worthy!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Turtle Bay!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh H
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 2nd stay at Turtle Bay ---- we splurged this time after we found a great deal on one of their oceanside cottages. Pros: Great location, Hammocks outside the cottages, view from the cottages, concierge service at the cottages, rooms are very nicely decorated, WiFi, large flat screen television, ipod/iphone dock, pool (especially, the kid's slide), comfortable beds, Grilled chicken sandwich at Leilei's are great, Host (Jeff) at Leilei's very nice as well, Ukulele lesson from Tutu Janet was fun, lots of activities to do on the property, Foodland grocery store is a 10 minute drive away (ask for the Kama'aina discount card). Cons: Food at resort is not very good (and very expensive), not really any restaurant alternatives in town. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: CJJamieson
Reviews.Content: We left Waikiki and drove up to Turtle Bay (1 hour ish) on great roads - a really nice drive actually - take the Island's perimeter roads (I THINK the 83 and 33) rather than Highway H1 and 2, and you get a stunning stunning drive along the coast. I wasn;t a big fan of Waikiki and was worried our 2 weeks Island Hopping could be a let down. No. Turtle Bay and surrounding areas were really really pretty and nice. We walked up the beach to the left of the hotel is you leave from reception and walked about 1.5 miles. We only saw 2 other people but LOADS of sea turtles - it was so nice! It felt unspoilt, it felt romantic and it looked like Hawaii did in my head before we rocked up to Viva Las Waikiki. Definitely do this! You don't need to walk that far - we'd seen about 10 turtles before we'd walked 200 yards, but the longer stretch felt really nice and private. We booked a Cabana on the Hotel's beach for 2 days of sun bathing. This was lovely, you don't get food and drink service at them but A) this is reflected in the price and B) The Hotel have a small beach restaurant a stonesthrow away from the cabanas. It felt nice and not too big to say that the Hotel is ~700 rooms. There were only 20 cabanas. Snorkel gear is free to borrow and it was amazing snorkelling around the bay looking at lots of sealife. A car is useful here (parking is free) as you can leave to visit the botanical gardens (where you can swim in a waterfall), Pipeline (THE surfing destination), and the nearby town of Haleiwa. We ate here most nights - some great restaurants! Jameson's was highly recommended but our favourite was Haleiwa Thai - best Thai curry I've ever had. The Hotel had 2 nice bars to drink in upon returning and felt omni-relaxing. Top Tip: Eat at the Hotel's golf club! Amazing Food & Service! Top Tip2: If you're there on a Thursday go to Surfers Bar @ The Hotel - they have speakers there ranging from Jack Johnson to the I'kau family. TopTip3: Theres a hidden Jacuzzi behind the pool to the right!

Reviews.Title: “North Shore luxury, perfect for a couple of nights.”
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a work trip in Sept 2010 ( sorry for late review). Loved it. Great room,spacious, good bathroom. There are some nice cottage style rooms here at higher price level if you are uo to it. Nice pool area, they do cocktails- yay. Great for a couple of nights, hire a car from Honolulu, drive up here, stay a couple and then drive to airport. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: barnesrules
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at turtle bay and all my husband and I can talk about is how awful it was and what a let down it turned out to be. It was for our honeymoon so we were hyped to stay there. Keep in mind, this review is coming from people who have stayed in European hostels- our expectations were high because we paid a lot of money for the service we thought we'd be getting. Yes, movies and tv have been filmed there, and as native New Yorkers, we know a lot of set design is used to transform places- it seems they used a lot of movie magic to make this place nice. First off, we had an ocean view room- the balcony was covered in bird droppings, the bed creaked everytime we moved, the pillows smelled like mold, and the sheets were stained. My absolute favorite part of the room was the awful shutters used to keep the sun out. Not so much- they were broken, paint was peeling off everywhere, and they did not serve a purpose as the sun woke us up every morning. A 4 star resort can't invest in black out shades like you'd find at any run of the mill hotel? Come on. The lamps didn't work, the phone was broken, the tv remote was broken, the AC vent was covered in dust, the room smelled like mold and mildew, and it was an awful color green. The bathroom was a real delight as well- the shower curtain- yes, curtain-did nothing to keep the water in- we had a lake every time after showering all over the beautifully chipped floor. Even small details like the soap holder and tissue box holder looked like they were purchased from a fire sale that an old motel 6 had in 1974. The food was terrible. The restaurants were completely over priced. Here's the clincher- there is a serious fruit fly infestation in Leonardo's- the spot of the daily breakfast buffet. I work in hospitality in New York, I know fruit flies mean disaster in the kitchen. I was so disgusted by it. They put citronella candles in the fruit display to try and keep them away- real classy. What happens then? They form a colony on the disgustingly dirty windows that haven't been washed in years. I find it truly amazing that my husband and I could walk the grounds and keep track of what improvements need to be made but the management hasn't. There are so many more complaints, but why bother listing them- from what management has responded to previous complaints here it seems they keep sayin the same thing- "come back after we renovate" no thank you. We took photos of all the items listed here, so it's all true, and can be backed up. Stay at the Marriott in Ko Olina- we did for a few days prior and it was amazing.... Oh and for the final kicker- the night before we checked out, there was a story on the news about a sewage leak in the water near the property, yet the hotel did not inform guests. Classy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting and grounds, but seems to cut a lot of corners.”
Reviews.Author: Tinyblackdot
Reviews.Content: First the good: this place is beautiful! The beaches, views, pools, it's in an awesome spot, and the only hotel around here. The staff at the resturant and check in are friendly and helpful, and maintence man is one of the nicest people I met on the island. Now the bad: rooms are in desperate need of updates, and carpets could use some cleaning, there are mini fridges, but no microwaves anywhere that we could find. No children's menus anywhere either. And no DVD players, which is a must for a family with kids. We also had some issues with the room, the first room we where in had some sort of generator or something in it, and shook the entire wall on one side of the bed, te noise was unbearable. The front desk was very apologetic, moved us rooms and have us complementary breakfast vouchers. The new room was clean and ready for us that afternoon, but the air conditioning was having issues and every night we where surprised by a flowing stream dripping out of the air conditioner. It happened 3 nights in a row. And the room never seemed to cool off. They also charge for EVERYTHING, put stuffed animals in your room and charge you if tountake them, or put bottles of water on the counter eith a tiny sighn that says they are $3 each. No beach umbrellas eaither. That being said, we enjoyed the lei making and pony ride, as well as the complementary snorkeling and beach area. If we come back we will probably be renting a vacation home, and will probably not come back here.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: erinbabyblue23
Reviews.Content: The only reason I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hotel rooms themselves are a tad outdated for the price you pay to stay there. Also, I requested two beds but they ended up not being able to give me what I had requested (not a huge shocker since in my reservation it said my request was not guaranteed). The problem was that I had to pay $50 to use one of their cots for 3 nights. If they can't give you what you requested 3 months prior, I feel they should give the cot for free. Having said that, there is NOTHING else negative I can say about this place. Although the rooms were a bit outdated, they were still nice and clean and every other part of the hotel was gorgeous. Their beach area was awesome and they give out snorkel gear to be used for one hour for free. Every time I stay at O'ahu in the future, I will only stay on the north shore at Turtle Bay Resort! North Shore is the ONLY way to go (it's worth the hour drive down south; so nice to be away from all of the thousands of tourists)! I had a wonderful experience with a very helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: lilkal
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go to hawaii for years but could not get my husband to go as the thought of the busy wIkkiki beach put him off. I researched the north shore and the reviews for this hotel and it did not disappoint, we will now go ba k. We had 4 nights here,a deluxe ocean view room on 6th floor which the views to wake up to we're heaven. There are so many facilities at the resort including a helicopter excursion. The buffet breakfast was good but expensive but we found Hawaii more expensive overall. the 2 rooms we had were not dated. Plain walls carpet bed desk and unit that house tv and wardrobe. The bathroom was nice it as a dressing area with a sink then you go through into a full bathroom with another sink which was great. Concierge service fantastic and is open from 7:oo am. the pool was nice and no worries Bout getting a sun bed Lthough lots of children were in the pool so we opted for the beach. If you got to the beach after 9:30 it was slim than you would get an umbrella but we never get one any way. Loads of beds though. The beach restaurant for food and mai tai brilliant and service good. Resort is about hour drive from airport and only downside was our flight got in after 9 and no car hire shops open so it cost $150 in a taxi. We hired a car the next day from enterprise who Re based at resort but we could not leave it at the airport so we had the return taxi fare as well. Definitely get a car if you want to see the island. We did pearl harbour which we got to around 8:15 no queues at all. The drive was around 45 mins with clear road signs to get there. We did shark diving in a cage arranged by hotel and stupidly we did this on the day before we left and the wind had picked up so we thought it was going to be cancelled so would advise not leaving this trip to last minute as if it does cancel you still have time to rearrange. ate at lei lei on site which was great but do recommend booking in advance. also at cholo a mexican in a town a out 20 mins away called haleiwa and also haleiwa joes see separate reviews. this was exactly how I imagined Hawaii to be and would go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Autumntraveller7
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Turtle Bay on the North Shore. We found the resort to be beautiful and the staff to be friendly and accommodating. I was a bit concerned that we arrived towards the end of the evening and were looking for a bite to eat, but not an expensive dinner. The Lobby Lounge had some great options.We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Although we found better places to snorkel during our trip, the free hour access to equipment was a nice treat, and, as we later discovered, rather unique. We found so many great beaches to explore in the area, as well as terrific access to many varied activities The turtles at Turtle Beach were amazing! We are already talking about a return trip

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little soul-less”
Reviews.Author: richeep
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure what to expect when I booked to stay at Turtle Bay. I have visited the north shore of O'ahu several times before and it is one of the most beautiful pieces of coastline in the world so I was excited to be staying here. What I was presented with was a slightly dated looking sixties hotel which seemed very corporate and impersonal and soul-less. The reception staff were very efficient but were not particularly welcoming and it was clear I was more a number to them rather than an individual. It doesn't cost anything to smile once in a while! I paid for a Deluxe Oceanfront room which was significantly more expensive than the standard rooms. The room was good quality in general and was well kept and clean, although just like my first impressions of the hotel, it was a little dated (particularly the bathroom which really needed a refurbishment). The room has everything you would expect from a resort hotel and has modern amenities in general. The balcony was worth paying extra for to sit out in the sun, but the views were disappointing - yes, I could see the sea, but I could also see a litter-strewn flat roof below. The cheaper rooms which didn't have a balcony appeared to have a better view. Wi-fi, parking and room safe were all included in the price of the room which was good. Everything else was an extra such as bottled water ($3 for a 300ml bottle - outrageous!) and even a toy fish left on the bed ($20). The complimentary bottle of chilled champaign left in the room upon our return from dinner was a nice surprise though! Foodland supermarket is a short drive down the road and great for getting a picnic to sit on the beach and watch the sunset. It also sells bottled water at approximately 1/4 of the price of the hotel water. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and very well manicured and the groundkeeping staff obviously work very hard to maintain them. The pools are small but well kept and the resort did not seem overcrowded which was really good. If you're looking for a resort hotel, then you won't have any problems here but European resort hotels are of a better standard and are far more welcoming. I think I would stay here again, but that's more to do with the location rather than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: przybylo4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our family vacation at Turtle Bay. The hotel is beautiful and quiet, the staff was extremely accommodating and the location is fabulous. Four of us stayed in a queen beach cottage room which was spacious and comfortable despite only having two beds and one bathroom. The buffet breakfast, which was included in our package, had enough variety to cater to all tastes, although it is expensive if you pay separately. We didn't much care for the dinner at Leonardo's but the poolside food and Ola was good. If you want to explore more of Oahu, you are removed from the mainstream and it is an hour drive to Honolulu but the scenery along the way is spectacular and the peaceful calm of Turtle Bay is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: MatthewK1
Reviews.Content: OK, first, we spent eleven days on Oahu, with seven of those days at this fabulous resort. We were looking for a true getaway for relaxation and we knew we wanted to avoid staying in busy Honolulu. This is our third time in Hawaii, having vacationed on Kauai and Maui previously. Though this was our first time on Oahu, we loved this stay. My wife and I agree the north shore of Oahu is our new favorite in Hawaii. Don't be deterred by people who say it's SO far from Honolulu; the drive is really not bad. Just far enough to feel like you're away from the city, but only like a 45 minute drive. We did the drive around to visit Honolulu/Pearl/Waikiki several times while sight-seeing on this trip with three young children in the SUV with us, and never had to deal with the "are we there yet's". Turtle Bay is in a great location on the north shore. The first time you drive up there, you do start to wonder just how far it is until you get there. But, once you're there, the drive doesn't seem bad at all. The resort is well located close to several awesome beaches and is also only a short drive from the Polynesian Cultural Center. And, they do have abundant activities on-site for those who dont want to have to drive. There are several better dining options on-site, but I have to admit that we didn't really spend much time eating in this property's restaurants. A few snacks and drinks around the pool. We did do Sunday buffet brunch which though pricey had about every food choice you could want. And really, the price there was pretty comparable to other experiences we've had in Hawaii. If you are flexible and willing to try some less formal dining, there are also several good convenient and affordable meal options on the north shore. Of course, try the shrimp trucks. Our experience - service there can be SLOW but the food is decent. WE LOVE TED's BAKERY. This place is absolutely the best for quick tasty meals; the breakfast pasteries are awesome and the lunch & dinner plate were tasty and filling, we used this place over and over again. Back to discussing Turtle Bay, we can't say enough good things about the beach cottages at Turtle Bay. We read several negative comments about rooms in the main hotel building but only positives about the beach cottages; a really good internet rate on the beach cottages tempted me and got me to book - SO glad that I did. Can't comment on the rooms in the main building, but the beach cottages are AWESOME. Very nice rooms. We had two adults and three young children into one of these cottages. Never felt crouded. Very comfortable. Can't beat the view from the lanai, andt the hammocks are wonderful. The beach is literally twenty steps from the beach cottage lanais. Also, the cottages conveniently have a nice sized refrigerator in them which we used to full advantage; our advice, there are grocery stores on the main road travelling in either direction around the island from Turtle Bay. Stop and shop for the basics if you're looking to save money on dining. This was HUGE for us with three little kids. I can say we will ABSOLUTELY be staying here again, the next time we visit Oahu. This is our new favorite in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay north shore!”
Reviews.Author: Sarz74
Reviews.Content: With my partner being a keen surfer, it was important for us to venture North, and we spent 6 idealic nights at Turtle Bay Resort. This place isnt cheap but it is lovely. The view from our room was gorgeous, the only thing is early October we had quite a bit of wind and a few showers, but this didnt bother us at all. We saved lots eating just up the road at Teds Bakery.. which i recommend for lunch and dinner everyday - yep, that good! We did find the front desk service a bit off, with long waits and staff going at a Turtle's pace (see what i did there.. haha) but thats probably our issue, and by day 3 we slowed down as well so it didnt bother us too much. We had dinner one night at 21 Degrees North which was again pricey but very romantic, unfortunately for us being serenaded only makes us giggle, but we did appreciate it..

Reviews.Title: “North Shore Weddings & Flowers at Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: We used North Shore Weddings & Flowers at Turtle Bay Resort for my daughter's wedding that was held in the Sunset Room at Turtle Bay. We received a list of possible vendors and we weren't able to get a hold of the first floral vendor (who came highly recommended) after repeated calls and left messages, however, Liz at North Shore Weddings (her shop is downstairs at Turtle Bay), got right back to us. We met with Liz who listened attentively to our thoughts and ideas of what we wanted for leis, bouquets, and table centerpieces and she quickly expressed her enthusiasm for helping us create and put together a cohesive, classy, beautifully memorable event for our daughter and the family. Liz thought carefully about the flowers, gave us some good suggestions, and even emailed photos of possible flowers to use for the bouquets which was helpful for my daughter to see and choose what she liked. She took the time to think out the color scheme, type of wedding/reception, and cost before giving us a proposal. We were VERY pleased with the leis, bouquets, and centerpieces. The icing on the cake, was the cake! - It was an artistic masterpiece! It was a beautiful day!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Emily Z
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Turtle Bay Resort a few weeks ago. The Room: We had an oceanfront deluxe king room on the sixth floor that overlooked the lagoon. The view was absolutely breathtaking! The room was a good size, and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The sound of the waves at night was very soothing, and I loved to wake up with a gorgeous sunrise on the horizon. Other reviewers on this site talk about how "shabby" the decor is, but I wouldn't expect luxury furnishings when one of the four walls of the room can be opened to leave the room open to the elements. The bathroom was probably the "shabbiest" part of the room, but all of the fixtures worked just fine, and it was clean. I loved the coconut toiletries that were provided. The Resort: Everyone was really friendly, and the grounds were beautifully kept. We had the five course dinner at 21 Degrees North, which was outstanding. We also enjoyed the cocktails at Ola's. We did a lot of traveling around Oahu during our stay (rent a car!), and found Waikiki to be WAY too crowded. I am so glad we booked Turtle Bay, because it was so laid back, and allowed for the true "relaxing" vacation that we were looking for, but we were still able to enjoy all of the great sites that Oahu has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ali P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently vacationed here and it was such a pleasant experience. We did absolutely nothing but relax and enjoy the prestine grounds, tropical breezes, and quiet. The service was good; however, if you are unsure about which activities to choose, be sure to ask for Sochi Goodwin, concierge. She'll take great care of you and is extremely personable. The workout room is small, but you can yake your yoga mat or exercise ball outside on the adjoining terrace and enjoy a fantastic view while you work. You have beaches on either side of the resort- one for surfing and one for snorkeling/ swimming. If you plan to do the later be sure to get to the beach by 10:00 or you won't have a lounge chair or umbrella to shield you from the sun. We were on the third floor and slept with the balcony door open. The beds are fantastic!! The food was delicious but pretty expensive- $16.00 for a hamburger poolside. If you want to be adventurous, try Romy's delicious garlic shrimp from the shrimp trucks alongside the road. You'll most likely have to wait, but it is worth it. Further down the road from the shrimp trucks you will find a neat little shopping center that has a Subway, Taco Bell, and Pizza Hut just in case you are traveling with picky eaters. If you love golf, both courses are difficult- hubby said Fazio was less difficult. Just know that it is windy and you've got to adjust your game a bit. Beautiful courses, well kept, and not as expensive as we thought it was going to be. Plenty to do on property itself. Great way to be still and get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at a relaxing, secluded location”
Reviews.Author: LivingWithMePhobia
Reviews.Content: We got back from our honey moon on Saturday, we stayed at the turtle bay for 6 nights. Overall this place is awesome! Don't listen to the bad reviews, I travel numerous times and stay in a variety of hotels, turtle bay truly has gorgeous views of the ocean and the resort is very open. Me and my wife loved the lobby and all the private beaches you can relax, as well as the banyan trees and the hiking trails, the seaside couples massage is definetly a must, especially if you have never have had a massage like my wife, the pool is nice and needs no updating, we had a pikake jr suite and it was big and spacious, the view was the best I have ever had, only a few concerns though, I had put in the notes of our reservation that it was our honey moon and I thought they would do something nice the day we got to the hotel but nothing was set up, bit of a disappointment, I was told about the resort fee but was not told about the 900 dollar hold they put on the card for any services that we would be using, this is not good if you were going to pay cash for everything like us, but the lobby staff was nice the girl at night helped us out and only put a 150 dollar hold on the card instead of 900! I forgot her name but I noticed she is the evening shift there, the parking well like the other reviews does need some improvement, at least some reserve Parking for hotel guests, the Italian restaurant is nice and had good pasta and steaks, ola by the beach was not bad, my wife didn't like it too much though, was very nice to sit on the sand by the water though, prices are a bit expensive all over Hawaii except for local eateries, teds is a must go, the omelletes are big to serve 2 people! Me and my wife got one for each the first day and then shared the rest of the days, good pricing, and the chocolate cupcakes are a must there as well, my wife had one every morning. We never had the buffet at the palm restaurant because me and my wife aren't much of big eaters (I eat very healthy, she doesn't but she doesn't eat much) so we ordered from the menu, food was very good and my wife said that the hot chocolate was the one of the best she had ever drank, I tried it and must admit from a person that puts Splenda in these drinks I didn't have to! LOL, the bathrooms in the rooms are very spacious I just think some need a nice tub, it could definitely fit, another place that is good is by halewai I forgot the name but it' was right next to the breakers restaurant, staff there was very good, we are from Miami so we didn't really want to stay by Waikiki and thank god we didn't when we drove there one of the days it looked just like south beach, didn't want to travel so far to be just like home, the Mexican restaurant by Waikiki is pretty good as well, I think it was called la cucaracha, the luau at the PCC was not worth it, food was not good and the show a bit boring we left at the intermission, maybe paradise cove is better, from what I heard, it is, and they give food while the show is going on not some cafeteria style food and then a show on the other side and then you tend to fall asleep, kuoloa ranch is a must if you love lost and movies, we wanted to get the KOS tours but they were booked, so we got the horse back ride 2 hour, it was a nice experience, we also did the grand circle island tour in the big island for one day 720 bucks for 2 people, wouldn't recommend it, you don't stay long enough in the places, next time we are definitely booking the flights on our own and just rent a car there and go wherever we want to go! And possibly save 500 dollars, over all we are going to be coming back to turtle bay, it was an exceptional place, just need a couple of improvements but hey, things cant always be perfect, hopefully we will be back after the renovations, and maybe they can do something nice in our room lol like flowers or something lol probably not, but hey you never know, thanks turtle bay for making it a nice honeymoon, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Resort”
Reviews.Author: Anonym9999
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in late July 2012 in a beachside king cottage with my wife and teenage daughter. The staff promptly brought an air mattress for the daughter which worked out well. The cottage was beautiful and sparklingly clean, featuring hardwood floors, marble bath, and very high ceiling. The minibar was well stocked and the prices were quite reasonable relatively speaking. There was a VERY well stocked sundries shop next to the pool with an impressive liquor, beer, and soda selection, lots of snacks, thorough OTC pharmacy and toiletry selection, as well as beach mats, hats, surf shoes, magazines, and so on. We never felt the need to visit Foodland to stock up. I don't think it matters much which cottage you get, the good and less good (there are no bad) features balance out. If you are in a cottage close to the water/hotel, people walk right in front of your patio. If you are on the far end away from the hotel, you have more privacy and less noise but a significant walk to the hotel. We were ecstatic with our cottage in the mid section a little farther from the water with lots of manicured lawn and several hammocks to choose from. We took surfing lessons which were the highlight of our trip. The entire crew at HH was always fun, pleasant and helpful...you can tell they love what they do. But special thanks to our instructor Mikey who had us riding all the waves we could catch from the very beginning as first timers. I suggest booking your surf lessons in advance, because if the hotel is full you are not likely to be able to walk up and join even a group lesson. If you can book a semiprivate lesson that is the way to go for sure. The golf facility is outstanding. They have new Titlist equipment for rental with one reasonable fee for the whole week, and a very nice practice area. Both courses were in excellent condition and had amazing views; Fazio is the easier track by far. The greens were lush with NO ballmarks and so they roll very true. The wind was a significant factor all 3 days I played, usually around 20 MPH, sometimes more. I booked a tee time the first day but after that just showed up and was off with no wait. We also enjoyed the sunset horseback ride, the wonderful tennis courts, the spa, the sunset music and drinks at Hang 10, and the excellent restaurants. I'm not sure which version of Ahi Poke I enjoyed more, Lei Lei's or Ola's, so I'm going to have to come back for more research. The steaks were surprisingly great at both places, with the nod to Lei Lei's. The creme brulee at Ola's was as good as I have ever had. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was excellent. The prime rib and seafood buffet at Leonardo's was not as good. The coffee and pastry bar in the hotel lobby is great if you don't need a full breakfast. The self-serve coffee provided in the cottage was satisfactory but rather weak...the stronger coffee with espresso shot option at the hotel was worth the walk. Special praise for the outstanding room service is deserved...delivery was quick and the quality was very good. The several beaches on the property were excellent. The towel card system worked well. The grounds were beautiful and well-maintained, we saw turtles frolicking in the water right across from our cottage, and we enjoyed playing with the few cats that roam the area. I do wish the staff was better able to enforce their posted smoking restrictions, but smokers tend to be more motivated and determined than any staff could ever be to stop them, so I understand the difficulties. This is a large well-run resort with a great variety and quality of activities that should please anyone in the family whether they want to partake in sports or just chill. We will be counting the days until our return, since the family consensus is that this was our best vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui T
Reviews.Content: Away from all the loud bustling of the city, the drive to Turtle Bay was one of my favourite. The location of the Turtle Bay was equip with the best views, an amazing location - right by the beach. The birds in the lobby was quite a sight and was great fun to watch. The pool is really nice, with an excellent food bar near by with staffs that catered to your every needs. Everyone was really friendly and assisted me with whatever I needed. The rooms were quite spacious and very clean. The food was delicious and it wasn't at all a long wait. We (my family and I) were surrounded with such a calming and fun atmosphere. Overall, everything was very charming and we would surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Birthdays in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Kadel86
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation to celebrate a 21st and a 16th birthday. The resort was spectacular. The North End is THE place to stay. This is not the built-up commercialized experience we would have had if we stayed in Honolulu or Waikiki. Each morning would start with a walk along one of the trails - leading us to WWII bunkers, Banyon trees, deserted beaches and spectacular views. We'd find a spot - snorkle or body surf on a beach completely to ourselves. Where else could you sit on a rock and watch a giant sea turtle rolling in the surf along the shore - popping his head up every once in a while to make sure we were still watching? The rooms were fine - clean and comfortable. The restaurants were no more pricey than you'd find anywhere else - and the food was fantastic. Pack your lunches and sit at the beach for an inexpensive - but priceless afternoon. Take advantage of the refrigerators in the rooms and stop at Foodland for basics and sushi made on the spot. The farm stand just south of the resort has amazing pineapple, mango, coconut, dragon fruit, watermelon and papaya fresh cut and in bags for $ 2.00. Perfect breakfast! Shrimp trucks line the Highway on the east - worth the drive to the Shrimp Shack - a truck owned by a woman from Orland Park, IL. Great! However, Turtle Bay no longer has the Friday night Luau. Unless you want to drive back to Honolulu or Waikiki, the closest Luau is at the Polynesian Cultural Center. Skip it. Dinner is cafeteria style as expected, but with minimal entertainment - no pig in the ground, no hula participation and NO COCKTAILS. The actual show is an hour and a half later across the center on the other side. However, we learned that during this break, free tours of the LDS Temple are given.....didn't know this center (and whole town) was LDS. Had I known, I would have chosen not to spend my money there. But back to Turtle Bay - I'd do it again in a heartbeat. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay is Turtle Bay!”
Reviews.Author: Firebird81
