Reviews.Content: On the North Shore of Hawaii this is the place to stay. The staff was always very kind and helpful, great food and surrounded by breath taking scenery! You will need a rental car to get to the resort, but the drive will be worth it. There are many scenic places on the North Shore. I loved it and will only stay at Turtle Bay on future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Ocean Villas #204”
Reviews.Author: Steven L
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Hawaii. Beautiful views, amenities and location. Awesome! #204 is a great rental and will stay there every time we go. It is rented by owner. The north shore of Oahu is the only place to stay. Waikiki is so built up. You get the best experience of Hawaii here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B
Reviews.Content: We just left Turtle Bay, and it's a nice resort. The staff was very friendly, and the rooms are great. Very nice and spacious, although parts of it was showing some age (paint chipping off the bathroom walls...) although it was overall a great room. The view is stunning. The north shore is incredibly beautiful. The food is amazing as well, although the service is slow. We ate at the Palm Terrace, Hang Ten and Ola. I would recomend eating at the Palm Terrace, especially for breakfast, it's delicious. In the evening we saw an amazing fire dancing show. The next day my sister and I bought some earrings and a necklace at a stand there and they broke within the hour we got them, so the Jewlry can be cheap there. We had a great time, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip to Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica E
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 17-27. Check in was ok, was not told about a $300 credit we had received from friends for our anniversary, until I asked about the next day after one had told us. Thought that was poor service. Upon on going to our room the a/c was not working. Took almost an hour. But did get fixed. We had king ocean view. Amazing view room was nice size and clean With the resort fee you received wifi which was nice and parking. Parking at the resort is HORRIBLE! They need assigned places for hotel guest! One night took over 20 minutes to find parking. Talked to manager they said it is because locals come out to surfer the bar. Very poor excuse. I very much the areas available for running. The pool was way too cold for me to enjoy. But sunning pool side was nice. Except for the kids running around and diving in the pool which clearly states no diving. I know this is a family resort just wish they had adult only side or adult only pool. The restaurant we most enjoyed was Lei Leis, excellent service and great food. Surfer the Bar was a huge disappointment for food and service was poor. Ola was very good, as was Leonardos. The lobby lounge was great for morning lattes and had some great pastries as well. Overall our experience was good. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Cottages Are Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Moonfish13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the North Shore (7/19/2012-7/26/2012). We were very pleased with our accommodations at Turtle Bay Resort. We chose to stay in one of the beach cottages and this was an excellent choice. The beach cottages made you feel like you were sort of in a private cottage instead of a large resort. The rooms were kept spotless and the concierge service was great. Fresh fruit was delivered to our room daily as well as the newspaper and each night turn down service was provided which also included delivery of chocolate macadamia nuts packaged in a pretty box each evening. Although the room was a little farther from the beach than expected, the views were superb and we could watch the sunset from our lanai as well as the turtles frolicking in the ocean. The water nearest the room was a little too rough for swimming and snorkeling unless you are an excellent swimmer and I would not recommend swimming for children. The pool area is in need of an upgrade but was okay. It gets very windy on the pool deck so bring towel clips or something heavy to sit on top of your towel to keep it from blowing away. The service poolside was okay, not great. I had to flag someone down whenever we needed service which is surprising as the prices were high. I would expect much better service than was provided. Also, the pool seems to be closed down fairly often. This occurred twice during our stay during prime time pool hours due to a "chemical imbalance". The restaurants are pricey. We tried Leonardo's. It was okay, not great. We also had lunch at the Hang Ten. It was also okay but way overpriced. We chose to dine offsite for the rest of our meals but be prepared to drive 10-20 minutes if you choose this option. I highly recommend Ted's Bakery for breakfast. They have fabulous omelettes, egg sandwiches, and baked goods. I also recommend Impossibles for pizza. It sounds crazy but it is pizza out of a food truck. You have to call on the day you want it as it travels to different locations on the North Shore daily but it was great and the proprietor was super nice and it was possibly the best pizza I've had (definitely the best pizza I've had in Hawaii). Overall, we all enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Main Hotel Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ND79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main hotel supposedly in a premium ocean view room. The room is very dated, felt wet and overlooked the tiny pool areas - which were periodically closed during the 3 day stay. We had been here before but will not return. While the north shore is fun to visit, the accomodations were fair to poor. We had stayed at Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club 1 bedroom condo earlier in the week which was awesome. We ended our trip at Marriott's Wailea Beach Club on Maui which was also nice. Recommend staying at Ko Olina from which you can easily do the north shore, Dole, Waimea Falls, all the beaches, etc - even Diamond Head and Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon... maybe we got lucky?”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on here before going, and some had me a bit worried after we jumped on a livingsocial deal. We were actually blown away when we arrived. Check in was a breeze, friendly staff took care of our car and our luggage while we sat there soaking in that amazing lobby view. Our room (625, top floor, fourth from the right on the right section of the property) wasn't super fancy but that's not why we decided to come here, we wanted to explore and get lost in Oahu. Oh yeah, shampoo keeps coming up in these reviews. All we did was call and ask for more and someone showed up 5 minutes later with a like 8 each of shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, etc so I'm not sure why some of you guys had problems. It was clean and the only complaints I could maybe muster was that the carpet was kind of beat up, but with people tracking sand EVERYWHERE 24/7 I imagine that might be tough to manage. The sliding door was too heavy for my wife to operate, but no biggie there. Speaking of the sliding door... the view we woke up to every morning was amazing, our Lanai overlooked the lagoon side of the property. We are torn on which side we want to be on when we go back, as you can't see a sunset from the rooms on that side of the building, but you have the lagoon view. Hmm, first world problems, right? We had seen how Waikiki is and did NOT want that. We didn't fly halfway around the world to hang out on a crowded beach with reserved seating. There was only one time I felt a little crowded during our entire trip and that was when a famous surfer was scheduled for an appearance at surfer the bar. It was kind of hard to find parking as locals were parked absolutely everywhere. No-Parking Curbs? Grass? On a tree? Pick one, or all three. Speaking of bars. Justin! I was happy to see another couple mention his name as I imagine we are not the only couples he has helped before. Justin was extremely friendly and helped us decide on a few different activities to do around the island. He showed (and wrote us directions!) some pictures from some of the amazing views on various hikes around Oahu so we could make up our minds on which ones to tackle. Someone give that guy a raise. As far as activities around the resort go, they definitely have a variety. Every morning after breakfast our room would be made and there would be a large flyer with the schedule of activities for the day and special pricing for certain things. Not sure why others were complaining about being unaware of what there was to do as we had no complaints. Totally recommend doing a helicopter tour. Shannon and Pilot Bob were great and decided to upgrade us to a longer flight due to scheduling and an issue with the intercoms on the rear seats where we couldn't hear the pilot. Next time we're definitely going to try out surfing, it was pretty cool watching the instructors out there working with others all morning, everyone seemed to be having a good time. Breakfast buffet was included in our deal otherwise we probably would have skipped it. There was ample selection and a chef on hand to make fresh eggs and omletes, which was really nice. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on the property since there's so many local choices minutes away to the west in Haleiwa (Luibuenos was a Justin suggestion, great food!) and to the East (Giovanni's Shrimp Truck & Fiji Market). All in all, we had a great time. See you next year, Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location, beautiful beach cottage”
Reviews.Author: JSM-DPM
Reviews.Content: The resort is quite a distance from Waikiki (approx 1 hour drive) and we arrived quite late at night. When we woke we were amazed at the stunning views of the ocean. We were staying in the beach cottages and received a fruit cocktail and fresh fruit and water every day. The cottages are absolutely beautiful and very spacious, a short walk through some beautiful gardens brings you to the main hotel which is very large. They have a lanai and hammock, and are serviced regularly. We really enjoyed the trip and went on the Shaka Kayaks sea kayaking tour, enjoyed snorkelling at the hotel and wandering the beaches around the hotel where we went turtle and monk seal spotting. We discovered that the bus which picks up from the hotel circles the whole island. For a couple of dollars, you can use it non stop for the whole day. We went snorkelling at Sharks Cove and also to the waterfall parks and botanical gardens. We also stopped at Haleiwa and found a beautiful sandwich shop (Waialua Bakery & Juice Bar) which you must not miss if you are there. Using the bus allowed us to visit many of the beautiful beaches of the north shore and we could certainly have found something new to look at every day. We thoroughly enjoyed the hang 10 bar in the evenings with lots of entertainment of local origin. The food in most of the restaurants was quite expensive and very similar across the resort. We most enjoyed Lei Lei's (bar and grill at the golf course on the resort) and Ola's restaurant (in front and outside the hotel on the beach), preferring these than the restaurants within the hotel, we also felt these were the most value for money. The Luana spa couples massage in the beach hut is an absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Sezzwick
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughters (9 & 11) and I stayed at Turtle Bay for 15 days last October...I can't believe I'm just getting around to writing this review now! We LOVED it!! The service was amazing from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out! The valets/bellman were so friendly and the restraint staff were incredible!! Our favorite was Bonnie, who made our vacation when the first morning we went in for breakfast she gave us a list of great places to visit and family activities - most of which we wouldn't have found without her! Our other favorite was Jen (I think that was her name) who was our hostess for breakfast several mornings and booked our horseback riding excursion at Heli-Huli adventure centre. She rememberd our names and was so kind to my girls. The pools were fabulous and we rarely had an issue finding lounge chairs. The beach was beautiful but we did have troubles renting snorkel equipment so I will bring our own next time. Lei Lei's was AMAZING!!!! The staff are attentive and friendly and the ribs?........FANTASTIC!!!!! There were frogs on the golf course every night we went and that became the favorite activity for my girls-Frog Searching! Our suite had an amazing view and almost every morning I would sit on the lanai and drink my coffee, read my book and listen to the waves crashing against the beach-PARADISE!! My husband and I treated ourselves to massages and we both loved it! There is nothing like getting a massage while listening to the waves rolling up on the shore. The concierge told us about a couple of great Shave Ice places in Haleiwa and we LOVED Aoki's!! All in all our time spent here was so amazing that we will be returning in September for another 2 weeks and we can't wait to see everyone again!!!! Turtle Bay absolutely epitomizes the Aloha Spirit!!! Mahalo Turtle Bay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on North Shore!”
Reviews.Author: wvi
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hawaiian getaway! My husband and I highly recommend the beach cottages, which are in a more secluded area away from the main hotel (ours was at the far end-even better!). Each have private lanais with beautiful views of the ocean.You can relax out on the lanai or in one of the hammocks that are strung between the trees on the lawn A short stroll to the main hotel brings you to a very nice pool area and bar, where you can hang out and watch the locals (and guests) surf. The room and bathrooms are very spacious, comfortable beds, very clean. Overall, a great place with many activities to enjoy, and a perfect place to just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Really is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mjsbgold
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort in Kahuku is truely one of the most beautiful spots on the planet. The hotel is situated on peninsula so that most of the rooms have water views that are just stunning. The grounds are extremely well kept and the ocean is breathtaking. The rooms are fairly large and well kept as well and activities at the resort abound -- from the pool, to the ocean, to tennis, golf, hiking, surfboard lessons-- you name it. The food at the resort is -- as expected -- very expensive. We also had trouble finding more casual food later at night -- essentially just pizza in the bar, which was ok but expensive. But we were fine once we discovered Ted's Bakery (do not miss) on Sunset Beach for breakfast and the shrimp trucks of Kahuku for lunch. The service at Turtle Bay is good, but I would not call it great -- although we did not have to wait too long to check in; it still seemed too long. Our questions were all answered during our stay but did seem to have to know what to ask -- some resort activities (like Hawaiian games) seemed to only take place after we insisted (despite the published schedule). Still, the views and the joys of the Northern shore and the beauty of the hotel made all that seem very minor. We split our time on Oahu between Honululu and our North Shore stay at Oahu which was wonderful. The north shore is a terrific balance for the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and has plenty to do in its own right -- don't miss the Polynesian Culture Center.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Break from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Bear9019
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days on Oahu. We have been to Hawaii 25 or 30 times over the last 45 years and stayed at all of the Oahu resorts - The Kahala, the Moana, the Halekulani, the JW Marriott, the Royal Hawaiian, etc. This time, we started at the Royal Hawaiian on Waikiki. We love Waikiki and all that it has to offer, but decided to spend our last four days on the north shore. We had never before stayed over there because it just seemed too remote. On recent past trips we had visited the Turtle Bay Resort for the day - before its facelift - and it just did not stack up with our plans and expectations. On future trips, it will absolutely be part of our itinerary. We were extremely impressed. The location, ambience and gracious hospitality reminded me of Hawaii in the 60's. The aloha spirit still lives on Waikiki, but the laid back, uncrowded atmosphere at Turtle Bay was a great way to end our trip. We got our Waikiki fix and wound down on the north shore before the trip home. The golf courses at Turtle Bay are all you could ask for - one by Fazio and the other by Palmer. The course conditions and layout were excellent. Although we did not play tennis, the courts were first class. Bike rentals, horse rentals and snorkeling are all within walking distance. The pool area has a full size pool, a pool and slide for kids. My wife likes to swim laps and it is plenty big for that. The food was great. We have done all of the big name restaurants in Honolulu. Lei leis at the Turtle Bay golf center was the best meal we had for this 10 days. We stayed in one of the beach cottages. It exceeded our expectations. Again, it brought back memories of the old resorts like the Cocoa Palms on Kauai or the Mauna Kea in the 60s and 70s. Lastly, the staff was without exception extraordinarily gracious and committed to the aloha spirit. It was very genuine and sincere. Now I'm not saying that we are giving up Waikiki but Turtle Bay will now be part of our Oahu plans. Whether just the two of you or the whole family, I think you will like Turtle Bay if you like good food, a beautiful location, deluxe accommodations and an active lifestyle - at prices that deliver excellent value. Mahalo to Turtle Bay Resort for putting the icing on our wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location on North Shore!”
Reviews.Author: johninclearwater
Reviews.Content: we love this place, it's nice and clean and comfortable and is close to all the World Famous Surf Spots...Bonzai Pipeline, Sunset, Waimea, Off the Wall, Etc...great bar called "SURFER THE BAR" where you can hang out w/ the pros and shoot the breez. look for specials!

Reviews.Title: “Windy North Shore”
Reviews.Author: AprilMLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We wanted an experience on the North Shore and away from Waikiki. Turtle Bay is the best and only resort in the area. The rooms were adequate/clean and had internet access. We enjoyed our stay and the activities that were offered. It was very windy and sometimes annoying. The restaurant food was mediocre. One night there was a fire dancer show that was very low key and quite enjoyable. The dancers were congenial and answered any questions you had about their abilities or show. We watched while sitting by the pool and having a drink. We also enjoyed watching surfers and looking for turtles. We saw a lot of both. We only stayed two nights and that was just long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: googoose2
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is your only hotel/resort option if you want to stay on the North Shore of Oahu. The location is great, with a gentle cove just perfect for kids and beginning snorkels, some really stunning and isolated stretches of sand straight out of "Lost," and another small cove used for surfing lessons. It's also well located on the North Shore, just minutes from the shrimp trucks (Giovanni's garlic scampi has no peer!) in one direction, and Ted's Bakery in the other, and only 15-20 minutes from the charming town of Haleiwa. We stayed here for 10 days in July, and the weather was mixed - lots of wind ever day of course, but also a fair amount of rain and frequent grey skies. We stayed in a 3br villa, which was very spacious and comfortable for our family of 5. The villas seem to be very popular with families with young kids (ours are teens) because there is a warm pool/hot tub right there, for the exclusive use of the villas, and you're just steps to the swimming cove, so it's very easy to keep the kids entertained. I wish I'd known, though, that the villas were really basically condos with linen service - there's no bar at the villa pool and no music/entertainment that far from the hotel. It felt more like a house rental than a resort stay. Other 'cons' include: the food selection is limited for a longer stay, and very expensive; other than Ola (on the beach - our fave place to eat) the restaurants had outdated decor and were consistently over-air-conditioned - bring a cardigan; there is no food or drink service on the beach; the lobby is open and echoey, so car noise mingles with wheelie luggage noise and bar music when you are trying to enjoy a cup of coffee or cocktail in the lobby lounge; all the cultural activities (lei making, uke lessons) are done in the lobby, which is awkward and a bit odd considering the gorgeous outdoor setting; and there are no Kids Club or teen activities offered. The 'pros,' include great surfing lessons, tennis lessons, horseback riding, and helicopter tours held on site; enterprise car rental on site (so you can get out and explore the awesome North Shore area!); a full spa and exercise room; friendly staff; and location, location, location!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon on the North Shore-Take the bad reviews with a grain of salt, this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: laurabumbala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I knew we wanted to go to Hawaii for our honeymoon and there was no other place to stay but the "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" hotel. The lobby shots alone in the movie sold us. We had to go there! We went for 7 nights 8 days in February. And while we were there Elizabeth Smart apparently got married and was actually staying on the same floor as us. Kinda crazy. Now after I booked the trip I was on here (trip advisor) looking at reviews and got completely nervous about the room and grounds because there are people on here that gave bad reviews on anything and everything. I was freaking out. But to my pleasant surprise I was glad I trusted my gut. We had an amazing time and Turtle Bay is a true Hawaiian experience. If you would like a very honest review, please read my somewhat winded reviews below on all aspects of the hotel and stay: 1. The Hotel Grounds/Location Be prepared that this hotel is way up on the North shore. I want to say it took about 45-to 1hr to get there from the airport. It is not close to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. Its definitely more secluded and on its own. But thats the experience my husband and I wanted. We went down to the Waikiki beach area while on a tour to pick up some other passengers and we were so glad we chose to stay on the North shore. It was way too much like any other city with chain stores etc. Turtle Bay in the north shore is peaceful, beautiful and you can really enjoy nature. The grounds of the hotel are really impeccable and clean. So many beautifully manicured plants etc. My husband and I just walked around upon first arrival and took everything in. Theres little outcomes where you can stand closer to the rocks and even a rock type peninsula that you can walk out (at your own risk) and get some great pics. There are also a few trails to walk on the Turtle Bay property (as well as an amazing golf course but we didn't play!, next time!) My husband and I walked to the Baynan trees and private beaches along the property. We are big Lost fans and these Baynan trees were part of the show, so it was an added perk to staying there. Pool area was were we spent a lot of time. Yes its a family resort so there are kids. I definitely saw about 20 prego chicks walking around. Most likely on babymoons. There were some kids in the pool occasionally but nothing that annoyed us. Everything was very relaxing which we were surprised. 2. Room It is definitely true that every room has a ocean view. I forget what floor we were on. But we were on a higher floor. We had an Ocean Deluxe Room so we had a balcony that we could sit out on if we wanted (but I am afraid of birds so I wasn't out there too much). CON: Theres no screen door, Just the glass slider. So me being paranoid of birds didn't want to leave the door open to listen to the waves at night because I was paranoid. But I found the room decor to be up to date and stylish and very clean. And Im a fashion designer by trade, I would know if the rooms weren't up to date! To be honest we weren't in the room all that much, but it was very nice. The hotel room is for sleep, you should be out enjoying hawaii! I have attached some photos. The bathrooms were a little meh. They definitely could use some updating but its nothing we minded really. 3. Hotel Restaurants Olas-My favorite. We ate at a table on the beach. Everything was so great. And I remember their bread dipping sauce was amazing. It was casual but upscale at the same time. The hostess' weren't that friendly but the wait staff was attentive and we had some great food. My fish was local and fresh! so good. Lei Lei's-Great casual restaurant on the golf course. We ate dinner here and it definitely had all the golf crowd. Food and service was great. Pool Bar-We ate lunch here a lot. Fish tacos were great! A little pricey, we realized we were better off eating local food for lunch which was much cheaper. Lobby Bar-This is a coffee/breakfast place in the mornings that serves coffee and muffins etc. then a bar at night. Shot out to our favorite bartender JUSTIN! He was amazing. I will say the Mai Tais we got the first night were amazing. And super strong. But there after they definitely got weaker, not just here just throughout the resort. I think because it was our first night they made them extra strong! But Justin was great with tips on where to go and introduced us to some great Hawaiian beer that we can get in CT. We did the breakfast buffet one day because I wanted to try it, but its honestly not worth the price unless you are gonna really EAT. 4. Spa This was our highlight. The spa was amazing. We booked a couples massage in the little hut on the ocean. Hearing the waves crash the rocks as a 6'5" Hawaiian man gave me a deep tissue massage, oh yeah. Paradise! My husband was there too, but he had a lady and we both were in heaven. We got to go use the sauna etc. afterwards and it was a nice relaxing day. Overall our stay was great. I think next time we would love to stay in the cottages and just lounge on the hammocks and porches in that area. We just weren't paying for the stay so we didn't want to over extend my husbands parents on their budget. But we did have to pay for everything else. Unfortunately Hawaii doesn't really have all inclusives. It would have been way more amazing if we didn't end up spending 3,000 dollars on food and excursions, but with that said, it was still amazing. The North shore is amazing and so is turtle bay. Don't listen to bad reviews. Unless you are Madonna and need things to be gold plated, then you should enjoy your time here :) You get a true Hawaiian experience. Other Tips: 1. All beaches are public so the parking lot at turtle bay does get packed with locals using the public beach. We rented a car and had to circle a lot of time to find a spot. 2. Try the local foods and food trucks-Shrimp trucks!!! Giovannis is amazing. 3. If you are on the north shore, you need to rent a car to get around and visit local stuff. There are fruit stands 2 minutes away from the hotel that are great and its abut 15 minute drive to Haleweia (forgive my spelling), which is a cute little surfer town. 4. Take a ride to Waimea Falls, great nature park and waterfall 5. If you are LOST fans like us, KOS tours is the only tour you need. You get to see Hawaii and all the cool shooting locations!!!

Reviews.Title: “You have no other option on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: mforr002
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are very nice. Apparently some of the villas have been recently refreshed and are nice, but the room you get it nothing like what is pictured on the website. The carpets and look like they are from 1970 and have never been updated. The halls smell like cleaning solvent. The restaurants are mediocre. Given that this is the ONLY hotel on the North Shore, it would be nice if they updated everything, but I suppose since they have no competition, there is no incentive. You can get a vacation rental home on the North Shore cheaper than this hotel. Given the amenities here, I would probably suggest that because you really aren't getting luxury accomodations (unless you pay for the villa, I suppose). Also, they should really get rid of the lame stuffed animal turtle that you can "adopt" for a fee. Cheezy.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort is an Oasis on the North Shore! Like going outer island without going outer island!”
Reviews.Author: Kahuna8899
Reviews.Content: What a perfect respit for tourists and locals alike...literally like going to a neighbor island without flying on a jet. The beaches are transcendant, the grounds are combed to perfection and if you're a golfer you'll be in heaven. The restaurants have amazing meals available on site for all meals for your day. The pool with slide are fun for everyone. Truly at its splendor!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the movies, enjoy your own vacation.”
Reviews.Author: tim b
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting Turtle Bay Resort to look like it does in the movies, STOP. Try to enjoy everything it has to offer for you and don't compare it to the Hollywood version. My first suggestion: Rent a car to get around the island. We went somewhere almost everyday. The one day we stayed completely at the resort was a much needed day of rest and relaxation. We went snorkeling, swimming in the ocean and pools, and horseback riding. Our total visit lasted 5 days at Turtle Bay before heading over to Maui. Now if they only could move Turtle Bay over to Maui, that would be the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: julies101
Reviews.Content: Had the great pleasure of staying at turtle bay June 23-29. It is a breathtaking place. We were on the 5th floor and had an amazing view for sunset. The room is very spacious and housekeeping did an excellent job of keeping it clean and tidy. The bed was very comfortable - I slept so good and did not hear a lot of noise from the hall or surrounding rooms. The grounds are beautiful and keep very nice - I love picking up the flowers off the ground and putting them in my hair. Lots of fun hiking. We had the great pleasure of a monk seal coming up on the beach for a rest while we were there - the staff blocked it off since they are endangered but answered all my questions with a smile. It was a little windy and a little cool while we were there but it was such a welcome relief from the 106 degrees it was back home in TX. I was thankful for the little chill. The breakfast buffet was very good and the ladies that waited on us were fabulous and very friendly. Leonardo's was nice but the service and food here were mediocre at best. i am so glad we stayed here instead of the overcrowded waikki. It is an awesome place and I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty setting, but the service and food poisoning will make you wish you went to another island”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: First off I know a lot of people write reviews based off having a particular terrible experience so when I read them I always take them with a grain of salt and usually just conclude they were being a bit over the top or irrational and usually end up ignoring the review, and proceed to stay at the place anyways. That being said, I usually brush off bad visits and never comment, and let the good ones stand on their own, but my recent stay at this hotel was almost absurd it was so infuriating... The positives...the location...which I can really only give credit to mother nature for since the staff nor the builders really have any control over that whatsoever. The grounds are well cared for, and the scenery is pretty for oahu, but its pretty remote so if you're into nightlife you better hope to have a car, and if you're young and like to go out then expect several lengthy taxi rides. The Staff at the pool bar Hang Ten, were absolutely awesome, can't say enough about those guys, friendly, informative and most of all attentive. The Bad: Service...Service...Service... This place made me wonder if I was the subject of some unwitting Truman Show were secretly people all over the world were watching me on candid camera as each dining or bar experience at this place enraged me. First waitress forgot half of our order, never brought us additional drinks, was dancing behind the bar for like 20 minutes and then lied to us about how the bus boy should have brought us everything we ordered...well its hard for him to bring us the food if you never rang it up on the bill (which she handed to me as she realized half our order never made it to the table). Secondly, and perhaps most hysterical, 30 minutes later we wanted to grab a few drinks to take outside for the fireworks. We walked to the lobby bar where another waitress insisted that we sit down while she whip us up a few drinks real quick for us to take out there...now i stressed I didn't want to sit down and we were in a hurry but she politely convinced me all would be well...seconds later the fireworks began and the waitress I swear to god said "fireworks!! I'm going to watch" and proceeded to run outside leaving us dumbfounded. Aside from about 4 other visits in which we had to wait on average 25 minutes for a waiter to approach our table, the icing on the cake was when my girlfriend got food poisoning from their restaurant 21 degrees on our final night and spent the entire evening vomiting. The next morning I called the concierge to inform them of this just so they could check their stock of food and prevent them from serving it to anyone else. In return they requested I fill out a security complaint form and turn it in upon checkout, which I was happy to do. At checkout, I'm not sure why I expected anything, but I hoped at least for an apology. Which I did not receive, instead I received a look of disbelief as if their top restaurant could have possibly done that (which reminded me my 45 dollar rib eye was also nearly charred to a crisp so don't think your crap doesn't stink). We didn't receive an apology, charges removed from our bill or anything. Perhaps I'm wrong to think this should be in order but every other hotel I've stayed at, even the normal 4 star hotels would have gone out of their way to ensure everything was fine. As for the rooms, they were ok, nothing really too spectacular. We had a room with a balcony which I enjoyed while she was puking all evening/morning. Can't really bash the rooms since they are about what you would expect unless staying at a four seasons, mandarin, st regis (which i highly recommend for kauai), or ritz class level hotel . In the likely event anyone has actually read this far I would say that this place is just going to cause you more headaches than its worth, the service sucks, the food sucks, the beach is a lagoon, the pool is nice, but usually swamped since its really the only place on the North Shore, my suggestion would be to go straight to Kauai. But since I would also likely ignore this review based on other previous positive comments, if you do end up staying at this hotel, make sure you spend every meal at the pool bar, those guys were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “I want to come back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErinandCraig123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for the first part of our honeymoon in December 2011. We flew into Honolulu early in the morning - around 6am. We got a taxi straight from the airport to Turtle Bay and hoped we would at least be able to drop our bags off. Luckily enough for us we were able to check into our villa already! We couldn't believe our luck and couldn't be more thankful. The staff were friendly and helpful - they carried our bags and took us to our villa in a golf cart. We stayed in an ocean view villa. It was gorgeous and the water was only a few metres away from our outdoor area. The sunsets were particularly amazing. We received complimentary champagne and juice. Its a big resort but where we stayed it was pretty quiet. We didn't really do any activities at the resort as we were still recovering from jet lag the whole time we were here. The pool looked amazing and they supply your towels but we didn't use this either as it was a bit too cold. Unfortunately at the time we were there reception was being renovated so the big glass window you see on the website and in Forgetting Sarah Marshall was covered but I can imagine how beautiful it would usually be. This is a place to stay if you are looking for a relaxing holiday. Its away from a lot of the tourist attractions like Pearl Harbour etc so if you want to do those things book in advance or hire a car. I would also recommend pre booking transport to and from the airport via their website before you come. All in all, it is pricey but it is beautiful. What is there to really complain about - your in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. Our room was perfect, nice and comfortable beds and beautiful view of the ocean. Service was impeccable from everyone. The pool was great. If you are wanting to explore the North Shore I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path and great for a weekend away from everything”
Reviews.Author: HighMaintenanceGal
Reviews.Content: On the North Shore of Oahu the Turtle Bay Resort was amazing! Beautiful buildings and grounds, everything was taken care of down to the smallest detail. This is truly a one of a kind resort and is perfect for honeymooners and lovers; you cannot beat sunset on the beach with a bottle of champagne. There is a chapel on the grounds and there were several wedding receptions going on while we were there. This is one place on Oahu where you feel you are truly on a tropical island that is far away from the overcrowded tourist destinations elsewhere on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Expansive resort in a fantastic North Shore location”
Reviews.Author: visual
Reviews.Content: (BTW, the title is not a typo - expansive is a word) Summary: What a great location! After our first few days in Waikiki, this place was the perfect two-thirds of our Oahu vacation. Got rather windy most days, but that meant staying cool even in the sun on the beach. It also meant our horse ride in the hills was cool, not hot and humid as it could have been. Overall, we all (including two teenagers) loved the place - good rooms and beds, good food and lots of activities. Definitely need a car to get around, or you'd be stuck at the resort the whole time (nothing within walking distance except the bus stop). We travel a lot (5-6 times a year), and this place definitely gets an unconditional recommendation. Details: Room/facilities - we had an Oceanfront deluxe, which meant a large room plus a good sized lanai (balcony), on the 5th floor - great view, though we overlooked the roof of their conference facilities. The wind kept us cool, and we left our sliding doors open with the A/C of the whole time we were there - closest thing to sleeping in the open you can get, while still on a comfy bed. I saw some reviews that called the rooms "desperately in need of renovations", that left us saying "huh?" when we got our room. Yes, there were a couple of things that looked quite dated (the 70s era soap and sundries dishes in the bathroom, for example), but the room was in excellent shape overall - the only obvious sign we could see was some rust on the A/C vent cover in the ceiling, but given that we were leaving the doors open, probably like everyone else, I can imagine the constant salty, humid air playing havoc on stuff like that. One nice feature was two sinks - one in the little dressing area so it made it easier for the 4 of us to get ready quickly. This should be a standard feature in resorts catering to families, but sadly is not that common. The grounds were very well maintained (though my wife the gardener remarked that she had expected more flowers), and it was pretty easy to get around to the main spots (pool, beach, restaurants). Again, for the people who've complained its quite a walk, the size of the grounds is a key attraction - this is not a typical Waikiki hotel that takes up its entire lot with a building, and everything is inside the building. The beach was a nice lagoon-style affair, with some basic snorkeling right there. On the other side of the resort is a rougher beach, with stronger waves, ideal for surfing. The pools were quite nice, even if the wind made it a bit cold to swim sometimes. Food: Quality was excellent, though we would have liked a little more variety in cuisines. Fair amount of local fish and shrimp, which was good, but we were left craving some spicy food. Prices were typical for a resort, and are typically one of the most frequent complaints about places like this. We also do the "how did that quick snack cost $100?" every now and then at resorts, but our way of dealing with it is to balance out the nice meals with simpler stuff from local (cheap) places or supermarkets. The best options we found were the Fiji market, about 2 miles away, which had good, spicy, Indian-style curries,and Romy's shrimp truck (not trucks really, just very basic restaurants, similar to the road-side restaurants in Asia), but thats why you need a car. Of course, then the cost of the car has to figure into the cost of the food, but oh well. Overall, I felt the resort does a good job of providing food options - they had some pizzas on the menu, and the Surfer Bar had a happy hour menu with pizzas for $15, which made for a very reasonable meal. Service: This is always the deciding factor for us at resorts - frankly, long after the credit card bill has come and gone, and the pictures relegated to the 46th page of Facebook albums, the memories that remain are shaped by the service we get. One of our cheapest but most memorable vacations was 10 days at an all-inclusive in Playa Del Carmen - because all the people we met genuinely tried to do whatever they could to improve our stay. This place has the same sort of service outlook. When I asked if we could get a room with a better view, they kept one aside for us the next day so we could come back and decide which one we liked better. They took us to and from the golf-course restaurant by golf cart (even though it was a few hundred yards, but it was about to rain). The fire-dancers let my kids re-take their pictures 3 times. We're not high-maintenance customers, but we do remember how our specific requests are treated by the hotel, and this place definitely gets our approval.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: Kelseymom
Reviews.Content: We wanted to experience the North Shore on Oahu, so we booked a Beach Villa for one night at Turtle Bay Resort. We prepaid for our Villa to get the discount. When we arrived at the Resort, we were surprised to find how large it. The website does not do it justice. It is large with a beautiful golf course, tennis courses, a large pool as well as beautiful beaches. The check in line was long, and it took a while to get to the counter. At the counter, we were told that we had been upgraded and moved to the hotel which we were not excited about as we wanted to stay on the beach. However, we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite and give a late check out of 4 p.m. the next day (we were flying out that night to go home and we had a late night flight so a late check out was great). What can I say – I highly recommend the Presidential Suite! Beautiful views we watch the sunset on one balcony and the sunrise on another. The suite has a double shower and a large whirlpool tub. My 10 year old daughter thought she had died and gone to heaven. We went to the pool in the afternoon. It is deep and large (however a little cold – the North Shore is quite breezy!). There is a waterslide, but my daughter was unimpressed with it. The next morning we got up and swam in the ocean. The beach is lovely. The whole facility is well maintained, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Older but still a great Hawaiian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amc23
Reviews.Content: As you can tell from the architecture in pictures the hotel is older and still has that older feel despite having much of it redone. I would highly recommend upgrading to the cottage if you can. They are very spacious and have the most amazing views from the lanai. Overall it is still a great hotel on the quiet North Shore and you get a great sense of old hawaii. I just would not choose this hotel if you are looking for something chic and modern.

Reviews.Title: “If safety is a concern, please do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Oahu_resident
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for a weekend in June and would have rated the hotel well. Unfortunately, I had an accident on the tennis court and ended up bruising my ribs and spraining my wrist. I do admit that slipping on the wet court was my fault. However, the lack of concern for my well-being after my accident was deplorable. After my tennis partner notified the tennis staff of my accident, my tennis partner came back with ice in a garbage bag. The staff at the courts never asked me if I would like to go to the hospital, did not offer a ride back to the hotel or even asked if I was okay. I was forced to walk back to my room, waited over 30min for someone from security to let me know that I would have to buy my own medical supplies (including bandages to wrap my sprain) since there was no first aid kit at the resort. In the end, I believe that accidents are inevitable. They happen, However, the true test of customer service is when an accident does happen, how the staff responds. In this case, there are other wonderful resorts in Oahu that have staff that care and show concern about their guests. Please stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Want a quiet paradise away from the craziness of the city?”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann P
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the time we left our experience was, in a word, perfect! The staff was friendly and made us feel truly welcomed. The food in all the restaurants was delicious and reasonably priced for a resort. Be sure to get a table at Hang Ten to catch the amazing sunset, or pick a quite grassy spot and enjoy it from there. Our room overlooked the lagoon and was clean and well ordered. We left the balcony doors open all night and fell asleep to the gentle sound of the ocean. The spa is one of the best I've seen, with great views of the ocean. The breakfast buffet was incredible! My only regret is that we had to leave this beautiful paradise, and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “If I could afford it, I would stay here everytime I visited Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: WorldTour1498
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, with breathtaking views of the ocean. The food at the restaurants and in the lobby bar is great, Hang Ten (the outdoor bar/lounge) has great drinks and live music. The resort is right on the shore, you can go to sleep with the patio door open and hear the waves crashing into the shore all night. The service, location, and amenities are worth every penny. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: rncathy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 9 day trip to Oahu. We stayed 5 days at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and finished it off with 4 days at the Turtle Bay. This was our first stay at Turtle Bay. As I already mentioned, the location is beautiful! I think most of the higher rooms ( above the 3rd floor probably) have beautiful views. Pay a little more to get a bigger lanai with two chairs and a little table, otherwise it is a little Juliet balcony. The resort itself is very cool and like someone else mentioned has a very laid back, cool vibe. I think the lobby has been recently renovated and it has a nice little bar called the Surfer that was fun. Great views from the lobby of the ocean as well. Now for the not so great: the rooms were more than a little tired. I had heard that, but I was still pretty bummed when we saw our room. It was not any better than the park and fly hotel we stayed at the night before our flight to Hawaii. I feel bad saying this, but if that is something that will bother you, it is worth knowing. Yes, the location is beautiful, but if room amenities are important, you may want to wait for the renovations. Another point I feel like I have to mention, is the wind. We mostly noticed it at the pool, but man..it was almost too much that it was difficult to enjoy the area. Obviously, I don't know if that is the norm for that property, but it was very windy the four days that we stayed there and for that reason, I probably would not go back. It seemed to really blow at the entrance and over the pool, but at the cove part of the beach on the other side of the hotel it was better. We went horseback riding and I didn't notice it over by the stables as much. The horseback riding was great, by the way! Highly recommend! We ate at Lei Lei's which was good and my husband and son ate at the breakfast buffet, which was okay they said. We had vouchers for the buffet, so we didn't have to pay for that. Good Mai tai's and Bloody Mary's at the pool bar. We had muffins and coffee at the little coffee bar in the lobby which was good too. Definitely go to Ted's Bakery for breakfast and lunch items and try Pizza Bob's and Luibueno in Haleiwa. We really enjoyed Waimea beach and the Waimea falls botanical garden. So, all in all we had a good time. Everyone was very nice at this resort and the service was great! I'm sorry to have to say the negative things, I don't usually..I just want to be honest. It was a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful places on earth”
Reviews.Author: Steven J
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and have stayed in some really great places but when I arrived at Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore of Oahu I realized that I was at one of the most beautiful places on earth. The grounds, the food, the accomadations are only overshadowed by the extrememly polite and friendly locals and staff. This resort is a real treat and you will not be sorry for making the drive to the north shore for the Turtle Bay Resort. Treat yourself to a helicopter ride around the island....a trip you will never forget!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort,”
Reviews.Author: PAMEAJANEY
Reviews.Content: This has been a wonderful vacation. Exdellent accomodations, cleaning service, property maintenance, security, and restaurants and bars. So much to do, Paradise Helicopters on-site, beautiful golf course, great horseback riding,etc. Spa was incredible. We never wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Carrie B
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Turtle Bay last August. Two kids, one couple and one super-fun Grandpa. We had an ocean-view suite that had 2 bedrooms, one sitting room/kitchen area and 2 baths. I honestly am counting the days until we can go back. The weather is glorious (a little sunny, a little cloudy...perfect) and my kids got to take free scuba lessons, surfing... The best part about Turtle Bay, at least in August, is that there aren't a lot of people there! We dined at the restaurants around the resort with no reservations, no dress-code... We just wandered in and ate fabulous fresh seafood with great service and had no worries. It is truly the perfect North Shore atmosphere. If you're interested in big beaches with tons of people and a wild nightlife, Turtle Bay is not for you. If you're interested in lovely surroundings with a completely laid-back attitude and absolutely fabulous service...look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot away from the bustle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: traveller29canada
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Turtle Bay and it was very nice. The location is perfect. We loved the chill, beachy vibe of the North Shore and wouldn't have wanted to base ourselves anywhere else. We rented a car and explored the rest of the island which was ideal. Very glad we did not base ourselves in busy Waikiki! The beach at Turtle Bay was great. Very friendly beach staff as well. The room decor is slightly outdated, but we did not mind. It was clean, had everything we needed and the maid service was fantastic. The view was the best part!! Sufer the bar was a great spot with happy hour being a great option. My only complaint would be that there were a few waitresses that clearly did not enjoy there job, which is a big turnoff for me. One of the restaurants, Leonardo's, could use more exceptional food for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you want to cancel”
Reviews.Author: Celic2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our 20th anniversary there for this November 23rd, they immediately took our money. We now now have to cancel because my sister has cancer. But they refuse to answer my requests for cancellation and refuse to refund any money even though we are within the time limit allowable....are they waiting till this time period elapses so they don't have to pay us back. We were jusy going to postpone...now we will NEVER book there again...service is crap.

Reviews.Title: “Kick back and relax”
Reviews.Author: Troosters
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay away from the busy Waikiki! You'll have the snorkel on one side of the hotel and surf on the other! Golf course and lots of other activities on site! No kids club, but the beach is nice and safe! Pool is good size, happy hour at beach bar and local restaurants with in 10 minutes drive. Looking forward to go back with family!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha1977
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 6 times already..... and I LOVE it! Its a great location away from the touristy Waikiki. The rooms do need an update. I've been coming to this hotel for the last 2 years (yes 6 times) and I've seen the lobby get a transformation and I think it looks great!! But yes I do agree that the rooms need a little updating. The staff at this hotel are amazing! Every time I stay here, the staff are so friendly it makes me feel like I'm coming back home every time I visit. I often eat off the resort because it is cheaper and more "local", so I can't really comment on the restaurants. The parking is sometimes an issue when its a weekend or an event at Surfer The Bar. Often I found that I had to park near the back end of the last parking lot which I feel is not really fare when we are the guests and should be able to park in the front area and leave the back area for visitors. But all in all I really love this hotel and thats why I keep coming back. I will be back there in 2 weeks to stay for 2 weeks and I can't wait!!! I would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to stay in the beautiful north shore away from the tourist trap called waikiki. Its a great hotel in an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property...However very expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: rlccllns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort June 14-22.. We booked through a travel agent and requested an ocean view room, are room was on the 2nd floor and we had more of a pool view than anything else. We thought the staff for the most part was courteous and polite especially in the bar by the pool area, the front desk staff I was not impressed with at all.. very cold and felt as if we were being rushed and we didn't feel as if we could ask any questions because we were a bother. My biggest complaint was how ridiculously priced the food and drinks were.. We made the choice to leave the resort everynight to find restaurants with better prices !! the food was o.k but not great for what it cost. We also felt that the room was o.k. but the furniture was beat up and the bathroom smelled like must and no ventilation. Considering that we spent a week at the resort we felt we should get a complimentary breakfast or a complimentary drink. Nothing at all!! We will not stay here again.. it's too bad that such a beautiful place can be so overpriced and unwelcoming.. One more thing to mention I had to listen to one of the staff members complain to my husband and I how many hours he had worked with no day off when we were going up the elevator. If you choose to stay here, I suggest dining elswhere.. you can find great food just a few miles away for half the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in chill North Shore but rooms are in desparate need of reno”
Reviews.Author: Stuckincleveland
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautifully situated surrounded by water. The grounds are very well maintained. The lobby and public areas are also very well done. The rooms however are in desparate need of renovation. The bathrooms are completely outdated and as a result not clean. The furniture is worn and there are bleach stains on the upholstery. The staff is cold and not that willing to help. The food was decent and you're only a 20 minute drive from Haleiwa which has more options. Overall, we had a nice time but it wasn't worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute change from Waikiki to Turtle Bay Resort just before we left home, and we are so glad we did. Staying here is like staying on another island. The remoteness is what we liked best about this resort. The rooms are large but plain, and it's true they are in need of a renovation, but hey are clean and the beds are comfy. The views, particularly from the higher floors, are incredible. It seemed like the resort was filled with mostly couples and honeymooners, but families seemed welcomed too. They had two pools in the main hotel area - a large pool used mainly by adults, and a family pool with a waterfall and pool slide; neither pool was ever crowded despite the hotel being pretty full. The beach cove adjacent was also uncrowded, and beach chairs and umbrellas were available for hotel guests to use. There was pretty good snorkeling right off the beach, and snorkel rental is free for guests for an hour a day. A few caveats: The food here is very expensive, even by Hawaiian resort standards, and eating anywhere else will require a 10-15 minute drive in either direction from the hotel. Even the poolside grill is crazy expensive. Other than the free breakfast included in our package, we rarely ate on property. A grocery store is 10 minutes away, and we stocked our in room fridge with sandwiches and stuff and did picnics on the beach.This is a different type experience than staying in Waikiki; Turtle Bay is a tropical resort vacation, while staying in Waikiki is more of a big-city vacation by the beach. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: pdolan0519
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time here. My husband and our 2 girls, 13 and 15, spent 6 days at Turtle Bay mostly relaxing and enjoying the beauty of the area. We rented bikes, had one expensive meal at the Italian restaurant which was delicious and another just the two of us at Ola's which is right on the beach. So pretty and romantic and good food. Yes, the food is expensive so we mixed in meals from local places with just the few splurges and it worked out fine. So worth it. We are looking forward to going back sometime before my oldest graduates! She's a Lost fanatic by the way, and we saw some Lost stuff right on the property. Oh, and we LOVED our suite. It was hard to get my younger daughter to want to leave it. "Their" room--aka the livingroom or sitting room--was huge and pretty. We were all so comfy and relaxed there. Hmmm. How can we just live there?

Reviews.Title: “Super Awesome but also Super Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tredi P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at Turtle bay and we both loved it! We stayed in a cottage for 4 days then moved to one of the king suites for our last 2 nights and the cottage was definetly our favorite. Service was great the cottage concierges brought us whatever we asked for and the room was so nice that I didn't want to leave it. We did the horseback rides, helicopter tour, couples massage in a beach side cabana, played golf and hung out at the beach all of which were expensive but Very enjoyable! Leonardo's wasn't as great as I'd hoped, we ordered dominoes pizza one night and lei lei's was great. The employees we came in to contact with were very nice and in the cottage area there weren't many kids, people or distracting things so it was easy to have a romantic time. I'd like to go back but don't know if that will hapen because of the cost and I haven't quite decided if what we got was really worth the amount we paid however Overall I loved it and would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Could, and should, do better.”
Reviews.Author: squirrel2203
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights back in March and had high hopes, but were seriously underwhelmed. Firstly, the parking is a nightmare - a large car park which was full to overflowing when we arrived and filled with, I suspect, people using the beach rather than with guests. We'd booked a room with a Juliet balcony, and asked for an upgrade when we arrived, and were offered a room with a full balcony. The rooms themselves are very tired and dark, and the bathrooms are terrible - awful fluorescent strip lighting and an old bathroom suite. The room was big but the furnishings were old, the upholstered chair even had some mould stains on it, and the room had a slightly musty odour too. Food-wise we were also disappointed. The breakfast buffet was ok quality but the omelette chef was fairly miserable, and the two dinners we ate at the hotel were a let down, and not cheap either. I wasn't blown away by the staff actually - the US is known for its excellent customer service but apparently this hasn't reached Turtle Bay yet. My Scottish husband ordered two drinks at the poolside bar and the barman actually turned to me with a look suggesting my husband was mentally deficient and he didn't understand him, instead of just simply asking him to repeat his request. The valet guys are similarly charming, losing their temper with us for being blocked in by another guest who'd abandoned her vehicle in the loading area. This hotel is very expensive (and charges a rip-off resort fee, unlike most European hotels!) but just doesn't deliver. It reminds me of a three-star in Spain to be honest, not a five-star resort in the US, but I don't think the North Shore really has any other "five-star" hotels so it gets away with it. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Service not what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Micksimpson
Reviews.Content: The pool bar waitresses were the only downside to our 3 days at Turtle Bay Resort. They were slow, appeared unqualified to do the simplest tasks like hand out menus, and just seemed bored. Lucky the rest of the staff around the resort made up for them. Concierges were brilliant as were the guys from the surf rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service....but guest rooms need help”
Reviews.Author: standards21
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at Turtle Bay & my hotel room is okay (Ocean Front Deluxe), but the bathroom is horrible. There is no bath room vent fan, poor lighting, outdated old fixtures & etc. The furniture in the room is warped and chipped. The paint on the plantation shutters is peeling. The parking here is also horrible. The service and food are both great. The lobby and other areas are nice. However, I will not book here again until those bathrooms are updated....seriously.

Reviews.Title: “NICE.”
Reviews.Author: Deb0411
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adjoining rooms for our family of 5 with a king & 2 queens. The rooms were spacious and clean, and having 2 rooms meant 2 BIG bathrooms, which was really wonderful. Previous entries talked about it needing renovation, but I didn't see that in our rooms, halls, or lobby. We were on 4th floor in south wing overlooking pool AND the bay/ocean. ( I wouldn't have wanted to be in 2nd or 3rd floor or you'd have seen too much roof of lower level.) We surfed twice with onsite Hans Heideman surf instructors. They were ALL friendly and helpful. Snorkeling in the bay was neat and lady in the Snorkel Rental shop was very friendly & offered ideas on places to go and see, as did the concierge personnel. Food was expensive at any of thier onsite restaraunts, but everything in Hawaii seemed expensive. Two Foodland grocery stores closeby convenient to stock our frig with snacks, drinks, and breakfast items. Ted's Bakery about 4 miles down was easy to get to, and had rolls, breakfast foods & lunches. I loved eating outside at almost every meal we ate. When leaving, our flights were in the evening, so I asked if we could check out late rather than at the standard 11am. No problem (and no extra charge). We checked out at 2, and got to enjoy our last morning on their beach and still had time to shower & pack up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay; Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: tramost
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in a king oceanfront cottage. We were offered free buffet breakfast since the handicapped cottage was the only one available when we checked in. We took the offer. The room is very nice, clean, spacious. The bathroom has a separate shower and tub and also very spacious. The lanai faces the ocean and has a nice grass area with hammocks. The breakfast buffet was excellent, lots of choices. The resort is beautiful. Nice beach and great to watch surfers do their thing. The only complaint is that the lobby lounge closes at around 9 pm. We decided one time to stop by at 9:30 and the bartender told us that we should go to the bar. We didn't because there was a cover charge required and didn't really care for the entertainer that night -- we only wanted a mai tai before we go to bed. Overall, it was a great stay. We can't wait to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location,”
Reviews.Author: prt239
Reviews.Content: have loved every minute here, only stayed two nights wish it was more , room is big have an ocean view , bed is so comfortable. Played golf on both courses, palmer course absolutely awesome , condition was immaculate up there with the best i have played, fazio course was good fun , but there is no comparison , if you play both play fazio first, or if money is no option just stick on the palmer . staff friendly, have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our peaceful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June with our two teenagers. Were in an oceanfront cottage - definitely worth it, if you can get a good rate like we did! We sat on our back porch and watched the ocean every a.m. and p.m. We had an easy walk to the pool and main building. The cottages are very spacious, which was nice with 4 adult-sized people. We had two queen beds. We didn't eat on resort. Drove to Ted's for breakfast - highly recommend it! Drove into Halelei for lunch and dinner - recommend Spaghettinis - it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but dated”
Reviews.Author: Chip004
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my daughter (mid-20's) for a mother-daughter getaway, and chose this location because we wanted to see the whole island, not just Honolulu. It is definitely away from it all, perhaps too much so, but certainly is in a gorgeous location. The incessant wind (not just a breeze) was something we hadn't anticipated. We appreciated the multiple outdoor areas – pool is separate from two different beach areas – so that the large capacity of the hotel doesn't seem overwhelming. The pool and pool deck area both are small for the size of the hotel, and felt uncomfortable to us when we attempted to lounge there due to a couple of loud families using the space. Our hotel room was spacious and overlooked the beach (I understand nearly all rooms have ocean views). The beds were comfortable and we liked having a large dressing area with a sink, separate from the full bathroom. However, everything felt a little old and in need of updating or replacement. The closet door wouldn't stay shut, the plastic tray that holds the soaps, etc. looked like it was from a garage sale, the paint on the walls was peeling in a few small areas, and the carpet had a sizable tear. Overhead fluorescent tubes above a dark plastic grate (circa 1970) light the bath/sink area. Yes, the rooms definitely need a facelift. If you're looking for a large oceanfront resort with golf, tennis, ocean sports, etc. and want to be on Oahu but not in Honolulu, this is a very good option. It isn't the Four Seasons, but it'll do. P.S. With 20/20 hindsight, as a mother/daughter duo that enjoy both shopping and sightseeing, we would have been smarter to stay in Waikiki. It is easy to get in and out of town, and there is so much more to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Imperial26203
Reviews.Content: Just got married at Turtle Bay and everything was better than expected. Planned the whole wedding by searching online and did it all with the help of the onsite wedding coordinator at TB. The cost were reasonable as I had a small wedding of 17. It basically works out like this. There is a package you can download from the TB website that has all the info about the different locations to do the ceremony. We chose The Pavilion, for that just in case it rains possibility. It turned out to be a gorgeous day and we were still so happy to have chosen the Pavilion instead of being on the lawn or the beach in the outdoors. It was more formal and the guest really enjoyed the Pavilion. The cost was $1500 for the Ceremony in the Pavilion. The other locations range from $1000 to $2500 for the ceremony. Since it was a small wedding we went with the onsite restaurant. Their fancy restaurant is 21 but they are not opened on Sunday which was the day of our wedding. So we lucked out and went with Ola's which is right on the beach. The food is cheaper and they do a fantastic wedding menu. Cost per person is anywhere from $69 to $89 for the meal only. Liquor is separate. You get an incredible amount of food. Appetizers to share and each person basically gets 2 entrees. Incredible. Not one person finished their meal and everyone was completely satisfied and truly enjoyed the meal. We did do the rehearsal dinner at 21 and honestly, 21 is a fancier restaurant but you're in Hawaii so go to Ola's Fantastic people there.... You're other choice is at the resort if you have more than 30 guests. I can't opine on the food with the resort but it will surely be more costly (because you have to rent the venue and the menu choices are more expensive than Ola's) and definitely not as good as Ola's. The key is getting the right planner at Turtle Bay. You have to go with Mikilani, she is the best and will make the difference in the experience you receive. I had a different planner when I first started and they never returned my calls as it took a while to lock in the date. They were also no help in making the decision on the reception location. Everything changed when I luckily got assigned to Mikilani. She is thorough and efficient and provides so much help and suggestions. Even the ideas of a sand ceremony that made it feel special and is a reminder of our special time in Hawaii. Don't get me wrong, she is not perfect and she is not your personal servant. She has many weddings to attend to and will probably give you more attention as the wedding date gets closer. They provide a list of vendors, some of which we used. Pastor Ron is the onsite Pastor that does service on Sunday's at the resort. Great choice. $250 + tip Bianca Photography was fabulous. Cost was $2k for 4-5 hours but she was incredibly professional and well worth it. Flowers were by Flower Farm. Cost about $1200 for Bouquet on Bride and maid of honor. All the rest of the floral for ceremony and reception. Very professional and highly recommended Cake was Sweet as Sugar as we went for a Cake Pop wedding cake for 25 ppl that was a big hit. Do the red velvet. $400 - $500 We had a Male Musician. Young Hawaiian Guy. $200 or $250 Forgot his name but he is on the list and a great choice as well . Make sure you take care of Mikilani if you can get her as she puts it all together for you. The one thing you have to splurge on as a couple getting married is a King Size beach cottage. The pictures online does not do it justice. Doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you walk in and there's fresh fruit and juice waiting for you, you really feel like you're in paradise. Search around and wait it out and you can probably get the room for less than $400 per night. The other choice is the wedding package rooms which are $200 a night. They were okay. I had a guest that went through Homeaway.com and got a 3br condo right next to resort. There is a main one that is right on the beach that is very nice. And a whole bunch of other timeshares and apt rentals that are nearby but not in walking distance of the resort. I still say to do the beach cottage. You won't regret it. FYI.... Golf package is great deal for the guys or any golfers coming to the wedding... Horseback riding is great too. Snorkeling right on the beach at the resort. Lots of famous Shrimp Trucks nearby Resort and the town of Haleiwa is 20 min away. A truly fantastic time and can't wait to return for an Anniversary. If you want to see more than watch the movie.. "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". The whole movie was done there. The room they had was the beach cottage and the dinner location was Ola's. The front desk in the movie overlooking the ocean is actually the lobby bar at the resort. Hope this helps..

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip was made special by Turtle Bay and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: donnawheeler
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Oahu. The first thing we did, rented a convertible!! Excellent choice #1. We started out with three nights at the busy beach of Waikiki and decided to end our anniversary trip at Turtle Bay! Excellent choice #2 We did all the sight seeing tours...Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, Punch Bowl, different state parks, Blow Hole and just riding up the east coast. EC #3. We decided to ride up the west coast towards the North Shore on our way to Turtle Bay. Check in was easy and they had a delicious pineapple juice for new comers. We went to our room and we were not too happy with the view. My husband said just call and see if they have another room. I didn't want to complain but ths was our first trip here and our anniversary. So I did call and they said if we wanted to see the cottages they would upgrade us for xx amount of dollars. We went to see and WOW!! We decided to upgrade and that was definitely EC #4-100 !!!! The view at the cottages are unbelievable. We had a hammock in "our" backyard and the sunsets were breath taking!! I didn't want to leave the room. In fact, when we left, I had to say goodbye to our hammock! :-) Some people have stated that stores and restaurants were far away. We didn't think that at all and found many places to eat and shop. The breakfast buffet at TB was very good. We went to the Polynesian Cutural Center...ok! But not the place if you are looking for a luau. We were constantly riding up and down the east and west coasts. We couldn't get enough of the breath taking views!! The people of Oahu were very hospitable and loved talking about their beautiful island. That is how we knew about some of the places we visited...asking the locals. We have many wonderful memories and pictures of our time in Oahu. Thank you everyone for making our anniversary a very special one.

Reviews.Title: “TURTLE BAY RESORT”
Reviews.Author: morena v
Reviews.Content: Just got back on 06/08/12. booked at Turtle Bay because it was a close drive to Polynisian Center, did not want to drive to Waikiki after the night show which ended at 9:30(amazing show). if you are used to newer hotel, this is not for you. we were staying at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki and yes this hotel is outdated. the showers, furniture in the bathroom are old. our room had a pee smell, didnt seem it was clean and left my slippers on to shower just in case, the view is spectacular and the beach area amazing. very poor service, we had to get out of our car and ask the group employees having a chat at the entrance to get our luggage to our room. i dont think we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing get away”
Reviews.Author: Salle230
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii, we chose Turtle Bay because it was away from busy Waikiki. After reading many reviews, I tried to have a positive attitude about some of the complaints. First off it's far from many stores or restaurants, and an hour drive from the airport, a rental is a must. We happened to like the seclusion. Check in was fast and everyday the staff greeted us with a smile. Our room was just ok, I have stayed in better, but it wasn't bad. The bed was comfortable and loved sleeping with the balcony doors open ( until the smoker above us would smoke). The furniture was worn and had scuff marks. We might have paid for the room...but who spends the whole time there? We also had a view of the roof, but the bay was still visible as well as the pool. I also liked the daily activity sheet they leave for you. We had the breakfast buffet twice, it was very good, with a good selection to choose from. It was a bit pricey for us. We also had drinks, lunch and dinner at Ola on the beach, I really liked my shrimp pasta as well as the pork nachos and garlic fries. We were so busy that 3 meals a day didn't happen. We did go to Foodland and stock up on snacks and juice in between meals. All in all we really loved Turtle Bay. It has so much to offer as far as activities. We mainly snorkeled. We saw many beautiful fish and even a sea turtle came right up to us. Although it is a public beach it was not overcrowded. We look forward to visiting again. Thank you to all the staff for helping our first trip be a delightful one.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: pink7oreo
Reviews.Content: The resort is fantastic, it has absolutely EVERYTHING. I'm just sad we didn't have enough time to take advantage of it. It has a pool, beach, and golf course on site. Surfers will love staying here as there are some awesome waves that can be caught in the area. There are various restaurants available on site and the room service allows you to order from each of their menus :) The only downside is that our ocean front room had a view of the asphalt roof. My only pet peeve is that cleaning service never came to our room when we didn't have a sign out on our door. We came from a resort that also had the same issue and it just added fuel to the fire as I was quite annoyed. But everything else was great otherwise. If you have time for a massage, they have a little hut that's right by the ocean and you can get a nice view and sound of the waves. There's also a great area that is an enclosed separate space with floor to ceiling window panel doors that can all be opened for those thinking about getting married or having an event at the resort. You'll get a great view of the sunset and the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bobby G
