Reviews.Content: Ok here goes! Just got back last night. We spent 8 days and after a rough start I will say enjoyable. We arrived and checked into our hotel and lasted about 10 minutes. The rooms in the main hotel are very outdated(40 years?). Showers are old and tile. Rugs on floor do not look like they have been cleaned in many years, furniture was all scratched up and the bureaus were musty. We were then upgraded at a cost of another $200/night with fees and taxes to the beach cottages. These were better to stay in. Hardwood floors, newer bathroom and clean. I would recommend you stay in these if you stay at this hotel. The employees and service were great. I would recommend this area if you plan on relaxing. I would say the food at hotel was ok but a little pricey. I recommend Ted's Bakery about a couple of miles down. The golf was great and play after 2Pm as it gets cheaper. About 10 miles down on the way to Haleewa you will be able to see some sea turtles which was great. We also saw a monk seal on turtle bay property. If you are used to newer and cleaner rooms such as a Marriott Hotel this may not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We went to Turtle Bay for our honeymoon and this is the place to be on Oahu if you're looking for a romantic getaway. It is an hour away from Waikiki, Honolulu, Pearl Harbor and the airport so you will need a rental car, but the drive to the North Shore is worth it. The views and scenery are breathtaking and the people are over the top nice. There's no way you can get upset in Hawaii! Positives: The beach is public, but it is not crowded and it is nice with snorkeling available The pool with the pool bar Hangten (where Forgetting Sarah Marshall) was filmed Speaking of the sunset it is amazing from Hangten where you can experience the "green flash" The breakfast buffet is amazing, anything you want The restaurants are all top notch with the price a little higher, but it's Hawaii what do you expect? Two golf courses on site Negatives: Stay away from room service, pricey and poor quality compared to the other food options on the property Limited number of food options and establishments The trade winds can be very difficult at times An hour drive away from the commercialized tourist areas (this is also a good thing tho too) Wednesday night talk stories at Surfer The Bar...boring!!! I rate this trip as excellent and I would love to go back. a couple of tips are travel to the local foodlands for snacks, water, frescas, and what have you. Also check out the waterfall at Waimea Bay. Sleep With the patio door open to fall asleep to the waves in the Ocean

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii the way it was meant to be”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: this resort had everything we wanted, in a beautiful surrounding. there were even lei making classes!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Hawaii at its best”
Reviews.Author: sandra b
Reviews.Content: I have been to Turtle Bay Resort three separate times. I can tell you by far after 5 trips to multiple islands, this is the best! 880 acres of pure wonder! We went to the Ritz on Maui for our second week and wished we could have spent the entire 2 weeks back on Turtle Bay! I highly recommend the beach cottages. The water is only 30 feet from your back porch. You year the waves all night long. Staff is so friendly and accommodating! And Ed by the pool makes the strongest Mai Tai's around, Delicious, but watch out! :) The miles of untouched, undeveloped beach and incredible sea glass is what draws us back again and again. And of course the HORSES! the stable is wonderful! Being a horse lover it is great to be able to go on vacation but still enjoy what I love most- riding! Alecia and Raule are AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort !”
Reviews.Author: capebretonerBenEoin
Reviews.Content: My husband, my son and I were anxious to get away from crowds at Waikiki, so we rented a car and drove around the east coast of Oahu up to the north shore. Turtle Bay was our salvation. This resort has everything we were looking for. While it was a short walk to the beach, they were practically deserted. The surfers far out numbered the beach goers.Our room had an incredible view of the ocean and from the balcony you could hear the surf.The food was good. Pool area was a little crowded. This may have been due to their celebration of 40 years in operation and there seemed to be a lot of employees and their families. Service was very good every where except around the pool and it seemed it was only one particular waitress who left alot to be desired. I would definitely head straight back to this resort for R and R.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you cold have wanted.........”
Reviews.Author: AdamCronin
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner always do our holidays in January and this year we decided to do a hell of a trip. Going to Whistler first, then Vancouver and lastly Turtle bay on the north shore. Once we landed and went to collect our bags through the James bond style airport, I picked up the open top jeep and drove up to the north shore. It was dark when we did this but the views are still fab, driving in Hawaii is actually okay with the top speed limits being 50mph, so you have no worry about keeping up with the locals. On arrival our pre booked lei's were waiting for us, they look amazing and smell like vanilla. Simply lovely. Our beach cottage (123) was amazing and after looking at some of the others around ours seemed to be one of the biggest, it was large, cool, modern but oozed Hawaii. The veranda was amazing, leading on to well maintained fresh green grass, hammocks and the sound of the roaring ocean. Breakfast was amazing and the omelettes were famous, the omelette chef was certainly kept busy... You have never tried one like it before it your life! Do some of the activities, the kayaks were fantastic and very reasonably priced. Everyone has there own views on accommodation and I can't speak for the hotel rooms but the beach cottages were amazing and well worth the extra money. Book it now! :) Adam

Reviews.Title: “Great secluded place in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gregg60
Reviews.Content: After travelling to the other Hawaiian Islands we were surprised to find this secluded gem on Oahu. An hour drive from the airport it is nestled on a cove on the northern shore - where the best surfing waves on the Island abound. The rooms are clean, and comfortable and not overly appointed. There are several good restarants on the property as well as two terrific golf courses. The resort has all the amenities on property that you could possibly want: golf, tennis, helicopter tours, kayak tours, bicycle rentals and fabulous beaches. You can't go wrong spending time there!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: londonbaby82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 1 night in April for an on site wedding...This review is not for the wedding at all just the actual hotel. The hotel room was spacious but needed a lot of updating and a coat of paint. The restaurants down stairs are very expensive and being on the north shore you don't have a ton of options. the pools are beautiful and the view is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: CastleLvr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in May, 2012 for 5 nights. I had never stayed on the North Shore before and I have mixed feelings about it. I love that it is so remote and less people then Waikiki, but because of its remoteness, it takes an hour to get anywhere and since my friend had never been to Oahu before, she wanted to see the sights. Check in was relatively painless except that we arrived at 10:30 p.m. and waited approximately 15 minutes for the reservationist because there was only one person at the desk and there was somebody checking in who was not satisfied with his room selection. They upgraded us to a 2 Queen room on the 5th floor with a balcony. The room was lovely and plenty big, but it could of used a new paint job. Also, a must for me in a hotel is for black-out drapes. Our room only had shutters and we both were up every morning at 6:00 a.m. because of the bright sunlight peeking through the shutters. While at the resort we went to the pool only once as the wind never stopped blowing all week. I was somewhat dissappointed by this as I was really looking forward to sipping some cold drinks by the pool. I did enjoy the hammocks that are lined up along the beach. We did have massages and they were WONDERFUL! A great way to start a vacation. The spa was nicely appointed and inviting. We only ate at the hotel once because after I saw that the breakfast buffet was $30 we decided to find somewhere else to eat. We drove down the street about 15 minutes to a Foodland and bought some snacks and drinks since we had a small fridge in our room we bought yogurt and fruit, etc for breakfast. For lunch, we found THE SHRIMP TRUCKS!!! OMG they were amazing. Just turn left as you exit the resort and it is about 9 miles or so. We went to Giovanni's twice for lunch. I had the shrimp scampi and my friend had the lemon butter shrimp. Just delicious. As for sightseeing, if you leave the resort and turn right and trip your odometer to 0, when it reaches just about 9 miles you are in front of a turtle beach. It was so cool seeing the turtles right in the surf eating on the kelp. Also, we enjoyed going to the Polynesia Cultural Center. I haven't been there in years and it was a lot better than I remembered. We both enjoyed all of the activities and I enjoyed the quick trip home as it is only a few miles away. I kind of felt sorry for the people that had to drive all the way back to Waikiki late at night. We made our fair share of trips to Waikiki though and it will take you a good hour to do this from the Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “A place to create wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: HibiscusDays
Reviews.Content: This place was really great in terms of location, the view, and being in the more slow-paced side of Oahu. The woman who checked us in was really nice, un-pretentious, and informative. She upgraded our ocean view room to an ocean view room with the largest lanai. I think this made our stay just that much nicer. As other reviewers have noted, the bathrooms in the rooms could do with some upgrading. Probably the one thing that I did not like was the hotel leaving a stuffed animal on the bed. My little girl was so excited to find it. I initially thought it was a small welcome gift for those traveling with children, but it turned out to be something you could "adopt" and take with you for $20. While we really could have purchased it, I felt this was a little manipulative and would prefer if the resort would just have these for sale at one of the gift stores. I would still definitely stay here again. Some positives: We liked the pools and how the kids could go from the large pool to the kiddie pool to the hot tub to the pool with the slide (when open). Our dinner at Ola's was delicious. Try the salmon with the brown sugar and miso glaze (I think that's what it was) and the prawns with pasta - delicious! Of course, it's also fun to mix it up and have a meal at one of the shrimp trucks (the garlic and butter prawns at Romy's was good even with the 45-minute wait) and the Coffee Gallery in Haleiwa makes a good cup of coffee. While you're in Haleiwa, stop by the Soap Cellar if you're into handmade soaps made from natural ingredients. I tried the one with Lemongrass and now wish I would have purchased more!

Reviews.Title: “Truly paradise”
Reviews.Author: Joshmcd5
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is such an amazing relief from the hustle and bustle that Waikiki and Honolulu are known for. The staff and seething are very complimentary to one another. I highly encourage joining the paddle board lesson as its one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Kiri J
Reviews.Content: We loved Turtle Bay resort! We finished our honeymoon here and loved it. We wished we stayed there longer. The rooms were wonderful, service was great and Leonardo's restaurant in the hotel was amazing. The location is just beautiful, the beach, the pool area and the walking tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Beautiful Authentic Hawaiian Location - Much To Offer - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rock-Subculture
Reviews.Content: This is one in a series of seven reviews for seven hotels and resorts I stayed at during a recent trip to Hawaii (Maui and Oahu) in the month of May 2012. This is part of a continuing series of my impressions and experiences staying at various hotels and resorts while traveling to attend concerts worldwide. This review is for the Turtle Bay Resort in Kahuku in Oahu, Hawaii. Property: Turtle Bay Resort Location: Kahuku, Oahu (Hawaii) Address: 57-091 Kamehameha Highway, Kahuku, Oahu, HI 96731 Phone: (800) 203-3650 Website: www.turtlebayresort.com Room Type/Class: Perfect Escapes (Room 540) Date: May 20-21, 2012 Booking Source: Perfect Escapes Overall Rating: 4.5/5 [Note: Score is totally subjective based on price, location, and comparison to "like" properties within same area and price range] This was my first visit to Oahu, and having read about and talked with others about Honolulu and Waikiki, I knew I wanted to spend at least part of the time at an area on the island that was, by contract, more “authentic” Hawaiian. Doing some research, it seemed like the northern part of the island, near Historic Haleiwa Town, would be an ideal place to visit. As such, Turtle Bay Resort seemed to fit the profile of the property I had hoped to visit. I booked the stay through Perfect Escapes, which also included a resort credit, which could be used at the many restaurants and shops on site at the property. Valet parking was smooth and quick, as was check-in. The resort features a beautiful and spacious lobby with incredible views of the ocean. There are also many places to sit and relax to enjoy the atmosphere and views. The room itself appeared a bit more dated than the lobby, but was clean and nice. My particular room featured great ocean views – nearly 180 degrees – and I found later that the sunset was centered in the ocean view, which was wonderful as the room featured a balcony with chairs to sit and enjoy the sunset from the privacy of my own room. The furniture in the room was pretty basic but functional. It was fairly large with a big, two room bathroom with sink in each. Also included was an empty refrigerator for your use. As a negative, I found the included Wi-Fi internet to be incredibly slow – so slow I opted to instead use my tethered smart phone over my carrier’s network instead, as just basic websurfing was much slower than reliable dial-up speeds. Leaving the room, there was a lot to do and explore. While my stay was limited to just one night, I felt as though I could be completely satisfied using the resort, its facilities, and the adjacent beach areas for several says without leaving the hotel and would have been completely satisfied. There are multiple restaurant options, shops, a nice pool area, and an excellent beach. After checking in and getting settled, I had lunch at the outdoor restaurant, the Hang Ten Surf Bar, and watched surfers while I ate, which was a lot of fun. The food was good for sandwich and drinks style fare. That night I decided to have dinner at their Palm Terrace Restaurant in the resort, which features Italian food. Unfortunately, the food here was pretty mediocre, so if I were to return, I would try one of the other restaurants. The property charges a $25 resort fee and valet parking is an additional $15 per night. Overall, I would definitely return for a more extended stay, and prefer this area to Waikiki and Honolulu. I feel the resort has a lot to offer in terms of amenities, and this part of the island was a lot of fun to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy M
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read a thousand reviews on this place before booking. I was a bit nervous as a lot of reviews said the rooms were old and needed updated. To be totally honest, yes the rooms are on the older side but very clean and comfortable. I'm becoming a hotel "snob" as I travel more:) and I would not hesitate to recommend this resort. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows, wow never been so comfy in a hotel. My husband and I spent 5 nights here and it was so beautiful. We hardly left the resort we enjoyed it so much. This was our 4th time to Hawaii ( we live in Alaska so this is our favorite getaway place:) Our 1st time to Oahu. Turtle Bay was a bit of a drive from the airport but I had no desire to be in Honolulu. The downside is food. There are several options at the resort but if you are feeding a family it can be pricey. Drinks, ok come on, the prices were way high, even compared to Alaska! Mai Tai $10, no not worth it. Oh, and refrigerators in the room, I didn't find out about it until after we checked out, it was hidden in the bathroom sink cabinet, who would have thunk it? I should have asked sooner, I just assumed the room did not have one. Each room has an ocean view, we did upgrade to the room with a large lanai, the cottages are quite a bit more spendy not worth the extra for us. Our room overlooked the pool area, pros: could hear the music in the evening, Cons: can be very noisy if you just want to listen to the ocean. Next time I probably will ask for a room overlooking the wedding chapel, nothing but ocean views for miles! and not as noisy. I loved leaving the doors to the lanai open all night listening to the ocean. and the sunsets were gorgeous, can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: halfmatathoner
Reviews.Content: We had the sunrise each morning. Over looked the bay side. Reserved on line, look for specials.

Reviews.Title: “8 days of perfection at TBR”
Reviews.Author: PPCDteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed in beach cottage 103 for 8 nights! The resort is beautiful, the location of the beach cottage was amazing, and staff was friendly and helpful! I think I took 1000 pictures! We rented bikes, took a guided kayak trip (way over priced but still glad we did it), visited Waimae Valley, snorkeled at Shark's Cove and the resort, and ate at Lei Leis, Ola, and Leonardos. All of our experiences were fantastic! I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye05
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night on our tour around Oahu. We got a great deal on-line and enjoyed the pool. & beach. We were there in June 2011 and there were not tourist occupying the pool at that time. Don't miss the turtle beach which is a nearby drive. Also if you want cheap great food (which you will not find at the hotel) check out Kahuku Grill not to far down the road. You can eat there or get it to-go, but it was amazing! The restaurants on the resort property are way overpriced for a budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Home Again.”
Reviews.Author: Janet F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used to come to Turtle Bay at least once a year. It has been 11years since we were here last and have to say, I'm very disappointed. Good things first, you cannot beat the location, it is beautiful. Views are amazing. Bad things, there is not enough help and most of the staff doesn't appear to be very good at their jobs. The hotel does need another facelift. Dennis at the Hang Ten Bar was excellent, however. Food is just so-so. As much as I love the location I think I would rather stay at a better run resort in Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort and Public Beach is a better name for this overpriced and over rated "honey moon destination"”
Reviews.Author: Vegasscorpio77
Reviews.Content: TOURIST BEWARE: Read the fine print and be careful if or when you choose to book a room at Turtle Bay Resort. The resort she be more appropriately named "Turtle Bay Resort and Public Beach with free amenities. Me and me new wife were charged $26 resort fee for each day we booked at the hotel which either had to be paid up front , via debit or credit card, or have a $150 per day charge held on our credit card. Once we saw how ridiculous priced and overated the food was, we decided to rent a car to explore the beautiful surrounding areas and its local cuisine and street food that ened of being a fraction of the price and 5 times better then what the resort was offering. After renting the car we also come to realize that there was no designated parking for us as guest and the valet was not only $15 it was available to anyone from the general public including the beaches that are on their 880 acre resort. We saw several families and locals parking their cars and mini-vans and parading to the beach and pool that we assumed was a private amenity of the resort that was included in our "Resort Fee". We were wrong. Our anticipated private north shore honeymoon getaway turned into Disneyland as we saw all the locas with their kids occupting the pool and the beaches. We called the front desk to ask if the pool area was for the public and she replied "no it's only for guest" but we continued to see several guest, that were not hotel guest, walking around the side of the the buildings, happily going to the pools without any security or anyone checking room keys or asking any questions in respect to who was authorized to be there or who were guest. Mind you, there is a vacant security center at the entrance that had no one in it that is only lit up at night for decorative purposes. The gates are never let down and and we saw not one security on their staff. If you are familiar with Vegas, like we are because we live there, Turtle Bay is like a locals Casino that the general public goes to that has no other options in their area to go to. The hotel casino guests pay the average $15 resort fees and taxes but all the locals more less occupy the casino floor and sometimes sneak pass secuity to go to the pools. Turtle Bay has no restrictions to the public flooding their beach and private property and encourages them to frequent the bar, the restaurants, and other parts of the resort to help boost their economy. Someone posted that the views are amazing. They are truly amazing and Oahu is beautiful, so is the dozen of otherpublic beaches that are on the North Shore thatt cover about a 25-30 mile stretch either direction. We as consumers are tired of being mislead , over charged, treated unfairly when it comes to our hard earned dollar, and so sick of the continuous nickel and diming we have to face. It needs to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy G
Reviews.Content: During my time in the US Army, I had the pleasure of staying at Turtle Bay. Needless to say, it is amazing! You're staying on the north shore of Hawaii, in rooms which are comfortable but the view will take your breath away. Would I return - absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Spot - Spring for the Beach Cottage!”
Reviews.Author: CassondraKO
Reviews.Content: It's bittersweet writing this review, having just returned from my most magical honeymoon at Turtle Bay Resort. It was hard having my coffee this morning without the smell of plumeria and the sound of the waves! We stayed in one of the beach cottages, which was well worth the extra cost. The room was amazing - a huge comfortable poster bed, marble bathroom with a huge tub (big enough for two!) and a lanai with a table, two chair and a bonus rocking chair. (The view of the sunset was out of this world!) The cottages have their own "backyard" with hammocks and private beach access (though the beach is rocky and you need to go to the main beach for swimming). As I said, there was a plumeria tree right beside our porch, and I got to smell it every morning when I went out on the lanai. The beach cottages also had a separate concierge who took care of all of our reservations (dinners, helicopter tour, horseback ride) and delivered fresh fruit daily. Everyone at the resort was super-friendly - you can feel the Aloha spirit the minute you walk in. There are flowers everywhere for you to pick up and put in your hair, and pineapple juice in the lobby. The resort offers plenty of activities - we enjoyed a couples massage, went on a helicopter tour, took a sunset horseback ride, and went snorkeling on the beach (guests get 1 hour of snorkeling equipment free every day!) The resort also offered surfing instruction, tennis, and golf. The on-site restaurants were nice - pricey, but not more than I'd expect to be paying at any other resort. I really enjoyed Ola's, where our table was literally in the sand of the beach. What an experience! :) The property is massive and beautiful and I encourage those who stay here to either explore with one of the walking trails, or to take a horseback ride to see more than just the beach. You'll be glad you did! So - long story long, Turtle Bay was amazing. We really couldn't have picked a better place to honeymoon. We will be back when our Aloha needs recharging :)

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii it is. What a low key excellent resort.”
Reviews.Author: TrueOpinion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in room 501. Check in was great, Kristin was very nice and upgraded us to an ocean front room with a small balcony. Bellman was very courteous and brought our luggage right up. This resort is truly the only resort on Oahu that you can escape the hustle and bustle and truly take in the rugged untouched landscape of the island. If u are the high maintenance type that are used to stay at Five diamonds property, please do the yourself and the staff a favor and stay elsewhere. This is definately not a luxury resort but it is the most relaxing property on the island with the most amazing view. Most of the hotel guests are young couples in their late twenties to early forties. Everyone is fit and into fitness, the nice gym was packed at 6:30 am. Ate at olas and lei leis and Ola is the winner of the 2. Ocean front dining at an affordable price, Jason was awesome. Room 501 was large with a small balcony with one chair, would be nice to have 2nd chair on the balcony. The view is just incredible, got to see sunrise on my bed overlooking the ocean. The room could use a little freshen up. The color scheme is green on green which is ok if u like green. The air vent has some rust and the walls have minor dings and scratches. The bathroom is big with double sinks and a large closet. We overlooked all these minor defects because at $225 per night, it is well worth the price considering the manificent view from our room. We are locals and will sure come back for more R & R. It's like being on the neighbor island without having to pay for the flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great property but beware high prices”
Reviews.Author: Pbergman
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a really pretty property. Great location and on a nice little peninsula. The main building is getting a little dated but not too bad. This is where "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" was filmed and it has great 270 degree views from the property. It may be one of the best (only?) hotel resorts on the North Shore. Upscale in Hawaii terms (this is not Beverly Hills so don't expect it) with a combination of good service but laid back approach. Warning, the Hawaii prices are inflated and this resort is at the high end of that bump. Expect 12-15 drink prices with specials dropping down around $7. Food is the same, $25 breakfast buffet. Dinners around $40-50. Note: the beach is NOT private so you can park there and enjoy their little beach (and I expect they don't mind you buying food at their restaurants) so its a good place to visit even if you don't stay. They have 2 golf courses which are top quality, tennis courts, horseback riding, moped rentals, will arrange scuba and snorkeling, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The North Shore is the only shore for me!”
Reviews.Author: lrgayles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rarely visit Oahu, opting for the "Garden Isle" of Kauai instead; however whenever we venture to Oahu, we book the Turtle Bay Resort. The property is awesome, the views are amazing, and the customer service is great. Everything we need is located within the grounds of the resort (except the Shrimp Trucks)! If you want to hang loose with the locals, sunbathe on the beautiful beaches of the North Shore, and get away from the craziness of Waikiki, then definitely reserve this tranquil resort. I refuse to book a hotel in Waikiki, knowing this gem is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: 2OurTravels
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews that said the resort was out-of-date, I wasn't sure what to expect. My husband and I loved this resort for its laid back North Shore feel. Our room was updated with modern light fixtures and a beautiful oceanfront view. We ate at Ola Restaurant several times -get the Ono or Butterfish. We used the on-site surf shop to rent paddle-boards, and we took advantage of the daily free 1-hour snorkle rental. We hiked on the trails around the property, saw the large Banyan tree, swam with sea turtles in the Kawela Bay, and saw where turtles laid their eggs. We took excursions to hike Waimea Falls, see the famous surfing beaches, and have a snow cone with vanilla & beans at Masumoto's in Haleiwa. This trip was a delight! We enjoyed our time on the North Shore a million times more than our time in Waikiki. Go to Turtle Bay and have a great time making memories while letting stress fly-away.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Florist”
Reviews.Author: Kristine M
Reviews.Content: I recently got married at a beachhouse near Turtle Bay and contacted their florist for my flowers. I was more than satisfied with their services and the flowers were absolutely beautiful. They were more than willing to work within my budget and they also serviced me even though I was not a guest at the hotel. I would like to highly reccommend this florist for anyone in the area getting married or having an event that needs beautiful flowers at a very decent price. http://www.northshoreweddingsandflowers.com/ I also had a lot of family and friends who stayed in the hotel and were extremely satisfied with this resort and all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here!!!”
Reviews.Author: NCA808
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times... I've had a few problems, but always fixed... Last night was very different!!! We decided to spend mother's day weekend at Turtle Bay... Due to a very busy Saturday, we were only able to stay Saturday night. We checked in around 6, took a dip in the hot tub, walked around the grounds, then went to bed around 10pm... But was woken numerous times by the loud music from the hotel's nightclub... I kept thinking, it's late, the music will end soon... Finally at 1:30 I called down to the front desk... But then I couldn't go back to sleep... I woke up this morning looking and feeling worse than I do on Fridays (after 5 days of 5:30 wake up calls)... This was supposed to be a relaxing get away for me... AFTERALL, IT'S MOTHER'S DAY!!!! They gave me a $75 resort credit for the noise issue... That didn't even pay for lunch for my family of 4 at the pool. At 11 I checked out because I was told there was no late check outs this weekend... Then at 12:30 as I'm returning my pool towel cards, the lady in front of me is checking out (somehow she got late check out)... Turtle Bay's management forgets that locals might just spend a night or two, but we might come a few times a year... IF WE ARE TREATED RIGHT... We are just an hour's car ride away... And when the malihini (visitors) aren't coming, us Kama'aina might be the ones filling those rooms... IF WE ARE TREATED RIGHT...

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Oahu for my and my daughter's birthdays last July. After 4 days, we found Paradise, Turtle Bay. Within a month of coming home, I booked again, and we will coming back on June 22 for another week of bliss. Food, service, everything was excellent! We had such a wonderful 2 days, and look forward to this next visit with great anticipation. So, if you are looking for Paradise, to to Turtle Bay, you will find it. As an aside, I have done quite of bit of traveling, and Turtle Bay is in my top 3. Can't wait for June 22.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and location”
Reviews.Author: pinto2125
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the turtle bay resort for 4 nights in April. Beautiful setting and great spot to stay to see the real Hawaii. The ocean room had sweeping views of the coastline. The room was quite big compared to other hotels and it had been refurbished. The Italiano restaurant was really good value and very efficient. It is really worth hiring a car and travelling to the north shore instead of staying in Waikiki We will definitely return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JS515
Reviews.Content: Great location! Stayed at Turtle Bay for 4 nights then went to Waikiki and wanted to come back to Turtle Bay. This felt like real Hawaii. A car is a must if staying at turtle bay. It’s a little over an hour drive from the airport to the hotel. Had a wonderful view from my room. The beds were comfortable. All of the staff was very friendly. The property was well kept. The rooms could use some upgrades but who really sits in the room all day. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything your neighbors are doing. The one thing I did not like was the water and stuffed animal that they leave out for you and then have a paper in small print saying if you take them you will be charged. $3 for water is a bit ridiculous. There are many places to go within a half hour or so of the resort so you are not limited to be stuck here. There are some great views along the resort property. There are also lots of activity choices if you don’t want to leave the resort. The food was good at each of the restaurants. If you are looking to eat outside the resort the town Haleiwa is not far and has many restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views and very romantic”
Reviews.Author: Matisse44
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a beach cottage which had the worlds best hammock right outside overlooking the water. The food options are varied and has a fantastic bar overlooking the water. it is worth a pre-dinner cocktail to watch the sunset and surfers taking on the great waves. The other side of the resort has a terrific swimming and surfing beach whish can be used all year round, unlike the other north shore beaches which are too rough nine months of the year. You can easily spend all your time in the resort or venture outside to the variety of activities in the nearby vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Sharon N
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Turtle Bay Resort several times - truly one of the most beautiful and well run hotels I've experienced. Such professionalism by all staff employees and the hotel itself is just gorgeous. We love the North Shore area - a true Hawaiian experience (also have stayed in Waikiki several times, much too congested - we love the serenity of the North Shore). Turtle Bay Resort has so much to offer from the beautiful views to the sea turtles in the water surrounding the hotel and also the adorable monk seal who comes up to visit the lagoon area. Excellent stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheLake1
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is tucked away far from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu. Ideal place to go to relax and unwind. Staff is eager and very friendly. Shops on site offer some unique gifts and clothes. Grounds are well maintained and golf course is top notch. Walk to the riding stables and stroll along the beach. Bar at pool serves sandwiches and variety of drinks. Meals on site are pricey. Take the to time to walk down to Lei Leis (on site) for dinner - if you order the pork tenderloin come hungry - the cut is approx three inches thick and melts in your mouth! Rooms are a bit dated in decor but you don't mind since all rooms have ocean views you open your door on the lanai and enjoy the sounds of the surf. Surfers show their skills in protected area by pool. Some novice tourists try their hang ten time here (site offers paddle board and surfing lessons). Enjoy a trip to Turtle Bay Resort and you will, like us, return!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice location - aging property”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMan
Reviews.Content: The choice of a hotel is all wrapped up in the choice of a location. I've been to Hawaii 10 or 12 times, but I never stayed on Oahu before. The problem with Oahu is that the vast majority of hotels are located in Waikiki, which I regard as hell on earth. I chose to stay at the Turtle Bay Resort because it's isolated from the city and has a few amenities to make the stay pleasant. The setting for the hotel is stunning - sticking out on a small peninsula with ocean on three sides. There is a small beach on the east side, and the other side has mostly rocks. The views are good in all directions. The beach was only so-so for snorkeling, but the shark's cove location is only about 15 minutes drive from there and has prime snorkeling. The major problem of the north shore is the wind, which was ferocious during our visit. This interferes with almost all outdoor activities, and is apparently a common problem on the north shore. The hotel itself is nicely situated, and the rooms were of reasonable size (but the balconies are tiny). Our room had a king-size bed, but no couch even though there was ample room for it. The pools were pretty small but acceptable. The water slide was barely used while we were there, and they pale in comparison to the Hyatt or Grand Wailea on Maui. The bathrooms are frankly pretty pathetic, because they are long past the point where they should have been remodeled. It's a financial decision of whether to close the hotel and remodel it, and this would undoubtedly result in higher room prices. For my taste, I would prefer that they invest the money in refurbishing and charge more for the rooms. The restaurants are all quite expensive, but that's typical on Hawaii. We had a very high quality meal at 21 Degrees North. We had breakfast at Palm Terrace and it was OK. We looked at the menus of the other restaurants and decided that they were too average for our taste, so we ate several dinners in Hale'iwa. The bottom line is whether I would stay there again, and I think the answer is no - at least not until they remodel all of the bathrooms. Next time we will try the Marriott in the southwest corner of the island (more likely we would go back to the other islands).

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful piece of estate.”
Reviews.Author: ShezzyD
Reviews.Content: Exotic, beautiful , warming piece of estate. The grounds were spectacular…so well kept. I had napped the whole way there and when I opened my eyes it was like a tropical paradise. The rich green of trees and plants, and the sight of the vast blue ocean accompanied with the subtle sea breeze just screamed out everything you saw on a Hawaii Tropical post card. The lobby area was so well designed as it showed off the estates no. 1 prize and that was the hotel had the most beautiful view of the ocean. The front desk people and car park attendants were so pleasant and accommodating. I mean who would blame being happy was expected if you had to wake up with that view every morning. We were there for our Honey moon so by that point we were so pleased we chose this resort to celebrate our first week in marriage. We got to our rooms and it was the ocean view queen. The room was clean, comfortable and cosy but wasn’t near as beautiful and flashy as it’s outside. Our room did include a bar fridge and a coffee maker. The room did not worry us too much as we were ready to be outdoors the second we entered our room. We had a good view of the ocean bay. The bay was a good area to sun bake and snorkel in as you were protected from the big cascading waves. The resort also provides you with the basic snorkel gear which was handy and really fun. If you grew tired of swimming and snorkelling just lazing around getting a sun tan was also an option. There were many beach chairs around if you chose not to lie on the sand. On the other side of the resort was the swimming pool area and the little bar central to it. It was a nice change of scene, but it was less quieter then the bay area. One little issue was the restaurant food there, it was quite expensive. So if you were wanting to eat out every night it could get pricey. Instead you could opt to drive and even settle to buying fresh fish with rice sold by the locals on the side strip of the rood in a food van. We are from Australia so getting some fresh Mahi Mahi fish was a happy treat. There are also the famous flavoured Ice cones near there. There was so many things to do and see. We enjoyed the hiking area, near the horses and golf course. Not to mention if you venture out you could see the special turtles from the rocky area. By the end of our trip I was sad to be parting from this paradise. I only hope I can come here and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “This is how Hawaii should be”
Reviews.Author: 1goofybird
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the other reviews, I was worried about the resort being run down or worse. No need! The public areas are clean and excellent. The rooms are looking a little dated, but not bad. The best thing about this resort is the location - it's on the North Shore and it is ALONE! Unlike Waikiki, where you may look out on a beautiful ocean view, but if you turn your head, you are looking into another hotel, this is the only resort in the area. Make sure you get an ocean-front room - our view was beautiful - an unspoiled bay with no other resorts in sight. If you like crowds and high-rises, Waikiki is for you, if not, Turtle Bay wins, hands down! Drawbacks - it was windy (surprise, it is on the beach), but not too bad and driving can be a pain if you want to go back to Honolulu - there is one road (either way) and it is two lanes almost the entire way, so everyone is using the same road and you can't be in a hurry. The rooms are looking a little dated (cabinets, etc), but the beds are fine and the rooms are clean. It isn't cheap, but if you want the real Hawaii (or as close as we tourists can get), this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie G
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding took place April 19, 2012 at Turtle Bay Resort. They couldn't have picked a more beautiful place. Our wedding coordinator, Tiare Boon, was awesome!! She did a fantastic job, everything went so smooth. I would have never thought planning a destination wedding would be so easy....a big THANK YOU goes out to Tiare!!! Flower Farm did the flowers and they were gorgeous. It was exactly what we wanted plus some! Bianca Photography did the pictures, we got a sneak peek of them online and can't wait to get our pictures. Our rooms were perfect....you could walk out on the balcony and hear the waves as if you were standing right on the beach. You never passed an employee who didn't speak, everyone was very friendly. We went to Maui and Waikiki....nothing compared to Turtle Bay Resort. We highly recommend this resort for your wedding, vacation, or whatever brings you to Hawaii. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place I Will Stay When Visiting Oahu”
Reviews.Author: JTadeo
Reviews.Content: When planning our family vacation in September of last year, the choice of hotel was the easiest decision to make; Turtle Bay Resort was of course the only option. A few years ago, one of my college buddies had their wedding at Turtle Bay Resort and it was an experience that I could only describe as something you see out of a movie. The grounds alone are worth the visit; exotic trees and plants, incredible ocean views, tropical breezes and winding trails engulf your senses. It is no wonder that "True Hawaii" is a phrase often used to describe this resort. To make things even better, the staff that works here is so friendly and helpful; everyone from the front desk attendants who were so accommodating to the housekeepers who greeted us every morning with a smile. That trip was the first experience I had of Hawaii and I was so glad it just happened to be at Turtle Bay. With my first trip to Hawaii under my belt, you could imagine my excitement when my parents came to me and my brother with the news of our annual family trip decision - HAWAII! (yes, I am 27 years old and my brother is 23, still taking family trips. It's ok, we don’t mind) Of course, at first we thought of visiting a different island since I had already gone to Oahu, but after all of the raving about my experience with North Shore and Turtle Bay, there was really no other option. My mom and brother had never been to Hawaii and I wanted their first experience to be as amazing as mine. Before I knew it, I was back on the plane to Oahu, this time with my parents, bother, aunt and uncle. Note to those who have never visited the island of Oahu: Don't let the initial lackluster views of Hawaii from the Oahu Airport be your definition of "True Hawaii." In fact I don’t even like to fully open my eyes until I hit the North Shore. There, paradise awaits. There are those who like the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and Waikiki beach. But to me, Hawaii is about relaxation, hiking to waterfalls, sipping a mai tai and forgetting all about the real world. All of these things you can easily do from or around the area of Turtle Bay Resort. Now here come the tips and recommendations: EVERY room has a view, although I would recommend asking for a room that faces the bay. I made sure that both visits to the resort faced this direction and I was so happy I did. As with all hotels, the higher the floor the better the view and amenities, but with TB, you really can't go wrong. It's all beautiful. The food is great at the resort, but it is not the most affordable, luckily there are many dining options within a short drive of TB. Of course you have to hit up a couple shrimp trucks. Fumi's and Giovanni's are two of my favorite. Haleiwa Joe's is great for dinner. Ted's Bakery for breakfast. Matsumoto's in Haleiwa for shaved ice. Things to do. For first time visitors that are staying there for a week or more, go to the Polynesian Cultural Center and plan to carve out a full day for the visit. If you are only in Hawaii for a few days, I would not recommend going there since it does take so much time to enjoy all it has to offer. Ha Breath of life is an amazing show and their luau is pretty great as well. Everyone needs some chachkies to bring home for family and friends and a little something for yourself too. You can always buy keychain, lei's, shot glasses and t shirts from the hotel stores, but if you want your dollar to go the distance, try the Swap Meet at Aloha Stadium. It is about an hour drive from the hotel, but if you’re planning a Saturday trip to Honolulu then stop by. Everything is very reasonably priced. I took care of all my gifts for under $50 (and I had a lot of requests from everyone back in Arizona). Other things we did on our 7-day vacation was the Dole Plantation Tour, the hike up to Diamond Head and snorkeled in sharks cove. But what we really enjoyed the most was out multiple visits to the macadamia nut farm about 20 minutes from the resort. Everyone there was so welcoming and their tour was so great. Highly recommended! Again, if you are planning a trip to Oahu and want to get away from the city of Honolulu, then I would recommend Turtle Bay Resort. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon bliss”
Reviews.Author: lorrainequain
Reviews.Content: stayed here on honeymoon for 5 nights in january 2011 beautiful relaxing hotel ideal honeymoon destination. pools beautiful. rooms lovely clean. food lovely. the hotel is out in the middle of know-where which is ideal for a quiet peaceful week of relaxation

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karrah W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Hawaii on vacation, when we looked into Oahu we noticed that almost all of the hotels are in Honolulu...which by the way is very busy...like Toronto, Ontario, but on the beach, since we were looking for a relaxing but fun getaway...we found Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore of Oahu. It was a beautiful location with small surf towns all around and Sunset Beach is a 5min drive. The hotel was great, a little expensive for dinning, but good, the rooms could use some updating, but they were clean and the staff was friendly. Elevators were always available and the pool seemed to always have some seats around it. The surfing is awesome on the north shore, even for beginners. So if your looking for an Oahu vacation away from the city and lights, go to Turtle Bay Resort, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Todd G
Reviews.Content: We stayed fro 12 days at The turtle bay resort. There were six of us that stayed in a three bedroom villa. The villa was superb. There is a good sized kitchen with a dining area where we were all able to eat breakfast or have coffee before we set out for the day. The cleaning staff was there every day and kept the villa spotless for us. The villas also have their own washer and dryer which was a huge bonus. Outside there is a short walk to either a heated fresh water swimming pool, which we enjoyed almost every night or walk 100 yards further and you are at a nice beach which had great snorkling. All the equipment was included with our stay. There are some fantastic restaurants at this resort, with Ola and Lei Lei's being our favourite. The only downsides to our stay was that we only had one parking spot at the villa but had two cars. We had to park our second car in the general parking which was a bit of an inconvenience but not enough to effect our stay. We will be going back again. I love the Turtle Bay resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views Made It Worth It”
Reviews.Author: arat18
Reviews.Content: We began a 2 week trip to Oahu and Maui with 2 nights at Turtle Bay. I booked a King Oceanview room through their site and prepaid for the discount. I was going to splurge on a beach cottage, but waited too long - kind of glad I didn't in the end, they looked fantastic, but I was glad to save the money for other activities. The location and property really are beautiful. We ate breakfast one morning at the Palm Terrace (ordered a la carte, don't eat enough to justify the pricey buffet), and bought some milk and granola bars the other morning at the store by the pool (this place was great to have to stop in for a snack, drink ,etc). We ate dinner one night at Lei Lei's - great food and great service. Only having 2 days on the North Shore and being quite adventurous, we did leave the resort both days - the negative is that everything else is a drive. This makes other activities and dining a bit of an effort - with the exception of the Shrimp Trucks (fabulous!) and the surfing beaches nearby. We did attempt to run/walk on the trails they indicate in the ammenities book in the room - we got lost several times and spent a good portion of our time on what I thought was a maintenance path - so I'd give a word of caution to anyone else who might give this a try! Overall we enjoyed our time at Turtle Bay, not sure I would come back anytime soon - maybe because Maui is my first love :) But certainly glad we stayed and experienced it! It was beautiful, not sure if it was worth the $ and what everyone hyped it up to be, but enjoyable nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: krinkle77
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at Turtle Bay this month for a couple nights on our trip to Oahu. If you need a break from the crowds and action in Waikiki, this is the place to come. It is gorgeous, quiet, and all the activities you could want our at your fingertips. If you don't want to spend a lot on meals, pick up groceries before you head. Black Coffee and a banana runs about $8.00! Given the opportunity, I will definitely be a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: RAKfromMD
Reviews.Content: This was our first (but not last) visit to the North Shore and Turtle Bay Resort. We had a great room on 6th floor of west wing. Being high up was great as you did not have the lower roofs obstructing your view. The only bad thing was that we were given a room with 2 queen beds instead of 1 king as we requested. But, after getting to our room and seeing our great view, we were fine have the two smaller beds. Their new bar, Surfer, the Bar was great. They have a great happy hour until 8pm with food and drink specials. The three cheese pizza was awesome! I think it came from the Italian restaurant - Leonardos. There always seemed to be ample chairs by the pool. Yes, you do need a towel card, as others had mentioned, but that was no problem and not a big deal. The cards and resort towels help prevent non-resort people from coming and sitting around the pool. Every evening there is some type of entertainment down by the pool and Hang Ten Bar. That is a great place to see the sunset. Many people surf near the restaurant. They have a small bleacher type area (near Hang Ten) where you can watch the surfers. The newly remodeled lobby area is very nice. Hopefully the hotel plans on continuing some of those renovations into their rooms. The room was nice and spacious but a bit outdated. I knew that going in so it was not much of a shock to me. We were not in the room a whole lot so that did not matter. We loved the larger balcony with our deluxe ocean view room. We sat out there every morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the drive!”
Reviews.Author: abb1953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for several days in early April, having booked months in advance. Watch Turtle Bay's facebook page for special deals. It's about 45 minutes from Honolulu by car, and the pace is leisurely as posted limits are low. But hey, this is paradise-enjoy the views! If you're planning a wedding this is idyllic, as they have a wedding facility that is all views of the ocean. Breathtaking. the north shore is much less frantic than the urban areas of Oahu and well suited to outdoor pursuits. Unless the surf's up around Sunset Beach, home of the famous Banzai Pipeline. With the layout of the hotel, most if not all rooms have a great view. We're partial to the wing overlooking the pool area, as the ocean is just beyond and sunsets are great to view from the balcony. Higher up is better, though. No complaints at all about the furnishings. As for dining there are some great options. We love dining on the beach at Ola. Open air, balmy, great food. Lei Lei's at the clubhouse has a wonderful caesar's salad with ahi. Perfect late dinner as our flight didn't arrive till evening in Honolulu. The Palm Terrace for breakfast has an extensive buffet. Having said all that, be ready for sticker shock if you haven't dined in Hawaii before. Just accept the fact that a dinner for two with a bottle of wine is $100+, lunches $50+, breakfast $25. A couple miles down the highway is a local institution, Ted's bakery, which is always busy and their food is much less. Their Mahi Mahi plate lunch is memorable, and so are the calories. Be ready to do some heavy exercise to work it all off. Other than that I didn't see much off-property worth trying. Figure also the jet lag you'll feel at dinnertime will discourage you from venturing out. I know north of the resort are the shrimp trucks and farms. Makes for messy eating but worth doing. As a golfer I had to try the Fazio course, the Palmer tournament layout being too pricey and my game wasn't up to it. I was a first timer on Bermuda grass greens, and had numerous four putts. Both tracks are very nice, but my course had just been aerated, and the greens were horrible. If you're a low handicap golfer, be sure to inquire beforehand about this. The golf deal they offer is a logical response to the high cost of shipping clubs. For $65 I got the round, cart and clubs. Too good to pass up. There's plenty to do on-property and other reviewers can detail all that for you. We love this place and it will always be on our Hawaii agenda. They are having a behind the scenes struggle to restructure long term debt with the foreign banks, and have had some financial diffulties in the past. I knew this going in, but to their credit, the staff was uniformly friendly and professional and made one want to come back. I only hope that enough will give this uniquely situated resort a try so that they will prosper and grow.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Rampright
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were getting married on Oahu. We could not have had a more relaxing holiday. We had a fantastic experience with Paradise helicopters. We were given a wedding gift of a no doors thrill flight, by my cousin, and it will never be forgotten. People who have issues with this resort must be very hard to please. We are very well travelled and this hotel can hold it's own with any of the other 5 star hotels we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, been here multiple times, but the rooms are falling a part.”
Reviews.Author: Devra_Alfred
Reviews.Content: The guest services are amazing. They work with you to make you as happy as possible and you can tell the staff genuinely love their jobs. Unfortunately the rooms, no matter what the price, are a bit disappointing. I'm aware I'm paying for a 'view' but having a nice clean bath tub with tiles not falling out would be nice. Or the cabinet door that cover the fridge shouldn't fall off every time you open it to get a drink. Plus the mold on the ceiling sorta sucked. Funny enough, I'm sure I'll still come back up there because even though the rooms are semi sub par, the bar outside and hot tub is fun. It's a once in a life time feeling to be up on north shore so even with a few small set backs, it's worth it. . The servers and hotel staff really make up for everything else. They are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Family Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: TimPro4543
Reviews.Content: After what seemed like an eternity at the Hertz rental counter at the airport, we enjoyed a leisurely drive out to the country. The Turtle Bay Resort was A+ from the minute we arrived at the Hotel front. The bell service was excellent and the front desk made check in quick and painless. What absolutely floors you is the lobby, photos do it no justice, expansive, wood and stone flooring with large windows overlooking and incredible view of Kuilima cove. The breakfast buffet was excellent, Ola's was to die for, a table on the beach, litlerally, feet in the sand dining, with an excellent menu and wine list, while the waves of the north shore crash in the distance. The Hang Ten Bar was the limit, the kids played in the pool while we enjoyed drinks and listened to Hawaiian entertainment play. Yes the Hotel is older, no the rooms are not run down, our room was clean, fresh, bright and had an incredible view. The bottom line is if you have children, of any age, this is the hotel for you, forget Waikiki beach, this is the where its at !

Reviews.Title: “Breath Taking”
Reviews.Author: genevieveCa
Reviews.Content: The cottages are remarkable. Very large with beautiful furniture, comfy bed, a lovely bath with huge shower and soaking tub. The view is awesome, crashing waves all day and a beautiful sunset from your lanai every night. The entire staff goes above and beyond to be of help in every way. We spent 7 nights and they were the most peaceful days we have spent in many years. We travel to the islands every spring & Turtle Bay is a favorite. Aloha & mahalo to the entire staff. Almost forgot, the grounds are beautiful flowers, trees and very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: csn279
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Turtle Bay in a 4-bdr, 3-bath villa. We were on the ground level, which meant we could walk right out onto our lanai, across the grass and right onto the beach. The resort is absolutely beautiful. It is pricey to stay and of course the restaurants on the property were expensive but we anticipated and planned for that. The pool areas were clean and beautiful. We appreciated the eating area in the lobby for breakfast and lunch, which turns into a bar later in the day. But we were able to get oatmeal, pastries, fruit, coffee, and breakfast sandwiches which did help keep the cost down. The north shore was very relaxing, and very beautiful...though we wished for slightly better weather. I did not expect to be chilly while in Hawaii! But it was very windy at the resort during our stay, and we had some rain. Overall, though, it was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit, with just one hitch”
Reviews.Author: oregonfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely quick 3 night getaway to the Turtle Bay Resort April 19-22. We chose to stay in the cottages which were just perfect. When we made the reservation, we were disappointed that there were no kings available. That turned out to be our great luck! We were put in Cottage 111, which had two beautiful four poster queen beds. More importantly, it had what we believe is the best view of all the cottages. It's particular building is slanted so that you have both a clear view and privacy on one side, and a full on view of the ocean on the other. We loved sitting on the lanai and watching the surfers, watching the waves, and watching the sunset. Just superb! We at at Ola for dinner on two nights, and enjoyed it. The food was great, and the service very helpful. Be sure to ask to sit outside and your feet will be in the sand while you eat! We rented bikes one day and enjoyed exploring the expansive property and near by areas. On our bikes we visited a WWII bunker, sat under a Banyon grove, swam in a secluded cove, and found our way to an offsite fruit stand for a refreshing snack. It was great. We also enjoyed leaving the property to drive just a little bit South to visit Sharks Cove. We snorkeled, and really appreciated the service from the rental stand across the way. So much fun! We also shopped in Historic Haleweia with great variety and beautiful art. It was a perfect stay until the last night. On that night we were woken up by a very loud beeping sound that sounded like an alarm at about 2:30 am. At first we thought it was a fire alarm, then we checked all of our electronic devices to see if there were alarms going off. We finally realized it was coming from the shower. We turned the water off and on, but it only got louder. We called guest services, and were surprised that they were not surprised or concerned. They recommended running all the water in the bathroom for awhile, and flushing the toilet over and over for an extended period of time. We were told if that didn't work, they would send maintenance. It was frustrating to be awake for an hour and a half in the middle of the night on our last night of our short getaway from our kids. We were disappointed that no one called to check on us the next morning, and that no one apologized for the inconvenience. Missing a couple hours of sleep in the middle of the night at a high end resort seemed like the kind of thing management would respond to--- but they did not. Overall, it was a great trip but we were sorry to end our trip exhausted from the lack of sleep. Final tip: When you go back to the airport, loop around the windward side of the island. Stop at the Valley of the Temples, and then take the H3 back to Honolulu Airport. Even with a stop at the macadamia nut farm and the temple, the drive from TB to the airport only took us about 2 1/2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated resort on Oahu north shore”
Reviews.Author: eyedr46
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay resort is by itself on a peninsula on the north shore of Oahu. It has three wings, and most rooms have beautiful ocean views. Rooms are large and comfortable. The Ola restaurant is right on the beach and has the largest grilled shrimp I've ever seen(U-12), reasonably priced. On one side of the hotel is open ocean for good surfing and on the other, a protected bay with a pretty beach with good snorkeling. The hotel also has two gold courses, one ans Arnold Palmer course. Downsides are that you have to drive anywhere if you don't want to eat at the hotel, and the hotel is on the windward side of the island, so it can catch more rain. Also, the hotel can be pricey with rooms ranging rom $300-$800/night. BUT we searched the web and found an oceanfront King deluxe for just $179/night through Otel.com

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation at Turtle Bay!”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Anna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay from April 5 to April 11th with our two girls (4 and 1). We had a lovely vacation and enjoyed our time immensely. Highlights: Watching whales from our lanai. The pool waterslide. Making sandcastles at the beach. The breakfast buffet. The hotel staff (from the housekeepers to, to the concierge, to the servers at the restaurants) were all lovely and helpful. They made us feel welcome and well cared for during our stay. Our room was clean and beds comfortable. Watching the surfers and wannabe surfers. Mai tais. And last but not least, the North Shore! There were a few things that would have me question my return. Nothing major, but I feel that I should provide full disclosure. 1. It is likely going to be colder on the North Shore that it would be in Honolulu. For the most part, it was 22-24 degrees celcius/75 F each day. In Honolulu, it was several degrees warmer. It also rains more on the north shore. We had a spell of rain each day. There is a breeze and the ocean isn't as warm. If you are looking for a beach/pool vacation, where you lie out all day and get a tan, please consider the weather. 2. Kids meals - there was a variety and options my kids liked (burgers, pasta, hot dogs, fish, chicken). They were reasonably priced = $9 a meal (which would include a drink and ice cream). We did find the meals inconsistent. The first time, the cheese pasta was homemade-ish and came with steamed vegetables. The next night, it was Kraft Dinner/Mac and Cheese from a box and there were no veggies. When we asked why we didn't get vegetables, we were told they changed the menu (even though the menu was still the same). We complained and they sent us a lovely fruit basket to make up for it. We were appeased. 3. Location - you are on the North Shore - you really need a car in order to leave the resort. Off resort, you will find great food (garlic shrimp, plate lunches) and beaches (Waimea). Self-parking is free at the resort, so it is nice to have the flexibility and chance to explore. Finally, we paid about $270 per night (this included the breakfast buffet and the sixth night). It is not cheap, especially when you factor in the the equivalent in a place like Mexico, but we did enjoy your stay and felt was we paid was definitely worth it. We also factored in that we got an ocean-view room, when staying at a comparable resort (Ko Olina or Hilton Hawaiian Village), we would have had to pay more for a view.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: GamecockChic
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been on the north shore for approximately 30 years and no one has touched it since. When I came out the elevator to our room there was what looked to be a 30-year old couch at the moment I was getting worried. After being in my room 10 minutes I just wanted to go home. If I had only paid 50 dollars a night for the room I would have expected the dingy appearance it smelled of mold. I paid around 240 dollars a night for this gross room. I would not recommend this resort until it gets updated or charges for what you actually get. The only positive is the location. It is away from all the traffic of Waikiki. This hotel is not worth the money. Please update your hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the north shore...stay here not Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: valtandc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. the service and concierge were awesome. the room was very clean and large....beds extremely comfortable. Ola's restaurant was great....lots of space and beautiful grounds....I don't get how people complain about a place like this. I guest if you are the stuffy type who needs the highest level of brown nosing from places like Four Seasons you may not be totally satisfied. I have stayed at Four Seasons and Ritz at different locations and don't need that hand holding attention....So I loved this place...My kids loved it...Great pool....and the pool is definately heated....the upper pool was so warm.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: krissiejade
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for our honeymoon and had been really looking forward to it. Sadly we were incredibly disappointed. The rooms are old and in desperate need of updating. The shower has no light above it so it is very dark (and very small). The carpet was stained, the drawers broken and dirty and the air con seemed to have two settings.........super high or non existent. We had also paid for a deluxe ocean front room and while we could see the ocean, we mainly looked the roof of the building and the pool. Given what we paid for the hotel we were left feeling very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Four night stay in the Villas”
Reviews.Author: buckcr
Reviews.Content: We recently concluded a four day stay at Turtle Bay. I found the amenities and other offerings to be above par and were very satisfied with every aspect of our trip . We elected to stay in a 3 room villa ( third floor) which are offset from the main hotel and essentially front the beach area. These were superbly furnished and served our family of five well. They can be booked via hotel site and I believe some may be booked via private owners ( we booked indirectly through the hotel with a package). Access is via gated area with coded entry. The advantages include your own private heated pool, upscale appointments (BOSE in every room, subzero , etc) and generous space.. We utilized the BBQ on a couple of occasions and were well stocked after a trip to the nearby Foodland. We enjoyed the snorkeling on two days and found it reasonable and not overly crowded. We played tennis on several occasions (brought our own racquets and balls) , did morning runs up and down the coastline and along the golf course. We took a surf lesson through the onsite surf school. The private lesson for myself and my ten year old was excellent and we were able to hit several sets of reasonable waves.(first time out - I recommend going with the private lesson) The point of the bay allowed other family members to be close enough to watch and provided plenty of photo opportunities. The spa services rated well. We ate at Ola's one evening and found it exquisite, a relaxed beach location and unhurried. Our waitor was excellent and steered us to the kalua nachos which were excellent as well as all of our generous portion entrees. Daily maid service for our villa was prompt and efficient. We were able to use the regular hotel pool as well although the private heated pool for villa guests was great. (I am not sure if all villa guests can use the hotel pool or just ones who rent through the hotel. ) We were given towel cards upon arrival. The manager of the villa area was friendly and very helpful. They do seem to monitor this area making sure it is appropriately utilized. When we went over to the regular pool area, we did witness hotel staff ushering some non hotel guests out of the pool area (contrary to other posters- they discouraged non hotel guests ) All in all, I found this resort's amenities outstanding and would consider returning. For a family, the villas seemed the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly & Not Accomodated”
Reviews.Author: Carl193
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay Resort for a 7 days and was very disappointed. We paid for a Deluxe Ocean Front two Queen beds, which the room overlooked the roof of the building. The drawers were mildew and the closet smelled like urine. We had the cleaning lady clean the closet every morning and sprayed each day, but could not take the odor away. We took the elevator down to the beach level and had three separate families with three dogs come on the elevator with us, which we were shocked because pets are allowed in the hotel. My son is allergic to dogs and cats and was very disappointed that no mention of dogs was listed on the website. Needless to say my son was sick all week and kept taking his allergy medicine and know the odor in the closet was dog pee. We couldn't check-out of the hotel, because we prepaid and they said we would lose all the money that we pre-paid in advance for even knowing that my son is allergic to animals. On Easter morning they had an easter egg hunt, which was not just for guest. It was open to the public. The girl that found the golden egg was not even a guest of the hotel, which I thought was wrong. We pay to stay at the hotel and resort and its open to everyone. The beach and pools are open to the public, so if you have a rental car good luck finding a parking place, because all the locals have their cars parked for the day to spend on the beach and surf. The only people my husband and I found very nice was the mainteance and maids. I would never stay at this hotel again. We were very disappointed, because when we visit the hotel three years ago they had a security guard at the entrance to let us see the resort and now they no longer have security guard and open to the public. They have a bar near the lobby called Surfer, which was packed of locals and barely guest. I was very disappointed and have stayed at many hotels in Hawaii for the past three years and will never stay at this hotel and resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hawaii heaven!”
Reviews.Author: sweptaway89
Reviews.Content: I am so excited to share my trip with you all to beautiful Hawaii and the wonderful hotel Turtle Bay Resort. Our trip went like a dream from start to finish. We booked a 9 night stay in the pikake junior sweet and omg the room, the hotel, the service everything was perfect. The hotel is located about 45 minutes on the north shore from the Honolulu airport. If you are staying here you will definitely need a rental, but trust me you want a rental because who doesn't want to take advantage of exploring this beautiful island? When you arrive at the hotel you are greeted by an amazing staff who is eager to share information regarding the hotel and the area. The hotels lobby has a floor to ceiling expanse of windows that allow you to have a clear view of the beach and the ocean, as this hotel sits on a peninsula allowing every view to be one of the ocean. The hotels lobby is also where you will find an array of various restaurants, open all day. Promise me you will have the breakfast Buffett that serves hands down the best homemade waffles topped with fruit that is out of this world. I can still taste those blackberries and those omelettes made to order. The beach is home to protected sea turtles and although you can not touch them there is no stopping you from swimming with them. That was an experience my family will keep forever. When you are not swimming with turtles you can always go to the other side of the hotel and enjoy the two swimming pools, while watching the surfers. If you get hungry there's even an outdoor cafe where you can buy quick bites like hamburgers and fries. This review could go on forever so I must be sure to include some of my favorite places visited while on the island. If more info is needed please feel free to reach out to me and I will happily answer any questions that you have regarding the island or hotel. Must see's: Koala Ranch Polynesian Cultural Center- they put on a evening show that is amazing. Hanamma Bay- safest area to enjoy snorkeling, it was an old volcano that collapsed and filled with water. It is now protected and taken care of by the state. Again promise me if you love to snorkel that you will go here!!!! Waikiki- one of the worlds famous beaches. The grounds have these beautiful trees that look like pieces of drift wood merged together. The roots spread across the top of the ground. It's amazing! The backdrop a dormant volcano that you can climb. Make sure you rent a car and make sure you plan a trip that can allow for a stay long enough to enjoy. Have fun!!! I pray that I can make it back someday, because I have certainly left my spirit in hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: makybes
Reviews.Content: This resort is in a great spot and has plenty of stuff to do both paid and non paid. The rooms are pretty old school with some damp spots on the carpet etc. Majority of staff were super friendly. The restaurants were nothing special and overpriced with the exception of lei lei's. We only stayed 2 nights and were already over paying plenty for every meal. Would stay again and for longer but would eat away from the resort as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable beachfront resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelReview187147
Reviews.Content: A great placed to stay with a family without breaking the bank. Ask for the Pikane Suite and 2 rollaways and you get an oceanfront room with plenty of space for the beds. Kids can run around the resort and they love the pools and safe cove for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “The North Shore done right!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2451
Reviews.Content: The laid back vibe of the North Shore was perfect for our getaway. This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we were pleasantly surprised with what we found! The employees definitely take great pride in service and went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. With all the amenities, you could stay here and not leave, if you so desired. Sunset and the huge waves make for a postcard perfect photo. We also enjoyed watching the surfers. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great North Shore Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: kylebrown
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip to Turtle Bay with my wife and 1 year old baby over Thanksgiving week and had a great time. The resort is on the North Shore so if you are looking to surf this is the only resort around. It has great golf and tennis, along with equestrian center and trails. You can do great walks or jogs every morning around the property and next to ocean ( this is where they filmed lost and another show?) we had a bob stroller and did find with the baby on the trails - some sandy spots that are bit of work but worth it.. There is a pool overlooking the surf spot out in front the hotel that is pretty nice, along with a public/ private cove beach on the other side of the property. Overall the property is really nice but the hotel is a little dated -70's- it is what it is. It is not one of these five stars resorts on the islands, but it has by far the best vibe going...and is ground zero if you want to surf. If you are beginner and want to learn to surf on property they have a great school from a legend Hawaiian surfer Hans Hedeman but be warned it will be a bit challenging- not like waikiki rollers....this is the north shore.
