Rooms are spacious and most have great ocean views along with balconies. Plenty of restaurants on property but pretty pricey if you eat 3 meals a day on site. I would suggest car rental and drive yourself to Turtle Bay - little over an hour, hit Costco or North Shore market on way to hotel. Eat breakfast in the room and do lunch at Teds, Shrimp Trucks, or Haliewa and dinner on or off property. Pool bar was killer for Sunsets and seemed to be the gathering spot every night for sunset, and Surfer Magazine opened up a nice bar/ club inside the hotel - i would check calendar to see what events they have going. The Polynesian Mormon center is just up the road about 10 minutes from hotel where you can get your Luau and show fix. The drive around the North Shore all the away around and down to Diamondhead and Wakiki is very beautiful. We left around nine and took our time for a few stops, i found Robin Masters Estate and ended up in Waikiki for lunch at Dukes around 12:30 pm. There is a daily resort fee of $25 for towels etc. and they charge for internet, it is a bit pricy but worth it. I would suggest 2 or 3 days in Waikiki for the shopping and other tourist stuff and 3 or 4 days at Turtle Bay for fist timers. We were at Turtle Bay for a week and had great time and will definitely go back - I surfed epic Rocky Point every day. North Shore only has big surf from Oct. through April roughly. Sorry for the ramble been meaning to get this post up since the trip and hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: DidiChicago
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay at an amazing property with a beautiful coast line then Turtle Bay on the North Shore of Oahu is the place! We took advantage of the amazing location for it own shoreline plus its proximity to the amazing food trucks, Waimea Valley Nature center ,Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach...the list goes on... Waikiki is great for a day( my husband lasted 1 hour and 40 minutes) but nothing beats the North Shore. I have vacation before on Maui, Kauai, the Big Island and grew up going to The Royal Hawaiian Im Wakkiki but for my money Turtle Bay is the place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Nights in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: johndhenry
Reviews.Content: The good: Low key North Shore relaxed vibe. Nice private beach for kids. Stayed in relatively inexpensive Cottage which was situated away from the 1970’s main building and its multitudes. Cottage was only steps from surf which you could hear from your room and it was great. The bad: Hotel is once again in decline. Owners did a much needed renovation a few years back when they purchased the property, but they have since dropped the ball and the hotel is once more fading with lots of deferred maintenance issues. Only one OK dinning establishment at hotel – Lei Lei’s (not owned or managed by hotel). The ugly: The Cottage had terrible ventilation and its old carpet was musty/moldy. No one slept well during any night of our stay and most usually woke with a headache. Verdict: So much potential, but a good night sleep is too important to stay here. Regrettably we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Stay in 3 Bedroom Villa”
Reviews.Author: TobyandMadison
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in a three bedroom Villa over Spring Break in March. The quality of the Villa thoroughly impressed us with top end appliances, furniture and finishings. There are two barbeques with easy access to the Villas and we only ate out once at Ola's and had a great dinner. The resort had something for everyone. We spent most of our sun time on the beach near the Villas and it was calm and easy to swim and snorkel. Our kids enjoyed surf lessons on the other side of the resort and waves were perfect. As a trail runner I enjoyed the variety offered throughout the resort but tended toward the beach trails over the asphalt trails that meander through both golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Couples paradise!”
Reviews.Author: abigolucky
Reviews.Content: We visited Turtle Bay after a week in waikiki. What a place! Relaxing, beautiful, great service, lovely pools/beach and big rooms. We had dinner at Ola's on the beach which was fantastic and very romantic. The sunset over the ocean is so beautiful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting relaxation and paradise! I would say that it is best to rent a car to travel around north shore as hotel is very much out of the way. Overall a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Hawaiian heaven!”
Reviews.Author: spagoerjacksonhole
Reviews.Content: Thanks to our travel agent and some word of mouth we scored by booking our 9 night stay at Turtle Bay Resort! I could go on and on, but basically it was FABULOUS! Not very often in ones travels does a vacation exceed expectations. It did! From the moment that we arrived we were in Hawaiian heaven. The location is amazing. It really is truly an exceptional and special spot. Like other readers, I had read some reviews on TA which were negative about the property (rooms, prices, etc), so I became a bit apprehensive prior to our arrival, even "warning" my family that it might not be that great... So, it was a wonderful revelation to discover what a gem this resort was/is! The Turtle Bay Resort is NOT a five star resort, it is NOT a Four Seasons, and the prices reflect this! If it were, believe me, the prices of everything would be double! However, the location and service ARE five stars! The staff could not have been more friendly, in a genuine way, not the forced five star way... Particularly housekeeping, engineering, and the breakfast staff (Elena!). Our Jr Suite with the breath taking views was perfect for a family of 3, the bathroom with the extra vanity sink worked well for us. Breakfasts were delicious, we miss them already! The amount of activities available onsite is terrific. My family surfed, snorkeled, played tennis, sea kayaked, took advantage of the wide variety of classes at the fitness center (from Hot Hula, Pilates, to several different yoga classes), and I read many books at the peaceful pool, where there were ALWAYS chairs available, and it was Spring break. We look forward to returning and hope to make it annual trip. We did get a peek at a cottage, and it looked amazing, however, we would be very happy with a suite again. I just hope that their prices don't go up to match their location and service! This resort is extremely well priced for the slice of Heaven which guests are lucky enough to experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, average service and room”
Reviews.Author: erica l
Reviews.Content: Room was moldy so we had to switch rooms. The room was outdated and a bit rundown. Some of the staff were excellent and very friendly while others did not make you feel especially welcome, not even asking how our stay was upon checkout. Ola the restaurant was average at best, while 21 Degrees North was fantastic. The location is absolutely beautiful. Overall this was an average resort in terms of service and our room. They overprice everything, since you are sort of isolated, with room service for two bagels being $20.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, the North Shore!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaBM3
Reviews.Content: My son is an avid surfer and Turtle Bay Resorts is the place to stay in the winter & spring months! Great surf right outside your room as well as some of the top surf spots in the world less than 15 minutes away!!! The accommodations were fine - clean, roomy, though a little out of date. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We also saw a wonderful fire dance performed by local dancers on the first night of our stay, right on the hotel property! Great way to start out our vacation. It was a very nice touch. The pool with a slide, snorkeling in the lagoon, and lizards abound were perfect for my younger son too. Very relaxing for me too, as a single parent. Hard to find such an easy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Tutrle Bay”
Reviews.Author: noni40
Reviews.Content: We spent a delightful week in a 3 bedroom villa which was very comfortable for a family of seven. It was very clean and the daily room maid service prompt. Luckily, our unit was on the 3rd level which enhanced the view for whale watching. The grandchildren loved the slide pool, surf lessons and snorkel beach. The morning walks to the kayaking bay were very beautiful and watching the surfers was great fun, especially with a Mai tai. There were activities for everyone. We ate lunches at the pool restaurants and stayed home for dinners. The local Foodlands had everything we needed, so I can't comment on the other restaurants. This is definitely an expensive vacation, but staying in such a beautiful spot was worth it. Where else can you find bays and beaches nearby where you are the only ones ? Let's hope the North Shore stays underdeveloped .

Reviews.Title: “Northshore Location Cannot Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: PopoJoy
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort's location cannot be beat. If you are looking to stay on Oahu's fabled northshore, this is the place to stay. View photos of our stay at: http://www.joybeyondfifty.com/2012/04/05/beyond-fifty-at-turtle-bay/ We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean Front Guestroom with two queen beds. The Deluxe rooms have a full balcony, the other, non-deluxe guestrooms, have small step out balconies. We were on the sixth floor, and had an outstanding view. We spotted whales everytime we were on our balcony during our stay. The resort staff is very nice, the restaurants serve good food, good drinks and with good service. There are several dining choices here, and all of them have amazing ocean views. We loved Surfer [THE BAR], the coffee bar in the lobby and the breakfast buffet. The hotel is not too large, so it is very easy to get around quickly. There are two pools, two hot tubs, and a small kids pool. All with ocean views. The large pool goes to eleven feet in the deep end (wow). And the small pool, has a waterslide and a waterfall, set in natural rock. On one side of the hotel, there is a large protected lagoon with a lovely beach. A good spot for beginner snorkeling. On the other side of the hotel, there is a nice surf break in the bay for some good surfing. Our room had nice convienences, a mini fridge, a safe, a coffee maker, and the wi-fi service (included in the $25 daily resort fee) was fast and reliable. They also have a business center near the elevators, that offers free computer use, and boarding pass printing. We would have given this resort an "Excellent" rating except that the guestroom we stayed in was in need of renovation. It was good size, with two separate sink areas in the bathroom/vanity (a nice plus), but all of our room's furniture was dated and felt old, the doors, walls and vanities were in need of new paint, and the bathroom mirrors and fixtures were dated. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel resort, and we do reccommend it to anyone who is looking to spend time on Oahu's northshore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...great service”
Reviews.Author: skypilotdl
Reviews.Content: What can you say. Turtle Bay has the best property on the North Shore. Sadly we only booked for 4 nights. would have gladly stayed a week. We had a beach front cottage steps from the hammocks and ocean and only a few minutes walk to the pool. Our cottage was awesome. Huge bathroom, sitting area, patio, safe, and a wifi connection just for our room so the connection was great. Greeted with fresh fruit and juice at check in. We usually don't require housekeeping but when we called for new towels and toiletries they were brought promptly. Amazing service. We were also celebrating our anniversary and much to our surprise a bottle of champaign was delivered to the room. I can't say enough good things about the staff and property. The hotel beach area was great for the kids to play in and take advantage of the snorkel gear we brought - if you don't have you're own it is available for check out. We were so busy exploring the North Shore that we didn't take advantage of the golf course, surf lessons, or horse back riding. That will have to be on our next visit which I am looking forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for families--great location!”
Reviews.Author: barbied1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day stay. It was beautiful. Very expansive grounds and ocean Views everywhere. We saw whales breaching from our room one night. You can watch surfers from bleachers that are right next to the pool facing out to the ocean. The restaurants are nice but expensive. The service at the pool was first rate. The only thing that needs improvement are the bathrooms in the rooms. Cheery and outdated but function just fine. We went on hikes to the stables and rented bikes to ride the trails there. I don't think they care much about those bikes. They were rusty and rickety, and the guy who set them up for us didn't even know how to put air in the tires. If you want to bike, maybe rent from somewhere else. Otherwise a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Beautiful Property With Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: singermom4
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a split stay for our Oahu trip - 3 nights at Turtle Bay and 4 nights in Waikiki. Upon checking in, we were approached very apologetically by a manager. The hotel was at nearly full capacity, and the deluxe ocean queen room we had booked was required by a longer stay customer - would we mind staying in the Presidential Suite instead? The only very minor negative was the bedding was king bed only and we are a family of four but the kids happily took the couches. Obviously these accomodations were not representative of the regular rooms but the notable fact is they never tried to charge us extra for the upgrade and the management genuinely seemed concerned that we should be happy with the room. Between the sudden marvelous upgrade and the breathtaking scenery around the resort we were not feeling like moving on to Waikiki. So I contacted the manager again about extending our stay and he said he would see what he could do. We didn't get confirmation until the next day but he offered us a queen beachfront cottage - again at no extra charge. We happily accepted the room and cancelled our Waikiki hotel. Truly the North Shore experience is not comparable to staying in Waikiki. While we did occasionally did lament the fewer dining choices available, if there was more commercialization in this area then it would lose its charm. True, we had to drive everywhere but the scenery is so magnificent we did not mind. At the hotel we dined at Ola's - excellent food (especially the butterfish) and service, Leonardo's - much better than I was expecting - very unusual and tasty ravioli, and the coffee bar for pastries and coffee. We also dined at the shrimp trucks and the town of Haleiwa which is 20 minutes away. We would get fresh fruit from a fruit stand minutes from the hotel and pastries from Ted's Bakery for some of our breakfasts. Amenities - unlike Waikiki, the hotel provides chairs and umbrellas at no charge on their beach at Kulima Cove. We also enjoyed walking the various trails both along the beach and through the jungle. We took the horseback ride and enjoyed it greatly (I have posted a separate review). There is a resort fee of $26 which includes parking, internet, athletic club and some other amenities. Though it seems high, it is altogether lower than paying for similar amenities at most Waikiki hotels. Other perks include being able to view wildlife such as whales, seals, and turtles from the resort. Parking in the general lot was a bit of a hike but the cottage parking was very close and convenient. Cottage dwellers can also call up golf carts to get to other parts of the resort. I highly recommend this hotel and hope for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Surfers paradise, a bit remote, you'll need to hire a car!”
Reviews.Author: Thewitts
Reviews.Content: We had just 4 nights here, and one of them was cut short by us departing at 2am! The hotel is about 38 miles from Honolulu, and a bit remote from civilisation! It is a lovely hotel though with several restaurants, golf course and lots of other sporting activities! It has it's own beach with a restaurant on it. Eating in any of the restaurants ain't cheap for us Britts! even a beer is about $7 for a half! The meals that we had were nice though and the waiters were friendly and wanted a chat each time that we dined. Great for the surfers as I have mentioned, the main reason is the size of the waves, and the only reason that the waves are always like that is.... wind ! It is constantly blowing a Hooley out there! So if you don't surf and don't like wind, don't go!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem! Water views!What a pretty setting!”
Reviews.Author: brclight
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this lovely site and the friendly, polite staff. Staff went out of their way to be helpful. Yes the building is older, but everything was very neat and clean. The views from our room alone were worth the trip. Water sports and restaurants were great. Lovely sunsets! Once you get there this place feels like it is very remote, but actually just an easy drive from Honolulu. This resort was a quiet and lovely place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is a Great, Luxury North Shore Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AttorneyJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in October both of the past two years. Unfortunately, we’ll missed this year, as the continuing education class I had been attending in Hawaii was canceled. For some reason, I missed sending in a glowing review of Turtle Bay the first year, 2010. I think that was because we were ill and wished to put the memory out of mind. Turtle Bay = Great, our feelings about our trip were concealed from us in a haze of that dern bird flu. My wife absolutely loves this place! The staff and service here feels very California upscale laid-back, while still remaining courteous and attentive. I enjoy the fact that the food and beverages are all top-notch. We've only stayed in the hotel portion of the resort, not having resorted, sorry - couldn’t resist, to the other facilities available. Even so, our stay in our premium oceanview room was fantastic. The rooms are spacious, well-organized, airy, and extremely clean. I believe the maid service checks on the room twice daily, with linen changes daily -- towel changes every other day unless you request otherwise. The rooms bathroom is nicely appointed. Open spaces of countertop, double sinks, and a spacious shower area are a pleasant experience. Everything is spotless, at least it was during both of our visits. The bed is a feather top variety, though not a temperpedic variant. I thought it very comfortable, though my wife didn't like the pillows. They were too thick for her. Neat thing about those, firm enough for me, soft enough for her. The balcony was larger than you might think, with full-size loungers table and chairs sitting nicely and not jammed into it. A very pleasant place to hang out for a fruit plate breakfast, or late at night with drinks and your best body-massage partner getting frisky. The lobby of Turtle Bay is wide open and beautiful. Lots of white marble and white plaster compete with beautiful flowers and exotic birds (the great big ones … like 2.55 feet tall, gorgeously-colored, but LOUD, parakeets, maybe? I don’t really know), only during the day, to draw the eye with bursts of riotous color. Our experience with the front desk staff during both of our visits was smooth, quick, and flawless. No problems with reservations, nor any other problems with any request that we had during our stays. A neat thing, when we went the second time, we were asked if we enjoyed the room from the previous stay, and would we want it again. That room’s view was fantastic (forget the room number, apologies) so we did and got it. Bar service was excellent, the nightclub was fun, though a bit dated, by urban mainland standards. Lots of good music, but quite old, and I don’t mean classic rock, but like Top 40s from 30 years ago, Flock of Seagulls, Duran Duran, like that. Dining was also excellent, with prompt courteous and nearly invisible service. The wide variety of food available was all fresh, well prepared, and served with flair. The beach area at Turtle Bay is nice, but a bit rocky when compared to most of the islands other beaches. As beach experiences go, the resort's own beach doesn't hold a patch to the state park beach located about 7 minutes to the south, to say it doesn’t compare well with Waimanalo would be an understatement. That being said, it stomps all over Galveston Island’s East Beach or Crystal Beach. Truly, our only complaint with Turtle Bay as a vacation spot, is its location. It is almost all the way to the North Shore of Oahu. Depending on which route you take south, it takes between 45 minutes to an hour to get back to Honolulu, and the somewhat dubious pleasures of civilization. Our first trip, no problem, as we were lying abed for an average of 15 hours each day. The second trip, however, we had explored everything we wanted to see on the northern half of Oahu, and wanted to go south -- which is a pain. The above being said, the North Shore of Oahu has its own wonderful, beautiful charm. My wife was amazed as, while I was engaged in my classroom experience (in an open-sided pavilion about 40 feet from a State Park beach), she was totally alone on a approximately ¾ mile, curving expanse of one of the most beautiful crescent, white-sand beaches in the worrld. There was simply no one else there, literally. The water was swelling at about 3-4 feet, waves breaking smoothly onto the beach in a soft, susurrant rhythm, and she was all by her lonesome out there. That's the North Shore experience, the way we've come to expect it. Not the North Shore Pipeline surfing, that is a couple more miles from where we were, but even that is laid back, I'm told, compared to other high-interest surfing locales. If you wish to spend a very relaxing vacation, in a beautiful low-key, high-end and well cared-for resort hotel location, Turtle Bay is fantastic. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation wonderful wedding”
Reviews.Author: JoSarsona
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get married at Turtle Bay back in 2006 in the glass chapel over looking the ocean. Since them we celebrate our anniversary there and / or try to stay there when we can. It is on the most beautiful part of the island. Away from the hussle and bussel of the city life. It's still old Hawaii and beautiful as ever!!!! Very relaxing every time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Virginia216
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort was amazing! The location was perfect and far away from the hustle and bustle of touristy Wakiki. Plenty of amenities offered and lots of choices for dining. Rooms were comfortable and spacious. I would highly recommend this resort and look forward to returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: SusanGH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 2 nights in late December 2011. It is a beautifully positioned, well-maintained resort, but truly "in the middle of nowhere". We used the resort as a base to do sight-seeing along the north shore, and did not take advantage of the golf course or spa facilities. Our room was large and comfortable, with a good-sized bathroom; the double-sink vanity together with a large closet and mini fridge were in a separate room attached to the bathroom, . Our balcony overlooked the pools, the pool-side bar, and the ocean beyond. The grounds are beautiful. We especially enjoyed having snacks and early evening drinks at the bar by the ocean where we could simply relax and watch the surfers. Amenities include self-service laundry facilities at a small cost; we found this very convenient and useful (we'd been staying in various hotels and cities on the islands and needed to do laundry). The restaurant - Leonardos - is over-priced and neither the food nor the service are worthy of the resort. Eat next door at Ola instead (make reservations). Bike rentals are available but must be booked in advance (unfortunately we did not).

Reviews.Title: “The Travel Gods Smiled On Us :-)”
Reviews.Author: bubba53smom
Reviews.Content: Honolulu is very nice and has tons of touristy fun, but Turtle Bay on the North Shore of Oahu is THE place to go to relax and get a good bit of spoiling. Arriving frazzled from NJ, we stepped into our ocean from suite and were greeted with a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary! The staff couldn't have been nicer, the amenities - while excellent - just could not compete with sleeping with the lanai doors open all night (no bugs! just soothing surf!) - and the gorgeous landscaping, the beautiful weather and peace and quiet of a secluded resort in a string of small towns. 20 somethings might be disappointed with the nightlife, but us 'old folks' relished the calm and the little town and shops along Kam highway. Can't wait to go back and get more spoiling! Must do's - off road segway, ocean kayaking, horseback riding, hiking (on the grounds and the nearby Waimea Valley) and visiting the roadside shops and shrimp trucks along Kam Hwy. It's only a half hour from Pearl Harbor and maybe 15 minutes from the Polynesian Cultural Center. Oh, and get The Green Flash at the poolside bar, available only at sunset each day :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki B
Reviews.Content: Nothing is forgotten at this place! Spa, check. Bar, check. Pool, check. Food, check. Even a few stores, check. I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveller_2x2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii. We booked our trip in October, but then started having second thoughts after reading the ongoing Tripadvisor reviews criticizing this property. We understood from the reviews that we could not expect much from the standard hotel rooms. True, the hotel rooms really need updating and decorating to warm them up - however, the room was very clean and a fair size, all we really needed. We had a view of the ocean. Previous guests had complained about the view of the roof of a building - yes, we saw a slice of roof, but above this, a spectacular view of the ocean very nearby. Staff within the hotel and restaurants were consistently and exceptionally friendly and helpful. Only negative was that (probably due to cold weather the first week) the hot tubs were very, very busy - often full of many small children "swimming" and splashing, and many of the people in the hot tubs were not staying at the resort but were locals or staying in the nearby condos. Admittedly tricky but would be better if the hotel could find a way to reserve their facilities for paying guests. The hotel has spectacular views, almost everywhere you look - the lobby, each restaurant, even the hall beside the elevator. We spent two weeks at Turtle Bay with our children. As we had a rental car, we travelled around the entire island but were always glad when we returned to the north shore with the relaxed vibe and spectacular scenery. We ate at Ola's on the beach 5 times and it was fantastic each time - service, scenery and food. We had the breakfast buffet on the Palm Terrace several time and while a bit pricey, it was delicious and again with great service - the other days we ate a light breakfast in our room with groceries from the nearby grocery store. Breakfast sandwiches from the lobby coffee bar were excellent as well. Caramel macchiatos from the lobby coffee bar were a staple - delicious with homemade caramel sauce and delicious espresso. As we were frequently travelling around the island we ate out of the resort quite a bit - our favourites were: Ted's Bakery, Shark's Cove Grill, Matsumoto's shave ice, all of the shrimp trucks (!) and the smoothie truck next to Giovanni's Shrimp Truck, Haleiwa Joe's, and a tiny chinese restaurant on the main street in Manoa. We used a travel guide to find our restaurants and had fantastic food at good value throughout our trip. We are frequent travellers and travel with our children. Turtle Bay met our needs exceptionally - absolutely spectacular scenery, out of the Waikiki "fray", friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Used the Resort's Surf School”
Reviews.Author: ntdavis524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a surf lesson at Turtle Bay. The resort was very nice and we would consider staying there in the future. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our surf lesson, but won't deny it was a lot harder than we anticipated. The area we were at was very rocky and the surf was fairly rough for beginners. I had heard it wasn't worth it to do a private lesson but it would've been worth the extra money. We had a whiney girl in our group and hogged one of the instructors the entire time. There were two other instructors for 6 other people and I believe a private lesson would've gotten us a lot more time, or at least more of your money's worth. Overall, the guys were great and we did enjoy our experience. They take pictures for you which was great, but of course they are pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Remote and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: GirlyBob33
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and starving. Our option was room service. It was overpriced for what we received, but we knew it would be more expensive because of the location. We reserved a deluxe oceanfront room, and had a room overlooking the pool area and the beach behind it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable. My only other complaint was the pool. While it was large, it was very cold and no one seemed to use it. The hot tubs were great though.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in town!”
Reviews.Author: CuthbertK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive - but it can afford to be, as it seems to be the ONLY place for visitors to stay on the whole of Oahu's North Shore. It's a lovely spot of luxury though in an otherwise hicksville kind of place, and we loved it for both those reasons. Big bed, 2 sinks, sea view, cozy duvet, lovely toiletries, free WIFI in room - but a steep $25 daily resort fee on top of booking price ( it includes parking - all hotels seem to charge at least $10ish a day for this). Front desk very efficient; convenience store in the basement. We didn't eat in any of the many restaurants at the establishment ( including 1 on the hotel beach) but had 1 overpriced, not great cocktail at the Hang Ten bar by the extensive pool/hot tub area, where it was nice to sit and watch the surfers though. The nearby beach offers OK snorkelling, as does Shark Cove - this place is no good for kids though as it has a very rocky entry. For turtles you need to go to Laniakea Beach from noon onwards - they come out on to the beach and say hi. This is not signposted - look for lots of cars parked on the side of the road on the left as you drive from the resort towards Haleiwa about 15 mins from Turtle Bay hotel. Haleiwa is the nearest town a 20-minute drive from the hotel - but what a drive - stop off at Ehukai Beach Park and Waimea Beach on the way to watch the waves if its winter. Good eats in Haleiwa - Jameson's, a little Thai on left as you enter town & Cafe Haleiwa. Great smoothie from Lanikai juice. Teddy's Bakery on the road back to Turtle Bay Hotel also fun, but the best food recommendation is Giovanni's Shrimp Truck - turn left out of the resort & its on the left in about 5 mins. Super-fat, super-garlicy shrimps n rice like you've never had before, washed down with a pina colada smoothie or real coconut juice. It's quite unbelievable this place - just beach after beach, no sign posts, street food on the roadside, chilled, chilled vibe - is only 50 minutes drive from the designer shops and high-rise hotels of Waikiki - I'm so glad we finally came here

Reviews.Title: “I Left My Heart In Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: KandDfromNY
Reviews.Content: There are few places I'd rather be than waking up to the sound of the ocean beating against the rocks outside our cottage patio. We spent a week in an oceanfront cottage at Turtle Bay as a last minute booking after a hurricaine forced us to cancel a trip to mexico. And let's just say, I've never felt more lucky to have had a vacation cancelled! The setting for this resort is unforgetable. My husband and I would just spend hours sitting on our patio staring out into the ocean. Yes, the food is expensive, but we're from manhattan and the prices are right on par with what we'd pay to eat out at home. Definitely recommend driving off the property for some dinners. In haleiwa there is the Cafe Haleiwa- usually a breakfast place that recently began doing AMAZING dinners. Make a reservation and arrive early to buy some wine next door (it's BYO). Also, Ted's Bakery is a MUST for breakfast sandwiches and pasteries. We spent most of our time lounging by the pool (which was a little chilly) and at the beach, basking in the sun with the cooling trade winds breeze. Did a little sightseeing to some of the Lost filming sights (we're dorks), and some hiking on the trails on turtle bay property. My husband played golf twice- the Palmer course made the hassle of flying with clubs worth while. The spa was too booked with weddings for me to get a pedicure during our stay- so book ahead if that's something you want to do! For dinner we ate at the poolside bar twice, Lei Lei's once was ok, went to Ola for a reservation but actually liked the bar menu better so ate in that section and listened to the live music. Never made it to 21 degrees north (the fine dining place) and wish we had demanded our money back for the meal we had a Leonardos- poor imitation of italian food (but again, I'm biased being an Italian from NYC). Breakfast at the Palm Terrace was a bit expensive, but could keep you full all day! Our only major issue was that upon check in there were no more king cottages available as we had booked (granted, our flight was delayed and we didn't arrive until after 7pm). Regardless, the two queens cottage was gorgeous, great view. Next day they move us into a king cottage, which was in one of the two cottage buildings that are set back quite a way from the water, overlooking a large lawn with hammocks. Still very beautiful, but no comparisson to the room we had just left. I was very dissapointed, as we were paying the same for this room as all the rooms which were a few steps from the ocean. We called the front desk to see if anyone was checking out of a king closer to the ocean but no luck. The next day we bit the bullet and were moved back into a cottage closer to the water. If I were to go again I'd request to NOT be in one of these two cottage blocks. Otherwise we had an amazing stay. 6 months since our trip and I wonder if it is too soon to go back already!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort experience”
Reviews.Author: Dawn7352
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one-bedroom waterfront cottage in November 2011. Outside the door a hammock was strung between two palm trees - heaven! The resort has a lovely pool and bar, several restaurants, golf course, riding stables, snorkle equipment available, and the service is impeccable. Plus you can sit and watch the surfers very close to the hotel. A definite A+.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay - Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: Hockeymom46and4
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location. Fantastic views. Plan to eat in a nearby town, this hotel is very expensive for food. On the down side, we could not get more than 2 people on our tiny balcony, however we were not in the room much. Go to the north shore beaches which are nearby. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: calumc
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Staff were helpful. Business centre lady assisted me in using her scanner without charge. Lunch at the beach was idyllic, affordable and tasty. Gym was reasonably well equipped and incl in the rate Internet was easy to connect to, stable and incl in the rate. Room was large and clean, shower pressure very good. Local calls are free. Minuses: Breakfast not incl and was overpriced for what was on offer Due to the family orientation, if you're anywhere near the pools, you're likely to be woken as I was at 7:30AM by screaming kids, as the doors are not double glazed. Car park required a few minutes walk to hotel entrance, concierge trying to charge about $12 for parking your car. If you're thinking of somewhere to take your family, this resort appears to be geared for families.

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out..sort of”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May '10 as part of our vacation/road trip/friend's wedding. So we wound up here as a last resort after taking off from Waikiki in the morning and just driving around and hanging out at different spots along the North Shore. We initially passed by this place while it was getting dark. We drove a bit more and didn't see anything else for a while, so decided to backtrack and knowing we would have to bite the bullet on the price. We didn't have much money and we let the front desk know. We were able to get a small discount through help from the night manager. The room was quite large and looked very luxurious. Everything turned out to be top notch. The beds and bedding were so comforting and particularly after a nice long warm relaxing bath to clean up from the long trip. The bathroom was split with lav and shower in a room while the sink was in an alcove between the bedroom and bathroom. In the same area as the sink was a large built in closet that can hold lots of clothes as well as luggage. A small fridge, coffee maker, and large mirror are also in the alcove. Now the room is described as one of the Ocean View rooms, but we only saw a sliver of it as the rest of the view was made of a forest of AC condenser units. There was a balcony to walk out to and sneak over to one end to get a better view of the ocean. We didn't eat there, but did lounge around the pool are and take dip for about half hour or so. The view from the pool is quite spectacular. You get to see over the bay with hardly an obstructions. There is a smaller pool with a slide for kids, but when we were there the slide was out of order. Hanging around in the lounge area is also a treat as there are large windows that provide great views of the beach and ocean. There is a small trail leading from the hotel down to the beach, which is quite desolate in the mornings and quite peaceful to just walk along to get lose yourself in thought or lack of it. Would normally not stay in a place like this without doing some homework first, but overall had a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for two nights. I had booked an Ocean View room but was apparently upgraded upon check in. I even booked it through hotels.com which was cheaper than doing it directly on the hotel's own website. My room had an amazing view of the ocean and the small beach used by the resort. Very lovely view. The small balcony was also rather nice, although it would have been cool if it was a little bigger. The actual room was very spacious. The bathroom for one was quite big and actually consisted of two rooms. It had all the amenities you would expect. The room was very clean and felt very comfortable and high end. The resort itself is located in an area without much to do, so luckily there's a lot of activities and options within the resort, such as two massive golf courses, tennis courts, a spa and much more. If you don't have a car, though, it's probably not the best place to stay. You can take some nice hikes in the area, and there's a few trails pointed out, but I would recommend having your own car to get around (which I didn't). In fact, the resort wanted to charge an outrageous $140 for a one-way shuttle from Waikiki to the Turtle Bay Resort. I ended up taking the bus which, to be fair, took about two hours but it was actually a rather pleasant trip, much of it along the coast right by the ocean, and I only paid $2.50. In fact, the resort has its own public bus stop just a short walk from the front desk. By the way, don't expect the front desk to look the same way as it does in the film "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". It looks much better in the film world! And there's now a bar in the approximate location where they had placed the front desk in the movie. The hotel itself has a decent pool, a couple of shops, and some nice restaurants. I had dinner at the Ola which was great, albeit expensive, but my excellent waiter was worth it. I also tried the on-site Italian restaurant, Leonardo's, which was nothing spectacular but the food was decent enough. You can also get sandwiches from the bar in the lobby area. They were fine, but expensive. One of the downsides is a resort fee which should be included in the room price. The hotel, and the North Shore, is a big contrast from the bustling Waikiki area which has a lot of more activity and options. But if you want a quiet getaway, a nice beach and great views, this is a great place. Sadly, the weather was terrible while I was there, so I think I would have enjoyed it a lot more if it had been sunny as it usually is in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Oahu - if you want it to feel like Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: RKane_RMG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our seach for hotels with the Waikiki area, but after looking at pictures, getting to be around the forest of hotels did not appeal to us and could have been located nearly anywhere. We wanted to stay somewhere that didn't feel like a city and are thrilled to have found Turtle Bay Resort on the North Short of Oahu. It was a great place for us and our three kids to spend our nights and do a lot of swimming, eating, and some activities. The kids rode horseback, we taught them to snorkel, we watched the Sunday Firestick show, saw some awesome sunsets, made our own Lei's, spent a lot of time swimming in the pools, riding the water slide, hanging out in the hot tub and ate some great food. Some have mentioned the cost of the meals, I do agree the cost is high, but not surprisingly so. The only thing that surprised me was the quality. It was excellent. The concierge service was tremendously helpful in suggesting ideas of where to visit, including helping us find the sea turtles that were hanging out on one of the many North Shore beaches. The only negative was the pretty constant wind. We had just missed the freakish stormy weather, but got to experience a lot of wind. By the last day, the wind was significantly reduced, but our time in the pool was a bit colder than expected due to the wind. That said, it didn't diminish our overall enjoyment too much. My wife, me, and our kids absolutely loved Turtle Bay Resort and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when we visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: F111
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 8 night stay at Turtle Bay Resort. It was a very nice place with very nice and friendly staff. We had a Queen Deluxe room. It was nice to watch the ocean but probably not worth the extra money for the extra deck space. Most the rooms have a great view and at least a small deck. The rooms were clean and neat. The paint a bit outdated in the rooms but that doesnt really bother me. The staff was very nice and friendly. The grounds keepers would stop whatever they were doing until you walked by. Any help you wanted (bags, car, etc.) was readily available but they were not pushy. (stayed at the Hyatt in Kauai a couple years ago the staff there would not leave you alone). Check in, check-out, towels, parking, everything was great. The parking and WIFI was included in the resort fee, so it was nice to not get extra charges. There was a nice pool, hot tubs, kiddie pool, small water slide and beach. Our kids had a great time. Hiking and plenty of stuff to do. The Palm Terrace breakfast buffet was great. Well beyond expectations. Because we stayed 8 nights it was included in our room rate package. Otherwise it would be very pricey. It was like $26 per person. Not really doable for a family of 4. Our room package included the free hour a tennis a day. We are not real tennis player but we were looking forward to playing. (2 adults and 2 small kids). What they don't tell you is the court is free but you have to rent the rackets ($8 each) if you don't have your own. That would be $32 for use to play for an hour. I thought that was pretty poor on their part, so we didn't play and the kids (and us) were disappointed. Drinks at the Hang Ten bar were nice with some type entertainment for a short bit each evening. The food was expensive and drink prices pretty high. $10 for a small Mai Tai in a plastic cup. All in all, a great place to vacation. We had a great time. Plenty to do and a nice clean place with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Pricey Food.”
Reviews.Author: Edistotiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in March. Check in was very smooth; the desk staff were very friendly & helpful. We were originally booked for a Deluxe Room with a King sized bed; at check in, the clerk advised me that the only available rooms with King beds were on the lower floors but that she could put me in a room with 2 Queen beds on the 6th (top) floor so that we would have better views. I chose to take the 6th floor room & our views were fabulous. The room itself is simply furnished. I did not find the green color of the walls objectionable (as have previous reviewers). There were a few scratches on the floor lamp and the table and a couple of small chips in the paint on the bathroom cabinet but overall the room was comfortable. There was a nice flat screen HD TV in the room. The bathroom was of an adequate size; it wasn't luxurious, but it was clean & operational (which is all I care about). The bed was comfortable, but I could tell that the management has scrimped a little on the thread count in the sheets. All of the pillows were too soft for me, but the housekeeper promptly brought me a firm one when I requested it the next morning. The lanai has a small table & 2 chairs. The AC was a little strange. I found that I had to keep the thermostat set at 4 degrees colder than I actually wanted the room temperature to be (for instance, to keep the room at 72 degrees I had to set the thermostat at 68 degrees) but just a minor thing. The restaurants however are ridiculously priced. Our first morning there we went to the Palm Terrace for the breakfast buffet; it cost $58 (plus tip) for the 2 of us. We went to the Foodland grocery about 20 minutes up the road & bought yogurt, fruit, sweet rolls, & juice after that; we kept them in the in-room refirgerator & ate breakfast on the lanai every other morning of our stay. We only ate in one of the in-house restaurants one other time during our trip. One night (when the weather was particulary bad) we ate at Leonardos, the Italian restuarant on grounds. Food again was overpriced. My husband had spaghetti & I had lasagna. Quality was only so-so; I can get food just as good at the little mom & pop Italian place near our home. Service that night was horrible (bread was served cold, specials not explained, drinks not refilled, not asked if we wanted to order dessert or wanted coffee after our meal). I don't know if it was because our server was young & inexperienced or just didn't care (I got the impression that it was a combination of both). we ate the rest of our meals at local restaurants in the area (You can find plenty within a 30 minute drive). That server was the only time we received poor service during our stay. The server we had at the breakfast buffet was very good. The rest of the staff we encountered were very friendly & tried to be helpful to answer any questions or fulfill any request. The housekeepers always greeted us when they saw us in the hall & asked if we needed anything. The desk staff & conceirge staff were also very helpful. There is a $25/day resort fee. For this you get free self-parking (the lot is around 100-150 yards from the hotel; valet parking is around $20/day), free Wi-Fi, use of the gym, daily newspaper, and a free hour on the tennis courts and volleyball courts (which we did not use). The resort grounds are very nice. there are lots of beaches & walking trails. They do have daily exercise classes, but a fee is charged for each one (usually around $10). There are lots of activities (horseback riding, segway tours, kayaking) but these are run by contractors who charge fees for each activity. We did not participate in any of the scheduled activities; you are provided a schedule each day. We enjoyed our stay at Turlte Bay. We would seriously consider returning there in future trips to the Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, medium management”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: My favorite spot to stay in Hawaii, gorgeous secluded spot. You can walk along empty beaches and explore the undeveloped North Shore without feeling you are in a tourist trap. Also we stayed in a beachfront cottage and that added even more to the "not in Waikiki" feel of this place. Walk out of your room right onto the beach. However the condition of the hotel has slipped since its renovation five years ago. And the management quality is a bit iffy, some great employees others not so hot. Overall though you can't beat the setting and the location. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “A 3.5 star property at a 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort many years ago when it was a Hilton property. Since then, it has seriously degraded in terms of quality of accommodations and service, while it still to bill itself as a top-tier resort. If you want to stay at a resort on the North Shore of Oahu, you really don't have any other choice than the Turtle Bay and I think they know it. It's a fantastic location, and a decent property, but certainly will not win any 5 diamond awards. They try and nickle and dime you to death every chance they can get. My recommendation for dinning would be to try all the neat local eateries a short drive away in Kahuku. And to also not pay for the ocean view upgrade. They all ocean view!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful resorts I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: JulieAhrnes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many nice luxury hotels throughout Hawaii, including the Fairmont Orchid water front suite, The Grand Wailea grand suite (5000 square foot room that we were upgraded to since our rooms had been given away) and many other luxury hotels on neighboring islands. Last year I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in an ocean cottage. I'll never stay anywhere else again. I just returned from my honeymoon which started in Seattle at the Hotel 1000 (same hotel chain) and ended at the Turtle Bay in the same wonderful cottage that we enjoyed last year. The difference this year, was that it rained and stormed every day of our vacation. Because I always choose my resort by how nice the room is, we didn't even notice the bad weather. Instead this year, we discovered the 12 miles of trails and private beaches that this resort has to offer. We really enjoyed the room service, comfortable bed, luxurious bathroom and on site restaurants. We exercised in the gym, walked, ran, played tennis for free (when it stopped raining a couple of times), sat in the cozy hot tubs and ate at the local fruit and shrimp stands. This hotel chain understands customer service and provides the best that I have ever encountered. We'll be going back soon, but this time during a season with better weather so that we can swim in some of the beautiful private coves that we discovered! Thank you to the managment of the Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Menjamin
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in November 2011 at this great hotel located in such a gorgeous place on Oahu. From the moment we drove down the long driveway we fell in love with the our surroundings and were looking forward to a great short stay and we weren't disappointed. The view from our ocean view was breathtaking and the room itself was very spacious and clean. All staff we came across were very friendly and the guys down at the pool bar bent over backwards to make our stay that little bit more enjoyable. Pros - Snorkelling with Turtles Horse riding on the beach Great for surfers Cons - Location - A bit tucked away from shops or other restaurants Resturants not that great and limited selection Travel Tips - Ensure you book a car when staying at this hotel so you can explore the rest of the North Shore. Haleiwa Town for shaved ice and a bite to eat and the Cultural Centre are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Cottage 102 for 7 nights to March 7/2012. Enjoyed a private dinner first night on our lanai with friendly service. Cottage was clean and the staff friendly. Concierge drove us to our room when it rained and provided us with fresh fruit daily. Although we had storms during our stay (which reminded us of winters on the west coast of Vancouver Island), we loved the warmth of the people we met. Had dinner at Olas and enjoyed it so much we ate there twice more (have the butterfish). Also Leileis prepared a swordfish plate as good as any we ever tasted. breakfast at Palm Terrace was included in our package and we enjoyed this start to every day. Our first stay on the north shore as we most often stay in Kauai and this part of Oahu is close to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 00Gemma00
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in to the time we left, everything was just perfect. What a beautiful place! The kids pool was great and our kids spent many hours on the waterslide. Walking along the beach we found lots of tropical fish in the shallows. Snorkelling was fantastic! We snorkelled here and Shark's Cove and Turtle Bay was better. Even our young kids snorkelled in the calm water and the fish were amazing (lifejackets for kids were free as well as sand play toys). All the staff were pleasant and the entertainment at night was great. Breakfast was really good and it was hard to adjust to 'normal' breakfasts when we left. We stayed in deluxe room but I think all the rooms would have a good view. Cannot recommend this hotel enough! We stayed for 6 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Hotel in the Middle of Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Tricia B
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Oahu and the Turtle Bay Resort. The grounds and ocean scenery at the resort are breathtaking. That was the only positive thing I can say about the resort. We stayed in an Ocean Front room in the main hotel. The main hotel is in major need of renovations. Our room smelled musty, had several warped doors and cabinetry in the bathroom and had paint chipping from the ceiling falling onto the floor when the wind would blow in. The lanai was very small any only had room for 1 chair. When we were there, they were having extreme high wind advisories which made it difficult to enjoy the outdoors. We brought our 6 year old to the game room and wouldn't allow him to play any games as they were all filthy! We did report this to the hotel management. We decided to try and find a nearby town for dinner, only to our surprise,there are not any nearby towns with decent shopping or restaurants. The nearby towns are very rundown and uncared for, very surprising for such a highly recommended place to vacation. The hotel management was very understanding about our complaints and refunded us for the rest of our stay. We ended up only staying 1 night and driving back to Waikiki beach where we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which I would recommend to anyone, beautiful resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: LaBu
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort's location on the north shore can't be beat. It's all by itself on a gorgeous stretch of coastline. We were particularly awed by the resort's night lighting of the breaking waves. There are great views of this from their Ola's restaurant. The hotel lobby spaces are a bit dated-looking but the property is very well maintained, inside and outdoors. The 4-bedroom ocean front villa is super nice and comfortable. The hotel's outdoor deck for yoga classes is so-so and not so great as you hoped. The dinners at Ola's are high-fat style and somewhat overcooked. The Ola restaurant space is a beautiful wood pavilion on the beach. The dinners at Lei lei's are delicious and far superior to Ola's. We learned why from some local residents that Lei Lei's is independent of the resort's kitchen. Shopping is not an activity here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: rhoffmann4502
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our week-long visit at The Turtle Bay and wanted to pass on our thoughts about our stay. This was our third visit to this resort in five years and each time we have spent many hours researching where to stay, and our decision has always come back to this resort for a variety of reasons. Some things you must know about this resort. First, THIS IS NOT WAIKIKI!!!! If you enjoy the hustle and bustle of a major city, do not stay here. If you enjoy bar hopping or the nightclub scene, do not stay here. If you enjoy two million people surrounding you and clogging the roads and sidewalks, do not stay here. However, if you enjoy a peaceful, quiet place to relax and decompress from all the above…..this is the place for you! This resort is on the North Shore, as far away as you can get from Waikiki and still be on the same island. The North Shore is Hawaiian “country” and is a completely different mind-set from the rest of the island. The resort’s tag line is “true Hawaii” and this is pretty much what the North Shore is all about. Having stayed at Waikiki resorts in the past and finding most of them over crowded, over-priced, and either understaffed and/or under-trained, the Turtle Bay Resort is a slice of heaven. This third visit was a vacation with all of our adult children, using three rooms and lasting a week. The new lobby is very nice, a lot more modern looking. The addition of the new coffee shop in the lobby is a great addition, offering coffee and pastries. The resort met all of our pre check-in requests, keeping us all on upper floors, in the wing we asked for. Check in was fast and efficient and the staff was very friendly. We have stayed in each wing of the resort now and I would recommend the best ocean views to be from the east wing, facing north. Request a room at the far end of this wing for the best views. Second best would be the southern wing, again at the far end, facing west. This trip was our first during “whale season” and we sighted over ten whales just from our lanai, including at least four that were “jumpers”, which was exciting to watch. We literally tracked them from one side of the resort to the other, a group of three-four whales for over an hour in one case. Yes, the rooms need to be renovated, especially the bath area, but they are very clean and well kept up. We personally spend little time in our rooms, other than sleeping and showering, so this was not a huge issue for us. I do agree with others who have mentioned that the rooms seem a little bare and maybe a small sofa or chair, other than those at the desk, would be a welcome addition. I personally wish they would repaint the rooms in a color other than the green they currently use as this shade of green I find too “industrial”. We have never seen mold or mildew that others have reported. The resort needs to look into possibly shifting the beds to the wall facing the lanai instead of perpendicular to the lanai. It’s great having the lanai door open to the sounds of crashing waves but would be even better if you could look directly out the lanai from your bed in the morning! Since our first visit in 2008 I have noticed new televisions (flat screen), new bedding (the best sleep I have ever gotten in a hotel) and mechanical (AC, etc) upgrades. My wife really enjoys the bath amenities from Spa Luana. Housekeeping was excellent and the rooms were always spotless. We ate at all the resort restaurants (except Twenty One North) and found the food good to exceptional, but as others have mentioned, over-priced; which I expect at any resort. Lei Lei’s (next to the pro shop) makes a great breakfast sandwich and is a great alternative to The Palm Terrace breakfast buffet (which at $26.95 is outrageously priced for what is offered). I’m not sure if they want to keep the breakfast at Lei Lei’s a secret or they just haven’t updated all their literature but if you look at the daily event sheet (Navy types can think of this as a Plan of the Day type of thing) left in your room every day, it only lists Lei Lei’s as serving lunch and dinner. After breakfast, from what I can tell, The Palm Terrace restaurant metamorphoses into Leonardo’s. I’m not sure why an Italian restaurant was chosen for a Hawaiian resort, but the food at Leonardo’s was average to good and serving size was generous. Ola’s, while not actually owned by the resort, is right on the beach and they serve seafood to die for! The Surfer Bar is a lively bar/grille area which and also spotlights local musicians/celebrities and is a vast improvement over the old bar there which was completely lifeless. Hang Ten is the pool bar/grille and although I have read a lot of complaints about poor service here, I never experienced anything but superior service and even want to commend Carol (wait staff) for her wonderful attitude and exceptional service. All the staff here were just great. We also really enjoyed the Polynesian Cultural Center crew that came out to entertain us next to the Hang Ten with the Tonga drums and the fire dance performers…very entertaining. Not a golfer, I can’t comment on the courses, but my sons and daughter seemed to enjoy their experience. Three of us decided to try the “Oahu Extreme” doors off helicopter tour offered from Paradise Helicopters, who are located right on the resort. This was a great tour, although it got a little chilly over the mountains (bring a sweater/sweatshirt!). We all got some great shots of Sacred Falls in particular and the North Shore in general. Josh our pilot and Sarah the “ground Staff” were great. The tour takes you from Turtle Bay, down the east coast to just north of Kaneohe through the Kualoa Ranch area and then over to the Waimea Bay area and all the well known surfer beaches (Banzai Pipeline, Sunset Beach, etc) and then back to the resort. All in all, about a 45 minute flight. The hotel grounds are spotless, very well kept up and absolutely beautiful. Lot’s of photo opportunities just in the plant life around the resort. For walkers/joggers, there are miles of paths, both along the miles of empty shoreline and along the golf courses. We walked the beach in both directions from the resort at various times and rarely saw another soul…very peaceful! The resort also offers trail rides and Seqway tours along these paths but we never ran into any on our strolls. The resort has an adventure center where you can set up horseback riding, Segway tours, kayaking, mopeds, helicopter rides, etc. You can plan an entire week’s activities through them just at the resort if you are so inclined. If you like to explore though, or want to go to Honolulu/Waikiki, you need to rent a car. We rented directly from the airport and used our vehicle for various day trips. There is also an Enterprise car rental at the resort. Plan on 45 minutes to an hour to get to Honolulu from Turtle Bay, and longer during rush hour. I thought Washington DC was bad during rush hour but the H-1 highway is right up there when it comes to gridlock. Other than a few “touristy” things in Honolulu, we steered clear of the urban parts of the island. We had a lot of fun in Haleiwa and along the surfing coast. The drive down the leeward side of the island is breathtaking, mountains on one side of you and the ocean on the other side. Remember that you will be charged a resort fee for each day you are at the resort. Why this is not just added to the room rate, we don’t know but while I see a lot of people complaining about this, you need to look at other resorts that charge up to $20.00 a day for parking, $10-15 daily for Internet,more for equipment rental, etc. I’ll pay the 26.18 fee. Overall, Turtle Bay, while not a five star resort (they don’t bill themselves as such), is a great place to stay and I would give it a solid 4 stars. I have read negative comments here but after three visits in four years, I have never had an overall negative experience. Very rarely we have come across an employee who may not have given the best customer service, or a meal that wasn’t the best, but overall this is a very high quality resort that really tries to satisfy the needs of every consumer. My wife and I plan on coming back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms! villas are gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: cmuffin
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel! we stayed in the 4 bedroom villa and it was just as pictured. we dined in the italian restaurant as well as 21 north - food was a bit overpriced and a little on the salty side but overall it was a wonderful hotel. great beach access.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but still a 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: This resort is awesome, the rooms are huge incleding the bathrooms. The views are amazing and the beaches are great. Surfers, families, couples, or whoever will love this place. The north shore is the side of the island to stay on unless you like slums and tons and tons of tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Golfing Paradise in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: danielmo
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples Turtle bay Resort. We played 7 golf games, 4 at Fazio Course and 3 at the Palmer course. Naturally the Palmer is much better golf experience. The 1st 9 holes of the Fazio are quite flat and tend to get water logged. Very pleasant golf courses to play. You absolutely need a car if you stay at Turtle Bay resort plenty of free parking available. In the morning we ate at Lei Lei for breakfast arount $10.00 PP this restaurant is right off the 1st tee very convenient. For suppers there are plenty of restaurant within driving distances. Also ate at well known spots such as Ted’s bakery & Giovanni Shrimp (trailer) for mid afternoon lunch. At the hotel we ate a 2 restaurants very good. There are plenty of fruit stands along the road where we bought fresh fruit (papaya,mango,pineapple,apples…) to eat in the room or at breakfast. You can also shop at the foodland to buy wine or whatever beverages to have in your room. The rooms were very nice, spacious and clean with comfortable beds and beautiful view from the room. Rooms facing the small beach have small balconies while the rooms facing the ocean & the pool have big balconies. Best rooms are facing the pool on the upper floors. This resort is highly recommended for a memo

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: RJMCA10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here. I wasn't sure that I would like the "isolation". However, the resort and the location were perfect. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was a slow time so we were upgraded to an amazing suite. That certainly added to the fun of the trip - but we would have had a great time in a regular room. The restaurants were wonderfull also. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TexasCrapsman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from five nights at Turtle Bay. This was our second visit to the resort, having first visited there in 2010. We had a wonderful stay and were completely satisfied with our experience. We did stay in one of the ocean-front cottages. These units place you literally within 30 yards of the breaking surf. Nothing is any better than falling asleep to the sound of the waves crashing ashore. We would highly recommend that option to anyone who can afford the extra charge. I have read many of the reviews posted on TripAdvisor and am amazed at the number of negative comments about Turtle Bay. Our experience was totally at odds with those of the critics. Turtle Bay's greatest asset is the location. You could not ask for a more beautiful, serene setting than this. The North Shore of Oahu is a different world than Honolulu and Waikiki. The pace is slow, everything is very casual, and you avoid the crowds that plague other parts of the island. The resort has something to offer for those who want to be active (golf, tennis, horseback riding, scooter rentals, etc.) and those who want to chill (peaceful lanais, a nice pool, a protected beach, and miles of hiking trails). The restaurants have something to offer most palates. The resort is older, meaning that you can expect to see some signs of age in places. The room fixtures and furniture are not the latest but they are more than adequate for most tastes. The staff appears to be diligent about trying to address the maintenance problems that come with any older structure. We found the service to be excellent. The check-in process was smooth and efficient. Every staff member we met was friendly, accommodating, and competent. Special thanks to the ground crew that keep the lawns and foliage immaculate. The resort offers great views of the North Shore's fabled waves. Many critics have complained that the resort is too expensive. I would agree that the rates are high, but they must be viewed in the proper perspective. The nightly rates for the cottages are more than we would normally pay, but we have not found another property anywhere that gives you such luxury and puts you that close to a beautiful beach. Food prices are high everywhere in Hawaii, and the restaurants at Turtle Bay are no exception. I would note, however, that we have spent as much or more for food staying at one of the Las Vegas luxury hotels such as the Wynn. If you really can't take the resort prices, there are more reasonable options locally such as Ted's Bakery or Tita's Grill. Haleiwa has some great eating places that are more moderately priced. Having said that, we enjoyed great meals at Leonardo's and Twenty-One Degrees North as well as a fantastic room service breakfast on our lanai. We heartily recommend Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Facility - more than golfing!”
Reviews.Author: Jack1959
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort is a beautiful facility and includes more than golfing. I have lived on Oahu for 5 years and never went to the Turtle Bay Resort because I thought that it was for golfers. I was wrong. This place has quite the selection of resort activities including horseback riding, segway tours, and even helicopter tours. We had a room on the 6th (top) floor overlooking one of two gorgeous bays. There is ocean swimming in a protected bay as well as more wave action in an unprotected bay. There is snorkeling and water activities in these two bays as well. The pools and hot tubs are well kept with a bar near the center. The grounds are gracious and also well kept. You can rent surfboard, stand up paddle boards and/or go on an "eco tour" via kayak. So, there is a lot to do here if the weather is cooperating. The staff are fantastic. They are genuinely friendly, caring and kind. We asked folks for help and they were engaging. Our room was cleaned up often and the bed and bath were comfortable and clean. Restaurants are a little limited. We went to Leonardo's our first night for Italian food. The problem is that I'm originally from the northeast United States and Italian food there is really really good. This had that "Italian quantity" but not the quality (bland?) that I'm used to. My wife said it was good and I am being picky ... well there you go. Another restaurant we went to was Leilei's and it was excellent but about 1/4 mile from the main facility. Overall, we have enjoyed our 3 days and 2 nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite, awesome view, needs a few pick me ups”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite that was huge, comfortable, and had amazing views (including whales breaching). The bed was super relaxing, the sound of the surf was ideal, the grounds were gorgeous. There are two things I'd change: some minor adjustments to the room and some adjustments to the menus. First the room: the air conditioning vent was rusty and it shouldn't look that way for a high end resort. And the couch had some stains making it look not so fresh. The restaurants are numerous (3 bars, an italian restaurant, and a fine dining place) but the menus could have been better. The bars served potato chips, burgers, fries, chicken fingers, etc.--nothing too inspired, and the potato chips came in the bag so it wasn't like they were homemade. Leonardo's had delicious Italian food and a buffet on Saturday night (not too enjoyable to watch people gorge). Breakfast is either a buffet again or muffins and fruit and coffee at a "bar" in the lobby. For $20 we had two coffees, two pieces of fruit, a muffin and some oatmeal. One of the best parts of Turtle Bay is the activities. We got up early to do a private horseback tour with Vera. She is very friendly and an asset to the resort. I strongly recommend if you like horses to do this one-hour ride ($125 per person). You can also take surfing and stand-up paddle board lessons, kayak, snorkel, rent mopeds, play tennis, enjoy the pool, or walk for miles on the beach. We walked along the beach the day we got here and watched a sea turtle come out of the water onto the beach. It was so exciting. Also, mongoose run all over the place and it is fun to watch them wiggle around, foraging for whatever it is they eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: PeggyJoe
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and the view from our room m we upgraded to a suite. Well worth it. All rooms seems to have beautiful views though. Great breakfast Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Short Staya”
Reviews.Author: Lanlubber
Reviews.Content: Friend and I went up to the North Shore for one night to get away from the hustle of Waikiki. We were somewhat concerned because of some of the comments about the property and only booked for one night. The lobby is gorgeous and the welcome at reception was warm. Our room faced over the pool and the ocean - the surf was not high but the sound of the waves and the palms rustling was most soothing after the traffic of the city. With such a short stay didn't have time for much but some snorkeling (use of mask/flippers was free for 1 hour - which was long enough). Excellent dinner at Leonardo's with exemplary service. Enjoyed the fire knife dances at sunset. Room was large and beds comfortable. Yes the counter and cupboards in the mini-fridge area were old and needed replacing but the room itself had obviously been recently refurbished. The tiles around the bath had been painted rather than replaced and the paint had worn off in places but the bathroom was clean and lots of towels. A gift basket ordered by my friend was delivered soon after we arrived and was full of delicious goodies most of which came back to Waikiki with us, All the staff were friendly - even just passing someone in the hallway you got an Aloha. Ordered breakfast off menu because we wanted eggs benedict which were not on the buffet. Buffet food looked good and was replaced frequently. Good coffee! Would go again

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: Andy W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in January. Overall we really enjoyed the stay although we were extremely put out to be greeted with a request for payment of a resort fee to cover such things as incoming faxes, local telephone calls, a safe in our room and tea and coffee. I would have been far happier paying for these on an as used basis - I'm on holiday, why would I be expecting incoming faxes? And the complimentary things all seemed to have a catch - for example the use of the tennis courts were free but equipment still had to be hired. As has been said in other reviews the service at Hang Ten bar was appalling - twice I stood waiting while waitresses chatted amongst themselves or walked straight by me - and I would prefer the option of adding salt to food if I want rather than having it liberally applied beforehand, but elsewhere was good and the food in 21 Degrees North was excellent. The room was excellent, although the bathroom did have mould in it. However, the setting is beautiful and we were certainly able to relax and enjoy ourselves away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but we did leave with a bit of a feeling that everything about the resort is designed with the intention of parting you from your money.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Benzarch
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Turtle Bay resort and felt a little shorted. The Entry and Lobby is very nice but you get to the rooms and you feel as though you are at Motel 6. The rooms are bland and have no amenities. A bed an Armoire and a table and chair that is it. The room si big enough to handle a small couch or a lounge chair, but nothin. The Bathrooms are spacious but are old and show it. Clean but old. Again nothing special. At $300 a night I was expecting more, will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing destination !”
Reviews.Author: RyanCarefree
Reviews.Content: We experienced the most friendly staff, beautiful setting in North Shore of Oahu. Great place to stay to get away from the city of Honolulu. We dined in most of the restaurants on property and all the food was delicious ( and we consider ourselves foodies). Hotel is beautiful. Highly recommend it! We will b back. Massage outside on waterfront is a must for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK”
Reviews.Content: The hotel markets itself as a "luxury resort". This is not a luxury resort. Rooms are dated - and the modernization is a coat of paint over everything - even the tiles in the bathroom shower are painted over and peeling. Front desk service and hostess service at Olas was terrible. Stood at the counter for minutes without anyone saying anything. At check-in we had to ask "where do I check in" before someone acknowledged they could help us. At Olas same staring down before the hostess said "can I help you?". In an empty restaurant, most restaurants assume table for two, but here she asked us if we had a reservation. Waiter and food at Olas was good, and so was the location on the beach, but the decor suggested beach bar and grill, but the food was closer to fine dining. Also very slow was service at the Hang Ten bar at the pool. Waitress came over after 20 minutes (we were only about 10 feet from the bar itself), it took 15 minutes after ordering to get drinks, 30 minutes after ordering to get an appetizer, and 30 minutes after we were done for the waitress to come back. Because of the high winds, we - like most people around the pool - ended up taking our own food to the garbage, because everything blows over and service is slow. The high winds keep everything rather cold - no one was ever in the pool during our stay. What is nice about this hotel is the expansiveness, the ability to take a walk and get away from other people. However, I did expect more signs and trails that were not horse trails.
