If you take a right after the bridge by the pool there are nice hammocks that we enjoyed. For resort activities, there were not any activities that really caught our eye. A lot of the rentals are to take off site. Food and service at Lei Leis was the best - I would recommend this as the number one restaurant at the resort. Otherwise food in the town of Haleiwa is good. We stayed half our time in Waikiki and half of our time here. If I had to do it over again, I would have stayed the whole time in Waikiki- and just taken a day trip to the north shore - the town of Haleiwa, sunset beach, and the turtles at Lanikai beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Colee626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our Babymoon in February, and it was very relaxing. It was a seamless check-in and our room was very nice overlooking the side of the ocean that is like a lagoon. The bathroom was showing it's age, so overall we liked the room, view, bed, and space, but the bathroom desparately needed remodeling. I like that there was a sink and prep area, separate from the tub/shower, toilet, and another sink. We ate at a few of the restaurants on the property, they were okay. The service was outstanding at evey place except for the Hang Ten bar at the pool. We could not get help being served any where we sat, eveyday we went down to the pool. Very disappointing. Our package included the buffett breakfast. Great food, for our first meal of the day and it got us going. The staff at breakfast was awesome. My husband golfed both the Palmer and Fasio courses. He got on quickly and had a great time. We got massages in the private bungalow overlooking the ocean through their spa. It was nice, but not worth the price we paid. Overall, vacation was great. We felt a little isolated for the seven days we were there so if we did this trip again I would do half my time here and half at another resort on the island. We liked the isolation, but it dragged on for a little too long. We went into Haleiwa a few times for dinner because we were over eating at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-Away from Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CherO50
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is the perfect resort if you want golf, tennis and beach activities away from busy Honolulu. The views are fabulous and the beach quiet and calm. Golf was excellent on the Palmer course, but don't go there in February when the Trade Winds are strong. Tennis, yoga, spa, horseback riding, kayaking and many more are all within walking distance. We enjoyed the coffee shop for a quick breakfast to go or to enjoy by the wall of windows before golf, and drinks and an excellent dinner at a sand table at Ola's on the beach away from the busy pool bar at sunset, as well as coconut shrimp and drinks after a round of golf at Lei Leis.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Ray D
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at North Shore. The Turtle Bay Resort was better than expected. The location is fantastic; far away from Honolulu with a beach, 2 golf courses and great real Hawaiian experiences. The surf was huge which made the two-lane roads a little crowded (there was a big surfing contest also). The hotel was nice, but the rooms were a little stark. The restaurants were good, but not great, and a little over-priced. We will go back there and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “NOT What i remember”
Reviews.Author: ToskeyEddie
Reviews.Content: This property NEEDS a complete Renovation. Upon Check-in we were given our room keys to go to the room and the furniture/fixtures in the room were chipped on all corners and a closed up smell welcomed you at the door. I proceeded to turn the A/C unit on and noticed dust in the air.... i looked at the filter and noticed it had not been cleaned in months. The other parties room that we were traveling with also had a poor room. Tiolet plunger not working and chipped furniture. The room lamp shades were dirty and some broken. I complained to front desk and then they proceeded to show me a room no better so i asked to speak to the night manager Aron who was pleasant and apologetic. He moved me to a suite 680 which i informed him that the room was way too big. It too was out dated and the room furniture needed to be up graded to say the least. The bed frame was dirty and broken therefor always rocking like a boat at sea. After 2 nights we decided to check out and the other party as well when we were suppose to stay for another 5 nights. The restaurant on site were not deserving of the prices they were charging at all. The plates of food were simple and not fancy but the pricing structure was not deserving. The Italian restaurant served me over cooked Calamari that was not fresh when the server explained to us how fresh it was going to be and the menus..... plain simple type print laminated... something you'd find in a diner not this resort..... The laminate was actually coming apart in your hands as the corners were all peeling. The beech Restaurant was no better when we got to try it the second night as the first night the front desk person told us it was open until 10pm and after walking there a staff member informed us that the Restaurant Manager decided to close early as it was not busy and this was 8:30pm???? come on people???? We did go back the second night and found it was over priced as well for what was being served and actually found that the server told us it is an independent Operator and that is why the night before, they closed early. The over all property sits on beautiful land and beach and it is a shame the Operators have let this Property go like this. It needs maintenance and new furnishings every where. The HVAC ceiling vent louvres were rusting in places and actually any metal areas where showing signs of rust in areas..... The basement level area going to the pool area was dark and ceiling tiles stained in a lot of areas... lighting in this area was very poor and those poor shop owners down there and a gift shop area with no traffic etc.... I asked 3 staff members on the resort where and what restaurant they recommend i try for meals and every one of them told me the food was all "crap" on the resort and if i wanted a good meal..... drive to either town... turning left or right out of the resort. Needless to say, i was not impressed with this place and when i was here years ago... under the HILTON brand it was a wonderful and beautiful resort. I hope the Owners put some money into this truly beautiful island gem as its needed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a cottage”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in cottage #136 and loved it. It was very quiet, with the exception of the waves, which we loved. Housekeeping was outstanding. Cannot compliment them enough. Unobtrusive and very timely. The only down side to Turtle Bay is the commute to Honolulu which takes an hour. We were there to attend a wedding and activities around the wedding so had to make the dreaded commute three times. There is a fabulous blow hole right near the hang ten bar and we sat by it, with a bottle of wine for an entire hour. We are not big "foodies" but we had a great meal at Hale'iwa Joe's. Be advised that it is a little cooler and rainier on the North Shore so bring a jacket.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay: like a comfortable pair of slippers”
Reviews.Author: Btafalcon
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is about as far away from Waikiki as you can get so it takes some getting to, but it is close to the big wave surfing, the Polynesian Cultural Center and a lot of nice beaches and country to poke around in, if you decide to leave the property. It has a sweetheart cove open to the sea, a nice looking pool I didn't try, and epic waves breaking. You can sit in the bar and watch waves breaching offshore. My blood pressure dropped so much I had to struggle to go play a round of golf. The restaurants are nice, the service is Hawaiian, friendly but slow but then I wasn't in a rush. The staff are about as nice as can be and took the time to talk It is a nice size. Just big enough to have a lot of choices (but I was feeling too lazy to try most of them) but not so big that I felt like I was in Disneyland or I had to park my car a mile away as happens at the big Big Island resorts. I don't usually like resorts. I like small resorts but like Goldilocks, this one was not too big, not too small, but it was just right, and there were the whales (sorry I feel I should say something bad before we all go into insulin shock, so yes the rooms are a bit old, but I didn't spend much time in mine, never turned on the tv. I turned off the ac and opened the window to listen to 20 ft waves smash into the reef.)

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Turtle Bay Resort and we loved it and can't wait to go back. We decided to spend Valentine's Day at the hotel after spending 5 days in Honolulu. We booked a beach cottage for one night and we were very happy when we got to the hotel at around 11 AM and were able to check in. They gave us room 110 which had a king bed and was only steps away from the beach and the wonderful sound of the ocean waves. The beach cottage room was large and clean, with a huge bathroom area as well. As soon as we walked into the room we got a call from our concierge who arrived with a tray of fresh guava juice, apples, bottled waters, and a welcome amenity of a small wooden ukulele. We chose the beach cottage room and the hotel because we had seen it in the movie Forgetting Sarah Marshall and it was even better in person. We only had one night at the hotel so we did as much as possible at the hotel. We first went swimming in the pool area and WOW the big pool was cold. The pool with the water slide was much warmer and while it did take me a while to convince my wife to go down the water slide, once she agreed and tried it she liked it enough to go down it a half a dozen times. There are 2 hot tubs in the pool area and the one by the pool bar had some great views of some huge north shore waves. We made a quick 5 minute drive to Romy's Shrimp Truck and had a really good lunch, and then grabbed our snorkel gear and went to the beach front area on the other side of the hotel. There is a snorkeling and swimming area that is protected from the waves by a reef and it was a very peaceful area to snorkel in. We were able to track down a turtle and swam with him for a bit, and we saw a lot of colorful fish and an eel as well. It was great having such a nice beach and snorkel area only a few steps from the hotel. After spending some more time back at the pool we headed west and walked along the beach area down to the huge Banyan Tree, which I had wanted to see as I am a fan of the TV show Lost which filmed a lot of scenes there and at the beach a few dozen yards away from it. While we were walking we came across a horse back riding tour of the area and that is something we'd like to try on our next visit. It looked like a lot of fun. The area to the west of the hotel is quite beautiful. We got back to the hotel in time for an incredible sunset and headed to our Valentine's Day dinner at Ola, one of the restaurants on the property. My wife and I each got the fresh fish of the day, which was Shutome, a variety of swordfish. The dinner and the service was great and the restaurant is right on the beach. A perfect setting. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and our only regret is that we only stayed there for one night. But now that we know how much we like it, we'll be back for a much longer stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at Turtle Bay for five days at the end of January and could not have had a better time. We really enjoyed our stay. While the rooms are a little older than you might expect, they are very clean. The staff is incredibly accommodating and friendly. While we were there, the hotel was also hosting a convention for Foodland. The property was sold out, but never felt crowded or busy. It was just pleasant and a really relaxing experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sue ellen w
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time visiting this property and I am never disappointed.From the welcoming open entrance to the great staff we are always so happy with all aspects of our visit. My friends and I ate at Leonardos Italian Restaurant,where we loved the open kitchen and a wonderful varied menu to choose from. We had the antipasto platter which was a larger portion than anticipated and thoroughly enjoyed . We also had the lasagna and it was authentic and delicious. Everything was very reasonably priced and a very nice touch was the chef coming out to say hello to guests and ask about our meal and experience.It made us feel special and I could see the other guests felt the same way. The Surf club was a lot of fun; we attended 80's night and the DJ was playing great tunes but the band were clueless. I don't fault the band; whomever is in charge of booking entertainment should perhaps do their research or be replaced by someone who cares to match events to appropriate entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Still awaiting much needed renovations”
Reviews.Author: AnjVW
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write about a property I have loved for a long time but that has fallen into disrepair. I have stayed at Turtle Bay 3 times over the past several years. This resort, located on one of the most beautiful pieces of land in the world, used to be our favorite place to come and relax. However, the resort has been on a downward trajectory in recent years, with complete neglect of the guest rooms in the main building. I suspect the cause is financial--ownership by a bank and then by private equity firms is never a good sign these days. Our last visit was a little less than two years ago. We stayed in one of the better, ocean-view rooms on the 6th floor. The furniture and shutters were chipped; the carpet was threadbare, the TV was a good 25 years old, the bathroom was dingy, one of the phones was dead and the light on the data port blinked 24/7 (we threw a tshirt over it at night). Yes, it was clean, but so is Motel 6. The restaurants and other common areas have been maintained, but what's the point if your room is a wreck? Between our first and second stays, the resort built a conference center, the enormous and jarring blackltop of which ruins the views from the rooms that had had the best views. Turtle Bay could ameliorate that by building a roof garden on the blacktop that is the first thing you see from the ocean-view rooms with real lanais (the smaller "lanais" are actually Juliet balconies). Note that the difference in cost between a room in the main building and one in the newer outbuildings is over $200 per night, so you're talking a completely different cost bracket to avoid the bad rooms. Another thing to note is that Turtle Bay is the ONLY hotel or resort on the North Shore. So, no matter how bad things are, its ranking will always be #1. Don't be deceived by that.

Reviews.Title: “Good but lacking detail”
Reviews.Author: darthvader78
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to turtle bay resort. We had a great stay and my family enjoyed the trip. We stayed in a beach front bungalow, it was more than we expected the room to be as far as location and proximity to the ocean. The room was showing its age though and I hope the new management will pay attention to those details. The paint was pealing from the humidity, the furniture scratched from so many years, and the main hotel is definatly showing its age. Although we had a good time and the grounds are amazing the construction going on around the hotel was horrible and intrusive. The hot tub was closed 6 of the 7 days we were there and the large pool was freezing because the heater was broken. The employees were nice for the most part aside from a few of the front desk staff. They should be the nicest as they are the first impression. Would I stay here again? Yes BUT not until they finish construction. The location is quiet and beautiful and the ONLY hotel on the north shore. The locals are so nice and eat away from the hotel. The hotel food is horrible, especially that wanna be italian joint. who the he** goes to hawaii for italian food, especially bad italian. The housekeeping service was great, always has been. They all need pay raises and to be comended. The shops are great and the new Surfer Bar is amazing, now if only the hotel could all look as good. Go and have a good time but be aware of the construction and dont expect the Aloha spirit from the employees, very few have it.

Reviews.Title: “Love this property”
Reviews.Author: Twisted C
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time at this property and will not be my last. I love the proximity to the ocean and the spot lights they have on at night facing the ocean so you can see the waves crest and break. The staff was very friendly, especially Ann B. If I had a choice to pay for 7 nights here, or get 7 free nights in Waikiki, I would choose to stay pay and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “**PERFECT***!”
Reviews.Author: ekcyep
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. From the front desk staff to housekeeping, to the lovely woman @ the coffee bar who remembered our sunrise order after the second morning of our stay...everything was absolutely perfect. Our extended family group ranged in age from 6mos., thru teens and beyond and everyone was happy! How often does that happen? Don't miss the spectacular trail rides @ the stables.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Typeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 wk and found so much to do and see right here at the resort. The beach has great snorkeling!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven... this is Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: Pepperpayne
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days in Waikiki, it was so nice to turn up and a spend a few days at the Nth shore and unwind at Turtle bay. Highlights; * Views / waves were amazing. * Lovely resort / very clean. * Plenty to do - generally all at a price though... * Golf - Arnold Palmer course was brilliant - Afternoon rate of $90 (clubs, cart etc) was good value * Breakfast buffet / Italian dinning - Very nice, not overly cheap though * Polynesian cultural centre only 10min away - well worth the trip * Surfer bar is very cool.... * You can sleep with your door open listening to the waves crashing - loved it. Not so great... * With the big winds come a very annoying whistle in our room (seal on the window/door was buggered). The resort kindly offered to change our room however as we had already unpacked - left it to the next day. * After spending a substantial amount to stay (for us anyway), the $25 a day resport fee seems a little cheeky * Everything costs money but you expect that going into a place like Turtle Bay. Overall, exactly what we expected - beautiful place and would definatley stay again if we return to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Massage was just Okay”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily22
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is beautiful, serene and peaceful. Perfect for a getaway or honeymoon. The spa experience was nice. Wonderful waiting and pampering area while you wait for your massage. They serve you cucumber or lemon water as you relax. We got the couples massage in the hut. The massage itself was not spectacular. We got the traditional island lomi lomi massage. I didn't feel my muscles were worked at all and it was not that long of a massage for what I payed for. A bit expensive for the massage I got but it was still relaxing nontheless. Perhaps a different massage would have been better. The atmosphere at the place was top notch though. Well worth a visit to Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Sisters loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: MrTandMe
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights recently at this beautiful resort after 4 nights in Honolulu - we had a beautiful suite with 2 bedrooms and living room/wetbar with lovely balconies with that incredible view. The staff were excellent and made us feel very welcomed and special. The swimming beach with the snorkling area was very enjoyable - also spent time in the pools and spa's. Will look forward to staying again at Turtle Bay - may be we will bring friends or spouses next time to share this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our villa room!”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early evening and were greeted by a busy but professional valet staff. We had reserved an ocean front room with a king bed. When the reservation person told us that we were being offered an upgraded room with two queen beds we were reluctant to change because of the two beds. Thankfully, we listened to her recommendation to take the villa room and were very pleasantly surprised! The villas are quite large with private lanai's facing the ocean. Loved the separate bathtub and shower with lots of space on the counter and below for our toiletries. We slept in every day and were never bothered by the cleaning staff but had our room cleaned every day even if we didn't get out until after 1:00pm. The room was a bit away from the hotel itself, but we were able to walk to the pool, convenience store, and restaurants if we wanted more activity. It's worth the short walk for the privacy. The only slight problem was that the fridge didn't work. it was plugged in with the door open and not working. Also, when we first walked in it smelled a bit moldy, probably because of the climate. Perhaps a bit of air freshener would help? We went to the hotel only one night for dinner at Leonardo's. It was a bit of a disappointment. The food and ambiance reminded me of an inexpensive Vegas buffet. It definitely wasn't worth the price. They didn't even warm the bread. Yes, it's close, but there are several less expensive delicious places to eat if you're willing to leave the property and drive for fifteen minutes or so. Would we return to this hotel? If we could stay in the same room, absolutely! If we had to downgrade to a room in the main hotel, probably not because we were spoiled staying in the villa room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SeattleKirk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two separate weeks staying and playing golf at the Turtle Bay resort in the North Shore Area of Hawaii. The golf courses were great and the people were wonderful. The hotel has no bad rooms - we were in the cheapest room they had and we had wonderful views. There are no other big resort hotels in the area, so the feel is much more laid back and casual than other parts of Oahu. The local area is fun with a surfer crowd, and the scenery and beauty of the area are fantastic. The deal we got was pretty good in my opinion. For about $350 per night we got a beautiful room, and all the golf we could play on world-class courses for the two of us. Recommended for golfing couples.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing disappointing disappointing”
Reviews.Author: maureenb608
Reviews.Content: Approaching the hotel drive should have been the first tip. The abandonned security kiosk had a general look of dilapidation. Hotel lobby ok but reception not a bit friendly. The rooms were unbelievably awful. Ocean front room sparsely furnished with minimal accesories..plant pots without plants,motel type desk with 2 kitchen type chairs and peeling paint on the sliding door shutters. We were then fortunate enough to get an ocean front villa at twice the room price. That was a treat. A wedding tent was erected in front of our room at 7am the next morning. Don't worry we were awake because room service first knocked on our door at about the same time and continued to return to our room on 2 occasions about 30 mins apart to see if they could clean.Obviously they were not pleased that we were not ready to vacate the room at that time. Hmmm... could have been the kids running around the halls outside our door until after 11pm the night before. Maintenance problem room fridge leaked and though the front desk was notiifed, no repairs were done. Beach towel fixed the problem. If you have little or no expectations, this is the destination hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay, the place to play!”
Reviews.Author: parkerhouse94
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is a beautiful resort! There is so much to do! The rooms are beautiful, with amazing views. The only downside to TB is it is a drive from Waikiki, and there are not a lot of food choices nearby. If you don't want to drive you'll have to pay high dollar for the resort restaurant food. All in all, however, its an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “North Shore beauty”
Reviews.Author: KitAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a convention at the Turtle Bay. This is about the only place to stay on the north shore. We stayed in cottage #100 which is the cottage closest to the hotel. Can't say enough wonderful things about the location and cottage! It was such a treat to be right on the shore drinking coffee every morning. There is a beach area but in January the waves are pretty strong for children-pool is a better swim area. The real exciting thing is the surfers right next to the hotel. Since the hotel juts out into the surf, the surfers are very close in- that was so much fun to watch. The only disappointment with with the "daily fruit". I expected to arrive and see a fruit basket with plenty of variety, but instead we were given 2 pieces of fruit each day----really? This seemed a little petty----seems like a bowl of fruit should be a bowl. We didn't eat in the restaurants, instead opted to go eat at the "shrimp trucks" every lunch, then dinner was with the convention. Rent a car in Honolulu because this hotel is at the opposite end of Oahu, but a really nice scenic drive!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgal1966
Reviews.Content: My personal experience here was wonderful. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I gave them a four because we were all there for a wedding, and they managed to not have the bride and groom's reservation. It took a day for Turtle Bay to find their mistake and finally correct it, but it did cause stress to the bride. The beach was nice and calm in the lagoon, and people were surfing farther out. The food at the restaurants were excellent. I enjoyed my stay here. The price was a bit steep, but it is Hawaii and everything here is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: bevbp
Reviews.Content: First: The great parts-views and location was incredible! North Shore and Turtle Bay Resort will fullfill anyones wishes for great vacation locations! Snorkeling with a sea turtle, surfing with some fun- energetic instructors, pool side entertainment plus whales seen from your rooms were just a small part of the Turtle Bay experience. Rooms open up to the sound of waves, trees swaying and tiki torches lit throughout the grounds. Second: The not so good parts-although resort food was available and good- it was so expensive! Our room needed a paint job. Our carpet was wet from either airconditioning or runoff from bathroom. Driving to find food or places to visit was tiresome and sometimes dangerous. (bikes and scooters are to be watched carefully!)Our room was on 3rd floor- but could hear doors slamming thru out. We were pool side and no real noises from that. What could be better than hearing waves crashing and perfect ocean air breezing through a room? Lastly-concierge service and directions to ANY PLACE was perfect. A week was hardly enough time to use all the ammenities. We highly recommend this resort for any couple, family or group wanting a quiet, full service vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too far from airport.”
Reviews.Author: ArtofHair T
Reviews.Content: Book and pay extra for ocean front cottage. If you book and pay in advance you can get percentage off. Park your own car and save the $15 valet fee.

Reviews.Title: “Pounding surf, turquoise ocean away from hustle of Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: mcubed48
Reviews.Content: We chose the resort for our January 2012 vacation after seeing the beauty of it in "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". So the good news and the bad news. GOOD NEWS FIRST. The property sits on a point of land which offers vistas from almost any room. The public areas are open to the ocean as well. The surf is gorgeous, fun to watch the surfers and paddle boarders. The whales spouted and breached across the vista from our balcony. There are two premier golf courses on site that are a bargain after 3:00. It is far from the crowds and high rise buildings of Honolulu. The staff was friendly and responsive. Breakfast was included in our package and was varied and fresh each day. There are ample "adventure" opportunities: snorkeling, Segways, horseback rides, lessons in paddle boards, tennis, surfing, etc. The property, landscaping, pools, paths are well maintained. The bed linens were very nice. We received good recommendations for dinners in Haleiwa. We enjoyed our visit to Pearl Harbor. The memorials offer the visitor the opportunity to learn as much as they want about the history preceding and following the attacks. It is respectful, somber, and yet beautiful BAD NEWS. What makes it a great place to surf, makes it a rocky beach, not good for surf walking, although there are paved trails for running. Our last day we discovered a gorgeous beach 7 miles further north that was sandy, great for walking and body surfing without fear of disturbing, or being disturbed by surfers. The bathroom was in poor condition with chipped porcelain in the tub, warped doors and faucets that soaked the counter when you washed your hands. The furniture is peeling, scratched and in general poor condition. The food on site was expensive (not that this is a surprise at a resort) and only moderately good, not interesting or exciting. Although our experience at Pearl Harbor itself was good, getting there was difficult. We are from the Chicago area, so we are used to traffic and highways, but the area around Honolulu is a mass of criss crossing, interwoven roads, with scant signage to direct you to Pearl Harbor. We drove through Honolulu with all of its high end stores, masses of people, cars and buses, and crowded beaches and were grateful that we were not staying there. This was our 4th trip to the Hawaiian islands, our first to Oahu. We chose right for our likes and needs by staying away from the city. We loved the surf, the look and sound of it. We were on the 5th floor, so whale watching from our balcony was excellent. The golf was good. We enjoyed checking out the surf beaches along the "pipeline" and the less frantic feel of the north shore. We came home refreshed and relaxed, not bad for 7 days away from snow and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on the north shore of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: LovemyAcura
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January, 2010 in a two bedroom suite on the top floor (6th) and loved it. It was at the end of a very busy two week land/cruise and we enjoyed the peace and serenity of the resort and its location. The views and the sound of the surf were incredible. We used room service and the food was warm, delivered promptly, and good service with a smile. We had them set up using the table in the living room area between the two bedrooms right in front of the sliding doors. We opened the doors, enjoying the sound and sights of the resort. Beautiful! The bathroom is in need of upgrading. The days of the tub shower combination are over and should be rennovated. The other odd things is that included in the cost of the daily resort fee, you are supposed to receive a newspaper. However we never found one in front of our door - we had to go down to the table near the elevators to get one. Odd. The rooms are nice and large with a tv in each bedroom and one in the living room area also. The rooms do need to be renovated to keep up with the times - the bathroom as previously commented on the kitchen with the tiny mini refrigerator. Ask for a room on the top floor with an ocean view. We overlooked the waves breaking on the rocks - very few people in the scenic views - nature at its finest. There was one problem with noise from a DJ performing for a local convention but the noise ended at 9 pm and was handled appropirately by the front desk. We highly recommend this resort. Wonderful place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the island!”
Reviews.Author: PelicanSunset
Reviews.Content: The rooms are perfectly fine. The oceanfront deluxe is comforable and clean with a large balcony. We could hear and see the surf up close. The protected beach is great - chairs, towels and snorkiling gear are provided free (with resort fee). Buffet breakfast on the outside deck is absolutely the best way to start a vacation day! Nothing to complain about. The staff was helpful and friendly. This was our second visit and we will be returning again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent location, had a really nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: aussieallisons6
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Turtle Bay with high expectations having just left a great place in Maui. A bit disappointed with our rooms as we had expected some kitchen facilities but apart from a small fridge we had nothing. This was not the resort's fault, however, as our travel agent had booked two ocean view rooms for us. The rooms were very clean, I guess a little worn here and there but unless you are staying in a brand new complex you are always going to get a little wear and tear. This resort is in a great location as the north shore is absolutely magnificent. The facilities were terrific - pool was a little cold. All in all we had a nice time - I would recommend anyone visiting the north shore to eat at the shrimp shacks along the road - scrumptious and better than forking out hundreds to eat at the resort restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations and beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: trvwll
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cleanest hotels that I've stayed at. Everyone there is very friendly and willing to help with any needs that you have. The views are amazing and the onsite amenities are great and there are many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous stay at the beach cottage, dusty musty smell needs major refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: kauailover11
Reviews.Content: I must say I am still traumatized from the stay at this property back in September 2011. Checked out after one night since the room was absolutely dreadful. The photos on their website is misleading, I expected a clean room with modern fixtures with a great view of the ocean the reality was a very musty dusty room stuck in the 70s, resembled a cheap motel room with flower motif curtains, stained sofas chipped furniture, torn wallpapers, spider in the bathroom, bird poop stuck on the handle of the slide doors of the balcony, the list goes on. Even bought a Febreze at a local Safeway to alleviate the odour but to no avail. The bed sheets were somehow damp so I placed some towels on the sheets instead. Was originally booked for three nights but my husband insisted we had to check out from this place and book somewhere else in Waikiki, and usually I am the picky type. Fast forward this story, since we got NO sleep due to itchiness from the beds, probably bugs,we drove up to the front desk to ask for a refund at 5am and cancel our remaining stay. The girl at the desk was delightful, obviously handled this before and secured a refund, although we did pay for this one night. Was very glad next day to leave the property to a clean hotel in Waikiki. The only pro at Turtle bay was that we heard the sound of crushing waves and saw some turtles but these don't compensate for the price for the room and it's quality, honestly there are plenty of other options on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTime686
Reviews.Content: The resort property is beautiful - right on the ocean, where we could see the big surfing waves, but also with a protected beach area which was great for swimming and had great snorkelling - we saw a lot of beautiful coloured fish by the coral. The kids loved the pool area, and preferred it to the beach. We had a good time horseback riding, making leis, and seeing sea turtles in the ocean (although you can't snorkel at that bay - there is too much sand mixed with the water). We also ate North 21 degrees, and it was fabulous! The food at Leonardo's was average. The room, however, was spacious but disappointing. It clearly needs updating, especially the bathrooms. We even had mould on the tiles by the bathtub and chipped soap dishes. When we were leaving, there was work being done in the lobby. We were told there are new owners and they are going to do some upgrades, so I hope that extends to the rooms! We stayed at Waikiki for half of our trip, and here for half. Waikiki is fun - all hustle and bustle and close to everything, but very touristy, and Turtle Bay is more relaxed, natural and calm. I would go again, and split the stay between both locations again to get the best of both worlds in Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: L0veT0Travel168
Reviews.Content: The view is amazing . We had no choice as it was the only resort in the area. If not, would not stay as it is not worth the $. The rooms were outdated, bathroom was falling apart...I thought that after 3 years after my initial stay that would have at least updated it....-NOPE.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Counts”
Reviews.Author: OldVagabond
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel directly to make a reservation on the same day we would be going there. I was quoted a price which was supposedly their special rate for local people for both a Deluxe Oceanfront King room and a Junior Suite. I was quoted prices without tax and resort fees and with them as well. I asked about the oceanfront to see if it had a direct ocean view. I was told it had stunning ocean views and looked directly out to the ocean. Upon arrival, I was given a different price which was more than $100 more for the night. I was told that the price I was quoted didn't include taxes and fees and besides they would have sent me an email confirmation as well. I explained that we left home soon after making the reservation and I had not seen a confirmation. However, they did have my reservation. I had the piece of paper with me that I had written the prices on. I noted that the price they were now giving me was the Junior Suite price. The hotel clerk went to speak to the Manager and came back to say that the price she had given me was correct. I said that we had come out from Kailua expecting to be paying a certain price to celebrate a special occasion, and I didn't think that, as the customer and a local person, I was not being treated very well. She then grabbed her calculator and after working some numbers said, "Well, this is the best rate I can give you". That rate was still a little over $30 more than I had been quoted. I said that I would take it. She then started taking my information and asked for my email address and that is when it occurred to me that the person I had spoken to on the phone had never asked for my email address so therefore could not have sent me a confirmation. I pointed this out and also relayed the conversation about the oceanfront room. I was basically not spoken to again or given any directions on getting to the room but handed a key. Upon arrival in the room, I see that we have been given a room as far away from the ocean as possible at the very end of the hall looking through the trees to the bay. I immediately called down to the manager and explained that so far this had not been a very good experience. To his credit, he said let me see what I can do and call you back. He called back after a few minutes and said that he had an oceanfront room for us on the top floor and would be sending a bellboy up right away to take us there to see if it would be okay. About 15 minutes later the bellboy showed up and took me and our bags upstairs. The room did look right out to the ocean so I accepted it. The bed was very comfortable; there were 2 sinks; and it was oceanfront and had a lanai. Those were the deluxe features of the room. The rooms are very plain hotel rooms otherwise. My suggestion if you are going to make a reservation at this hotel, make sure you have something in writing in your hand prior to going. Make comprehensive notes and post reviews. Maybe then Customer Service will become important to them again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Trip!”
Reviews.Author: ackbyrd
Reviews.Content: My sister and I decided to stay a few nights here after a family vacation to Hawaii. We are not big resort types, but this was wonderful. The way the resort sits, there is a pool side and a beach side-so it does divide up the numbers of guests you sit with. There had been a gilch with our reservation and were upgraded. I can now see the big differences in the rooms. We were on the 4th floor and had a beach side view. We would have been very disappointed if we had stayed on the second floor-yes ocean view but seriously obstructed by the roof. The rooms are large and comfortable. We had a late night flight and we given a hospitality room for an hour to shower before our flight-it was on the second floor-so we did get to compare. We asked the staff many questions and ended up getting a lot of attention-be nice and smile and people will go the extra mile for you! The resort is older and therefore needing and getting renovations-which is ongoing. I think the real disappointment is that people are expecting the Ritz Carlton though not paying RC prices. This is a great resort for the rates. If you want the Four Seasons experience-go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great family holiday spot”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at Tutle Bay. The children loved the pools, my husband enjoyed the world class golf courses and I enjoyed the relaxed pace and breathtaking views. Yes the resort looks a little tired but we were prepared for that from the reviews on Trip Adviser and did not let it spoil our time here. The restaurant on the golf course was terrific. Highly recommended for families, will try a villa next time.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Heaven”
Reviews.Author: aproch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 10 day for our honeymoon in August. We booked our package through Costco and it also included the breakfast buffet every day of our stay. We checked in and instantly knew that we had picked the right hotel to stay at. The staff was all extremely friendly and helpful. Within 10 minutes of arriving in our rooms, a bottle of champagne was sent to our room. We had a standard ocean view room and had no complaints. There was nothing like being able to open the door and see/hear the ocean. The bathroom had 2 separate sinks which was really nice when my husband and I were both getting ready. The TV had basic channels but we didn't go to Hawaii to watch TV. The wifi was iffy in our room but again we didn't care too much considering we were in Hawaii. Our first night there we ended up falling asleep and waking up around 8:30. We didn't realize that most the restaurants closed early so keep that in mind if you eat dinner late. We ate at most the restaurants and they were all good. Most the meals were pretty expensive but we expected that most everything would be expensive while we were there. We ate at Leoardo's twice - once we ordered a pizza and brought it to our room and another time we ate there. Both times it was good. We had the Palm Terrace breakfast buffet every morning since it was included in our package. The breakfast was really good and I would suggest trying to get a package with this included since it help cut down the cost of food. The waffles and omelets were our favorite! Most nights we would go to the Hang Ten bar for happy hour and ate dinner there one night. The bartenders were always really friendly and the views were unbelievable. We ate at Lei Lei's twice which is over at the golf course. They have really good steak and it was reasonably priced we thought. We also got the chocolate chip cookie and ice cream dessert which was delicious! We also ate at the restaurant right across from the check in desks and there was a musician there. It was a nice place to hang out and we both got chicken fingers, they were good but keep in mind they were around $12 each. The beach around the area is amazing. Several days we got our early to get the beach chairs and umbrellas that they offer for guests to use. Some days they did all get snagged pretty early but we were fine laying in the sand. We really liked the towel service, it was nice to not have to worry about lugging wet, sandy towels back and forth from the room. We also went horse back riding twice through Turtle Bay. The first time was just the standard 45 minute ride and it was beautiful. It goes to the biggest banyon tree that was in Lost and Pirates of the Caribbean. They also take you to a secluded beach that was also in Lost. The second time we went was the longer sunset ride. It went on the same trail but was a little longer. Riding back along the beach at sunset was the most amazing views we've ever seen. Our guide was very friendly and she had a lot of knowledge about the area. My husband's horse got a little crazy when we were back near the stables and ended up galloping towards his stable. My husband (who's only ridden a horse once before) was a little startled but we all ended up having a good laugh since he was okay. Our honeymoon at Turtle Bay was nothing short of perfect. Before we even left we were planning our next trip back and would highly recommend staying there. We went to Waikiki for a cocktail cruise and went through a couple hotels there. Even though Turtle Bay was full when we went, it never seem overly crowded anywhere and we loved being away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a remote place”
Reviews.Author: Noxgear
Reviews.Content: The scenery from Turtle Bay Resort is beautiful, but the reality is that it is difficult to utilize. Although they have a nice little protected bay for swimming and snorkeling, it just isn't like swimming in the ocean. The hotel pool and water slide are a lot of fun, but we were surprised how cold the water was in the main pool. Maybe they had just refilled the pool or something. This seems to be one of the only hotels on the north shore of Oahu. Apparently all other major hotel chains have decided that there just isn't enough there to attract the tourists. The big surfing areas don't have much sand or places to relax. Waimea Bay has a great sand beach, but there are no hotels within 5 miles. Rooms are very large and comfortable and we scored a nice connecting suite for the two rooms we booked. The hotel also provided us with a hospitality suite at 4 pm after we had checked out so we could clean up before we headed to the airport. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. They do offer horseback riding and a kayaking trip to Kewala bay to see the sea turtles. We went there but realized that the bay is no good for snorkeling due to the water clarity close to shore and the fact that there is a lot of coral you can bump into. Probably the only way to do Kewala bay is by kayak!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: littleone3009
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Turtle Bay Ocean Villa #108, which was part of the Turtle Bay Resort, but independently owned. There were 7 of us staying there, and there was plenty of room for us all. Villa was very clean when we arrived, kitchen is fully stocked with cookware and dishes. Our dishwasher did not work, we e-mailed management and they offered to send a repairman out. We declined as we didn't want to wait around in the villa all day. The TV did go down for a couple days, but we were in Hawaii so no big deal! There is a private pool for the villas, as you are not allowed to use the main resort pool. Also, the beach was steps away, you are on a little cove which protects you from most of the waves. Several people snorkeling saw sea turtles right offshore! The resort offers surfing lessons as well. Went to a couple of the restaurants at Turtle Bay, they are rather expensive but food was good. There is a grocery store about 10 minutes away if you would rather prepare your own food. There is alcohol served on the resort, and sold in the gift shop, but you won't be able to buy it in every grocery store in the area as it's a dry county. All in all, it was a very nice resort, biggest issue we found was that it's very far away from the main tourist attractions, so found ourselves doing a lot of driving (rush hour seems to start at about 3 in the afternoon!).

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay - Love at first sight.”
Reviews.Author: ga2295
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Turtle Bay Resort for a week over the 2012 New Year Holiday, arriving on December 27, 2011 and departing on January 4, 2012. We came for a wedding of friends at Turtle Bay Resort, but turned it into a vacation as well. The wedding was the best we have ever been to, and was coordinated by the resort. Outstanding outdoor and indoor venues! The food and decorations were amazing. This was our first trip to Hawaii, but will not be the last. We loved the North Shore and all it has to offer. We never even made it to Waikiki (which was way overcrowded this time of year), but felt like we did not miss a thing. The surf was absolutely mesmerizing, and the trip would have been worth it if all we had done was sit on the veranda and watch the waves. The food at Turtle Bay was very good for the most part, with a wide variety of places to eat. We enjoyed room service several times, and the service and food was excellent. The resort staff was very friendly and courteous, and we felt like they bent over backwards to accommodate our needs. The atmosphere was totally relaxing. I could go on and on about Turtle Bay Resort, but would encourage you to enjoy it for yourself. This was the best vacation we have ever had, and will return to Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “"Not what I expected"”
Reviews.Author: plleij
Reviews.Content: After seeing the movie all i wanted to do was stay at the resort. How disappointing now that we are here. The hotel needs upgrading, the paint is peeling off the shutters and the tiles in the bathroom & the chairs have bleach stains on them. Location is fantastic but the hotel itself is not worth the $$$$$$

Reviews.Title: “Not quite living up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: dkenglish7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in early November 2011, on a package that included breakfast and one night free. Based on descriptions of the room types, we opted for an upgrade to a "Pikaki Junior Suite." This is an end room on the main building which is more spacious - but as far as I can tell it otherwise differs not at all from the other main building rooms. When we checked in, the bell staff were warm and accomodating, and they remained so throughout. But there was a line to check in (only one person on the desk at peak times) and the aloha we've experienced at other Hawaiian resorts was nowhere in evidence. Our suite had no obvious defects, but the bathroom was more reminiscent of a motel on the interstate than a resort. There was much evidence of deferred maintenance, from the scars on the bathroom tile where fixtures had been removed, to the rattling ventilation system. The public hot tubs were quite deteriorated, with many loose or absent tiles. The decay was everywhere evident, but the setting was fantastic. The restaurant staff were friendly, but the breakfast buffet was no different than any other Hawaiian resort. Evening service was quite erratic and the food nothing special - we had a much better meal at the Kahuku Grill nearby. Don't pay anything close to full price until the work gets done!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: slatsyrc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Dec. 2011 over Christmas for 3 nights. I had booked over the phone since I could not find availability online at a rate of $409/night, however, when I arrived, the front desk said that the rate was not right and lowered it to $299/night...that was a pleasant surprise. The room was decent in the South wing overlooking the pool area and with an ocean view. The room could use an update as it kind of smelled damp and the bathroom was not very nice, but having 2 sinks was nice. The room was very quiet as we did not hear alot of noise from our neighbors. We had the buffet Christmas dinner at Leonardo's, and at $50/head it was not worth it. The food was mediocre, which caused us not to eat at any of the other restaurants during our stay and the hostess was very rude. Parking is somewhat inconvenient as it gets full quickly and you have to park far away. The resort beach was nice, free snorkeling rental for an hour was nice as well. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel, although compared to other resorts I have stayed at, it is not as updated or nice, but for the price in Hawaii it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$ - Hotel needs major renovation”
Reviews.Author: jillian646
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised by the reviews of this hotel. Upon checking in, we were immediately dissatisfied with the service and the condition of the resort. We paid extra to have the deluxe oceanfront room...and I'm still wondering what was "deluxe" about room. Perhaps the bed, because it was comfortable, but I'm pretty sure nothing else has been touched in the room since 1975. The only reason why I give it 2 stars is because of the location. The North Shore is truly a special place in Hawaii. I recommend staying at one of the B&Bs in the area (we LOVED Santas by the Sea). I'd rather support local/small business than give my money to Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice Of Heaven...but with a couple of faults”
Reviews.Author: Hhunterr
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here during Christmas. Overall it's a great location, and a great hotel. I would pick Turtle Bay and the North Shore over any other place on Oahu. I'll comment on a lot of things both good and a little bad. First the hotel itself is world class. It's the only resort on the North Shore and the locals want it to stay that way. To understand it all you have to do is drive into Honolulu/Wakkiki/Diamond head for a day trip. The North Shore is called the country by most folks on Oahu. It's where everyone goes to get a way. Since it was the holidays when we were there, it is a CROWDED area. But because it has no competition it can command a premium price. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very professional and friendly. The room are very nice. We were on the 3rd floor of the west wing and had a great ocean view with a full balcony. I think the only really bad rooms were the 2 floors below us because the ball room part of the hotel would interfere with the view. Some of the balconies only were partial, meaning it would be very difficult for 2 people to sit on them. Other than that, all the view I think would be fabulous. Our room had a two sinks (which is always a nice touch in a hotel) large bathroom area, mini fridge. I would have like to have had a microwave in it. It also had a nice flat screen but you couldn't adjust the picture size on it. The beds were great also. The only real fault with the room was the air conditioner. It didn't cool the room very well. But I call house keeping and they brought a fan up which made all the difference. House keeping does a great job there! We attended a church service being held at the hotel on Christmas eve and it was great non denominational service. The pastor does a Sunday service at the hotel also. I learned that Turtle Bay donates a very large breakfast (for over a 1000 people) for the area homeless on Christmas as well as other things through out the year. It's nice to have resort do that. There are 7 restaurants at the resort. All of them are very expensive and the selection is minimal. I was really disappointed that they did not have a wider variety on their menus. The best was the morning buffet. The egg chef was great!! She really can make an omelet. They also have a wide variety of fresh fruits, breads, etc, etc... The rest of the time it was a choice of a cheeseburger (lowest cost I think was about $16), some seafood or beef dish. I choose not to eat at the Italian restaurant because that's just wrong in Hawaii. I do have to say that Ola had some of the best Poke I had on the island. And one of the best views. The Hang ten Bar is by the pool. It has live entertainment most nights but they stop serving food at 7pm. There are a variety of things you can do at the resort but all are costly. I would definitely recommend that you take a surf lesson. It's taught by Hans Hedemann's Surf School which is located right at the resort. The folks that run it are GREAT!! My 16 year old took a 2 lesson and was up riding waves within the first hour. The instructor that helped him was from Australian and did a great job. My son spend the rest of the trip down there hanging out and riding waves. Overall, it's a great resort but you pay for what you get. There is a lot to see on the North Shore. You must get a car to see it. Good job Turtle Bay with your part of the experience! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO THE SURFER BAR @ TURTLE BAY”
Reviews.Author: benson j
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort Hotel. Had an amazing time; the property is great. DO NOT GO TO THE SURFER BAR IN THE HOTEL. Not only is the place awful but the bartenders are jerks and the manager is incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Nice Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F
Reviews.Content: I booked our family at Turtle Bay Resort to be away from the bustle of Honolulu and explore the famed North Shore. After reading a few negative reviews on TripAdvisor and seeing weather forecasts calling for rain everyday, I was very concerned. However, my fears were misplaced. The resort is beautiful, on a large, carefully tended property right on the coast. The pool area, while not as huge or modern as some resorts, was not over crowded, offered poolside drink and food service, and an unbeatable beachside location with tremendous surf and many people surfing each day... just mezmerizingly beautiful. We stayed in the beachside cottages which were roomy, nicely decorated and in a secluded beachside locale, easy walking distance by garden path to the pool and main hotel restaurants and with lots of parking nearby. The bathroom was beautiful with glass shower stall, huge separate soaker tub and lots clean linens, and daily-supplied soaps and creams. The water pressure was strong, the rooms were clean and smelled nice, but yes there are some minor details like trim that is warped from water damage at the shower stall. We had two minifridges and a sink area in our king size rooom, great for keeping drinks and supplies and preparing snacks and simple breakfasts. We were provided by the resort with fresh fruit every day. Turtle Bay staff (especially Judith our lovely housekeeper,all the cottage concierge staff and Laura in the hotel store) were all very kind, friendly and helpful. The on-site restaurants were good, with excellent service staff, but pricey. We tended to eat off resort in Hale-iwa, very close by and a fun town to visit. There are many restaurants there with a good variety of food from American, to Mexican and Thai. We also had takeout breakfast from Ted's Bakery just down the road that the kids loved. The resort spa, and seaside massage cottage for two (what at treat listening to the pounding surf!), was great. Regarding the weather, yes, it rains a little everyday: a sunshower with almost guaranteed rainbow that passes gently over like a blessing in this little bit of paradise! No wonder the hills and valleys are so lush and verdant. The weather was perfect, sunny and hot most of the time, cooling in the evening enough to wear a light jacket or pashmina. I loved this part of Hawaii, the laid back tempo, the local surf scene and the many things to do and see, and this resort in the center of it, was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time. service was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: wextraveler
Reviews.Content: we visited turtle bay resort for 5 nights at the very end of december 2011. frankly, i was apprehensive about the visit because of the wide ranging reviews on tripadvisor, but our visit definitely exceeded my expectations. my husband and i stayed in beachfront cottage 114. it was lovely - spacious, comfortable, and very clean. our adult kids stayed in two rooms in the hotel - we never saw their rooms. it sounded like they were adequate but not topnotch. we had lots of amenities in the cottage that our kids did not get in the hotel: daily fruit, special concierge, chocolates at turndown service. everyone we encountered at turtle bay provided exceptional service. always friendly, always with a smile, always interested in us. from the moment we arrived at check-in, we were given first rate service. we were greeted warmly, and when it appeared that one set of kids had a better view than the other, the second room was changed to a better view. i contacted the main hotel concierge by email shortly after we made our reservations to arrange a special new years eve dinner for our family. we have found most hotel celebrations overpriced. at the beginning, the main concierge worked with me and one of the chefs but i was put in touch with brian, the ho'okipia ( hope i have that right, he is a cottage concierge) who put me in touch with julia regner, assistant restaurants manager, because we had very specific requests. both brian and especially julia went out of their way to fulfill our desire for this dinner. and it was incredible! we had a table set up on our cottage patio, decorated with orchids and candles. the food was fabulous. we had a server, rolando, dedicated to our dinner and he did a great job getting the food from the hotel kitchen to our cottage while it was still hot, and serving us. my family was so happy - it was one of the best new years eves we have ever shared! julia came by at the end to make sure everything had gone well and to introduce herself. the cottage concierges also provide great service. we had a problem with our transportation from honolulu airport to the hotel which was not at all the fault of the hotel or the teansport company. i contacted brian right away, and he sprang into action, reaching out to the various parties and resolving the problems expeditiously. he called our room each day to see if there was anything we needed, and reconfirmed our transportation back to honolulu so there would be no problems on our return. while at turtle bay we took the shaka sea kayaking tour, with ryan and jenny, which was a lot of fun. another day we went standup paddleboarding offsite and loved it. we got massages at the spa. they were average. we used island transporter company to get to and from the hotel and airport, and they were great. we also used them to go into honolulu one night foe dinner, which made tge evening really nice for us not having to worry about directions or driving unfamiliar roads late at night. all in all we met the friendliest, warmest, and finest people. they made a wonderful trip even better. we appreciated it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Just about achieves four stars”
Reviews.Author: david h
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week with four grown up children and we thought the staff were generally very good,... however pool bar staff and those in the restaurant were less inclined to help. food was good and decent value during the day but evenings were particularly expensive for average food. breakfast buffet was good but value not the best when compared to diners in local towns which offered very good value and very good food. facilities were good but rental for items such as tennis rackets ($16 for two for one hour !!!) and snorkels $10 for an hour show that there is intent to rip off where possible (you could buy a snorkel mask for less 5 miles down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay on our last day in Hawaii (January 2, 2011). Prior to a final day on Oahu, we were at Kauai which we absolutely loved. The first disappointment really has nothing to do with Turtle Bay, but with the traffic in just getting to the place. During the surf season, the single road along the North Coast CRAWLS.....so the 45 minutes we thought would take to get there turned into almost 2 hours. Once we arrived we we found the lobby (compared to the 4 other places we stayed at) to be very "corporate" and vanilla. The place was packed so we tried to make dinner reservations right away with the concierge who really could not care less about helping us. We wanted to go the the restaurant on the beach, but she told us they were not answering their phone (huh? -- it is a restaurant owned by Turtle Bay..) so we made reservations at the restaurant on the golf course which seemed like a bad dining hall with green carpet. Then we went out to have a drink at the bar and our waitress got in a big argument with the bartender about turning down the music and left our table to get a manager to handle their dispute. The only reason why I am giving this a 3 star review is because the beach is absolutely beautiful -- once you get away from the bland resort structure and some of the grumpy service staff, the outside grounds are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Callaker
Reviews.Content: For our second anniversary in November, my husband and I returned to beautiful Turtle Bay Resort. We were married here in 2009. We again stayed in one of their beach cottages. This one was further from the resort and literally steps from the ocean. Perfect! The beach cottages are definitely worth the extra money. There was some construction happening on the front desk area but it didn't disrupt anything. I'm excited to see the changes when we return this year. Staff all over the resort were friendly and super accommodating. I requested a replica of our wedding cake to be served at our dinner at Twenty One Degrees and it was exactly what I wanted. Thank you!! The food at the resort is expensive and not worth what you pay with the exception of Twenty One Degrees. If you're looking for a romantic, great tasting meal and don't mind spending money this is the place to go. Stay away from Leonardo's. It is billed as a new restaurant at Turtle Bay. The only differences from the previous restaurant there are a few italian flags and the menu. Worst pizza and calamari we've ever had. As far as the rest of our meals, we bought a toaster at Walmart and had bagels and fruit every morning. The best and cheapest food is off the resort but not too far of a drive. North of the resort are shrimp trucks, Tita's Grill and Kahuku Grill (both our favorites!!!!) and south of the resort of course is Ted's Bakery (best breakfast ever and don't leave without a piece of chocolate haupia pie!) We spent our days snorkelling, relaxing on the beach, and hiking around the resort. The weather was a bit windy but beautiful!! Make sure to stop in Haleiwa town for shopping and restaurants. The spa staff was amazing as well. We booked a couples oceanfront massage and pineapple pedicures. So relaxing!!! I can't wait to return this year!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: genwren
Reviews.Content: We brought our adult aged kids and teen to Turtle Bay for Christmas. We stayed in a beautiful beachfront villa that had two master suites, a room with two queens, and a 4th with a queen. It was perfect for our family and we were ground level so easily accessible to beach and resort. The grocery store was great and nearby and the kitchen was gourmet and well stocked. My only complaint about this resort was the lack of beach chairs for guests. Truly - $2000.00 a night at a beach resort and no chairs unless you tipped the beach staff. Even then the chairs are cheap, flimsy, and uncomfortable. The lame excuses for why they didn't have any just didn't fly. Overall, the resort is amazingly beautiful, laid back, and close to the best surfing on the island. Despite the chair situation, I still give it an excellent as my family all agreed it was our best vacation together ever.

Reviews.Title: “Location great...service and quality poor1”
Reviews.Author: kelly j
Reviews.Content: The location is spectacular but the service is very hit or miss. We booked and paid for our trip in May and yet when we showed up they said they did not have our cottage available. The checkin person just looked at us and acted like she did not care and had no plan...then suddenly she had a cottage available to us...it was infested with ants. The employees on average really did not seem interested in helping us except the pool bar wait staff...of course it costs $100 to feed two kids and two adults mediocre chicken fingers and fries!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lcd199
Reviews.Content: This is my first review ever. We stayed for ten days in two bungalows. First, I thought if you are paying Chrstimas prices you might get two bungalows near each other, not in our case. Second, our air conditioner started dripping the first day. We called for service they came did not fix it. We put the ice bucket under it and towels and called again. The housekeeper even called everyday. By the look of the wall and floor this has been going on a long time. Never offered to move us, no contact from management or anyone to see if it was fixed. The maintenace man just kept telling us he would find someone to fix it. Well in ten days it just got worse. Needless to say I could not wait to come home and get some sleep. All I can say is do not stay in bungalow 142. The grounds are nice and the staff. The pool is freezing, which is a shame because it is beautiful. The spa was wonderful and did save my trip. Leonardo's we did not care for. We ate three days staright at Lei Lei's. Horseback riding was also fun. My son and daughter surfed quite a bit. Thank goodness we had a car and friends we went and visited. Next time we will rent a house. For the prices and condition of this resort it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays w/in a week - two different experiences: part 1”
Reviews.Author: LAGinagirl
Reviews.Content: I had business in Honolulu the first week of Dec, so my husband and I decided to book-end the week with two weekends at Turtle Bay. I had been to the property for lunch a year ago and thought it would be the perfect place to unwind before my conference and afterwards. I booked both weekends online simultaneously. The first weekend was for Fri-Sun, the second an extra day for the following Th-Sun. These weekends' experiences were SO different that I'm actually going to write two different reviews. This review is for weekend #1. Of course, it goes w/o saying that the location is specatular. The service was adequate. Our room was a HUGE disappointment. I'd reserved an ocean front deluxe king. We were given a room on the 2nd floor which directly overlooked the (ugly) roof of the Palm Terrace restaurant. We also had a view of the parking lot towards our right. Of course, the view beyond both the rooftop and parking lot was spectacular. It was an oceanVIEW room but certainly NOT ocean FRONT. The room itself was also a disappointment. As other reviewers have also commented, the room's decor did not match that of the photo on the hotel website and the bathroom was severely outdated. Paint was chipping everywhere. There was a coffee set up, however it wasn't adequate for two people. The amenities (ie soap et al) were just ok. Nothing extra offered as might be expected at a "Preferred Hotels and Resorts". No robes, cream for the coffee. Aside from the location, I've stayed in better maintained and equipped rooms of mid-range pricing (think Doubletree, BestWestern). The pool was FREEZING cold. Aside from a few brave souls, it was empty during our entire stay and pretty much worthless. We did make use of the jacuzzi which overlooks the bay. We left on Sunday morning for Waikiki. I'd booked an upgraded room (the Pikane Suite) for our second weekend there, so we just bit the bullet during our first weekend and looked forward to a better experience on our return. I will post a review of our second weekend's experience under 'part 2'.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: JSN
Reviews.Content: I was really scared of this place based on the reviews but it's the only game in town, so we drove up after two nights in Waikiki. I had booked a deluxe ocean view for about $250 a night; I generally don't pay that much. It's a tremendously beautiful site, just awesome. Front desk seemed genuinely interested in getting us a quiet room for my light-sleeper husband. Our room was spectacular, waves were crashing, we slept with the doors open to the lanai. Room was spacious, two vanities, complete coffee setup, well decorated and clean. Management sent up a bottle of champagne for our anniversary celebration, a really delightful gesture. Other than the drunks out on the lawn one night, it was great. I have no idea where the terrible reviews have come from. Huge remodel going on in lobby but I don't sit around in lobbies so didn't care. Dinner at Leonardo's was fine, great service and OK food. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Location - Location! The Perfect Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: des104joy
Reviews.Content: I love this resort. The location is awesome if you want to experience the North Shore of Oahu. This is one of the most scenic places on earth. I love the two bays that book-end this property. The bay to the west is great for learning how to surf and the bay to the east is great for laying on the beach and swimming. The staff here are very friendly and helpful. The golf course is awesome - especially the twilight rate. Each room has an ocean view. This is much nicer than staying down in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “BEYOND DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: DKM581
Reviews.Content: OK- this is my first time ever writing a review on one of these things. But my husband and I were so disappointed with Turtle Bay Resort, we felt we should tell you all about it. It was our honeymoon. Let me start by saying that this was a really big trip for us. Our schedules don't allow us to take trips very often, so I really wanted everything to be super nice. We had just been to Maui and had a great 4 days there. We then came to Turtle Bay expecting it to blow our socks off (we had seen the movie Forgetting Sarah Marshall and was expecting something like what that movie portrays), but it was quite the opposite. The room was almost bare looking. Lots of random empty space. It felt like a dorm. The bathroom had horrible fluorescent lighting- looked like it hadn't been updated since the 70's. The paint was chipping everywhere and the drawers smelled like mildew. There were also broken-esque old lamp shades. For the money- It was AWFUL. The staff was OK. Kind of nonchalant and laid back. Not really into catering to you at all. Not that we needed much of that, but it was so the total opposite of what we had experienced in Maui. The pool is FREEZING and is situated on the side of the resort where it is VERY windy. You can't even sit there and relax. It might be different in the summer months but in DEC. it was less than stellar. Also the lounge chairs are uncomfortable and old. They really should get nicer ones. The food at the hotel as a whole was mediocre at best and way overpriced for what it was. We all know hotel food is expensive- but this was just not good food. We really like the North Shore but next time we come to Oahu we will stay in Waikiki and make a couple day trips up here. We will not be staying at Turtle Bay ever again. Total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewing Surfer, the bar!”
Reviews.Author: Funandsun20
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Oahu from the lovely state of Florida to visit my bestfriend that lives on the island. One day we found ourselves on the north shore and stumbled upon turtle bay resort so we decied to check the place out . I had recently heard about the bar opening threw a mainland friend of mine that travels to north shore several times a year. It was noon when we were there so it wasn't open but we noticed that the green band was playing the following Saturday so we decied to buy tickets and go. And I can say it was honesty the best choice I made while I was on the island . We had a blast listening to the green we danced the night away met amazing people and made great new friends. The staff was so welcoming they kept the drinks flowing no matter what! The atmosphere was Amazing!!! Covers of surfer magazine on the walls including a beautiful picture of the late Andy irons . Overall surfer, the bar is a great place to come dance , listen to music, meet amazing people and spend a chill night on the beautiful north shore and learn some culture as well. It's the place I look most forward to going when I move to Oahu in April ;)

Reviews.Title: “We Love Turtle Bay!”
Reviews.Author: timnbea
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay has become my favorite place in the world. This resort is sparkling clean and completely breathtaking. The service is excellent and the food is delicious. I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone interested in a heavenly experience.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort- amazing”
Reviews.Author: Fiji2010USA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Turtle Bay during our visit to the North Shore and the resort was amazing. Everything you can think of is available there. They have a great beach and a couple pools. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The view is amazing there. We stayed there on December 8th, right when the Pipemaster competition started and the waives were so wonderful. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed at first, but it grew on us.”
Reviews.Author: Duncveggies
Reviews.Content: After a week in a rental house in Kailua with our family, my husband and I spent 3 nights on our own at Turtle Bay. I have to say, at first we were a little disappointed. Based on the reputation of the resort and the price for a night's stay, we were expecting extreme, complete, unadulterated luxury. Like other reviewers have said, our Pikake Suite was very spacious but seemed a little dated. Before we arrived I had read somewhere that the resort was built in the 1970s and that it was remodeled in 2003. But, our room definitely felt older than 2003. The good: our view of the ocean, the breakfast at Palm Terrace, my massage in the spa, walking trail on the grounds, kindness of each and every staff member we encountered. The bad: the floor plan on the website showed the Pikake Suites with patios, but ours didn't have one. The food prices were extremely high in the resort restaurants. Also, we weren't expecting so darn much wind. The ugly: ants in our bathroom (but we had this problem at our rental house in Kailua as well) and dinner at Leonardo's.
