We placed our order, and our waitress came back about 10 minutes later....about the time we were expecting our food to arrive...to tell me they were out of my choice for dinner. Then, when we did get our food, we didn't get any bread. I saw a table nearby get a basket full of bread, so I asked if we could have some. Our waitress told us that the restaurant was "out of bread" and she had only given the other table some because they had kids and had asked her to scrounge up any bread she could find for them. Really??!! However, after 2 days here, my husband said our accommodations at Turtle Bay were growing on him.

Reviews.Title: “A very romantic weekend at the Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: marieglodt
Reviews.Content: Aloha from Maui, It is a tradition every December to take a romantic getaway before the holidays hit full swing. Being a resident of Hawaii and a travel agent I like to visit a different island at least twice a year. This year we picked the North Shore of Oahu and stayed at the Turtle Bay. The perfect fit for this hotel is someone who doesn't mind a little rain (it normally rains here every day at least for a little while), who likes to travel off the beaten path and try local food and less touristy places. During the winter time they hold surf contests at Sunset beach when the waves are up. The weekend we stayed there was a big contest which can delay traffic a bit. Granted this resort is not for someone looking for night life, lots of shopping and shows nearby. If this is what you are looking for Waikiki on Oahu is a much better fit for you! This deluxe property has horseback riding, helicopter tours and lots of great places nearby to eat the best shrimp ever! Make sure and try lunch or dinner at Ola's right at the Turtle Bay Resort. Marie Glodt Travel to Maui

Reviews.Title: “Great location for some quiet time, dated and average staff welcome.”
Reviews.Author: HartwellTravels
Reviews.Content: We spent half of our Hawaii trip on the North Shore before heading down to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Turtle Bay is quite far from anything and does offer some good activities on the resort like horse riding, golf, tennis. I would recommend this if you are wanting some time to chill out and not worried about having shopping or access to restaurants. We found the staff unwelcoming on our arrival which after spending 13hours from Australia was disappointing. Basically, we gave our name, credit card and we got a room number in return; no explanation of parking, facilities or that "Aloha" hospitality we were expecting. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a room with a balcony. The hotel is also a bit tired and undergoing some refresh. Our room was clean and of average size accommodating two queen beds, and all rooms do have an ocean room. The hotel offers good options for restaurants and we did have Italian at Leonardo's. We found the price reasonable and the food was good quality and value for money. Outside of the hotel, you don't have a lot of options nearby. The best options are in Halawei town which offers a number of quality bakery(s), burger joints, cafes (and a McDonalds if you are that desparate). Overall, I found the food on the North Shore a bit limiting, but there is a Foodland supermarket about 15-20mins drive from Turtlebay at Sunset Beach and is next to the Shark's Cove Grill which is ok for a lunch option. Their is a nice pool and gym at Turtle Bay. Beach itself is clean, but options for snorkelling and swimming is limited as there are coral/rocks but doable. We ended up using Turtle Bay more as a base to drive into the coastal towns and local sights.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a resort on the north shore, this is it”
Reviews.Author: audballa
Reviews.Content: we are staying in a beach cottage. the room is huge and nicely furnished with a view of the surf from our bed! the grounds are beautiful and the staff has snap-to service. visit Ted's Bakery (famous in the surfing world) down the streeet for breakfast food! yummy. beautiful place. the restaurants are waaaay overpriced here, so unless you don't mind, then just eat outside of resort down or up the road! aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Bronna61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 2 nights after doing the 7 day cruise around the islands. The hotel is a bit dated, but the room was comfortable and we had a beautiful view of the ocean and sunsets. There were not many electrical outlets in the room which surprised me. Bedside tables were nicked and carpet was nothing special. All in all it is the view you are paying for. Resturants were pricey and they charge you $25.00 per day for beach towels that we didn't even use. You have to pay that regardless. Parking was free, but if they have events going on it can be hard to find a place to park. They do have valet parking for a price of course. Beaches were nice and we enjoyed watching the surfers. North Shore is known for the high waves. We rented a car as Turtle Bay is really not close to anything. But if you are going for relaxation and wonderful views of the ocean it is a nice place to stay. I just think it is a little over priced for what you get. I would probably stay there again, only because it is so beautiful there and not as commercialized as Waikiki. I do think Turtle Bay needs to do some serious updating on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: BCTravelBug404
Reviews.Content: The North Shore is beautiful and the resort is located right on the beach. We rented a car for the week. We found the resort easy to find from the airport, and there was free parking. Valet parking was extra but the free parking lot was close to the hotel. We enjoyed walking along the coastline. We saw a few turtles on one walk, but there is a beach down the road where turtles show up pretty much daily. The restaurant Ola was the best out of the ones we tried. Leonardo's hands down the worst, the lasagna was pretty much a pasta lined bowl with meat and cheese soup inside. Thankfully, they took that off our bill for us. Palm Terrace was a decent breakfast. At night Palm Terrace turns into a different restaurant, we liked the pizza there. Over all though, the food was expensive and the rooms would not be worth the full price (we got them for half off through a sale). We had a Ocean King with a nice view, the room was large (looked almost as if it needed more furniture), mini fridge was excellent for drinks and food, in-room safe was good, and the rooms were clean. We slept just fine with our sliding door open, though some people might think the "roar" of the ocean is too loud. Ted's bakery down the road is a must. There is also a supermarket nearby. If you give them your phone number you get the preferred customer prices. We didn't mind that the hotel was over an hour from Honolulu. Besides Pearl Harbour, we didn't go into Honolulu. We enjoyed driving around the island every day, seeing different sites and stopping wherever we felt like it. Also, there was free wi-fi. And only parts of it actually remind you of "Forgetting Sarah Marshall".

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the private villas”
Reviews.Author: Listcoli
Reviews.Content: I organized a group of 14 to stay in 3 of the private villas at the resort. The villas themselves are great and would be perfect for a large family. They were not particularly well appointed, especially in the kitchens but it was adequate for us. When you stay at the private villas (as opposed to the villas owned by the resort) there are certain things at the resort that are off limits to you, like the comfy beach loungers and towels, plus there is an entire pool area that is also off limits to you. A bit disappointing considering my group ate dinners at the resort, booked golf and spa treatments, rented a car and went on a kayaking expidition. Overall, it's a large resort and managed as such so if you like that sort of holiday this is a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not really Forgetting Sarah Marshall....”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Gal22
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Hawaii and stayed at Turtle Bay during the latter half of my honeymoon last July. I am a travel agent in Toronto, Canada and had done alot of research into the hotel so I knew pretty much what to expect in terms of location, but I didn't realize how far away from everything it was. First off- it is about an hour from Honolulu, pretty drive.. very scenic. The cost of a taxi is about $100 each direction. We used Oahu airport express- private transfer where the driver seemed super sketchy and scary .. but totally reliable and always on time. The resort itself is pretty isolated and there isn't much around that you can walk to other than some public beaches and plantations. The dole plantation is closeby as well. We stayed in Maui for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon and wanted something a bit quieter and more romantic for honeymooners. It was funny because all of the reviews had mentioned no kids and lots of couples but the first day on the beach I had never seen more kids in my life!!!!! They were everywhere. No complaints but just funny that it was the total opposite, but it was only that one day which was probably a Saturday and it is a public beach afterall. The resort shuts down pretty early at night, and although there are some bars and restaurants we found ourselves in our room by about 8pm or just after dinner which was okay with us because we were up early. The resort is a bit dated, and the rooms are big but very simple... no pictures on the wall even. It did not look what they made the resort look like in the movie Forgetting Sarah Marshall, and although you can see where different scenes were filmed it wasn't as luxurious as it was in the movie. The beach was pretty clean, and if you stay at the resort the beach chairs are included (limited) which is a bonus because the resort in Maui you had to pay about $50 a day if you wanted one. You couldn't swim out very far as there is tons of coral nearby so the snorkelling isn't the greatest. On the other side of the resort you would often see surfers out in the evenings because of the strong surf. The restaurants were nice and clean, the food was pretty much the same all around. The buffet breakfast was AMAZING! and although a bit expensive... well worth it if you are a breakfast person. The pizza was also amazing in the dinner buffet. The bar by the pool serves great appitizers and full meals if you want them. We didn't leave the resort out of the 6 days we were there... so it was very relaxing but because there wasn't too many things going on some days it was a bit too relaxing! I think next time I go to Hawaii I would prefer to stay closer to Waikiki so it gives you some options for activities... shopping, restaurants, entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “A little good, a little bad”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_512
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Turtle Bay in late November for a week. The title sums up our vacation nicely.Some parts of the vacation experience were great some not. Turtle Bay is not really close to anything so you need a car to get there and tour other sites. The setting is spectacular and the grounds are amazingly well kept. We witnessed 2 weddings while we were there so it appears to be a popular spot for weddings (you would need to be ok with ocean breezes and less than perfect hair for pictures) The Good: The staff, other than some of the front desk staff (see the bad) were polite, cheerful and helpful. The restaurants/bars all provided a good vacation experience. The Palm Terrace breakfasts were good, the upscale Twenty One restaurant on site was excellent. Ola, the beach restaurant has great ambience and is a wonderful place to dine with the beach and ocean as backdrops. One of our meals at Ola echoed the review - my wife's meal was excellent, mine so bad that I would not finish - the manager listed to my concerns and reduced the bill by the amount of my dinner although I had not asked for that. Nice touch and I have no doubt that we would visit Ola again. Lei Lei's, the dining venue at the golf course was very upscale with good food, service and ambience. The beach is small, but very pleasant and the surf school around the bend from the beach appeared well used and popular. The pool area is very clean and well kept and the food and drinks were ... well appropriate. The golf course staff were great - very informative, helpful and appeared very interested in making sure you had a good time. We played the easier of the two courses and used the afternoon special rate deal. Full marks here for experience, cost and staff. The Bad: Well not a lot, but what didn't work was some of the importnat things to us. The front desk staff at check-in were the exception to the great staff we encountered here and set a poor example for the start of our holiday. On check in, they were abrubt, disinterested and unhelpful. On checkout, a different shift and very polite and helpful. Our room was the pits - likely the worst view in the resort. The room was very large but sparsely furnished and the furniture there was old, worn and stained, not to mention uncomfortable. 1 table, 2 table charis, 2 bedside table and one comfortable bed. Bathrooms were a green colour and in poor shape. The room was reminiscent of a cheap motel. All in all not up to the rest of the resort experience but we didn't spend a lot of time there anyway. Would we go again - in a word no. The resort is undergoing renovations and the rooms, if ours was the standard, badly need a refit. The cost vs the quality isn't there when compared to the other resort we visited in Kapalua. If we had a choice as to which to visit again - Kapalua wins by a large margin.

Reviews.Title: “Miss it already.”
Reviews.Author: Amik92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11/16 to 11/19. Wonderful, beautiful accommodations. The room 5th floor oceanview room & balcony were huge! Nice feature is the dual sink set up with separate full bath. So they didn't pick Italian marble, but good quality Corian. So they didn't change out to some fancy light fixture in the bath. We all travel with the Continental 48 luxury in mind, but we should Get Over It!!! The fluorescent lights in the bath save money, overstuffed furniture has a tendency to get musty in humidity. All that is avoided here, while keeping a wonderfully welcoming bed, just like a Westin. Loved the grounds, walked to the far edges of the shoreline both East and West, saw the resident Hawaiian Monk Seal at play in the bay (Hey! those are an endangered rarity!) the bay one over to the west has Honu like crazy!! Plus the beach on the east was tame, sandy and quiet. Fantastic! Construction is nearly complete on the lobby; it wasn't an issue at all. What a wonderful full service hotel in an area totally under-served by the hotel industry. Kudo's to Turtle Bay, totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience just as my vacation started at turtle bay ocean villas”
Reviews.Author: nessa c
Reviews.Content: oh my god we couldnt wait to get to hawaii after 10 hours of flight we finally got to the ocean villa at turtle bay its the 10 of december we got to our unit and couldnt wait to get some shut eye when we opened the door the unit smelt really badly first off we were so tired i told my husband lets just take a shower and hit the beds and thats where it all just got started there were blood spots on the pillows i couldnt believe my eyes a long awaited vacation trip turns into a night mare as soon as we opened the front door, it gets even better there were mold on the shower walls and dried soap spots on the glass, i am so disappointed we are never coming back... the next morning when we got up there were rubbish stuck in the bushes on the lanai it smelt like a huge ash tray i cant believe we spent this much money for this crap they have the worst cleaners i cant believe anyone would stay here we rented a ground floor from the liottas my friend raved about this place geesh im gonna thank her for a nightmare vacation next year i rather go to maui im never staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Alley J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon from Sept 12-16 in an ocean front cottage. We booked through Hotwire and when we checked in, we were told there was no record of our reservation. Luckily, we had our itinerary and were able to be accommodated. The guest services person manually checked us in and asked us if we wanted the king sized bed, which we said yes too but when we reached our room, he had put us in a 2 double bed room and were too tired from traveling all day to change. Thankfully, that was really the only hiccup of the trip. All of the workers were extremely friendly and accommodating and our room was beautiful with a great hammock overlooking the ocean. We had read a bunch of negative reviews but our experience was positive. The food was great-expensive but that's to be expected at any hotel! The pool area was well-kept the entertainment was nice during happy hour. The beach was clean and snorkeling was a must--lots of colorful fish and even a sea turtle! All in all, we had a great honeymoon and would definitely return for an anniversary trip!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: LuciArlingtonHeights
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my 7th trip to Hawai'i, but first time to Turtle Bay Resort. This was only a week long trip, and we decided to just stay on O'ahu. After 3 days in Honolulu, Turtle Bay was a delightful surprise. The setting is spectacular, the restaurants were wonderful, and the staff was friendly and polite. Our room was enormous (although a bit dated), and the balcony was the largest we have ever had anywhere in the world. We enjoyed the hiking trails, and although we did not play golf, the courses were beautiful. I would not hesitate to return, especially to see the new lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the north shore”
Reviews.Author: yks9
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at Turtle Bay Resort. The room was large, contemporary, clean, and bed was super comfortable. Lot's of closet space too. Service was friendly and helpful, staff was knowledgable about the general area and island overall. So many options on things to do there you could never get bored. If you want to relax, there are beautiful pools and beaches on either side. Food is a bit pricey, but that's the cost of transporting so many things from the mainland. The proximity to Haleiwa is great. Very close to surfing and shave ice!

Reviews.Title: “turtle bay ocane villa's stayed in liottas 3 bedroom condo”
Reviews.Author: 333Nina001
Reviews.Content: me and my family decided to take our first vacation to hawaii we are so glad to have found this 3 bed room condo from gina liotta the unit was really beautiful we had the ground floor unit. which was really awsome for my children they loved having fun in the pool and the spectacular dinners at the hotel was awsome, we will come back next year and hopefully stay longer the owners were very easy to deal with and we met one of the nicest cleaner they have a true island girl with lots of aloha made us feel so welcomed and greeted us every time we saw her... We have traveled all over the world and have never came across such hospility from the securtiy guards, the cleaner, and the turtle bay workers also... the only thing we didnt like was the manager who was screaming and yelling at the cleaner for helping out a delivery person we found out she manages the cleaning for gina. we will come back to turtle bay next year and hope to see the aloha and the hospitility that was shared and not see really nice people being treated poorly and have alot of aloha and hospitility with us the next time so if you want to have a beautiful stay on the beach and friendly local help with lots of aloha the ocean villas is the place to stay....north shore also have the most beautiful beachs lots to see plenty of turtles and we will be back next year....and dont forget to check out teds bakery you wont regret it ..

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is quite expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for my husband's birthday from Nov. 27 to Dec. 4. We paid $250 plus about $50 in taxes and the resort fee, for an ocean view which was more of a Bay view. I think all rooms have ocean views, so dont' pay extra for any special views. When we arrived, the lobby was under heavy construction, something we were not warned about. If anyone has done renovations at home, you know it is a stressful living environment. The same can be said about going on vacation to a hotel that is under construction. I would have liked an advance warning. We arrived quite late and there was hair in my son's bed, perhaps it was just from the maid, but if that is the case they should wear hair nets or something to cover their hair to prevent it from falling out into the guests beds. Fruit flies for breakfast. Every morning there were fruit flies at our table, landing in the creamer, on our food, etc. The staff were friendly but breakfast os quite pricey at $25 a person. The rooms are supposedly renovated but they choose a hospital green. I have no idea why they would choose such a colour, the wood in the room is warm, but the paint, bedding and shutters do nothing for the ambiance of the room. The walls are paper thin, we were put next to a family with a baby, which is fine as we have a baby too, but we could hear the baby next door crying like he/she was right in our room. Recreation. The bay side of the beach was so dirty. I saw numerous cigeratte butts, garbage and a bottle cap, which my young son could have stepped on. The gym's equipment was dated and rusty, it's time they upgrade their equipment. While the North Shore is an absolutely stunning tropical paradise, the hotel did not live up to my expectations, this is my 4th visit to Hawaii, and I much preferred the Waikiki Prince, Waikiki Marriott on Oahu and the Kannapali Hyatt and Kannapali Westin on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on North Shore, but Outdated & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: JPharm
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great place on the North Shore of Oahu, this is the best you are going to find. The resort is set in a beautiful location (many of the scenes from Lost were filmed here) There are a multitude of beaches perfect for all aquatic activities from surfing to snorkeling. The pool is in a lovely location, and the hot tubs are perfectly situated for watching the sun set. The hotel is under construction, so parts of the lobby are hidden by drywall and caution tape. While our room had a great view, that was the only thing that was great. The decor was outdated, and the bathroom looks like it was last updated in 1985. We were not impressed with the food at the hotel, and instead drove to Haleiwa each day to feast with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jesspete
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under construction which they never told us when we booked our room. We stayed in the beach bungalows which were beautiful(best bathroom i have ever seen!) but not worth the $450.00. We had what looked like mold on our wall room 118 great room because it was an end but grossed out form the wall-I can't believe they have not fixed it and put people in the room. The pool was cold-so kids never went in. The breakfast was very expensive. The manager gave me $100.00 off our bill which was nice but we spent $1600.00 for 3 days. Service not worth it! i would expect a lot more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: unhappysadtraveler
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay resort has a unique location on the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It is the only resort placed on the northernmost tip of the island (the majority are on Waikiki - south - and some on the west coast). During the winter, the location is great for surfing but less so for swimming. The hotel itself is placed beautifully, it looks good from outside and the premise (reception area, hallways, restaurant, pool) is also decent. The rooms, however, are in a real need of renovation. Worn out furniture (if not outright dirty), doors, and walls - see photos - and the baths are really not appealing at all. The overall appearance of the rooms does not create a comfortable feeling at all. When we complained we were moved to a Deluxe room which was better but still not at par with other Hawaiian hotels we stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “All it's cracked up to be!!”
Reviews.Author: KER924
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay Resort for the second leg of our honeymoon after staying in Ko Olina. As soon as we go there, we wished we were scheduled to stay longer than the 3 nights we had booked. The hotel staff left us a nice complimentary bottle of champagne for being honeymooners, which really impressed us. There were so many restaurants to choose from. We had dinner at 21 Degrees North, Ola, and Lei Lei's (which is off the resort but within walking distance). Our favorite was Ola. We were seated on the beach!! The pool was always crowded, but the view was amazing and it was very relaxing. The Hang Ten poolside bar was pretty good, but pricey, as are most poolside bars in Hawaii. There were plenty of activities and the resort posts daily activities in the lobby, so you know what is always going on. The beach is a public beach, although it is pretty much right on the resort. There was a bit of construction going on at the resort, which kept of from checking out a few things we had planned, but there was plenty to do that we really didn't miss it. We follow the resort on Facebook and it seems as thought they have a few new attractions as a result of that construction. We are definitely planning an anniversary trip back and Turtle Bay is in our plans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Seal555
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful setting on the north shore of Oahu but it looks like it is still stuck in the 70s - facade and public areas. Room was spacious and had a nice view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but not very good value”
Reviews.Author: btandrmb
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Oahu and up to the north shore for a few days, you are limited to 1 hotel Turtle Bay Resort (TBR) and a number of B&B's or holiday rentals. POSITIVES: The rooms are quite large and clean, great comfy beds and we were in a room that had a balcony. We arrived early and a room was found which was nice after 15hrs of flying and driving. The staff were friendly and the location is spot on. In our expereince here there wasn't really anything bad about the place that stood out. Food was good depending on where you ate, prices a little high (expected for a resort). We didn't spend much time by the pool or eating in as we were off driving around the island. NEGATIVES: It was windy.... very windy but I don't think TBR can control this but just be aware that the location is out on a sort of point at the top of the island so wind will be a problem sometimes. What really annoyed me was the US$25/N resort fee which covered a number of useless things as well as parking, WIFI, beach towles etc. It must be a USA thing, but $25/n is a rip off as the car park was pretty full and at times it took a while to find a spot, and there was a bit of a walk back to the hotel. Free WIFI is pretty much standard fare these days in any resort and being given a 'towel token' to swap for a towel is silly. Overall this is a good hotel and we enjoyed our stay. Clean, comfortable, large rooms and nice location. If the resort fee was closer to the $10-15 mark it would feel like less of a rip off. It is a bit of a drive (20-30mins) to the closest 'large town' so dinners require a drive or at resort. I would opt for the drive, it's an easy one and better value.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in the 'country'”
Reviews.Author: LauraT512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 5 nights in October 2011. Yes, the resort was built more than 30 years ago but it's still a beautiful place with a great staff. We had an ocean front room with a lanai that we sat on every morning to drink our coffee and watch the resort wake up. It was absolutely wonderful. The staff is super friendly, the grounds are beautiful, the room was clean. We took advantage and had a planned activity every day and had a great time surfing, kayaking, segwaying, and snorkeling. I called late one afternoon and asked if they could send maintenance up to look at the airconditioning because it rattled. They were there in 10 minutes. Waikiki couldn't compare to the fun we had in the 'country' part of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ErinandTony
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights while on our honeymoon. The first night we were greeted with a celebratory bottle of champagne. The daily breakfast Buffet was also included in our room rate - plenty of items to choose from and we rarely ate lunch since we were so full. The rooms also have refrigerators so we could stock up on sodas, beers and snacks from the grocery store down the street. The location and views are absolutely stunning. We spent plenty of time on the beach ( in the free lounge chairs and umbrellas) and even hiked around the grounds to do some exploring. We also spent 2 days in Waikiki and I'm so glad the rest of our time was spent here. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “30 yr Anniversary trip was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Deborah B
Reviews.Content: Me and My husband traveled to Oahu and stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for our 30 yr wedding anniversary and it was phenomenal.. The resort was beautiful and clean. the staff was great and so very helpful..Our room was clean and had two bath areas of which i liked ... we had a big balcony with a view of the ocean to wake up to each morning...The food was delicious(a little Pricey though) . The resort is quite and we enjoyed the laid back atmosphere..We rented a car when we arrived in Honolulu and toured the island and the North Shore was so quite and out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki . We enjoyed our stay so much we plan on going back next year and stay 2 weeks at Turtle Bay. The rest and relaxation and views at Turtle Bay is just awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our one week stay.”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: This place is all about location. We saw turtle from and lanai and watched the surfers wipe out and ride. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I agree that rooms need remodeling. Our room 572 had a bathroom door that was peeling, the wood had lifted. The bedroom wall had something splattered on it, I tried wiping it down but it needs a new coat of paint. The bathroom fixtures are probably the original 1972 fixtures. They are doing an extensive remodel, the lobby looks great and the halls are done too, please do the rooms. All this aside I would stay here again, it's Hawaii, who wants to stay in the room. Friday at 4:30 the chef does a cooking demo in the lobby with complimentary wine. Be sure to try the pineapple juice they have at the reception desk in the evening. Yes there are no screens to sleep with the door open, use your wooden shutter doors! I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DNR4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in October. The resort scenery was beautiful ! Our room was nice. We had booked an upgraded beach front room and had a view of the ocean...once you got past the roofs of the first floor! The service in the coffee stand and the Italian restaurant was great! We did the turtle kayak excursion and it was a fantastic experience! It is a long drive from Honolulu/Waikiki, but those areas are so crowded that it was nice to get to the North side of the island away from the crowds. My only complaints about this beautiful place: 1. Parking was terrible!; 2. Wait staff service at pool side bar/cafe was almost nonexistent. Overall really nice place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: xraided5150
Reviews.Content: After doing quite a bit of research online, we decided to stay away from Waikiki and give the Turtle Bay Resort and North Shore a try. I am so glad we did. All the negative reviews about the resort being "long in tooth" and "in need of updating" were put to rest when we walked into our deluxe ocean front room on the forth floor on the west wing. We had a beautiful view of the resort and ocean. The room was clean with plenty of space. The room seemed freshly painted or atleast painted in the last few years, carpet was clean and seemed newer. Beds very comfortable, TV was a HD 42inch flatscreen with limited cable channels, but in Hawaii we didn't watch much TV. There was a minifridge but no microwave which was pretty much the only negative thing about the room, Bathroom was large, with double sinks, granite counters, big closet, bathtub/shower, luxury hawaiian shampoos and soaps, lots of fresh towels. We were greeted warmly everywhere we went. Our maid was excellent. She noticed we had kids with us and our room was stocked with extra towels and tolietries for the remainder of our visit. Room service and the restraunts are pricey but on par with the other resorts in Hawaii. We ordered a sandwich plate late ($19) and it was enough for two people. I liked eating at Ted's Bakery and the shrimp trucks which farm there own shrimp and serve'em fresh both 3-4 miles from the resort. Parking isn't great but 100 percent better than in Waikiki, I didn't spring for the valet though since self parking is included in the resort fees of about $26 a day but again, parking in Waikiki, even in the hotel you're staying at could be about the same, at $20-$30 a day. But for me it was the location and beauty of the North Shore that truly won me over. It really is "true" hawaii. Head 15 mins west for a good restraunt selection and real Hawaiian soverniers. Head 15 mins east and check out the Polynesian Culture Center, especially if traveling with children. There is a great lagoon on the Turtle Bay's property and a few great beaches within a 5-15 min drive including Waimea Bay where you can jump off rocks and Sunset Beach with nice soft sands and good body boarding waves. My kids loved the pool and waterslides and the small on site arcade. Plenty of shops onsite as well and lots of fresh fruit stands close to the resort. I tried Papayas, dragon fruit, passion fruit, pinapples, guavas, and fresh coconut juice. All amazing and let's you know you're in Hawaii. If you're going to Hawaii you can't go wrong with the Turtle Bay Resort and the North Shore. I Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: themeigans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay in March, 2010 for 4 nights. The resort is over an hours drive from Waikiki which can be quite daunting if you are used to driving on the left hand side of the road. The rooms are really basic, dated and in need of renovation. It rained during our whole stay and as a consequence there was nothing at the resort to do as all the activities - pool, beach, tennis and horse riding require fine weather. For a couple of hours when the weather did clear, we ventured to the beach which is mainly rocks and reefs with only a small areas suitable for swimming. The food in the various restaurants is average and overpriced. If you want the option of doing various activities and eating outside your hotel, stay in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relax and unwind location excellent”
Reviews.Author: bretkero
Reviews.Content: check in was smooth we arrived early but stil got our room delux ocean view we had room 452 perfect views of ocean and sunset and to hear ocean during the night very relaxing staff were helpful but not intrusive bit pricey for drinks and meals (lunch) but quality food we chose to eat in town rather then hotel for dinners

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: brisbanegirl51
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have had just spent 9 days on Oahu. It was our first visit to Hawaii. We wanted to see more of the Island other then just Waikiki so spent 4 nights at Turtle Bay. I must admit I was a bit nervous about what we would find at the Turtle Bay Resort due to the very mixed reviews the resort does get here on trip advisor. I am glad to say that our experience was a very positive one. While i do agreee that the resort does need a make over we had a great room which was very large and had a wonderful view over the beach (room 255). In fact you could not get any closer. It was wonderful hearing the waves crashing onto the rocks throughout our stay. We found the staff very helpful. Some reviewers have been critical of the prices at the restuarants onsite. Coming from Australia we found them to be be pretty average for resort restuarants. 21 was very exxy and we did not eat there but Leonardo's was great, food quality excellent and prices pretty good. 2 people could share a large pasta dish for about $20. We had a hire car so was not limited to the resort. Just 10 mins north is a small town called Lei which has a very good foodland and several fast food outlets which are worth checking out. We had lunch at Tita's Grill which was very yummy (shrimp) and I would recommend you give them a try (dont be put off by the appearance of the shop). Over all we had a great stay and would not hestitate to recomend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your vacation time here”
Reviews.Author: iTrip247
Reviews.Content: The service was not good. I regret staying there. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Property, Staff Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: rdpecha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 20-November 1st and from the moment we drove out of Honolulu to the North Shore we knew we made the right choice. Turtle Bay is the only resort far away from the hubbub and close enough to a town, Haleiwa, where we could explore other restaurants to avoid the pricey resort restaurants!! As we stayed here 12 days, we were very surprised that not one single person on their staff ever really got to know us. We weren't expecting them to remember our names, but at least recognize us at the pool after we spent a few days with the same waitress and tipped generously. It was like she never served us the next day we saw her, and the same goes for the other staff. Kind of bizarre as we go to Caesar's in Vegas every year and the staff remembers us from the year before! Anyhow, the rooms were dated, but definitely nice and though we didn't have the best view over the pool, we still had the ocean to look at. Definitely stay on the 6th floor if possible. We would go to Hang Ten bar by the pool at 5:30 to get in on happy hour and watch the gorgeous sunset. So cool to see the surfers with the sunset in the backdrop. The food at the restaurants was very good, we ate at Ola's, Lei Lei's, and 21 Degrees North. The service is slow, but the food comes out quickly. I would definitely return to Turtle Bay and possibly stay in one of the cottages, but only after verifying they have been renovated. The hotel reception area and main lounge was being renovated, so they are on the right track. They just need to work on getting their staff engaged with their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but hotel could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay for 7 nights in September 2011 for our Honeymoon. It was the 2nd leg of our 3 leg trip (Las Vegas, Hawaii & San Francisco) so we wanted to stay somewhere away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki so that we could relax and experience true Hawaii. The resort itself is very impressive, there is lots to do in terms of activities, there are hiking trails that we did 3 or 4 times, Horse riding lessons, Surfing Lessons, Kayaking and free activities including Lei making: We had a surfing lesson for $75 each for 2 hours, which was good but I got sea sick! The pool area fantastic but the private beach is nothing to write home about, the snorkeling is poor (go to sharks cove instead) and you have to get down there early to get a lounger with an umbrella (if you’re fair skinned like me you’ll need one) The rooms were just OK, we were a bit disappointed when we first arrived so we asked to see an upgraded room (we were happy to pay) the “upgrade” was exactly the same room and view but with probably an extra foot of balcony for $25 a night…we chose to decline. The rooms were clean but very basic, there was plenty of wardrobe space, a nice big TV, Tea and Coffee making facilities, a fridge, iron and a big bed, but the bathroom was cramped and old, the décor very dated. We’d love to have been able to afford to stay in one of the beach front villas or the bungalows but we’d have been adding a few extra zero’s to our stay if we had. The hotel staff were not great, no-one acknowledged it was our honeymoon, let alone receive any form of congratulations. It’s obviously a hub for honeymooners from all over the world which I think they take for granted. No-one was particularly rude to us, they just appeared to be a little unapproachable on occasion. We also really begrudged paying the $25 per day “resort fee”. We knew about it before we travelled (after we’d booked) but just couldn’t understand why they couldn’t have factored the fee into the overall cost of the holiday. For your $25 you get WiFi access in your room (we used this every day) a paper (never saw this), use of a snorkel for 1 hour per day (we already had our own)…I can’t remember what else was supposed to be included but we certainly didn’t benefit from any of it. There is a good selection of restaurants and bars at the resort; Opa’s (on the beach) was lovely, 21 degrees north absolutely fantastic, a must for anyone celebrating a special occasion. Leonardo’s do a great takeaway pizza but I was sick on the night that we ate in (dodgy scallop). We only had breakfast at Lei Lei’s but it was lovely. The Hang Ten bar does the best cocktails and burgers and the Ahi (fish) sandwich/burger was the nicest thing I had all holiday! Downside is that everything is very expensive due to being a resort, we brought breakfast cereals and milk from the local Food Land and ate in our room on most days. Also whilst we were there some renovation works were going on in the main lobby which we were told about 1 day prior to travelling. This was OK as it didn’t affect our rooms but what we weren’t told was that the main Bar was also in the Lobby and was closed for the entire duration of our stay. This would have been OK but unfortunately it was the only bar open past 9 pm. We were told that the hang 10 bar was open until 10 pm but when we went to get a drink after our dinner one night at 9:30 we were turned away as they were closed. We were in bed before 10 pm most nights as we didn’t have anywhere else to go. Ultimately it wasn’t the end of the world but it would have been nice to be able to go for a quiet drink after dinner and not have to go straight up to our room. Whilst the resort is secluded you can still get about without having to hire a car. We got the bus to local towns a lot, the bus stop is within the resort walls, they very frequent and good value for money (you get a free return if you travel back within 2 hours) If you do get the bus or hire a car you must go to Haleiwa; it’s an excellent local town with lots of shops & restaurants along with the infamous Giovanni’s shrimp truck – a must, the best shrimp I’ve ever had. Other areas on the bus route include Sunset Beach (where all the locals go surfing) and Sharks Cove (opposite Food Land) which is fantastic for snorkelling – be careful of the strong current against the rocks when you get in though). If you do hire a car (and you can do it at Europacar at the resort by the day) I would thoroughly recommend a visit to the Dole Pineapple Plantation and Pearl Harbour – it’s an emotional day but worth it, get there early if you do go, it’s free to get in but you can make a donation. Overall we had a great time in Hawaii and would love to go back. The locals are so friendly. I would recommend Turtle bay but be prepared to spend a lot of money. If we did go back to this resort it would be to stay in a beach bungalow…if we couldn’t afford that we’d stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Hawaii and I looked for other places to stay for weeks, and finally settled on returning to Oahu and the Turtle Bay Resort, simply because we haven’t seen all of Oahu yet and I didn’t want to mess with the Waikiki and Honolulu craziness, like last time. Booked the reservation online and made a few requests; all of which were met. Turtle Bay is the best place for a base if you’re going to try and experience the laid back side of the island, as the resort has everything that the big ones have (and I think more) without the crowds and noise. The food at all the restaurants is first rate; they are all so good that none just jump out. Last year we took the helicopter tour, which everyone should try with the doors off for the best views. We ate once at each resort restaurant and then used our rented a Jeep and explored the whole island and ate at all the little whole in the walls on the north shore we could find, most of which are within a short distance of the resort. Surf was good and no crowds unlike just down the road at Sunset Beach. We’ll be back here the next time we go to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: brownize
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Hawaii for my 50th birthday. I had said that when I turned 50 I wanted to be golfing in Hawaii and he made that dream come true! He picked the Turtle Bay Resort and it could not have been a better experience. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still offered a lot to sightseeing things to do. We had a great time on the Fazio Golf Course as well as hiking the trails to secluded beaches, enjoying the amenities of the resort and a really great helicopter tour of the island. I would certainly reccommend this resort to anyone that wants to experience Hawaii but not so much all the people and attactions of the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort. If u are looking for a resort this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: clippermama
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views. Spacious rooms, very clean It's kinda off by itself. The pool and spa were great. Friendly staff everywhere. We had a great time on beach water is kinda rough but it was early private very few people on beach. I really enjoyed it here but o think will try beach house rental next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: Hello All, If you are booking a wedding through Turtle Bay Resort, Oahu, think again. They are charging you a $1,500+ site fee to have your wedding on the beach at Turtle Bay. FYI, all beaches in Hawaii are public through the state. Anyone can walk on any beaches in Hawaii. Turtle Bay is not a secured resort. They have Condos next door and several residents come right on the beach from there Condo. I used an outside company for my wedding and was absolutely beautiful and private. We got married at Sunset at Stables Beach. The outside company provided more than Turtle Bay for 80% less than what they charged. Also include professional photographer. So before booking with Turtle Bay for your wedding, think again. If you are a guest at the Resort you can have guests as well come to your wedding. The resort is beautiful and other than the wedding staff that lied to me about the public beaches, everyone else was WONDERFUL.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Jfeil
Reviews.Content: Great views of the North Shore. We were in a bungalow, with a Lanai, and large lawn out back. The sunsets are incredible. Best food is at the golf course, great place to start the day

Reviews.Title: “Stunning vistas...still hungry though”
Reviews.Author: BoarderX
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel at a truly beautiful location with awesome views in both directions from its spot nestled between two bays. Rocks and coral over here, sandy beach over there. Majestic power of the sea, along with a calmly protected snorkeling bay. I don't golf, but the tennis courts and other basic activities were nice and perfectly in line with what you'd expect from a large Hawaiian resort. The pool and jacuzzis weren't incredible, but definitely get the job done. The biggest challenge was casual eating. There are some solid on-site dining options, but they're almost entirely in the $25-60 per person range, which can get very expensive very fast. Wouldn't be a problem, except that there aren't many offsite food alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethikei
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband and family in early January. Great resort and we wished we would have stayed more than our two nights. The north shore of the island is gorgeous and a great break from Honolulu. We stayed here in winter, so the huge waves were amazing. Despite the huge waves on most of the north shore, we were still able to snorkel in the Turtle Bay lagoon at the hotel. Being able to see the surfers ride the 20 foot waves at Pipeline was incredible. We loved walking along the beach. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience, beautiful resort with lots of stuff to do”
Reviews.Author: 66MaryB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with lots of stuff to do, you will never get tired of this place. Rooms were really good, clean and hygienic :) Only problem is that this resort is 1 hour away from all major attractions in Oahu (Honolulu). We thought of staying in this place because we were tired of city crowd and highways and this is the best match if you want to just stay away from all such things. But if you are planning to visit a lot of attractions in Honolulu then be prepared to drive. However the drive is worth too. The road follows the ocean and you can see green and blue water and lots of beaches all way long. North shore is a heaven for surfers, and we loved the high tides. Have a great time in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Not overdone”
Reviews.Author: GratefulMo
Reviews.Content: Its a beach resort, yet not overwhelming about it...which gives TBR a nice laid back feel. A really great pool area with nice view of the breaking North Shore waves. All the rooms have nice views and there are over 10 miles of hiking paths to view the coastal landscape

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: nmlynarczyk
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is a true Hawaiian experience. Turtle Bay has a great beach (where you can see sea turtles), and it is near many other wonderful ones. The resort also has some very good resturants. They have a great breakfast buffet that is worth the money! If you don't feel like eating at the hotel there are other dining options about 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “The location makes the place.”
Reviews.Author: Workerbee22
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our second visit to Turtle Bay. The location and property is hard to beat. The rooms are just so so. In just one year we noticed a deteriorization of the rooms and facility. We stayed in the Beach Cottages which are very spacious and located ocean front. The location makes the place. The cottage itself is getting run down, beds need replacing and there are no real special amenities that go with this almost $400/night room. Overall I give it the very good rating because of the location on the North Shore and the property itself. Dining on site is also marginal. We prefer the casual golf course restaurant, Lei Lei's, over the others. Short of renting a house on the North Shore, Turtle Bay is about your only option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Stunning Location”
Reviews.Author: Cormell
Reviews.Content: After 5 days in the bustle and nightlife of Honolulu, Turtle Bay was a welcome respite from noise and crowds. Famously featured in the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" the resort itself is smaller than it looks on line but every bit as nice as advertised. My wife and I stayed here in March of 2010 and were impressed by the service and quality of the rooms. We were fortunate to have a west facing one over the ocean so the sunsets were spectacular and the rainbows were constant from our balcony. We were even able to spot the occasional whale There are limited eating options in this resort so it is recommended to bring in some food of your own. With all the fresh fruit and good food options in Hawaii this is not really an issue. The restaurants that are there however feature excellent cuisine and quality service. The area around the resort is surfer paradise. This is the famous North Shore of Oahu. You can watch surfers from your balcony, the pool, pretty much anywhere on the grounds or move up the coast a few miles to all the most famous North Shore surf spots.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: george c
Reviews.Content: We were in Hawaii for a mini "working" vacation. I'm a photographer and I was shooting a wedding in Honolulu. We stayed at Turtle Bay to get away from the noise, traffic and over-saturation of Waikiki Beach. It definitely fit that bill - Turtle Bay is a pretty large resort sitting on a quiet, secluded peninsula with views of the ocean from pretty much every side of the hotel. The location is really tough to beat. It's quiet, there's a nice cove to where you can go swimming with a good sized beach and plenty of beach to walk in either direction. The grounds are nice and the restaurants have pretty good food, albeit at a premium price. There are a couple of shops with the expected items like resort wear, souvenirs and sundries. The nearby town of Haleiwa on the North Shore is a great place to go for a few local restaurants and shops and to see the sea turtles come up on the beach. Also a great place to surf, obviously, and the views are awesome of the waves. The Dole plantation is reasonably close too. The staff was just O.K. They weren't rude or anything, just... "disinterested". We received no information about the resort, the grounds, activities or the restaurants or anything when we arrived and the desk clerk seemed rushed (even though we were the only ones checking in). Service in the restaurants, especially at the "Ola" restaurant on the beach, was definitely much better and more personable, but overall I was underwhelmed by the service. Where the largest problem comes in is with the price vs. value comparison. The rooms are just so-so. Clean, but definitely dated. The bed was comfy and the room was a good size but the space could be better utilized, maybe with more comfortable chairs or a sitting area. No refrigerator or mini bar in the room. Plenty of closet space too. The fixtures in the bathroom are old, grout in the shower tiles and bathroom floors were stained and dirty and the furniture on the balcony was old, worn and pretty cheap. It was definitely better than your average "Best Western", but not much. As for the ocean view, about 70% of the view from our "Deluxe Ocean Front" room was the roof of the convention center below. This was a pretty big disappointment for us and exposes a pretty major general design flaw in the hotel. Walking around the grounds we noticed that nearly all of the rooms on the lower 4 floors of any of the room towers would have the same problem as ours, since the hotel juts significantly from the bottom of the room towers on almost every side. If you are on the higher floors you could look over the roof below with a more clear view of the ocean, but on the lower floors most of what you see is the dirty flat top of the roof below. Seems to me someone should have thought of this when designing a premium hotel in such an amazing location with the potential for near 360 degree views of the ocean form every room, but hey - I'm a photographer not an architect. Additionally, there is a fair amount of construction currently going on at the hotel. They're putting in a new lounge and doing some roof repairs. We weren't told about any of this when making the reservations or when checking in, though there were signs posted throughout the resort. As a result some areas are closed to guests. They did the work in the middle of the day when most people were out and about so it was not a major inconvenience, but it's worth noting. Overall, we would not stay there again. Since we were there in the off season, we apparently got a "deal" at $215 a night (plus a resort fee of course) and frankly, it's maybe worth half THAT price. We're not typically all that nit-picky when it comes to resorts, as long as they are reasonably clean and offer a good amount of amenities for your dollar. In this case it was exactly that lack of value for price that really bugged us most about this place. You could certainly stay at a worse resort, but you could also stay at a much better one, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dated with a cheap 'tart up'”
Reviews.Author: Time2venture
Reviews.Content: After being spoilt at the Trump Hotel, my partner and I headed over to Turtle Bay for my best friend’s wedding. To say we were disappointed was a massive understatement. After reading Russel Brandt’s book where he describes his stay at Turtle Bay during the filming of Forgetting Sarah Marshall (The Hotel is nothing like this movie FYI) we were expecting bland, but it was worse than we had feared. The Hotel staff were unhelpful at check in and the Porters did not immediately offer to assist us with our bags, instead watched us drag them to the check in counter. The rooms are BADLY dated. The walls are a putrid green colour that makes you look unhealthy. The grout and sealants have all deteriorated. The bathroom and ‘kitchenette’ (?) area adjoin which I thought was a little group. For their age, the bathrooms are clean. The bedrooms have received a minor ‘makeover’ but are still very bland and average. There is a noticeable lack of art on large blank walls. The staff leave a stuffed animal on your bed for ‘adoption’. I thought this was a bit cheeky and was curious to know how many people had taken it assuming it was a free gift. I also thought it was a little unhygienic to leave a toy, handled by who knows how many people, next to your pillow! If you are going to stay at this resort definitely hire a car, otherwise you will be stuck there. It’s also really windy on this part of the island! I was also disappointed that the Bride and Broome were not better looked after by the Hotel. Their wedding coordinator was lovely but there was no ‘special treatment’ for having a wedding at the resort (a complimentary drink, room upgrade ... anything!). The positives, our view was amazing, we stayed on Level 2 and were very close to the ocean we could hear the waves crashing (there is a sliding door.... but not really a balcony. Balconies come with superior rooms but aren’t worth paying for). There are a lot of activities offered by the resort. The grounds are beautiful. Also, you will Turtle Bay probably offers more ‘true’ Hawaiian experience as it is a little bit of the tourist track (sort of). The pool is pleasant and quite large (although the attendants were very inefficient, you wouldn’t want to be parched and waiting for them!). The beaches were also lovely and we did sight a couple of turtles which was really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Hardie”
Reviews.Author: Liz1379
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel!! Our daughter was married on North Shore in a private home on the beach, but we had many of our family and friends staying at this hotel. The staff was amazing!! They went out of their way to accomodate our Mother who needed a wheel chair to get around. The rooms were perfect. We couldn't have had a more perfect wedding. The kids enjoyed the pool and slide and we all enjoyed the wonderful staff that took care of us on the beach while we played in the ocean waters, swimming with a sea turtle. In addition, we ordered our Wedding bouquet and flowers from Liz Requilman at the North Shore Weddings and Flowers shop right on the pool level of the resort. They were amazingly beautiful and Liz was so accomodating with our budget and went out of her way to help us. It was great to not have to pay a delivery fee or leave the resort. Please mention her in your "preferred vendor" list. You won't be disappointed! Thank you, The Hardie's

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: Fadi E
Reviews.Content: Eloped at Turtle Bay and loved it. Mikilani from TB hooked up everything and all that assisted were great! From Ambiance Photography to Reverend Lunalilo, North Shore Wedding and Flowers, Island Transporter and Art Kahaliki (guitarist), everything was organised really well and done fantastically. Hotel was also extremely helpful and we had a great time in a great pocket of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: TJMcV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May. We stayed in a Bugalow away from the main hotel and it was PERFECT. We wanted a quiet romantic week of surfing and eating Poke and that's what we got. It rained everyday, that's why the water is so murky in the photo, but normally it's gorgeous crystal clear blue water. We dined at Ola and Lei Lei's, Ola was delicious Lei Lei's was adequate. The resort itself is a bit dated but for me that is part of the charm, it's Hawaiiana. Great stay, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted when visiting Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Trisha C
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this Hotel. It is located on North Shore of Oahu and was everything I wanted out of my first trip to Hawaii. There slogan "True Hawaii" is right on the button. The hotel was very family oriented and the staff very friendly. We originally booked a standard room with 2 double beds. However we were graciously upgraded to the Pikaki suite which included a queen bed, a sitting area with a couch, two chairs and a coffee table. There were four of us; two on the bed, one on the couch and a roll away was brought in for the other one. One of the things that I really appreciated when staying here was that every night when we came back to our room the beds were turned down and beautiful Hawaiian music was gently playing in the background. Can you say heaven? haha. I could have spent my whole 7 days at this resort and would have been on cloud nine the whole time. Hope to return someday to do just that. However since it was our first trip Hawaii, we did venture out. The resort is a short trip down the highway from the Polynesian Cultural Center, famous shrimp trucks and the little town of Hale'iwa in Waialua Bay (home of Matsumoto's Shaved Ice, very yummy). Snorkeling at the resort was amazing and our favorite FAVORITE restaurant was Lei Lei's Bar and Grill. Every single dish that was ordered was delicious and served with yummy edible flowers. (never had them before) Thought that was pretty neat. I missed this place the moment we pulled away to the airport. I hope to return one day very soon!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: LoriD555
Reviews.Content: my husband & I stayed here for the last couple of days of our honeymoon. the resort staff was great, moved us up to a higher floor for view and sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne, nothing but couresy and promptness when any request was asked. downside...the rooms need updating. the bathrooms were somewhat dark and a little dingy. everything was clean and in working condition, but could use some freshening up for what you pay. restaurants are a little pricey but no more than nice restaurants and hotels back home. food was good in the 3 restaurants we ate in ,Palm Terrace, Leonardo's and Lei Leis. husband has a gluten allergy and we were accomodated very well. grounds were wonderful, cannot beat the views and ambience. will stay here again, if we have the chance...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Nice Resort a little pricey.Room had a Great view and beautiful balcony. Great Place for surfers, snorkeling was a little murky, due to the high surf. Nice beaches at the resort and close by if you have a car. Polynesian Culture Center is close and a must see. Only drawback is the food at the resort is a little pricey, and the room decor could be updated a little for the price you are paying. I didn't bring my golf clubs but the courses looked great jogging by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean and a relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: LTVL
Reviews.Content: Spent a nice weekend at Turtle Bay..we had an ocean/pool view room 4th floor south wing. I called ahead to see if early check in was available for kama'aina rate. Arrived at 1..checked in and poolside 1:30. Good service and friendly staff. We had a great dinner at Leonardo's. Enjoyable and very relaxing..would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: stevevickibc
Reviews.Content: Great location, surrounded by ocean. Not sure if oceanfront is worth the extra money as all the rooms had excellent views of the ocean. Stayed overlooking the bar/pool area and it had a better view than the opposite side looking over the roof of the conference center. Couldn't hear any noise on the 4th floor from the bar.The rooms are a bit dated but clean & quiet. Staff are OK-some helpful, some not so much(didn't seem to be bothered). Better than renting a vacation rental on the North Shore-we rented one & left early to go to Turtle Bay where it is safe & quiet! Nice size pool area with 2 hot tubs-even on a fully booked weekend, there was lots of room for everyone. Nice secluded beach to watch turtles. Went to the Seafood Festival and had a really good time-the food was amazing & everyone was friendly. Would definitely recommend for family or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service in a fading beauty”
Reviews.Author: zenboy4ever
Reviews.Content: The staff were all great, especially the valet staff, housekeeping and the adventure center. The location is wonderful, right on the beach on the north shore of Oahu. The rooms were clean but dated. There were renovations on the lobby happening while we we there. I hope the rooms are next.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Laura Z
Reviews.Content: We selected this resort because we did not want to be any where near Honolulu. And it was a good choice. North Shore is the best place to be on the island. I agree with the other reviews that the place is a bit run down. However, the service was great. Every staff member that we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The other guests were great too....mostly honeymoon couples. We went to the outside bar for happy hour every evening to watch the sun set and the beautiful view. Many guests did the same. There were many places to eat on the property. Ola's was spectacular. We weren't impressed with Lei Lei's...nothing special there. Our only "complaint" was that the rooms definitely needed a remodel. They were clean, yet old. My recommendation would be to have a screen door so that it can be left open all night to enjoy the sounds of the surf. We definitely will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing management”
Reviews.Author: MMTLatelyHawaii
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying many of the staff were incredibly nice and helpful, notably the housekeeping, valet and pool staff. For a place recently close to bankruptcy, I don't think management put any emphasis on guest satisfaction. Beautiful resort, average rooms, great views from all balconies, but overpriced for what we received: 1. Disappointing check-in experience: a line of us waited for 15-20 minutes while the staff checked in guests. No early check-in so we had to wait once to register, once again to pick up our keys. Part of the issue was that other guests were randomly approaching the desk, and the staff went ahead and checked them in despite the rest of us waiting in line. Once we finally got to the desk, the staff was friendly and helpful as you would expect. 2. The pool: great facility, but we were ignored by "our" waitress completely for over an hour, and when we requested service from a nearby waitress, we were told to "grab her" meaning our server. She eventually rushed by us, didn't even slow down as she said 'you ok'? We were not about to tip this woman for any service, so we left and walked to the bar instead. 3. Leonardo's hostess: though we had a reservation, two separate parties were seated ahead of us who had arrived after us. The hostess brushed us off, saying "you're next". And no, they did not seat us anywhere special. Overall we had a great time, but for the price, they should brush up on the customer flow issues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in beach cottage”
Reviews.Author: beckyras
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week for a final family trip before our son was off to college. When we checked in we had a free upgrade to a suite on the 6th floor if we wanted it. After looking at both choices, (I had booked a cottage) it was an easy decision. The cottages were so close to the ocean, how could you take the suite? We slept with the door open (Screen door locked) every night. What a wonderful sound! The service was great and friendly from our concierge and all the restaurants! Breakfast was included with the room and was good. Lots of choices with very friendly service.! Loved the room and it's proximity to the pool. (We were a very short walk.) People have reviewed the place is run down, granted I didn't see a regular room, but the common areas were very nice. Really, what do you want?? All in all a great place if you want to get away. We went to Waikiki for a day, glad we didn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: Navywife25
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for a wedding and had a great time. The view from the room was fantastic. We could see the surfers from our balcony. It was a bit over priced for what you got. We did not understand the $25 resort tax. We stayed the rest of the week at the Hilton in Honolulu and did not pay that tax for a much nicer & newer room. The pool was wonderful, the water clear and cool. Plenty of chairs, but you could not " save one" for very long.. The food was good, the drinks, watered down, but the staff was wonderful. I can't say we would ever stay there again for more than one night as a break from Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “great location and facilities-beware extra fee”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryScot
Reviews.Content: this is idyllic setting and so close to all the north shore attractions - nice choice of staying an enjoying all the conveniences that come with a great resort. If you like to venture out, it is very central. When I booked, I didn't see the "small print" that stated you need to pay and additional $25.00 per day which covers things like wireless internet, parking, free newspaper, etc. Don't mind paying but should be more obvious when booking as it is a sizable sum to add if you not expecting it. Still, its a great place and I would return for sure.....

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: MarV713
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and had a great time. Great location if you want to scape Waikiki and enjoy the North Shore. Great views, nice beach, fine rooms (though not fancy) an close to great surf spots. One hour drive or less to Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome on the North Shore at Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: Awesome is the word for this place. The most beautiful and romantic surroundings are to be found at Turtle Bay Resort. Everywhere you look there are beaches, ocean, mountains, and palm trees and you will think your looking at a post card. My wife and I had the best vacation of our life here. The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff were friendly and catered to all our needs, the pool was fantastic, and there really are turtles in the bay at the resort. Everything you want to see to discover Oahu is within just a few miles of the resort. If your looking to shop and visit tourist attractions you need to stay in Honolulu. But if you want to see the real Hawaii, then stay at Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore. We would go back tomorrow if we could. Like I said it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay Resort in one of the bungalows in September of 2010 when we traveled to Hawaii to get married. The view was sensational from the room! The resort is beautiful and the staff was great. While visiting our car got burglarized and the staff was extremely helpful in helping us settle our affairs. It isn't easy to cancel everything on a weekend with a major time zone difference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort & Location”
Reviews.Author: princessvontrapp_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 10 fabulous days at the Turtle Bay Resort.It was our second visit within a few years and Sept/Oct is definitely a better (warmer) time to visit than Christmas. Last time we stayed in a nice hotel room, this time we spoiled ourselves and stayed in one of the beach cottages (because we booked very early in the year, we got a 25 % discount). It is almost impossible to be closer to the ocean if you are not on a boat. It really looks like on the web site and the sound of the ocean and birds is so soothing. Room: Top notch bed (great mattress), large bathroom, decent furniture, great lanai where we had multiple room service dinners and breakfast. Safe, closet, coffee maker, TV, bath robes, slippers, umbrellas, personal fridge (in addition to mini bar). Daily FRUIT delivery, e.g. 2 bananas, or 2 apples etc. Location: look right at the ocean from your bed and enjoy the silence away from the buzz of the hotel/pool. Outside are hammocks that we used religiously to watch the stunning sun sets. Pool: we never used the main pool but the small pool with the water slide (fun and warm!). Hot tubs are nice; very hot and crowded. Pool menu is limited but some good choices like fish tacos. Restaurants: we love Ola, the restaurant right by the beach. Luckily most people don't want a table in the sand so we got it. It's open air, great fish, salads, service. Make sure to book on a Sunday night as all other restaurants will be closed. Five stars for Ola. As my husband is on a gluten free diet, we never tried any of the other restaurants but had room service from 21 which was very good. The Italian place looks good but the interior looks very 80s. We had breakfast there once, sitting outside, which was good. Hale'iwa has a number of restaurants and we ate at Joe's. We also tried the shrimp trucks which were surprisingly expensive. While Romy's was excellent, I discourage you to go to Giovanni's. They were the first truck but the people who cared seem to have left (Shrimps totally overcooked and a coconut drink was 5$$$$!). Bad attitude. Beach: great beach. Calm bay where we swam most days, rented a paddle board and enjoyed lying on the beach. It's beautiful and relaxing. Only minus is for the staff by the beach. I'd say there is a bit of an attitude to give you a beach chair, carry it and hand out towels - even though you pay a heft resort fee. Something needs to happen here. Not sure if the little beach shack/store belongs to the hotel; they absolutely don't care and don't know anything in that shack; disappointing. Other attractions: there is great kayaking on the river in Hale'iwa. Avoid the kayak rental opposite Joe's (right in the harbor). Unfortunately, they don't like to "serve"; we are not asking for a smile but don't be in a bad mood. There is another place close to the main road by the bridge that looked like it had a lot of variety; the river also looks good for paddle boarding. The north shore is amazing. It's quiet, windy (but pleasant), you can walk on beaches for hours and just feel nature. We saw a monk seal pup on the beach. My husband played both golf courses and thought it was decent. There are bikes for rent and tours available. We had massages that were wonderful, and I took four yoga classes which were of exceptionally high quality and attended by many locals. GREAT JOB! If you are not on vacation to party and want to fully chill, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Has it all in a very peaceful and relaxing setting”
Reviews.Author: bruzer53
Reviews.Content: The north shore is perfect for couples wishing to spend a romantic vacation away from the bustling area of Waikiki. The grounds are gorgeous, service friendly, food at any of the restauarants is a delight. The rooms are ok. With so much to do and see, you just can't help but fall in love with the place. Can't wait to come back again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wishing we didn't have to go back to reality”
Reviews.Author: JC and VG C
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to take a week long vacation to Hawaii and weren't sure what to expect of this resort. The drive out to the resort was about an hour from Honolulu, which after 10 hours of flying seemed a bit daunting. We arrived late at night exhausted, but were greeted by friendly staff who quickly set us up with our room. We went to sleep and when we woke up the next day and had a look over the resort we were pleasantly surprised! Initially we were on the 2nd floor Oceanview, but we really couldn't see anything from there. We asked for an upgrade and we got a much better view on the 5th floor complimentary. Because we were staying for 6 nights we also received a promotional offer for their daily breakfast buffet ( which was so delicious!!!) all free. The views from the Palm Terrace are unbelievable... it truly is paradise. The other views you can't miss are the sunsets which are truly memorable. We'd recommend you rent a car when you stay on the island. Although the resort is great, there is so much to see and do while you are there. We went to the Polynesian Cultural Center, where you can see the show "Ha, the breath of life". We also recommend that you check out Kualoa Ranch... get the sunset package where you can do 2 tours and receive a luau dinner with entertainment. It was a smaller crowd which made it feel more intimate and authentic. We can't wait to come back to visit... :)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of crazy add-on taxes!”
Reviews.Author: TankHead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 3 nights. We had booked online before our stay and missed the incredibaly small writing at the bottom of the booking stating that additional taxes would be included in the price. Well be prepared for incrediable taxes that the staff can't even explain to you at the check-in counter. While this resort is in a beautiful location and has some amazing places to sit and watch the sunset, lay on the beach or by the pool, the prices of the accommodation and food on site left a bitter taste in our mouths. We had just come from Hilton Village in Waikiki where we had paid far less for a room and had been treated wth amazing hospitality. The prices for food etc were ridiculous at the Hilton also but there were other otpions within walking distance so I guess this didn't effect us as much. The Turtle Bay Resort is a great location and the rooms were big and clean. I guess in a place like this we just expected a nicer staff and reasonable prices (there are so many families staying there - how do they afford it!?!)

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the sunsets alone”
Reviews.Author: ParkerRules
