Reviews.Content: I keep thinking about this resort. Spent extra for the private cabanas on the beach, but worth every penny. The views from your own hammock are breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore Weddings & Flowers at the Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: PAshford00
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a destination wedding here at the Turtle Bay Resort (yes, a wedding in Hawaii-how original=D) and struggled to arrange flowers from so far away. I tried searching online for florists and couldn't get any helpful info about pricing or what I could expect for arrangements. My husband had traveled to TBR earlier this year and I gave him a laundry list of wedding to-dos to check on, no luck on flowers again. We went to Costco to try to fo our own flowers, the flowers were not the freshest. At the last hour on the day before our wedding we checked out the florist at the hotel. Liz Requilman at North Shore Weddings & Flowers at TBR was able to come through for us. She provided a gorgeous bouquet and floral arrangements for us at a very reasonable rate. She was so kind and cheerful, she obviously loves what she does because the flowers were done so well. I highly recommend Liz and her services. I called her my floral godmother!!

Reviews.Title: “every day in paradise”
Reviews.Author: maye19
Reviews.Content: recently spent a week at Turtle Bay Resort and it was the best week in paradise I've ever had. The staff was friendly and helpful from the time we arrived, until check out. the breakfast buffet was fresh and different every morning. Had a great time on the horseback ride, and also the shaka kayak tour; We got to see sea turtles every day, and even monk seal mom and pup on the beach near the resort. rented a car in honolulu upon arrival, and planned great day trips from turtle bay. Just all around excellence and I plan on returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “dream come true.”
Reviews.Author: clecklass
Reviews.Content: We arrived at TB resort after 3 days stay at Royal Lahaina Maui and what a contrast! So very clean and so easy to find your way around. We were given a room on the 6th floor of the west wing which i requested from home by e.mail (as recommended on trip advisor ) it was fabulous, comfortable and offered gorgeous sunrise and sunset views. We enjoyed 7 dreamy days/nights here and will definitely return. This was our 1st visit to Hawaii to celebrate our joint 50th birthdays so we explored Oahu rather than take advantage of the resort facilities. On our next visit we will explore TB resort with nice gentle coastal walks and plenty of poolside relaxation. Our only slight disappointment was how early the outdoor bar stopped serving (22.00 hrs) so our nightcap was had on the balcony rather than by the waves. Hang Ten Bar we think could be more flexible with times and trust the customers to be the adults they are. We ate at Ola's and had our table on the beach. fabulous food and a great dining experience. We also ate at leonardos this was a lovely restaurant but the food was average. My lasting dreamy memory is being sat on a sun lounger with a yummy Mai Tai in hand, watching the surfers and thinking life could not be better. I left my heart in Turtle bay and hope it won't be long before I can go back for it.

Reviews.Title: “Got married here last April. Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FULLYLACED
Reviews.Content: We were able to prepay and stay in the beach cottages for about $320/night and it was worth every penny. Plenty of space, beachfront view and updated island modern furniture. The concierge was amazing and the week-long stay leading towards our wedding date was stress-free and comfortable. The entire property is huge and we had a great time on the segway tour and tennis courts which were a few steps away. If youre a surfer (which I'm not), the waves are consistently grand. If you enjoy watching, theres a great spot to spectate with stadium style seating. All in all, if you want a more secluded Island experience away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, this is the getaway for you.

Reviews.Title: “Activities, Accommodations and Views”
Reviews.Author: SpokaneNancy
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 3 days and 3 nights at this resort after 7 long days in Waikiki. Our room was ocean front, sunrise view, overlooking the smaller bay. Ocean swells had changed so the bays had great wave activity and the surfers were great to watch. The rooms have understated decor, comfortable bed but could have used another comfortable chair for evening lounging. A great amenity would have been a full-length mirror and better shower heads. Besides having the small bay for swimming and the lovely pool area, we had a fabulous time on the Segway and Kayak tours. These are separate activities and unique. We were lucky enough to have the guide to ourselves for the Segways which are awesome. Our guide so knowledgeable and friendly, was thorough in our training and our 90 minutes seemed to fly. We toured the forests, beaches, around and across the golf course, got to see a Monk Seal and movie and TV locations. We would do it again, although spendy. Kayak Tour was with our friends. Learning curve was quick, having wave action was great, and I am wary of the ocean, but it was safe fun and the instructor/guides were helpful. We got to see the turtles, ride waves, and have fun! Resort has great dining experiences and and options for indoors, outdoors by the pool, on the beach etc. My big disappointment in the resort was the lack of branded resort beach items and women's clothing as I bought none in Waikiki and had to settle for airport shopping. Resort staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in need of updating, some service issues”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Turtle Bay Resort and loved the location and the laid-back vibe of the resort. It was busy while we were there, but it never seemed too crazy. The beach was relatively uncrowded early in the mornings and the pool seemed to clear out in the late afternoons. I really loved how everyone gathered in the evenings to watch the surfers and the sunset. The location is really almost magical and it is what makes this resort worth the price. We had an ocean-front deluxe room which afforded an amazing view accompanied by the sounds of crashing waves all night. Perfect for sleeping! The main part of the room seems to have been renovated somewhat recently, but the bathrooms obviously had not. As others have noted, the bathroom was very dark and everything was very outdated, though it was clean. The beds were very comfortable and our request for feather-free pillows and comforter were accommodated quickly. Much of the staff was very friendly and efficient. The valet retrieved our car very quickly and housekeeping was very fast. Service in the restaurants and at the pool, however, is terrible, with the exception of Ola, the beach-front restaurant, which was a great place for lunch. We had the breakfast buffet in the mornings and that was by far the best food service we had during our stay. Coffee was brought and refilled quickly, but the staff seemed harried, even thought he dining room was rarely full. At the pool, you had to be served by one of the servers. For some reason, you could not order and receive a drink directly from the bar. We were able to order drinks from the bar, but had to wait for them to be brought to us by the pool. Very strange. We had two dinners at the resort - one at Leonardo's, the Italian restaurant, and one at 21 Degrees North, the "fine-dining" restaurant - and service and each was seriously lacking. At Leonardo's, we made reservations and were seated at 8pm. We then waited for almost 20 minutes before anyone stopped to take drink orders or bring us bread or water. My husband had gotten up to ask the hostess if there was a problem when the waiter finally arrived at our table. When I told him my husband had just gotten up to inquire about the service, he asked if he should just come back when my husband returned. I told him that probably wouldn't be such a good idea and asked that he go ahead and bring our drinks. It took quite a while for us to get our drinks and appetizer, and then even longer for us to get our food. The food was good, basic red sauce Italian, but not great. The next night we ate at 21 Degrees North. The atmosphere at this restaurant is certainly more upscale, all adults, and actually quite sophisticated. Unfortunately, we had service problems similar to those the night before. We made reservations and were seated at 8pm. The dining room was not very busy. We were brought water quickly, but then again waited at least 20 minutes for our waiter to appear. He only seemed to be serving two other tables, so I'm not sure what the issue was. We joked that perhaps he was also cooking. Once he took our order and brought the drinks, service was much smoother, but making a table wait for 20 minutes before initial contact is really unacceptable. The food here was excellent though. We opted to eat in Haleiwa the third night. Overall, I loved Turtle Bay because of the location, and I would probably stay here again. The hotel was beginning renovations in the lobby while we were there and I hope these renovations eventually extend to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buggiewmn
Reviews.Content: We went to Turtle Bay for our honeymoon. We arrived late and got to our room and we were really disappointed. The room was large but was furnished with very little furniture. It could have easily fit a love-seat, end table and lamp to fill the space. The bathroom was large as well with a huge closet but out of date. It needed some sprucing up. The large king sized bed was very very comfortable. The resort was going through a remodel of some of its restaurants and as a result your options were more limited. They did have Hang 10 open later to compensate a wee bit. The resort made up points the next day and the rest of our trip. The resort was on the most perfect northshore location. Great views all around. our balcony was large and had an ocean view. Our stay included breakfast at the buffet.was amazing! Fresh-to-order omelets or egss, fluffy warm waffles, a great side selection that varied slightly every morning, fresh fruit, juices. I would recommend it to everyone who stays. It is expensive if it is not included in your stay, about 28.00, but as a result we didn't eat a big meal until dinner because of the choices and options that they provide. Tip included also for us too. We really liked that with your stay you get 1 hour each day of free snorkeling down at the beach and that you could rent surf boards and other sea equipment right there on site. The Adventure center was unique as they can set you up with segways, scooters, helicopter tours, horseback riding and much more. Overall we had a really great time at the resort. For us the aesthetic of the room was really upsetting and disappointing as we were expecting more, but the location of the resort and the daily activities certainly make up for some of that. We are interested in their remodel and would like to go back in the future and see what changed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable but tired”
Reviews.Author: ted2dale
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given room that safe and phone did not work, luckily they could move us to another ocean view room on 5 th floor. Room was large, could have had a comfy chair to fill up some empty space. Balcony was very tiny, room for 1 chair, kinda scary with wind blowing so hard. The hotel started renovations day we got there so some things were not open. Loved walking along the beach and looking for shells. Hotel interior is old and tired feeling, carpet depressing in halls. We did enjoy the Lion Coffee in our room however; it is the best. Staff was helpful and friendly, and cleanliness was evident. Orchids in bowl to take for your hair were at front desk and were nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok...”
Reviews.Author: alohamommy1
Reviews.Content: We are local and live on Oahu. We decided to stay at Turtle Bay for the weekend and got a great rate during their online sale. We called before driving over to see if there was a room available early and they were very accomodating on the phone. When we arrived, I found the front desk staff to be unfriendly and actually ignored me while I was waiting directly infront of them to check in. The valet and bell men were friendly and nice, however it took nearly 30 minutes to receive our bags. I know it doesnt seem like a long time, however the hotel was quite small and it didnt seem busy. Our room had a nice ocean view (i think all the rooms do), but it wasn't as clean as I would have liked it to be. The carpet felt really dirty underfoot, sticky~ possibly from the salt air? The room definitely needed refreshing- new carpet, paint etc. the bathroooms are outdated, old and very DARK! My 4 year old asked "mommy, is this a junk hotel?"... I absolutely adored the spa boutique which carried a bunch of beautiful yoga outfits and beach attire. And the toiletries in the room are TDF! I normally won't touch the hotel toiletries, but these were special and had a yummy coconut lime scent! Very tropical! The pool is average, and the on-site restaurants weren't that appealing. We drove to Ted's Bakery down the road near sunset beach, it's a hole in the wall, run down building, but they had yummy take out and pastries. We ate at Hukilau Cafe, it was crowded and not air conditioned, but the food is good and service fast. All in all, TBR was worth the discounted price I paid to stay here. This was a quick weekend getaway for our family. If you are thinking of paying their regular prices I would highly suggest looking at the Turtle Bay Ocean Villas that are across the hotel, they look alot newer! Or maybe look into a private vacation rental. If you are looking for a pristine, well maintained, lush resort this is NOT it. If you are looking for a resort on Oahu, try ihilani or your best bet is probably another island!! I forgot to mention the resort fee, which is a daily fee for local calls, newspaper, self parking and internet. It will be added to your final bill. And beware of the in room movies, if you accidental push an incorrect button you may order a movie. Once the button is hit the movie is automatically ordered, unlike most places where it confirms your choice. Once it is placed, your stuck. I tried calling the front desk but they said movies are ordered through their cable company not through them, so there was no possibility of cancelling the order even after a few seconds....

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: scottrn1
Reviews.Content: Not quite the way it's seen in Sarah Marshall. About 1 hour drive outside of honaloulou. Really nothing around except for the resort. Resort is nice but slightly dated. Lots of rocks and not the calm pristine beaches of Waikiki. Stayed in one of the private bungalows which is the only was to go. Very quiet and beautiful. Overall nice but a little too remote for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: bberquist
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is a little older, that have got a lot going for them. Very relaxing, great customer service, and good restaurants. I only wish that we could have stayed longer because we did not have enough time to explore all the opportunities they had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: DenverBiscuit
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort. It was nice to get away from hectic Waikiki. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. The resort is beautiful and every room as far as we could tell had an ocean view. I loved it here! The food on the resort is very expensive, but everything we had was very good. I thought it was a nice touch that the resort offered 1 free hour a day for us to use the snorkel gear. I saw several sea turtles right in their bay! My only complaint was the Hans Hedemann surf school. My husband and I really wanted to learn how to surf and our instructor was not the most friendly. We got some tips on land then went out to the water. He kept checking his watch and while their were only 3 of us in the group lesson we each only got 5 times to try and catch a wave. Each of us did stand up at least 1 time. We then headed in. Once we returned my husband noticed that we didn't even get a full 2 hours. I wish we had researched this better....for all of you interested they have some great instructors not far from the resort if you have a car. They will teach you how to surf and make sure that you catch several waves and want you to have a good time. Just look for signs along the road. Most will not even charge you if you can't catch a wave or don't have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “They've forgotten Sarah Marshall!”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel but an awful greeting/first impression. Expecting a 'hello, welcome to the Turtle Bay' I got "credit card please"...I'm not kidding..that's the welcome I got after 10 hour flight and long drive to the North shore. I shook it off and settled into the otherwise wonderful resort. Busy, bustling and buzzing. The pool/pool bar and surrounds were a great vibe and the Mai Tai bar was too good (couldn't avoid it:) Rooms overlooking the ocean were sensational and the experience in total was just as I'd hoped. The restaurants were great and plenty of options to enjoy the sun, surf and sand.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Touches & Comfort in Austere, Slightly Shabby Room”
Reviews.Author: LLDearness
Reviews.Content: We were happy to find an online rate of $183/night (add $25/night resort fee & 13% taxes) for our 4th floor Junior-suite sized room. The room was a surprising mix of high-end luxury touches & comforts and furnishings that were a bit battered and sparse. We had a general sense of having received one of the 'cheap' rooms that was pending renovation. Not the normal result we get when we're fortunate to discover excellent Internet / shoulder-season rates. Luxury touches & comforts - great king bed, deep & wide balcony; rounded railing is comfy for surf watching, marble flooring is cool to the feet for summer days, separate dressing room, super comfortable webbed chairs, wide tub for soaking baths & excellent shower head with outstanding water pressure & plenty of hot water. Lovely tropical bath soaps, shampoo & lotion. Privacy sign was consistently respected - an almost unheard of event anywhere else! After the first couple of days, I could nap without concern! The restaurants were uniformly gorgeous, staffed with personable, competent wait-staff who served pleasing entrees that were competitively priced with other in-hotel restaurants on Oahu/Honolulu and without long lines. Ditto the coffee service bar in the lobby. Service personnel were consistently polite, friendly and prompt. We used valet parking, bellmen, cleaning service, calls to housekeeping, dining & spa reservations, towel service by the pool and shopped in both gift shops. Janice at the spa delivered the best scrub experience I've ever received (their Signature chocolate/coffee). I wasn't comfortable during the Pineapple pedicure - no spa chair so the soaking angle was awkward for the 10 min soak; I was self conscious in just a robe in their unisex, public, outdoor spa area where the world walks by. I would have gladly sacrificed the view for more foliage. We didn't click into the value of the Enterprise Rental car booth in the lobby until after we'd left; I was a tag-along on my husband's business trip & carless most days. Another benefit added by this resort. We enjoyed Giovanni's Shrimp truck on the main highway north of the resort for fabulous & generous shrimp plates with 2 couple of fragrant rice ($13/plate). We adored our day & night at the Epcot-like Polynesian Culture Center (also in North Shore), their luau with traditional hula dances & their acclaimed & dramatic evening play "Ha: Breath of Life". We found the hibiscus hedges & variety of palm trees & flowers along the coastal highway one of the best experiences we've ever encountered on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best honeymoon spots!!!”
Reviews.Author: famezzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 days on our honeymoon trip. We booked a beach front cottage and we request fot a king bed. The fist day there wasn't availability of a king beach front cottage, so they gave us a beach front cottage with 2 queens, and they said to give us a king beach front cottage the next day, as they did. The first cottage was just ok. It was a little smelly. The maid came and tried to freshen it up. Ok these cottages have almost the same amenites with king beach front cottages. Next day we moved to king beach front cottage and it was awesome! It has all the amenites of a five star hotel. The cottages also have a pair of umbrellas for the sudden rain. The maids and concierge people were very helpful. The view from the lanai is breathtaking. The resort is really nice. It is one of the best hotel i have ever been. The grounds and swimming pool area are great. HangTen's cocktails and food are delicious. We ate at Ola restaurant too. The food is good but not impressive. North Shore is really nice, we liked it very much. We hope we have again the change to visit this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Belfastgal1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. Beautiful rooms, food good and lots of space at the swimming pool and beaches. Very clean rooms with lots of space and stunning views. The service staff were lovely and very friendly. Bit far out so if you want to see some of the island, really need to get a car which you can hire at the resort. Recommend Ted's Bakery!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Blissful Place”
Reviews.Author: seabrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just about perfect for our trip. Here are my pro's and con's from our experience. Pro's: 1. Beautiful hotel and amenities. Comments of out-dated decor are unfounded. 2. Amazing view of both sunrise and sunset over the waves from the hotel grounds. 3. Studio room was spacious, clean, and modern. 4. Wireless was included, which usually wins big good-will points with me. 5. located conveniently near the north shore and PCC. Since we didn't care about the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, the isolated location was perfect. 6. I took the surf lessons. Jamie was a great instructor and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Con's: 1. None of the on-site restaurants are family budget friendly. This is not a huge deal because we prefered hitting Ted's Bakery for breakfast and various beach stands for lunch. If you plan to stay more than a few days and/or need more space than a studio, you probably get more value from the Turtle Bay Condos. We were actually in the process of reserving a condo when the price of a hotel room went down below 200/nt, so we took it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a big deal - an over priced Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tat3r
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort bc there certainly is a lot of hype about it. I even made it the last stop in our 3 island trip thinking I was saving the best for last, but it was in fact the least impressive of 4 resorts. The hotel, at first impression, is like an average Holiday Inn. The rooms are probably on par with a Holiday Inn Express. Every bit of the grounds is taken up by the structure of the hotel, not much left for natural beauty - which also leads to lots of people, like a Waikiki hotel on the North Shore. The grounds were boring, only color was green, where the heck are all the flowering plants I saw at every other hotel & throughout the islands? A resort fee of $25 per day as well, comes with wifi & daily snorkel use for 2 people for 1 hour per day (thats kinda lame - 1 hour, really?!) So, we thought it was boring. Go to the Royal Hawaiian instead, much more beautiful & service is fantastic. If you go to the Big Island, go to the Fairmont Orchid, it's what a resort should look like, simply paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time At Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 5 nights at the end of our month long trip around the US and Canada. We had a basic room which are very large clean and tidy with a nice view of the ocean. The rooms were so nice and quiet, we didn't hear anyone in the rooms around us. We had a bad experience with a taxi driver, trying to get to Turtle bay so I really think this resort should offer some kind of reasonably priced shuttle service. They do offer a service but the cost was going to be around $160. Taxis cost around $130 to get you from the airport to Turtle Bay anyway. On the way back we booked a fixed price taxi ($85), which I got from the Oahu forum here on Trip Advisor. I can't for the life of me remember the name of this guy, but if you search for fixed price taxi in the forums, you'll come across him. Definitely the way to go. The resort is beautiful with lots of food options so you could not leave the resort if you didnt want to. When we first arrived we went to the bar around the pool but found the prices a little too much and the food options not so great so decided to explore. We went to look at the golf course and came across Lei Lei's which overlooks the Fazio golf course. Once we found Lei Lei's we never left. Lei Lei's is not part of the actual resort but is on the grounds and just a few minutes walk. This place has awesome food, reasonably priced drinks and the best staff - all staff were so friendly and really made this place. One night we met the manager of Ola's, he was having dinner there - what does that say! The other thing we loved about this place was that there weren't tourists there, it was all locals. We met so many nice people here night after night. We took an off road segway tour which I have to say the price was a bit steep at $99 each for a one hour tour but was the best thing we did. We were the only people booked on the tour so we had a private tour and those things are so fun to ride and it was beautiful to ride through the trails around the resort property. The resort property is so big that there are various walking trails you can take - some quick and easy, others a bit longer but the trails are all marked so you don't get lost. There are also a heap of quiet beaches that you can walk to around the property if you prefer the ocean to the pool. We did a ATV tour at Kualoa Ranch which is where lots of movies and tv shows are filmed. It's a beautiful place and you should go and visit. If you don't have a car to get around you can hire mopeds. But if you don't feel safe doing this, Oahu has a bus system called The Bu and it only costs $2 one way. There are a few different buses but basically you can go around the whole island on the bus. Just be aware there are LOTS of stops so a trip that would take 15 mins to drive there can take 30-45mins on the bus but it's a great, cheap method of transport. The bus has a stop on the turtle bay property and you can get timetables online or from the front desk. I really loved it here and the Northshore was beautiful and if I came back to Oahu I would definitely go back to Northshore and Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential...Okay but could be so much more!”
Reviews.Author: PearlCItyMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle bay resort for one night over the Labor day weekend with a local Hawaii Resident rate of $205. This resort is great for those that live on island because when you're here you don't feel like you're on the busy island of Oahu.. BUT it could be so much more. The service is just okay. Many folks from our party noted that they waited by the pool for over three hours before anyone came to ask them if they wanted to order something. Other folks complained that the shuttle service to and from the golf course never came after requesting for over 15 minutes. If the service was just a little better, this resort/hotel could be five star fabulous. The grounds are beautiful, nothing else like it on Oahu, they have a great golf course, and the golf course resturaunt is fabulous. The food served at the pool is also delicious (if you can get someone to serve you). One thing that did bother us was the breakfast buffet. There used to be child prices and adult prices. Now its' just the same price whether or not your are 4 years old or 44 years old. So puzzling because we know families that specifically avoided eating there because of this. There is no way a 4 year old kid is going to eat $28 or so worth of food.. Anyway, we may come back, just because options outside of waikiki are limited. But if you are coming from off island and want to stay away from Waikiki, unless you really want to be near the north shore, I'd look into the Ko Olina Marriott hotel instead. You get a much nicer room and amenities for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Soteria
Reviews.Content: The location is off the beaten tourist area of Waikiki. It was just what we wanted - a quiet place to chill at the end of a long year. We stayed at the villa that comfortably accommodated nine people - my family of five and two sets of grandparents. It was the perfect place for family bonding and the kids to grow closer to their grandparents. The backdrop of the ocean waves and stunning sunsets made for the ideal picture postcard and 'wish you were here' vacation! Eating places in the area were mediocre but then again my family is made up of a bunch of 'foodies' who 'live to eat'! We made up for it by buying food from the grocery store and had a good time whipping up meals together.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lpaoli23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one of the most peaceful spots in the US. It is expensive, but it is worth the extra money to get a beachside villa. Snorkel with the turtles and just relax at this resort. Also, you can save money by not eating every meal at the hotel but instead heading about 5-10 minutes down the road to Ted's Bakery. It's a local dive but it has amazing food, huge portions, and the best Haupia Pie!

Reviews.Title: “What a dream!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalparadise1106
Reviews.Content: So much to say about this place. Everything was beautiful...from rooms to grounds, to views. Great snorkeling and turtles viewable at turtle bay at any time of day. Great surfing. I did not, but other guests spotted seals on several occasions. Several pools, bars, restaurants, stores. Activities desk if needed. We received complimentary champagne...don't know why...but it was great. Was pricey, but worth every dollar. Much more here than for comparable prices in waikiki. It is on north shore, so many activities might be far. Short drive (10-25min) to grocery, restaurants locally. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel that needs to be polished”
Reviews.Author: jacobaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for a week so we could attend our granddaughters' graduation from a North Shore high school. We arrived late after 23 hours of travel and had a speedy check in, but when shown to our room, I pulled the drapes to see the ocean. Alas, no ocean even though we had booked ocean front. Our view was a roof full of debris. This roof also housed the airconditioners. Off, in a small corner , one could see the ocean by an adundant stretch of the neck. I called the front desk and told them that this was not what we had booked. To their credit, they immediately changed the room and sent staff to help us move. The second room had a magnificent view and a small balcony. The room was light and airy and a good size. There was a coffee set up and a small refrig. The common areas of the resort are just beautiful. There is plenty of seating in the lobby and a coffee bar to enjoy. There are also copies of the NYTimes and the Wall Street Journal. The resort is set in a gorgeous place and the views are awesome everywhere you look. The restaurants are fine but nothing special. However, since there are several restaurants, one can choose from a typical beach grill or Italian. The breakfast buffet is quite nice, though pricey. Prepare to pay $26 pp for breakfast. The individual rooms show wear in a resort that was built decades ago. Our room had stains on the upholstered chairs. Some chairs were also ripped and had stuffing hanging out. The knobs on the closet doors kept coming off. The vents were rusty and needed a redo. The telephone near the bed did not work. The sliding doors to the balcony needed major muscle to open. The beds were comfortable and seemed to be updated. There is evidence that Turtle Bay was once a 5 star resort but today, I would give it a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, great amenities and services, a few problems and a little on the high end ...”
Reviews.Author: Army_Dude
Reviews.Content: Staying on North Shore was definitely the way to go for the wife and I. Turtle Bay Resort is absolutely beautiful. The beach was not much for swimming in my opinion, but I did spend a little time out there snorkeling and wading in the ocean. Most of the beach in the area is surrounded by rock and coral putting most people in the same general locations. Regardless, it was a great location. I was a little disappointed with the parking. As guests of the resort I was hoping we would have priority parking over the general public, however, when we returned from our day excursions throughout Oahu, we often would have difficulty finding an open place to park. The general public can park in the lot the same as guests, and the beaches are public so the privacy encourages people from outside the resort to come. Additionally, I was greatly disappointed to find several of whom I assumed to be tourists doing drugs in the parking lot. As my wife and I were walking to our vehicle to go to Honolulu, we had the strong scent of marijuana float across the parking lot and later saw a few stoners with what I assumed was a marijuana cigaratte coughing it up. Aside from this the only other issue I had in my week stay was on billing - I was charged for my private surf lesson three times in the initial bill. I believe the issue has since been resolved, but because I had a flight to catch I had to complete the billing on good faith as the front desk could not complete the billing until the concierge desk returned from the evening. Expect to pay to eat at the resort. Alcoholic beverages cost me on average $10 each, and meals cost me on the low end $50-60 for dinner for two. I did pay over $100 for a dinner for two at 21 North. I recommend stocking your fridge for an extended stay or there are nice places to dine in Hale Iwa. These issues may dissuade you, but know our stay was the best we've had in a long time (on par with our stay at the Willard). I would definitely go again to the Turtle Bay Resort. The location was great, we enjoyed the sunsets on the beach, surfing, horseback riding, kayaking, snorkeling, etc. All of this is available on the beautiful North Shore and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Sorry no photos at this time, but you can watch "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" as much of the movie was filmed on location at the Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “A very scenic location with amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Susan N
Reviews.Content: This resort on the North Shore of Oahu is located in a very beautiful and private setting. The resort offers alot of amenities, most of which cost additional money. Very nice pool area and beach, several restaraunt choices, very laid back atmosphere. Fun to watch the surfers in Turtle Bay. Restaraunts are a bit overpriced however but it's isolated area limits your options.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Jed P
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel located in an otherwise depressed area of Oahu. Most rooms have spectacular views with one small exception - the conference center is located on the ocean side of the hotel. The view from my floor-to-ceiling windows of my "Ocean Front" room was somewhat spoiled by the view of the expansive roof of the conference center. Get a room on the upper floors so the view of the roof is less intrusive. Keep in mind you are at a resort with resort pricing. The breakfast buffet was $26.95 per person. Even I cannot eat enough food to make that worth while. Go to Lei Leis. Its part of the country club. The menu is limited but affordable. Read the fine print, there is a $25 per day "Resort Fee" which is not included in the room rate. It didn't buy much. If you plan to use a wake board, buy one at a local surf shop. They are about $10 to purchase and $10 per day to rent from the hotel. I donated mine to the hotel at the end of my trip. The woman told me most of the ones they provide were left behind by guests of the hotel. So why weren't they free to use? There are no bars or restaurants in the area, so the hotel is your only option for food and drink. Go off-site to the area beaches. They are incredible. There are at least 10 within 15 minutes of the hotel. Lastly, there is a heliport at the hotel. Take the 40 minutes helicopter ride. Its worth every penny. You'll get to see the entire island from 2,000 feet. Overall I was very pleased. The property is very lush and tropical. The staff is very helpful & friendly. Well worth the money even with the additional Resort Fee.

Reviews.Title: “Cold clientele for such a warm place”
Reviews.Author: revolvedtriangle
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks with my brother, who lives in Honolulu. I love the quiet of the North Shore, as well as the respect people have here for the culture and the terrain. I booked 2 nights at Turtle Bay on a weekend when my brother was working. I'm a New Yorker and a full time yoga instructor. I know how to mingle and be quiet! The families kept to themselves, the women with men held tight and the singles were arrogant! The staff was a gift, especially the bartender in 21 (Allison?), as well as the same sex couples. If it weren't for them, there would be no interaction here in this absolutely beautiful location. Hotel is above average, but nothing special. Beach area small and rocky. I'm comfortable alone but the last night's meal...."Pity Party, table for 1!" Couldn't wait to get back to Waikiki and the beautiful freaky people!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: pochen9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the cottages - couldn't be closer to the ocean and a front row seat to every sunset. We intentionally wanted to be on the North Shore away from the hustle of Waikiki and near the beaches up north. We spent one day down in that rat race and were so happy with that decision. Admittedly the north shore is not packed with great restaurants, etc, but if the ocean and peace and quiet are what you want, it's great. BTW - we were perfectly happy with the Turtle Bay restaurants. And the local joints were fun too. The cottages have a small frig to keep snacks and drinks in as well. Overall, it was a great set up. The resort was apparently a bit run down when Hilton sold it a couple years ago but the new owners have really done a nice job making it into a destination site. There are no other hotels up on the North Shore and even it there were, current regs would never let them be sited so close to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous - worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Mom22NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Turtle Bay with husband and 2 girls ages 5 and 11. Rented a beach cottage which was beyond fabulous! The grounds were beautiful, the room was impeccable. Lovely fruit each morning. One caveat - don't expect to sit on the beach outside the beach cottage as it is mainly rocks and rough surf but gorgeous to look at and the sunsets are perfect. The pools onsite are great. There is a very large one which was quite chilly but then the smaller (4 feet deep) one with the water slide is warm and so much fun! We spent hours here and then went to the beach in the front of the resort where we got beach mats, umbrellas and lounger chairs for free. Towels were also given by the resort. Breakfast buffet is very nice, good food, not always hot. Service is spotty though - look for Sandra, a French American woman who is very accommodating and happy to be there. Lunch around the pool is over priced (as expected) and mediocre. Leave the ground for 30 mins and hit up a shrimp truck instead! Dinner at Leonardo's though was wonderful - twice! The gnocchi and the linguine and clams were both incredible. Horseback riding onsite was also nice, wish it were longer than 40 mins. If you are going to Waikiki, stay here last. We found this so relaxing and then went to Waikiki and were shell-shocked!

Reviews.Title: “I should have researched more before going here.”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter05070
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is beautiful, the people who work there are really nice, and the rooms are lovely. But the place is absolutely, positively jam packed with people--thousands of them. It's also incredibly expensive, but I knew that before I arrived. I was surprised at the size of the resort, since I was thinking that a resort on the North Shore would be reflective of the place. But it's huge, and it reminds me of a cross between the Great Wolf Lodge chains of family resorts and Sandals. Which is probably not what they were going for. I wouldn't stay here again, and I couldn't really recommend it. I felt like i was nickeled and dimed nonstop. I will say that the staff was incredibly nice, helpful, and bent over backward to accommodate our special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: travelingbl0nde
Reviews.Content: The views from this place can't get better! Waking up every morning to the ocean, mountains and pool! Fantastic! Cocktails near the pool are good. Sunsets are amazing. I had no problems with in room internet (I'd read some things saying it didn't work great but it was fine for me). The not so great if you're there for touristy stuff (I wasn't) you'll have quite a drive/bus ride ahead of you. The nearest anything is about 10-15 minutes away if not farther. Parking leaves something to be desired. The room wasn't super clean. Hairs in the bathtub upon arrival, eek! Mentioned to the front desk staff that the first afternoon/evening I was there it sounded like furniture was being moved (I really thought they might be rearranging the rooms) the response I got was that there were a lot of honeymooners in the building. Really?? Overall a great trip. Kinda pricey for what you get but who can put a price on relaxation and gorgeous sites!

Reviews.Title: “Still an amazing place to visit....”
Reviews.Author: Mombo1966
Reviews.Content: Family and friends joined us for our 40th anniversary at Turtle Bay. We stayed there once before and were not disappointed when we returned last month. Fantastic place, super service (the staff could not have been more wonderful), gorgeous location, best pool I've ever seen, and great food in all the restaurants that we visited. Turtle Bay is not known for its luxurious rooms - they look a bit worse for the wear, but the beds are comfy and the TVs are good, and the bathrooms are spacious. Our view of the pool, from our balcony, was lovely and the place was really quiet, in spite of being full (as far as we could see). We rode horses one day - a delightful experience with good guides - and my husband played two rounds of golf. We'd strongly recommend parasailing as a fun activity, and the concierge can steer you to the appropriate place in Honolulu. All in all, a super visit. We look forward to another visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jst123
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the north shore of oahu because our son moved there and it's the only resort around. We were very pleasantly surprised. Our villa was beautiful with a gorgeous view of the ocean. The staff were friendly and helpful and the pools were nice. The breakfast buffet was terrific, but the food at Ola was ok at best (although an amazing setting on the beach) and Lei Lei was not good at all. The food was disappointing, but unless you want to travel to every meal you need to eat on property. Overall though, a very good experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners would not return- thanks for the two queen beds”
Reviews.Author: JRJM710
Reviews.Content: To be honest I was very disappointed in my stay, and would not return or recommend going to Turtle Bay. I booked two separate packages and asked them to merge the two over a year in advance (never happened), to ensure the transitions would be smooth and easy. The packages included some amenities such as rental car (which had to be extended- thank you to enterprise for doing all the leg work to make that easier than expected), daily breakfast, chocolate covered strawberries & champagne (which I unexpectedly had to call and schedule for them to bring to the room), massages, kayaking tour, and a meal at 21 degrees north. After expressing it was my honeymoon (multiple times), our first room was 2 queen beds (rather than the King I requested). Which I was told could be changed the second day, the second day comes and they say it would be impossible to change because they are sold out. We also had to call to see when they were delivering the chocolate covered strawberries, kind of kills the romance/surprise. The kayaking tour was "eh", it would be really fun and excellent for a beginner. Part of the tour included hiking to spots my husband and I had already hiked at on the hotel property. SPA LUANA IS AMAZING! Our couples massage was romantic, relaxing and on a beautiful cabana on the beach, the spa offers lots of amenities before and after the service as well. The 5 course dinner at 21 degrees north was excellent, and they really took care of me by making accommodations for my food allergy, great service. Whenever there was any kind of error they would blame someone then say they would take care of it (and call us back), and we were never called back nor was anything taken care of. The pool was packed with families (lots of children under 12 in the hot tubs all day and all night), very little opportunities for romance or privacy anywhere outside the room. The pool bar/grill "Hang Ten" provided great service, great food, and some delicious drinks (get the Fish tacos!! sooooo good). Overall, the resort itself has beautiful views, but the staff is not helpful (sometimes not competent), and certainly not friendly (even though we were kind, friendly, and respectful). The restaurants (with the exception of "Ola") did provide great service and good food. The Spa had exceptional service, friendly staff, and great amenities. Seriously, not once during our entire stay did any employee acknowledge it was our honeymoon or a special occasion, and we got pretty much exactly what we paid for and nothing more (sometimes even less). I really expected more from such an expensive, well known resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dana Z
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take our daughters on a beautiful Hawaiian vacation. You never know what to expect until you get there. It was everything we were looking for and more. Beautiful location. The ocean surrounds the property. I don't think you can go wrong. I'm pretty picky when it comes to hotels. I highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: texas_sandnsun
Reviews.Content: First of all, I agree that the property is beautiful. The hotel has the potential to be amazing. But it falls short in multiple areas. This was our third trip to Hawaii. There was no aloha welcome. In fact, we were rushed out of the drive despite the fact we had the only car there at the time. Not one of the 3 attendants offered to help with our luggage. We made it to our room, which was mediocre at best. We had a deluxe ocean front room. The room was large but filled with worn furniture. All painted areas were scratched. The bathroom looked as though it was completed in the 70s. At night I could not see the beautiful grounds outside and immediately thought we had made a mistake. In the morning the hotel was somewhat redeemed by the beautiful grounds. The pool was frequently overrun with screaming kids. I never had trouble getting a lounge chair, but the chairs were old and uncomfortable. The views by the pool were amazing, especially at sunset. I did not find the hotel conducive to a romantic getaway. I thoroughly enjoyed the north shore experience but would not return to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property but fading rooms”
Reviews.Author: ehings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for four nights in August 2011. We enjoyed our stay and would return again. Pros: great views from every room, huge property with wonderful trails to explore, plenty of activities, great pool area, easy parking, excellent sunset watching location. Cons: condition of rooms in main hotel includes chipping walls, rusty vents, and dirty marble floors, expensive restaurants, difficult wifi setup in room and lack of central wifi, some rooms have connecting doors between rooms that lets a lot of noise in. Overall, we would return again, but the owners must quickly renovate the rooms. The property is too gorgeous to waste on subpar rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyhere
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking from the moment you drive onto the property. The lobby has a spectacular view of the ocean. The west wing views were either ocean view or pool side/part ocean. The resort was well equipped to handle fun... Surfing, kayaking, snorkeling, scuba, swimming, beach, golfing, horseback riding, hiking, tennis all on site. Great time had by the family. However be prepared to spend money. Will visit this resort again. Views are worth the trip...

Reviews.Title: “Felt like 'Real Hawaii'”
Reviews.Author: love_to_roam_pa
Reviews.Content: I think their motto is "True Hawaii" or something like that but it really fit. The surroundings made you feel like you were somewhere special. If you're looking for dinner options outside the resort, well, Honolulu it is not. There wasn't much to do close by. But dinner options in the resort itself were adequate. The sunsets on the North Shore were just ridiculous, so beautiful, and Turtle Bay had a hot tub situated so you could sit in the hot tub and watch the sunset. Very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie V
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful with amazing views of the ocean and pool. The pool is big and there are lots of activities to do if you choose to stay at the hotel. I took ukelele lessons and tried the shell hula and lei making which were a lot of fun. The service there is really great as well. Everyone is very friendly and happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bedroom Views”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh B
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for 3 nights before our 7 nights in crazy Waikiki. The rooms were very dated, I assumed being Hawaii it would be luxury and upper class but it felt like I was staying somewhere completely different. To win it over the views from our room were terrific and the grounds were just beautiful. Our best day was going to the Arnold Palmer gold course. It was just spectacular and a really good day. I would not have been able to stay a full week, after 3 days we decided there wasnt much else to do there anyway. Golf - Done. Most Restaurants-Done. That was about it really other than the beach. If your happy to do nothing and just look at the view and relax then this is perfect for you, we wanted to enjoy most of Hawaii so for us 3 days was plenty at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, but gorgeous surroundings”
Reviews.Author: HannahMumbai
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at Turtle Bay after watching Forgetting Sarah Marshall, but were so disappointed. When we arrived we received a nice greeting at check in and then were excited to get into our 'luxury' room. Geez, what a disappointment! The room looked like it hadn't been decorated since the 70's! There is little furniture so that there are big odd empty spaces and the furniture that was in there, was dated, scuffed and marked. My fiance went to reception to ask if we could be moved and came back with a new key card. We then walked to the next room full of expectation, only to enter a room which was filthy! There were marks on the chairs, rust on the fittings and the room smelt musty and damp. We moved to a third room after speaking to the manager who also advised that this was an upgrade, but I couldn't see how it was different from the first two although admittedly it was clean. We stayed here as we felt it was the best we were going to get. The grounds of the hotel are stunning and seeing the turtles so close is great, but it's so let down by the tired hotel. I understand the hotel to be part of the 'luxury collection' but really can't understand how it was included in this. The restaurants and activities on site were very expensive, although there is a decent amount on offer. Room service food was very good, but didn't enjoy the food at the bar at the golf course and thought the breakfast was incredibly expensive. I would not stay at this hotel again and nor would I recommend it to anyone (I liked).

Reviews.Title: “Potential for greatness”
Reviews.Author: LesRose
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a more unfriendly welcome at a hotel - there were four people at the counter when we checked in and only one other guest - no smiles, no Aloha, no welcome. Just finally a deadpan face says "can I help you?" - check in was so blase'. We did see a friendly face when the bellman lead us over to the cottage. No doubt about it this property is in a beautiful location and the cottages themselves are lovely inside. Though the cottages are not singular, they are sixplex units, they're very spacious, with dreamy beds to sleep on. Vaulted ceilings make it feel so airy and the wall of windows, the lanai and the ocean beyond are gorgeous. The desk area is good, nice comfy upholstered seating. The closets are miniscule but the bathroom is huge! The tub is bliss, plenty big for two - but the lack of a grab bar near either tub or shower in a bathroom is ludicrous, in one that is all slippery marble - idiotic. However it's a pretty bathroom. We had some issues with our privacy and the meaning of the 'privacy please' sign. We had issues with access, I have mobility restrictions and found much of the place to be inaccessible. It was not the best or worst of accessibility issues I've faced, but the simplicity of correction and the safety are items of importance for this hotel. Cars parked in the access aisle, construction, slow room service that delivered cold food. Staff members grumbled a lot about management - We enjoyed one fine meal at Ola, the restaurant on the beach - it was excellent, but second time not so good. Construction on our building was unnanounced - unnerving. The slip of lawn between the cottages and the beach are quite popular with people passing by. The cute little turtle sitting on the bed with the "I'm for sale" note - ahem, I think it's tacky to do that. The polyester bathrobe? Mini bar - the whole checklist and so on - key to get in - those are just awful, but ours would not unlock so that I could verify inventory. Sofa had dirty smelly cushions, but when housekeeping cleaned the room they clobbered the bathroom with chlorine bleach - whew! Last, but not least - why on earth is a hotel claiming to be a true Hawaiian experience not serving Hawaiian jam and jellies? Check out was a real chaotic time - rain caused trouble - staff was very grumpy and slow. Floors in the lobby were so slippery, not a rug in sight. While we did enjoy our cottage, the hotel itself needs to make some changes and adjustments. The potential is there, if someone would unlock it this place could be wonderful. The North Shore of Oahu is definitely a beautiful spot, worth spending time and focus on - it's another world from Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return next year”
Reviews.Author: NPOConsultant
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 nights at Turtle Bay, our first-ever trip to Hawaii. We had a fabulous time in every respect, and are already making plans to return for two full weeks next year. Yes, the room decor is a bit dated, and yes, the bathrooms need renovating - but we didn't come to Hawaii to hang out in our hotel room! Bed was great, bathrooms completely adequate, and the view from the lanai was heavenly. We spent most of our time hanging out at the pool being catered to by the Hang Ten staff. We ate in all of the restaurant, including a final nite chef's dinner at 21 Degrees North that was excellent. Our room rate included full breakfast buffet every day, and we took full advantage of that. Breakfast buffet is outstanding, with all the usuals plus fresh fruit, yogurt, homemade granola, etc. Staff was very friendly - not one less than wonderful experience. The only "negative" we'd add is that Turtle Bay can get really breezy. Some of the days we were there we had consistent 10-25 mph winds all day, which made the pool rather chilly. All in all, it was the best vacation we've ever had, and we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: Aikidoshi
Reviews.Content: This place really made us feel like we had gone to the right place: warm welcomes, great service and lovely views. The locatoin was fantastic: who needs a noisy city location when you can have uncrowded beach time, a great setting and wild sea turtle visits every day? Rooms are large and ocean front is definitely worth it. Lots of close attractions and not far from Haleiwa with its surfing culture and famous shave-ice. Plenty of activities on site too, at extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, primo staff”
Reviews.Author: ArthurLondon
Reviews.Content: There are no better beaches than the north shore of Oahu in the summer. The waves go away and the water is crystal clear. This is the only hotel to stay at to explore the area. It is great to stay up here so you can explore each beach like Pipeline, Sunset and Waimea early or late in the day when the daytrippers from Waikiki go home. The hotel itself sits on a beautiful point with water everywhere. Staff is very experienced and very friendly. Lobby is very open and relaxing. Nicest elevators anywhere. Rooms are very big and lanais are huge. Food is good but expensive. The only drawback is that the AC in the rooms and bathroom decor is dated. Took a surfing lesson at the hotel and the instructors were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good in general”
Reviews.Author: UKCathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Turtle bay resort, it was our first time to Hawaii and i'm glad we went North Shore its much nicer than Honolulu. We stayed at this resort mainly because it was easy for us to book being from Australia. However we did then go stay at a holiday house afterwards which was nice too. Being a hotel its just a room, but all of the rooms do look out at the sea which is nice. There isn't much distinction between the ordinary room or deluxe, one has a slightly larger lanai which is not worth the extra. Our room was nice enough, it will soon become dated. The outside of the hotel is a bit confronting it does not blend in at all with surroundings. Our only problem with the room was the toilet got blocked but think thats common of American style toilets. The maintenance were onto it straight away and reception called to follow up and cleaners came to clean up. We chose not to eat at the restaurants except around the pool. The staff were very friendly around the pool but the reception staff was snooty to me. The restaurants are overpriced and boring. We had a car so drove down to Giovannis shrimp truck and Shark cove grill, cheap and tasty! For breakfast we ate in our room we had granola and our own bowls. Really for the price and being five star they should include breakfast. They left a toy turtle on the bed as we had a young son, its a nice touch but of course the child wants the toy and it cost $20! I put it down to one of his only souvenirs. The pool area is great for kids and adults, nice little separate pools and spa and waterslide. The beach was a bit rough and no snorkelling like at other Haliewa beaches. My husband did the pilates class which he enjoyed, bit more vigorous than he's used too! We would stay here again. Lovely area.

Reviews.Title: “stunningly beautiful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamester1
Reviews.Content: This place is outstanding. It is placed in the most beautiful setting, on a peninsula between two bays (one for swimming, beaching and snorkelling, and the other for surfing, big waves and turtle viewing) and every room has a water view. How can you go wrong with that as a starting point? The pool area is lovely with lots of chairs for guests (no silly reserving of chairs needed). The beach area certainly could have used more lounge chairs and umbrellas, but it is large enough for the resort and quite a nice family swimming and snorkelling area. The restaurants are very good, and they have thoughtfully left substantial bar fridges in each room if you want to keep some provisions. The resort offers every type of activity imaginable, from golf to horseback riding, bike and kayak rentals, etc. The rooms are large and clean. They probably need an update, but you can't expect this to be done every year. They have been well maintained and they are quite nice, just not quite as great as the rest of the place. But why stay in your room anyway, when the hotel is so wonderful. I hate to share this secret, because it may get too crowded (and therefore expensive) but skip wakiki (except for a day or two to check it out), then grab a rental car and drive a measly 1 hour to the North Shore and enjoy the best that Oahu has to offer! And from Turtle Bay, you are a short drive to amazing scenery, great restaurants, neat little towns.....a bit closer to the real Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bratzj
Reviews.Content: We were married at Turtle Bay a couple weeks ago and had a fantastic experience! We stayed in a room in the main building the first few nights, and the rest of the time we had a cottage. Both had beautiful views of the mountains, water, and sky! Every restaurant has something different to offer, and the service at each one was great! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, the girls in the spa (which I visited multiple times) were all very friendly and professional and seemed to enjoy their jobs, and the concierges assigned to the cottages were so nice! Tiare did an excellent job planning th wedding and coordinating with is all the way from the Midwest, she is such an asset to your staff at TBR. If you are looking for a truly spectacular Hawaii experience, stay at Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ButchU
Reviews.Content: Saw the place in a movie- {Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Soul Surfer], and made reservations. Very expensive; nothing complimentary. We bought an all-inclusive package online, but still had to pay a daily resort fee. Because it's Hawaii, and on a beach, one would think that there would be more amenities as people do not stay in the rooms - like a welcoming lei, or a free meal, or a 4th night free on a multiple night stay. The resort offers 3 or 4 free "classes," but everything else is exorbitantly priced. Even the daily valet parking is ridiculous- $15.00 for a lot right next to the free lot. The resort is almost an hour away from Honolulu, Waikiki- etc. and there is no free shuttle from the airport. There are beautiful beaches nearby- Sunset Beach..So, renting a car, driving, hotel - can run into a few thousand dollars. You can do the same at a moderate hotel. The beach at Turtle Bay is also open to the public....what's the point? I'd stay again- but only at a deeply discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than Expected!! Will Be Back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TxMommyof2
Reviews.Content: I've been keeping an eye on these reviews for the past year, while planning our anniversary trip to TBR. To tell you the truth, I was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews. I wasn't sure what to expect, when it came to our room condition or the service we would receive from the staff. We just returned from a 5 day staff at the resort and I can tell you, it was amazing!!! The rooms... We stayed in a King Ocean Front Deluxe. I've seen several reviews about this hotel being outdated and I can tell you that I've seen worse (and paid more!). The only thing that was horribly outdated were the tissue box covers and the soap dishes on the bathroom counters...they are puke-yellow and probably original to the hotel. If you are going to let this affect your stay at the hotel or from booking a room at this hotel, you are missing out. For us, we weren't only paying for the room, but paying for the location of this resort...and after sitting in Honolulu traffic for 2hrs, the location of Turtle Bay made all the difference in the world :) The staff... Wonderful! While unloading our rental car and walking up to the hotel, we were greeted by several staff members who were leaving for the night. Everyone made eye contact and made conversation. The concierge desk went above and beyond to answer our questions about available activities, as well as booking them for us. Food... It can get pricey, but there are ways to avoid that. We frequently ate at The Bay Club, but we would split a meal and have drinks....the meals are plenty big to split and feel satisfied! There is a gift shop located at pool level that has snacks, drinks, alcohol, and sandwiches. The coffee bar in the lobby has affordable snacks and drinks as well. There's also a grocery store a little further north from the resort. Must See... If you are in the area, a must is Pearl Harbor of course! It's free to enter, as well as visit the USS Arizona Memorial. However, tickets are a first come, first serve basis, so get there early! If you find yourself having to wait for your time slot, there are free museums to tour. There's a couple of snacks bars that have pretty affordable snacks and drinks. The Polynesian Cultural Center was amazing! We booked through Turtle Bay and it was effortless! We did the late entry Luau and show and it was a wonderful experience! The Dole Plantation was a neat place to visit...not too much to do, but it was free to park and enter. Cute little shops set up around their grounds and very affordable meals. All in all, a wonderful trip and a wonderful stay at this resort! If I had to make a suggestion to the resort about improvements or even "warn" future guests, I would say that it would have been nice to have been "warned" about the weddings that were going to take place. Our room faced the ocean, but also overlooked the wedding area, which is beautiful. The first couple of weddings were very quiet and beautiful, but the last one was extremely loud. If we would have known about this at check in, we would have moved our plans around and would have been out to dinner or at the pool bar that night..but not knowing, we made plans to stay in that last evening, watch the sunset, and sleep with the door open so we could hear the ocean one last night. Instead, our hotel room started booming at sunset and didn't stop for a few more hours after that, however didn't last too late and their music taste was similar to our's, so we found ourselves singing along to most of the songs anyways ;) But I'd definitely recommend future guests to ask about your room location and weddings at check in so you can plan accordingly :) This resort has it all. You can have a romantic vacation or a family vacation! We will definitely be back and hopefully with our kids next time! A wonderful stay, thank you Turtle Bay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkipru
Reviews.Content: North Shore is beautiful however this hotel is a 2 star hotel charging 5 star prices! The 1st room was a ocean view room which faced a brick wall (no joke) when we entered the room the smell of bleach really chocked us! It made our eyes water so straight back down to the miserable receptionist to complain. She told us that house keeping would sort it out to which a maid came round with a bottle of lemon sprey (making the smell even worse!) We picked up the phone to report the problem again and demanded that we get moved to a different room. We finally got moved to the next room which had a strong urine aroma in the wardrobe! We decided to keep the bathroom doors shut and put up with it. The hotel is very basic considering what you pay, thank god we were only here for 3 nights! We ate at the hotel 1 night and never again! The couldn't even get Lasagne right! We had a car and found some really nice restaurants up the road. All I can say is that having stayed in lots of budget hotels, for a quarter of the price of Turtle Bay, you get better service and don't have to pay stupid $70 per day charges with attitude staff that are totaly rude. I would stay here again if they paid me to!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Lisa b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my 20 year old went there for a family vacation. It was beautiful. We loved the trials at the hotel. Food was good, but pricey. go into town and you can get great meals that are less expensive. Lots of families with young children. My 20 year old was bored, not enough to do for that age. Loved the room and view. Having 2 sinks was great! Lots of storage, and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very accommodating. If we go again it will be just me and my husband. We usually go to the all inclusive resorts at the Rivera Maya. Tons of stuff to do for everybody and it is gorgeous. My husband is a travel agent and wanted to see Hawaii for his clients. He would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Family”
Reviews.Author: pkmiles
Reviews.Content: The staff are very nice and accomodating. We have two small children, 20 months and 4 years of age and the hotel was able to help us with everything we needed, including a high chair. The suite we stayed in had a connecting room as well which is always a plus. We would recommend it to other families for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I will stick to Waikiki when on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: RicoSantaRosa_CA
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort was a disappointment. While the common areas, restaurants and bars were nice, the rooms were terribly dated. Carpet looked in need of a good scrubbing, if not replacement. The bathrooms looked literally like something out of a Motel 6: bad tile, beat up wood vanity and cabinets. The closets were made with cheap hanger rods that sagged and were badly repaired once (or more than once???) before. All in all, for the price and hype I expected more. Granted, it was business and I left after 3 nights for Maui and my timeshare, but it was absolutely not up to par. Also, they were in the midst of installing a new roof when we arrived! Their response to my question of what was all that noise on the roof was "it will only go until 5 pm and they won't work on weekends". Well, this was Wednesday and I was leaving Saturday!!!! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “The Anti-Waikiki: Turtle Bay is a Great Base from Which to Explore Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Tommyg2230
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong: I like Waikiki! I get a big kick out of flying all the way from DC and jumping in the ocean to look at DiamondHead. But Honolulu is a city, you know, and sometimes it's good to get even further away from it all. On Oahu, that would be Turtle Bay. So if you love Atlantic City, South Beach, and Santa Monica, you probably won't much care for this place. To get there you can take the bus, but really you want to have a car, because the scenery is lush, the waves on the north side are stunning, and there's always Chinaman's Hat, which I never get tired of looking at. There is only a handful (by which I mean, like, five) restaurants in the area other than those in the hotel, but one of them is Ted's Bakery, which by itself is almost a reason to go to the North side! But the location is spectacular precisely because the north side is so quiet and remote. The hotel juts out into the Pacific and is surrounded on three sides by water. It has a small unremarkable beach (but truly great beaches are hard to come by in Hawaii). I agree with some reviewers that the place seems a bit tired, but it definitely is not shabby; and I also know from experience that even an "Ocean Front Deluxe" room can mean looking out the ocean over the roof of other parts of the complex. But on two visits a year apart I found the rooms to be large, comfortable, and clean. Ola's restaurant is pricey, as you would expect, but we found the quality and service to be excellent. On a previous visit I had an unfortunate service experience at LeiLei's; but I wrote to the manager, he apologized and when we returned a second time we were warmly greeted and well-served. It is my impression that the quality and selection in the main dining room had deteriorated during the year between my visits, but maybe I just hit an off-day. Some reviewers have complained about the towel policy (you are given a "towel card" which you trade for a towel; lose the towel and you'll be charged a fee). But the towels are large and carry the hotel's name and logo -- I bet that a lot of those towels "walked" before the policy was implemented. I have been fortunate to visit all the major islands except for Lanai. One entirely unanticipated result of my stays at Turtle Bay has been to come to understand how beautiful Oahu is, and how much the north side must be largely unchanged from what it was 25 or more years ago. While to my taste the Big Island is "true Hawaii," if your only destination is Oahu you will get a great idea of that, on a smaller scale, on the north side. And I think that Turtle Bay Resort is a comfortable, reasonably luxurious for the money, and excellent base from which to explore it.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: jebachord
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed a week at this resort, and really enjoyed the property. My husband was there to GOLF for a week with his MALE buddies. I rested and enjoyed the pools and even took a golf lesson! We stayed in the condo's, which were lovely. My only complaint is that there were too many families with young children EVERYWHERE! Being an older couple (over the age of 55), it was a little too crowded with young children. I would return to this property, but NOT during July or August. Great Golf courses, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and activities, but a very dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr575
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is the only hotel in the North Shore and they know it. The good news is that the hotel was well designed long ago to maximize ocean views from each room. We were on the 5th floor of the West wing facing the pool, a bay and the mountains. It was a fantastic view. There were an amazing number and variety of activities. This would be a great place for kids (or others) to learn to surf as the waves are consistent and they run along one side of the resort, making for great photo opportunities. Food was also excellent, but expensive. The only bad news is how old the hotel is and the prices charged. We paid almost $300/night with all fees. Our room made poor use of available space and the painted plywood bathroom vanity was badly chipped and beginning to fall apart. There's no light above the shower and no exhaust fan. Tile damage was badly patched with mismatching tiles. The pool bar had a number of old analog TV's with plywood housings protecting the 80's technology from theft. I understand there has been a long running battle over expanding the resort. Perhaps they are holding off improvements until they understand what they will be allowed to do. That's bad for current guests. It's a fabulous location, so maybe it will be great once again. We spent most of our North Shore time in a private vacation house. I would like to stay at Turtle Bay again, but I can't justify staying for longer than a few nights given the price and condition of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort -- Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelxoxo
Reviews.Content: We were at Turtle Bay a week ago and I knew I was going to miss paradise! I wouldn't stay anywhere else on Oahu. Turtle Bay is the most beautiful resort in the most beautiful location. Our room was overlooking the ocean. We could hear the waves breaking out our patio. The restaurants had delicious food (we ate at Leonardo's for dinner and the Palm Terrace for the breakfast buffet). The coffee counter was fabulous in the morning (homemade fresh whipped cream-delicious!!). The spa was really nice. My daughter had a massage and I had a facial. My husband played golf and had the best time. We snorkeled right off the hotel beach. I couldn't get my kids out of the pool and jacuzzi and the food and drinks at the pool were fantastic. Some people have commented how quiet it is at Turtle Bay. Your day can be as relaxed or as busy as you want to make it. We stayed for 4 days and 1 day we spent just relaxing by the pool, but the other 3 days, we visited the USS Arizona, went snorkeling at Shark's Cove (make sure you visit Mike at the store across the street to park (pay the $5) and eat at the Shark's Cove Grill-delicious), we went snorkeling and spinner dolphin watching on a Hawaii Nautical catamaran for 4 hours, went to Haleiwa (cute town off of the 83/99 Highway) where we shopped and ate the best Mexican food at Cholo's and had shaved ice at Matsumoto's, drove around the entire island (you have to see Sandy Beach-the most beautiful beach I've ever seen), shopped and ate dinner in Waikiki, ate breakfast at Ted's Bakery (get the breakfast sandwich) and had the best time of our lives. We traveled with 2 adults and teenage kids and we all had a blast. Our room was very spacious and very nicely decorated. It was beautifully decorated, clean, very comfy bed, big bathroom, safe, coffee maker, hair dryer, etc. All the staff were very nice and very helpful. Definitely a 4 star resort in my opinion. What made it even nicer is we took advantage of a 24 hour Facebook special. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “we liked resort”
Reviews.Author: leanneandrew15
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have stayed at a "resort" Compared to Australia holiday prices we paid a huge amount daily. Value for money I can't say yes to this. The resort its self was spotlessly clean and our ocean view room was wonderful. Found most staff to be really freindly. Found valet staff to be quiet rude except for the young guy from Sydney who was working there. Rooms where sound proof whick was great as many young people where constantly in the pools at 2am in the morning they where certainly not concerned about the noise they made. Thought the resort could have put on more activities on for guests during the day. Overall an enjoyable 5 days. TIP - make sure you decide where and what time you want to eat each night and book in the morning otherwise you will waiting and waiting. Saturday night buffett was to die for recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon @ Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: akvalleygirl
