Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Maui in early July, and for our second week on the islands we decided to hop over to Oahu for some alone time. We stayed in Waikiki for 2 days (which we LOVED) and then moved up to Turtle Bay for the remainder. First off, I will note that if you like to have stuff to do besides golf or lay at the pool, you may not want to stay here too long. We stayed for a week and ended up leaving a day early because there is just not much to do on the North Shore. The North Shore made Maui (which is perfect and so laid back) look like it's crazy busy! But, the NS is beautiful and it's worth seeing, I just wouldn't plan on spending an extended amount of time there. Second, we were there on our honeymoon and our stay was given to us as a gift and was fully paid for 6 months before we arrived. When we arrived the front desk would not let us check in without calling the folks who paid for our trip, it was extremely rude and out of line since it was long paid for, and stessful as the gift giver was getting on a plane to fly out of Hawaii. I understand they need to keep a card on file for incidentals and I offered mine and it was still a big ordeal. It took us over 45 minutes before they would give us our keys. Third, the hotel needs major upgrades! Our room had peeling paint, leaky vents, and it was just not what you would expect for the prices they charge. However, the beds are fabulous, and it was amazing to go to sleep at night with the doors open and listen to the crashing of the waves. So peaceful. But - it was not all bad. Our dinners were amazing, and several gave us free deserts after finding out we were honeymooners, which was nice. The cleaning staff there is the friendliest group of ladies I have ever met, they were super sweet and always offered up an 'Aloha'. The beach @ TB was very nice and not too crowded, and it was awesome to be on resort property still because we could go down to the beach at night and not have to worry about being unsafe. And - you can't beat waitresses bringing you drinks and food pool side! So, if you enjoy golf, tennis, or surfing, Turtle Bay may be the place for you. If you are looking for just places to shop, have lot of options for places to eat, etc., I would suggest only spending a day or two at TB and going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again unless I brought my kids”
Reviews.Author: seethesightsUSA
Reviews.Content: This resort is very family friendly which is great unless you are looking for relaxation and romance. We were disappointed that there was no adults only pool. Even sitting at the deep end we were constantly splashed and surrounded by noisy kids. I might not have made an issue of it, but we stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki and were spoiled by the infinity pool where no one under 16 is allowed. Even eating dinner at Ola's at 8pm we were surrounded by kids. I liked both of the rooms we stayed in (we got upgraded on the last night due to a/c troubles) but recommend getting a lanai with chairs. The bathrooms were large and pretty, the furnishings were comfy and attractive. I have never snorkeled before and thought it was great there and was included in resort fee (one hour which was plenty). We received complimentory champagne which was very nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. We went to the beach and the man giving out towels set up chairs in the shade for us, then let us know when an umbrella became available because he thought we were too close to the volleyball net (he was right). We stayed over the July 4th weekend and got to see a gorgeous fireworks display. We had bfast in Haleiwa one morning then at Ted's. I would recommend buying sandwiches from the frig at Ted's to have for lunch later--grab some pie too!

Reviews.Title: “ARRGH”
Reviews.Author: jghappy
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed this time. dropped from 5 to 3 stars. A beautiful resort but...two Q room pre-paid but not available at ck in-offered king with rollaway and air mattress on floor for 4 people. (Did this several yrs ago and floor is too dusty, ALLERGIES) Manager found 2Q room (321) next to air duct system-noise and vibration all night. Really appreciated the nice desk clerk who warned us of the problem and arranged for us to move to a nice quiet 2Q the next day. Pool area deck dirty with food particles, sticky and slimy. Italian restaurant good. Lei Lei's restaurant good. Restaurant staff all really great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat from Waikiki Beach”
Reviews.Author: Ilyngirl
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for a deluxe oceanfront room. Prior to our arrival I called and requested to change our room to a beachfront cottage and was told that I wasn't able to do that because I already prepaid, never the less we were looking forward to our trip to the north shore. We walked into our room and our deluxe oceanfront room was a view of the roof of a lower restaurant, te shoreline and the parking lot. Needless to say I was not happy at all and immediately called the front desk. I was put in contact with Terry and he was wonderful. He had a bellman come and escort us to an alternate room. This room us exactly what I envisioned when I think of deluxe oceanfront!! The bathroom was very dated, but large. The best was absolutely the sunsets and this made staying here worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dated with bad views....”
Reviews.Author: kelemtrev
Reviews.Content: We didn't technically stay over night at Turtle Bay but we were there. We checked in a little uneasy after reading other reviews (after making our reservations) and unfortunately our worries were well warranted. We paid extra for a "deluxe" room which basically meant we had a slightly larger lanai to view the rooftop of other parts of the aging building. The view was AWFUL! The room was so empty it felt awkward and strange. Not one single picture on the walls. Walls were scuffed and marked up from others children/luggage/ etc.... Bathrooms were huge but had a strange asylum feel to them. Stark white with little lighting. What was there was fluorescent with a metalish grate over the fixture. So dark in the shower area it would be hard to shave!! Needless to say, we headed back down to the desk and checked out. If there is any good to this place its that the girl at the desk (wish I could remember her name) didn't give us a hard time about it at all and refunded our $ with no problem. Obviously it was something she was used to doing. She didn't seem the slightest bit surprised about the issues we mentioned.To make a long story short, you should just stay on a different island all together. Waikiki is way too busy and doesnt even have the "tropical island" feel one would expect when traveling to Hawaii and the North Shore's only option (Turtle Bay) is in desperate need of updating......such a disappointment.....

Reviews.Title: “Racism marred a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kaaren76
Reviews.Content: We were having a wonderful time and would have rated this resort as excellent EXCEPT that, on our last day, a staff member humiliated my Vietnamese-American daughter-in-law by demanding that she leave the premises; he refused to believe she was a guest, despite the protestations of my Anglo husband and my Anglo self, and despite the fact that she had a key to one of the hotel's villas. After protesting to a manager, we received a sullen apology and a bogus explanation of the event. This poisoned our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but Low Key Resort”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel on Oahu's North Shore, but it's a nice only-choice. Every room has ocean views. If you get a deal (AAA, AARP, etc.) it is not too steep for resort amenities. Service was great, quality of the bathroom, towels, bedding top notch, restaurants abound on the premises (there are no restaurants to walk to outside the premises). It's not over-the-top like the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The surrounding area is NOT Waikiki, so it's the place to go if you want some tranquility. Of course, there's the annoying daily activities fee ($25/pp), which is a rip-off, but I guess it's what consumers have come to accept as part of the deal with the conglomerate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated room and musky odor, but beautiful views and property grounds.”
Reviews.Author: qnookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort on the final 2 nights of our 5 year wedding anniversary 2 week trip to Hawaii. We had started off in Honolulu, went to Kona on the Big Island, then went to Kaanapali on Maui, and were going to finish it up visiting the North Shore of Oahu. We were so excited to stay at Turtle Bay Resort for the culmination of our trip...what a disappointment. The staff at the front desk was very courteous and gave us a room on the 6th floor. We had paid for an Oceanview Premium, but when we got to the room, we were dismayed beyond belief. The room had furniture that was clearly from the 1970s which was peeling and hand dents, and the paint on the shutters was peeling. The A/C also was not working and the room felt as if it hadn't been occupied in months. In fact, there was no "Activities" sheet in the room, and the in-room fridge was unplugged with the door open. There was a musty, not-been-aired-in-a-while odor that was not being helped by the non-working A/C. I used the phone to call the front desk, got transferred to housekeeping, and was told that it would take some time to send someone to my room. I called back 5 minutes later to the front desk and asked to speak to a manager but was on hold for about 5 minutes. So, I told my husband to grab all the suitcases and that we were going to head to the front desk because we were not going to stay in this room. This was NOT the way we were going to end our trip. I went back to the front desk and there was no one there with 2 front desk attendants. I spoke to the woman who had checked us in and I informed her of what had happened. She apologized for the fact that I had been on hold and that the A/C was not working in that room. She was going to place us in a room that was a lower price than what we had paid, and I said that that was fine as long as the rate of what I paid changed. Then, she stated that she could put me in a Junior Suite at no extra charge. You would think that this would be great, right? Well, when we arrived at the new room, it was indeed about 2.5 times the size of the previous room, and the A/C worked, but it still had old furniture and that musky odor! However, perhaps because it was a larger room, the odor wasn't as pronounced as in the original room. The bathrooms in both rooms were large, but severely outdated and desperately need to be updated. In the Junior Suite there was shoddy caulking around the shower head, and there was paint peeling from the shutters of the glass sliders. There was also a rust-stain from water that was clearly leaking from the A/C. The furniture smelled old, and after sitting on it for a while, my clothes smelled like it. I didn't put any of our clothes in the drawers because there was an overwhelming odor of old in them! The views from both rooms was wonderful, and the bedding was plush. The staff did their best as far as customer service is concerned, and even sent a bottle of champagne as apologies. However, a $39 bottle of champagne is not going to make up for the fact that I paid over $250 a night for a room with peeling paint and banged up furniture that hasn't been updated since before disco was king! The grounds are really beautiful, and there are many picturesque portraits that one can take. One night we went down to Happy Hour at the bar by the pool, and the live music was awesome! The snorkeling they have onsite is terrible. There are hardly any fish, and the water is not as clear as in Maui or the Big Island. It was nice to see the surfers, and we did go on a hike to the WWII bunker. We did stop by the Dole Pineapple Plantation, which was totally unexpected (literally decided to stop while driving by on our way to Turtle Bay Resort) and awesome! The pineapple soft serve ice cream was delicious, and it was really neat to see all the different kinds of pineapples growing in the little pineapple garden! When I return to Hawaii, I would NEVER stay on the North Shore again, least of all Turtle Bay Resort. It is really out of the way and the rooms are not what rooms should be for that much a night. I don't know if it was just the rooms that we got (facing the snorkeling beach) that weren't redone or updated, but I couldn't believe how cheap the actual rooms were. It was definitely NOT something to write home about, and there are much better places to stay at and visit in Hawaii than here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: southsidegurl
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and once you figure out where to go for which meal, it's even better. The issue I had was the lack of chairs around the pool and a large pool that was too cool to enjoy. It has a lovely children's area with slide and warmer water. If you are hoping for a full on beach vacation, you might be disappointed. the beach is a public one and although not overly congested, there isn't a lot lot of water that is without rocks. So it's not ideal for kids... Maui is a better choice. There are two small towns within an easy drive of the property and they have more island character. The polynesion cultural centre is 10 minutes away. Overall the staff was very nice and food, particularly the breakfast buffet, was delicious. A small warning that a couple of the older gals on pool food service, were less than ideal severs, actually kinda rude. If you get the delightful "Gabby" you are in luck however!!! Wifi is included in the 25 dollar resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional resort but pricey indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Rupes44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay in the Spring of this year to golf and get away from the Honolulu crowds. If you are looking for a secluded Hawaiian vacation, this is most definitely the place to be. We were upgraded to a suite with a private lanai which was excellent to sit an enjoy the spectacular ocean view offered by every room. The resort itself offers a variety of activities which I suggest you take full advantage of as you'll end up paying for them in the resort fees anyways. That being said, there's really no need to leave the resort once you're there which was a really great option to have. The 2 golf courses are fantastic- we felt as though we had the courses to ourselves and they were very well maintained. The Palmer is a much more unique experience than the lower priced Fazio but both are great courses. If you're looking for a more unique Hawaiian golfing expeience with different landscapes, best to look elsewhere. Overall, this resort offers everything it promises. Although you end up paying for it, it is definitely worth the price of experiencing a unique and secluded vacation outside of the usual holiday crowds. My partner and I had a wondeful, romantic and relaxing vacation and would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for the same.

Reviews.Title: “Rent a Beach Front Cottage!”
Reviews.Author: PowerSurgeClinton_MD
Reviews.Content: What an unbelievable experience of luxury and fun. The cottage rooms are in groups of six. As we entered the cottage, soft music was playing. The concierge arrived with a tray containing goblets of juice, complimentary T-shirts and fruit. All the amenities you could need: luxury bedding, hardwood flooring, large screen TV, 15ft ceiling with a fan, marble bathroom with tub for two, spa treatments, a fantastic view of the ocean and direct access to the beach. While the resort has numerous activities and places to eat, we were so mesmerized by the view we were anxious to return to the room and hangout on the lanai. In the evening, the sunset over the ocean - directly in front of the units and the sound of the water is soothing. Splurge and treat yourself to a stay, even if only for a few days of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: AZRN
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this resort. It's all about location. Our room looked directly at the beautiful ocean. We watched the sunrise and sunset from our balcony. We fell asleep listening to the waves with the doors open. Beach is steps away. The rooms are small and nothing special but the view makes up for the unimpressive room. One of the best parts was the uncrowdedness of the resort. There were people and children but it never was crowded (and we were there in July). Very peaceful & serene. We spent the entire time on the North Shore didn't even sightsee in Honolulu. The locals are super friendly. Resort restaurants too expensive only ate there a few times. We bought local food and ate on our small patio. Went to Foodland when we arrived to pick up oatmeal and simple food for breakfast/lunch (mini fridge in room). Some of our favorites: Ted's bakery (we were there every day), shrimp trucks (we went to Fumi's), Grass Skirt Grill (delicious reasonable fish burgers), Spaghettini, shaved ice trucks. Favorite spots: Shark's Cove for snorkeling (better than snorkeling at TBR), Turtle Beach to swim with the giant green sea turtles, Byodo-in-Temple, horseback riding, Waimea Park & Beach. In my opinion forget the typical tourist traps like the Dole Plantation & Polynesian Cultural Center. We went to the PCC for the highly recommended night show. It was ok but I didn't think it was spectacular. We were glad we didn't spend the entire day at this overpriced venue run by LDS church. Instead enjoy the natural beauty of the island - there's plenty of it. We hated to leave and would really like to live on North Shore. Used North Shore Taxi to and from hotel- $40 cheaper each way then hotel recommended car service.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury”
Reviews.Author: Retired_ACN_Partner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for half of our vacation in Oahu at Turtle Bay Resort in a 4 bedroom villa. The villas are new and have high quality furnishings and complete kitchens. Very different pace from Honolulu...it was quiet and relaxing. Kids can't wait to go back. Short drive to Polynesian Cultural Center...which is a great show. Went horseback riding on beach...saw an old World War 2 coastal bunker...boys liked that. Did a helicopter tour right from hotel...expensive but very well done. Short drive to Waimea Falls Park...where kids went swimming under the Waimea Falls...cold but exhilarating and beautiful. Great little restaurants all along the North Shore...plus Ted's Bakery and shave ice. Pools at Turtle Bay were fine...nothing over the top. The beaches had a mix of great sandy areas as well as some very rocky places. Oldest daughter saw a turtle swimming while snorkeling. Nice...but nowhere near like Hanauma Bay. Never ate in the restaurants...although order room service a couple times and it was very good, although a little pricey for what you got...even for Oahu. Main building looks a little old and in need of some rehab here and there...but villas were exactly as promised. Very relaxing and luxurious time on the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Atmosphere yet BEAUTIFUL Location!”
Reviews.Author: VacationFanatic2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a perfect place for relaxation. There is a beautiful beach that the whole family can enjoy. The one thing they don't mention is that it's a public beach and many of the locals attend the beach on a daily basis. The villas aren't worth money, because most of them aren't on the ocean. Actually, maybe about four have direct ocean views. But the villas are amazing throughout! On our last day we moved in a Beach Cottage. It had a great view and the ocean was literally outside your porch. Staff was understanding and friendly! The food was good but slightly over prised. Everyday at sunset their is a crowd gathered outside to see the sunset (while we were there, there was live music!) If you're going because you saw Forgetting Sarah Marshall... it's nothing like the movie. The resort is about 25 minutes from town and 45 minutes from Waikiki. The surfing lessons they offer at the resort aren't worth the money. (I'd recommend Sunset Suratt Surf School, it's amazing) It's a very unique resort, and I would recommend it to a family, but not a couple looking for a spa getaway. We will go again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JMurr49
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Turtle Bay Resort when on spring break. What a great place to stay. The north shore is very unique and far removed from Honolulu. The staff made us feel very comfortable. The food was great at the hotel and the pool and pool side bar were wonderful. Each evening we would watch the sun set from the pool. The beach and snorkeling were lots of fun. Traveling all up and down the north shore from this spot was very easy. We only ventured into Honolulu for a couple of tours but stayed around the north shore most of the time. I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “In bad need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: traveltime009
Reviews.Content: Our first and last trip to Turtle Bay. I understand the resort was close to bankrupt in 2007 and they obviously have not done any renovations since then. The location is very nice but the rooms are looking more like prison cells than hotel suites. Dining options are limited and expensive compared to Honolulu and the other islands. Not much in the way of activities if you don't play golf. Hotel may have some activities but they do a very poor job of advertising any activities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LiveFreeOrDieHard
Reviews.Content: Okay at first, I hated the rooms. I requested to see 4 different rooms. The rooms definitely need updating and the bathrooms are "motelish" but the view and location far than made up for it. The amazing bath products are too die for as well and they are huge and not skimpy. I ordered more online because I can't get enough of the amazing Papaya/passion fruit smell. We opened our sliding door with the little balcony and could feel the ocean spray. Yes, that's how close you are and it's amazing. All rooms have an fantastic view but the top floors towards the beach are the best. Request rooms closer to their snorkeling area. You can watch the restaurants torches light in the evening and have a cocktail from your balcony and watch the sunset over the horizon. It's surreal! The resort fee is like $23-26 dollars and that includes free parking, wifi, 1 hr snorkeling equipment and free newspapers and some other stuff I forgot about. The business center is free and you can check into your flight and print boarding passes which is also great. Always, always get the buffet breakfast. It is sooo unbelievable with an omelet station and the most amazing waffles and fresh cream you will ever have. All in all, I spent 10 days and Turtle Bay is amazing. The restaurants are expensive but with the shrimp trucks within 5 mins of drive time away and Haleiwa a stone throw away, you can eat elsewhere. Loved it...and I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marine4747
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Turtle Bay. If you are going to stay on Oahu, Turtle Bay is a great location. It is far from the mayhem that is Waikiki. Views are spectacular. Food is average. Stay on the left side, not the right. The hotel has a wing that overlooks the pool and one that overlooks the swimming bay. The pool side wing is far superior. We stayed on that side in our previous visit. Rooms appear to be newer, cleaner and views are better. The rooms overlooking the swimming bay were quite simply old and battered looking. In my opinion 2 or 3 days is plenty to see this side of the island. Use your remaining time to visit other islands or a Diamond Head hotel if you don't like the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and loved the north shore”
Reviews.Author: familyof4LA
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. To say that we had our share of issues would be understatement. But each time the hotel came through but I especially liked the fact that the the hotel staff made it a point to call back and check if the issue was taken care of. To begin with safe had issues which was taken care of immediately, then the air conditioner( guy was there within 5 minutes ) . WE had a small issue with the grill smoke coming to our room. I just called and mentioned it to them asking when they would be done. The hotel manager immediately offers to move us to another room. Exceptional service and follow up. Hotel has a amazing beach , a fantastic pool ( or pools ) and the kids loved the slide.Good dining and loved the fact that the hotel is so particular about smoking . With kids around that is one of the major things you look at .The view was spectacular and the lanai big enough for four to sit.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Turtle Bay and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time, and will be back for more!”
Reviews.Author: Hulaforshort
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we visited Turtle Bay Resort. Since the resort is renovating the roof we got a free upgrade on our room to a much nicer one, but with two smaller beds. I just adore turtle bay. It is a very nice hotel with a fantastic location and view! We only had a couple of days here, til we went to Honolulu but I wish we had stayed longer. Yes it is pricey but you pay for the nice beach that you can hang out at all day. You get lots of pools, with different temperaturs. There are several restaurant that all serve great food. The breakfast buffet is wonderful! The staff is usually friendly but the one that we got at the front desk was not very nice (maybe very stressed?) The room was fantastic and the view is just to die for! Location is the best part, here you can easilly access all the best beaches of oahu within just 30 min of driving. However, you may not want to leave the hotel at all! They have turtles right at the bay outside the hotel, lots of them also! You get free internet access, you can even borrow computers! (kind of slow though) Next time we visit Oahu we well stay here but for a longer period. Once you've been here, you want to go back...best hotel I have EVER stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Family loved.”
Reviews.Author: Pat303631
Reviews.Content: The bigger swimming pool is not heated and was very cold. Breakfast is delicious and should be included on the packages. Expensive rates. Should have a playroom with ping pong, foosball table....

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: humuhumu_fish
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids (8, 11) stayed here for 5 nights. The resort was everything we had hoped for. The grounds are beautiful as were the views from our room. Our room was perfect for the four of us and the balcony was the best part. The kids loved the pools and the beach. They use a card system for pool/beach towels (you each have 1 card to trade for 1 towel) which means that pool chairs tend not to be so hard to come by here (a very nice idea by the way). Unlike some other resorts we've been to in Hawaii, food options here for parents with kids were good and the prices were not horrendous. All of the staff were very friendly. We had a car and really enjoyed snorkelling at Shark's Cove (highly recommended). All in all, our stay exceeded our expectations (which were high to begin with). We would return to Turtle Bay Resort without hesitation and highly recommend it to anyone considering staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, in desperate need of renovation and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: MKM44
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay here. My room was not even close to the picture on the website. Everything is musty. The grounds are in need of funded care. I was so disappointed with this relatively expensive hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kam1700
Reviews.Content: We loved it here. Beautiful location, and would definitely return. This is not a 5-star, upscale hotel, but it has the best location of any other hotel property we saw on the island.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: garmischgirl614
Reviews.Content: 've stayed here twice with family since we live on island. The hotel is located on the tip of the north shore on Oahu right on the beach. The hotel has a medium sized pool, a slide for the kids, and two hot tubs located in seperate parts of the pool area ( one has a beautiful view of the ocean right in front of you.) The rooms are very nice and always in very clean condition with a nice smell. I would recommend that you get an upgrade if you can because it is totally worth it!! The first time we stayed here we got an upgrade and this will get you a room on an upper floor with a view of the popular lagoon-like beach and the rest of the ocean. This view is beautiful and at night you can leave the windows open and feel and here the ocean waves. The normal room that we got the next time was also very nice with an ocean view but it was on a lower level so we could see the roof of the restaurant below. The good thing about this room was that its balcony was larger. The restaurants in the hotel are pretty pricey but have very delicious food. If you don't want to eat at the hotel you will need to drive pretty far down the road to any other restaurants so its most likely you will eat at the hotel. The nearest restaurants are in Haleiwa. I would recommend Haleiwa Joe's :) The beach at the hotel is pretty nice in the lagoon-like area. The water is pretty clear and gets deeper as you swim more out, but its still a great area for the kids. We've seen sea turtles in this area so if you're lucky you might be able to swim with them...just keep your space because its illegal to touch them! Overall I LOVE this hotel and can't wait to go back. It's a great choice for anyone who wants a relaxing place to stay on Oahu because all you will ever hear is ocean waves, unlike in Waikiki where you will hear cars at all times of the night driving around. It is a great destination for vacation for the whole family :D

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and already planning a 3rd!”
Reviews.Author: Jrydersmom
Reviews.Content: WE LOVE Turtle Bay! Traveled with our 4 and 6 year olds and they absolutley loved the pool and water slide! My husband and I loved the Yummy Mai Tai's pool side and really good continental breakfast. We skipped the full buffet, and stuck to the less expensive option but loved the bagels, smoked salmon, cream chesse, fresh frruit and veggie quiche, and selection of juices. All you can eat!! We missed the hawaiin back ground music playing throughout the hotel like at other resorts on the islands. There was a really great singer in the Bay Club on our last night of July 9th (wish I knew who he was) but the place was empty?? Not sure why, we all really enjoyed him! Nearby Lei Lei's on the golf course was also really great for dinner! Eating beachfront at Ola's is a must! Watching the fireworks at the resort was a treat! Snorkeling at near by sharks cove was the best. Foodland had all we needed for snorkel gear, sunscreen, and munchies. Every day was a dream, returning to Turtle Bay and 11 days was not long enough!! Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, lots to do! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: thesmiledoc
Reviews.Content: On Oahu, the most populated island, we went to Pearl Harbor, Waikiki, got some culture, lol, then went to the north shore for a great stay in the beach cottgaes at Turtle Bay. Ocean-swimming, kayaking, golf, tennis, snorkeling, surfing, hiking, horseback riding, helicopter rides, scuba, stand up paddling, hiking, exploring, turtkle watching, a limited keiki club, or just hanging out as a family at the beach. Great value, as we know what other beach front resorts can cost!!!!!! I'l have to say there are lots of things that I thought could be done better and improved, but we had a great time. I know their long time GM died suddenly last fall, they have new owners as of 2008, and the place has a great location. We checked out a room in the main building and it was nice as well, and a lot less money. Not sure why someone could be as negative about this place as "alyle" typed in, but for a 30 year old resort, it is standing the test of time. All they need are outdoor showers like Hualalai and it would be unbeatable. Thanks. PS. the challenge fo all resorts on Oahu is to maintain a resort feel in conjunction with "all" beaches being public with a large population using kamaaina access. Also, new direct flights to HNL from Shanghai are coming soon!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell7280
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about turtle bay. My husband and I visited in June on 2010 for our honeymoon and stayed in a beach cottage. From the moment we arrived we felt very well taken care of. Upon arrival the beach cottage concierge welcomed us with tutle bay tshirts, fresh fruit and this juice that tasted like heaven. The beach was feet from our lanai door and so beautiful to look at. We slept with our door open ever night so we could hear the waves crashing. It felt like paradise. We had the best time of our lives there and can not wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.....very average”
Reviews.Author: alyle
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the cottages at the end of June. I guess I was expecting more. This was our 4th trip to Hawaii, but our first to Oahu and Turtle Bay. I expected to find some Hawaiian activities on site-especially since there was a kids club advertised. Every Hawaiian resort I have ever stayed at had Lei Making, hawaiian crafts, hula dancing for the kids, etc. What about blowing the conch shell at night when they light the torches....or an evening of Hawaiian music by the pool???? Nope, none of that. In fact, when we found the kids club in the hallway off the pool, it was closed, lights off, no sign of life. Too bad, there were a TON of kids there. The cottages were great-they are expensive, but thankfully we didnt stay in the regular rooms. I would have been extremely disappointed if we had. Our room was large and spacious. When we first arrived, we met our "concierge" for the cottages-he explained to us that we would get fresh fruit every day and if we need anything that he would be there to help us. What a joke...he was never seen again! Even my 8 year old daughter asked why he never brought us the fruit he said he would bring! Later, I noticed 2 red apples sitting on the refrigerator....could this be "the fruit"???? RED APPLES????? the next day we got 2 plums! Plums? Really??? I can get red apples and plums at home. I expected some tropical fruits-and frankly more than 2 for the family of 4!!! I just wasn't impressed by anything and I am bummed we wasted our money there....should've have gone back to Maui or Kauai like we were thinking originally. Turn down service is RIDICULOUS-they woke my kids up every night...ugh. Oh and there is NOTHING to do on the North Shore. 3 days was plenty. I guess when there is no competition and you are the only game in town, you don't have to impress your guests. I am so mad that we wasted our money there.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive--misleading internet information”
Reviews.Author: jbza
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property, but NOT the "true Hawaii". They are the ONLY hotel in Kahuku, so it's hard to be ranked other than number one. First off--they say you have an in room mini-fridge--what they don't say is it is stocked to capacity w/booze and overpriced snacks, then they have another empty fridge, that if you USE it, they CHARGE YOU --UNBELIEVABLE,especially in the face of the high price you pay to stay here-- so forget about getting any of your own snacks, drinks, or heaven forbid, what if you had medication or required a special diet? Ola restaurant is overpriced and mediocore, Italian is better. They also say they bring daily fruit--a joke--2 pieces for 4 people and none of it was tropical-we got plums and apples--couldn't they have walked across the street to the fruit stand and got some mangos, bananas--it IS Hawii--not apple country. The "turn down" interupts your evening, then leaves just 2 chocolates or cookies again for 4 people. They charge the mysterious $70/day "resort fee" so you can get the "complimentary fruit and newspaper". Blow off their restaurants, and go up the street to Ted's Bakery, and the local fruit and shrimp stands for an infinitely better food experience.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful summer Hawaiian getaway spot.”
Reviews.Author: isk8dude
Reviews.Content: Idyllic spot, views of both sunrise and sunset during the summer. Booked through an airline vacation website: comp 2 tix to Polynesian Cultural Center, comp daily breakfast buffet, comp 7th night stay worth about $1k overall. High floor east wing, tiny balcony just enough for two chairs. Room spotless but Spartan: zero decor, 2 nondescript art photos. How about a room mirror? Bed and linens appear newly upgraded. Double closet and double sinks very nice but bath lighting also needs upgrading. If we stayed here again, would consider a villa with kitchen and barbecue options: restaurants around here are just OK for the money, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: bobitSydney
Reviews.Content: not really a 4 star more like a 3. Restaurants are really average with limited choice. We went for 5 nights but ended up checking out after 2...rooms old, if you like golf then you will be ok otherwise not much to do.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Turtle Bay!”
Reviews.Author: IU2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay Resort for our first two nights in Oahu before heading to Honolulu. The first night we arrived we were very tired, so we ate at the Italian Restaurant. I would recommend skipping this restaurant because it was overpriced and not that great of food. However, the rest of the resort was wonderful! We stayed in an oceanfront room that was very clean, spacious, and had a very comfortable bed. Turtle Bay had a breakfast bar in the morning where you could purchase pastries, coffee, and other breakfast items. The baristas were extremely friendly and it was a great way to try the different Hawaiian coffees. Turtle Bay has a long stretch of land that you can go hiking along, which includes an old WWII bunker. Also, my husband and I were celebrating our anniversary, so when we returned to our room in the evening there was a bottle of champagne. Everyone that we encountered was kind and helpful at the resort. If we make it back to Oahu we will definitely head back to Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: thestacey
Reviews.Content: So nice to hang out on the north side of Oahu. Close to sharks cove for snorkeling and Sharks Cove Grill is a fantastic place for lunch.. just minutes away from hotel. The hotel staff was nice and we enjoyed hanging out at the pool and bar area especially during sunset. The rooms were clean and spacious. I feel they need to update the furniture in the hallways though.. it looks worn and tattered, near the elevators. Also new toilet seats would be nice. Our's were loose and cheap plastic. Nonetheless I will stay there again! It was wonderful to be footloose and fancy free on the beautiful north shore! The restaurant Ola's I think is the name was really good too. The pineapple pedicure at the spa was fab u lous!!! The Hawaiian gal forgot her name was wonderful!!.. It is worth the $105 dollars. My feet never felt so good all week long.. I will definitely go back for that someday. Highly recommend it! Love to be pampered

Reviews.Title: “Over the Moon -loved it and we will be back again and again”
Reviews.Author: TGRHonolulu
Reviews.Content: This is our first time back to Turtle Bay in six years and my husband and I were exhilirated to find the resort even better than our last visit. We were attending a family reunion/wedding, we stayed in the beachfront cottages and the rest of the family in the actual resort building. Both experiences were glorious. The staff (from bellman, to front desk, to maintenance, maid, waithelp) were so friendly, helpful and gracious. The grounds are lovely and beautiful and extremely well maintained; Our family of fifty (50) ranged in age from 2 to 82 - and everyone could not get over how great this resort is - the children loved the pools, and children's activities, the adults loved the beach, tennis and golf, and the romantic 'edge' the resort has - while the teens loved he surfing and horseback riding . Options for dining and varied pocketbooks/budgets were great -- and every day we saw a minimum of six turtles - all day long! Strolls down one beach to get to secluded Kawela Bay (no one there) was just as much fun as strolls down the other beach towards Kahuku town - where we found a glass ball. The cottages are so beautiful and well worth the price w/impeccable service - however, the main building with its beautiful ocean views and large lovely rooms were equally desirable. Something for Everyone! True old style Hawaiian Hospitality in an equally beautiful surrounding - Absolutely hard to beat! My husband and I found it hard to leave - as did the rest of the family - including the Bride & Groom.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GaryD60
Reviews.Content: On my recent honeymoon, we stayed 3 nights in Turtle Bay Resort and could not have been happier. The location was exactly what we were looking for...out of the way, quiet, NOT Waikiki craziness. The staff was incredible. When we checked in (late night due to long flight) the receptionist told me that the only room in our category was facing th e pool and not the ocean so he upgraded us to a cottage suite with a beautiful view. The room was very comfortable even though the bed was a bit too soft for both of us. Great experience all around and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Oahu and not wanting to be in the commericalized Honolulu area.

Reviews.Title: “Very secluded and hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: lizzyjbeach
Reviews.Content: We were unable to find a condo to stay in at the North Shore and as this is the only resort in the area we stayed at Turtle Bay for 3 nights. As per the hotel photos provided and the hype of the filming of Fogetting Sarah Marshall, we were excited about staying here, but dissapointed when we arrived. We received a free room upgrade, which was a nice gesture but i would hate to think what kind of room we would have received. The hotel and rooms are in dire need of an update. Very outdated decor. The location is very secluded. Get a hire car if u can. We did not and all of the hire cars (except the most expensive) were taken. There is TheBus $2.50 which is a great service but you waste alot of time waiting around for. And make sure you ask for a transfer ticket which gives you free return travel within 2-3 hrs on same day. Food is pricey at the hotel's restaurant and the only Foodland is a 15 min bus trip. There is great snorkling, we saw turtels, colourful fish and eels, just off the beach. Waimea Bay was the best to swim at as not big surf season. And make sure you go shark swimming with North Shore Shark Adventures, it is awesome!! This place is very secluded, maybe do a day trip from Waikiki or if you have the money, stay in the deluxe ocean rooms. Staff members were average, as per previous review, Carol does need a refresher course in customer service. We ate at the Hang Ten Bar & Grill and had lunch at the bar and watched the staff member's continuously eat food from the section where they finish dressing the customers drinks, very unhygienic. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible front desk, worn-down rooms”
Reviews.Author: gradientdescent
Reviews.Content: Despite preferring small hotels, we've stayed at a handful of large "five-star" Hawaiian resorts. Turtle Bay was easily the worst of them, which is a shame, because it's in such a beautiful location. We booked at the hotel's parent company website (it's part of Preferred Hotels Group) and selected a rate which included daily breakfast and daily resort credit. We brought a printout of the confirmation, and yet the front desk insisted they had never seen such a package before and took 15 minutes to reverse-engineer the rate to make it match our confirmation. They could not, at check-in, promise to give us the credit or the breakfast we paid for in the rate, and suggested we check back later. A few hours later, when I returned to find new front desk staff, they still had no verdict, and were neither concerned nor apologetic for the confusion. In the end, after a few conversations, we got what was included in our rate, but not once did any front desk manager or employee apologize for the confusion; the resort staff, in general, made zero efforts to provide great service. The only exception: the waitresses by the pool bar were excellent and personable... they should be running the show! I hear the resort used to be pretty fabulous, but those days are long gone. The room had a fine view, but the furnishings were pretty tired and the bathroom looked like it hadn't been renovated in 10+ years. All of the food we ate was pretty standard, overpriced, uninspired resort fare (see my reviews)... especially compared to the amazing food one can find in Honolulu! We love the North Shore's vibe, which thankfully hasn't been overrun with any other mega-resorts (yet), and definitely recommend visiting the area... next time we'll definitely be renting a house.

Reviews.Title: “used to be perfect, now in dire need of updating”
Reviews.Author: mt234
Reviews.Content: if you want to be perfectly secluded and feel like you're miles away from everywhere...stay here, because you are both of those things. This property used to be stellar, gorgeous, and very chic....about 20 years ago. Unfortunately the physical property itself is in dire need of updating. Furniture is very very old, everything in the rooms is worn, down to the soapdishes and kleenex holder. the food at the restaurants is blah blah blah, could be so much better. Staff is pretty good though, they have much less attitude than what you'll find in Waikiki. Front desk was very understaffed, but they did do a nice, efficient job. All other staff were very pleasant and genuinely nice. Bathrooms are quite large and the rooms are very nice sized, nice lanais, just everything is very old and really needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, needs room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: jetbee
Reviews.Content: Third time to Turtle Bay, last two times were great, but that was years ago. Same old furniture, the light green chairs and sofa needs to be upgraded, big time. Had a smell of urine, maybe wet towels, please smell them before unpacking. The balcony on this particular floor could only accommodate one chair, not good for watching sunsets. The carpet could be redone as well. This place does need some attention. Speaking of attention, the front desk doesn't give you a nice "greeting" they act as if we are a bother. Jill, at the front desk, was anything but helpful. No smile, no help when it came to our reservation of two queen beds, that's what I paid for for nearly four hundred a night! Nope, not this vacation, found out their was plenty of rooms with queen beds, the maids were more than happy to show my empty rooms. The pool was nice, although when is it ok to put a towel done for hours and not be there? Pool staff needs to address that. Pool waitresses, some smiled, but for the most part seemed bored. Carol needs to go! She was rude to about everyone she took orders from. I asked one waitress why she is so snappy, she said she gets away with it..Nobody seems to care she speaks down to guest. Wow, because of her, you could loose business. Lei Lei's was about the best place to dine, the seafood pasta was very good, also the prime rib was delicious! I loved the dressing on the salad, it was a balsamic vinaigrette. Yummy! But if you really want some great food, turn right out of the resort and go 20mins to Haleiwa Joes Seafood and grill. The steaks are great! My favorite was the crab avocado salad, the best salad in the world! The wait staff was great as well. I might go back, but I'll wait to hear of some changes...

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing!”
Reviews.Author: tls9093
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed in an ocean front room at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach at Waikiki and had also payed for an ocean front room at Turtle Bay. What we had was an ocean VIEW room at ocean front prices. They essentially call all of their rooms ocean front althought very few of them are. 1st disappointment. They were working on the roofs and something must have been blowing into the rooms because everytime I walked on the carpet for more than 10 minutes my feet were black. My laptop screen and keyboard (both white) also had the black sticky stuff on it. 2nd dissapointment. Their "beach" has very few umbrellas available for their customers, I don't know maybe 12-15, so if one wants to use an umbrella, they must be claimed quite early. And, people from other hotels in the area were coming over and using the hotels limited umbrellas. I recognize that these are public beaches but the hotel is certainly within its rights to only allow their hotel guests the use of their umbrellas. Also, the girl working the beach is not particularly pleasant. 3rd disappointment. Staff was just so-so at best. After waiting in line at the front desk along with several other disgruntled guests, I complained about the above three items and a few other less important issues. The woman took notes and nothing happened. When I complained again the next day, there was no record of my concerns. The second woman I spoke with sent up some loaner slippers so my feet would not get dirty. Anyway, this place is definitely overrated and the staff leaves alot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was fully booked, but was quiet.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how I went so long without writing a review for this resort. it has been some time since my visit and I still think about going back daily. The resort was fully booked, but I never felt like it was crowded. If anything it felt empty. They have so much space and plenty of beach area, so you almost always have the beach to yourself. The locals were very friendly and it was beautiful to watch them fish in the early mornings. They had wonderful stories and great smiles. Would I go back? yes, in a heart beat. Was the room the nicest I have ever been in? No, not by a long shot, but it felt right. If that makes any sense. There was some sand in the tub, but that is expected in Hawaii when most of the guests will be dragging sand into the hotel after enjoying the beach. Try this place out, it is away from the touristy areas of the island and has plenty to do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and hotel....very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LE116
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is located on the North Shore of Oahu and really gets you out of the big city to experience quiet, real Hawaii. Turtle Bay beach....yes, we saw lots of turtles...and the wave break is great. Perfect place to learn to surf, watch the surfers...which is what we did, enjoy the sunsets, do some fishing, some golfing and exploring. Hotel is nice, we were in a deluxe ocean front room....nice, needs some update on bathrooms. I would stay in one of the cottages next time....is more expensive, but located on a really nice lawn with Turtle Bay beach right out in front...hammocks and all....very cool. Golf course is nice and we liked the restaurant there the best....Lei Lei's.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort- with Minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Marriedin06
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a beachfront cottage while celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary. This is the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in- the beachfront cottages are gorgeous!!! There are minor repairs that may need to be made- our closet doors came off the hinges and there was a crack in the sink- but it is far from being outdated as some other reviewers stated. The views were amazing from the room, and listening to the ocean outside your door every night is so relaxing. The bed was comfy and the room was always cleaned well. We ate at Lei Leis and Ola's. Ola's wasn't as nice as it looked in "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" but the food was ok. They charged a $15 corkage fee when we brought champagne we received upon arrival. Lei Lei's was better but without the beach view. A few minor issues: -Cottages were a bit far from the rest of the resort and restaurants, which made it pretty difficult when we had to walk with all our laundry to the only washing machines on the 3rd floor of the hotel. The change machines did not work, and we had to wait for the front desk to give change. -Front desk usually had only 1 person working, even during busy times. The check in time took at least 10 minutes, so when waiting for something simple (like change for washing machines) it was very inconvenient. They should definitely employ more people for the front desk at all times. -No in-room movies in the cottages. The hotel is pretty isolated and everything closes early, so there is not much to do. We wanted to stay in and rent a movie for the night, but we were first told they were updating the system so try the menu again later. The next day we were told the cottages never had movies available. -Lots of time restrictions- Beach chairs only available 9-5; spa only open until 8pm and even when we tried to call at 7:45 pm to schedule a massage they were already closed; Slide in pool only open 9:30-5:30. For all the money we spent for our stay, we expected less restrictions. However, all of these minor issues did not hinder our stay. It was a beautiful resort and the North Shore is much nicer than Waikiki. If you can swing it, splurge for the seaside massage which is absolutely amazing!! If we can afford to stay again in the future we definitely will!

Reviews.Title: “A fun place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Galletly86
Reviews.Content: We finished our holiday in Hawaii (mostly spent at the Hamoa Bay Bungalow in Hana) at TBR, which I had seen on the movie 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall'. We had a nice time, although I'm glad we didn't spend our whole holiday here. We had a great sea view from our room in the main hotel, the staff were relaxed and friendly, and the beaches at Turtle Bay and on the North Shore were beautiful. That said, the restaurants weren't great (Lei Lei's has nice food but is a tad boring, much better is Haleiwa Joe's down the road), and it was really windy the whole time we were there. As far as resorts go, I'm really glad we stayed here rather than any of the resorts in crowded Waikiki, but it wasn't nearly as nice staying here as it was in our own self-contained house in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable stay.”
Reviews.Author: msboston
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Turtle Bay with high expectations....none of which were met. The rooms are dreadful: dirty, dusty, rusty; paint is falling off the walls; lampshades are ripped; chairs, sheets and towels are all stained. When I spoke to the front desk staff about my disappointment, they didn't take any action or even offer an apology. While the views are great, most balconies only have room for one chair (no table or second chair). If you are unlucky enough to be near the lawn, you will hear everything from the wedding reception directly below your room. Housekeeping, while very friendly, starts knocking on your door at 8am and seems to return OFTEN! Neither the restaurants nor the food was impressive. Room service staff members were very polite but staff in the restaurants/bars were not. "Gym" was GROSS! Very bad odor, falling apart. Tried to run on the hotel's trails multiple times, but VERY POORLY marked. Incredibly disappointed in every single aspect of this hotel. A complete waste of a vacation. I want my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment...rude staff...horrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: TrishandDerek
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to our stay at Turtle Bay as I have wanted to stay there for years. We arrived after a very long travel day from Florida pulled into the driveway, the valet guys were all behind the desk screwing around. Nobody directed us where to take the car and nobody offered to help us with our luggage. I went to check in and the staff was lacking in customer service, very short with me. Checking in was a little like renting a car..I felt like I was initialing my life away. I was given "Towel Cards" and if we didn't return them we would be charged for towels. That was a first for a beach resort and very tacky. Hubby went and parked the car (which was quite a distance) and came back and said everyone had a parking placard on the dash. Had to go back to the desk and get that and haul it back to the car. Note to TURTLE BAY-get some customer service training! I have had better service at a Residence Inn. Our room was large and clean, and I paid for the deluxe ocean front-and yes, we saw the ocean but underneath us was a huge tar roof. The overall resort is nice and sits in a very pretty spot. I wish I could remember where our room was. I would call and find out where the unobstructed views are. The best part of my stay, was the spa, they were wondeful. I had the most amazing pineapple coconut pedicure, done outside. Ladies, well worth it. Maybe the spa folks could give the front desk, valet, some customer service tips.

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressive as we had anticipated.”
Reviews.Author: Aurrora40
Reviews.Content: During the recent Memorial Weekend Holiday, I flew to Oahu to vist with family and friends; we stayed at Turtle Bay because they had offered a pkg deal w/flight and room; well, even with this "deal" we were all very disappointed with the resort; from the rude employees, to the difficulty in checking in, to the sparse rooms, to the unimpressive spa, we all decided never to return. We had so many instances of disappointments and frustrations (i.e., the small store downstairs couldn't sell alcohol for hours because there was no one there old enough to sell it; they had construction going on Memorial Day that was so loud you could'nt sleep in, my manicure/pedicure was cancelled, with no other dates available, the resort fee was astronomical, and the choice of restaurants were unimpressive at best.) I would not recommend staying at this resort if you are traveling to Oahu for a vacation; choose another resort if you want an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in a gorgeous part of the world”
Reviews.Author: thetourister
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel/resort. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant was quite good also. The rooms were decent size.

Reviews.Title: “It had potential, but they just don't seem to care”
Reviews.Author: RhinoGeek
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was okay but changed as time went by. We stayed in one of the Cottages which was again at first glance really nice. Views are lovely and not nearly as noisy as where we were coming from. I want to point this out right up front - Safety needs to be a bigger concern as the bathrooms in the cottages are an accident waiting to happen for anyone. They look lovely with all the marble on the floors, tubs, showers, and walls. There is not one single grab bar in the bathroom. Have you seen what water does when it gets on marble and you try to stand or walk on it. Upon checkin we noticed the front desk staff never smiled at all. Just git'er done and get them on thier way. We were told to follow one of the bell staff to our cottage and that person was nice and all smiles. We were told that at anytime we needed assistance to go anywhere on the grounds just give them a call and someone would come and help right away. He noticed my significant other was using a cane. We also said that we understood that we could have the use of their wheelchair while on thier grounds. We were directed to the bell desk to pick one up. So far so good. We went to dinner promptly after getting in our room and were told upon checkin that the concierge would be giving us a call to set up a "convenient time" for them to come by and welcome us. We placed the "Privacy Please" sign on the door and left knowing that they would call us to set up a time. When we returned from dinner we found that they had indeed entered the room while we were out and left a few "gifts". 2 t-shirts advertising Turtle Bay. So right away they let us know that our privacy was of no concern. To top that off the t-shirts were wrong size so we can't use them. That simple phone call from them might have taken care of that. We proceeded to check out the grounds while using the wheelchair as I figured it would be easier on her. It's a good thing we did since there are a lot of winding, up and down, paths to get to the resort main building. Not real friendly for a wheelchair. When we made it to the resort main lobby area we really noticed that they had used flagstone with 1 inch grout joiunts and was sealed with a slick surface. What were you thinking! We ate at one of the on property restaraunts and it was really good including the welcome staff and our server. Had a wonderful time at dinner there. The next time we went to that same restaraunt, this time for lunch, the welcome staff was great but we got a server that couldn't get the order right and didn't explain the special well enough to tell us that the nice piece of fresh fish you were getiing came "smothered" in sauce. Who does that to fresh fish? He then proceeded to say we could "scrape off the sauce. Not. Since my order was wrong we decided to leave well enough alone. I paid the $8.75 for 2 Iced teas before I left since he said we wouldn't be charged for those orders. We decided one morning to have a breakfast at the golf club since they said they were open for breakfast. 3 pastries does not constitute breakfast. Once again we had to leave to find food. Remember when I said they would assist us in getting around the grounds to see things? I called the next day and was told that they would be happy to do that as long as we called when they were "not busy" Who were they so busy with that they can't honor what they say to the already paid guests. Oh Joy! One time (there were several times) we were in the parking area and they have access ramps at both ends of it. Kudos for that. But we noticed that everyday someone would park and block those access ramps. We noticed that the paint was really faded on the spots and you really couldn't read the "no Parking" which could have been better if there was good paint or even a sign. We asked the security guy who comes around if there could be something done about that since we really needed to use that access. His response was something to the effect of "we tried leaving notes for the vehicles telling them they could be cited for parking there but nobody ever does anything about, so there is really nothing I can do". Apparently it happens all the time and they got tired of telling people. One other thing they do is for the parking permit they print your full name on the pass and you place it on your dash. These are in big letters. So everyone who walks by has your name and it is associated with your vehicle. I kinda don't like that. There were a few other things like the "snacks in your room" not lining up with what the inventory sheet for it says. The key that goes to the mini-bar didn't work either. Not that we wanted to use it at those prices but were curious. If you wanted to go to the front desk for something you have to either go the long way around the pool and then up the elevator and then back around. Or you had to go up the road, not on a walkway, actually in the road to get there. Try doing this if you have mobility issues or are in a wheelchair. One morning we woke up and had decided to have a nice "in resort" romantic day. We went outside to get some fresh air only to notice that a truck was pulling up in front of our cottage offloading new copper gutters to be placed on our cottage building. The workers off loaded all the gutters and proceeded to install them. Thanks to the resort for "not letting any guests no about this" We had 3 honey moon couples in our cottage building wanting some romantic time. Nice going guys. I was going to call the general manager from the business card they gave us when we checked in. I showed it to my wife and she informed me that we couldn't call him. I said, why not? She said it would be long distance since he died 6 months ago. Again, nice going guys. Can't you give us a name of someone who is actually alive. Checkout day was a joke! It happened to be pouring down rain and when we called the bell desk to send a cart to take our stuff up to the front desk area so we could load it in our car without getting soaked we were told we would just have to wait. I called our cottage concierge and told them what was going on and they said they would send someone right over. They couldn't beleive we were told that by the bell desk. Needless to say the guy that showed up to help us was not pleased. Grumbled a lot about them being too cheap to provide any kind of rain gear for them. It is the North Shore afterall. So finally at the front counter to checkout, as we are approaching my significant other is using the cane and walking very slowly, almost slips down with every step because the floors are so spippery with all that nice slick sealant I mentioned. The front desk is covered with plastic so that it doesn't get wet? The desk is 50 feet from any opening. Leaks?? We had to wait until they got logged in to do anything. Would I recommend? Nah, not to anyone I like until they get things fixed. I didn't mention that the room service breakfast we ordered was barely warm when we got it. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, just expected a bit more”
Reviews.Author: Mrsfrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August of last year for our honeymoon. We were very excited to check in and the nice lady from the front desk gave us the room with the nice sunset view when she found out we were there for our honeymoon. We walked in to our room and we were somewhat disappointed. The room was just average. Average in decor and size. Although the view was amazing and the balcony was very spacious. The bed was huge and comfy. And they use high quality beddings. They also welcomed us with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. We purchased the breakfast in bed package from our travel agent. And we were very happy we did. They had good selection of hot and hearty breakfasts. It's delivered to our room on it's own table hot and fresh. The facilities itself was superb. The pool and jacuzzi were spacious. The beach and the hammocks were divine. And the lobby was very pretty. The restaurants were amazing and the food quality was up there. Very good place to stay. We will probably go for a more upscale room next time.

Reviews.Title: “a very romantic place and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: littlelilies
Reviews.Content: My husband and i got married in Oahu May this year and chose to stay at Turtle Bay for the first part of our honeymoon. Such a beautiful romantic place (even thought it rained most of the time) we couldnt help but venture outdoors and just enjoy our surroundings. We went to Waikiki the following week and it was a headache , i wanted to go back to Turtle Bay Resort. Friendly staff, the resort is kept very clean and such a beautiful location. We had sunset shots taken here as well for our wedding. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Beach Cottage "Stacation"”
Reviews.Author: DnD_10
Reviews.Content: Charles, our concierge made us feel welcome and made honest recommendations for dinner. Cottage on the beach was an excellent private location for a kamaaina vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Spectacular Setting”
Reviews.Author: LizzyJB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay in May on the all inclusive golf package. The hotel property itself is gorgeous with 2 golf courses, stables, walking paths, nice beach and amazing views. The views from our room were spectacular and it looked like most, if not all, of the rooms probably have ocean views. On the whole our room was very nice and had a comfortable kind bed and was nice and spacious, however the bathroom was pretty dated. I don't know how old this resort is but it is in definite need of some cosmetic upgrades. It seemed like a lot of the the things in the hotel were in original condition and in need of some tlc. We didn't really mind because we have stayed in much worse places and we were in Hawaii afterall, but generally speaking the entire place could use a fairly significant overhaul. For the price I don't think I'd go back knowing what I can get for the same price elsewhere. We had a good time and enjoyed one of the restaurants (Ola) but there was just something a little bit lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4 Nights at Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: delmarglobal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful 4 night stay at Turtle Bay Resort to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. We loved it! Our visit kicked off with the jaw dropping view of the bay from our 5th floor balcony, and a surprise gift of chilled champagne and glasses for our first night. We hiked some of the trails, enjoyed the jacuzzi, the pool, the beach and the snorkeling. Loved the cooking demo and food and wine tasting in the lobby. Took a yoga class at the spa (excellent teacher but the class was way more advanced than I was). A small investment in new yoga mats would be a big improvement (not in my ability to do yoga, but in appearance and quality worthy of the spa); the fabric chairs in our room showed some wear and tear. We dined at Ola's, and 21 Degrees North. Both were excellent. Thank you to the latter for the complimentary hot chocolate souffle dessert -yum. Pizza and salad at Leonardo's was very good, and the lobby barista was so convenient for coffee etc. Due to the heavy rains and thunderstorms, and the roof under repair, there was some "indoor rain" in some places. None of it dampened our spirits. We found the staff gracious, the other guests friendly and considerate, and the 800 acres exactly the kind of retreat we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Cottage = 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: I would give this 3.5 stars for the beach cottage. We stayed in a beach cottage for 6 nights for our honeymoon. Overall, we had a good time (who wouldn't, it's Hawaii, and it was our honeymoon), but I don't think we'll be returning to the Turtle Bay Resort. Perhaps it wasn't a great pick for our honeymoon, but my husband really wanted to stay there after watching "forgetting sarah marshall" My thoughts: -Rooms: comfortable and clean. our beach cottage had a great view. huge bathroom, which we liked. feel like the resort may want to consider some decor upgrades, etc. just didn't have that "luxury" feel we were hoping for. -It was pretty irritating that we were not able to get a cottage with a King sized bed. We had two queen beds for our honeymoon. Didn't really feel like putting up a big stink about it while we were there though, so just kept the 2 queen beds, as they said there were no King bed cottages. -Free WIFI: Slow and unreliable and frequently cut out. -Business Center: they need to put a limit on how much time people spend in there. We tried to print our boarding passes in advance and had to wait over half an hour, as there was a whole family in there using the computers. -Service: crappy and not friendly. our card key (one of them didn't work), and to check in and get this fixed took about half an hour each. there are always lines to check in, and concierge is grumpy. our private VIP concierge was nice and friendly however. -Common areas: too many people. children everywhere (especially in places they shouldn't be, ie, in the hot tubs). we found it was hard to get a seat by the pool or into a hot tub, as they were packed with teenagers. -Parking: beach cottage parking lot always full. we got to park there one night our entire honeymoon. so, we had to walk across to the main lot (not fun) every time we wanted to use the car. -Food: service at the restaurants is great. the poolside bar has good service, but terrible food. Ola was really good. -Price: we didn't get a fruit basket despite it being our honeymoon, but did get a bottle of champage, two glasses of juice, and a Turtle Bay Tshirt for each of us. Overall, this place seems to be a good place to go with your spouse and 3 kids. I don't think we'll be returning here in the future, but could see how it may appeal to some families.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as Good as last year”
Reviews.Author: Brokenback
Reviews.Content: We visited Turtle last year and realy enjoyed the resort thought the buffets in the evening were great especially the big seafood buffets and really like the breakfast and all the staff were happy and helpful. This time around things seemed a little different, the buffets are gone and quite frankly the italian restaurant that has replaced it is fine if you want Pizza (the pasta is not as good) every night, we asked some of the staff members why the buffets were gone and were told they didnt know but said a lot of the staff have left as not as many people go to the new restuarant hence not so many tips, so it seemed the staff were puzzled by the decision. The breakfast was not as good either and the service we got was dreadful to ok'ish, one day the breakfast vouchers we were suppose to give to our waiter were left on the table as he/she did not even bother to come to our table to ask for tea/coffee/water, unlike last year when we were getting top ups after every mouthful of Coffee. The rooms were ok however not a patch on some of the waikiki upgraded hotels and do look like they need some money spent on the decor - and considering the price per day they should look more like a holiday hotel room and not a green box. So why would you stay here you may ask? - well you havent much choice when it comes to the north shore, and as a base its good to explore from, the swimming pool is ok apart from being constantly bombed or dived bombed by kids, the sunbed fight in the morning is great to watch when you see people out there as early as 7.30am reserving their sunbeds - often one lot in the shade and another in the sun. Food - do not eat in the Italian eat at Lei Lei's situated at the golf club - you must try the ribs. Ola's on the beach is also very good Breakfast - if you do get the vouchers for staying 5/6 nights then fine but dont pay the prices for the buffet its not worth it We will not be going back again, we looked forward to our return however was disappointed P.S. I am sure the manager will write some lame response when he should be saying yes we are changing the restaurant back to evening buffets and we are spending some money re upgrading the rooms. Good luck everyone that goes there its not terrible but after staying in the Outrigger Reef and what they have done with their upgrade it blows this place off the map for us.

Reviews.Title: “VIP offer on facebook”
Reviews.Author: JKW09
Reviews.Content: TBR has a VIP offer on facebook -- $100 resort credit if you book more than two nights. Fellow travelers, if you want to take advantage of this, you have to book your reservation through facebook. NOT turtlebayresort.com or the TBR reservation desk. We are loyal TBR customers. We saw this deal on facebook, called turtle bay resort to book our reservation. However, we had called during memorial weekend, the reservation desk was closed, so we tried to book it online thru facebook. We encounter some problems and couldn't book it thru FB... so instead, we booked our reservation through the resort webpage thinking we'll just call the reservation desk later on a weekday and tell them we would like to take advantage of this FB offer. I called TBR and explained that I'm a FB fan of theirs. I explained the situation how i was unable to book my reservation through facebook, they told me there's nothing they can do. i asked them if they could cancel my current reservation and re-book it for me. They said no, because i had booked an advanced purchase package which cannot be cancelled. it was frustrating explaining to them I don't want to cancel my trip, i just want to fix this problem. I will admit the reservation desk ladies were polite, but they were unable to help and they failed to help me understand why the problem was irreversible. A twenty minute phone call for $100 resort credit? i gave up, it's just silly. It just seemed like it shouldn't be this complicated. the hotel made a very public offer to their facebook fans to reward loyalty, it made no sense that they couldn't honor it. It's true that the hotel rooms in the main buildings aren't great. You just have to tell yourself you're paying for the view. Kulima Bay and Kawela Bay are unbelievable. TBR is still a great deal considering the view. if your top priority is food, service and luxurious rooms, then the Kahala is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: QuietTravelerInVA
Reviews.Content: We came to Honolulu for a business trip, but wanted to spend some vacation time in a more relaxed, rural setting. Turtle Bay is just perfect. Not overly opulant, but a lovely, gracious resort in a wonderful setting on a peninsula - all rooms have ocean views. Clean, modern rooms with wifi, wide screen TV, small fridge was nice for drinks and snacks. The modest resort fee keeps you from getting "nickel and dimed" and includes parking, newspaper, beach umbrellas, towels and chairs by the pool and ocean, snorkel equipment, etc. Very gracious, helpful staff. The grounds are huge, and we did miles of hiking by the sea and through the woods. This is a quiet resort, so don't expect a lively night life - expect peace, quiet and restful beauty. We did a couples massage in the little cabana by the ocean - heaven! The spa is modest but adequate for a treatment or two. Delicous food at Ola's seaside restaurant and the on-site Italian restaurant. One of the nicest things is the location - in the cooler northern part of the island with a rural, "real Hawaii" flavor: easy nearby day trips to botanical gardens, old-fashioned surfer town, Dole Plantation, Polynesian Cultural Center, farmer's market on Sunday for snacks, fruit and gifts, shrimp farm shacks for outdoor lunch, and plenty of uncrowded beaches. The resort itself has a protected bay for swimming and snorkeling, nice because the water can get choppy when windy (we could sit on the lawn and watch surfers catch the waves!). Or, you can hike down paths to more secluded beaches. Resort has everything - golf, tennis, horses, surfing lessons, even helicopter rides, so you could just stay and be happy, but we liked the opportunity to both relax/enjoy the resort and leave to explore. It's about an hour's drive from the airport if you take the highway, but leave time to amble around the island on the small roads by the ocean and mountains - the beauty makes it well worth it. We did a air/hotel package and got a good rate so that helped with value. We loved this place and this vacation!
