Reviews.Title: “absolutely true hawaii”
Reviews.Author: adkath1969
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from the 19th may for 3 nights in a ocean front beach cottage.it was above and beyond our expectations.the welcome drinks,the tshirts,the champagne and the location we knew we were in paradise.the service we received from our conceirge jeremey nothing was a problem ,my husband even received a upgrade in his helicopter flight ,it was definately a let down after leaving, to spend 8 nights in waikiki .we have returned home now and have started planning our next escape to turtle bay resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: lawfive
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed in the resort for 4 nights. It is true what they say - every room has a view of the ocean. It is very nice to sit out on the balcony reading or having breakfast. The pool is good enough. It's not bad, but its just a pool. There is plenty of space to lay out or to go swimming, but it lacks in many frills. What it lacks, it makes up for in service. Towels and cold water are provided pool side. However, I recommend ordering drinks directly from the bar. The pool side wait staff is friendly and professional, I just think the hotel needs to hire more. It took quite a bit of time to get food and/or beverages pool side. That's ok if you are just hanging loose, but if you wait until you need food or something to drink before asking, you'll feel disappointed in how long you have to wait. The ocean is right near the pool, and a great place to watch surfing. In the bay, the resort fee includes free snorking (1 hour per day) which I recommend taking advantage of at least once - especially if you have not done it. The bay is calm and a great place to go for the first time. Plus you'll see many fish and if you are lucky - a turtle! Ola is the beachside restaurant and worth taking advantage if you can. The food is good and you might be able to get a table right on the beach! Be weary of the chairs though as one of them stained my shorts! But I suspect that is a one off occurance because of something another guest did (my guess). But maybe worth checking (just in case I am wrong!). The inside hotel restaurants are ok. The italian place and the bay view place pretty much have the same menu. Bay view's is a subset of the italian place. The nicer restaurant looks better, but we didn't go there. If you have a car, I recommend heading into town to sample the local restaurants. There are plenty to choose from, so I will not detail here. That said, you wouldn't go wrong staying on property to eat if you are willing to pay a tad more. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is friendly. The little gift shop next to the pool is a great place to get supplies at a reasonable price. They even sell beer and wine, which are nice to have on the balcony before heading to dinner. The sandwiches are a cheap alternative for something quick. Lastly, if you love to golf, you'll love the course here. Guests can play for $65 after 2:00, and that includes clubs, range balls, and 3 balls for the course. They sent me off by myself and I got done in 2hrs 15min. Given that I was on vacation with my fiancee, I was very appreciative that I was back to the room by 4:45 and ready to enjoy some more of the resort before dinner time! I recommend playing on site if you've always wanted to play golf in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Onmessage1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place! Rooms are wonderful (ask for Ocean Cottage or deluxe ocean in South Wing) and the food, amazing. Leonardo's has wonderful Italian food at a fair price, Ola's tasty and interesting upscale casual gourmet and Lei Lei's wonderful meat and seafood. Service is also excellent. When we complained that our room was not the quiet one we requested (wedding below), profuse apologies followed with an upgrade to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice hotel-great service!”
Reviews.Author: love2ski2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best we stayed at in hawaii. It is on the spendy side, but worth every penny. We saw this hotel in one of our favorite movies and wanted to check it out. So without any kind of reservations, we pulled into the hotel grounds. They let us walk around, and even check out the suite we were interested in before purchasing it! The location is really nice, and the staff was excellent. We had such a good time, we had to book another night before leaving! Also, check out some of the local fruit stands down the road towards the famous beach surf spots. Nice beaches at the hotel, but the sandy north shore is only a few miles away. Highly recommened this place, and don't miss the spa experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beach Cottages= Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: austinjones16
Reviews.Content: This review is for the beach cottages. We didn’t stay in the actual hotel building so I have no clue about the rooms in the actual building. My wife and I went there on our honeymoon. We were there for 6 nights, and were the recipient of the “stay 5 night get one night free program”. I highly recommend this particular package if you can get it. Firstly, as far as price goes, these beach cottages are great. If these were located on Waikiki, they could easily go for twice the price, and they would probably still be a steal. The location is great, right next to the water and away from the more public pool and hotel areas. Parking can be a little difficult since there aren’t many spaces and some of the locals seem to use the parking to unload/load surfboards (another great thing is that the cove seems to always have some surfers or stand up paddlers in it, which makes for great watching). The rooms are great, such high ceilings and very roomy! We had the two queen beds and we had more room than we knew what to do with. The bathroom is very nice and the finishes are great. The bathtub is huge, definitely a two man tub, if there is such a thing. Mattresses’ are nice along with the bed frames, which are slightly larger than a normal queen bed frame, and they show a little wear, but nothing out of the ordinary. We didn’t really use any of the internet, TV or movie ordering services, so I can’t comment on those either. Housekeeping was great along with the concierge services that provided fresh fruit and ice each day. Housekeeping thoroughly cleaned the room each day with fresh sheets and they did a turndown service at night complete with macaroons, and chocolate covered macadamia nuts. The grounds at Turtle Bay are very well kept and are really beautiful, and the groundskeepers are very good at what they do. Dining: Dining overall was very good. We ordered room service one night and were really impressed with the prompt delivery and pickup, not to mention the food was great. The room service menu appears to be a smattering of dishes from each one of the onsite restaurants so it’s pretty good. Prices were steep even for Hawaii, but hey it’s a resort! That’s how it works. The restaurants had very good service except for the Bay Club, but that has more to do with only having two waiters for the entire place, rather than willingness of the staff. You’ll see resort pricing at each of the restaurants so be expecting 30-50 a meal or more, but the food is certainly worth it. We enjoyed every meal that we ordered. I know I was ragging on the service at the Bay Club, but the Kobe Burger there is really good. Part of the package that we got included a full breakfast buffet each morning, which was amazing. There is so much to choose from, and they have a chef that makes omelets, and they are out of this world good! You have to put the salsa on them. The salsa could possibly be the best salsa I have ever had, and I live in Texas, where there are Mexican places on every corner. Beaches: The Beaches there at Turtle Bay were excellent, and not very crowded. It might have been due to us being there during the week, and school not being out, but it was very pleasant. The beach on the East side of the resort is very placid and has some pretty good snorkeling, and you get two pair of gear for an hour a day for free which is pretty awesome. The beach in front of the beach cottages is very rocky and there isn’t just a whole lot of sand. It also is a pretty busy habitat for crabs and the like. On the plus side, the entire time we were there it was never busy at all, so it could work out to be a nice place to relax. Pool Complex: The pool complex was also very enjoyable. The big pool was never crowded, and the water was nice and cool, and very refreshing. The slide pool was really nice but there are a lot of kids in it. My wife and I did slide down the slide and it was enjoyable. Not as much for us as the kids that used the pool. The poolside service was really good, Hang Ten, the restaurant located at the pool makes very good drinks. We didn’t actually order anything to eat there but the drinks were very good. Overall my wife and I really enjoyed coming to Turtle Bay. I would definitely recommend this resort for any couple, and especially a newly married couple, as it gets you away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Honolulu. The staff is friendly, there is no request to small or large, and it is a very relaxing resort getaway. The price is great as well, and the entire complex is so close to the water. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great food, georgous view from rooms and great service!”
Reviews.Author: kvitacek
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so friendly and helpful whether we were checking in, at the gift shop, eating at one of the hotel's diners, just getting coffee or ordering room service. I highly recommend staying here, it is paradise! I had a chance to use the gym and it was very clean and they had a nice variety of machines. The front desk concierge are very resourceful if you need any brochures be sure to stop there and ask. The night club has a hip atmosphere with pool tables if you enjoy that atmosphere, or hang at the hangten bar next to the pool where the food is simply amazing. Lei Lei's has the best breakfast croissants and definately try the room service if you are in need of R & R. Fridge in rooms were nice to enjoy a mix drink of our own before turning in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Willhouse4078
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and myself stayed a week at Turtle Bay Resort and I loved it there. I did read a bunch fo reviews here on Trip Advisor both good and bad. We choose to stay here because it was away from city. We stayed in an Ocean Front Deluxe room with a King Size bed. The view from our room was amazing it overlooked the pool area and right out to the ocean. We ordered room service twice once was for dinner and we ordered a pizza and the second was for some chocolate covered starberrys which came in little tuxedo designs. With it being on the north shore to do anything is a bit of a drive but it is worth it. The prices at the resturants at the hotel are a bit pricey but that was expected. We did go to the local shopping center and bought some snack and drinks for the room. The pool area was very nice the one towel policy didn't really bother me. Everything seemed clean and up to date. And as for the help within the hotel I never had an issue with the staff all of them were very helpful and more then willing to go out of there way to explain things for us. The parking was the only downfall because unless you valied your car it was a long walk back to the hotel. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in Oahu

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Lizziewith
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing stay at Turtle Bay. From the moment we arrived we felt relaxed in such a beautiful location and atmosphere. The pool areas are really well kept, very clean, plenty of sun loungers and the bar with the best Mai Tais I've tasted. We ate in all restaurants apart from 21 Degrees and never had a bad meal with all the food fresh and delicious. Our room was large and airy, with amazing views over the ocean with a super comfy bed. This was our first time in Hawaii and we loved it! The hotel is the perfect location for relaxing or getting out and exploring the North Shore. We'll definately be back in Hawaii and at the Turtle Bay as you can't fault the location or hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: beachdreamer3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Turtle Bay for 3 nights after staying in Waikiki for 2. Would never stay in Waikiki again after spending time on the North Shore. The grounds of the resort are absolutely beautiful....we stayed in an ocean front room which looked out to the bay. Got to see a the sun rise and hear the waves at night, the view was fabulous. They have two categories for ocean front rooms, we stayed in the slightly cheaper one which has a smaller balcony, but it was ok, it has enough room for two people, although there is only one chair! The rooms are very clean and have a very comfy bed...although you can tell the property is older. The AC vents were kinda of nasty looking and the furniture slightly outdated but overall very nice and clean. It is basically the only place to stay on the North Shore and we loved this area of the island. We didn't really eat much at the resort, lots of great local eats around and the shrimp trucks are right there! Delicious. Great beaches like 5 min. outside of resort if you want to venture out. The beach cottages looked really nice too. Loved our time here and would def. come back. Look for special rates and you will get a better value for your stay. Breakfast buffet was delicious, although a bit pricey. We ended up getting yogurt and granola and eating breakfast on our balcony or on the beach two mornings which was so nice. The scenery and grounds make this place worth your money! Highly recommend for a relaxing vacation. Oh and i almost forgot the best part...loved loved loved the pool slide!!! i was sooo much fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and options for activities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views from the lobby and restaurants. Make sure your room view is sunrise because they are doing repairs for the next few months on the sunset side.

Reviews.Title: “A half-hour for a medium-rare cheeseburger isn't even "Hawai'i time"”
Reviews.Author: Dissenter
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is what happens when you are the only game in town. The location and grounds are stunning, with the North Shore's legendary smooth, swell-fed waves right out your front door; about the only comparison I can make is to Cottesloe in Perth. But undoubtedly due to the fact that they are the only resort for twenty miles, their customer service leaves a lot to be desired. (I don't normally ding a property for one incidence of lousy service, but three or more in two days is enough to establish a pattern.) Groucho Marx's aphorism applies at the hotel proper. They are coy about telling you about the size of their balconies--ocean-front rooms have balconies too small to sit on. Don't know what the architect was thinking. Self-parking is included in your resort fee ($25/day), but there isn't nearly enough of it, and you are in for a bit of a walk. Get your own bottles of sparkling at the local Foodland, as the drink tab will be steep, even during happy hour. Still, they do have amenities (see photo). If you buy the golf package, make sure you play all of your golf on the Palmer; the Fazio is Ala Wai without customers. From the perspective of conditions, the Palmer course doesn't hold a candle to Poi'pu Bay (in Kaua'i, which is a real treat), but the service was immaculate, and that goes double for Lei Lei's (the golf course restaurant). The Palmer is female-friendly, being ~5,400 yards in length, but both sexes would do well to bring a few balls. If it gets close to the water, it will go in; the layout is a credit to Palmer's staff. I would recommend this place for an over-nighter, or if you are a surfie. The best plan is to bid aggressively on Priceline, as the rack rate is a bit high. The problem is that there really aren't a lot of great places to stay on Oah'u.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Stay at The Turtle Bay Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 4 nights at this resort and had a fabulous time! I am not sure how anyone could complain about this place. There is a beautiful view no matter where you are here. I am not saying everything was perfect but things on vacation rarely are. Hotels receive many guests and rooms will have a few imperfections here and there. I thought the rooms were very convenient. I liked the bathroom and the second sink in the separate dressing area. We made good use of the refrigerator. I personally loved the decor and thought the soft green walls were nice. I find it funny that people complain about the lack of pictures on the wall. Who needs pictures when you have that gorgeous view outside your balcony? We had a deluxe ocean front room and the big balcony is worth the extra cost. The only trick is getting one with a great view. I would suggest charging a bit more for the rooms on the 5th and 6th floor because they offer superior views compared to what you get on the lower floors. That way you would know in advance what you are getting and it would help with the complaints from those with the lesser views. I for one would be willing to pay more to ensure I had a room on the higher floors instead of crossing my fingers at check-in. We ate at all the restaurants and they were fine. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace the most. The food was good and the view was even better. It was a great way to start the day. We also ate at Ted's Bakery up the road at Sunset Beach and it was delicious. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative this is your place. There isn't any nightlife here but that was OK with us. We would spend the day at the beach/pool or touring the area and then have dinner around 7 or 8 PM. Ola and The Bay Club had live music at dinner on the nights we were there and that was a nice touch. I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel and hope to be able to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mariabountouraki
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, I was spoiled to a few nights. room views were fabulous, the ocean sounds amazing, spa looked great, saw turtles on the beach and seals. Fantastic place to stay and be spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it to stay at this property”
Reviews.Author: Garden_Isle_Girl71
Reviews.Content: I will be perfectly honest and tell you that what made me want to stay at this hotel was that I watched the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". That movie was probably the best thing that has ever happened to this hotel as many of the other guests I spoke to eventually stated that it was also the reason why they chose to stay at Turtle Bay Resort. Let me warn you that if that is why you are considering this hotel, you are much better off just driving up and seeing it (which will take all of 10 minutes to walk the whole property) and then staying elsewhere. The Hotel Room: I've read some of the positive reviews and it seems that those happy with their stays were in the ocean front suites. That must be the case because the hotel room we were in was so outdated and beat up that it was a little depressing. For example, the furniture has knicks and scratches all over, the A/C was leaking water, the window coverings were stuck open, etc. Let's just say it needs remodeling badly! There are a couple of positives: the bed was comfortable and the view was beautiful. The Staff: The front desk staff is not particularly friendly either. They asked how our stay was and when we told them, they waved us off with a "too bad, hope the rest of your vacation gets better for you." The housekeeping staff, on the other hand, was very courteous. The Amenities: The amenities were a bit of a joke as well. Particularly for the $25 (plus tax) YES, plus tax, that you are charged daily for a resort fee. For example, two of the three pools were closed and the Jacuzzi jets were out of order. This wouldn't normally be a big deal except for the fact that there is NOTHING else to do here. There are no other amenities on the property unless you want to pay extra for golf or tennis. So, just call it a parking fee, which is what it really is. I would really encourage you to do your research before saying here. Their Website looks very nice and they make everything look high-end, but this is far from what we experienced. Granted, if you really want to stay on the North Shore, there aren't many choices. But the island is so small that you can stay anywhere and drive up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon stay!”
Reviews.Author: MPC17
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Turtle Bay Resort, where we spent a few nights on our honeymoon. Everything was great. Our ocean-front room was spacious, clean, comfortable & nicely updated. The grounds are gorgeous. My husband took a surf lesson and had a fun time, the guys were all friendly and helpful. The spa is nice - simple - but nice ... we had a couples' seaside massage and really enjoyed it. The beach area is small but perfect for the resort, not too crowded and it was nice to be able to go snorkeling and not have to leave the resort. We had dinner at Lei Lei's (pretty good), Bay Club (just ok) and Ola (absolutely loved it), lunch and drinks at Hang Ten (good pool-side place) and had the breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace (pricey, but good) two mornings. We wish we could have stayed longer ... really great Honeymoon destination!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amazing staff, mediocre food and a bit pricey but overall *great* resort.”
Reviews.Author: GSather
Reviews.Content: I can’t speak to the rooms in the resort – but the cottages are just stunning. 2 queen beds in a large room with a closet, armoire and sitting area with a table, chairs and a couch as well as a small refrigerator and liquor cabinet. The bathroom contains a HUGE step in marble tub, easily large enough to fully submerge 2 adults. Step out the back door onto a perfectly manicured lawn, a shared hammock and miles of beach with a rocky break. Yes, there are turtles here – although a bit small (1-2 feet). I saw some larger turtles trying to beach but they were having some issues with the larger rocks between the beach and the surf. The resort is excellent – they offer horseback riding (and their horses are well cared for and sweet creatures), mopeds (tripods for those that may worry about balance), helicopter rides (SO FUN!), snorkeling in the protected cove (but where are all of the fish?), a great pool area with large beach towels that can be checked out. The staff was unfailingly courteous – we had a lovely lady named Donna who made sure that our rooms were sparkling and we had all of the amenities we needed. Each day fresh fruits and ice were provided so that we didn’t have to make the long journey to the hotel. The restaurants are a little sub par for resort restaurants – with the exception of the Hang Ben bar at the pool (amazing and fast fare, excellent drinks), the Bay Club and possibly Ola’s (they were busy so our food was cold, but they did offer to bring new dishes to us. We declined). Things to keep in mind – sugar ants are prevalent – clean up after yourself if you’re snacking or drinking. Feral island cats are also common – don’t leave food outside (although we did purposefully fed one skinny little momma). All in all, I would spend a few more days here if I happen to be on the north shore again – but it’s worth journeying off the property for meals and other adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery, comfy room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryJosie
Reviews.Content: W are on day 4 of a 5 day stay here, and we've loved every minute. The staff are all friendly and attentive. The view from our 3rd floor room is of the pool and west side ocean, and we love sitting on the lanai each evening. Definitely worth the upgrade fee from a standard to a deluxe oceanfront to get the lanai! The pool is huge and salt-water rather than chlorine, which I prefer. The $25 resort fee includes parking and free wi-fi. The TV service was just upgraded today and is great. The on-site restaurants are pricey, but the Palm Terrace breakfast buffet was excellent, and we really enjoyed a dinner at Lei Lei's. Pizza at Leonardo's was tasty, and the cheapest meal we had ($14 per pizza, which can feed 2 with an appetizer to start). We love this place and would definitely return! You definitely need a rental car, and make sure to explore the surrounding area - shrimp trucks, Halei'wa, surfing beaches, etc!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort -- it is where to stay on the North Shore !”
Reviews.Author: chucky2
Reviews.Content: After touring the Waimea Valley/Falls park in Waimea, we arrived at Turtle Bay Resort - the beach area is superior and offers good snorkeling. Many surfers will also show their talents and entertain the Turtle Bay guests right beside the pool area. The cocktail service pool side was exceptional, as was the food selection and quality. Rooms were tastefully decorated and were eceptionally comfortable for sleeping. A range of stores for guests, and several restaurants both on and off site. But ...the key offering at Turtle Bay is the true relaxation and north shore laid back feeling - that you don't get at Waikiki -- so this was a change (but we loved Waikiki). Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Food, Horrible Service, Good Location but wouldn't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sstone83
Reviews.Content: If you go here, don’t eat at the restaurants. Overpriced, Denny’s food with bad service to follow. The beach cottage we booked was pricey (Ritz-Carlton pricey) so I expected them to be nice. They weren’t and the front desk staff and concierge don’t even compare to a Marriott. I booked spa appointments two months prior only to get to my treatment and have the wrong type and length time. Since they were busy, I was told they couldn’t do anything about it. When I told this to the concierge who booked it for me, I was told they would research it and get back to me. Well, they did… the day before we left and I was told that he didn’t get it wrong the spa did. Not to mention I called ahead to tell them we were celebrating a birthday and our anniversary. It wasn't even acknowledged at checkin. I had a better time at the next hotel in Honolulu, the Wakiki EDITION. So much better!! Bottom line is, if you are expecting a high end expierence to go with the pricey room rate (at least fo the cottage-dont know about standard hotel room rate) DON"T stay her.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: shannona75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay from April 30th - May 3rd of 2011. We had come from spending 12 days on Maui and wanted to see a little of Oahu. We wanted to stay out of the busy Waikiki touristy area which turned out to be the BEST idea, but more on that later. We drove the 45 minutes from the airport to Turtle Bay and it was a decent scenic route towards the end along the ocean. Once we got there we noticed the lobby was very nice and if you saw the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" you would recognize it right away. The people were very nice.... $15 a night for valet which I thought was a bit high. We were promised an "Ocean View" room and when we got to our room we were VERY disappointed. The rooms were old - no place to put your clothes (no dresser or furniture other then a desk and TV stand even though the room was very large) and the "view" was 95% blocked from a building. We could see the very tops of the Palm trees and about 2% of the water over the top of the building. I am not even sure what the building is, but later on i realized it was part of the gym/spa that was added. Either way - this was NOT an ocean view. I was annoyed but only there for 3 days and didnt have the energy to argue them about it. We spent the next day on the beach which was very nice and quiet. Umbrellas are limited and are positioned along the beach and not movable. If you do not get there early enough you will have to wait until someone leaves. The lounge chairs are old and uncomfortable. You are only allotted one towel per person. But the ocean is nice with the waves crashing on the rocks around it - and a little beach restaurant as well as a little refreshment hut very near by. The grounds looked very nice but we didn't spend much time by the golf course so I cant really speak of it. The pool area and pool was ok. Same uncomfortable lounge chairs, only 1 towel but more umbrellas. There is a little bar which was convenient and there was waitress service. There are a lot of options of restaurants which is nice and the breakfast buffet is good. All in all I would say that the hotel is a 2*-3* which needs some serious updating in the rooms. If you can get a really good deal to stay here then I would take it, but anything above $200 a night is to much. On our last day and on our way back to the airport we decided to go to Waikiki beach to see if we should have stayed there. We are glad we didnt. It was busy and loud and crowded and very touristy. The beach was PACKED. If you are young and looking for a big nightlife and more of a "Social scene" then this is your place. But if you are looking for a more quiet relaxing time, I'd stay outside of Waikiki. However, Waikiki did have some amazing shopping. Very high end stores so it is a fun place to spend a day walking around. On a separate note - we spend our time at the Westin in Maui and LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: TheAwesomes
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights through Whatahotel.com (would recommend), and received free breakfast buffet, $50 food and beverage credit, and a welcome fruit basket, but still felt the rates were too high, after the resort fee, etc. There is no denying that the location, property, and views could justify high rates, but the building itself could use some work. As other reviews state, the rooms are average and a bit outdated, but you'll be fine if you have reasonable expectations. I liked how you can walk quite a distance in either direction from the hotel to find a quiet bit of beach, although most of it is not swimmable. I did not like how the outdoor bar is directly next to the only pool, which results in dripping wet kids running between the tables while you're trying to enjoy happy hour and watch the sunset. (Not the fault of the hotel, just a caution that it's more family-oriented and not as idyllic as you might expect.) Nice overall, but would not recommend for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort.”
Reviews.Author: Staceyzig
Reviews.Content: For all those agonizing on where to stay (like I did) either the north shore or Waikiki, I made the right choice with Turtle Bay. The location is amazing and the resort is beautiful. Waikiki Is so busy it's a relief to get out of the city. I am only on day 2 of my vacation so I cannot yet comment on any of the services offered at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Sad that such a nice location is wasted on a hotel like this one...”
Reviews.Author: ssimmons66
Reviews.Content: So, my husband highly recommended the Turtle Bay Resort because he has stayed there many years ago (when Hilton owned it, I think...) and loved it. We were very excited and we had spent the first part of our vacation on the Honolulu side of Oahu and the second part was to be spent at Turtle Bay. When we arrived, the hotel looked run down and in need of a serious overhaul. The room/hallways of the hotel faintly smelled like urine and the restaurants were less than desirable and run down as well. There was black and brown mold all over the bathroom shower/floors and it was very disappointing. In addition, the weather was rough that day and the spa was out of service, go figure. The grounds at this resort are beautiful, however, the resort itsself is not being managed properly and it really shows. So disappointing for a property with that much potential. My husband and I are not the complaining types, so we spent one night there (instead of four) and checked out the next morning to return to our lovely hotel in Honolulu! Too bad. :(

Reviews.Title: “Love Wind? Love Rain? Hate the Sun? You'll LOVE it here”
Reviews.Author: bravodeltaecho
Reviews.Content: While I will say that on a perfect day, this would be a great spot to land for a vacation, you will TRULY be rolling the dice with the weather. If the sun happens to come out. You will score! If it's a normal day in Kahuku...get ready for enough wind and rain to ruin your day and make you wish you would have just stayed home. Stay in Honolulu (where it's sunny and clear when it's terrible up here) at a nice resort and make a day trip to see the North Shore. You can plan it so you hit the sun...see the beaches...etc. We came on a month where the rain was supposedly in the "least of the year" category. Friends...listen to me clearly here...10 days of STRAIGHT RAIN (and wind). To be fair, you could be in the open air 20% of the day. The other 80% will be inside. We come from a beach city, so maybe a little jaded...but it's nicer where we live...should have stayed there and saved the dough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl5555
Reviews.Content: We just came back home from a one day stay at Turtle Bay after the 7-day NCL cruise. This is truly a beautiful resort with natural beauty. The hotel sits on a point overlooking the pacific with 2 lovely beaches. The gardens and the pool are lovely. We had an oceanfront view on the 6th floor (top floor) with 2 queen beds. The small lanai overlooked the pool area onto the beach. The room had a large closet area with a sink outside the main bathroom (very nice after being in a cruise ship cabin for so long). The room was clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and ordered off the menu. The service was great and the food was delicious. The resort is a bit of a throwback to another era. The room was very nice and clean, but you could tell that it had originally been designed quite a while ago. They even had a gameroom with traditional quarter-sucking video-games and an air-hockey table. The business center consisted of 2 Gateway PCs (wasn't Gateway bought by HP several years ago?). Most of the staff was very friendly (especially Ricky the Bellman - Mahalo Ricky for all your help). Why not 5 stars? Well, we were a bit put off when we first arrived. We arrived and wanted to register. The person greeting the cars (valet perhaps?) insisted that my husband could NOT stay in front of the hotel while I registered. He was quite belligerent that the car must be moved ASAP. They made my husband take the luggage out of the car and self-park while I registered. Every hotel that claims to be this caliber needs to have an area reserved for registering guests near the entrance. Also, I wonder if this would have been an issue if we were going to Valet park the car and give him a tip? There is a $25 resort fee that includes the cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on the North Shore....only resort on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Jaimeandjohn
Reviews.Content: On paper, this place has everything: picture perfect views, amazing wildlife surrounds, world class golf courses, horse riding, excellent tennis, good food, a cultural environment amongst the locals that protects this resort from new competitors, a fantastic gentle surf break, family friendly and a fun pool.....so why does it miss? Unlikely the welcoming charm that accompanies most of the laid-back North Shore, the staff here lack that certain oomph that would otherwise have ou think that they enjoy working in paradise. We had to request 3 of 4 days the bottled water that comes with the rooms. We had to ask for our bags to be delivered to our room 90 minutes after check in. Room service can occur at 3pm - on those days you can forget any mid afternoon naughties. The spa looks great in the brochures but at $470 for a double massage, you can get half way to Bali for that!! Breakfast buffet was as good as anywhere, and there is so much going for it we recommend this resort and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views, Very Happy we stayed”
Reviews.Author: ldewit7
Reviews.Content: We travelled with an infant and a 12 yr old. The resort was clean, friendly and had everything we needed. We were thoroughly satisfied and would recommend this hotel. We had an ocean front deluxe and had enough room for the crib. I disagree with other reviews that it is outdated. The fixtures are not kohler but they are american standard. It was very clean and more than comfortable. The pools were lovely and poolside service was fantastic. We found the restaurants a bit pricey if you are on a budget - everything has resort prices so know that going in. The spa prices were out of reach for us. We hiked, snorkelled in the bay, relaxed poolside and watched the sunset and saw a turtle. With a car, you can explore quiet beaches, find the shrimp trucks and ted's bakery. It was a great leg of our trip. I don't know why people make such a big deal about the resort fee - break it down....$25 per day.....includes self parking, internet, snorkel gear, volleyball rental and much more. You would pay about $30 a day just to park in waikkiki and $13 a day for internet. We found the internet worked just fine. They are not hiding the fee - it is bold when you book online ...not really a big deal when you consider the cost of a trip to hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Family Vacation and Wedding at Turtle Bay Resort!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTerrier81
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Turtle Bay Resort. My husband and I had stayed at the resort in December of 2009 and had written a review upon our return about how much we loved it there. We returned about a month ago, this time we brought along 12 members of our family for our wedding which we had at at the resort. Once again Turtle Bay did not disappoint. Anyone that has ever planned a wedding know's all of the stress and planning that goes into it. TBR made the entire process leading up to our arrival effortless. Everyone that we dealt with from the reservations department to our coordinator was so helpful and professional, and really made our wedding everything that we had hoped that it would be and more. Also, I can't say enough about 21 Degrees North Restaurant, we had our reception dinner there and the food and staff were exceptional. Not only was our wedding day perfect, but our 10 day stay at the resort could not have been any better. I can't stress enough how kind the staff at the resort are. During our first stay in 2009, we met a waitress at the Palm Terrace restaurant named Annie and we would talk to her every morning at breakfast. When we went back, she was still working at Turtle Bay and we told her that we remembered her from the last time we visited and were so excited to see her again. After we had caught up and Annie found out we were getting married in a few days at Turtle Bay, she told us that she wanted to make our wedding lei's for us. It was such a kind a touching gesture and one that I will never forget (the lei's were absolutely beautiful too!). Turtle Bay Resort describes itself as "True Hawaii", and I couldn't agree more. The hotel is situated in a stunning area on the north shore, with ocean views everywhere you look. There are miles of trails at the resort that make you feel like you could be in a tropical jungle. Even our family, many of which are experienced travelers who have been all over the world LOVED Turtle Bay and everyone was so sad to leave. Mahalo Turtle Bay for an amazing wedding and for a vacation that our family will never forget! We will definitely be back soon! If you are considering a trip to Oahu, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “THE STAFF MADE US FEEL LIKE THEY WERE DOING US A FAVOR BY HAVING US THERE..”
Reviews.Author: GMANINV
Reviews.Content: Let me first say, that I always read the trip advisor but take it with a grain of salt as some people are never satisfied. We have stayed in Hawaii on seven differrent occasion, but this is the first in Oahu. We are golfers and it was our anniversary. We purchased the unlimited golf with a ocean view room. As you can probably imagine, they don't give those away. No biggie we don't mind paying for nice things..Upon arrival, we did not get one offer to help us with our bags. We parked a long way away and lugged them in. I was upgraded to a deluxe ocean view which was nice. I ordered a bottle of champagne at the front desk to be sent up the following night to our room on our anniversary. Not only did it never arrive, they were hosting a large wedding on the grounds outside our window, so what should have been a nice champagne toast overlooking the water at sunset, turned out to be listing to loud music and people yelling all night. It would have been nice if they would have let us know, but it was clear they really didn't care.. I stupidly forgot my daily golf voucher the first morning. We walked over to the course because it wasn't that far. We had three days of golf and were registered guests, but they still did not trust us to bring it back the next day, even though I offered to leave my credit card. Yes, you guessed it, we had to go all the way back and bring it to them.. The Fazio course is plain and mediocre. The Palmer course is very good and well manicured. The rooms are very old, but in Hawaii, thats no big deal. When we checked out, I mentioned how dissapointed I was regarding them not taking the time to deliver the champagne to our room and not advising us that there was a wedding outside our room on our anniversary, even though they knew was... Their response..."THATS A BUMMER".. We won't come back, the scenery was unbelievably good, but they can't screw that up...... Our advice. If you want to go to Oahu, stay at the JW Marriott and visit Turtle Bay for the day or skip Ohau and go to Princeville, where they treat you like guests.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced what I dreamed Hawaii would be staying at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Strega7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick trip to Oahu. My family has never been to Hawaii and I was afraid that by going to Oahu, it was going to be more like visiting an overcrowded city than a nice relaxing beach vacation. By staying at Turtle Bay resort, I had my nice relaxful beach vacation I was looking for. It is about an hour drive up to the North Shore, but very beautiful and worth it. The resort grounds are beautiful, I think all rooms have a view of the ocean, I loved the beach area, and then also the swimming area. When in our room sleeping, I never heard any noise from any room around us. I was actually quite amazed at how quiet our room was. I was also very happy with the staff, they all seemed very friendly. We tried the shrimp trucks and also Teds Bakery, both are a must do. We drove one day back to the city to go to Pearl Harbor and was glad that we were not staying in the hustle and bustle of the city. We also did a "LOST" hummer tour with KOS tours, if you are a fan of the tv show lost, I would highly recommend this, it was a blast. Can't wait to go back to Oahu again.

Reviews.Title: “great if you go to relaxation but stay on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: chon
Reviews.Content: This is the only resort/ hotel on the north side of Oahu. There's nothing on the east and west side of the island. The south side is all Honolulu/ Waikiki. The main building resort is a huge compound/ hotel setting (huge tri-star architecture) with some three hundred plus rooms. Then there are side buildings with more expensive bunaglo settings. The setting is beautiful. While staying here, be sure to play a round of golf on either of the two 18 hole courses. The Arnold palmer course is much, much nicer. Golf club rentals were $45 (for the week, not a day- didn't know this). You can get an affordable round of golf in if you are military or a resident.. OR you can play a discounted rate after 2PM. You can also walk the 18 hole Fazio course after 3 PM for like $15. (The Palmer course is further out and does not allow walking- and you wouldn't want to walk it, anyway.) Beautiful walking trails to the left and right of the compound.. The best restaurant is Lei Lei's, which is actually the golf club house. I had a 24 ounce prime rib. To conserve money, my wife and I grocery shopped at Foodland and another place (both about 8 miles out. Most rooms come with a refrigerator.. nothing else. Restaurant dining on the resort is pretty expensive. I had a hamburger and fries for $16.95 while poolside, but it was good. Drinks are seriously expensive.. about $10.00 average. This place is a definite must visit. There is zero nightlife on the northshore. Zero. But most people don't go northshore for that. We had spa treatment one day. They tack on an additional 18% to the stated fee. My wife and I had 50 minute couples massage for $358. It was good but much pricier than I anticipated. One word of advise.. do not do the Luau.. everyone wants to do a Luau b/c it's Hawaii. We went to the Polynesian Cultural Center, which is Mormon operated. It was such a disappointment. $200 plus dollars and then they upsell you on everything. I mean everything. Food was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave, very relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: westloch
Reviews.Content: Second time to Turtle Bay resort. Still as beautiful and friendly as the first visit. The staff was exceptional in all areas, from check-in, towel counter, restaurants, to the beach staff and housekeeping. We definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Dekangaroo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Turtle bay late in the evening for our week’s vacation. No doorman or bellman to assist at a 4 star hotel? When we went to check in even though we called every week for a month prior requesting a king bed in our beach side cottage, we received two doubles. Upon registering, I noticed that there were two lights out above the desk making it very difficult to see the registration card. Both of which was still out when we checked out a week later. The food at the hotel is of very poor quality and extremely overpriced. Don’t waste your time eating at the resort and go off property. After a few meals on property: Breakfast at Palm Terrace, which was awful and extremely over priced; a snack in the Bay Club sports bar which is a mismatch of old furniture with no ambience; Ola’s where we were unable to dine due to the hostess being too busy talking on her blackberry to be courteous; Room Service knocking on our door at almost midnight when we never ordered room service. After all this we ended up eating out for the remainder of the week. Prior to arrival we also booked two 80 minute massages and ended up getting only 50 minute massages even though we had a confirmation. The cottages while nice, but lack any touches that would justify the pricing and the rating. Linens were very old, warn and of very poor quality. Overall a very disapointing stay and definitely not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Was not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Angela6569
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews online we decided to pay the extra money and stay in one of the cottages. The cottages were very nice but the parking was difficult. After checking in and finding that there was no parking near our cottage we had to park further down and drag suitcases for a family of four back up to our cottage. It would have been nice if we had been warned there might not be any parking and offered some help. Once in our oom we were immediately greeted by a concierge. He was very pleasant and told us he looked forward to "pampering" us for the next few days. Call me anytime he said. Never saw him again. When we did call the concierge it took several tries to get someone to answer. We told him we wanted reservations to a Luau at the P.C.C. He said, "Oh, I used to work there. They never sell out. You don't need reservations". Upon his advice we went to the PCC around 12:30 the next afternoon, they do not open until 12 and were told that they were already sold out. We had to make reservations to come back the next day. By the time we got back to the hotel we had wasted almost a whole day of our vacation waiting, and then driving back and forth, including a trip to a restaurant he recommended which is a whole other story. Finally, the beds. Unlike even some of even the cheapest hotels they do not put the blanket between two clean sheets. Since the blankets are probably not washed that often your only option is a sheet and questionable blanket. Also, they only use flat sheets not fitted for the bottom. Most mornings we woke up with nothing between us and the bed. Very gross. For the money they charge you would think they would at least spring for some fitted sheets. Also, the room was not cleaned very well. They left a cup of lemon water sitting on my nightstand for two days. Also, don't ask for more than one cup of POG juice which is complimentary upon checking in. We were told management did not allow it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: Keena_b
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and sad to leave. Beautiful grounds and setting. Nice pools. Beach for surfing, another for snorkeling. Friendly staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but the staff suck and it is over rated and expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Britanictraveller
Reviews.Content: Other than the location, the hotel sucks. I'm writing this while still at the hotel because I feel so badly about it! Having paid for the hotel in the UK before I left, I wasn't surprised to have to pay local taxes but to have to pay $25 per room per day (I have 2 rooms) is ridiculous - they may as well just be open and honest and include it in the price. They say it covers parking (if you can find a space within 1/4 mile of the hotel), Internet (which is slower than slow) - and just to make it even better, they refer to it being "complementary" yet use it to justify the $25 (clearly the General Manager has no idea of the dictionary definition of complimentary)! and if one more member of staff asks me the "programmed" "how are you today" and walks off before I even answer I will go mad! The check in is a disaster - we queued for 15 minutes, I asked the member of staff how many stars the hotel was - I had to tell him it as 4 star! I've stayed in far better hotels in the UK, other parts of the US and Africa. - I definately would not recommend it Basically a rip off -

Reviews.Title: “RESORT, SERVICE OUTSTANDING.”
Reviews.Author: ralphsr39
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded, had cottage on ocean front. Reception of employees was very interested in our comfort and awareness of what Turtle Bay had to offer to make our stay enjoyable. Also informative about other activies on North Shore...Resturanr at Golf course for dinner was pricy, but excellent...You have to try Ted's Bakery, local, everything on menu is excellent to bake goods. It seves breakfast, lunch and dinner plates..(not expensive) We have eaten there several times thru years past.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations...and they were high to begin with”
Reviews.Author: EVLightning
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a place so relaxing you forget what day it is, miss your flight, and "have" to stay two more nights, as a result? We stayed for what was supposed to be 5 nights between Christmas and New Years with three young children, 7, 6, and 4. However, we must have discovered "true Hawai'i," as we lost track of the days and realized at about the time our flight was scheduled to leave, that we were supposed to be on it. It seems the hotel had been trying to contact us all day, but we didn't have our phones with on the beach or on our kayak trip, and therefore were clueless. Instead of being angry with us, they just let us stay in our room while they upgraded the guests who had reserved our beach cottage. Not sure how they could have upgraded them, as the cottages are amazing, but I'm grateful they did and truly sorry we messed up the plans of those folks who were expecting a beach cottage. Our kids loved the pools and the beach...we ate lunch beachside nearly every day. Went to Ted's a few times for various meals and enjoyed the main restaurant in the hotel a couple of times. Tried to get into the beachside place and the other restaurants onsite, but we didn't book reservations in time. The food was better than decent and did not seem horribly priced, despite what you read from others. We're fairly discriminate when it comes to eating out and there was nothing that we had that would make me inclined to give the place a negative review. We don't do buffets, so can't speak to that, though we did do a buffet that was provided free on New Year's Eve because of a power outage. Considering everything was heated by candles, it wasn't too bad...especially for the price. Another example of the exemplary service. Really the only drawback was the weather. The rains came early this year and it did rain nearly every day, but no day was a total washout and we still received our fair share of sun...certainly enough for a bunch of pale-skinned Minnesotans. We chose Turtle Bay to celebrate our 10th Anniversary and because I had seen Forgetting Sarah Marshall. I read hundreds of these reviews and was a bit leery after reading some of the complainers comments, but I would stay again in a heartbeat...and we will be staying again. We stay at nice places when they are available and did stay a night at a very nice place in Waikiki, but Turtle Bay's location and relaxing vibe put Waikiki to shame. If you want Cancun or Miami during spring break, Waikiki is the place for you. If you want relaxation and time with the family to just be...pony-up for the beach cottage at Turtle Bay and you might just forget what day it is, too.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort Cottages are Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Wally_G_Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in one of the Turtle Bay Resort Cottages. Absolutely awesome view from a beautiful room. Not sure how a room could have a better ocean view. The cottage concierge was helpful and the daily afternoon fresh fruit delivery was a nice touch. Our only problem was finding a parking spot in the Cottage parking area. It was always full. Tennis courts were plentiful. Golf was right there. Helicopter was giving rides all day. Not sure what the rooms in the main building are like. Be sure to stop by Ted's Bakery, Waimea Valley and Hale'iwa when on the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing compares to North Shore”
Reviews.Author: KasChris
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 1/2 year old daughter stayed here for 5 days in late March. We reserved a premium ocean front room which was on the 4th floor facing the cove.The room was roomy, clean and had a small balcony. The beach at the cove is great for small children. Given the enormity of the waves in this area, the sheltered beach was perfect for my daughter to play in the water near shore. One of the unique aspects of the TBR is that they use large floodlights to light the waves at night on both sides of the hotel. The only criticism about the room was the intermittent wifi. If you are going to provide wifi, it should work. Otherwise provide wired internet. We ate twice at Ola, twice at Leonardo's, once at Lei lei's,3 times at the poolside bar and twice ordered room service. In my opinion the restaurants and room service at TBR are on the high side of Hawaiian expensive. Ola is a nice, airy restaurant on the beach. As my wife is a vegetarian, the kitchen twice improvised pasta dishes which she enjoyed. I had the (shutome) local swordfish one night and ahi the other. The accompaniment, particulalry the local purple sweet potatoes, made the dishes. Leonardo's appears to be struggling with identity as a new restaurant. Unfortunately, the space doubles by day as the breakfast buffet, so there is little Italian ambiance. As this was my wife's birthday and I had pre-ordered a cake, I was a bit disappointed that the well-intentioned hostess spoiled the suprise by inquiring about the time of presentation with my wife. We shared the caprese-style salad which was good, utilizing local tomatoes. However,the mozzarella was not as fresh as one would prefer. My wife had the penne with a very spicy arrabbiata tomato sauce. I had the fresh ravioli filled with chicken, mushroom and prosciutto which was very rich and tasty. Later in the week, we again shared the caprese and my wife had the eggplant parmegiana which was baked and not quite breaded enough for my wife's taste. I had the steamed clams and the mushroom and fresh tomato pizza, each okay but somewhat lacking in real flavor. On both occasions the wait staff was earnest. On one evening, one of the valets was nice enough to drive us in a cart the relatively short distance from the hotel to the golf course where Lei Lei's is located. For a golf course restaurant, it does tremendous evening business. Many reviewers claim this is the best restaurant for food at TBR. My wife had a vegetarian pasta and I had the ahi sashimi as a starter and the prime rib, both which were quite good. The hotel pools were great. The keiki pool was only 1 1/2 foot deep and my daughter loved being able to stand up no matter where she was. The adult pool was beautiful and the pool area, including the bar, provided tremendous views of the ocean. One thing that distinguishes TBR from most Hawaiian resorts is that when you look down the beach you see beach, not a string of other resorts. We had a great time and felt that the staff was friendly and honest about the services and amenities it offered. Me definitely plan on visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Outdated Decor”
Reviews.Author: DenaDuo
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the North Short of Oahu this is the only resort/hotel option available. Having said that....the location of this resort is fantastic. Views from hotel room were beautiful and relaxing and there is ocean on both sides of the resort. But we were somewhat dissapointed in the decor. The lobby was ok but the rooms within the hotel portion of the resort were outdated. But the room size was very generous and bed was comfy. Happy hour was excellent at the pool bar---good choice of beer options and great way to watch the sunsets. Restaurants were expensive....especially for breakfast....but the Italian restaurant was reasonably priced and food was delicious. We opted to eat outside of the resort the majority of the time at some of the local restaurants in nearby Haleiwa for lunch/dinner and the local restaurant "Ted's" for breakfast. If you are a golfer there are two beautiful courses to choose from. We were also not overly impressed by the staff there. For the amount of money you spend I expected a little more attention and friendliness from them. Also, hotel is under construction for their roof but we didn't really hear them working too much but we weren't really there for the majority of the day so I'm not sure if the work was more intrusive during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting - bad everything so-so..”
Reviews.Author: jjgoehring
Reviews.Content: The setting is beautiful. We finished out honeymoon at Turtle Bay after staying 9 days in the Fairmont in Maui. We got hooked w/ how impressive the hotel was portrayed in the moving Forgetting Sarah Marshall (walk in the lobby and you'll quickly feel fooled b/c the movie make it look so much better) and w/ our desire to visit Pearl Harbor we thought this would be a great way to end our honeymoon. We had a cottage room that was 50 feet from the water and the hammock outside was a great touch. Here is where I leave the trip saying I'll never go back ... we pull in and up to the check in - the parking situation was a mess. The valets were not interested in helping and/or directing traffic to keep the area flowing. We get to the front desk and the person did not give us that polished staff impression we had at the Fairmont in Maui. You could tell this was just a job to the person checking us in and not very interested in highlighting the resort. So within the first 15 minutes of pulling into the property we say to each other - I wish I was back at the Fairmont b/c their staff puts this one to shame. Next, I'll talk about their stupid "resort fee" - you get free internet (that doesn't work half the time) and park yourself (I guess that means you get no help getting your bags to your room). The beach/pool experience was frustrating, don't even get me started how angry they had us when we arrive at the beach and literally have to fight to get beach chairs - they ran out of chairs!?!? So you have to stand waiting for someone to leave - the kicker was that It wasn't even crowded. Then you have a "towel card" that gets you a ONE WHOLE towel for your day at the beach or pool - in contrast the Fairmont has towels rolled up and waiting for you to take whatever you need and don't lose your towel card - yup, they charge you $25 for that if you do. Last, the restaurants were marginal at best. I expect to pay more at a resort, so higher pricing doesn't bother me, but what does is when you pay a higher price and the food just wasn't that good. Average at best food was the theme as we tried every place at the resort. Personally, my wife and I will never be going back here and we'll make sure our friends are informed to have a better expectation than we did if they want to go here.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must-stay, must frequent vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: emelletea82
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort was an amazing stay! The pools were clean and sparkling, there was ample chairs, tables, and umbrellas, the beach was clean and even for the North Shore, Turtle Bay has created a beach that is friendly to families, breaks the huge North Shore waves, but still leaves a bit of wave and nature to play in. After reading some of the reviews, I was afraid that I would arrive to find a hotel that was at the end of it's glory days and sinking into disrepair and therefore sinking in quality. What we found was none of that. From the moment we arrived to the minute we left, everything was wonderful! There wasn't a bellman, wait staff, front desk staff member, or even a cleaning lady who wasn't anything but A++! The hotel staff even offered to keep our bags for us and let us hang out and play at the pools or the beach for the rest of the day after we checked out since we had a late flight back. We are planning our next trip back even from the airport as we wait for our return flight home. And one last thing, you HAVE to try a Monkey's Lunch while lounging at the pool!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthPilgrims
Reviews.Content: Being from the UK, you're not meant to know Hawaii 'that well'. This is our fourth trip and for the first time ever, we haven't done the two island 'thing' we did the North Shore and Waikiki. Turtle Bay is wonderful and we loved it, wonderful location and the staff were very good. We upgraded to a 'premium ocean view' and what a bonus, we saw the massive waves for 6 nights. I'm glad we hired a car though as we nipped down to Waimea Bay and Pipeline on an almost daily basis. What a shame you Americans drive on the wrong side though, I would have thought our 5 litre red Jeep is now legendary as we made people swerve all over the place on our daily vigil. Foodwise, I've known better, 21 Degrees was lovely, Ola Bar was passable, Lei Lei's was OK and Hang Ten was awful, but we ate out at lot and between that and 21 Degrees, it didn't spoil the holiday. Fumi's shrimp truck was a hit though, and we visited that most lunch times, as the food around the pool was a tad 'American' for us (I hope that's not an insult, but the amount of food was a put off). Lovely staff, truly lovely and we loved the hotel. Thanks a lot. Ian & Lyn.

Reviews.Title: “Love the North Shore and Turtle Bay Resort is Not Too Bad, Either!”
Reviews.Author: RichlandTripsrus
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my fist and won't be the last trip to the North Shore of Oahu. What a beautiful and so tourist frenzied free location to spend 12 nights. My friend and I booked 12 nights in a premuium oceanfront room at the Turtle Bay Resort. This is the largest and most full service resort on the North Shore. The property is beautiful, and the staff for the most part are top notch. The rooms are showing their age and especially the bathrooms really need to be updated. The only negatives were the drink prices appear to be a bit high $10 plus tax for a glass of white wine at the pool bar, and we tried to really like the staff 3 times at the main lobby bar, but failed! We booked through Costco Travel and had a rental car for the entire time which made it easier to go off-property for more reasonably priced meals. That is another suggestion for the new resort owners which is to offer more family oriented and a bit lower priced menu selections.

Reviews.Title: “love love love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: OKAY YES, I have to admit, the only reason why my boyfriend and I chose this hotel was because it was in the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall!" Hahah. BUT WE DON'T REGRET IT! The staff was amazing, like most customer service you'll receive in Hawaii. Our room was probably the best room we've ever had in all the islands we've stayed at in Hawaii. Our view was AMAZING!!!!! I loved the location because coming from a big city, we loved being away from Waikiki and all of the tourists and loud noise you would find outside of north shore. Overall, I would love to come back here!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: atechmonkey
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd year in a row going to Oahu and again staying at Turtle Bay (we should get a frequent guest card like starbucks lol..jk) we will be going last week of April. Last year was awsome we went during the 4th of July weekend, They have a concert/food thing going on the lawn, the food was great and the "Ka’ala Boys" I think they were called were really good. Fireworks were amazing definately a must if your there during 4th of july. It was definately a great family experience. Turtle Bay is one of the main reasons we keep coming back to oahu for our yearly vacation. If you do plan to go during 4th of july weekend i recommend getting your seats early atleast an hour before show, if you are planning to watch from the pool area. It does get crowded but it was lots of fun. The staff is great, the rooms and views are beatiful. My wife still isnt very confotable going into the water by herself, the beach is really calm so a great safe place for those who those who still need some swimming help.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort away from the hustle of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: yeowoh
Reviews.Content: We took the unlimited golf package and it was fantastic value. Turtle Bay resort offers 2 18-hole wonderful courses and so we spent the whole day at the courses without thinking much about the hotel and other amenities. As soon as we checked in after the golf games late in the evening, we started to regret not spending more time exploring the resort. The room was spacious and well appointed with a firm comfortable bed. It has a lanai opening out to the sea offering panoramic views of the ocean beyond the bay. The bay for swimming looks fantastic and very inviting although it was already too dark to enjoy it by the time we saw it. There are also lovely jogging tracks around the resort and horse riding trails by the beach which we would have loved to undertake if only we knew the resort offered much more than just golf. Dinner at Ola at Turtle Bay was great. It sits by the beach at the bay and the ambience was just unbeatable and the price was reasonable. The resort is just a short drive from the famous surfing North Shores of Oahu and the quaint town of Haleiwa on the west and the Polynesian Cultural Center in Laia on the east. So, Turtle Bay resort can make a nice base for a fun-filled and relaxing week in Oahu away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but service outrageous! Extremely expensive!”
Reviews.Author: mariodambrosio
Reviews.Content: Never again in my life! The most rude people I've meet in my life! They try to charge also the air to breathe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on North shore”
Reviews.Author: HarperFredsmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from for four nights in march in a deluxe ocean view room which had a nice balcony overlooking turtle bay. Room was was large and clean but the bathroom could use a revamp. Its a good base for exploring the north shore and has some nice walks around the area. The Italian restaurant Leonardos was pretty terrible. My spaghetti meatballs was like out of a tin, totally overcooked pasta and sauce was way too sweet. My wife's Lasagne was equally poor. There was nothing Italian about this place. I had some better meals at Lei leis near the golf course. I'm not sure I would go for a cottage for twice the price when they are very unprivate with people wandering past your door all day gawking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: 10truck
Reviews.Content: We are not resort types, but this was a great experience. The service was awesome, the room was clean with amazing views. The beach is nice and protected. The food is decent. They have all you could possibly ever need. The only thing that bothered us was the litter. Why do people, especially smokers get to just drop their butts and other garbage? You do need a car to get here. I am sure shuttles and cabs are way expensive as this is on the extreme North Shore. But it is worth it. There are lots of places to drive to and things to do away from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but watch out for extra charges!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dette17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel since it is my nth time going to Hawaii but my husband and my daughter's first time. I want them to experience the tranquility of the island away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We all loved the hotel and yes, the extra $25 per night "Convenience Fee" was disclosed to me by my travel agent and I agreed to it. We didn't get the room that we booked on our first night and they put us in a one bed room instead with my daugther sleeping on a roll-away bed (she didn't sleep at all because of the springs from her bed). I stated this to the front desk when I checked-out and he credited me one of the $25 charge which is okay. Today I found a $75 extra charge to my credit card and they told me that it is due to the towels/towel cards not returned to them. I told the crediting manager that I returned the towel cards and he reversed the charges. A few minutes later, the hotel manager, Fina called me to apologize and to check if there's anything else....kudos for this! Overall, the hotel is great, housekeeping and staff are awesome and I would go back again and again to the hotel. But just watch out for extra charges that might creep up on your credit card when you come back home. Another thing too is, they offer activities for kids like lei making, ukulele classes and hula classes at no charge (lei making is $5 for materials). Tutu teaches the ukulele and hula, she must be 100 years old but she is the cutest person ever. The kids enjoy her, she's very lively and enthusiastic about what she does. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and Great Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Wetrug
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at Turtle Bay at the end of February and had a great time. The grounds are beautiful. The beach is nice and great for novice snorkeling. They do have a limited number of loungers, so if you want one get there a little early. The pools are nice, we only hung out around the main pool area and never had a problem getting 2 loungers together. The room was nice, we had a deluxe ocean front on the 4th floor. View was awesome. Room was very clean, no problems. We only ate at Ola's and Leonardo's. Both are a little pricey, but Ola's was definitely worth it. We were a little disappointed with Leonardo's, and wouldn't do it again. Overall, great resort, the north shore is beautiful, definitely rent a car and check out places to eat in Haleiwa and the shrimp trucks. If you're expecting 5 star luxury then this isn't the place for you. But they don't advertise themselves as 5 star, so I'm not sure why people are always complaining about this. All the staff were great, including the check-in desk. You've got some serious problems if you can't enjoy yourself here. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly resort with safe swimming on the north shore of oahu.”
Reviews.Author: Surfcoast09
Reviews.Content: The resort is family friendly for all ages of children. The beach behind the resort has calm waters, even when other parts of the north shore have 20-30 foot waves. The grounds are impeccably kept, barely even a grain of sand other than on the beach, or even a leaf on the lawn. Guests are expected to adhere to the "resort rules"-- security and housekeeping hand out "tickets" or "notices" for not adhering to the rules. These notices are always politely stated, but can drive a person crazy after receiving one every day for something or the other--for not completing the parking pass required to be shown in the window of the car, or for leaving a towel outside accidentally, or for sitting and talking outside later when others in the condo are asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Unspoiled beauty and Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: elizabethF67
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that any negative reviews HAVE GOT TO BE coming from overall negative people. YOU ALL Know the type of person(s) I am referring to. Turtle Bay is an absolutely beautiful, clean, natural, rustic yet elegant dream location. The resort was love at first sight. My family which includes two teenage daughters my husband and myself, had the best vacation of our lives. Turtle Bay has so much to offer, all nestled along the NOrth Shore. From gorgeous sunsets, rocking waves, excellent bay for swimming snorkeling, it has a beautiful pool area, pristine landscaping, delicious restaurants (Ola being my personal favorite) a bounty of activities available to you and above all, the most wonderful staff ever!! We stayed on the second floor in a deluxe ocean view with lanai...OHHH MY GOSH!!!, The view was breathtaking, the room clean clean clean...and the beds were sooo comfty!!! This is our third trip to Hawaii, our second to Oahu. We have stayed at 5 star resorts in Kona, Honolulu, Mauii and Kuai(sorry for misspelling) The North Shore is truly unspoiled. We explored to the East and West of the resort. Saw 4 enormous sea turtles sleeping on the beach. Swam in the crazy waves in Waihema bay, and witnessed some remarkable surfing. Waihema Valley is enchanting, with a rainforest and waterfall. We drove into Haleiwa, the surfing town, quaint surf town with great shave ice ... I could go on...But please do not let any negative review question your decision to book at Turtle bay,book it you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Wished we would have stayed here the entire trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: WestTX_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3/12 to 3/16 then went on to Waikiki & the Surfrider. This was our first time to Hawaii and it was so peaceful & amazing. We were able to swing a beach cottage, but even if we had stayed in the hotel it would have been great. The property itself is still looking good and the staff really represented the "Aloha" spirit. We ate at several of the on site restaurants and were treated to exceptional service & food. We loved the North Shore all way down from Haleiwa to Laie. We snorkeled several different locations when the surf wasn't to high and loved the beautiful scenery. We were celebrating our 5 year anniversary and would come back in a heartbeat with our children. I appreciate all the reviews and advice that I used in planning our trip for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing way to end our trip to Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: mcmomny
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here in the beach cottages and it was more than I could hope for! A wonderful way to end our trip to Hawaii! Check in was fast and friendly, we were directed to our beach cottage and our luggage almost beat us there! Rooms are wonderful! Yes a little older but huge high ceilings, massive marble bathroom with all kinds of coconut lotions, soaps and bubble baths! Thick, lovely towels. And the lani was what makes the room! Table and two chairs and the best views anywhere! Very friendly birds landing on my lap looking for hand outs! After being in our room only a few minutes and the guest service person arrived with fresh juice, bottled water, Turtle Bay T shirts and fresh fruit! We explored the beach, went to the pool area and had a great lunch and local beer at the pool bar! When we returned to our room Champagne was waiting for us as it was our anniversary! We watched the sunset from our lani, walked out to the beach and over to the main hotel for dinner. We opted to eat at the bar where they had live music, very enjoyable. We had a pizza which was plenty for the two of us as our lunch was huge! The next morning we hung out at the pool, it had been raining up to this point and the sun finally came out so we soaked up as much sun as we could before we had to check out and head to the airport. This was an amazing hotel, loved being here! Only negative I could mention, we booked the "romantic beach cottages" at a much higher rate then the main hotel and the room next to us was a couple with two small kids. It was just surprising to hear kids crying in the cottages they advertise to honeymooners!

Reviews.Title: “Very average resort, but fine value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3 star hotel. It is not the same quality that you would expect (or get) at a Westin, Hyatt, Hilton, etc., which I consider to all be solid 4 star hotels. If you're paying more than $225 a night, you're paying too much. Highlights: Service is good, the views are gpod, and the beach is nice. This is a fine place to spend a couple nights. But not more than that. Negatives: The rooms are clean, but other areas could use a scrubbing, especially the very dirty fitness center. Also, the food is horrible. Do whatever you can to avoid eating at the hotel. Plenty of local places that will serve you better food at far more reasonable prices. While most resorts in Hawai'i have average to above average food, the food here was very much below average. Bottom line: Turtle Bay is an okay resort on the north shore of Hawai'i, but you can do better for the same or slightly more money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Memories for a lifetime made in just 24 hrs at this beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kostiuk
Reviews.Content: Made welcome without any fuss, although we arrived 6pm without a reservation, were given room on 6,th floor overlooking beach and pool and the magnificent sunset! Room immaculate, staff service friendly and efficient, cocktails at happy hour in lounge with musicians creating relaxing ambience and dinner in the Italian restaurant of a high standard.
