We slept with doors open, sounds of the surf crashing on rocks, altogether a memorable 24 hours, we will be back for longer next visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on North Shore, do it up local style”
Reviews.Author: airriq
Reviews.Content: This resort is to enjoy the island in a more natural setting. From the local restaurants and beaches to the overall quiet state of North Shore, this is the best way to enjoy Hawaii. I used to live on Oahu, so I had no need or desire to go to Waikiki. It's great for some and there's much more nightlife, but it's a city and doesn't make me feel like I'm getting away from it all. Most people have the basics covered in the hotel, but here's my tips that I didn't necessarily see in other reviews. Try to get down to the front desk around 5 - 6pm every day and take advantage of the fresh pineapple juice every single day. Snorkeling isn't the best I've ever seen but for most people who've never done it, you'll see a variety of colorful fish that will get you excited. Snorkel in the morning and go farther out in the bay towards the waves to see the best views. Even out there, you can still stand up in some spots. In the room. use the wooden blinds and open the sliding glass door every night. It will still keep the room dark and you can hear the waves all night. Consider getting a waterproof camera even if it's a throwaway. Take pictures going down the slide in the pool. Whether you're young or old, I guarantee you some of those pictures will be your favorites. As for the island itself, I'd encourage you to not eat at the hotel if you have a car. It's not a slight on the food there and I don't say that because I think the food is poor. It may very well be great. It's just that if you're on the island, go take advantage of the local food. We didn't eat on the resort once and I wish we could have stayed longer just to eat at our favorite places over and over again. As for my favorites, you really should do breakfast at either Ted's Bakery up the road or Haleiwa Cafe in Haleiwa. The quesadilla is the best and get it with avocado if you like avocado. The other must is Kahuku Grill. You turn left when you leave the resort and it's tucked away, but look it up. They have one of the best burgers. Now, I'm west coast so I'm obviously partial to In N Out. People have come up to me for years and said this burger or that burger is as good as In N Out and none have come close. Well people, we have a legitimate contender. Get it with avocado and bacon. Well worth it! All these places are just simple places, but it so makes you feel like you actually live there. If you're a stuffy dress up and see the wine list type of person, you may be disappointed. If you like good food at a good price, stay local! And for those of you who've never been, get a few flavors of Hawaiian Sun drinks while you're out. They're all good and no they're not diet, but live a little since you're on vacation. Speaking of which, the infamous shaved ice. You can get it anywhere, but I'd go to Haleiwa to either Matsumoto's or Aoki's. Get the Lilikoi flavor at least once. It's passion fruit. And I'm partial to pineapple. If you like the fruit, you won't be disappointed. Yes, it's touristy, but hey, you're a tourist. And if you have some time, you really should consider the ATV tour at Kualoa ranch. Do the 2 hour tour. It's not cheap, but again, if you spent the money to go to Hawaii, spend a little more and do it. You will not be disappointed. Besides, you'll save all that money by eating local. One last eating suggestion, try to stop by a Cookie Corner. Look it up! Again, I know my opinion is just one of many. However, I hope you try and like at least some of the suggestions. Pass it along if you agree. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Loved the whole place. great room, great food, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrsEGA
Reviews.Content: The weather was stormy and we still had a great time. Ono restaurant on the beach was great.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyheather
Reviews.Content: After a few dasy in Waikik we were ready for some relaxation and the opportunity to spend time in smaller towns and less crowded beaches on Oahu. The room was large and clean - our view was Ocean Front which was 2nd floor - we had a wonderfulu view of the pool - a bit obstructed by the roof of the restaurant but ok. The pool is wonderful and much more than the cement hole you get at other hotels. Loved the Italian restaurant - prices were such better than I had read on previous reviews. We drove around the North Shore - Sunset Beach, Shark Cove but returned in time for happy hour and drinks by the pool. At night there was live entertainment which was wonderful. The only thing that 'irked us' were how fast the employees drove around on those gator / golf carts. They would whip around corners at night going way too fast and we had a few romantic peaceful walks interupted as we dodged out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to stay in busy Waikiki, this is the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: robbygole
Reviews.Content: If you're not looking for the crowds of Waikiki, the Turtle Bay resort is a great alternative! After renting a car, it took us about an hour to get there, with a little rushhour traffic in Honululu. It was easy to find, and the staff was all VERY welcoming. It was our anniversary, so they upgraded us from a junior suite to a 2 bedroom suite, and sent up a bottle of champagne. The rooms are somewhat generic, nothing too luxurious, but everything you need, including big bathrooms, refrigerators, guidebooks, nice TVs, etc. The two bedroom suites are actually two adjoining rooms, the first is a standard room, the other is a larger room with a few couches, desk, chaise, dining table, second bathroom, and larger lanai. It was almost too much space for us! Between the beaches and the jungle walking trails, there is a lot of places to walk and get away from the hotel itself, and there are no other hotels or homes for miles. The main beach is nice, not at all crowded or noisy. The surf was a little rough, but it's March. Snorkeling was OK, but nothing special. Quiet rooms, very comfortable beds. Drinks are expensive, $10 mai tais and $5 to $6 beers, but there is a shop where you can get a six pack of local beer for $13 or bud light for $11, along with wine, liquor, snacks, etc. Several dining options, pretty good food but very pricy. I recommend Lei Lei's, on the golf course. Fantastic breakfast and dinner for a little cheaper, just won't have any great ocean views. Several small towns and eateries are within a 10 minute drive, so it makes sense to venture out. Lots of cool surf shops and well marked beaches. I would recommend spending one day off of the resort for exploring, shopping, and other beaches, but there is plenty to do if you stay there. We did not do any of the activities (horseback riding, kayaking, etc), so I can't attest to those, but very happy with the resort in every way. One thing to consider, although almost every room in the resort itself has great ocean views, they don't all have full size lanais. Some only have Juliet balconies, not big enough for a chair. I would recommend asking for a room with a full size lanai.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice hotel but don't expect management to address any concerns.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyRN
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at this hotel. The grounds were beautiful! A few things annoyed me. One morning, actually our last day there, I was almost run over by the exercise class. I was 12 weeks pregnant at the time so I was a little upset. We got back from our vacation and I emailed the management to let them know that it was bothering me. I felt like I had every right to the side walk as the "class" The instructor was actually the one that grazed me. I never received a call or an email from the resort. I did not want anything but some acknowledgment and an appology. I also never saw the waterslide working once in the five days we spent there. There were a lot of kids there for it to not be in working condition. As far as the food, we never ate at the resort so I can not comment on it. The soap and shampoo in the rooms were nice. The staff was pleasent. (Other than the exercise instructor) The rooms were very outdated but clean. I also like that snorkeling for 1 hour per day is included in your room package.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: travelzoe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read reviews and done all our research. We were so excited to enjoy our vacation in Hawaii where we stayed for 3 nights in Waikiki and then drove to the North Shore to stay 2 nights at Turtle Bay Resort. When we checked in, the valet staff was friendly and eagerly convinced us to pay extra to valet our car. We then waited in line behind the crew for Cougar Town for 45 minutes. When we got to the check in counter, the staff was overwhelmed and we were treated differently than the LA group. (Having lived in LA for 20 years, I know when I'm being treated differently. We were treated as though we were just some dumb couple on vacation - not people with money.) We got to our room, which was not even at Motel 6 standards. The walls were all scuffed with black marks and poorly touched up with non-matching green paint. The wall outlets were crooked and falling off the walls with unknown (dust?) black/gray fluff coming out of the cracks. The green walls felt like a hospital and the bathroom was dark and dreary. The lighting in the bathroom was falling apart, chipped and dirty. The wood around the window/sliding glass door had chunks missing from it and the room was furnished with only a bed, 2 desk chairs, a small table and an armoire with the TV hidden in it. The space is big, but empty with nothing on the walls, except two square pictures over the bed. Our lanai had one chair, but no space to actually maneuver around the chair to sit in the chair, or stand on the lanai. No plants, no comfort, no anything. The towel cards given to you at check-in leave you feeling paranoid about hidden charges all over the resort. (If you lose your towel card, or don't turn it in at the end of your stay - that's $20 per towel). The restaurants leave a lot to be desired and you get the feeling you've been duped. The overall feeling is hospital coloring/insane asylem. We couldn't sleep there and managed to work with Expedia to get a full refund. We tried working with hotel staff to get another room, but they were booked completely and the manager, William, was very rude. We've never been treated so poorly on a vacation. It took 3 hours to get our full refund - which was all we wanted once we stepped into our room.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Amazing-Celebrities Included!”
Reviews.Author: junkforjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for two nights in March, after seeing it on "Forgetting Sarah Marshall." We booked the cheapest room, but I asked for a complimentary upgrade and we got a cottage right on the oceanfront. It's the North Shore, so you can only swim in their private beach area, but the beach was awesome with a little reefy area full of tropical fish. While we were there, they were filming the TV show "Cougar Town." We saw plenty of actors walking past our cottage, very cool. Courteney Cox was laying next to us at the beach. We drove to Haleiwa (don't listen to other reviews, it's an amazing drive and only 15 mins away). Got a plate lunch from Kono's, then sat on the beach and watched the surfers take on the major waves. Overall, great hotel. The dining options are limited, so I wouldn't stay for a week. 3 days would probably be perfect. Plus, no tour groups (after being in Waikiki, it's something we appreciated!)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for those seeking a modern resort experience.”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBoy44
Reviews.Content: We had visited this resort 20 odd years ago when it was a Hilton hotel. We thought that in the intervening period the resort was likely upgraded and this would be a good retreat from the congestion of Waikiki. There was no congestion! However, the room had not seen an update in quite a few years, it at all, since our last visit. The furniture in the room was sparse and beaten. The lamination was coming off the bedside tables. They had apparently painted the tile and some of the fixtures in the bathroom, these too were peeling. The location is still a lovely spot but the surronding area, which are mostly private residences, is gettiing a bit seedy and run down. Unfortunately, it is a long drive into a fairly good sized town for any sightseeing or shopping. While that wasn't the primary goal of our trip it would have been nice if there were things closer by. Overall we were terribly disappointed with maintenance and quality of the hotel room. The pool and beaches were okay and we tried to use those as much as possible and just stay away from the room

Reviews.Title: “I found heaven”
Reviews.Author: jenlion
Reviews.Content: What a perfect place. After seeing the chaos, insanity, and NOISE of Waikiki, I never want to be on Waikiki again. (If you love Waikiki and the nightlife, then perhaps the North Shore is not for you). Turtle Bay was the opposite. Quiet in man-made sounds (the ocean will roar!). Not too crowded even when booked completely full. EVERY single staff member polite, cheerful. OK, a couple of the wait staff were missing a few screws or tired and beyond caring, but even they were never rude; the rest had open smiles no matter what. Our son loved the waterslide. I loved the heated pool, with the option for a colder one on warmer days. I was surprised there was a beach appropriate for kids even in winter waves; I'd expected north shore waves to be too violent for a preschooler, but there's a whole protected area next to the hotel with a perfect beach and safe swimming. There were always enough pool-area chairs, without having to wake up at the crack of dawn and stash something on your chair to "reserve" it as you do in some places. This, on a day we heard they were fully booked. The heated pool did get busy, but stopped short of being too crowded. Food was not great. It's tough to get really good food on the North Shore, based on my experiences this trip. Haleiwa offered more options, but nothing great. Lei Lei's food was hands-down the best we found anywhere nearby. The bay club was ridiculously bad in every respect. Didn't bother with the other restaurants once we learned that all the hotel food comes from the same mediocre-at-best kitchen, except for Lei Lei. The hotel's regular restaurant apparently can't even cook a hamburger without destroying it (poor innocent piece of Kobe, ruined!). And there's no good grocery store nearby (again, to Haleiwa you must go, which is tough if it's a big wave day and the roads are stopped up), so you're stuck with resort food unless you plan well ahead. Even so, I'd happily spend another week here. My husband and I shared a 2-bed room with our three year old, and the room never felt crowded or small. One note: as seems to be common with hotels everywhere now, those beds advertised as queens were not queen beds. I have a queen at home. That was no queen. Expect to be close to your bedmate. It worked, but barely. Otherwise, the beds were quite comfortable. If I wasn't so eager to open the shades to see what the day looked like outside, and go out on the lanai to enjoy the waves in daylight, I'd have happily slept hours more. We were initially placed in a room in the south wing, second floor, facing the pool. Turns out that is directly above the smoking area outside the lobby. No thank you. Somebody smoked something especially foul our second morning. We were moved to the 6th floor the day after I complained. We packed our suitcases, went out for the afternoon, and came back to pick up new keys and fin our stuff moved to the new room. They were incredibly accommodating. Everyone wants the upper floors, apparently. The bathroom was slightly disappointing; a regular tub and shower. (Water pressure considerably lower on top floor!!). Kind of an icky green color. I was expecting something more. And, as others mention, the tub bottom is higher than the bathroom floor, and this is dangerous to a klutz like me. I managed not to fall by concentrating VERY HARD on not falling every time I got out of the tub. Whew. After the first day, I did not mind the bathroom anymore. It was large and worked fine. The gift shop was a godsend. Snacky foods, hat to replace the one I forgot, drugs, sunscreen, whatever. So glad it was there. So: Rooms good. Bathrooms adequate. Food bad. Giftshop good. Staff good. Pools wonderful. Towel service wonderful. Seating outdoors good. Setting beautiful. Beach good. A final note: I've stayed in a few other resort-type places in my life. Not many -- I'm not so rich -- but a couple. And I've been uncomfortable in them... a pervasive snobby attitude sees to prevail in so many. But here? I was PERFECTLY comfortable. People were just *there* enjoying the ocean and the setting and their drinks and the pool. There didn't see to be that undercurrent of snobby/judging/nastiness you get in some places. Nothing near that vybe. Maybe it's because there were so many families with normal-seeming kids (rather than trust fund babies) here, I don't know, but this is the first kind of resort place I've been able to really relax and enjoy and feel so comfortable. It was well-kept, well-ordered, full of happy but not-too-obnoxious people. I want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Incredible”
Reviews.Author: MPBX
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Turtle Bay Resort. My wife and I stayed in a Deluxe Ocean View Room that had an incredible, head-on view of the ocean. It was roomy, spacious, and comfortable, with a large king-sized bed and large balcony with seating. We were thrilled. The crashing of the waves is intense and very loud, but soothing. You can hear it even with the sliding glass balcony door and shutters closed. The staff at Turtle Bay is exceptionally friendly, right from the attendant at the front gate to the housekeepers, valets, and waitstaff. Dining at OLA on the beach was a treat, and the Hang Ten poolside cafe was great for lunch. We did a casual dinner at the Bay Club restaurant, and unfortunately they were understaffed that night. Our order got messed up and the waitress was very inattentive, then went out of her way to complain about being really busy. In contrast, however, our waiter at OLA, Connor, was exceedingly attentive, made excellent and helpful suggestions, and took very good care of us. The swimming beach (which is Kulima Cove, I believe) has some of the clearest water I've ever seen, and is great for snorkling. Lots of great fish swimming in the reef that rings the cove. There's enough clear, sandy bottom as well, to make it comfortable to just swim as well. It's very calm and serene. Guests at the hotel get a free hour of snorkling, as well as the use of hotel beach towels and beach chairs. On the other side, in the actual Turtle Bay, the waves are massive and constantly crashing. Didn't see any swimmers out there; it's mostly dominated by surfers catching the big waves. I highly recommend Turtle Bay, even for a night or two. It's worth the experience, and provides the kind of relaxing beauty people come to Hawaii to see.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is an absolute thing of beauty.”
Reviews.Author: kenspidey52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Cottages and it was worth the cost. What a view and what a resort. Everyone was friendly from the check in to the private beach cottage concierge, Charles. The bartenders at both the Hang Ten and Lei Leis were friendly and fun. The room at the beach cottage was large with hardwood floors, great patios with awesome ocean views. The rooms were kept impeccable clean and the service was very good. I do not understand all the bad reviews of this place, because I could find very little wrong. We ate at the new Italian restaurant Leonardo’s the first night. The food was good but not great, the portions were small and the service was not very good. Our waitress was friendly but she really lacked the skill of properly delivering food and drinks. Our salad was served only minutes from the main course. They are just starting out so I will cut them a break, but I did expect better. We ate at the breakfast buffet the first morning and it was great. We decided to have it every morning of our stay. Everything was fresh. The fruit especially the pineapple was exceptional and the pastries were wonderful. This is the best buffet breakfast I have ever had and I have had a lot. The second night we ate at Olla’s. Very good food, average service and rather expensive. The location can’t be beat though and I think If I ever return I will do lunch here. The third night we ate at Lei Leis which we killed very much. Great service and food plus friendly people. Overall we had a great time and great experience with Turtle Bay and we hope to return someday. If anyone decides to stay away because of some of the reviews here they are really doing themselves a disservice as this place is a jewel. Turtle Bay is an absolute thing of beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Inclusive Resort”
Reviews.Author: KXB_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days prior to moving on to Honolulu for a business meeting. Loved the resort, wish I could have stayed longer. Beautiful beach, pool, tennis courts, golf course, yoga studio - it had it all. Wish I could have stayed longer

Reviews.Title: “Breathtakingly beautiful and so relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Ksma23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights over the presidents day weekend and I really can't say enough about the property. We rented a cottage and if you can splurge I'd say they are the best way to go. The scenery right outside your sliding glass door is truly breathtaking and the sound of the crashing waves is mesmerizing. The service in the cottages was superb. Complimentary Turtle Bay T-shirts and fresh fruit upon arrival....not to mention the turn down service with chocolate covered macadamia nuts nightly. Our ice bucket was always full and no request seemed to small. I found the rooms to be clean and I'm fairly picky about that. The floors are all wood and I looked behind and under the bed and there were no dust bunnies to be found. The bathrooms were huge and well appointed with the most fragrant line of lotion, bath gel, shampoo, and conditioner. As for activities there is plenty to do. My husband played golf and did enjoy himself. He did recommend playing the harder course (there are two) as the one he played wasn't the most challenging. I did visit the spa for the lomi lomi facial and massage, both were heavenly and I would highly recommend. We took the helicopter tour (located on property) and it was also something I would recommend. We flew all the way to Honolulu and got an aerial view of Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, and most of the North Shore. I hate flying normally but the ride was so smooth and picturesque, you really don't feel nervous. We also took a horseback ride that went back and forth between a tropical rain forest setting and the beachfront. We went in a small group of 4 which was nice and it was really leisurely so you really got to take in the view. We watched people take surfing lessons there on the property and I was really impressed with that as well. The instructor had a family of four surfing (mom, dad, and two boys) well within 45 minutes, and it was fun to see how good and encouraging the instructors were. The hotel also offered glass bottom kayaking but we never saw those out on the water. We ate at most every restaurant (with the exception of 21) and my husband and I both commented that it was typical resort food for the most part. Not horrible, but nothing remarkable and a little pricey. My breakfast recommendation would actually be to drive 10 minutes to Ted's Bakery in Sunset Beach, as they offered huge portions, good prices, and a nice variety of fresh bakery goods, omelettes, etc. There are also a couple places in Haleiwa, but that's a good 20 minutes away. For lunch there are also the shrimp trucks, which are pretty close to the property. Drinks at Turtle Bay were good, but also a little pricey...$10 for a pina colada at the pool bar. So to summarize I will say that the property is absolutely beautiful, a vacation we will remember forever. I would recommend it over staying in Waikiki without hesitation. After living in Hawaii for many years the North Shore gives you the true feeling of Hawaii. It remains unspoiled and there are so many countless beaches that aren't overcrowded and commercialized. It is truly a special place and we will definitely stay there again. The hotel concierge also took care of booking whatever we wanted off property as well. They got us booked for our luau at the Polynesian Cultural (just about 10 minutes away), and helped us with everything we needed to know to for our day trip to Pearl Harbor. The hotel always had someone available to answer questions in person and

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reno2277
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay as part of a vacation package through United Airlines. We upgraded to a Beachfront Cottage, which was well worth the money. Turtle Bay has there only little slice of the beach where you can snorkle & swim and several restaurants on site. All of the restaurants we tried were good, but the buffet was surprisingly awesome. I recommend renting a car if you are staying at Turtle Bay because it is far removed from most of the excursions & the various vendors will not run a shuttle out that far. Keep in mind that driving into Honolulu is about 45 minutes to an hour - 1 way, but it's a beautiful drive. O'ahu is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but..”
Reviews.Author: kitkat2011
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with really nice views and several things to do. Though it didn't quite live up to our Forgetting Sarah Marshall expectations it was still a really nice place to be. Stayed for 2 nights of relaxation before heading to Waikiki. And it was definately long enough. Really hard to get to without your own car, few transfer companies are willing to drive out there without charging alot. Wouldn't recommend it to younger people, mainly retired couples and honeymooners. We were also disappointed that the water slide wasn't working and on a few occassions other facilities weren't available due to the weather. But overall nice place with amazing views and scenary - worth the trip out there.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: TheSchu's
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2007, and there have been some positive changes since. The rooms are very spacious, with a balcony in every room. Love that factor! A fridge in every room, saves you a ton of money on drinks. $11 for a Mai Tai is way too much. The weekends are crazy busy, but Mon-thurs the resort is quite quiet. Lei Lei's which is a restaurant at the golf course is the best place to eat. The prime rib is sooooo good! A good selection of fish and steak on the menu. The best place for breakfast is Ted's Bakery which is up the road (about a 7 minute drive) Also very good for lunch! We ate there for both meals, you cannot beat the price:) We love Turlte Bay, and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “A big resort, but plenty of places to get away”
Reviews.Author: MavenNyc
Reviews.Content: We are not big resort people, so we definitely had some reservations about staying at Turtle Bay. But because we threw this trip together last minute based on an unusually cheap airfare, the place that we've rented before in Lanikai was not available, which is how we wound up here. For a big resort -- I think there's over 400 rooms -- there are plenty of places to get away. When you check in, the map on the back shows various hiking trails, many of them along the beach and pretty much each morning, we took one of the hikes, which was a great way to start the day. We thought about springing for a cottage, but in the end wound up in the main hotel with a nice view of the ocean. Each night, we opened the sliding glass door to the small terrace and closed the shutters and fell asleep to the sound of the waves, which made for great sleeping. And the hammocks by the cottages are a great way to spend a few hours. And they're not just for people staying in the cottages. We ate at Ola's (twice), the Italian place, and did breakfast every day because it was free since we booked a seven-night package. They also threw in free tickets to the Polynesian Cultural Center and gave us a free night, so between the $50 in breakfast, the $200 in PCC tickets and the free night, it was a pretty good deal. Here's what we didn't like: the hotel only recently went non-smoking -- like Jan. 1 of this year -- and at first, they put us in one of the former smoking rooms. But it takes a lot longer than 40 days to rid a room of stale smoke. Luckily, the front desk manager agreed to move us to another room the next day. We also thought the spa services were way over-priced at $135 for a 50 minute massage and $65 for a pedicure. And the classes, which are not part of the $25 resort fee, are spotty. A Pilates class by Marissa was great, but the yoga class taught by some dude was one of the worst I've ever taken and I've taken a lot of yoga. I'd also add that while they bill this as a honeymoon spot, there's a lot of kids here and a lot of poorly behaved kids. (There's also a lot of poorly behaved adults too, which kind of surprised us, given that this isn't some cheap place on Waikiki). One night at the Italian restaurant, there was a little girl running around the tables and shrieking at the top of her lungs while the parents blithely sipped red wine. And the last night we were there, a young girl was in the next room and because the rooms have those inter-connecting doors, we could hear her screaming at 5 am. Would we come back? Probably, since the beauty of the property makes this a great escape on an otherwise crowded island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful secluded getaway with amazing beach cottages!”
Reviews.Author: lrkoende
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, when I first arrived at the hotel, I was a bit concerned. We arrived at 2:30pm for a 3:00pm check-in and they didn't have our room ready. However, the hotel staff quickly offered to store our luggage and invited us to have a drink down by the pool and that they would come find us as soon as the room was ready. About 20 minutes later our beach cottage was ready. They drove us with our bags to our cottage and the valet had our car parked in the dedicated cottage parking, without even asking for a tip. Fifteen minutes later, we were contacted by the dedicated cottage concierge making sure everything was great. I have to really complement the cottage concierge team for their outstanding customer service. They took care of any dining or activity booking with amazing professionalism. The other outstanding part about this hotel was the amazing view from our beach cottage. It truly spoiled us. Every night we had amazing sunset views while lounging in our room. We kept ordering room service as the view was the best in the hotel. Only minor issue was the service at 21 Degrees North. It is supposed to be the resorts high-end dining experience, but there was long waits between the courses and almost no check-in. They definitely need a new executive chef there as no fine dining establishment would allow such poor service. On the upside, their new casual Italian restaurant had some really great pasta dishes! In summary, I highly recommend upgrading to the beach cottages for a higher level of service and amazing views. They spoiled and set the standard for our four other Hawaiian stops on this vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: doonssis
Reviews.Content: Another world!! Amazing!! Feels like you are in a postcard. My stay was a few years ago but I have not forgotten. You are a bit away from the bustle however can rent a car. You will not be disappointed. Staff and property were wonderful. Not one complaint. Oh and the beach lua is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Most Awesome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: LorenaL56
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were so happy with our accommodations. We stayed at the Villas. We loved the resort, the beautiful waves, the pools, the beach, the breakfasts, the restaurants, everything really!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: wwcavs
Reviews.Content: This was the second of three hotels (Outrigger Reef on the Beach and Ohana Waikiki West) my wife and I stayed at while on our honeymoon. The location (North Shore) is amazing. There are things to do on the resort (beach, hiking trails, tennis, etc) but there isn't much close by if you choose to leave the resort. I would definitely recommend renting a car to explore the North Shore. Free parking was included with our reservation. The room itself was clean, but wasn't as big as expected and it was very dated (it looked very 80's). The view from the room, however, was spectacular. Wifi and free local calls were included. While we were checking in it almost seemed like we were inconveniencing the woman at the front desk. They also had our booking wrong (they had us checking out 1 day early), and when I told her, she looked at me as if I were lying. The staff, for the most part, was pleasant and the housekeeping staff and was awesome. The guy at the Enterprise rent-a-car is the best, very helpful and friendly! During our stay we attended two events (Seafood Festival and a local chefs event), which were well organized and entertaining. We also dined at two of the restaurants on site. They were also quite good. Aside from our check in experience, our over all stay was very nice. We would definitely stay here again if we find ourselves in the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best places ive stayed”
Reviews.Author: dbyrne4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 5 nights and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. We were upgraded to an ocean view room with a balcony (must have sunset side!) The room was quite good, everything you needed - im still trying to understand why upmarket hotels in Hawaii have shower curtains, it needs to be a shower screen fullstop. We had a room change due to a broken sink drain and were very fortunate to get a suite, the view was fantastic and the room was huge. The dining options were OK, tried the new restaurant (Leonardo's) food was OK, not great but not horrible. Now i understand Leonardo's is not the most expensive restaurant at the hotel, but since when was it OK to wear a baseball cap inside - let alone when dining. Some standards need upholding. Dress of other patrons was ordinary as well. All in all the hotel was great, the beach/bay was nice, the grounds immaculate and the service quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Still love it”
Reviews.Author: Fam_of_4_BC
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Turtle Bay. We loved it so much last year that we came for 9 nights this year. We had lots of ups and a few downs this year. The location is unbeatable and the view from the Ocean front suites is spectacular. We left our door open every night and listened to the waves. Lying in bed and watching the ocean is one of the highlights of this resort. We had reasonably good service overall. We love the turles den and the lattes they make are better than starbucks. We had a lovely horseback ride with a great tour guide. The negatives for us this time around were the pools were cold - 67-71 degrees is not warm enough. The kids pool was closed for about 1/2 our trip which was also hard for our little ones (it was a a cool 75 which went up to 78 while we were there as well). There was one day as well when the pool supervisor decided no kids in the hot tub. This was only for that day and every other day was fine - not too sure why that went on?? The other negative for us was that at our loved restaurant Ola's - where we ate at least 4 meals and enjoyed at least 3 - had a waiter that seemed annoyed to have customers - we left a comment on our room charge that night and hope that they rectify this - glad it was not our first trip to the restaurant or we would not have returned!!! We liked the addition of Leonardos to the resort - where we could go for a more relaxed dinner with the kids for a resonable price. I also love the Spa Luana gift shop and the staff that work in there are so genuinely friendly it makes the shopping that much more enjoyable. We love Turtle Bay and would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “No visit to Oahu is complete without a stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Roadlesstrvled
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is located on the other side of the island of Oahu, the exact opposite of Waikiki's high-density tower blocks and meager beach and surf. While the rooms may be a bit overpriced, the location alone is worth the effort. The hotel juts out into the surf of Oahu's famous North Shore and its expansive grounds give you ample room to find some privacy, if you need it. If you can't make it to the other islands, this resort gives you a taste of the Hawaiian Islands.

Reviews.Title: “1 star resort at a 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: withkids02
Reviews.Content: we traveled here after staying at the hilton hawaiian village (ali'i tower), and were soooo very disappointed!!! The rooms all have that "old feeling," they've been painted, but not been updated (the sliding door to your balcony is an old fixture and gets stuck). The bathroom is completely unremodeled and looks it: fixtures and tub from an old apt. I was not expecting this when I booked especially not at their prices. The location and most of the service was excellent (some front desk issues), but overall good service. But the hotel itself is not worth the price, not if you're looking for a resort feel, if you're looking for a motel 6 feel, then prob won't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Please visit Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore of Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: hasenbuhler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in Kahuku, Oahu at the end of December 2010. It was our family's first real family vacation. What a beautiful place! My husband and kids had never been to Hawaii, so they really enjoyed our stay. The rooms need a little updating and there needs to be more places to choose from to eat for teenagers later in the evening. We felt like there should have been more casual dining like a BBQ style place near the pool that could stay open later for older kids to eat while parents go to the finer dining restaurants. The staff did an great job in accommodating us with a free air mattress for one of our sons, and a free breakfast buffet for 4 and a free bottle of champagne for my husband and I to enjoy together. I also have to commend the concierge desk for going out of their way to get t-shirts for us from Paradise Helicopters, which was closed down due to the President of the United States being on the island. They contacted someone in their offices and they went there, opened up, just to get us t-shirts. That really made us feel special. I would definitely stay at Turtle Bay Resort again. All around a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, outdated rooms, caveat emptor.”
Reviews.Author: Marc89JA
Reviews.Content: Our group (7 rooms) booked their rooms separately to attend a wedding offsite. Reservation Myrna Ramos-excellent); Valet/concierge-all very good; Housekeepiong-Mary Jane- very good; waitress- Bonnie Corriogan- excellent; Engineering-very good-fixed air conditioning challenge ASAP. View from the rooms are excellent. Rooms are neat, but very "old" . Feels like one is in a "value" hotel, not a resort. The worst- - make sure to bring your reservation copy and print it to let front desk klnow what you expext. Will not tell you of your free breakfast, will not tell you re:Credit of resort fee, will not tell you re: eligibility to upgrade. Carol (front desk ) is terrib le- - getting info from her is like pulling teeth, went to back office at least three times- - few minutes at a time. Coupon picked up following day, for one day instead of two. Our group started comparing notes- - all but one got same treatment. from front desk. Caveat Emptor- - - Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Oahu - to get away from Waikikii”
Reviews.Author: darlingnikki71
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in Turtle Bay and it was great. The restaurants were all good food and service. The pool was great, and the local restaurants are also worth travelling to.

Reviews.Title: “They have it all!”
Reviews.Author: shelmor61
Reviews.Content: On Oahu, land and beachfront is a premium! Space, privacy and leisurely enjoyment of the beauty of the island of Oahu is difficult to find, except at Turtle Bay. Every room seems to have a view of the ocean; the rooms - large, spacious and beautiful, from the welcoming chimes music playing from the clock radio as you come in, to the cloud-like bed and pillow. Activities abound: helicopter tours, horseback riding, scuba & surfboard lessons, lei making, dancing, golf -- things for kids and adults. Spa experiences abound from indoor, to on the ocean-front. Beautiful pool areas, with several hot tubs, all within view of the ocean. The brunch, expansive and delicious. While we were there to see the sites of Oahu before heading to Kauai, the lure of just experiencing all Turtle Bay had to offer was a huge pull in the opposite direction. While we aren't about the huge crowds & traffic we experienced on the rest of the island, if we were to return to Oahu, Turtle Bay is the only place we would consider staying ... and it would be for luxurious R & R.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mrzUk
Reviews.Content: Tutle Bay was our last stop before flying back to the UK and I was really looking forward to staying in the resort of 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall' fame. Perhaps my perception of the resort is biased by my over-optimistic expectations and the fact that it rained heavily for the 2 days of our stay, but some things are bad in any weather. On arrival it took us over half hour to get checked in even if we were only 3rd in the queue. When our turn came the guy at the desk typed the equivalent of War and Peace in the computer although he only asked my husband for our names and our home address. When giving us directions to our room he spoke really quickly and with a very heavy accent so we didn't really understand even after asking him to repeat twice. This meant that we either had to guess were we were going or get someone to take us there. We decided to ask at the valet parking desk and thankfully someone came over with a buggy and took us to our bungalow. As many others have commented, the rooms are very dated but I suppose some find this charming. Although not the most up-to-date room, the bungalow was clean, comfortable and spacious and it had a lovely see view from the veranda. On arrival the radio was on with very relaxing/romantic music, which was a very nice touch. The only problem was the door to the veranda which came off altogether when we opened it to have a look outsite. We managed to put it back together somehow so didn't bother to call maintenance. The next day when we came back from our day out we found that the door had been fixed. Obviously the maid had noticed and got it sorted, which again was great. The resort itself was beautiful even in the rain, so I guess it must be stunning in nice sunshine. The beach looked a bit small even when nobody was there so I wonderer if it would get really crowded in nice weather when the hotel is full. The location is great for surfing and for trips to parts of Oahu which are more 'native'. Overall I don't think I would go back to this hotel and if friends asked me for advice I would probably warn them not to expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ,quiet and plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: DeborahMosmanNSW
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 ( 2 adults and 2 daughters 23,13) stayed here for a week before a week in Waikiki. Turtle Bay provided the quiet relaxing atmosphere before the buzz of Waikiki. Speedy check-in. We had booked a 2 bedroom Pikake Suite. Very spacious, great size lanai. We had fabulous views from lanai on the East Wing overlooking the surf. We spent many hours watching the waves and the surfers. Great pool,friendly and efficient staff. We had Christmas lunch at The Palm Terrace which was good value. We also ate at Ola's on the beach. We had hired a car so enjoyed driving into Halieva, Cholo's - Mexican a favourite howver all eateries were good. Plenty of surf shops to meander through, Bars, famous shaved ice. There is a foodland near Waimea Bay where we bought snacks, fruit and the local fish. My husband a keen golfer played the course twice and was very impessed with the course.My family hired surf boards and surfed off the point which they enjoyed, and there is also a bay for snorkelling and swimming as well. There is a resort fee per room per day which covers,internet,parking,snorrkelling equipment, paper . I feel this charge is uncecesary and should be inluded in the rate you have already paid rather than an extra charge.. Overall very relaxing and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “future trip, past experiences”
Reviews.Author: jghappy
Reviews.Content: I have been reading up on TB in trip advisor in anticipation of my planned July 27-30 2011 stay at TB with family. Last stayed at TB in 2009 and 2007. I love this place. Yes, the rooms are "dated" but they have a 60's character (mad men) that is charming. Yes, the type of room isn't guaranteed (kids had to sleep on a mat on the floor one night while waiting for a 2BD room.) But, people are GREAT starting with front desk, and the place quiet and relaxing after Honolulu hotels. Shrimp trucks (garlic scampi) roadside fruit stands, and northshore snorkeling can't be beat (with turtles!) Loved the ride in the golf cart from the hotel to Lei Lei's restaurant. Best food at TB. Nice little gym (no charge.) Bathroom has nice separate dressing area. Great coffee bar in lobby. Daily resort fee covers parking, internet, equipment rentals that would add up to more at other hotels. JG

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss service, doesn't measure up to rating”
Reviews.Author: ampm91
Reviews.Content: In terms of service and aloha spirit, The Turtle Bay Resort falls flat. That's not to say we did not find any staff members who were courteous and helpful (Damien at Ola was exceptional), but it's hit or miss from there. We stayed two nights in a beach cottage to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The setting is gorgeous as was the view of water, a mere 30 feet from our deck. We could clearly hear the surf with sliding doors open; when closed the room was pleasantly quiet despite the presence of young kids on either side of our unit. (note to honeymooners: this is a popular family spot and boisterous children abound.) Beds were comfortable, spacious bath w/ Japanese soaking tub, lighting on dimmers, bathrobes & slippers and bath accoutrements met expectations for a $500/night room. However, the room shows wear and the furnishings were uncomfortable, especially on the deck where chairs and bench lacked chaise pads. The property needs another pool, as the pool area was over crowded, hot tub included. The daily fresh fruit and ice was delivered as promised, and the turn-down service with chocolate-covered macadamia nuts one night and palm leaf-wrapped coconut macaroons the second night were a nice touch. The manager also sent a complimentary bottle of champagne our first night with a note promising personal service for cottage guests, noting a special concierge extension. The bartender called to confirm our drink order w/ lunch before room service delivered, a mark of a professional and great service. So while the planning is obviously there to help create a special experience, and sometimes succeeded, other aspects and staff members ruined the mood. The maid did not remove room service platters when our room was "cleaned," inviting fruit flies to congregate by evening. Our tissue box was empty and also not replenished. At checkin, we were early and, so, left our bags with the valet. The front desk said they would call when our room was ready (an unmet promise), while we happily went out to enjoy the spectacular surf hitting the Bonzai Pipeline. When we returned after 3 pm to check in, we pulled up to the front to collect our bags and room key. My husband first stopped by valet to leave our car key, in case the car got in the way during the ensuing 5-10 minutes we expected to be there. Rather than welcome us and thank us for the gesture, the valet curtly said there was no parking at the entrance and said they'd move the car if we took longer than 15 mins. Checkin was perfunctory, adequate, but not exactly welcoming. We were given a map, but later discovered our unit location was not marked. We'd emailed the concierge in advance of our trip for reservations at Ola, and discovered they had not been made. So we asked the concierge again for help when we first dropped off our bags and discovered when we came back to check in, they still hadn't been made. Three times a charm, our third request finally stuck. Overall, the setting is beautiful, but for the price and service promise, I'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a romantic resort, look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: HypeMedia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend our anniversary in Hawaii. We wanted to lay & relax in the sun and have a romantic & spoiled week. There were more kids than adults at this resort. Screaming & screeching in the pool from 7am to 7pm, then at 10pm we had to shut our sliding door- we hated not hearing the waves, but the screaming was out of control. Kids in the outside bar, in the 'adult' hot tubs, in all of the restaurants. We never did lay by the pool because of the kids. We had a fire alarm & evacuation for 2 hrs one night, then another night we had no electricity for 3 hrs. The rooms stink so bad we had to wash every piece of clothing when we returned home. The maid rinsed our cups in the sink rather than replace them with clean ones. The service was very poor, & not real friendly. The view was absolutely stunning but not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Service was the weak link”
Reviews.Author: bkay001
Reviews.Content: Arrived Christmas Day for a 2 night stay at Turtle Bay. Only stayed for 1 and here is why: Checkin was very impersonal, with only dialog on room selection, not even a" How are you?". Had an Ocean Front Deluxe room booked. The room I received was in that category(so I am told), but at best a partial ocean view, mainly the pool and resort driveway. Went to see if another room was available, and there was not. After speaking with a manager who preceded to talk to me about legal definitions of ocean front ( meaning the view was not what qualifying factor, it was the location of the hotel itself.) I explained booking any hotel on the island I would be hard to find one selling a room as ocean front if not with a great ocean view. He made no gesture in anyway to help mitigate my disappointment. After the room issue went nowhere we decided to eat at one of the restaurants . The server was very sweet but the pizza we ordered took an hour and came to us cold. At the pool the the scene was no different when hearing a cocktail waitress tell a couple they would get a drink faster by going to the bar themselves. Later that night we ordered extra pillows as the ones we had were very clumpy. It took well over an hour to get new pillows. After all the service issues and poor room we decided to check out a day early. The front desk was very sympathetic when hearing my dilemma and agreed to let me check out without penalty a day early. However, no other gesture was made. Later in the day another manager called my cell after hearing about my issues. He also was very sympathetic but made no gesture to me. In these situations a small effort by management can go a long way. All he would of had to do was take a cold pizza off my bill or something of that nature to make me feel as though they were truly apologetic for ruining a Christmas day trip.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back again”
Reviews.Author: jvhawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the North Shore for 3 of our 8 nights on Oahu to mix the vacation up. Having lived on the island for 3 years, I knew all we would want to do is relax. I would go back to the Turtle Bay Resort based on the location. It is great to get a feel of where the locals live and eat where they eat. We did not eat at the hotel once other then coffee. We are at Teds 2 times, went to the Supperette in Kahuku for some Poki & Rice twice and then down to Luabueno's in Haleiwa. It rained most our stay so to sit at the pool and relax only happened about 20% of our stay. I do not think that this hotel is a 4 star plus. I would say 3 1/2 stars. It was clean, just a little rundown, the staff was nice. On my husband wanted to watch the game at the poolbar. The TV's were really small, so we went the the restaurant/bar inside that was playing the game only to find that they do not pipe it through the speakers, they leave that for the Hawaiian music. Same thing when we ventured down to the golf course restaurant. Someday when we go back to Oahu we will go back to the Turtle Bay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: tinat168
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an oceanfront room in the main hotel. The view was amazing! The room was quite large but could have used some updating. The main mirror in the bathroom had all these black spots all over it but luckily there was a second mirror in the next sink area that was clean. Another comment about the bathroom is that the shower tub is slightly higher than the bathroom floor, so we had to be extra careful when stepping out of the shower. Although this was not an issue for us, I could see this being a potential problem for individuals with balance/coordination difficulties. The pool and beach areas were excellent. We loved the pool bar and food! The pool/beach towels were of excellent quality -- long and plush! We went snorkeling at the beach and saw lots of fish and a sea turtle. I also took advantage of the surf school, and I caught the best waves of my life! The property's grounds were outstanding. We walked through the beach cottage area, and there were several great hammocks. If we could afford it, we would definitely stay at the beach cottages next time! Hotel food was good, but nothing spectacular... There weren't too many options outside of the hotel, but we ate some great shrimp at Giovanni's, ono poke at the Kahuku Superette, and Fijian curry at the Fiji market. Hotel's breakfast buffet was decent, but could definitely be better! The best breakfast buffet on the island is the Halekulani hotel, in my opinion Overall, I would return to this hotel and try to stay at the beach ccottage! We might also venture out to Haleiwa for more dining options. This is a great place for a family vacation or romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Rooms & Physcial Building Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: Plantriptoday
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for 1 night this past December. Overall, the property is great but the hotel itself is very tired. I enjoyed 1 night here but more than that would not have been as nice. Pros: - Lovely beach for swimming and then other beach for surfing. - Plenty of beach for walking on and exploring. - Resort pool and fitness center were nice. - Staff all seemed friendly and helpful. Cons: - The room is extremely tired looking. It reminded me of a 1980's Holiday Inn. I'm used to Westin-type rooms. If this is what you are used to as well, you will find the room sub-par on all fronts. - I do not think bathroom has been updated since it was built. Knowing what I know now, I would not stay at the resort again. I would, however, consider renting a condo on the property.

Reviews.Title: “not as promised, greatly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fsi
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through Orbitz, and while the room is large, it looks like it hasn't been updated in 30 years. There is no comfortable chair in the room, although there is lots of room for one. The a/c is not working well, and the "balcony" is big enough (barely) for one chair. The heating on the main pool has been broken for more than a week! We asked for water 3 times before we received any at breakfast, and I had to ask for butter for my toast! This is my 5th trip to Hawaii and I do NOT recommend this hotel. Unfortunately, we have 6 more nights here as part of our package. To add insult to injury, there is a $25 resort fee which feels like incredible nickle and diming.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Oahu by far”
Reviews.Author: oualumni
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Villas at Turtle Bay. The hotel is dated and needs an interior facelift, but the Villas are high end condos with incredible interiors. We cooked our own meals for the most part. Grocery stores are close by. The Villas are located just adjacent to the hotel so all of the hotel amenities are there. Ola's restaurant located between the hotel and the Villas is awesome and so convenient. All beach in HI are public, but not many locals because of the security gate at the entrance. The deserted beach goes as far as you can see, all sandy and accessible. Snorkeling is great, horseback riding, tennis, golf, spa, yoga, triple crown surfing, this place has it all. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, but not so great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LaniInMA
Reviews.Content: THE RESORT There are many activities offered right on the resort, which is nice. Unfortunately, for a family with a 2-year old, there was little we could do. Children must be 3-years old for the horseback riding. The bike/scooter rentals did not have child-safe seats or attachments. The keiki turtle club also had an min. age. The walking paths were not "stroller friendly". The only activity we could truly enjoy with our toddler was the beach. Although the beach on-site was small, it was relaxing. Umbrellas and chairs were always available. The towel exchange was convenient. The equipment rental center had sand toys that we used free of charge. Our best days were spent on this beach! Snorkeling was also fun, especially with the free rental that came with the room. ROOMS The rooms were old, as others have commented on. I didn't mind the older furniture. The thing that bothered me most was the carpet. It was very sticky-feeling and our feet were always black after walking on it without shoes. The dust balls along the edges of the carpet were also bothersome. I dropped a cotton hat near the corner of the room and it was filthy when I picked it up. A regular carpet cleaning would make a big difference! All of the rooms have great views, but there is a difference that I wasn't aware of beforehand. Standard rooms (no balcony) are located on the lower floors. They have more obstructions and views of the conference/restaurant rooftops. This is also why a higher floor is better,...less roof view. Rooms with a small balcony face the sunrise and the beach. Rooms with a large balcony face the sunset, which is probably the better of the two. There is one smoking floor (5th floor) on one of the wings. If you are sensitive to this, be sure to ask for a room in one of the other wings. We originally had a great 6th floor room,..until we realized that we could smell cigarette smoke all the time from the floor below us and therefore couldn't leave our balcony door open. They were very good about allowing us to change rooms. DINING All of the food at the resort was VERY expensive. Our first night there, we were tired and decided to order room service. We ordered a pizza, fries, and 3 drinks,..the total was almost $60! And the pizza was not very good. The Palm Terrace breakfast buffet was expensive, but worth it for the variety of food and fruits! Ola, the restaurant on the beach, had a wonderful and relaxing view, but again was very expensive. My $10 salad which was supposed to have chicken and mandarin oranges had only one piece of each and was basically all greens. Expect to spend a lot of money if dining on site! Tricks for getting better food at a lower cost: 1. Shrimp Stands - take a left out of the resort and you'll find several shrimp stands and trucks. 2. Fruit Stands - Take a right out of the resort and fruit stands are located right along that road. Buy some and store it in the fridge in the hotel room! 3. Ted's bakery - turn right out of hte resort and it's about 10/mins minute down the road on the left. Great breakfast foods (including hot dishes). Their lunch and dinner meals are only okay. 4. Haleiwa - There are wonderful restaurants in this town. It's a 30-minute drive, but well worth it. The Grass Skirt Grill and Bonzai Sushi Bar were great! VISITING ATTRACTIONS The resort is fairly close to Haleiwa, the Polynesian center, Kualoa ranch, and Waimea falls, but is a really long drive to everything else. I would recommend only staying at the resort for a few days unless you plan on using all of the local amenities (helicopter ride, horseback riding, scooter rental, surfing, etc.). Outside of the resort, you definitely need a car. Fortunately, you can rent from a place located right in the lobby of the hotel. OVERALL I think this resort offers more to families or couples traveling without children or with older children. It seemed to have great amenities and it's unfortunate that we couldn't enjoy them all.

Reviews.Title: “Views and service can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: luv2getaway00
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Turtle Bay Resort, our first trip to Oahu. We were overall very impressed with this resort...we tried to go in with an open mind given some negative reviews, but have since concluded that 'you can't please everyone'. The location is stunning...not only are you mere steps away from the north shore, the rooms have gorgeous views. As pointed out in other reviews, they are not all unobstructed and you may have a portion of a roof visible in your view...it is your choice whether you choose to focus on the roof or the beautiful Pacific beyond it! The surf is so fierce that you could hear it roaring all night long...I miss that sound! That being said, the location that makes it also breaks it...yes, you are aways away from the nearby towns and at least 1 hour away from Honolulu/Waikiki which can be frustrating if you end up with rainy days like we did! But we still enjoyed the scenic drive to the other side of the island. Also, the nearby towns aren't nearly as far as we expected...you can find a grocery/convenience store (but no major shopping!) within less than 10 minutes drive. The service was immaculate...every single staff member that passed us in the hallway greeted us and wished us a good day. Such friendly staff! The resort is also immaculate, very clean. It appears as if they are slowly but surely updating it...rooms feature super comfortable beds (my understanding is they were newly replaced) and flat screen tv's and simple decor/colours making it appear modern. They still need some work, like the baseboards have seen better days, but it's not the "dilapidated, rundown resort" some reviewers claim it is. The bathrooms are huge and include a mini fridge. The balconies are a very good size (depending on which room category you book). I will review the restaurants separately but the one thing I will say is that this is the one area I was remotely close to being disappointed as I was not impressed with the selection for daytime lunches/snacks. It would be nice if there was a place where you could go grab a quick sandwich/snack, but it does not exist. A soup and salad would have cost me $19! On that note, I do feel the resort does "nickel and dime" you a bit...that resort fee really needs to be amended. We knew it was there and it is what it is, but charging $25 per day for such items as wi-fi or coffee in your room seems a bit absurd given that no other hotel I've ever stayed at has charged for these items! In my opinion, those items should be included in the room rate...even if that means upping it by $25 per night. Drinks are $10...again, a little excessive in my opinion, but it was also expected. The pool is great and not too crowded and the crowd seemed to be a good mix, mostly young families and young couples from what I noticed. The resort appeared virtually deserted after dark. Lastly, don't forget to become a fan/like Turtle Bay's facebook page and you may be eligible to save $100 off your meal charges!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon destination”
Reviews.Author: ValMc10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on October 10 and headed out to Oahu the very next day. We had such an amazing time on our trip. The hotel was gorgeous, perfect spot if you don't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki or Honolulu. The location, seated on the North Shore of Oahu, is a great blend of local culture and fantastic resort amenities. Our room was perfect, we had a direct view of the ocean and the view was certainly not wasted on us. We would go back in a heartbeat. It was slightly expensive, as is most of Hawaii. But definitely worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in a Beach Cottage, had a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JWoww86
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for the rooms in the main part of the resort, as we stayed in a beach cottage. That being said, we had an amazing stay here at Turtle Bay! We stayed here for three nights this October for our honeymoon. The beach cottages are nice and secluded, and although they are not LITERALLY on the beach, the beach is about 20 steps ahead of you. From these cottages, we could see the sunset every night over the water, it was truly breathtaking! The service was great, and there were several things to do within the resort. We went horseback riding on the beach, it was outstanding! On the trail ride, we passed several LOST filming locations and an old WWII bunker. I highly recommend doing this, it is a great way to see the beaches around the resort. We also did a couples massage in the oceanside cabana - what an awesome experience! The Spa Luana was very nice and the staff was great. As far as the food goes, the North Shore is fairly limited, so we ate the majority of the meals on the resort. We did the buffet breakfast every day, and then lunches and dinners at different places every day. Our favorite restaurant at TB was 21 Degrees North, which is the more upscale of the restaurants there. Our sever was AMAZING, and so was the food. I think my favorite part of the meal was the trio of creme brulees for dessert: original creme, pistachio and kona coffee - definitely the best I have ever had within the states. The beach at Turtle Bay was great, and though there is only one small pool available for resort guests it never got too crowded and was generally a friendly crowd. The thing to remember about the beaches at Turtle Bay is that they are public beaches so anyone can use them. If you are a surfer, the North Shore has some of the best beaches anywhere and from what I understand, Turtle Bay is great for surfing. All in all, I would stay here again and again and we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “frustrating experience in paradise”
Reviews.Author: beachloverPrinceton
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Turtle Bay in a beach cottage and although the location was great and the hotel grounds beautiful, we had an overall frustrating experience due primarily to poor service. We booked a king size bed cottage 3 months in advance only to find out at check in that they only had double queen beds (we hate those!) cottages available. In an attempt to remedy our frustration we were offered the presidential suite, but we asked to see it first, before making a decision. At 3.45PM the room was not ready (neither the cottage, nor the suite), which is unacceptable when you pay over $500/night (at worst the room should have been ready at 3PM, in most good hotels it would have been ready earlier). Finally, when we were given the key to the suite, we were also told that they have given the cottage (on the assumption that we'll take the suite!) to somebody else! We were very frustrated and upset because the whole point of going to Turtle Bay was to stay in front of the ocean, not in the 5th floor of a hotel! Finally, after a heated discussion they "freed up" the queen beds cottage, which we ended up taking (the presidential suite was nice, but huge and impersonal). About the cottage: very nice room, but outdated. Again, for $550/night you would expect at least that the lanai light works (it didn't)! Furniture was old, the mosquito screen had holes in it, the cleaning staff left the detergents in the bathroom! The grounds were beautiful and well maintained, but we didn't even enter the pool: it was constantly full of kids jumping in and out! At a resort of this size you would expect a separate kids and adult pool. And the chairs! They had these old, cheap, plastic chairs, without a cushion, fit for Comfort Inn, not a five star resort! And of course, they didn't set up the chairs for you (with towels) and gave you one towel per person. We enjoyed the long walks on the beach, especially the beach fronting the cottage, but again were frustrated to discover they only had 2 or 3 hammocks for 30 plus cottages- obviously they were always occupied! We dined at 21 north, good food, but nothing special. Ola menu seemed rather basic and the restaurant looked unpolished (we dined at much nicer looking beach restaurants), so we skipped it. Instead, we had a wonderful dinner at Bonzai Sushi in Haleiwa and a nice casual lunch at the shrimp trucks, in the proximity of the hotel. Overall, we came expecting Hana Maui service and quality in an otherwise similarly beautiful location and were dissapointed to discover the hotel lacks class and does not pay attention to service/discriminating customers. The lack of attention to detail spoiled the overall experience, e,g, pool scene, lobby and reception (no lei upon arrival, refreshing drinks or cold towels), poor service, room not ready on time, etc. We would definitely return to North Shore and hope that either the management makes some changes (the hotel really needs an upgrade to be called 5 star) or that some stylish, intimate hotel opens in between!

Reviews.Title: “Bad place to stay in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Bella5816185
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 5 nights after 3 nights stay at Royal Hawaiian and thought to enjoy the relaxing days away from the busy Waikiki. It was worng move to stay here at the turtle bay. I booked ocean front deluxe room. When we went to the room. Ocean was no where to be seen unless you poke you head outside of balcony and look toward to you right otherwise all we see was parking lot and swimming pool. The front desk first said they all sold out ocean front rooms. Hello, I prepaid my ocean front delux room through hotel 2 months ago. And then they tried to argue the room we are in is Ocean front deluxe even the manager William was trying to convince us that the room is ocean FRONT deluxe. The room can't even pass as partial ocean view. Anyway, they finally said to move us the next day and we asked to be reimbursed for the first night. And they magically have a room to move us to. All I try to said is watch out when you tried to book ocean front room they may try to fool you. Now, the room was bad, bad, bad. The bathroom doesn't look to be updated since 60 or 70 and tile wall has patches with different color tiles. Moble countertop has stains and discolor. The room is good size but nothing fancy. When we asked for a baby tub, they said they don't have it. We have been travel all over the world and stay at least 4 stars hotels, we have not has problem getting one for our 20 months old. It feel like big down grade from Royal Hawaii. And I thought this was supposed to be 4 stars. The location of hotel is good if you just want to have more privacy and don't mind to be in the motel this is good choice. Everthing is very outdated. Don't come.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: pattengl
Reviews.Content: Do you like the country? Do you enjoy watching wave after wave crash into the shore? Do you like secluded beaches where you feel the island is your's to explore? Sound's like a commercial but this place is so real. My wife and I will be dreaming about Turtle Bay and our vacation for years to come. Do yourself a favor and stay away from Waikiki. If you really want to see Waikiki take the Helicopter ride from Turtle Bay. You will be flown around the entire island for 220.00 a person. Bring a good camera cause the photos will be incredible. We booked our trip through Costco Travel(flawless and best value). Activites: Helicopter- must do Segway Tour- On Turtle Bay property. Lot's of fun and great way to find that secluded beach to hike to later. Jared our Segway guide was very informative about the North Shore, movies filmed at Turtle Bay and the nature in the area. I would not pass this up. Teds Bakery: Great food, great prices. Short drive from hotel. Close to Sharks Cove. Shrimp Farms: Try Giavanis, good food and again good prices. As to some of the reviews that say the hotel is dated or not up to par. Those people just don't get it. Turtle Bay has an enormous staff that work around the clock taking care of the grounds, rooms, and anything else thats needed on the property. I know because I watched them and commented to my wife about how well the property was maintained. I will stay at Turtle Bay again. One of the best vacations of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LMH023
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon November 8th to the 14th. Located on the North shore, best part of Oahu. From the moment we got there the Service was incredible. The concierge staff were very helpful. Housekeeping were amazing. The staff on the beach, especially the woman running the beach hut was fanatastic. Alot of choices for food, but Ola's was our favourite, romantic dinners on the beach! Nothing whatsoever to complain about!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantice getaway”
Reviews.Author: jason h
Reviews.Content: Great view from room about 5 floors up. Incredible sunsets and sunrises. Waves crashing past as you sleep. This spells romance which made it my wifes favorite vacation locations ever. Love the services and the help. will return again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Planning a wedding there was very annoying!”
Reviews.Author: ckyocc
Reviews.Content: I'm a wedding planner based in NYC and a client of mine wanted to get married at the Turtle Bay Resort. Looking at their website and reading reviews, I thought this would be a smooth planning process...I was mistaken. You would think that a venue that did hundreds of weddings a year would know how to respond to emails and requests. I had to email several times, leave at least a couple voicemails and finally leave a very stern voicemail in order for them to respond. This happened on multiple occasions. I ended up having to call the management company in Texas to get responses on a few things that were holding up my clients from sending out their invitations. Only after I filed a complaint with the management company, did the general manager of the resort step in to help. The resort is unionized, so i think the employees feel no need to do a good job. They have all sorts of hidden charges (they charge 1/2 of the site fee to have a rehearsal, plus extra if you want the event coordinator there). There was garbage and cigarette butts at the ceremony site (right in the aisle) and when i asked the event manager to have it cleaned up, she said the crew was not there on saturdays and there was nothing she could do, i asked for a rake at least, she never got one to me...My helpers ended up on their hands and knees picking up the garbage so the bride could walk down a clean aisle. During the cocktail hour, we were supposed to have passed hors d'oeuvres (we were paying for 2 waiters to pass them out at $65/hour), but the hors d'oeuvres ended up on a bussing tray on the side of the lawn. The Event Coordinator that was assigned to the wedding did pretty much nothing. In the end they tried to charge us for some indoor audio setup, when we were outdoors the entire time. It has taken over a month to finally get them to adjust that and get the clients' money back. A headache to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great location that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: cottydoo
Reviews.Content: Reception was rude and sarcastic. I had called a month ahead to tell them it was our honeymoon they told me they would give us a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we checked into the room my wife complained that the bathroom was dirty and she was surprised that for 240 a night it was really outdated. So I went downstairs to see if there was another room available or if I could pay for a upgrade. When I told her the complaint she said she dosn't pay attention to bathrooms and that the room had been remodeled with a new bed and tv. I didn't really care about the bathroom either and our view was awesome so I said ok can you please just send some one up when you get a chance to clean it up. I then asked about the champagne she said that should have been done when we first checked in. I told her I had called ahead and that when we checked in I had mentioned it was our honeymoon. I guess she didn't believe me so she went up to the other receptionist then came back and said I will check the notes if you called. She then checked the computer and said there were no notes... I said uh ok well do you guys sell champagne (I didn't want to bum my wife out more by not only failing to get us a new room but also not getting the champagne they promised us) she paused then sighed and said its I will call it in for you. An our later the champagne showed up and the room service guy congratulated us and was real nice so I tipped him. Housekeeping never came to clean the bathroom and I didn't bother calling our going down to complain. Anyway the views were amazing the setting is beautiful but the front desk was awful and the room was pretty lame for the money paid. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “needs some work”
Reviews.Author: pstan20213
Reviews.Content: large rooms but only place to sit was 2 chairs and small table. Cleanliness was not that good, bathroom had alot of hair on floor when we came in and room was not vacuumed 2 out of 3 days we were there. Alot of water damage in ceiling and after rain lst night holes started opening up and dripped down wall. Also air conditioner leaked in both our room and friends room, thus carpet under it (vent was in ceiling) was always damp. Great location, good beach and pool, just older establishment that needs some work

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in relaxation”
Reviews.Author: PortlandORGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Turtle Bay and look forward to going back. The North Shore is simply stunning and worlds away from the hubbub of Waikiki. Our travel was arranged through AAA and based on reviews here, we chose to stay in a cabin.
