We never did see the hotel rooms (we had planned to check them out for comparison but the cabins were so terrific, we never got around to it). We requested a king but recvd 2 queens upon check-in. A king was available starting 2nd night so they moved us. They offered $25 off (one night’s resort fee) for our troubles and by asking for more, I rec’d a total of $50 off. In our room, we found tshirts and fruit, along with a note from our concierge (who we never did meet -- apparently the cabins have their own concierge; when we needed something we just hit 0 so I'm guessing we used the main hotel's concierge). The first cabin was #124. That set of cabins is set back (probably the furthest back of any set) from the ocean. A large swath of lawn separated the ocean and the rooms. The view was still nice (and many hammocks in the area) but it wasn’t the view we wanted. Since we were moving anyway, I had my husband scope out rooms with a better view and put in a request if a room closer to the ocean was available. Our second room had a spectacular view (my husband won’t let me post the number, sorry), just steps from the ocean. But all of the rooms offer wonderful views and it is heavenly sleeping with the doors open and the sound of the surf crashing so near. The cottages aren’t exactly cottages; they are single-floor rows of 6 rooms, separated in the middle by a storage room. Despite having neighbors, our lanai felt completely private, during the day and evening. It was great having a large lanai as we were able to use it during our daughter's naps and after we'd put her to bed. The cottage rooms were fabulous. Spacious, clean, a separate bath and shower. We had our 4 yr old with us and there was more than enough space for all (she slept with us so no rollaway). The room with 2 queens felt spacious and lovely. Had it not been for the view, we wouldn’t have minded staying there. The king room had a wet bar area that the queen didn’t have and in the bathroom, the toilet had a door (not found in the room with 2 queens). I'm picky about mattresses and found both rooms to have nice mattresses and had no problem sleeping. There is a $25 resort fee. While not onerous, I found it irritating. It covers things like internet, the newspaper, self parking (in the city perhaps but parking is self-parking is abundant at Turtle Bay, it was ridiculous they listed it) and a few other things that we didn’t use or want (like an hour volleyball rental). I’d much rather them raise the room cost by $25 per night and skip the resort fee all together. At a nice resort, a fee like that makes you feel like they are nickel and diming you. The towel card didn’t help that feeling. You are issued 1 towel card per person and must present the card to receive a towel at the pool. At the end of your stay, if you don’t return the right number of towels/cards, you are charged. I realize that there are people that steal towels but really? Maybe it’s because I wouldn’t dream of stealing but having to keep track of a towel card was just silly to me and one more thing I didn’t want to deal with on my vacation. I don't think I've ever stayed at a resort before that had a towel card. I rated cleanliness only a 4 because the rooms next door to us must have ordered room service -- and the dishes sat outside their doors for at least a day in one case and two days in the other. Our room, itself, was perfectly clean but it seemed a bit icky that used dishes would be left outside for so long. We went to 3 of the 5 restaurants – missed 21 Degrees North because it isn’t open Sundays or Mondays and we planned poorly and we skipped the Bay Club entirely because it’s more a bar than a restaurant, not on the beach and we had our 4 year old. For variety, we did venture offsite to Romy’s, Giovani’s, Kahuku Grill, Ted’s Bakery. I’ll review the restaurants separately except for Lei Lei’s as we only went once for breakfast (3 options on the menu, we had the breakfast croissants & French toast – a good option for something different. Pretty sure the cheese on the croissants was Kraft Singles. The coffee, like at Palm Terrace, is weak). If you require coffee stronger than water, hit the cart in the lobby. The resort offers plenty to do (horses, surf lessons, tennis, etc) but we stuck mostly to the pool and walks along the beach. My husband did take a surf lesson; the waves were a bit rocky so they went offsite about 10 minutes. He came back bruised and battered as the waves were still quite rough 10 minutes away but he had a great time and wants to do it again. The waves are a bit rough for playing in the ocean (remember, we have a 4 year old) so the pool with it’s beachside bar/restaurant, Hang Ten, was our preference. Our daughter loved the waterslide and there's a waterfall in the same pool. Pool rules say no floating devices but nearly every young child we encountered had them and on the second day of our stay, we brought out the floaties for our 4 yr old and no one said a thing. One thing about security – You can lock the screen doors to the beach but I found that moving the screens a bit and / or the sliding glass doors, allowed more than enough space to slip through the door. I discovered it after I returned from the spa and my husband had locked the screen for a walk – I didn’t realize he was out of the room and went to the ocean side, and slipped right in. A simple dowel or stick of the right size placed on the glass door side of the track would fix this problem. I mentioned it to management before we left so they could fix it. It’s not critical as you can shut the glass doors for security but it’s something to be aware of so you don’t leave thinking your room is secure and come back to find something of value taken. We were lucky, my husband left his wallet sitting by my computer and camera equipment and nothing was taken but our story could easily be different. They were filming a reality tv show at the resort while we were there. That was unfortunate as there were certain areas off limits -- including a stunning beach on the property that we were hoping to see. The staff, everyone from the maintenance people to the cleaning people to the bartenders, at Turtle Bay was phenomenal -- friendly and professional. Every encounter we had with the staff was a pleasure. The North Shore is so relaxing and Turtle Bay maintains that feel. A great resort for kids; I look forward to going back when our daughter is a bit older and we can go on a longer walk down the coastline and enjoy more of the activities.

Reviews.Title: “What's the state fish of Hawaii? The Humuhumunukunukuapua'a! Yeah!”
Reviews.Author: Bzulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few months ago, and absolutely loved it. Figured there were so many positive reviews....why bother writing another one? Well, we watched the adult comedy "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" last night, which was largely filmed at Turtle Bay Resort, and enough great memories came rushing back that I thought i should revisit the experience. Checked in early and went to our room. The room overlooked the pool, the inner beach by the condos, and the north shore radar site that first spotted, and ignored, the radar returns from the attacking Japanese aircraft in 1941. The view was mostly inland. My wife was not impressed, so we returned to the front desk and politely asked for a room with more of an ocean view. We said that we would wait for however long it took, so we sashayed down by the pool and killed a few hours swilling Mai-Tais and chilling. After a few hours, we were called and were shown to our very nice ocean view room overlooking the wedding reception area. It was stunning and incredibly romantic. My wife even misted up a bit because it was "so perfect." I must have slipped the receptionist a tip earlier, because a few hours later a nice young lady brought up a chilled bottle of champagne for us to enjoy on our patio. The resort fee includes snorkeling, so we grabbed masks and fins and hit the little bay every day. It was, by snorkeling standards, a bit lackluster, but it was just fine with me, since my attention span is only good for about an hour of flailing in the bay anyhow. The bay by the pool had about four large sea turtles flopping in the tide, which attracted quite a crowd on the shore, watching with pleasure. We ate at the restaurant on the beach once. The food was pricey, but OK,. We had a couple of friends visit for dinner, and the girl of the couple said it was the most romantic dinner she had ever had. The resort grounds were very nicely maintained, the pool was great. Our room was nicely appointed. If you want an idea of how the resort appears, check out "Forgetting Sarah Marshal," which has a lot of very nice footage on the resort. It's in the vein of "The Hangover," or "Pineapple Express," so it definitely is not for everyone, but but the footage is quite nice. We loved it, and after watching the movie again, my wife said she would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mart0146
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here at the end of October 2010 for our anniversary and for a "babymoon". It was one of the best vacations we ever had. We had booked into a deluxe oceanfront room, but were offered the opportunity to upgrade for a nominal fee at check in. This is something that is offered to you when you book your reservation online directly with the resort. We were able to upgrade to a beachfront cottage for about 40% less than if we would have booked directly into that room category. The room was absolutely beautiful. We were welcomed with cold bottled water, juice, ice, fruit, t shirts for both of us, and a bottle of champagne. We had excellent service from everyone from check in to concierge to the beach attendant to housekeeping. We swam and snorkeled at the resort everyday and snorkel equipment is included in your resort fee for an hour daily. We did not eat at the resort at all. There are numerous places to eat that are not a far drive from the resort. We recommend Ted's Bakery at Sunset Beach, Opal's Thai truck and Haleiwa Joe's in Haleiwa, and Hukilau Cafe in Laie. We also picnic-ed on our beautiful lanai a few times after picking up food at the Foodland just beyond Sunset Beach. We highly recommend Turtle Bay and the Beachfront Cottages, and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still charming”
Reviews.Author: 2012done
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to this resort was back in 2007, then again in 2008. This year we decided to make another visit before heading to Waikiki. We stayed in the east wing of the resort (bigger lanai). The first time we were in the room facing the beach, beautiful view. however, the lanai was very small. The beach is great for snorkling and Ola still offers great food. Each evening we enjoyed our stroll along the pathway, watching the wave coming ashore. We enjoyed the services at this resort, from the valet to the beachside service. Third time is still a charm!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at a great resort! We did want more food options though.”
Reviews.Author: Harris_Jayhawker
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay was top notch in nearly every aspect. The resort is located on a great stretch of the North Shore and offers a ton of activities. We enjoyed golfing, great hiking, swimming, and the spa while we were there. We also found the location to be rather convenient for Haleiwa, Waimea, and Sunset Beach. My one complaint would be that Turtle Bay does not offer a good value when it comes to food. We struggled to find economical options for while we were staying on the property and instead drove into town for food. Ultimately that was ok with us as we prefer local places such as Ted's Bakery and the shrimp trucks. It just would have been nice to have something convenient on the property on those tired nights when you didn't feel like driving.

Reviews.Title: “fine, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: OldMoscower
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel with my wife and daughter in October for 5 nights. We choosed this hotel, because wanted to be out of crowded Waikiki, still good in quality, but with reasonable price. It was fine, but nothing more. Some comments: Be prepared for resort fee of 25 USD, parking is included. BUT, You'll be lucky, if you'll find the free parking lot close to hotel Possibly, you heard about shrimp trucks, so you'll find it turning to the left from the hotel. the first one will be in 5-7 minutes drive You should plan about 1 hour and 15 minutes drive to the center of Honolulu to the right and about 1,5 hour to the left from the hotel. One time we turned left and were awarded by amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “A gem! What a fantastic vacation - thank you Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: ASU_Sundevils
Reviews.Content: Travelers – Me, wife, daughter (age 10) Dates – October 15-22 (7 nights) Origin – Carlsbad, CA Why the North Shore and Turtle Bay? Primarily two reasons: 1) While in Waikiki for spring break in 2009 we rented a car and took a day trip to the North Shore. We did some shopping and ate lunch in Haleiwa, and had an excellent snorkel session at Shark’s Cove. 2) The movie ‘Forgetting Sarah Marshall’ really made the hotel look good. How did we plan the trip? Through Costco Travel I got a package that included 7 nights in an ocean front cottage (including hotel tax but not resort fee), 7 days of breakfast buffet for all of us (including tax and tip), and 7 days of a convertible from Alamo (including tax) for about $542 per day. I consider this a good deal and have always had good service from Costco Travel. Arrival – It was probably close to 1:00 p.m. when we turned left off Kamehameha Highway into Turtle Bay. It would be an understatement to say that we were excited as we drove up the drive toward the resort. We stopped at the parking guard house and were very pleased to see that a pre-printed parking card was waiting for us. The parking attendant was full of the aloha spirit and made us feel very welcome. We then pulled into the front of the hotel so that we could check-in and were quickly greeted by a valet. He had no problem with us leaving our car in front while we checked in. We had a very short wait at the front desk and then were quickly and courteously checked in, including receiving our breakfast buffet vouchers, towel cards (including an extra one … just ask nicely!), and leis. We were asked if we wanted to use valet parking or self-park – we decided to self-park because there is a small lot dedicated to the cottages. By the time we had driven the couple hundred feet from the lobby to the cottage parking lot the concierge for the cottages rolled up next to us in a golf cart and immediately took care of our luggage. She was super nice and really made us feel welcome. We were so excited as we walked up to cottage 116, and were blown away when we opened the front door and saw exactly how close the cottage is to the ocean. The concierge brought in our luggage, left for a few minutes, and then quickly returned with cold drinks, bottled water, ice, fruit, and Turtle Bay t-shirts for all of us (she had asked our shirt size before she left the first time). She then proceeded to answer all of our questions and give us all kinds of information about the resort. Once the concierge left we quickly unpacked and knew that we had picked a great place for a vacation. Staff – You’ll notice that in my description of the arrival I have called out the great attitude of the four employees we encountered. This attitude extended across the board to all employees at the hotel, including pool servers, beach shack rental, beach boys, towel girls at the pool, hostesses and waiters/waitresses at Ola’s and Lei Lei’s and Palm Terrace restaurants, hotel concierge, business center concierge, maids, turn-down service, tennis shop, Kohala Bay shop, Lamont’s – all of them were incredibly nice. We found ourselves commenting over and over about how friendly all of the staff are at this hotel. The aloha spirit lives at Turtle Bay. When I read previous Trip Advisor posts about rude staff I just can’t fathom how that is possible. We certainly encountered nothing but great service, and I felt so strongly about this that at check-out I asked the front desk person to get the manager on duty so that I could relay the positive feedback. Resort Fee - $25 per day is charged to your account and covers all of the following: local calls, no-fee access to 800 numbers & credit card calls, wireless internet, in-room coffee and tea (while the coffee isn’t 100% Kona it is from Hawaii; my wife said it was pretty good), daily newspaper (Honolulu paper, and I was also brought the New York Time on Sunday because I asked for it), self-parking, rental for one-hour per day for two people of a snorkel set or boogie board or volleyball (we bring our own snorkel equipment so my daughter took the boogie board for two hours each day), access to the fitness center, one hour of tennis court time per room per day, in-room safe, incoming faxes, and use of the business center (Internet access, print boarding passes, etc.). I’m not a fan of resort fees but I must say that we got our money’s worth on this one, and I recommend that you do the same. We rented the boogie board each day; we played tennis every morning; I use the fitness center a couple of times; my wife drank the in-room coffee; I love reading the newspaper (and the Honolulu paper is pretty good); we always use the safe; I used the business center a couple of times to get directions and print boarding pass. Cottage (location and exterior/front) – Simply put … you need to do the cottage rather than the hotel room if you can afford it. The cottages are a fantastic experience. There are 42 of them grouped in seven buildings of six side-by-side cottages. Within a group of six there are two clusters of three, which allows for connecting doors. From the outside (front door) the cottages aren’t anything special – they are far enough away from the rest of the resort to assure some privacy but close enough to everything so that you aren’t too far away. For example, from our front door to the tennis court took about 90 seconds; from our front door to the pool took about two minutes. We were in cottage 116, which was close to a perfect location. My definition of “perfect location” means the patio is the closest to the beach and the view from the patio is unobstructed by any foliage. With that as my definition I would choose 114 on my next visit, with 115 and 113 being my next choices. Don’t get me wrong – 116 was excellent but the other three would be just a bit better. One quick comment about the non-cottage rooms. The hotel rooms facing east/north-east have extremely small balconies that are only large enough to hold two small chairs. In fact, the first floor room (floor two of the hotel?) have no balcony. The rooms facing north and the rooms facing west/north-west have larger balconies that appear to be much more conducive to sitting. If you want to watch the sun rise then go with east/north-east, if you want to watch the sun set (and have a bigger balcony) then go with west/north-west. But if you can afford it and you don’t need a suite-sized room just do a cottage. Cottage (bathroom) – The bathroom is immediately on the left as you walk in. It has a large tub and a large stand-alone shower with a glass door. The floor and counter appear to be marble – the counter is large as is the mirror above it. Unfortunately, the counter has only one sink. The coffee pot sits on the counter along with the coffee/tea/etc. The toilet sits next to the counter against the cottage exterior wall. Both the hot water and water pressure are fine. Also on the counter are the amenities, including shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion. We liked everything but the lotion (I liked the lotion but my wife and daughter did not). There is also soap, cotton balls, q-tips, and a sewing kit. Cottage (interior) – The interior is larger than a standard hotel room. The depth is probably at least twice the width. Your attention is immediately drawn through the room to the view of the ocean out the patio. There are appear to be two different sizes of cottages and ours was the smaller of the two. The difference in size is in the width of the room. Just past the bathroom the room opens up and has a very high vaulted ceiling of at least 15 feet. There is a well-functioning ceiling fan with a wall control (multi-speed) on the wall next to the thermostat. The thermostat functions well and the a/c is very good but could be a bit quieter. The closet is small and contained two robes and two pairs of slippers. We could have used a few more hangars but it was not worth a call to housekeeping. The safe is also in the closet – we used it all the time and it functioned perfectly. Our room had two queen beds, which I found to be very comfortable. There were plenty of pillows and blankets. In between the beds was a nightstand with two lights (one for each bed). Opposite the beds was an old school armoire with drawers. The TV sits inside the armoire – it is a flat panel plasma of ~32”. The picture quality was good and the selection of channels was good, too. I don’t watch much TV when I am in Hawaii. There were several drawers in the armoire, which provided plenty of space for our clothes. On either side of the armoire were large benches, which were great for sitting or placing items. Next to the bed was a rack capable of supporting a large suitcase. The main sleeping area was set off from a sitting area and the patio by wooden railings, which are great for drying wet clothes. You step down two steps to get to the sitting area, which contains a mini bar, small refrigerator, desk, two chairs, couch, coffee table, and lamp. The refrigerator worked very well and we stocked it full of water that we purchased at the Foodland in Pupukea. There was plenty of room for all of us and our stuff without feeling as if we were crowding each other. I found the room to be very dark at night and very quiet. The furniture was in pretty good shape but with obvious nicks and cuts and scrapes that come from extensive use. Cottage (patio) – A large sliding glass door with a screen door leads to a large covered patio. On the patio is a table, two chairs, and a rocking chair. There is also a nice ledge on which to prop your feet and /or place items to dry. The patio was a bit dirty and the furniture is showing its age, but that is what I expect given the proximity to the ocean. The patio is lit but when the light is on at night it tends to attract bugs. You are in the tropics – you will see bugs, including bugs that you may have never seen before. You will also see lizards, and feral cats, and chickens, and other critters. Get used to it and don’t complain about it as this is part of Hawaii. Grounds – Just past the patio is a small garden, then a few feet of grass, and then the beach. Immediately in front of our cottage it was too rocky to get to the beach but about ten feet to the left some stairs had been carved into the rock making it simple to get to the beach. Be warned that the beach in front of the cottages is quite rocky. You can swim there – many people did – but you need to be more careful than you would in the cove. I liked the landscaping but I think there was just a bit too much grass. There is a lot of volcanic rock in the area and it works really well with the landscaping. There are many varieties of trees, which may not be in keeping with peoples’ image of Hawaii. Again, this is real Hawaii – it’s not all palm trees. Trust me – it looks great. There are plumeria trees all over the place and may daughter & I would collect the newly fallen blooms and cover our patio table, which really made our patio smell great. We replaced the blooms every two days to keep things fresh. Grass is not easy to grow on Hawaii – it will appear uneven, you’ll see some dead spots and even some weeds. Again, this is Hawaii. The overall look of the landscaping is extremely good. I saw landscapers working every day trimming bushes, mowing, edging, pruning trees, etc. The landscaping is well taken care of. Make sure that you checkout the blowhole near the Hang Ten pool bar – very cool! Cottage (cleanliness) – The maid service was great; typically a crew of two gave the room a thorough cleaning every day including damp mopping the hard wood floors. We found them to be very prompt, courteous, and friendly. The turn-down service was also very good. Each night they would leave chocolate covered mac nuts and, sometimes, macaroons (which my wife and daughter said were delicious). Late every morning the cottage concierge would stop by with some fruit (apples, plums, oranges, bananas, etc.) and a fresh bucket of ice. Dining – We ate breakfast every morning at Palm Terrace. The service was always efficient and friendly, the food was good and plentiful. My wife, who really knows salsa, pronounced the cook’s salsa to be exceptionally good. She spent some time speaking with him and got the recipe. This salsa was on her eggs every morning. We had two dinners at the golf course restaurant – Lei Lei’s – and enjoyed both meals and the service (although they need to fix the broken tiki torches). This restaurant is very popular with the locals. We had one dinner at Ola’s (our last night) and really enjoyed it (I’m sounding like a broken record, aren’t I?). The service and food were very good, although my king crab could have been a bit warmer. Both restaurants have a keiki menu with plenty of choices for even a picky child. We also ordered drinks from the bar at Ola’s twice – once during the day at the beach and once in the evening around sunset. Both times the service was fast and friendly. Tennis – The tennis complex seems to be deemphasized at the resort. There used to be ten courts but it looks as if six of them are being left untended and will eventually be torn out. This is too bad as I’m guessing that there aren’t many good places to play tennis on the North Shore. Locals are allowed to have a tennis membership at Turtle Bay. We played tennis every morning and the four courts that are being kept up are in great condition. The tennis staff is very nice and helpful. Golf – I didn’t golf but a lot of people were golfing, and there was an amateur tournament going on while were there. I bought a hat at the pro shop and received, of course, excellent service. The golf courses do not hug the ocean so don’t go expecting a Pebble Beach experience. Horses – We didn’t ride but we checked out the horses – there are a lot of them. Trails – Our first full day we took a long walk west on the beach past the bunker to a very secluded cove. It was a beautiful beach; unfortunately, the water was a bit murky so we didn’t swim there. We walked back through the forest trail. I highly recommend these trails but be warned that to walk the beach trail you must have reef shoes and you must be prepared for a strenuous workout. On another day we walked east on the beach – absolutely beautiful but it is very hard to walk on that sand. The benefit is that there are no crowds. Cove – The cove is cool … water temp was at least 78 … small, unintimidating waves … mostly sandy bottom. I wish the water were clearer, but when I did snorkel I did see some nice fish. It is a fun place to spend the afternoon, especially with small children. The beach boys will happily set you up with chairs, towels, and an umbrella. There may be times when they are out of chairs and umbrellas but if you are patient they will set you up as soon as stuff is returned. The woman who runs the beach toys shack is extremely nice. By day three she knew our names and had a boogie board ready for my daughter. Beaches – The beaches are absolutely gorgeous; my words couldn’t possibly do justice so I’m not even going to try. Pool – I was very pleased with the pool area for many reasons: 1) Towel girls are very friendly; 2) Food/drink service is friendly and plentiful; on a weekday (and this is mid-October) there were always at least four girls serving and at least two bartenders; 3) The Jacuzzis are perfectly positioned to watch the sunset, and they are hot; 4) The keiki pools (there are two) are warm and fun, especially the water slide; 5) The pool is much warmer than I expected and might even be heated; compared to Grand Wailea or Fairmont Orchid or Hilton Hawaiian Village this pool is much warmer (I love it!) Shopping – Not much here but the basic sundries and snacks can all be found at Lamont’s. Foodland is only a couple of miles from the hotel, and you can always take a trip to Waikiki if you want to shop. Summary – Turtle Bay is a gem; if you go expecting a five-star resort you might be disappointed. Turtle Bay isn’t a five-star resort nor does it claim to be one. What I did get is five stars (and then some) of relaxation, which is priceless to me. Don’t go expecting nightlife, and don’t complain about the fact that there isn’t any. You are missing the point of the vacation. By the way, there is plenty of nightlife but you just don’t know about it. Remember, you are a tourist, not a local. I can assure you that there is plenty of nightlife on the North Shore. We were extremely sad to leave; there were tears in our eyes as we drove through the guard shack one last time on the way to Kamehameha Highway. We’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “UTOPIA! :)”
Reviews.Author: katie_vabeach
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have made Turtle Bay Resort our annual vacation spot. The North Shore is just amazing. I debate coming home after every stay - one of these days I will buy that one way ticket. :) If you want to experience true Hawaii, visit the Turtle Bay Resort! They are tucked away on the North Shore of Oahu. It is absolutely beautiful. There is so much to do on the North Shore too - waterfalls, hikes, surfing, good restaurants in Walimea, surfing lessons, massages at Turtle Bay, shopping in Walimea, Dole Pineapple Plantation, Macadamenian Nut Farm( this is a must - take the tour - you won't regret it( fire dancing, boat ride, fruit tasting). The resort itself has snorkeling, 2 pools, 5 restaurants, spa, shopping, golf, ennis, any everything! GO THERE! Food is incredible too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CABhonolulu
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancé live on Oahu but love to get away every few months and so we go to turtle bay resort. We stay in the beach cottages which are amazing! They are open spacious and very clean. There's a large bathroom with shower and big tub. There's a mini fridge, kitchen like sink, and the beds are pretty comfortable. The views from your room are amazing. You just open your back door and have immediate beach access. There are always turtles and although the beach isn't very good for swimming it is great for walking and finding shells. There's hammocks everywhere and it is so relaxing. The pool is great and there's another beach a small walk from the pool which is great for snorkeling!!!! I'd like to say a big thank you to the manager Terry and bartender Vinny for always being so accommodating and making our stay at turtle bay even better!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the place to stay in Oahu, amazing.”
Reviews.Author: hawk570
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary at Turtle Bay, and it was the best anniversary yet. This place is incredible and has the best views no matter where you are. The rooms were spacious and clean as was the entire resort. The restaurants are a little pricey, but not as bad as some have stated on their reviews. As for the food, top notch. The pools were very nice, but a bit on the cold side, as this is my ONLY complaint . Don't forget to take the horseback riding tour, well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: 4Virginia_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the oceanfront cabanas at Turtle Bay in late September, early October. I would highly recommend these accomodations. Our room was beautiful...large king size four poster bed, hardwood floors, ultra modern bathroom, step down into large sitting room with desk and wet bar. The most amazing part of it was the porch and the view! We were literally steps away from the ocean. We had a beautiful grassy area, with a hammock and then the gorgeous ocean. This resort offers everything so there is no need to leave once you're there...and you won't want to!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay; Just double check the room ahead of time.”
Reviews.Author: Neepaconejo
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Turtle Bay once we got our room situation resolved. We booked 6 nights for an Ocean Front Deluxe room, which is considered to be the highest end of regular rooms with a nice size lanai included. I had read in an earlier Trip Advisor review to request a room on the 4th floor or higher and one that has an odd number room number to avoid getting a room with noise from the pool. I checked with the front desk the day before we arrived and they assured me that my room fit those requirements. Just ONE thing I forgot to ask: “Is the view beautiful?” We arrived just in time for sunset tired from our flight and traffic out of Honolulu. Imagine my dismay when I saw that 75% of our view included a large expanse of the red roof of the resort’s ballroom and neither sunset nor sunrise views. I wanted to say something to the front desk but my husband was tired and wanted to stay put for that night. The next morning, I was at the front desk requesting a different room and they were happy to give us room 522 which while on the pool side was far enough from any noise and provided a beautiful sunset view. Here are some short points that might be helpful to future visitors: 1) Obviously, make sure your room is not one that overlooks the ballroom 2) If you have flexibility with your dates, try to stay when there’s a full moon and make a point of getting up early before dawn to see the moon set on the water; absolutely stunning! 3) We booked our room through Blue Hawaii Vacations and saved an amazing amount; it included the Buffet Breakfast and a rental car and still was less than booking just the room directly on the resort’s site. Had a reasonable cancellation policy as well. 4) The Palm Terrace breakfast buffet is worth it if you can have it included in your room price as a special. There’s plenty of variety so even if every dish isn’t delectable, you’ll have plenty of choices. (The made-to-order omelets are great; the scrambled eggs in the covered dish are not.) The evening meals served at the Terrace were hit and miss but they have a very good large salad. Get there before 8:30 p.m. so you can hear the live entertainment instead of the ubiquitous Hawaiian music they pipe in the rest of the time. I liked the music the first two days but I think it was the same tape they played over and over…or at least that’s what it seemed like. Ola and Lei Lei meals were better as was the variety of music. 5) There’s a cement walking path that goes all the way around the buildings and is a nice way to walk off the calories at the end of the day. The walking path that takes you past the stables and into a lovely woods is particularly nice an hour before sunset. 6) Kayaking at the resort was $100 a person and is for beginners and very tame but also enjoyable and instructive. 7) Be aware that the height of the waves picks up from the end of September to March making surfing and snorkeling more of a challenge for beginners. I was told the snorkeling on the North Shore was a lot better April-August because the water is clearer and more areas are accessible. 8) 15 minutes south is Waimea Valley which is a great place to visit on a hot day and you want to do something other than a beach activity. It has a shady paved walkway that ends at a waterfall with plants and flowers from all over the world and a cool archaeological site to visit along the way. 9) Get directions to Turtle Beach (also called Laniakea beach) where you’ll find turtles basking in the sand but please respect them and keep your distance. 10)Twenty minutes south is Haleiwa where you’ll find galleries and shopping and lots of restaurants. The last Saturday of the month there is an Art Walk from 6 to 9 and the galleries and some of the other shops stay open late and offer music and refreshments. We found some art in our price range both at KAI KU HALE right next to a great ice cream shop and at the Haleiwa Art Gallery which is down a bit further and across the street. Take a look at the work by the artist Bailey Leung. He paints miniatures of flowers and landscapes that make nice and relatively speaking affordable keepsakes that are easy to bring back and were priced starting at $75 and up for original works. One other note, my husband was not a snorkeler and as a beginner, I felt I needed a snorkel partner so I asked one of the kayak instructors if he would accompany me. He showed me great spots and helped me navigate areas that I would not have attempted. Contact me if you want his contact information. Overall we had a very restful vacation and thank the resort for making our stay such a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: jasminscent
Reviews.Content: We came here to attend a wedding, one of the many that took place on 10/10/10. Considering how many weddings and how full the hotel was, the staff did an excellent job with checkins, checkouts, etc. We had an oceanview room with a huge balcony, and had coffee and breakfast there almost every morning. The room was clean but a bit outdated. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom was very spacious. The two sinks, one alongside of the toilet and another outside of the bathroom itself, really made it convenient at times. Free WiFi is alway a big plus for internet junkie like me and unfortunately, for a workaholic like my husband. The staff were all very friendly and wiling to help. We swam in the little cove area near the resort and saw a monk seal sunbathing for a few days. Sunsets right outside of the spa are beautiful so don't miss them! We only ate once at the resort at Ola for the wedding reception and the food was great. Their butterfish was melt-in-your-mouth tender, shrimp with pasta was garlicky and tasty, and we had a variety of wonderful little bites of appetizers. Desserts were also all very tasty. Overall, a nice relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: IslandGurl47
Reviews.Content: My family just came back from our stay at Turtle Bay, and it was amazing! We stayed over the 10/10/10 weekend and even though the resort was full of weddings and other events we were made to feel like visiting royalty. All of our needs were attended to above and beyond expectations. Our room, the Pikake suite, had breathtaking views of the North Shore surfers and pounding waves (rooms 480 and 482). Ola was a fun place to eat, right on the sand with a maitai in hand and a Hawaiian monk seal lounging on the beach. The snorkeling in the cove at Turtle Bay afforded us the chance to swim with a sea turtle, watch so many different colored tropical fish and explore the volcanic craters of the reefs. Nearby is Waimea Valley where we swam under a waterfall and lunched at the famous Giovannis shrimp truck, although we liked the Kahuku truck better. Look for Bonnie in the main restaurant at Turtle Bay, she is a sweetheart and will definitely make you feel at home. Our teenage daughter loved it as well, there was an arcade, ipod dock in room, lots of shopping, and of course virgin cocktails, surfing lessons and horseback riding. Just an amazing resort!

Reviews.Title: “Every room has an ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: gabbysmom24
Reviews.Content: Every single room of this resort does have an excellent ocean view due to the way the resort is located on a sort of cove of the beach. The staff was always smiling and very polite every time we encountered them. They were more than happy to help us with questions or suggestions and they also helpfully booked all of our itinerary for us quickly and accurately. The resort is located in a secluded area of the North Shore and it was very peaceful and beautiful. I will definitely be making several trips here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My jaw hit the floor when I saw the dramatic 360 degree ocean views”
Reviews.Author: selbert
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is unique and fantastic if you have kids and want to enjoy everything Oahu has to offer as well as just hang at a fabulous pool with stunning dramatic views of ocean and rock formations...Food is fabulous! Room is fabulous and clean. Service was 5 star. and I like thats its not in Honolulu its on the laid back side of Island closer to Dole, Polynesian Center and North Shore. Waikiki Beach is fine and dandy but the better more secluded beaches are on the "turtle" side... : ) You could prettty much just stay at the resort with kids and go to their private beach but one must venture out to Polynesian Center (just once just to see how cool is it), go to Dole and have some amazing Pineapple frozen yogurt and feed the koi fish. Go to North Shore (the waves are amazing but the town itself is just tropical and sleepy (fine by me.. : ) )...The big hits are Kalua Ranch (im spelling it wrong) where they filmed "Lost" and go early and make reservations for snorkling in Huanema Bay ( I did not do this though im planning on it next time..) Turtle Bay is amazing ! It is special and you feel really away from it all..In waikiki its too busy and crazy and really its only a 30 minute drive (not on peak hours)... If your a clubber dont go to Turtle Bay..If you golf, have kids, (love the kid pool with big water slide and waterfalls (big hit with kids..)..Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Theworldfromskipton
Reviews.Content: We stayed as part of our honeymoon for 5 nights and wish it had been much longer. We found the hotel excellent in every department. Very comfortable rooms which were spotless with fantastic views. The staff were very efficent and friendly and the hotel had had a feel of a very well run establishment. The hotel position is ideal away from the hustle of Waikiki and near the beautiful surfing beaches of Sunset. Excellent dining facilities with great food, particularly liked the beach bar & restaurant. I have been a Travel Agency manager in the UK for over 30 years and this is one of the nicest most enjoyable hotels I have ever stayed in. Already saving up to go back as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “Must go. Best resort on the island!”
Reviews.Author: yongininlub
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell... Turtle bay is the best resort on the island. Seemingly far from the bustle of Honolulu, this place offers clean accommodations, top notch service and beautiful breathtaking scenary. A bit expensive, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Relax!”
Reviews.Author: ebickford
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to sit back and relax, this is located on the slower side of the Island. We spent most of our time on the beach or in the pool. The rooms were immaculate and they had great facilities for our 1 year old. There was a pool 1.5 FT were she could splash and play, not to mention the waterslide that was fun for kids of all ages. The places to eat were great and the buffet was so good! Aside from the wind maiking the pool less attaractive to my 1 year old (got cold too fast) it was a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfection and amazing setting!”
Reviews.Author: sundevil731
Reviews.Content: The most amazing vacation and the perfect beach wedding Everything was perfect at Turtle Bay Resort. Best location on the island of Oahu, secluded, remote, peaceful...absolutely paradise! The staff was super friendly and very accomodating to all of our needs. We stayed 4 nights, two nights in a junior suite with a huge room and balcony then 2 nights in the Cottage. The cottages are the best option to stay in, huge rooms, plush bedding with a canopy bed, amazing bathroom with stand up shower and spa tub. Definitely recommend for any type of trip especially with your spouse, just absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view everytime”
Reviews.Author: Makakilosunflower
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at Turtle Bay Resort. It amazes me that every room has an ocean view. The rooms are clean and we enjoyed our stay again this year. The sunsets are beautiful so find yourself a spot at the pool to relax and take it all in.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiMike00
Reviews.Content: I have been to many leading hotels around the world and this by far was the least worth it as far as value was concerned. Everything is itemized and you are nickled and dimed the whole way through. We bought the 250$ room. Then there was mandatory 25$ charge for activity fee. The activities are actually less than most other 4-5 star hotels provide. (e.g. it includes use of the pool). Breakfast was not included-- that was another 25$ per head for the buffet. And since they dont cover any of the food, there was tons of fruit flies (at least the restaurant manager was kind enough not to charge us). The rooms were adequate and the view was great, but that would be the extent of my positive remarks. The TVs are very outdated. The service should be much more smiley given the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious. Absolutely outstanding location, backed up with 5-star world class service”
Reviews.Author: ocean_afficinado
Reviews.Content: We've been to some lovely places, but this resort takes the cake. If you like the ocean and want to be close to it, this is the spot for you. Service at the front desk was among the best we have ever experienced, hands down. Room, exceptionally clean and well appointed. We stayed in a cottage for 4 nights, and could see the waves, just steps from our room. I am told there is not a room at this resort that does not have an ocean view. All resorts should be designed like this. The pool area was surrounded by wonderful panoramic views of the ocean as well, and there is a beach right at the property for snorkeling and swimming. 2 Champion golf courses and great tennis courts. We would not hesitate to return. We took the scenic route to the resort from HNL airport, HWY 83 along the coast - spectacular. We toured the Wailea Botanical Garden, just a few miles from the resort. Go early and be one of the first to swim in the waterfall at the end of the trail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Food, Great Golf”
Reviews.Author: DrBobParkCIty_UT
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of December and the first week of January at Turtle Bay. The facility met or exceded all our expectations. The pool was crowded and noisy the Christmas to New Years week, but once the children had returned to school, it was perfect. The Arnold Palmer golf course was one of the best resort course we have ever played. All the rooms have great ocean views. The resort is on the isolate end of the island so it is without the frenetic feel of the hotels near Honolulu. If you avoid the work day morning rush, you can drive into Honolulu in about 45 minutes to visit all the tourist"sites.

Reviews.Title: “our romatic honeymoon at turtle bay”
Reviews.Author: chantel084
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the 5 star resort at turtle bay in Oahu and it was just perfect... the room was more than i asked for and the location was picture perfect! the staff were very friendly and helpfull... we stayed for a week but wish we did make it longer! if your looking for your true dream destination make it turtle bay!! this is also where the movie "forgetting sarah marshall" was filmed :) thanks

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful and relaxing place to stay. We totally enjoyed it all.”
Reviews.Author: thomas_lr
Reviews.Content: This resort is the perfect getaway spot on O'ahu. The facilities are great and the views are gorgeous. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We stayed a few nights in Waikiki at 4*+ hotel but our stay at Turtle Bay Resort was the icing on the cake as far as my wife and I were concerned. We will certainly choose to stay here again the next chance we get to go back! Tips: I would rent a car. The resort fee you will pay covers self parking. I would drive down the road a few miles to experience the Hawaiian charm of the nearby town, Haleiwa.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing views from the resort”
Reviews.Author: tsmack4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon at the Turtle bay resort and we had a great time. All of the staff at the resort we wonderful and we never had any issues. The room was spectacular (446) with great sunset views. We upgraded to the premium ocean front room which has a large lanai with two chairs. We didn't spend alot of time in the room but we found it to be everything that we were expecting and more. Yes, the TV wasn't a flat panel but who needs a TV when you can lay and bed and watch the sunset and the see the stars. We had breakfast every morning in the Palm Terrace and ate dinner there as well, I would highly recommend their garlic fries, if you like garlic. Ola's had awesome food and wasn't terribly priced compared to other places on the island. Hang Ten has some awesome Mai Tais. If you have a car, which I would recommend make sure you stop by Ted's bakery which is only 5 minutes down the road for some good food (Get there early, they run out of certain things around lunch). We went to food land and got a few items which made the trip alot more affordable. Matsumoto's shave ice is also a must, we went 3 times on our trip of only 7 days. We will be going back for sure some day. I strongly recommend going here rather than anywhere else on the island. It is so peaceful and quite, but close enough to everything if you want to go out for a while.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT TROPICAL SPOT”
Reviews.Author: suecrc
Reviews.Content: Totally Romantic and everything at your finger tips..Didn't have to leave for anything. All staff incredible and guest service oriented. Loved it, Loved it, LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Couples Retreat Indeed. Relaxing and Romantic.”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelahs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first saw this hotel in the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" and we knew that was what we wanted for our honeymoon. However, we did a lot of research on all of the Hawaiian islands and looked into a number of hotels before we decided to stay at Turtle Bay for 10 days. It was very important to us to find a resort that offered a beach on the property (not beach access like a lot of the resorts boasted) and private outdoor space. The ocean front Cottages offered us just that at the best rate we could find on all of the Hawaiian Islands. We arrived in Oahu after 26 hours of traveling only to find a cranky driver and room keys that didn't work. The front desk staff was more than helpful and drove us back to our cottage and stayed to make sure we got in and were happy with our room. We were more than thrilled to find the our room and the view was exactly what we had seen online and in the movie. We stayed at Turtle Bay for 10 days and enjoyed every moment of it. The beach, the pool, the drinks, the hiking, it was all perfect. However, we do highly reccomend renting a car. After two days at the resort we were ready to get out and explore. Thankfully they had an enterprise rent-a-car in the hotel lobby. We went to the local Foodland and got some snacks, beer and wine to keep in our room (this saved us a lot of money, though we didn't find the resort prices to be very expensive at all, paying them for 10 days would have added up very quickly). It also allowed us to explore all that Oahu had to offer (avoid Honolulu). We spent one day just driving around the island admiring the scenery. The food at the hotel was great. We only ate at Hang Ten, Ola and Palm Terrace (for breakfast only because it was included in our room rate) but really enjoyed all of them. We loved the omlets at breakfast, shared the short ribs at Ola almost every night and drank sea orchids at Hang Ten almost every day. We also went to a few shrimp trucks and Ted's Bakery a lot. Both are fantastic. The bottom line is that we did our research before we came here, read the reviews (both positive and negitive) and came here anyway. But your experience in Oahu is what you make of it and Turtle Bay puts everything in place for you to have a fantastic, unforgettable time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware what you think you booked”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeet58Australia
Reviews.Content: This is a very special location with a reasonably dated property generally trying hard. Our biggest problem (having booked a BEACH Cottage with a "lavish 4 poster bed") was to be allocated a cottage nothing like the image on the internet site with 2 queen beds, no wet bar, next to the tennis court toilets with great difficulty even seeing the beach! Upon complaining to the "Aloha Manager"(yes, that really was what his name tag said!) the advice was that room type is never guaranteed.!!!???*** There was nothing they could do. 30 minutes later while dining, they had "found" a room and we could now shift into it (on our own at 10.30pm) So, be very, very sure what you have booked! After this problem, the stay was a delight and the restaurants great.. not to mention the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort in Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: Blondie59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 4 nights at the end of August. I was a bit wary because of some negative reviews concerning the rooms & expensive prices but I'm glad I didn't let these opinions deter me from staying here. I researched this resort a lot & booked it about 5 months in advance through Hotel.com when they had a 20% sale on. I was a bit worried about not getting what I asked for because I didn't book it through the resort's own website but I needn't have worried as all the special requests I made with the booking were granted. I booked a deluxe ocean front room (because I read about the standard room lanai's being too small to sit on) on a high floor & requested an early checkin time of 10am. As soon as we arrived at the resort I was very impressed with not only the lovely grounds & location but also with the very friendly staff. Our room was ready when we arrived at 9.45am & we were on the 4th floor in the west wing with a large lanai with a beautiful view overlooking the pool & surfing beach. Other reviewers have said that the rooms especially the bathroom were in need of an update but honestly I didn't find this the case at all. Our bathroom was fine & so was the furniture in our room. So what if the tv isn't a flat screen although I have read that they are gradually puting them in all the rooms. We dined at the Palm Terrace restaurant & Ola's & enjoyed both meals & I didn't think they were that expensive, no more than a nice restaurant back home in Australia charges. We found plenty of things to do while we were there & could have stayed longer as we didn't get to do everything we wanted. We hired a car for 3 of the 4 days through Enterprise so we could explore the rest of the North Shore & surrounds & so we could dine out at other restaurants than those at the resort. We enjoyed swimming at the main beach & got to see the mother monk seal sunning herself on this beach. We also enjoyed relaxing by the wonderful pools & never had a problem getting a sun lounge even though it was peak season. We went for a walk which took us about an hour & a half to the other beaches that are past the cottages & saw some turtles in the shallow waters & also saw the banyan tree where they filmed Lost & also just finished filming the Pirates of the Carribean IV. We also did a 40 minute helicopter flight with Paradise Helicopters which have a helipad at the resort. We flew over Sacred Falls, which you can only see by helicopter, Kualoa Ranch, Kanohoe Bay, Pearl Harbour, Dole Pineapple Plantation & the North Shore Beaches. It was amazing & worth every penny & we got some great photos. The only thing that I would complain about was the wind in this area. I thought that because we were there in the summer months it wouldn't be very windy but there was a constant wind all the time & the first 2 days it rained on & off especially late afternoon. I also found the temperature to be cooler than I expected for the hottest month of the year. It was much cooler than Waikiki & I would expect it would be rather cool in the winter months. So if you want a nice resort in a beautiful location away from all the hussle & bustle of Waikiki do yourself a favour & stay at this resort. Don't let other people's negative reviews put you off. Go ahead & splurge a little bit & book a deluxe room which is well worth the extra dollars & peace of mind. If you are expecting a five star resort then go & stay at the Royal Hawaiian or Moana Surfrider.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this one”
Reviews.Author: JekyllCham
Reviews.Content: It should have been excellent as the views are pretty spectacular and its fantastic location if you are a surfer or golfer, however it is positioned as a luxury resort and I felt as such it was lacking in many areas. The main pluses were the most comfiest bed I've every slept in, the room was nice and spacious, free parking and wifi, and the views spectacular. What it let itself down on was service mostly and restaurant facilities. Pool bar service and staff were petty good, and there was a lovely bar called Ola which was on the beach which had a good atmosphere and reasonably priced bar menu in addition to happy hours. This seemed to be independent though. However for the rest, the Bay Restaurant was lacking in any atmosphere whatsoever and the food there very average and expensive to boot, the 'late night bar' was a joke, the barman in there was not interested in serving past 11 pm except on weekends and wasn't exactly friendly even though we were a big group with a thirst and money to spend, so we find ourselves in each others room at the end of each night desperate for somewhere to socialise which is not ideal. In addition I continually felt ripped off at every opportunity, from breakfast being priced ridiculously high, to the outrageous prices for spa treatments which came plus 18% service charge which goes to fund 'mystery costs' and doesn't even cover staff tips so you are welcome to add even more if you like the service!!!, in addition to costs for things such as using the tennis courts, even though unsurprisingly no one was on them, which really should be included. On the whole I have stayed at many more luxurious places at less cost with more included and better more personable service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Kitten712
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days after 8 in waikiki. We thoughts it would be a nice relaxing "finish" to our trip. We loved the open air reception area and the face that the hotel never felt crowded or busy. The staff seemed friendly but we had difficulty getting ahold of the concierge - she was either not there and/or talking to other guests. We couldnt seems to get the timing right to contact her for services. The hotel was nice but the decor was a bit outdated. For me, there wasnt anything here that really justifed the $300/nigt price tag. (Luckily for us - we booked it through Costco and paid 1/3 less when we combined it with our car rental). The room had a great view but could have used a bit "more"......The lanai was an outright joke. It literally could only fit 1 chair on it. When you are marketing (in large part ) to couples on romantic getaways - you may want to have enough room for both of them on the balconey to watch the sunset. Im just sayin...... ;) It was a typical resort with resort style prices on everything. I agree with another reviewer - skip the restaurants here and go to Teds Bakery! We were there almost every morning and some times lunch too! We took a surf lesson with the hotel resident provider. The waves that afternoon were not that great and they have us the option to wait for them to pick up or to cancel.... as they wanted to give us the best possible experience. We really appreciated this, as most places will let you got and sit for 2 hours without and wave and still charge you for it!! Eventually it picked up and we had an awesome time (thanks Pat!!). The small beach is nice for laying on but there isnt much else to do there. Its a bit too murky/isnt anything to see for snorkeling. So i suggest you head up the cost to Sharks Cove and or the place right across from Foodland where all the diver go - youll see much more here! The pool area is nice and well maintained and it has a small hottub - that was unimaginably HOT!! I couldnt stay in for more than a few minutes...but it was nice to just sit on he side and hang my legs in. I wish it had been positioned better - as you couldnt sit in it and watch the sunset.....which would have been pretty nice. The shorline is not very nice to stroll along as it is covered in lava rock and is rough on the feet. However, we did see quite a few turtles .......some others we spoke to donned some "aquasocks", climbed over the rock and snorkelled with the turtles. They had a business center that you could use for free - which came in handy when we wanted to check in for our flight and print out our boarding passes! They provided you with a "towel card" which allowed you to check out a towel on the beach or at the pool. You just exchange one for the other ...and then get it back when you done. This was nice and convenient. They have a $25/day resort fee - which allows you to check out a snorkel set for and hour each day, park etc. I would have referred it included a bottle of water/day. Overall - it was just okay..... Id recommend checking it out .... but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveAurora_Illinois
Reviews.Content: When we were first looking online at the Turtle Bay resort, we had mix feelings and had decided to try it out. Well we were pleasantly suprised. After checking out a few rooms (HIGHLY RECOMENDED) we were put on the 6th floor on the west wing and it had a fantastic view, very clean, and big enough for 3 adults (my son joined us). The breakfast buffett was wonderful and we enjoyed all the unique fruits that were available. The staff whether at the palm terrace, houskeeping, bell service and front desk were friendly and caring, though we did have the same experience with the cranky pool staff as others have. One big suprise was that the stores on the resort had reasonable prices for their products. If want to have a relaxing time without and enjoy nature and not pay a arm and leg for an above average hotel, this is the place to go. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit...hhmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: sortiz
Reviews.Content: This is my second review and second visit of this hotel. The first time, it was just my husband and myself, but this time we took our preteen daughter and stayed longer. We stayed in a different type of room this time with a Juliette balcony instead of a lanai and I missed having a lanai. The only plus was this view was better than our last because it looked out across the beach and Ola restaurant - breathtaking! Our other view with the lanai was the ocean looking through palm trees and at a wedding below. However, as another guest commented, there was a horrible smell in the room that we could not locate and the a/c was loud so we didn't get much sleep at night. We spent 3 nights there and arrived home today exhausted. Also may have been due to the couple next door that were arguing, slamming doors and throwing things around their room last night at 2 in the morning......The guests on the other side of us thought that it was okay to smoke on the balcony even though there is a non smoking sign clearly posted on the door....HELLO!! The business center staff are wonderful. I had some work to get done and had forgotten to bring an Ethernet cord with me which they were gracious enough to lend me one - (Remember to bring one if you want to access the internet at high speed!) I couldn't have completed my work without it so they saved me! Thank you! We spent a lot of time at the pool because we are locals and don't really need to visit the surrounding areas. This visit was to relax and get away from it - the north shore is perfect for that. I have to agree with another reviewer about the wait staff at the pool. It seemed hard work to get their attention and order food/drinks etc. and paying for it was a very slow process. On 2 separate days, we had to track our waitresses down to settle the bill after they had left it for us. I have left reviews for the other restaurants including Ola, Lei Lei's and 21 Degrees North - all pretty good! Overall, I would have to say that this was a good visit. Yes, it is older furnished and there was an unpleasant smell. For the price of the rooms, people do expect more. However, my main problems were caused by other guests and not by the staff or the hotel. I've noticed that more and more hotels are charging a resort fee now so this is not really a concern for us anymore. The Turtle Bay Resort is worth a stay but be advised that it is older, off the beaten track and there is no nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Spacious, Fun, One of a Kind”
Reviews.Author: Original_SoCalGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. The restaurants are good. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Yes, the bathrooms could use some updating, but they're large, clean and have everything you need. The balcony in the deluxe room is huge. We spent a lot of time on the balcony enjoying the view, the ocean breeze, and the peaceful sounds. The pool area is fantastic with three different pools and two jacuzzis. One pool is 1.5 ft. deep for small children. There is a 4 ft. deep pool with a water slide. The largest pool is 3 feet to 11 feet deep. The pools seem to be just slightly heated so it is not problem getting in. Getting out, is a little painfully cold when it's windy. We ate at the Palm restaurant and it was very good. They have a reasonably priced childrens meal for dinner that includes a drink and dessert. We also ate at Lei Lei's on the golf course which was very good as well. On a couple of early evenings we walked over to the stable to see the horses. They are very friendly, although we were cautious when petting them because they don't know us and we don't know their personality. We never had an issue w/ the horses. One thing I'd like to see at the stables is for the weeds around the corrals to be cleared away. I want to know that the horses are very well cared for and not just a money making attraction for the hotel. You won't be sorry staying at the Turtle Bay Resort. It's an amazing and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Go, Stay, You'll Enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: mpg71
Reviews.Content: This is an above average property. You simply can not beat the views from just about everywhere. The staff is very friendly and helpful....er....almost. For whatever reason, the pool waitress staff is incredibly cranky. It seems like all the servers have been there just a bit too long, and are seriously put out by, well, everything. BUT, everyone else was great. The room choices are a bit confusing on the website, but clear once you get there. For my money, upgrade to the Ocean Front- bigger balcony (or request it). The ocean view rooms are the same size as the Ocean Front, but the views are so much better from Ocean Front. Also, with Ocean Front you fall asleep to the pounding waves. The bigger balcony is great, because more than one person can sit on it. The little balconies are little. Barely one chair can fit. We had friends who stayed in the suites, They were big, but you're not in the room much, at least we weren't, so it seems like a waste to me. We also had friends who got an Ocean Front Cottage. Very nice. Big room. Patio that over-looks the bay. Not really a private beach though, no where to lay out. But, they were very nice. You get more personal service. Better parking, you own concierge. Free day rentals of equipment, etc. Lots of perks. This is an open resort. The beaches, even the pool, can be visited by anyone. So, the beach gets a little crowded. It's also a family resort, so lots of kids. It got a little loud by the pool. (No, I do not have kids. Didn't bother me, just loud) All the restaurants were really good. But, after a while, all the dishes were somewhat similar. There is variety, but if you're staying for a while--rent a car and explore the surrounding area. The snorkeling is just okay. Much of the coral has been killed by bad snorkelers who stand on it and kill it. So, there's not much to see. If you're going, and are going to snorkel, please be mindful of mother nature. Treat the coral, turtles, fish, etc with respect and allow it to regrow. There is a $25 resort fee (per day). Which I'm not a fan of. It seems to include a lot of stuff, but if you don't use it, you're still paying for it. IE - free WiFi (in room only), free coffee (in room), ONE HOUR of free snorkel (but if you go over, they get you for $14), etc. Just know it's charged to you no matter what. I enjoyed my time here - but make sure you explore the rest of the area. Shrimp trucks just outside the property. Shaved ice at Matsumoto Grocery Store in Haleiwa. Jump off the rocks at Waimea Bay, etc. There's lots to do!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: OragneCountyThor
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, expensive restaurants. $10 Mai Tai and $15 Hamburger. The restaurant at the golf course, Lei Leis, has good food. Off Resort eating is limited and about a 15 minute drive. Careful of the Ocean Deluxe rooms as many of these rooms look over a red roof top with no white water view. Stay at the cottages if you can afford to do so. Not really a resort with accessible ocean swimming as most adjacent beaches are rimmed with lava rock or have swift current. The one family beach is small and gets crowded. Excellent service and the staff is very attentive. One issue with my room was resolved immediately and without question.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the cities, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: miss_nt
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a quiet, and away from the city kind of resort, this is the perfect place for you! This resort is consider to be the "country" side of the island. It takes about 1 hour (maybe a little bit more, during busy hours) to go out to the downtown area of Honolulu. There are many nice food places around, by saying that, I don't mean restaurant, but little trucks that sell food, those are delicious! **SNORKELING** I thought snorkeling was a bit disappointing... There are fishes, but nothing CRAZY to see, unless your super lucky. But that's not the worst part, if your really thinking of snorkeling by turtle bay, be careful of the corals, those are sharp and can cut deep. I've read about this hotel, and the review before going, and I was very careful while I was snorkeling, but my friend and I still got cut deeply. And the worst part was, the so call "first-aid" kit they had only had band-aid, and since they don't have any anti-bacterial stuff, they tell you that salt water is good for killing germs. My friends and I went to this resort because we knew there was a beach that was very private, and would be the best for proposal, I actually emailed the management on their website, they didn't reply (prior to going to the hotel). And when we got there, we spoke to a lot of people, still wasn't clarify. We spoke to a really nice lady, I believe her name was christina, and was trying to help us set up for the dinner on the beach, she gave us some numbers to call, and we did. Turns out the person was on vacation, and we try to find christina again, but on our way trying to find christina again, some lady wouldn't let us contact christina, instead she gave us some other numbers. . . And the way she spoke to my friend and I were very unacceptable, I don't work there, don't talk to me as if your my boss. In the end, all the phone number, all the people we spoke to was useless, no one knew anything, and the people we called, called us back after a couple of days. Which was pointless, because it the proposal was done already. We ended up planning it at another location, at another hotel. **The restaurants** I only went to one of the restaurant, I believe the name was Ola, it is basically eating by the beach, and its really beautiful. The food was a bit over priced, and it wasn't super delicious. I ordered drinks with my friend, and she totally forgot my drink, and ask if I want anything... very forgetful, when i told her 2 minute ago. But otherwise, it's a good place to eat, good experience, very romantic. Overall, I'm satisfied with the experience, I really enjoy the location of the hotel, although it is a bit far from the central area of honolulu, but it was a very tropical experience. The rooms were nicely cleaned everyday, and the house keepers are really nice. The furnitures are a bit old, but who care? Look at the damn view!!! I really enjoyed turtle bay, I will probably go back again !

Reviews.Title: “The golf is overrated”
Reviews.Author: b85prose
Reviews.Content: We drove all the way (over an hour) from Wakiki to play golf here and were really disappointed. The course was not very attractive. Despite being on the ocean there were only a couple of holes with ocean views. The greens were not in good shape, very rough and bouncy. We played the Fazio course. There is another course there called the Palmer course. It did not look much better if at all. The resort itself was underwhelming. I'm glad we didn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelbug8074
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at this resort because one of our favorite movies is "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" (admittedly, not the best way to make plans!). We did not do any research until the week before our honeymoon and we got very nervous when we started to see bad reviews on Trip Advisor. I could not be more relieved and happy to tell you that they were totally wrong and we had a wonderful experience! Lodging: We stayed in one of the beach front cottages (again, like in the movie). It was beautiful. The bathroom is large and has a soaking tub big enough for two. Plus, if you like, you can get spa services brought in to enhance the experience. Right after we got settled in, we got a phone call and champagne, with an orchid floating on the ice, was brought to our room to welcome us! Very nice! Food: Room service, while expensive, was prompt and tasty. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast (delicious omelets) at the hotel restaurant and dining at Olas. All around good food experience. However, if you want more authentic experience, leave the resort and head north. On the way, you will pass many shrimp trucks full of delicious, fresh, (sloppy!) treats. Also, we had breakfast at the Hukilau Cafe (kinda hard to find - have a GPS) and it was delicious. Services: My husband golfed and said it was great (but windy). He was especially pleased they let him go out without a foursome so he actually got some alone time, with no need to rush through. I went and had a sea-side massage. While the massage itself was wonderful and relaxing, I was disappointed with the spa amenities. Basically, there is nothing to do before/after your treatment to enhance your spa experience. But, with the beach so close, it does not really matter. Not sure I would have spent a lot of time there anyway. Other: The staff was incredibly helpful and polite throughout our stay. Through the concierge we booked our trip for the Polynesian Cultural Center (I would pass on this) and a helicopter ride. She was great at helping us figure out which packages to book /when to go. The bartenders were open with recommendations for food places and other "off the beaten path" beaches /sites to see. All-in-All a wonderful experience and I know my husband and I will be back (hopefully soon!)

Reviews.Title: “Just Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: msjin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for over a week in Oahu, and spent the last couple of days at Turtle Bay. The resort is truly beautiful and was so much better than Waikiki. The water at Waikiki is murky but the water in the North Shore and Turtle Bay was crystal clear. We had a room in the hotel with a king size bed and it was very pretty. Yes, the bath tub was a little dated with the pain peeling in the corners, but it really was not a problem. The grounds are so beautiful and you feel that you are really getting a sense of true Hawaii. We ate at Ola a couple of times, and the food there was great. We also drove to Ted's Bakery which is not to be missed. It was really nice to be away from the crowds and was a very romantic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap but the cottages are fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Theoneandonlydlr
Reviews.Content: It seems people love or hate this place, we loved it. The Cottages are semi detached bungalows which face onto an area of grass then a rockyish shore of the ocean, we had a beautiful family room with 2 double beds and a seating area, huge bathroom, loads of storage and patio with uninterupted view of the ocean. Soon after we arrived the cottage concierge came to see us with welcome drinks and snacks and free Turtle Bay Tshirts for everyone, she let us know all the relevant information and we had a number to get in contact should be need anything. It was my sons 12th birthday whilst we were there and as treat we decided to book him a seqway tour (thank you Melissa for organising you were great) The maids turn down the beds each night and leave a treat on the pillow. The breakfast here are fantastic but expensive so factor that into the cost of your stay. The pool was never busy and beautifully clean. As part of the room cost we had an hours free court time on the tennis courts but had to pay $8 each to borrow a racquet. Evening meals were average and quite costly so we found it best to eat out most evenings. The pools were never busy and the kids loved the pool side and the arcade room. Oh and yes Turtle really do come to the shore here We spent a couple of days lounging around but Turtle Bay was a wonderful base from which to explore the North Shore of Oahu, away from the concrete jungle of Waikiki and remember you can drive across this island in less than an hour! Downsides, the cost of extras - surf lessons/scuba can be found far cheaper in Haleiwa

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great property!”
Reviews.Author: deneb1300
Reviews.Content: THE place to stay on the north shore of Oahu. Beautiful property on the water. Rooms, maybe just a bit dated, but the whole family agreed we'd go back in a heartbeat. My family had adjoining Deluxe Ocean Front rooms on the top floor (6th floor), but I don't see how any room on the three wings wouldn't have a direct view of the ocean. Very quite, very relaxing, very beautiful - a complete 180 from Waikiki, but only an hour drive away. North shore Oahu has surpassed Maui as the family favorite of the Hawaiian Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Cottage might not be what you think.”
Reviews.Author: kathleen2520
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a beachfront cottage. The service was fantastic. Our concierge, Terry, was the best!
