Overall our stay was great, but we were disappointed that the cottage was not more private. After looking at the website again, I realize it does say there are six units attached. We had a view of the lanai to the right of us and there were many people walking by. While we saw some amazing sunsets and enjoyed breakfast on the lanai, it was not what we had in mind. I would recommend staying in a room rather than a cottage.

Reviews.Title: “We walked in the room and knew we had made the right decision.”
Reviews.Author: boyleston
Reviews.Content: We wanted a resort stay for the end of our Hawaii vacation and opted for a cottage room. It was beautifiul, ocean front with lanai overlooking a grassy area that had a hammock. The service was impeccable and the prices (even room service and the mini-bar) were "resort reasonable." The small refrigerator and coffee maker in the room allowed us to further arrange our meals and snacks the way we wanted. I must admit, on this portion of the trip we didn't do much more than beach-pool-hammock-meal-repeat, but there was plenty to choose from if we had wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but dislike resort fees”
Reviews.Author: jemichigan
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience at the Turtle Bay Resort was positive. The staff is friendly and very responsive to correcting minor problems. The rooms have excellent views and the breakfast and lunch buffets were excellent. Great beach walks. The negatives were the room furniture was a bit worn and the televisions sets should be updated with newer LCDS or Plasma models. I would also like to see the "Resort Fee" ($25.00 daily replaced with a "User Fee"). The vast majority of services offered for this fee were not needed or used by us. (Includes incoming Fax, newspaper, local telephone, 1 hour snorkling equipment, 1 hour tennis time daily, parking and internet.) However, in spite of this I would still recomend the resort to others who wish to stay on the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay has the potential for the ultimate HI experience”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: We visit HI often (our 18th visit) but this was our first visit to Oahu. We spent 2 days in Waikiki and were thrilled to leave the busy city to head to the more remote north shore for a true Hawaiian resort experience. The "bones" of this resort are excellent. Great location, large oceanfront rooms, miles of great beaches in every direction and good restaurants. But I have to say, we considered it somewhat of a missed opportunity. It is a property that has"lost it's luster." My rating should be somewhere in between a 3 and a 4 if TA had that capability. I will add that our experience was in the main hotel and not the cottages or villas (which I've heard are considerably more luxurious). The rooms are very large, freshly painted, clean with comfortable beds. We had a spectacular ocean front location with a large lanai to watch the sunset. The rooms were so large that they seemed empty and stark. Not much in the way of design as there were no pictures or even simple touches to add elegance. Old style TV's had difficulty reading the remote and staying clear. No mini bar but an empty fridge (nice touch) but there were no wine glasses or openers with which to toast the sunset on the lanai. The bathrooms, although clean, are dated and in need of upgrades. Linens and towels are thin, rough and small. Common areas could also use upgrades to add luxury. Hallways had framed posters instead of artwork. The expansive lobby was too bright and not elegant. Landscaping around the property had empty spots and patches of old and tired plantings. Pathways to regularly visited areas (restaurants, shops, elevators, game room, picturesque cliffs) go passed dumpsters and the underbelly of the hotel. Palm Terrace, the breakfast/buffet restaurant offered large quantities and choices of mediocre quality options. Bakery items could very well have come from Costco. If our rate did not include breakfast we would not have visited every day. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. We were pleasantly surprised with the caliber of most of the other restaurants on the property. We had excellent dining experiences at Ola, Lei Lei's and 21 degrees. A complaint is that most dining locations offered similar menu types. Different style restaurants (Japanese, Italian, etc.) would be welcomed when you are a captive audience and there are not many off property options. A desire for only a lite bite at the Bay Club bar offered probably the worst pizza we have ever had and included very poor service. The Front desk staff and especially the concierge could sorely use some additional training. The concierge had not even visited all the restaurants on the resort's property and could offer no menu's or recommendations for local locations off property. Totally useless. Are they only there to sell tours?? The beach is accessible with a friendly/helpful staff. More shade umbrellas would be appreciated. I wish they didn't make their pool towel process like getting a loan from a bank but I will admit that it gets the guests to clean up after themselves. Summertime afforded a good opportunity for learning to surf. The poolside scuba was also a great plus. We did not partake in golf, tennis or horseback riding. And lastly........Management............please, please, please........like most high end resorts around the country and around the world..........convert the entire hotel to NON SMOKING!!! The North Shore of Oahu has so much to offer for those who like to explore. It is a truly lovely location and we had a wonderful week here. Turtle Bay has the potential for being a perfect Hawaiian getaway but unfortunately, in it's current incarnation, it just misses the mark for being considered high end.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelbug
Reviews.Content: We booked on Costco and felt we got a good deal. The hotel was wonderful, staff was nice,and our 12 year old son loved the pool (though it was a bit cold). The fridge in the room saved us tons of money. Just go to town to Ted's Bakery or the grocery store and stock your little fridge with drinks and food. The beach is beautiful though be sure to bring water shoes because it is rocky.

Reviews.Title: “We Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: barnone80
Reviews.Content: We had reserved 2 rooms, one for my husband and I and the other for our 3 college-aged kids. When we checked in at 7 pm, only 1 room was ready so we went out for dinner at Ola's ($180 for 5 people). At 9 pm our other room was ready, but come to find out it had only one bed so they had to roll in a cot (which they said they wouldn't charge us for -- gee, how nice!) The next morning they sent someone to our room to inform me that I could not smoke outside on the balcony. The third day they were able to change us to a smoking-balcony room and we finally got a room for our kids with enough beds to go around, but it cost us an entire 1/2 day to deal with the situation and shuffle everyone around. Because our rooms were not adjoining and there was a lot of back and forth between rooms, we wedged a flip-flop in our door to keep it ajar so we didn't have to constantly get up to open the door. This prompted a visit from Security who informed us we couldn't leave the door ajar "for security reasons" and "for our own protection." We have done this in hotel rooms from Bangkok to NYC with complete safety, so we can only assume that there is some crime wave at TBR which makes it unsafe to even keep your door ajar while inside your room. When I went to the front desk to discuss this with the manager, I was given the same speech that I got from security -- "not allowed...for security reasons." The resort is very lovely, in a great location, and quite picturesque. The rooms are large and clean. But even though TBR is completely dependent on your tourism dollar to stay in business, they behave as if serving you is just a big annoyance. The staff was stunningly inhospitable and had no desire to make us feel welcome or satisfied. For all of our trouble, they didn't so much as comp us a free soda at the pool even after speaking to the manager! As a result of the deplorable service we didn't spend much time there. The local mom & pop shops, however, are very glad to have your business, are very warm and friendly, and not nearly as expensive. The town of Hale'iwa is 10 minutes away with a great selection of restaurants and shops. You can get to Honolulu in 40 minutes and there are plenty of attractions between the resort and downtown. My one last criticism is that there are only 3 washers/dryers for the entire resort, one of which was out of service. I finally had success doing some laundry (after trying for 3 nights) when I made up a sign-up sheet for washer/dryer time. This really helped quell a lot of the hostility of people trying to use the machines. Even still, it took 4 hours to do 3 loads of wash because of the backlog. One great element is the ease of viewing sea turtles in Turtle Bay (on the west side of the hotel.) Thrilling. All in all, Turtle Bay provides a nice place to sleep and a beautiful place to wake up, but other than that I give them a big thumbs down. Unfortunately, it is literally the only place to stay on the north shore except for rental houses. No other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best spot in all of Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTandE
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 wonderful days at Turtle Bay Resort, and decided this is our favorite place among the Hawaiian Island resorts. It's just perfect - relaxing, ginormous property, laid back, casual, friendly, comfortable and down right cozy. When we arrived with 3 teens in tow, we were booked into the 2 bedroom Ilima Suite with another room across the hall for the boys. The view was really disappointing - mainly the roof of the convention area, so we called the front desk. We really expected a delayed response, but within 5 minutes Melissa called right back and moved us to some rooms in the South wing with spectacular views. We had 2 king rooms and 1 junior suite - all were wonderful. The hotel was switching out mattresses for new ones while we were there, so I don't know if the mattress on which my husband and I slept was new or not, but it was so incredibly comfortable. We slept like babies every night. The property is amazing. The swimming beach is fantastic, the pools are wonderful (perfect water temp), and the walking trails are beyond description. We walked for hours daily, and loved every secret beach we found. The place is like something in a dream - just beautiful. The restaurants are very good - and very pricy. We were satisfied with the variety, and did not get bored eating at the hotel every day. We did rent a car one day to go into Haleiwa, and stopped at the famous Ted's. WOW - amazing food!!! Do not miss the pies and bbq! I think one of the best parts of Turtle Bay is the staff. Every single person speaks, and is genuinely eager to make your stay as perfect as possible. When (not if, just book it!) you go, make a point to get to know Thomas at the bag check/valet desk. Our family fell in love with him - what a sweetheart. Melissa and William at the front desk were helpful and accomodating when we switched rooms upon our arrival. In all of our travels, we have never switched rooms, so we weren't sure how the request would be received. They could not have been any nicer or patient. Best bartender on Oahu - Nalu at Lei Lei's - don't miss his blueberry lemon drop! Trina kept our room spotless (did I mention the huge bathrooms?!) and always chatted with our kids - almost took her home to Texas with us! Around the pool and at Hang Ten, Robin and Diane are the girls to find - so happy and sweet. Find these folks and they will enrich your stay! We were never bored. Between the Segway Tours (take water!!!!!), helicopter rides, spa, surfing lessons, snorkeling, lei making class,shopping, swimming, walks along the trails, tennis (these were just the ones we did) there is never a reason to be bored. I chose to veg by the beach and pool, and loved the breeze there on the north shore. The only thing I didn't like was the fitness room. The machines were often out of order, 1 working TV but no remote to be found, rarely any towels, empty drink containers everywhere, and a terrible view. That is the only thing I can complain about - the rest of Turtle Bay Resort is awesome. I hghly recommend Turtle Bay Resort for anyone - it's truly paradise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KellieAnn6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at Turtle Bay in February. It was such a great place: very quiet and relaxing. We stayed in one of the ocean front cottages and had the kindest concierge who took care of all our needs. He even helped me book a private in-room massage- so amazing. The food was great, the pools beautiful, and the view was very nice. We were fortunate to get a daily buffet breakfast with our stay and the buffet was the best breakfast I've ever enjoyed. The pineapple was to-die-for! We would love to come back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JeanineK1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay, not much to really do, and not a great place for kids. Scenery beautiful and all rooms have ocean views, along with views of the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “We learned to surf”
Reviews.Author: colombian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights with another couple. The room was clean and very comfortable. The jacuzzy at sunset is a treat. We learned to surf at this resort, and the people at the surf shop really make an effort for you to learn and get on a wave. I didn't go to the beach at the other side of the resort but it looked good. Overall an amazing place! Make sure you stop at the shrimp van east of the resort and also at the "Kahuku Superette‎" where they have an amazing tuna with rice (ahi poke) on a little bowl, the locals go crazy for that stuff, Im going back just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Bellas_adventures
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for seven nights for the second leg of our honeymoon. Ceck-in was ok, but we had an electronic tag on our booking saying that it was our honeymoon and also mentioned this to the chek-in woman and she did not even say congratulations. We found service in general at this hotel to be barely adequate. My husband also lost his wedding ring on the main beach and we contacted lost and found on the same day and I have also contacted the hotel since we got home but no answer. They have a person that goes around the beach with a metal detector a couple of times a week, so they should haefound it by now, but still we have not heard anything from them. Contrary to what most reviews on here say, the room was really nice, modern and not at all dated. We had a room with a small lanai (balcony) overlooking the main beach and Ola's restaurant which was a really good view. After the maids made up the beds they put Hawaiian music on the radio which was a nice touch. One very bad thing about the room was that the fire alarm didn't work! There was a fire alarm going off on one of the mornings and I only found out as I walked out into the main corridor and heard it there. The alarm had then been going off for a long time and no one had come knocking at the doors either. We evacuated the building and walked around to the main entrance. There were still several people sitting on their balconies as if nothing was wrong. We stood outside waiting until we got bored and walked back into reception where everything seemed to be as normal. Whe asked the check-in personell if it was safe to go back in the building and they told us it was but did not give any more information. We also told them the fire alarm in our room did not work and no one had been knocking on the doors. The did not seemed bothered. The food in the restaurants is good but extremely overpriced. The only ok value is the buffet. The servers in Lei Lei's and in the sports bar are nice, but the servers for the buffet are very rude. I would recommend eating in other local places including the shrimp trucks and breakfast at Ted's bakery is very nice and good value. We only went to the pool area once and it was very nice, clean and lots of spaces and clean towels and free drinking water. We also rented bikes one day and cycled arond the hotel grounds. This is a good way to explore the area and the nature around the hotel is gorgeous. We went on our bikes past the stables, a few beaches, to the WWII bunker and the Lost banyan tree. The surf guy you have to rent the bikes from though is very strange and gave us one price and then when we went to pay put the price up! All in all Turtle Bay is a very nice hotel in an absolutely gorgeous location and there is lots to do and see, but just be aware the prices and the service which is the big minus for this place. I would still like to return here at sometime in the future, I just hope they get more service minded people (ike the staff at Lei Lei's, they are great) and take a reality check with the food prices.

Reviews.Title: “Not one to repeat--but Turtle Bay Resort was so good I had to go back...and discovered the fun of Segway too!”
Reviews.Author: LostIsland
Reviews.Content: In March 2008, we stayed at Turtle Bay Resort for 6 nights in a deluxe oceanfront room which was on the sunset side (#516). We loved it enough to come back for another 6-night stay in December 2009...this time in a Pikake Suite (#331) which was on the sunrise side. I love how close this hotel is to the water. I love how close it is to surf spots where surfing became legendary. I love the beautiful lobby with spectacular views out floor-to-ceiling glass windows. The tranquility and beautiful setting—just a short drive from Honolulu International Airport--certainly match my idea of how a resort can be “true hawai’i”. Most of the food was really good. We dined at Ola’s Restaurant both times. In 2008 we dined at 21 Degrees North. Multiple times we ate lunch at the Palm Terrace...and several times at both Lei Lei’s Bar/Grill and Hang Ten Bar/Grill. In 2008 we mainly hung out at the pool, watched the surfing near the hotel, and drove to the nearby surfing beaches to watch waves/surfers. In 2009 we did the Paradise Helicopters tour of Oahu which was awesome (arranged by the hotel concierge). We also drove down the windward coast to beautiful Kailua Beach and (on another day) to Dole Plantation. On both stays, I spent a significant amount of time on my room balcony. A new discovery for me: the Segway tour! [see “activities” at Turtle Bay Resort website] My husband noticed the “Segway trail rides” sign near the kiosk standing along the main resort road. Having done a Minneapolis riverfront Segway tour, he wanted more of this. I didn’t imagine how fun this would be!!..and how suited it is for scenic Hawaii. We booked the 90-minute off-road trail tour (which includes a 30-minute mandatory training session). Then we headed out with our guide on a route with breathtaking views of secluded beaches, ironwood forests, and historic landmarks. (see my Trip Advisor video) The fun and the scenery were exhilarating! It was so fun that I’ll be searching for more Segway tours on future travels! Info about the segway tours can be found at the turtlebayresort.com website. Click “activities” (at top) and then click “segway tours”. [They also have moped rentals.] More info at [--]

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheCamMan
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights on the North Shore at the Wonderful Turtle Bay Resort. Service was friendly and courteous, rooms were well kept and clean. Yes, the bathrooms really could use a makeover, but they aren't bad. The restaurants were ok, but we found ourselves eating mostly at local places, and grabbing our own stuff at the local grocery stores just a few miles to the east. The location, and the grounds is my favorite thing about this hotel. 5 miles of beautiful shoreline! The hotel is perfectly set on the point, which offers great views from most every room. Lots of activities are available right on the property, from snorkeling and surfing to horseback riding and hiking. Plus the Polynesian Cultural Center is close by as well as Sharks Cove, Jumping Rock, and other fun spots to spend the day. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting. Truly paradise.”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyThe4ofUs
Reviews.Content: I've been searching for the perfect Hawaiian vacation to satisfy the needs of my 6/8 year old boys and my husband who surfs--and think I found it at this hotel. Turtle Bay has the most magnificent setting I've seen for a Hawaiian Hotel. While I love the pools at the Grand Wailea and Kyatt Kauai they feel too removed from the ocean. This hotel sits out on a peninsula with waves crashing all around it. It feels wild and natural. The pool has a fun slide for the kids, but there's also a great swimming beach on one side of the hotel. We stayed in the cottages (sign up as a "preferred hotels" member on their website and you get upgraded one room category), but had to move to a suite after 3 days because the cottages were fully booked. It was worth every penny to be right at the ocean's edge. In fact, I think I would only stay in the cottages. A few downers, like the sheets not staying put on the beds, and it's got a little mustiness to be expected from an oceanfront hotel built in 1973. But any negatives were quickly outweighed by the perfect setting. It was great to finally have a place where my husband could walk out the door and go surfing, and we could watch from the patio. Food was great at "Ola" the beachfront restaurant. This was one of those places where everything was easy. No long mazes to get down to the pool, no overcrowded beach chairs with people saving them at 7:30am. Just pure relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: superkalifragaistic
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Turtle Bay Resort with hubby, kids and extended family. We had a great time and didn't mind that things weren't perfect. It is true that some things are rusty, but this IS Hawaii, which is known for it's tendancy to turn everything metal into rust. I would say that considering how fast things rust here, they do a good job keeping on top of it. We found the room, (Ilima suite, which we shared with family) to be very nice and nicely kept. The beds were comfortable and the views unmatched. Yeah, it is true that the bathrooms are not as updated as the rooms themselves, but it did not bother us. The staff was absolutely wonderful, so nice and always went the extra mile. We found the food to be very good, at all the restaurants. My husband and I also went surfing at the onsite surfing school, and I have to concur that, from my perspective I didn't feel at all safe out there surfing. In fact, I'm surprised that they even let children of any age go out on the water. I consider myself to be in fairly good shape, but I was completely taken aback at how hard surfing was. It looks easy from the shore but I was completely exhausted within 20 minutes of fighting the waves. If you are an excellent specimen, then I say go for the surf lessons, but if you are not in peak condition you will not do well out there and perhaps not enjoy it. I think surf lessons here might be complicated by the fact that the surf is really harsh. Which is great for professional surfers, but not so good for beginners. It is also complicated by the fact that it breaks against rocks and not a beach with makes entry and exit difficult for us newbies. Anyway, I hate to complain about anything, because we had such a wonderful time. My daughter (6 years) LOVED the pony/horse rides and she did them almost every day. It became part of our daily ritual. I also went to Spa Luna and had a facial and it was heavenly, as was the outdoor lounging area for the spa. I highly reccommend it! I'm sure I'm forgetting something, but, really it is paradise and you will have an awesome time. Yes it was expensive, but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay beaches are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Harrde
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVE the North Shore side of Oahu. After fighting the traffic in Honolulu, will NEVER stay on Waikiki. The purpose of our trip was to get away from the Houston rat race and Turtle Bay Resort did the trick! The resort is huge, with lots of room to roam and not have to put up with crowds. The beaches are fabulous! -- amazingly clean, and most of the time we found ourselves walking alone on them...you don't see that very often on Texas beaches! There were quite a few family scenarios with younger kids, but they mostly stayed around the pool and snorkel areas. The staff was always very friendly and courteous and made a point to greet us each time we crossed paths. Our room was huge with an ocean front view and a deluxe balcony. It was very clean and had a small refrigerator and coffee maker. The mattress could have been more comfortable, but we still slept fine. Everything in our room seemed to be fairly new and in good shape. The food and drink at the resort was excellent, but very pricey. My advice to save a buck: find the nearest Foodland and stock the fridge in your room, or eat where the locals go. (Ted's Bakery, a few miles west of the resort, is awesome!) The North Shore does not offer a night life social party atmosphere, so if you are seeking that, stay in Honolulu. BUT, if a calm getaway with opportunity to decompress is what you are looking for, Turtle Bay will do the trick! Our 9-day stay was very pleasant and I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a mess and needs an investor!”
Reviews.Author: strafel
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay here for two nights after we visited the Polynesian Cultural Center. We did not want to drive back to Honolulu after a long day and show. The location of the hotel was beautiful, but everything else was a wreck. The property is old and in major need of being redone. I can't beleive what they are charging for rooms...in the main hotel. It is a dump that is falling appart. You can tell they tried to refurbish by changing the carpet and thats about it. The bathroom floors were dirty and sticky. All the hardware in the room was rusted and old. I would never stay here if you are paying more than $129 a night....stay elsewhere. The prices were also crazy. I just don't understand how they can charge so much and let this place get so run down. My daughter also had a surf lesson with the onsite surf class. After an hour she cut her foot bad on the reef. The staff at the surf school poured peroxide on it and said don't worry it will be fine. They then went to the gross bathroom (take a deep smell when you enter) in the lobby and brought back hard paper towels and masking tape to wrap it up. I could not beleive it....they told me it would heal by tomorrow. I rushed her to the ER and she had a lot of coral stuck in the wound and it required stitches. Our trip was ruined and my daughter could not walk without crutches. After that we left after one day and went back to Honolulu, before heading home.....i would never stay at this place again! The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: SandwedgeonRye
Reviews.Content: The Best: Throughout our five day stay, every staff member we encountered was pleasant and accommodating. We rented from their 'junior suite' category- wonderful view of the bay and of the resort itself. The Mediocre: Parking. The not so good: What's up with the breakfast menu at the golf club? Three entrees? Overall very good experieince.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lnstorm
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a honeymoon, this hotel is the one for anyone wanting to totally relax and have a romantic time. The rooms are very big and ours had an extra area with loads of wardrobe space with an extra sink and fridge and coffee maker. The view we had was of the private beach and this we think is the best side to get as it's cool and quiet. The food was best in the beachside restaurant, and the atmosphere's better here too. All food is expensive in this complex but the location is worth it. Just a tip if you go to the golf hut there is cheaper food here for breakfast and meals. Nightlife is very quiet so don't go here if you want lively bars! Make full use of the facilities that are included in the EXTRA DAILY CHARGE OF 20 DOLLARS. You will be charged this when you leave as it's not included when you book. We didn't know this and missed out on some of the facilities we didn't know we were paying for! This is the only complaint, but as it was our honeymoon and we were then off to san fransisco we didn't really care. Private beach has free snorkles to use. Lovely calm sea as it's guarded by rocks. Loved it. We didn't venture too far. Went to the nearest town to the right as you leave the hotel. Good for picking up stuff from supermarket and also has some restaurants here. all in all it was very relaxing and a real treat. Also, we got a free bottle of champagne on 1st night as it was our honeymoon - great start to our week there. P.S. for us I think 5 days would have been better than 7 as it's quiet and we're young, but the location was so beautiful we just enjoyed the relaxation. Make sure you walk along the beach to watch for the turtles! So cute! This is the bay that you can see from the pool. Oh yes, almost forgot, the cocktails at the pool bar are GREAT! :)

Reviews.Title: “I wanna live there”
Reviews.Author: jmusk
Reviews.Content: After staying there, I will never stay in Waikiki again. The room was not much more expensive than the hotels in Waikiki. Everything about the resort was exceptional. You never have to leave the resort, although Oauhu offers a lot to do if you've never been there. Being on the north shore means you are 45 minutes from everything, but also provided the seclusion that I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: gchappycouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights at the start of our honeymoon.Having never been to hawaii,my partner suggested this place from a movie.We hired a car from the airport and drove to the resort.Check in was pretty quick(10 mins) and we were told our room was ready.It wasnt,it was filthy,dust everywhere,blood smeared in the bathroom,stained chairs.This isnt what I had expected for such an expensive place.We got our room changed and it was still pretty much the same but a better view. The first night we had dinner at the place where breakfast is,and it was something from a nightmare.I ordered something from the menu,they have updated the menu out the back and added extra items,ones im allergic too,but they hadnt gotten around to updating all the menus that customers get.so my meal came out and I couldnt eat it,a great first dinner as husband and wife. The next night I ordered a Hawaiian pizza,and being in Hawaii,and such a expensive placed,you would think that their pizza would be good,It was the worst,most expensive pizza ever!!!!!! There was 6 pieces of pineapple,and it was covered in parmesan. The next night we went to the place next to the gold course,dining with guests we had made friends with,another mistake.I ordered steak,and the waiter decided that he would change my order and add mushrooms and prawns to my dish.So when it came out,I couldnt eat it. The next night I ordered some chicken pieces and chips from the bar,after me asking about them several times,it took 1hr,and they had forgotten about me? The next night,the place is fully booked out and there wasnt anywhere to park,we had been shopping all day and had a car full of items,they told us to park about 1klm away and walk,and that valet parking wasnt available due to no space(there was plenty)The resort fee is a joke as they seriously need a renovation. I wont keep going but there were more bad experiences,the good points are its a great location,huge variety at breakfast and Ethelia is the friendliest housekeeper anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Relaxing, Scenic Locations I've Stayed”
Reviews.Author: RCBaird
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed here in late September 2009. I had decided to limit our stay to the North Shore and avoid all the congestion of Honolulu, so we never did the typical Waikiki Beach/Diamond Head stint. I have no regrets about my choice. We rented a car at the airport in Honolulu and drove to the hotel, arriving after 11pm. The room with two double beds that I had requested was not available that night, but they kindly gave us a lovely suite at no extra cost until our room was ready the next day. While the hotel is not the newest, I thought it was well-maintained, and the view from the oceanfront room could not have been prettier. There's a protected bay in which you can swim, and there are several small pools, one of which has a water slide that my daughter loved. They also have horse stables on the property, and the guided ride along the beach and through a forested area was worth the time and money. The staff were friendly and service was good, with the exception of one woman at breakfast who never returned to your table with more coffee. Once we learned to avoid sitting in her area, we were fine. The breakfast each morning was enjoyable. We ate dinner in the main restaurant several times, and once each at the restaurant on the golf course and the open-air one on the beach, which was especially good (I'd make the trip back just for the flourless warm chocolate cake). When I return to Oahu someday, I'll probably spend at least one night in Honolulu, but I would definitely re-visit Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, That's all I can say!”
Reviews.Author: acadien67
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort because we didn't want to stay in Waikik the whole time we were there, and boy were we happy we did!! First this hotel is awesome! Nice pools right on the edge of the open ocean, with nice hot tubs around. Great view from every room in the hotel, it as all the rooms facing the ocean! You are away from all the tourist in Waikiki, and theres lots of nice place like 10min drive from hotel. Hiking places are just a couple of minutes away. There is a nice secluded kinda beach only like 15minute walk on the shore from the hotel, there we were lucky to see a Turtle coming out the water to rest for a couple hours!!! WOW The hotel staff is nice, specially the lady at the pool bar!!! This hotel makes you feel like a star, bedrooms are spotless!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, the only thing its a little pricy... but how often are you gonna go there!!!! Oh and by the way the snorkeling at the hotel beach is awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: hulablondie
Reviews.Content: Rude front desk, valet, and pool attendants. Staff overwhelmed at full occupancy and let it be known to everyone. Small mediocre rooms, some with great views however. Nothing to do in the evening but eat industrial tasting food. No entertainment, music, or hula!! A ways away from any town or property, Overpriced and generic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, will be special to us forever.”
Reviews.Author: gazcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 9 nights in an ocean front king delux. I was a little concerned about previous reviews as some seem so negative but I'm very glad to say that overall it was a beautiful place to stay. Check in was simple and straight forwards. We had no problems at all. We parked for ourselves in the car park and didn't use the valet parking. Its about 5 minutes walk from the check in desk. I don't honestly know what other reviewers are moaning about - parking was so easy. We always found a space and its no distance to walk. The room: It was spacious and very clean. I am a bit anal about being clean and hate dirty places but I couldn't find anything to moan about which my husband was very glad!! The view from our 4th floor lanai was beautiful if a little spoiled by the ugly roof (why haven't they turfed it??). We avoided this by moving the chairs to face the sunset but as we were on the end of the wing it was easy to not see. But I would imagine if you were nearer the middle of the hotel it may be a problem. The bathroom was spacious and clean and they left gorgeous products from the spa for our complimentry use. Yes, its a little dated but it was all in working order and we had no complaints. I particulary liked the separate dressing room that leads onto the bathroom as this meant we both had lots of room to get ready. Tea and coffee making equipment is in this area too and is complimentry. It also has a fridge which was fab for storing beer/wine/food. The beaches: both were beautiful in their own way and neither were ever crowded despite being open to the public. We saw turtles feeding on Turtle beach and my husband snorkled on the other beach and saw a few fish. The pool: this also was never crowded - which is great when you take account that the hotel has 900 rooms and was nearly full the whole time we were there. We enjoyed the smaller dipping pool with pina colada smoothies the most! There are 3 pools, one big for the serious swimmers, the dip pool and a shallow pool with a slide for kids. There is also two jacuzzi's. There were lots of families with children at the resort but we never felt it was a problem. The food: TB has 5 restaurants. We tried the palm terrace for dinner and it was lovely food and wine, but the atmosphere was dead! No-one talked! There wasn't any music, if it hadn't of been for the excellent company I would have been a little bored! This was our most expensive meal on the resort. We also had breakfast there once. For nearly £50 I'd expect it to be more special. I know american's don't generally 'do' hot tea, but, frankly, it was awful. Yes they had lots of things but it was for example 5 types of bread which took up space and piles of cakes ect. Also they had a bit of a fly problem which was unpleasant. Service was okay but not that great. We didn't bother with 21 Degree's as the menu was so fussy and expensive. Also after our Palm Terrace experience we decided that it was probably better not to bother. Then we thought we would try the Bay Club which is supposed to be a 'sports bar' We thought it would be a little more lively but it wasn't! It was so dark in there we couldn't see our dinner! The food was okay but nothing to wow you with. Everyone had gone by 9.30pm. We had room service breakfast once and it was such bad value that I would not recommend it to anyone. So much cash ($50) for not much in the way of food. However! Don't let that put you off! We ate at Lei Lei's which is the place on the golf course. This place was so much better. The food was lovely and you could tell people were enjoying themselves. The service was excellent. I would recommend this place definately. Our favourite by far was Ola's. Its a beautiful restaurant right on the beach. The staff were all lovely and friendly, and the food was superb. We ate there 3 times and had our last meal there. If you eat anywhere at TB eat at Ola's! So Turtle Bay. Yes its a bit dead at night but hey, we were on our honeymoon so it didn't bother us!! I think it would be quite boring if you went alone or you didn't get on that well with your partner. We used it as a base because we knew lots of places to go to have fun. Make sure you hire a car so you can explore a bit. There are two towns nearby (Halewia and Laie) where you can find entertainment/food at a more reasonable price. For example, do not under any circumstances miss Teds Bakery for breakfast! (try the bacon and egg breakfast sandwich, yum) We went to Sharks cove (across the road from teds) and my husband snorkled with shoals of fish not just 3-4. Also make a trip to Lanikai beach and sunset beach - so beautiful. Its a shame the hotel restaurants let it down a bit and the other niggles like the $25 service charge for 'free' newspapers that are by the lifts not delivered to your room. Also we didn't use their snorkle gear as we had our own so TB basically got $225 for nothing which was annoying. My husband played golf twice and enjoyed himself very much. Both golf courses were immaculate and very beautiful (complete with resident Egrets!) Prices are very reasonable after 2pm if you can stand the heat. Playing at 7am is expensive but worth it as the course is empty. We also made use of the spa and had the couples massage in the cabana (aka shed!) This was expensive but so relaxing after our mammoth flight. If you can afford it, do it! I would recommend TB to others but would also warn them of what we found. Its an old hotel at the end of the day which wouldn't be allowed to be built now. This does compensate for the dips in quality/money spent. We totally enjoyed our time at TB and would stay there again. Its a beautiful place and if you can stay there with the same approach as we had you won't go far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel4me
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in the Resort at Turtle Bay. The resort could use a renovation. The property is beautiful, but the rooms are simple and not luxurious at all. The beds were very uncomfortable. We requested waffle pads but they ran out. Apparently we were not the only ones who found the beds less than desirable. The view from our room was striking! The beaches on the property are awesome. The beaches are all public, so you do not have to be a guest to enjoy them. Privately owned condos are available, however they are not on the beach. Services at Turtle Bay Resort are unreasonably over priced. If you decide to stay at the resort you should know the restaurants are extremely expensive. There are two small towns within a short drive. Haleiwa has several eateries with good, reasonable food. We recommend Haleiwa Joe's. It is a little pricey, but worth it. Laie is the other direction(east) and we recommend Laie Chop Suey. Their food is plentiful, yummy, and inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “A stunning place to wind down and relax”
Reviews.Author: charlett
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews was not sure what to expect. However, we loved the resort and thoroughly enjoyed every minute we stayed there. There is a wonderfully relaxed atmosphere throughout the resort, which is in a stunning location. We splurged for my 40th birthday and stayed 3 nights in one of the beach cottages - definitely worth it. As sson as we walked through the door and saw the view, we knew we had made the right choice. the room was huge with high ceilings and wooden floors and had an old colonial style feel to it. The bathroom was large, bright and airy. Not long after we arrived we were visited by our concierge Terry (the cottages have their own dedicated concierge service), who made us feel very welcome with a guava juice and free resort t-shirts. He took care of my birthday dinner reservation and even had champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries sent to my room on my birthday - they were delicious. Would highly recommend Ola as a place to eat - right on the beach, laid back atmosphere and excellent food - you have got to try the pork nachos. We had booked dinner at 21 North, the fine dining restaurant, but found it a little too formal, so we simply enjoyed a cocktail and headed for Ola again. The pool overlooked the sea and never felt crowded. A great place to enjoy cocktails and snacks. The Palm Terrace restaurant does a great breakfast. Some people have complained the prices are too steep, there is a lack of breakfast choices and nothing to do in the evenings. You cannot expect to stay at a resort like this and not pay high prices. There was adequate breakfast choices and if you go expecting lots of nightlife then book a hotel in Honolulu instead. We loved every minute at this beautiful resort and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful getaway resort”
Reviews.Author: thekld
Reviews.Content: Took my wife and two kids to Oahu for seven nights and wanted to stay a couple of nights out of Honolulu so we picked the Turtle Bay and, on balance, were happy with the choice. POSITIVES: View and Balcony: Spectacular (see my pictures). Very nice, breathtaking, unobstructed views of pool area, palm trees, beach and surf. It was nice because once the kids went down to sleep, my wife and I could sit on the balcony at night, drink a glass of wine and soak in all the night time views of the beach and waves. Staff: We arrived late due to several travel delays and I mentioned to the front desk that it was my anniversary. The next afternoon the hotel had left a bottle of champagne in the room courtesy of the hotel manager. Very nice. In addition, one day we asked the concierge for information about walking trails on the property which turned into an impromptu tour of the entire property aboard on the hotel’s golf carts fully narrated by one of the concierge staff. Fun for the kids and very informative. Jacuzzi: There are a couple of Jacuzzi strategically located around the property. The one away from the pool area and close to the surf was AMAZING!! Loved sitting in the Jacuzzi and watching the huge waves pound the beach. Lobby: Amazing and spacious lobby with great places to sit around and chat/take in the wonderful views of the ocean. NEUTRALS: Location: Excellent getaway location . . out of the way of everything else. Nice beach on the property but for a quiet retreat there are several nice secluded beaches within a 10 minute walk. The only problem is there are not a lot of affordable food choices close to the property so you are stuck with the restaurants on the property which tend to be pricey. Also it is a long drive from the airport, especially after a long flight to get to the hotel. Room: The décor was a little dated and worn. The carpet could use a replacing in the room we were in. The bed was nice as were the linens. The bathroom was acceptable. Pool: Nice with waterslide for the kids but not heated so the pool was VERY cold. Even if they heated it a little it would be great. NEGATIVES: Weather: The wind was howling both days we were there. It is my understanding that it is always windy at the resort. I personally hate wind so it was a big detraction against me going back. Snorkeling: The snorkeling off the beach adjacent to the property was not very interesting. The water was not super clear and tended to be a little rough. Not that it bothered me but it certainly may bother a beginner snorkeler. No free Internet: This is 2010 and my new pet peeve . . wireless Internet should be free somewhere in your hotel or hardwire Internet should be free in your room. SUMMARY: If you are looking for a getaway resort, you probably cant beat this hotel on Oahu. All in all, I would stay here again but pray hard that the wind would die down for the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Miss This Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveldent
Reviews.Content: It has been a few years since we stayed at Turtle Bay. We stayed two years in a row - On our honeymoon and the following year, for our first anniversary. We have wanted badly to return for the last few years but we have been waylaid by family issues. We will get back there as soon as we can!!! It is all about beachfront, beachfront, beachfront. I am all about the beach all the time, especially an isolated beach, which you can access at Turtle Bay's five miles of private beach. In the winter, the crashing of the surf is comforting as well as exhirilating. Plus, why even go to Oahu without seeing all of the famous North Shore beaches? There are no bad rooms at Turtle Bay - They all face an amazing ocean view. When we stayed, the restaurant would pack an incredible picnic lunch, which we carried to an isolated area - Turtles were surfacing just off the beach - awesome. If you are into narrow ,fake, crowded, dirty beaches and smog, spend your time in Waikiki. If you want to enjoy the true beauty of Oahu and the Pacific Ocean, Turtle Bay is the place to stay. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: vallette215
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at this resort. The food is pricey. But everything else was everything I hoped it would be. The North Shore is the place to be on Ohau if you want to get away from the crowds and traffic. Not too far to drive to all of the island's many places to visit. The room was very comfortable. The view was outstanding. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT NOT MUCH GOING ON”
Reviews.Author: Ronny1978
Reviews.Content: After lots of research we decided to go to hawaii on our honeymoon. We decided to split our trip up between the North Shore and Waikiki. The North Shore is worth a visit to see the true Hawaii and see more of the local crowd. As far as Turtle Bay goes, its a pretty dated hotel. When we first arrived we were greeted and upgraded to a suite for the first 2 nights but it seemed older and not as nice as the standard room we stayed in the last night. There is absolutely nothing going on after 10pm, We even asked about leaving the resort to go somewhere else and everyone we asked said everything on the North Shore was closed. The sand is very rough and the beach wasnt crowded at all. All in All it was a nice place to visit just to say I have, but probably wouldnt stay their again. While on the north shore you gotta try the glazed doughnuts at teds bakery and the shrimp truck was great. The Dole plant was neat to see but was kind of boring. We ended up leaving Turtle Bay one day early and going to Waikiki and there was a huge difference. We like being around a lot of hustle and its there for sure. The beach is great and people having fun everywhere. Lots of shopping and resturants to check out. Turtle bay employees were nice and the grounds are awesome just not a happening place to be if you are young.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Lvgerst
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is a great resort, secluded, realxing, chill atmosphere. It is away from the hustle & bustle of downtown Waikiki. There are several activities and amenities at your finger tips. PROS: Service, excellent, attentive staff that was ready to accomodate your every need. Beautiful grounds, location is perfect. Lots to do, several good options for food. Location is only about an hour from Pearl Harbor... so would definitely recommend staying on the North Shore/Turtle Bay over saying in Waikiki. My husband golfed one day and said the course was great and the staff/pro shop was very helpful and on time. CONS: Rooms are not as up to date as some other hotels at the same price point, that said, you do not spend that much time in your room anyway. The space is clean, well kept, bathrooms are huge, ocean views are incredible. Beds, furniture, TVs are a little dated. Overall, a wonderful experience and vacation at Turtle Bay, would definitely recommend to anyone who would like to visit Oahu!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views, Top Class Service. Serenity On Oahu”
Reviews.Author: greatdaneVacaville
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because of the initial value and found so much more. First of all, the manager heard of our unique situation and bent over backwards to accommodate us as well as upgrading us to a beach cottage for an amazing price. I found the staff to be second to none and the resort itself although no the newest one around, was well cared for and very clean. The restaurants are all good and offer quite a variety of choices. We read ahead of time some complaints about the food prices, but to be quite honest we didn't really notice them to be any higher than any other hawaiian resort or mainland resort for that matter. The hotel set us up with a great scuba diving shop down the road in Hale'iwa called Deep Ecology. They are a small shop with great down to earth staff that know their business. Their prices were quite good too. There are also several places to eat and shop in Hale'iwa if you don't want to drive into the crowds and traffic in Honolulu. I can honestly say if Turtle Bay wasn't there, we wouldn't even consider going back to Oahu. There is so much to do at the resort you don't even need to leave. Snorkeling, tennis, golf, and riding horses on the beach to name a few. We noticed that just about all the rooms have some sort of water view, but if you can afford it, I HUGHLY recommend the beach cottages. It is like your own little bungalow on the beach. Trust me, it is well worth it. We read many reviews from Trip Advisor before we booked, and I believe that just about all of them are from people you probably couldn't please in any capacity. Bottom line is if you are considering Oahu, stay at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Introduction to Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: kchriste19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary by spending 10 days in Oahu. We were lucky enough to stay at Turtle Bay Resort. It was incredible! We stayed in a Deluxe Oceanfront King room which meant that the balcony was a bit larger than usual. The room was large and very nice. The two sink areas were very convenient! The staff was courteous and extremely helpful. The package we purchased included daily breakfast which consisted of a full buffet. The food was plentiful and delicious! The pool area was very nice and included a small pool with a tiny waterfall and slide (this one was our favorite!). The beach area was lovely and the free hour of snorkel equipment each day was great! My husband had wonderful surf lessons and rented a board the rest of the week! The resort is a one hour drive from the airport and Waikiki, but we found this to be a godsend instead of a hinderance. We rented a car which allowed us to see the entire island. If you're looking for a quiet Hawaiian vacation, Turtle Bay is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and location, but HUGE disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kat_from_Van
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for one week in October 2009 to celebrate our five year anniversary and my spouse's 40th birthday. We made dinner reservations months in advance at 21 Degrees North and asked for the best table in the house, which I was assured we would get. When we arrived at the restaurant, there were no window seats available, and they wanted to put us in the middle of the restaurant at a table with no view. When I explained to the hostess that we were celebrating a special occasion, and that our reservation was made months in advance, she scoffed and told me that everyone had made advanced reservations and that we would have to wait at the bar if we wanted a table with a view. I seriously doubt anyone else had booked as far in advance as we did. We waited approximately 30 minutes and were each offered a free drink for the inconvenience. I have no complaints about the meal - it was fabulous, although ridiculously overpriced I found the cleanliness of the hotel, especially the rooms, to be unacceptable and sub-standard. The carpet in our room was absolutely filthy! The carpet was not being vacuumed regularly; (although I did ask for it to be, and left a tip for the maid everyday) the bottom of my feet were black from walking on the carpet. I wore my flip flops in the room during our entire stay. I also saw a very large, dead cockroach in the hallway between our room and the room next to ours. It was hours before the roach was finally removed - DISGUSTING! Overall, the resort itself is gorgeous and worth a visit. I doubt I would ever stay there again, but if I did, I would stay in one of their beach cottage suites.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to stay but a bit boring.”
Reviews.Author: jac2028
Reviews.Content: This resort is lovely, it's beautiful with a nice pool and beach. Surfing lessons are really good and the town of Haleiwa is close by.The service and food were excellent and it was a really good stay. Rooms are nice and every one has a beautiful view. The north shore is definitely a good place to spend a couple of days and since there's lots to do on the resort it's a nice place to stay. The free parking was an added bonus and it was nice that the pools don't close until late. That being said this is a bit of a romantic resort- good for couples. But for people looking for fun it's a bit drab. The hotel bars close early and there isn't anything close by that you could walk to instead. The resort food and drinks are a bit overpriced and watchout for the resort fee of $25/day which isn't included in the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfection!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sclwkr
Reviews.Content: my husband and I just returned this past weekend from a week long stay at Turtle Bay resort. We had researched and read up on Turtle bay for a couple months prior to going. I have to agree with one reviewer who asked if the people who sent in negative reviews actually stayed at the same place we did because our stay was perfect from beginning to end. Beginning with the airport ..had rental car arranged and it was a breeze through buget..we upgraded to jeep with removable hard top and it was the best thing we could have done....we had that roof off the entire time..couple times it started to sprinke and it was a hoot and would stop before we could decide whether to put top back on!! We arrived at the resort at about 9pm. Have to admit the drive in the dark and rain when you first leave the airport was alittle intimidating on unfamiliar highway but we made it no problem. Check in was quick and hassle free. We were originally assigned to a room on 2nd floor and we asked to be moved up to higher floor. they were booked for the night but the next day we were moved to the 6th floor. In all honesty if we had to stay on the 2nd floor it would have been ok..view was beautiful looking over the pool to ocean but the view from our 6th floor was AMAZING!!! The room was roomy with king sized bed, desk, couple chairs. Bathroon setup was neat..you walk into outer bathroom with sink and large vanity and huge closet, mini fridge and little cart with the coffee maker and coffee stuff. safe in the closet worked well and was easy to use. Then you walked into ajoining bathroom with another large vanity and sink , toilet and shower. plenty of towels and generous supply of great smelling toiletries everyday. I remember someone wrote review and complained how everything in room had price tag attached and you couldnt even drink coffee without paying. Not true!! You get fresh supply of coffee, tea bags, sweenteners and creamer everyday..there is a little sign on cart that you can purchase their turtle bay mugs for 5.00$ and there is bottled water in room at 3.00 $ a bottle. We purchased the same brand of hawaiian water at the foodland for next to nothing and kept in fridge. I personally loved the bedding and the bed. The open air lobby is amazing!! the carpets in the whole place looked clean and fresh..the entire place is spotless I'm telling you!! There are several different pool options..the large main pool which by the way I rarely saw more than a handful of people in. I think deep end was 11ft. couple little kids pool one with slide even adults could use, and I think at least two hot tubs. tons of lounge chairs and tables and umbrellas. The grounds surrounding the pool had this super soft, cushiony grass. They have these big tiki torches all over and light at night. They also have large spotlights shinning out at certain spots all along the edge of property that borders ocean and at night you can look out to water. I saw a bunch of turtles one day on the side of pool going toward the cottage direction. We ordered drinks from the hang ten bar several times...I really recommend the lava flow..they were consistanly good. This is the one area I was less than thrilled with...they have a couple waitresses who would come around to you and ask if you wanted anything and then deliver it to you and start a tab for you...somedays they'd be real consistant others they'd come to the people right beside you several times without ever acknowledging you. This happened more than once so I actually used this as my meter on whether to spend 10.00 on a drink..if they asked I got one and if they didn't I didn't. My husband golfed a few times and both the courses and he loved both of them. Said the guys were nice and helpful and the experience was what he'd hoped it would be as a golf lover. I went exploring on these days...if you walk in the direction of the cottages and just keep going you'll come to the WWll bunker and on further a bay where they kayak, and you'll see their horse stables and horses. What you won't see?? people!! I swear if you walk and distance on the main resort beach you will soon feel as if you are the only one there!! If you go the direction of the main swimming and snorkling area you find another empty beach unless like me you look up and find yourself staring at a huge seal!!! the last couple days we saw seals here. Oh!! speaking of walking...when my husband had us invest in +90.00 keen waterproof sandals I thought it was alittle much. WRONG!!!! You must have decent water shoes/sandals with that rugged sole for the northshore!!! I can't stress this enough...we would not have been able to see, do, explore half the stuff we did without them. Those rocks in places are like sharp glass!! The tide pools especially...they're everywhere and full of cool fish but again the rocks are like jagged glass. We had kind of avoided Ola's because figured it was too expensive. Then we went for lunch one day and it was the best lunch we'd had!!! You can get a burger for like 9.00 at lunch. I got the fresh fish of the day sandwich and it was 15.00 but got great salad for only 1.00!!!! extra instead of fries and it was the best fish I ever had. Do take note however on one thing...when reading the menu the one side had Entrees listed and the prices were higher than the average lunch type things so we thought that part of the menu was the dinner side...loved it so much went there for supper the same night...different menu !! alot of the things you got at lunch were now way more expensive and the entrees jumped in price..but still remember this my fellow foodies...this food especially the fresh fish is heavenly AND you get a ton of food with the main item all included in the price..I had fresh fish and it came sitting on top of huge pile of all kinds of vegetables including purple sweet potatoes. they don' nickle and dime you for side dishes. The service at lunch and dinner was excellent and the view....you are sitting on the beach staring at the ocean!!!!! I wish we had discovered Ola's earlier in trip. ate at the palm terrace..good shrimp and crab hash for breakfast and the spicy shrimp at dinner while almost too hot was really good, but this place way too expensive and they do nickle and dime you and charge for salad or fries etc.. too many other places to spend less money for more food. We went to Haleiwa town and it was fun. we got out shave ice at Aoki's and it was really good. No reason to stand in the crazy line at the more famous place next door. Teds bakery ..i actually liked their food better than bakery items . food is really good and huge portions!!! Try Fumi's shrimp truck..I got the spicy garlic and hubby got the coconut shrimp. I loved mine but didnt think his was that great . did get the famous sweet corn..it was really good but had no butter on it. wasnt sure if thats how they eat it so we ate plain. Stop at Waimea falls park. This place is beautiful..I felt like we were in Jurassic park. Made it to the falls...life guard there that day so my husband got to swim under the falls. He said it was great..water 30 ft deep!! The famous jumping rock at waimea beach across the street is really neat in a terrifying way...these people would climb and climb to top of this huge rock formation then wait for a good wave and jump!! big sign saying jumping here could cause injury or death made for humorous backdrop to my pics!! we drove all the way to chinaman's hat and that beach is beautiful. we also drove toward Haleiwa town and passed a beach where these MASSIVE sea turtles come ashore to bask in sun...you'll know you're at the right place because traffic suddenly becomes heavy and slow. find a place to park across the street and check it out. You really have to be right beside them to appreciate how huge and beautiful they are. About the wind at the resort..I'd say it ranged from brezzy to blustery but it felt great!! it kept you from ever really feeling hot. You really need to use the sunscreen too...that sun on your skin is Hot at times. I know this is jumping around but I'm still so excited I keep thinking of things so you have perfect vac like us!! for cheap but tasty meal check out the foodland grocery store. one night we bought one of those bbq chickens that they have made up and some pre cut veggies with dip and a couple pieces of Teds pie...they sell at foodland too, and had ourselfs a picnic that was less than 20.00 and we were stuffed and happy. Also, every morning there is a pastry cart up in the front lobby that opens at 6am. once we discovered that, our breakfast dilemma was solved...for 10.00 for the two for us we'd get 4 pastries and two cups of really good, fresh coffee. they also have all kinds of fresh fruit and yogurts and cold sandwiches pretty cheap. this is actually a pretty helpful place if you need to watch your food money. Virginia was always working and was very friendly. Every employee we encountered was kind, helpful and sincere. we were constantly greeted and asked if we needed help. Oh!! another pretty cheap but really good place to eat breakfast was Kono's in Haleiwa town. their bagel concoctions are really good. I tell you people...I literally had a lump in my throat more that once the last two days just thinking about leaving...I can only imagine the person who goes to what can only be described as heaven on earth and complain about a too small bathroom or old carpet must be one sad person indeed. Oh!!! one more thing. our flight out didn't leave till 1030pm. so the desk told us we could stay till 12:30 to check out. so we hung out did stuff , had lunch at Ola's and laid by pool....then we figured we'd head into Waikiki and honolulu. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!! got to the general area of honolulu around 4pm sat . crazy traffic, nothing to look at but ugly , industrial type buildings and lots of run down everything...even with our navigator it was impossible to get anywhere we tried to go....things started to look up when suddenly I saw we were in Chinatown...unless we were in the wrong Chinatown or the wrong side of it , it was two blocks of absolute slum!!! I was shocked by the boarded up windows, graffiti ect. we actually drove to airport 3hrs early rather than deal with this area. just did not feel safe at all. It was actually shocking and I can't imagine that there are people who go to waikiki and honolulu only and probably think they saw the real hawaii. we returned car to buget...even easier than checking in, and explored and ate at airport. lots of shops there actually and a restaurant called Dewars not bad if a little expensive. Hoped this helps all you regular working stiffs out there who will recognize the most wonderful place on earth. mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, If a Bit Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: DonR725
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Oahu where we celebrated an anniversary. We spent three nights at the Kahala Resort near Honolulu, and then two nights at Turtle Bay Resort up on the North Shore. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at Turtle Bay, but not as much as the Kahala. To be fair, we also paid about half the price to stay at Turtle Bay, so I still consider the return on value to be good. I gave the Resort the benefit of the doubt with the four-star review, I would really consider this to be about a three and a half star resort. The resort sits on an absolutely beautiful location on the North Shore, with ocean right outside the doors of the hotel as far as the eyes can see. We enjoyed wandering around the property grounds quite a bit. There are sandy, quiet beaches for swimming and snorkeling, and rocky beaches with bigger waves for surfing. We went on a guided kayaking excursion one morning on property and had an outstanding time. They also had a wonderful, multi-tiered pool complex with plenty of chairs for relaxing. My wife and I thought the view from our fifth floor oceanfront lanai was the best we have ever seen, and we travel quite a bit. So, it seems like Turtle Bay has the outdoor parts of the resort figured out, and they are 5-star all the way. Unfortunately, I felt the indoor parts of the resort need some significant work. Except for the beautiful view from our lanai, our king room was nothing special. The bathrooms are screaming out to be remodeled. They are nowhere near the quality they need to be for a place that wants to be considered a true luxury resort. They reminded me of any motel that you can pull into on any highway anywhere in the mainland. I was very disappointed in the dining offered in this resort. They have you captive on the property and it shows. I can't remember getting worse value for dollar paid on food at any resort in my travels. The dinner buffets, priced at a similar point to the very best buffets at an elite Vegas resort, offered very few food selections, disinterested staff, and poor quality. There isn't a lot to do at night, so I wandered around the shops at the resort some and found them to be quite disappointing as well. An awful lot of touristy junk being sold that you wouldn't find at a true first class type of resort. Be aware as well that you will get hit with the dreaded "resort fee" here. I think it was $25/day or so when we were there. What I got out of that practically was "free parking," so I guess I paid $25/night to park. I think it was also supposed to include a newspaper every morning, (never saw one) fitness center access, maybe an hour of free snorkel rental. So, all in all, I would recommend Turtle Bay, because of its beautiful North Shore location and wonderful outdoor activities, just be on notice that you may be a bit let down when the sun goes down and you have to spend some time indoors in your room and the resort restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views, Seclusion, Pricey Food, & lots & lots of Wind”
Reviews.Author: GnometteJ
Reviews.Content: I now understand why the North Shore of Oahu is the most popular surfing spot in all the world, even during the "mild season" the wind was blowing like crazy creating amazing waves in the ocean. This resort is beautiful, very secluded (which is good and bad as I will soon explain). Staff was very friendly and accomodating, they even comped us a bottle of champagne for our wedding anniversary! Grounds are clean and well maintained. Rooms are also very clean and well maintained. I did feel like they were trying to "sell me something" everywhere I turned though. Upon arrival there was a cute little stuffed octopus on the bed asking to be taken home for the low cost of $20. The seclusion factor was a bit of a problem when we wanted to pay less than $20+ pp for every meal. The nearest town is at least a 20 minute drive. There are great little shrimp trucks fairly close to the resort, but if you want to sit in a restaurant you'll have to drive. Food at the resort was tasty, but like I said, nothing cost under $20 and anything alcoholic to drink is at least $10 for one drink. Overall, we were happy with our stay. The cove next to the hotel is a great place to snorkel and there was tons of trails for hiking and exploring. Not much to do at night though once the sun goes down other than dine and sit on your lanai listening to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawai'i!!”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui two years ago for our honeymoon, so we weren't sure what to expect when we decided to go to Oahu for vacation. Well, let me tell you - it is exactly as said...each island definitely has its own charm! We knew we didn't want to stay in Waikiki/Honolulu. To us, that's not how we like to experience Hawaii. This being said, we knew we wanted to stay in the North Shore. I'm not sure why there's so many negative reviews, but again, having been to Hawaii before, I can honestly say that Turtle Bay was great! If you are more interested in staying in a commercial location, then Waikiki is definitely the place. If you want to experience the country, then definitely stay at the North Shore. It's as simple as that. You are not going to get the Hyatt or Marriott or Westin in the North Shore. Unless you are renting a house, Turtle Bay is the only place to stay and it is worth it! Arriving at HNL airport was easy. We flew a direct flight on Continental and it was a breeze. The plane was absolutely freezing and I felt bad for people who didn't have blankets. I actually have a Snuggie (haha) and brought it with me and it kept me warm on the flight. Baggage Claim was easy and we went outside to wait for the Alamo Rental Car Shuttle Bus. Alama is outside of the airport, but so very close. We were able to get our car in no time. (We used Priceline for the rental car and got a standard size car for $18/day...can't beat that!). We had rented a Jeep on our honeymoon in Maui and knew that we didn't care to do that this time around. FYI, gas in Honolulu is around $3.49/gallon for Regular. Once we got our car, we were off to the North Shore! We pulled up to Turtle Bay and was so impressed that we could see the bay to the left and the hotel lobby to the right...pretty cool! It's really great to see the floor to ceiling windows and the open air lobby. You immediately relax! Check in was great, we were given room 572 (deluxe ocean view room w/king bed). There is a roof that you will be able to see from the balcony, however that did not bother us. The view of the Pacific Ocean is what we cared most about. Besides, you're not looking down when you're on the balcony, you're looking out to the ocean. We walked to the cottages and those look great too! We walked around the property and Turtle Bay keeps it pristine. They do a great job of manicuring the lawns and really keeping the resort clean. We did not see trash anywhere on the grounds of the property at all. We chose to Self Park...there is absolutely no reason to valet park unless you really want to/need to during this time of year. We never had any trouble finding a space to park in at all. Yes, the furniture is dated, but it's Hawaii!! It's not a Ritz Carlton, people. Will you be holing yourself up in the room while you're in Hawaii? We sure didn't. The room was clean, did not smell of mildew, was not musty and the air conditioner worked perfectly. Could they update the furniture and the beds? Yeah, sure. But, it's not anything to ruin a trip to Hawaii. We had absolutely no complaints about the room. The rooms have a safe and a mini-fridge. They also have ample closet space. The free wi-fi worked just fine for us. I used it to get on the internet one night. I have a Macbook, and the free wi-fi was just fine and it was fast for me. It's also a good thing they have free wi-fi because some spots in the resort/room couldn't pick up a service. Once I got on the resort's wi-fi, I was able to use my cell phone. The service was great and the staff greeted us every time they saw us. We were given complimentary champagne upon arrival as well. The elevators were fast and we barely spent any time waiting around for them. Concierge opens at 7am, so that's convenient as well. You will get towel cards at check in and that's the only thing that was iffy. You get one card per guest which equals to one towel per guest. It would be nice to have more than one towel. If you lose your towel card, I believe it's $25 - they explain this to you at check in. We did not eat at any restaurants at the hotel. We learned from our honeymoon in Maui that it is much better to eat the towns next to the resort...much better food and we really like the local flavors. Of course it costs more to eat the resort, but if you want to stay there and eat, you have to understand that you're paying for convenience (unless the food is just absolutely amazing). In Maui, we had the breakfast buffet and we chose to not do that this time around in Oahu. We went into town for breakfast instead (and loved it!). There is a grocery store on the way to Turtle Bay, called Foodland so you can stop there to get things if you need to. The bay part of the resort is great, especially around 4:30/5ish pm. This is when the local surfers come up. The winds picked up and the waves got pretty big (although obviously not as big as they are when it's Winter season from what I've read and been told). My husband and I picked a patch of grass on the resort and watched the surfers catch waves. The cove (beach) part of the resort is great too. As a resort guest, you will have someone there to give you towels and set up your chairs. The little stand at the end is where you rent your snorkel gear. The young men who set up our chairs and gave us our towels were so nice, however the lady working the stand for the snorkel gear was not that nice at all. Oh well. The pool area was nice. Be prepared to jump into some cold water, but once you get in, it definitely feels refreshing. The wait staff at the pool are definitely on top of their game - they do a great job of balancing when to leave you alone and when to ask if you need something. I read in another review that it was too windy to lay by the pool. I completely disagree. It is windy, don't get me wrong, but is the North Shore and anyone who would've done some minor research/reading about the North Shore prior to arriving would know that this is the windy side of the island. The winds were actually nice...provided some breeze from that strong sun. The winds definitely did not ruin any of the time we spent at the pool. Here are some tips: -Golf: if you're doing a twilight tee time, keep in mind that the sun will be down by 7:30pm. There should be enough time to finish, especially since the courses are not crowded at all. The pro shop has good gear, mostly updated and not stuff from years ago. -Mondays in the North Shore: absolutely awesome! Everything is lighter - traffic, restaurants, beaches. Everything starts to pick up on Wednesdays. -Haleiwa Town: we went into town pretty much every day. Such a quaint town, very charming! We ate at Haleiwa Joe's for dinner (decent, will post review), Aoki's Shaved Ice (awesome), Matsumoto Shaved Ice (awesome!), Pizza Bob's (just okay). The town pretty much gets isolated when the sun disappears, so keep that in mind. Not everything stays open until 9 or 10pm. My favorite was Ted's Bakery! The food was great every time we ate here. I even tried Spam and Eggs for breakfast and surprisingly it was good! My husband really liked the omelletes. The chocolate haupia pie was different, but we liked it! Be prepared to eat outside and sometimes share a table. You have to get your drinks first before you order at Ted's and they do take credit cards, not just cash.
