We also ate at Fumi's Kahuku Shrimp truck...loved it! My husband got the garlic butter shrimp and I got the spicy garlic shrimp. Make sure you have cash for the shrimp truck. There is a Pizza Hut and a Mcdonald's if you keep going down Kamehameha in Haleiwa (past the shopping centers). -We also swam with the sharks via North Shore Shark Encounters...and it was AWESOME! They dock at the boat harbor in Haleiwa. I'll be writing a review about this as well. I highly recommend it! We were originally going to go with Hawaii Shark Encounters, but ended up with North Shore Shark and we are so glad we went with them instead!! I can't rave about them enough! -We went to Waikiki for dinner one of the nights and it was easy to get to (left Turtle Bay at 3:30pm) and easy to get out of (headed back to Turtle Bay at around 8:30pm). It takes about an hour to get to Waikiki/Honolulu and you should definitely be careful on the way back when it is dark. Just take it easy and follow the speed limit! Tip: definitely follow the speed limit during the day and night because many people just cross the street, sometimes without looking and also some walk very close to the street because there are no sidewalks (it can be hard to see them) on Kamehameha Hwy to get to their cars from the different beaches all along the highway. -We also went to Hanauma Bay one day and it was absolutely worth the drive! If you leave the North Shore any earlier than 9am, you will definitely get stuck in traffic on the freeways heading to Honolulu (rush hour). We left Turtle Bay at around 9:15 and didn't reach any traffic at all. Hanauma Bay is gorgeous and the snorkeling was great too. While we didn't see an abundant amount of fish (as compared to Molokini in Maui), there are different types that make it worth while. Parking is $1 and it is $7.50/pp to get in. You have to watch a 15 minute video about Hanauma Bay (required) before you can get down to the beach. There are trams that will take you up and down the hill for $1/pp. You can rent snorkle gear and lockers as well. You cannot rent chairs, so make sure you have towels, umbrellas and whatever else you will need. Once we were done with Hanauma Bay, we went East and took pics at the scenic point (you can't miss it, it's breathtaking!). We could've driven back to Turtle Bay this way, up the windward coast, but we had other plans. We heard the windward coast was gorgeous though! Oh and also, Hanauma Bay is closed on Tuesdays. -Waialae Country Club: my husband wanted to stop by on our way back to the North Shore after spending the day at Hanauma Bay. The people in the pro shop are not that friendly, but it was great to look around. We ate at The Counter near Kahala Mall on the way out of Waialae CC and had an awesome burger! I think they may be owned by the same people who own Kua Aina Sandwich in Haleiwa because one of the people who worked at the counter was wearing a Kua Aina shirt. Could just be coincidence though, but we did hear that Kua Aina had great burgers too. -University of Hawaii: We saw the exit coming back from Waialae Country Club and decided to stop in to take a look at the campus. -Waimea Bay: beautiful! You can't rent chairs or snorkle gear. Turtles were in the bay swimming the day we went. You will see people jumping off the rock/cliff and it could be tempting to try. Check out was wonderful too. If you're coming from the mainland (continental United States), then your flight will most likely be a red eye. Our flight wasn't leaving until 7:30pm, so we were able to get late check out (at 12:30pm) and then give our bags to the bellman, who locked them in a closet. We signed up to use a "convenience" room at 2:45pm. We needed to get some stuff out of our bags and the bellman politely opened the closet for us and waited while we got our stuff (clothes, etc.). We were then given a key by the reception to a room on the third floor. I think it was 352 or something like that. It's just a big room with a couch, tv, desk, bathroom, balcony, etc. Basically everything in a room except a bed. Talk about convenience!! We showered and got ready to go to the airport. Because of this convenience, we were able to lay by the pool for the day and we didn't feel rushed at all. We were able to squeeze in every last minute we had left. Overall, my husband and I decided that we definitely did it right by staying at the North Shore/Turtle Bay and then travelling to Waikiki/Honolulu when we wanted. Staying in Honolulu and then travelling to the North Shore would have just been too much, especially with the traffic, plus I don't think day trips to the North Shore will give you much of a taste for what it's like. There are some great beaches all on the way to Turtle Bay (Waimea Bay, Pipeline, Sunset, etc.). If you take the time to read up on what these beaches are made of, you'll have a better understanding of what the North Shore is like for the locals, especially in Winter. Locals come to the North Shore on the weekends and we saw the traffic heading back to Honolulu from the North Shore on a late Sunday afternoon and it was brutal! Anyway, that's it for my review. I hope it helps you and that you enjoy the North Shore!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjlepi11
Reviews.Content: I am at a loss for what to say here...Turtle Bay was EXCELLENT on all levels. Having stayed in Hawaii for two months (work related) in the past, I knew the North Shore was the place to stay in order to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki/Honolulu. If you want to be in "the country" as they say, the North Shore and Turtle Bay can't be beat! The negative reviews here are NOT what you should pay attention to. Yes, EVERY resort will have somebody go through it that has a bad experience. I do not believe this is the norm with this place. From check in to check out, the service was perfect. Everybody had a smile on their face and bent over backwards to please you. We stayed in a room on the fifth floor with a small lanai that was more than enough...we weren't in our room except to sleep anyway! The grounds of the resort are fantastic...lots of trails and beaches to walk around on. Saw lots of sea life: sea turtles, monk seals, and whales. The sunrise is something we saw every day from our lanai...never got tired of that! The only negative is the restaurants are pricey, but that is to be expected. We traveled to the local towns, mainly Haleiwa, to eat most meals, but we did go to the grocery store and stocked our minifridge for breakfast and lunch, which saved a lot of money. I can't recommend Haleiwa enough...lots of good restaurants and shops there...you have to eat at Jameson's By the Sea, it's great! Also, don't miss out on the local shrimp trucks! You are only 45-60 minutes from the south side of the island, which is not bad at all. You will need to get a car anyway to get to the resort from the airport. The north side of the island is simply lovely, all the beaches and towns are perfect. My wife and I will DEFINITELY be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't over think it - just hang loose!”
Reviews.Author: javillane
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I'm shocked at how ticky-tack some people can be while on vacation. This resort is like ANY other resort - perfection to some and less than expected for others. If you are looking for a beautiful setting to go enjoy, unwind, explore and relax then this is it. My family of 5 (2 adults, 2 kids age 8 and 11 and 1 grandmother) had a great time this past week. Yes, the food was expensive and we did some light shopping at the Foodland market near Sunset Beach for snacks and a few drinks, but overall this was a great location. Don't miss dinner at Ola's on the beach. The prices are higher than you would originally think you would want to pay, but well worth it. The Kalua pork nachos appetizer are WONDERFUL. Went back for a quick afternoon snack at Ola's bar on the last day just to get one more shot at those nachos! We originally were put in rooms on the 2nd floor that looked out onto a roof top and had barely any ocean view. The front desk was very helpful in relocating us to other rooms (#249 and #251) when we explained our disappointment with the original rooms. Check in was a breeze, no waiting. Golf and horseback riding was easy to book and reasonably priced for a resort enviornment. Kids had fun at the pool and thoroughly enjoyed snorkeling in the shallow bay as well. There were many different kids of fish to see and they like looking at the fish guide at the beach shack that helped them identify the fish they saw. We even saw a few humuhumunukunukuapua'a (state fish of Hawaii). Having a car to explore the North shore is well worth it. We ate at Fumi's shrimp truck (5 minutes East of hotel) twice. The spicy shrimp and butter/garlic shrimp was fantastic. We also found several fun shops and good restaurants in Haleiwa (about 20 minutes West of the hotel). Breakfast burritos at Kono'a - YUM! Our family enjoys the relaxation and pampering of the resort, but also seeing some of the local small town sites as well. Had a massage in the outdoor oceanside shack. That was relaxing, but loud visitors walking by kind of ruined the moment a few times. Not the fault of the resort necessarily, but it's too bad this shack isn't a bit more isolated. The main walkway around the hotel is right next to the massage shack. My only complaints would be the somewhat crazy food prices (ex: $18 for spaghetti or $7 for a smoothie for the kids at the pool) and the lack of a full length mirror in the rooms. We have traveled to many all inclusive resorts as a family and I would have to say that this vacation was definitely more expensive overall, however, that doesn't mean we enjoyed it any less. If you go prepared to spend a little more while on vacation and don't get hung up on the prices, you will certainly enjoy this location. We'll be back sometime again in the future I'm sure! Thanks Turtle Bay Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: patches2010
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Turtle Bay Resort 1-2 times a year for the past 5+ years for a mini-vacation. It's a great place to relax from the busy city life. When we're there, the entire staff ~ from the parking attendant ~ front desk ~ pool attendants ~ housekeeping, always makes us like we're part of their family. We also enjoyed star gazing by the pool or on our balcony! We'll be back again in September 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Villa was awsome”
Reviews.Author: TSull1763
Reviews.Content: Great location, quite areas, wonderful walking trails. The Villa room was modern and had very high end appliances like Wolf cooktop and microwave and Large Sony Wega flatscreen TV with Bose surround sound system. Private gate access for extra security. Breathtaking views, we saw whale every day we were there. The only downside was all resturants were to the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: onewhocares
Reviews.Content: On a truly spectaular site, Turtle Bay offers spacious rooms and immaculately kept grounds. GREAT golf. Although all rooms have balconies and face the sea, not all balconies are equal. The poetically named "Juliet balcony" has room for Juliet, but not for Romeo! Discuss what kind of balcony your room will have when you make your reservation. Also check for Government, AAA or senior rates; their are some good discounts. The $25/day resort fee includes parking, 1hr per day/guest of snorkeling AND tennis, beach chairs at their private beach and other more prosaic items. The rooms are generous and breezy. The air conditioning is kind of loud. I just opened the patio door and let the trade winds take care of it. The wood furniture is a little worn. Play real hard during the day tho, There is NOTHING to do at night!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place we've ever been”
Reviews.Author: Jules72873
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay was by far the most beautful resort we've ever visited. I'm completely baffled at the negative reviews. I question whether they stayed at the same place as we did. Our room was gorgeous, beautiful paint color, comfortable bed and linens, updated furniture, and the list goes on and on. The bathroom was great and we loved having 2 sinks. I agree the food is pricey but we expected that. We purchased some wine and snacks from the store down the road and kept it in our rooms. That helped cut down the cost. The setting is absolutely breathtaking. My husband and I loved taking 3-4 miles walks every morning as the sun was coming up. I can't think of one negative thing to say about this place. It was as close to perfection as you can get at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Checkmate1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a deluxe seafront room at Turtle Bay Resort. The location was stunning and we loved everything about the resort. Our flight home was cancelled due to the Iceland volcano and although we had originally booked for one week we ended up having to stay for two. The staff were absolutely fantastic to us and could not be any more helpful if they tried. In the end this was more than a holiday for us but an experience we will never forget. We were concerned and stressed as we did not know when we would be able to return to the UK, but we were so touched by the way we were treated and the hotel made us feel like family. In the end we did not want to leave. It is impossible for us to name everyone who was so nice to us but we like to say a big thank you to Fina, Director of Guest Services, Annie in the main restaurant, Julia in Ola's, Lisa in Lei Lei's and all the staff at the front desk and concierge. We can truly say that it was a wonderful and memorable experience and we will certainly be returning as soon as we are able.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: vegas_star
Reviews.Content: Turtle bay is very remote and idylic but don't stay at this hotel. Terrible rooms, dated and falling apart. We moved room but the others were just as bad. Too many kids at this hotel to be a romantic stay. Check in staff were rude. Don't bother booking for any of the restaurants it's first come first served for bookings. We were very disappointed by this, being left to queue for over 20mins for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Mario1986
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly employees. Nice trails to take long walks a long the beach. Kids like the swimming pool and the breakfast buffet was good. Rooms are pretty big, but they need some updating, the same goes for the bathrooms. Could here the noise in the hall and next room. Pillows are so soft that could hardly move my neck the next day. The bedding well they just put a sheet not fitted that when you move around you end up on the bare matress. Its not wat you expect for a pricey hotel like this one. Nice to golf or go horse backing riding. Overall its OK.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite part of the resort is the movie Forgetting Sarah Marshall.”
Reviews.Author: ChristyReyn
Reviews.Content: Heavy sigh. I've never written a remotely negative review of a hotel before, and have always thought that people who gripe about paradise are whiners. That said, Turtle Bay Resort has an amazing setting and disappointing service. The furniture is from Bea Arthur's estate sale, our ocean view room features a sliver of the Pacific, but whatevs, until today (we're current guests) everything had been ok. Our waiter in the "fine dining" restaurant was intoxicated to the point of being unintelligible and I thought that our waitress at the rundown pool bar was going to stab my husband when his plastic cup blew over in the strong winds (it's not like we asked for a free refill, so I'm not sure why she was so livid). But we were stilling hanging in there. This morning we awoke to hordes of screaming, unsupervised elementary school children who are staying here. They were running around, pawing at the buffet, generally acting their age. A hostess at the "lavish buffet" (if you equate fruit flies with lavishness) kept trying to seat people at a table that was at the epicenter of the screaming children. We watched as not one, two, three, four, or five, BUT SIX different parties requested another table, but it was the first one she took people to, anway. It was like something you would see in a Saturday Night Live skit. If I had to share a comment with management (not that we've seen a member of the management team in our four nights here) I would say that it is terribly inconsiderate of the people who have traveled here for their honeymoons/to celebrate retirements/just to relax to turn the resort over to one hundred unaccompanied ten year olds. Service at Ola's, The Bay Club, and Lei Lei's are top notch. This is a three star hotel with a five star setting.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location”
Reviews.Author: phladun
Reviews.Content: We had not initially planned to stay in Oahu more than a few days in Waikiki but extended our stay after driving the north shore road and seeing the spectacular natural beauty of this area. We booked 3 nights at this hotel on Hotwire for $183 per night plus taxes and fees for a total of $209 per night. Although the Hotwire listing did not mention that there was a resort fee (Hotwire usually mentions this), I was expecting one and it turned out to be $25 per night. The resort fee covered the self-parking, use of the safe and the wireless internet. We checked in very early in the day (around 10:30am) so we were not expecting a room to be ready but we were offered one (maybe because we had a baby in tow and the front desk clerk felt sorry for us). We ended up with an oceanview room with two queen beds and when I say oceanview, there was a view and it was spectacular. The room furnishings, carpet and bathroom were fine but probably could use updating in few years but the room itself was fairly spacious. There was a bit of a chemical smell in the bathroom on the first day of our stay. There were two vanities with sinks: one in the bathroom and one outside the bathroom. The dining options at this hotel are overpriced but since you pretty much need a car to get here, it is easy to drive around the area to go to different restaurants. We did go to Ola once for supper and once for lunch and very much enjoyed our meals there. There is a nice swimming beach with great sand for lounging on. As we had a car, we spent most of our time exploring the other beaches and areas of the north shore. There are some trails on the property and we hiked to another beach to the west stopping to take a photo under the banyan tree used to hide from the smoke monster in the Lost television series. The pool area was quite nice and our baby enjoyed the paddling pool. Overall, we were fairly pleased with the room, especially the spectacular view. I was a bit annoyed with the amount of the resort fee but since there are very few accommodation options on the north shore, I guess they feel they can charge whatever they feel like. I particularly feel that it’s ridiculous to pay for parking on a huge property in the middle of nowhere which is probably why they call it a “resort fee” and not a “parking fee”. When we checked out, our bill showed a charge for one day of valet parking but it was quickly reversed when we said we had only self-parked.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing :(”
Reviews.Author: SanMogal
Reviews.Content: Went for out first wedding anniversary. The hotel is very dated and nothing like what it looks. The rooms have only the bare essentials and NOT CLEAN. We had to move out room twice and then finally got upgraded to a suite. The condo owners get a real discount on the hotel rates for guests and such, so I imagine it gets a lot of wear. If you are looking for luxury, then stay at one of the hotels on Waikiki. I wanted to avoid the crowd and came to the North shore, but was not worth the $$$ at all. So sad. The massage was very good at the Spa, the Spa facility is very small, a tiny steam room, and I don't remember a sauna. But it was nice. We had a great time over all, because we made the most of it, and Hawaii is always magical and beautiful no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a relaxing getaway to the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Mannuni
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at Turtle Bay on the advice of a family member who lives in Hawaii and recommended it as a nice alternative to the more bustling Waikiki scene. It certainly fits that bill. It was our first time in Hawaii so we we really didn't know what to expect. The North Shore is a bit sleepy in April, so if it's nightlife you're looking for look elsewhere. We rented a car at the Honolulu airport and drove up to Turtle Bay which only took about an hour of easy driving. Self parking is free. The hotel sits out on a spit of land, almost projecting into the ocean. From what I could see it looked like every room has a balcony and an ocean view. We rented a "Deluxe Ocean View" room which overlooked the main pool area and the coastline beyond, but I don't think any rooms face inland. The room was plenty big, if a little empty of furniture. But who really uses the sofa that some rooms include? The bed was big and comfortable and the balcony had two chairs and a small table which was where we spent most of our in-room time. The bathroom was a little odd, though. Seemed like the renovation skipped that part of the room. Serviceable shower and all, but just didn't match the rest of the room. Had a little fridge which was also nice. Best part was waking up to the sound of the ocean every morning. We were on the sixth floor and it sounded like it was right outside our door (I'm considering that a positive, but some might disagree.) The beach is smaller than I would have expected, but the water is sheltered and makes for nice swimming. I don't think swimming on unprotected beaches is such a hot idea on the North Shore. It's rough surf, even in April. Lounge chairs were freely available to resort guests. There's a bar/restaurant right there on the beach that's excellent. It's called Ola and it was great. The pool is surprisingly small for a hotel this big and we didn't go in. There's also a bar by the pool, but it's more what you'd expect from a hotel pool-bar; good for drinks, but I wouldn't bother eating there. Their fancy restaurant "21 Degrees North" has a nice menu and it's a cool space, but I don't think the food quite measures up. It's close, though. And it's probably the only fine dining option on that side of the island. Good wine list, too. They were offering a five course tasting menu which I ordered because I wanted to try as many different things as possible while I was there. I can't say it was worth $75, but if it had been, say, fifty I'd have been very happy with it. So it comes close. Lastly I highly recommend the Paradise helicopter tour that departs from the hotel grounds. A forty minute tour takes you all the way down the windward coast, over the mountains to Pearl Harbor and back up the central valley. I was worried that I'd be motion sick, but it wasn't a problem. Surprisingly smooth and it's obvious that they know what they're doing. There's a longer tour available, but I can't see what else you'd want to do up there so forty seems about right. So, a big, family-friendly, golf-heavy, self-contained resort for people who want an easy get away vacation. Good but pricey dining options and a very helpful concierge staff round it out. A very different vibe from Waikiki, but I think that's the point.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Darbydog6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic time at the Turtle Bay Resort this past week. Staff is friendly, accommodating and professional. Housekeeping did a wonderful job each day keeping our room neat and clean. The hotel sits on the edge of paradise and is well worth the money. The views are spectacular. During our one week there we share the beach with a seal and turtles and saw a hump back whale from afar. The beaches are private and pristine...and so relaxing. We had several meals at Ola and would highly recommend the food and atmosphere. We used the resort as a jumping off point for other north shore activities. We'll definitely recommend to friends and plan on going back in the future. Maloha Turtle Bay Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2tx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for our first trip to Hawaii last week. If you are interested in Turtle Bay just let the reviews guide you. What Turtle Bay is versus what it is not. Turtle Bay is a remote hotel located on the North Shore of Hawaii. This is a part of Hawaii known for surfing and there are little small towns surrounding the hotel. You will not find any bars or nightlife in this part of Hawaii. The town pretty much shuts down at sunset. There are tons of outside activities around this part of Hawaii. We went hiking, surfing, eating, and shopping. We also stayed in one of the cottages which had an awesome view for us to look at whenever we were in our room. The cottages are also located near one of the hiking trails. I hiked these trails almost daily. Upon exploring you can take the trails to a secluded cove where I was fortunate enough to see endangered sea turtles and they had a nest for a highly endangered mink seal roped off, but I did not get to see the seal until my last day when he finally came up on shore and lounged in the sun. The views are awesome! The room was clean, the fan worked and did not rattle, and the AC cooled the room to 65 each night. The staff was very friendly and met all of our needs. We flew out at 7:30 in the evening and Turtle Bay provided us a courtesy room to come back to the hotel after check out and shower, clean up prior to heading to the airport for free. We did not eat one meal at the resort. Teds Bakery is about 5 miles outside the hotel. We drove to town each night and enjoyed meals which typically cost us from $15-$50 for the both of us. If you are planning on nightlife, partying, hanging out in your room all day/night than this is not the place for you. The rooms are in need of remodeling. But if you are more interested in what happens outside the hotel room than it is hard to find a more attractive stretch of land than Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Family Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: alicia80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Waikiki for our first 6 nights & had a great time at the Ohana East Hotel...Highly recommended. This was our first time to Hawaii - we travel overseas with the family every year so know what to expect for our hard earned money! After lots & lots of shopping & days spent on the busy beach, we were really looking forward to heading to the North Shore for our last 6 nights for some real R&R at Turtle Bay Resort. When we arrived we were hit with a $358 USD bill for "Taxes & Daily Service fees" which were apparently not charged by the resort when we booked & paid 4 months earlier!! Thanks TBR... Was not happy about that little surprise...but the costs didn't stop here! Staff confirmed it was reservations error, not ours, yet we didn't even receive a simple apology or discount or anything!!!! The $25 p/day service fee is a load of crap, it's supposed to cover basic use of facilities like tea/coffee, Wi-Fi, 1hr use of snorkelling equip & tennis courts p/day, parking, gym etc. We booked a Jnr Pikake Suite to accomodate the 4 of us which worked out to be over $330 p/night so we were expecting this to be INLCUDED anyway and to have a QUALITY & LUXURIOUS stay. The room was ok, we were on the 3rd floor with lovely views & secluded from the wind! (It was a shame it was so windy the whole time as it made the beaches & pool cold to swim in). The beaches were not great to swim in anyway as they were so rocky & volcanic with choppy waves. The bathroom was pretty old, would have expected a spa bath instead of the old tiny one we had in our "Suite". Nothing was free in the room, there was a price tag on everything from water, coffee mugs & a stuffed animal they want you to "adopt" for $20 each. The in-house movie channel didn't work either. The resort seemed to be under-staffed most of the time which was annoying - especially considering the place was not even at 1/2 capacity full! The only up-side to TBR is that the food is nice & reasonably priced...although we got sick of tipping all the time as we didnt feel the service was that great and after paying so much to stay here in the first place, it really bugged us! Kids club was another disappointment, the notice on the door said open saturday nights in off-peak season from 5pm-9.30pm so the kids were really looking forward to that...when we enquired about it, we were asked if we wanted to book the kids in at the cost of $85 USD each!!! NO THANKS!!! What a rip off!!! Our 4 & 6 yr old didn't understand & were really upset about that. All in all we wouldn't recommend anyone go there as it isn't worth the money!!! Our Waikiki Hotel was much better, for 1/2 the price so if we ever return, we certainly won't be going back to TBR. On the up-side, the staff were all very friendly (especially the coffee cart lady) and the resort shops were also very reasonable on prices.

Reviews.Title: “rooms very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kleblang
Reviews.Content: The room was disappointing. The bed sheets were scratchy. The bed had no fitted sheet, it was just a sheet layed ontop. Then a feather comforter between to other sheets. (not in a duvet). The sheets were 60% poly. Very Hot. The a/c filter had an inch layer of dust on it. The stuffed animal they want you to purchase was really dirty and didn't even match what was on the picture next to the info sales letter. They could of used a flat screen tv, but thats not a big deal. Just very disappointed in the quality. The view, spa service, golf, and horseback riding was great. Just would think twice about staying there again. Recommend eatting at local places. We loved Ted's Bakery in the morning. Embassy Suites in Waikiki was awsome! Loves the rooms, bed, breakfast, happy hour, service. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: SheriS4
Reviews.Content: this hotel was awesome, very relaxing they took care of us as if we were their own family. Great time will go back (soon I hope)

Reviews.Title: “Week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Qbncrzr
Reviews.Content: This idyllic location on the North Shore of Oahu is set far away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu and Waikiki. The property has everything you would want to do: sunning on deserted beaches, snorkeling in a protected lagoon, golf & tennis, and great service. The only thing that we felt could be improved on was the lack of entertainment in the evenings. Also, choose your room carefully as some of the ocean front rooms can get rather noisy from the waves crashing on the rocky point.

Reviews.Title: “What hotel were you in?”
Reviews.Author: rootednomadic
Reviews.Content: I read every negative review on this site and I was very worried about the kind of place we decided to stay in for our first trip to Hawaii. After staying for a week the only question I have is " what were they talking about?". We booked an oceanfront premium room and that exactly what we got. The view from our balcony was breathtaking. The room was spacious and clean and the staff was AMAZING. EVERYONE on staff was amazing. I've NEVER met a friendlier staff more eager to do anything we asked for. It went beyond just saying "hello" in the hallway. They asked how our day was, they gave suggestions for places to go and things to do on the island, and then asked us how we liked it after we did it. If we needed extra towels or pillows, we got them. Menus for the hotel restaurants, no problem. Reservations to area events, we got it, no worries. Maids, bellmen, front desk, waitresses, valets, all the same. I've stayed in Hiltons and Marriots where I didn't get this kind of attention. At the risk of naming names, Trina and Tess YOU ROCK!!! The food was expensive but ,unless you went to Honolulu for McDonalds or Jack in the Box, food was expensive everywhere on the island. I mean if you spend that much money to be in Hawaii, you shouldn't be expecting the $5.99 Buffet at Sizzler (and there was a Sizzler in Honolulu!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!). The fact that the hotel is on the North Shore made it even better. We spent a day in Waikiki, and it was incredibly conjested and noisy. It had lots of high rise hotels and expensive shops, and very little privacy. There were at most five or six people on the beach with us on the north shore, despite it being a public beach. At night, we had the beach to ourselves which made for romantic sunset walks and together time. For people thinking about staying here, don't read the negative reviews. and do it. Trust me, you'll thank me. Mahalo Turtle Bay. Hope to see you very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: babyknewport
Reviews.Content: We returned from Turtle Bay a week ago. We didn't really know what to expect, and we were happily surprised. The grounds surrounding the hotel are beautiful. You feel you are in Hawaii. You are not on a strip of sand with 20 hotels plunked down - if you like that feel, you may not like this. This feels more remote. The property has many interesting features. There is a bay for swimming and snorkeling, a surf break for surfers, a beach with tide pools for exploring, horse back riding, golf, tennis, jogging paths, pools, etc...I liked the large size of the grounds. It felt relaxed. The restaurants were all very good and the service was good, as well. We ate in the hotel for breakfast each morning. Usually we ate out for lunch after a snorkeling trip or surf trip in Haliewa. Teds Bakery was delicious and the bakery in Haliewa had great sandwiches, smoothies, acai bowls, etc...We ate several times at Ola on the beach at the hotel for dinner. Fresh fish and happy kids - what could be better? This trip we stayed in the hotel and had an ocean view room on the fourth floor. We had a good deal on the room and were content with it. the balcony had great views. The rooms look like they have had some minimal updating but the bathrooms really need a little TLC. The florescent lights kind of bugged me, but i didn't hang out in the bathroom too much! My husband said they should get flat screens - the old tvs really date the rooms. Our room connected to the kids, so we had our privacy, too. I think next time we will investigate the beach cottages or villas. they look wonderful! The hotel structure has a bit of a "conference hotel" feel in the lobby and some of the public spaces. We usually stay at the Mauna Kea on the big island, and if you have been there, you know that the lobby is beautiful and truly hawaiian in design and feel. this does not feel like that...this is open, but feels like it was made to house large groups of people. One thing my husband and i did see on our daily runs (out by the horse stables) were 2 big green dumpsters with garbage overflowing. this really irked me and i was hoping someone would clean it up, but nothing! it isn't a big deal, but it bummed me out every time jogged by. The north shore is wonderful. we will definitely return to Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort- Nice for a few days on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: PuffySummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay resort for the first 6 nights of our spring break vacation (March 24-30, 2010). Overall the resort was nice and we would stay there again, but for fewer nights. If you are planning to stay on the North Shore, it is a good option. It was VERY windy when we were there which made it almost impossible to hang out by the pool for a good part of our stay. However, because Turtle Bay has so much property, we were able to walk to a beach that wasn't so windy. Even though it was spring break and the resort was full, it never felt crowded. This resort is very large and has plenty of space. Resort Grounds- Excellent. Beautiful. Very clean. Vast shoreline with many beaches and coves to explore and enjoy. The pool was large and cleaned frequently. The pool area was very nice. We never had trouble finding a parking space, but did have to walk quite a distance. Room- Just ok. Clean. Ample space for 2 adults and 1 child. 2 queen beds need to be replaced. Decor needs to be updated. Large balcony with a great view of the pool and ocean. Descent sized mini-fridge. Free Wi-fi in the room. You get what you pay for.....priced appropriately. Next time, we will splurge and stay in one of the ocean front cottages. Food- a bit pricy, but typical for Hawaii. Recommend going to the grocery store down the road (10 minutes by car) for snacks, beer, water etc. We ventured out of the resort often and ate breakfast several mornings at Shark Cove on the north shore. It would be nice if the resorts in Hawaii had coffee available in the lobby for the guests who haven't adjusted to the time change. We were up very early every day (typically between 3 and 4am Hawaii time) and couldn't get a cup of coffee until 6am. Overall impression: Beautiful property. Ok rooms. Food a bit pricy. Excellent location. Priced appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the TBR Team”
Reviews.Author: kenrosela
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Hawaii with my wife and 2 children April 1 and proceeded to one of the most beautiful places on earth, Turtle Bay Resort (TBR) north shore Oahu Hawaii. The good new was, we were in Hawaii. The bad new was, I contracted a bacteria infection before we arrived that manifested itself Easter Sunday. I went to church with my family and came back to the hotel to rest. Within a few hours I had a raging fever and tried to fight it off. To make a long story short, I was restricted to the room for the better part of a week, no sun, no water, no golf and no drinks. The 4 reasons I went there were gone. The hotel staff took care of me like I was family. They brought my wife food to go from the buffet, they changed my bed several times a day. They made special arrangements for me to fly in a bulkhead seat home to LA and worked like crazy to make this horrible situation pleasant. Christina who works for the Sales Director Mike Wilkins went out of her way to help me and my family. If I ever get sick again I might just jump on a plane and fly to Turtle Bay to be with my family there. THANKS to everyone on the staff of Turtle Bay. Mahalo and Aloha you taught me what they both mean. Ken Rose Krose@afmla.com

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: LLeone1985
Reviews.Content: My mom and I vacationed at Turtle Bay Resort as a girls getaway last February. We absolutely loved it here! We stayed in a beach cottage and it was so worth the price. Every morning my mom was up and on the patio well before sunrise listening to the waves and drinking her coffee. Doesn’t face the sunrise but the view was still amazing as the sun came out. The staff there was amazing. Immediately upon checking in we had icy fruit drinks delivered to our room along with t-shirts and fresh fruit. The fruit was replenished daily, and it was absolutely delicious. The main breakfast restaurant staff was great. By the second day they already recognized us and knew our drink orders. Everyone was very helpful, pointing us in the right direction for wherever we needed to go. Staying in the cottage was wonderful. The room was beyond beautiful, and it was very nicely located. Outside the cottages there were many open hammocks just waiting for you to lay in. All were situated to overlook the beautiful beach. The beach coming directly up to the room was not ideal for anything other than looking at, was difficult to get to and the waves were a bit aggressive, but other than that it was ideal. The walk to the calmer beach was very short and scenic. Everything you could possibly look at at the resort was absolutely breathtaking. One of the reasons we chose this resort was that it was away from Waikiki. We wanted a quiet and peaceful vacation, and Turtle Bay certainly delivered. There were very few children at the resort, and not once did we encounter a loud group to interrupt our serenity. The room was immaculate. Everything was cleaned twice daily, and the bathroom looked as if it had never been used. The tub was so big you could swim in it. Beds were comfortable, we both have tempurpedic mattresses and pillows at home, so they took a little bit of getting used to, but overall we both got great nights sleep. The food was delicious. We were both a little skeptical, since neither of us traditionally like hawaiian food, but everything was very tasty. Plus they have ‘normal’ menu options for when we weren’t feel adventurous. We also took advantage of their spa. We enjoyed a couples massage on the beach. It was wonderful. Listening to the natural waves while enjoying a massage. It really doesn't get much better than that. The entire experience was one of the best we’ve ever had. We both can’t wait until our next visit to Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Diming at it's finest.”
Reviews.Author: mycocaine
Reviews.Content: From the get go, we were pleased with the area that the resort is located in. A beautiful bay, the North Shore, shopping nearby, grocery store, etc. The staff was polite and very responsive to our requests, needs, and desires. The hotel itself is where I have the problem. We entered our room and found a stuffed fish on the bed. Previous vacations had something like that as well as a thank-you for staying with us or something that would remind us of where we had been. Not this fish. It had a nice $20 price tag on it and a "adopt me" blurb. If this money were going to the WWF or a local Environmental group I would think that this would be alright, but as far as I know, the hotel just wanted to make some money. If I had 2 kids or more, I would have been out a bit of money. It continued in the room, "The first cup of coffee is on us, if you would like more, it will be billed to your room. Please feel free to take the mugs, it will be billed to you room." I'm surprised that there wasn't a sticker on everything in the room and where I could buy it online. The room itself, 4th or 5th floor facing west if I recall. Pale green like this website colour. The furniture was from the 1980's or earlier and had a used rustic look. For $250+ a night, you would think that they could maybe spruce up the place. I've paid less and had much more. More pillows, newer furniture (nicer furniture that wasn't purchased at my parent's garage sale), flat screen TV's on the wall, and complimentary items like slippers, bathrobes, bottles of water, plates of cookies or fruit. Not here. So what does this money get you. Apparently I could have made use of the tennis courts, had free internet, received a newspaper daily, etc. etc. etc. According to the hotel many guests previous to me asked for such items and paid a small fee for them. So now the hotel just included it in the price of the room. Thanks, but no thank-you. I would like that Tennis court money back please. If everybody decided to go and play tennis, TB Resort would have to either build more courts, or make it a 36 hour day some how. Not once did I receive a newspaper at my door. As for the internet. That should just be standard and not an add on price. It helped plan our outings. My next little pet peeve is the parking lot. A little bit of a walk, but nothing I can't handle. It just seemed that the lot was always full and I had to park a long way away. They had sections blocked off for this and that. Thank-you's go out to the person who invented rolling luggage. If I had a problem I could have paid for Valet service. But this would just be more money that really wouldn't make my life any easier. Instead I was fighting for parking with people who just came to use the beach areas. Food is not included. Continental breakfast would have been nice. My fiancee told me that there was a coffee and breakfast place in the lobby. Looked to her that is was complimentary, but the cashier was around the corner hiding from view. That is what I heard, I did not really investigate, I have nothing to say about it. But the buffet restaurant is decent. Grab yourself the $15 mini all you can eat buffet. If you want an omelet or waffles, I don't think it is really worth the extra $5. I can stay at a Howard Johnson and get those for nothing. There was lots of fresh fruits, breads, cereal, yogurt. Good start to the day, but after doing this once, I was happy with my Egg McMuffin combo for $5.99. Once, we went to the restaurant down by the Tennis courts, via hotel Golf Cart shuttle. Nice little restaurant, good food, prices... a little steep for the shrimp considering I drove by the shrimp farm the previous day. But still good. 4.5/5 for atmosphere and quality of food and drink. The staff was very nice as well. The small bar restaurant in the hotel was quite noisy and the food is typical pub fare style all battered. Nothing surprising here. I love to play golf, wish I had, but I didn't care for it. Instead we walked about 20 minutes west of Turtle Bay to the next bay (Protection Bay???) past the WWII bunker and enjoyed swimming, seeing turtles, and conversing with other couples. Recommend people visit this beach as it is quiet, protected from the rough surf, and you are bound to see green sea-turtles. Pack the sunscreen. So, would I recommend this hotel? I don't think so. There has to be something that gives more bang for the buck around there. As for my complaints, I guess I'm just comparing this place to hotels and services that I have come to expect. This place just wants your money and more when you get there. Nice location on island for sunsets, but that is about it. P.S. be weary of the shampoo and conditioner, my girlfriend had an allergic reaction to it. And the shark cage swimming on the north shore, recommend, pretty neat experience. That is my 2 cents worth, and no, Turtle Bay, you cannot have them.

Reviews.Title: “Away from it all and wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Norcalfamily2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the TB resort because we couldn't get rooms at the Grand Wailea, Maui for the first 3 days of our trip. Now that we are home and I reflect on our trip, we should have spent the 3 days at the GW and the rest of the trip at TB. Why? Simple, if traveling during a holiday period, Easter break for us, one resort took care of its guests and the other made you regret that you were there. TB was sold out while we were there and there were plenty of chairs available at the pools, you got waited on by friendly, helpful staff at the pool area, where the drinks and smoothies were great, and there weren't people everywhere. It was relaxing and enjoyable, not overpriced, just a great value, and beautiful location. Lots of activities for the kids. Definitely a place we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: britzone86
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort was one of the most relaxing places I have ever stayed. The staff was very attentive, and they couldn't have been nicer. Our room was spacious, affordable, and had great views. The restaurants on site were delicious and comfortable. Ola was relaxing being right on the beach, you can have your feet in the sand while you eat. It was such a treat. The Hang Ten bar was our favorite "hang" place (no pun intended). The bartender could not have been better. He was so nice and and made you feel like you were apart of the turtle bay family. We couldn't have asked for a better visit to Hawaii and the turtle bay. The beach and pool were amazing. Being able to hear the ocean waves while you are laying out at the pool or sitting at the bar with a drink in your hand was the biggest gift ever. It was so unbelievably tranquil. Stay at the Turtle Bay Resort it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great and staff even better.”
Reviews.Author: Montaukbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I originally booked a hotel in Waikiki for our 20th wedding anniversery. Shortly afterwards I changed my mind, in part, because of some of the reviews I read here. As such, I feel somewhat obligated to share my experience at the Turtle Bay Resort. First thing that struck me was the location of the hotel. The main building is set out upon a point of land that juts into the Pacific and is surrounded on both sides by beautiful coves. The resort is peaceful and dare I say, serene. The grounds are very well kept with no litter at all to be found. Most importantly the staff were extremely courteous and quick to respond to any request. Our room was very clean and surprisingly quiet. Even with adjoining rooms occupied we never heard a sound other than the ocean waves crashing onto the beach at night. On our first night there we ate at the Bay club which is your typical hotel bar and grill with simple menu. I had a Kobe beef burger ($17) and my wife had Chicken Ceasar salad. Both dishes were good. Another night we ate ate the hotel beach side restaurant, Ola. We both had steak dishes ($34) which were prepared by the head chef and not line cooks. The steaks were done to perfection and served with the greens of the day. Meal was worth every penny. The only meals that I found to be rather expensive would be breakfast. If you like to eat well first thing in the morning then I would suggest signing on for their meal plan. For those who just need a little something, there is a coffe bar that is set up in the lobby which has coffee, tea, muffins and such. Overall the food pricing seemed within reason when considering that this is an island resort. The hotel has ample ammenities and several small shops that are in line with any establishment that bills itself as a resort. There are several miles of hiking trails that follow the coast line and reward you with gorgeous views. There are horses available at the hotel stable for rides along the beach as well. There are plenty of sitting areas along paved walking paths around the hotel itself where one can watch surfers and the setting sun. We ventured to Waikiki twice during the week we were on the island and we are so glad we didnt have accomodations there. As we are from NYC, Waikiki seemed to us like 5th avenue on a beach. Turtle bay was exactly what we were looking for - quiet, low key with subdued elegance. Be aware that the resort is located on the north shore of Oahu and far away from any night life and shopping centers. A car is a must. Make a left coming outside of the hotel grounds and after a short drive you will find some fruit stands and the famous Kahuku shrimp trucks that serve plate lunches. Make a right and you will drive past sunset beach and the legendary Banzai Pipeline surfing area. The hotel location can't be beat in my opinion. Okay, now for the negatives. Parking can be difficult as finding an open space can be hard at times. If one can't be found then valet service is available for an additional $10 fee plus tip of course. The bed matresses could be better. After reflecting on our stay there last week ( Mar 27 - Apr 4) the only other knock against the hotel would be the lack of some more cable TV channels. My wife and can't honestly think of any other negative issues worth mentioning. I know, cable TV channels, really. If you are looking for a relaxing place to stay and be away from the hustle and bustle of urban life then you should strongly consider the Turtle Bay Resort. We would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, serene”
Reviews.Author: livinlg
Reviews.Content: Wow is all I can say. This place is just gorgeous! Set on the northend corner, this resort is right on the beach and all by itself. Tons of golf, tennis, swimming, hiking, horseback riding, spa...whatever you need. perfect honeymoon spot. They have yoga classes in the morning and the spa is fantastic. Enjoy a steam before your service. I got a reflexology massage after running (shinsplints) and James is the man! The service was outside on the Lanai overlooking the ocean. Very relaxing. 12miles of running, hiking trails (maps in lobby), wonderful restaurants, tons of activities for kids, pool with waterslide, watched a cooking demonstration from one of the chefs. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Truly gorgeous location!”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyMonkBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last June as the first part of our honeymoon in Hawaii. The location is just lovely! I think the north shore of Oahu is amazing in general. We hired a car and drove a lot along the coast, stopping at lovely beaches, it felt really 'Hawaiian' if that makes sense! The hotel itself was great, the room had a nice balcony with a lovely view. We ate at the poolside bar a few times and loved the burgers!! We saw a turtle swimming around the rocks just below where the pool is. And if you walk down the beach (past where the stables are), keep going you come to this quite secluded cove. In that cove were loads of turtles, i tried to go in the water and snorkle with them but it was very cloudy, it might not always be this way though so worth a look. We only stayed here for 4 nights as i thought that the other islands like Maui and Kauai would be the better ones to spend more time on.. however i really fell in love with Oahu. We also visited Waikiki and this was great fun. Everyone had said not to go there, too commercial etc but it was great for a day out. We also went to Pearl Harbour, which was very interesting. If you stay at this hotel or anywhere in Hawaii in general you just can't fail to be happy, its beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaSoonergrl
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights in Honolulu, Turtle Bay was a peaceful escape from the traffic and noise. The bellhops greeted us immediately and were happy to help us. The first thing I did was open the balcony door to enjoy the view overlooking the reef and beach. The room was large and very clean. It was very quiet in our room even though we discovered later that their were other occupants in several rooms around us. The bathroom had two separate areas and each had it's own sink and vanity. There was also a large closet. The only complaint I really have is the mattress wasn't that comfortable and if you sat on the end of the bed it would rise up at the head. I think they need to update the mattresses. Overall we had an awesome stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway...”
Reviews.Author: nyu05
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is beautiful, huge and romantic. The one and only thing I had complaints about were the exorbitant prices but I think that's the case for most of Hawaii (at least the touristy areas). We loved the restaurants, had a great time hanging out by the pool and the beach and enjoyed everything about it. The rooms were beautiful and clean, the bed comfy. All in all a perfect relaxing vacation. If you want to avoid paying the crazy prices for the restaurants, head over to Waimea. You'll find some really great places with decent prices and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but WAY overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: poiuytrewq73
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon and decided to splurge and book one of the beach cottages (about $400 a night). After an hour drive from the airport we arrived and checked in. We dragged all of our luggage around, attempting to locate the cottages, as no one offered or was available to help. When we found our room it was nice except it had two full beds instead of a king which we had booked months in advance. When we inquired at the front desk about the room, we were told by a surly gentleman that there was no king rooms available and there was nothing that could be done. We were told when booking a room there is never a guarantee. We are a very laid back but when we spend $1700 for 4 nights it would have been nice to at least be treated well while trying to solve the issue. Besides having to sleep in separate beds, the grounds are quite beautiful and the location is great. For a 4 star resort it is rather run down. EVERYTHING is pricey here. Food, drinks...($12 ceaser salad $10-$12 cocktails. If you stay make sure you have a large buget!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to escape!”
Reviews.Author: starrygirlb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 10 year anniversary. We stayed 6 days and had a wonderful time. I am already missing this place like crazy! The check-in process was fast and easy. There was no line at all. In the 6 days we were here I only once saw a line at the counter and it was not much of a line, only 3 people long. The resort seemed to be very well staffed. We originally booked a premium oceanview room but after the first night decided to upgrade (For an additional $150 per night) to the beachfront cottage. Very glad we did!! The first room was perfectly fine and comfortable. It was clean and spacious enough. The view was pretty and of the ocean. We just felt it was a little bit on the standard side and were wanting a little more romance and luxury which we found with the cottage. The cottage was amazing. Hard wood floors, high ceilings with ceiling fan, one whole wall was a sliding glass door that looked out to our own private patio. Just beyond our patio was a very relaxing hammock (which I took a 3 hour nap in one afternoon!). The cottage bathroom was very nice. Marble floors and shower. Very deep soaking tub. We're talking really, really deep tub here. It was up to my shoulders when I was sitting in it! And the bath products were great. Coconut-pineapple fragrances that felt very Hawaiian. The cottage had 24 hour butler service. They brought different fresh fruit daily. The turn down service in the evenings was nice. They would leave coconut shortbread cookies on the pilllow and lay out the robe/slippers for me. And they would turn on the radio to soft, hawaiian music. It was lovely coming back to this at the end of the day. The staff was very genuine and friendly. Our cottage also came with a welcome basket that had bottled water, fresh fruit, Turtle Bay shirts for both of us, and this amazing, exotic tasting juice ( a blend of passionfruit, orange and guava). We ate at Bay Bar one night, enjoying pizza and beer. It had a good casual, relaxing atmosphere. Twice we ate at Palm Terrace, once for breakfast and once for dinner. All the resteraunts were a little expensive but portions were large and the flavor of the food was fantastic. I had spaghetti and meatballs ($19) and the meatballs were literally the size of tennis balls! The portions are definetly large enough to share an entree between 2 people. If you want a good but inexpensive breakfast on property, try the little area in the lobby by the coffee bar. They have fresh fruits, muffins, danishes and coffee galore, We ate there one morning for about $6 total. We had drinks at the poolside bar that were expensive but also plentiful in size and flavor. The bartender was friendly and service was fast. She even brought us free samples of a blended drink. All of our other meals were off-resort. (Ted's Bakery, Halewaia Joe's, Breakers) . Northshore is simply breathtaking. It can't be explained in pictures or in words, you just have to see it and even then you still won't believe it's real. There are hiking trails on the resort property that make for a wonderful, free activity. If you do the trails, be sure and take your camera. We did a helicopter tour that was worth every penny. Oahu is even more breathtaking from up above. We also did a shark encounter with Northshore Shark Encounters, hands down the best part of the trip! Anyway, I would highly recommend Turtle Bay to anyone! Start to finish this was the dreamy, luxurious vacation of a lifetime! If you go here, spring for the cottage-it's worth it! Oh, and be prepared to never want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for North Shore Exploring”
Reviews.Author: NalaIndy
Reviews.Content: Spent week at Turtle Bay with husband and friends. We had a great time exploring the North Shore, and relaxing on the hotel property and beaches which were amazing. Buffet breakfast was worth trying to get included in your price, as with all islands, food is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: BostonTerrier81
Reviews.Content: I titled my post "Best Vacation Ever" because that's all I said to my boyfriend the entire time we were there. I literally cried for a few days BEFORE we even left because I was so sad to know we would be leaving soon. The staff at the hotel is INCREDIBLY friendly and kind. During our stay we got to know a waitress at the Palm Terrace Restaurant (her name was Annie) and on our last day she gave us BIG hug goodbye (thats how great they are at this resort). They go out of their way to ensure that your stay is unforgettable. The hotel grounds are beautiful and impeccably manicured, the ocean views are stunning and can be seen from almost anywhere. If you are looking for nightlife this is not the place for you, however if you are looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, I HIGHLY recommend this resort. We loved this resort so much that we are currently planning a wedding at Turtle Bay and are counting the days until we return!! Mahalo Turtle Bay for a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: antterande
Reviews.Content: This resort had it all! My husband and I just came back from a one week stay. The hotel was clean, friendly staff, great eateries all with magnificent views. Situated on the actual northernmost shore of Oahu, the hotel takes advantage of the beaches and rocky shoreline. Wonderful views and large waves everywhere. Loved the organic menu at their restaurants . . . . I had a Lychee infused martini made with organic vodka which was wonderful. The hotel is just down the road from where world-class surfers surf the pipeline, fun to watch. The hotel also supports our men and women in the armed forces and hosts special events and packages for their respite. Our room was a deluxe oceanfront and was huge. The bedding was super comfy with pressed,soft sheets. Nelson lamp in each room. Huge closet. The only thing that surprised us was the noise level of the wind and surf. With the sliding door shut it is still slightly audible. Although the beach is open to the public, the resort is gated which was nice. All in all, this place is a jewel and I hope to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway for locals”
Reviews.Author: rubisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel has views that are astonishing. The crashing surf surrounds the place, but there is still a quiet bay where children can swim and the snorkeling is not bad. There aren't lots of fish, but there is a great variety of fish. I found everyone there to be very friendly, polite and helpful. None of the problems reported by others on this site were noticeable. The pool slide is perfect for small children, but not fast enough for teens. The restaurants are expensive, but there are other cheaper options within 15 minute drive from the place. Since they provide a small frig, it is easy to eat breakfast and lunch out of the frig. Overall, this is a wonderful place for locals to get away from it all and a nice way for folks staying in Waikiki to spend a few days of their vacation on the quieter side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelodyD3
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! It had an AMAZING view from the room, ocean view. It was right on the beach and they had a really nice pool where both kids and adults could enjoy themselves. It was an amazing trip :D

Reviews.Title: “Mid-range "resort" in great location.”
Reviews.Author: sam_overlands
Reviews.Content: We just stayed four nights in a Deluxe Beachfront room at Turtle Bay Resort. It looks like 3/4 of the rooms are this type- ones with a balcony that fits two chairs. It's about what you can expect from a mid-range 3-star Marriott or Hilton... It's a 'resort' only in that they offer lots of activities (at a price). The room- for $188 a night through Pleasant Holidays not bad. Big room, not much furniture in it, not that clean, bathrooms new and pretty nice, although the lighting is bad and the shower really dark. The first room they gave us overlooked the pool and roof mainly, not exactly what we hoped. We asked to be moved and were accommodated. Still lots of rooftop but nice view east. My impression is that when you book through a consolidator like PH you are low on the totem pole, so to speak. The bed was terrible. The cottages look amazing however- worth the money for sure. The food- Pretty good, but really expensive! $25 for spagetti and meatballs. F&B is clearly where they make money- makes sense as you are a captive audience when on-site. We had lovely dinners at 21 Degrees North and Ola's. Room service was timely and good. There are many great places to grab a bite just a few miles down the road in either direction. The rest-- Nice location in the country- so much better than Wakiki!! Shrimp and produce stands, yummy Ted's Bakery nearby, pristine uncrowded beaches...Long lines at check-in and out, everything on "Hawaii time"...Very friendly hotel staff, except for, oddly the concierge staff...We did the kayak tour with Shaka Kayaks and it was great... Snorkel rental for one day was $28 for two of us (only 1 hour comp as part of the $25/day 'resort fee'), oh and the Wifi didn't work (also supposed to be in 'resort fee'). If we go back to Hawaii, we would probably rent a little beach house instead. Probably a better fit for more independant travelers. We received a nice follow-up email after our stay, and I find it caring and responsible that the management seems to follow TripAdvisor. Traveling to Hawaii is clearly a very big deal to a lot of the people who stay at Turtle Bay, and I think the management truly strives to make the experience a good one. Bottom line: Beautiful, more authentic-Hawaii feeling North Shore location for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: shelleystreet
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on an extended lay over in Hawaii from Australia to US. So pleased we opted for the Northshore over Honolulu or Waikiki. Scenery and atmosphere got better and better the closer we got the the hotel. Very accomodating staff, checked in at noon and room was ready, offered porterage and valet immediately, parked ourselves, bags in room when we arrived. 10 mins later a bottle of champagne arrived because we had told the front desk we were moving back to US from Oz (we assume)! View was awesome, nice balcony with sea view, close enough to see the whales breach! Very close to Halei'wa - which is a great town for strolling around, shopping and eating. Had dinner in restaurant one night which was fine, nothing extraordinary. Didn't stay at the resort much but was great as a base for going anywhere, drove all the way down the Windward coast road back to airport, stopping at beaches and coves along the way, which was amazing. Recommend Kailua and especially Lanakai for swimming - gorgeous! we were the ONLY people there! We will be going back to spend more time exploring the Windward Coast - just perfect. Went to Hanauma Bay to snorkel but was too choppy by the time we got there (3pm) so too much hard work, a lot of the coral was dead and too many people mixing up the sand. Would like to go again but in the morning. Overall - stay at the Turtle Bay if you can (great rates on Expedia) and make the most of the more unspoilt parts of the island. everything is within an hour - hour and half and the driving was half the fun!

Reviews.Title: “amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: dixiebelle
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Turtle bay. We checked in very late but valet parking were right there to help and park our car. We had purchased the golf inclusive package with a ocean front room... I was a little disapointed that part of my view was of the roof top.... but beyond that the view was spectacular! We had some issues at the golf course.. but the hotel manager Fina took very good care of it and us.. Fina.. that was so appreciated! The palm restaurant was where we ate ..wonderful service and fantastic food! The chef always took time to talk with us and describe what she had created. Only one rude person we encountered was a woman at the conciarge desk who was flapping her hands all over the place and told me she was to busy to take my postcard...no big deal I guess..lol..The rooms were clean and of a good size...bed was slightly lumpy .. but so enjouyed sleeping with the ocean waves crashing and the wonderful breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Anakalia68
Reviews.Content: Huge resort. Very beautiful. Staff was all extremely friendly and helpful. On our first night there, we decided to have supper at Lei Lei's which is located on the resort but as it was a bit rainy we were taken there by golf cart. They picked us up by golf cart when dinner was done and the driver accidentally ran over a huge frog with the golf cart. When he dropped us off at the hotel, he even thought he needed to apologize and said "Sorry about the frog". We joke about that still! There are two beautiful parrots in the lobby throughout the day that are amazing to watch and talk to. The breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace was splendid! The hostesses and waitresses were extremely friendly and courteous. We upgraded our room to include breakfast so I would definitely do that if I go again. The bartenders at the pool bar are quick witted and very accommodating and fun to chat with. The grounds are gorgeous. Don't miss taking the slightly hidden, albeit rocky, path to the northern tip of the property to watch the ocean waves. I went there early in the morning to catch the sunrise and never did I witness anything so magnificent as those crashing waves when the first morning sunshine was shining upon them. We slept every singe night with the sliding glass door open and fell asleep to the sound of the ocean waves. I miss that! Most certainly when I return to Oahu, Turtle Bay will be where I'm staying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bizizgr8
Reviews.Content: Turtle bay is in a beatiful location on the north shore of Oahu. There are miles of beach around the hotel, and if you are willing to walk a bit, you'll have a nice stretch to yourself. There are some hiking trails as well and the property is full of flowering trees and nice landscape. We saw a sea turtle while we were there in March, but it was fairly far down the beach. We stayed in the beach cottages, away from the main hotel. The view was gorgeous, and there are nice hammocks on the lawn behind the cottages. The room was nice-flat screen tv, big marble bathroom. We got a discounted price by booking through travelocity-I don't think the rooms are worth the $950/night listed on the website. They also offer lower prices to local residents, and because of this, one night our neighbors were a group of 15 people having a birthday party, and another night some local-looking teenagers were smoking pot on the lanai next to us. Not exactly what you'd expect at a "luxury" hotel... Beach cottage renters are supposed to have a private conceirge. When we called the private conceirge, they never answered the phone. (They called back within 15 minutes, though). There were also a couple of days when they didn't refresh the ice in the room, which wouldn't be a big deal except that you can't go out and get ice for yourself. The conceirges were always friendly, and they were about the only ones. The front-desk clerk, Renee, gave us a bad impression of the hotel from the moment we checked in. She was curt and distracted throughout the process, and when I questioned why she wanted to put a $2000 charge on my credit card after we had pre-paid for everything (it's in case you want to charge anything to your room, and it doesn't fall off for 2 weeks after you check out...), she acted like it was a major inconvenience. The resort restaurants we tried were good, but overpriced. If you want to save a bit of money, the Haleiwa town that is 20 minutes away had some good restaurants. I didn't think the drive to Honolulu was that bad. If you go down the Windward coast it's quite pretty. That being said, it will take you 1-1.5 hours depending on your route.

Reviews.Title: “Dont use the surf school at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sffun23
Reviews.Content: The Villas and Cottages are great, but the surf school is not to be trusted. Absolutely do not use them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views!”
Reviews.Author: tebbs1220
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and was very impressed, It was on the pricey side to what we are used to paying, but totally worth it! Our hotel overlooked the ocean, we could go out to the pool and over look the ocean, rooms were comfortable and staff friendly. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Resort that Made Leaving Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: FolsomAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to spending the second-half of our trip to Oahu at the Turtle Bay Resort and found it be such a disappointment. Like many families we work hard to travel to Hawaii, and deserve clean rooms, quality food, drinks and service, as well as resort experience if that's what we pay for. The rooms are just grubby. There were bird droppings all over the patio furniture, the beds are below par, and the bathrooms show that the cleaning staff doesn't really clean the rooms between visitors. The age of the resort shows in the cinder block walls and the stench of years of cigarette smoking. The views from the tower rooms are good, and the waves pound amazingly into the rocky shoreline. This part of the island is super windy, so sitting by the unheated pool is a unique experience. I can see why people have weddings here though, it is very photographic. The parking lot for guests is difficult because there are rarely open spaces available so you have to valet your car as a result. This place is very understaffed and shows in the disappointing service. Imagine walking up to the bar to order you drinks, and then they bring it out to you -- this was common at three of the bars (pool, beach, and bay club). Note: This is not a resort beyond the golf courses the grace the entrance. They list the resort amenities (which you pay $25/day) as a gym, free local calls, free incoming faxes, an "hour" rental of snorkel gear, a free hour/day on a tennis court, and free parking (if you can find a spot). Highlights: It's on the North Shore, the staff that checks your parking pass is nice, there are parrots by the elevators, and your $10 Mai Tai always come in a plastic cup! I respectfully recommend that a traveler waits until they hear of a significant investment in this property before they consider staying here. Turtle Bay doesn't meet the baseline requirements of Hawaii resort.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: krystaldeep6
Reviews.Content: upgrade and get a condoe, its worth the perks, and privacy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Mark4432
Reviews.Content: I was raised on Oahu and now live on the Mainland (California), so I will give maybe a slightly different perspective on the hotel. We used to have a house in Kahuku, a few miles from the hotel, that we would use from time to time. It was considered the “country”, and still is. If you want the “city”, don't stay here. But the “city” is not the real Hawaii, at least not for me. I would not stay in or even visit Waikiki if you paid me. This hotel and its location are just great if you want relative privacy, the “old” or “real” Hawaii, beaches and coastline with relatively no one on them, views of the mountains unspoiled by high-rises, and houses with galvanized iron roofs unchanged over 50 years. If you want shopping 'till you drop and fake Hawaiian music in endless Polynesian-themed bars, then this is not the place to stay. All the nice things said about the hotel and the restaurants are basically true. We were there eight days, and found that maybe 95% or more of the time the service and quality was great, but maybe 5% of the time there was a real loser thrown in. But that may be true anywhere. When the hotel did mess up for me in a giant way, they gave us a basket of fruit and the manager apologized profusely, so they do seem to care. The kiddie pool seemed really nice for the kids, plus the beach area has basically no waves so it is entirely safe for little children to play (safe from waves), although we did not bring children. The prices in my experience, having travelled heavily in Hawaii and the world, are about normal for a resort. But the food quality is surprisingly good, and the portions are good-sized. So, for example, we always split a single lunch order by the pool so per person it was not expensive, and the quality was excellent. If you want cheap, you probably shouldn't be in a resort like this, but you can always go to the Subway and McDonald's in Laie, about 15 or so minutes south. I was impressed that in the Palm restaurant, which often has buffet dinners, they have live Hawaiian music every night, by a member of a group (Mixed Plate) or the whole group (Saturday) who are really good and sing mostly real Hawaiian songs in Hawaiian. Maybe for you this is not an issue but for my wife and I this was a big deal. It is not easy to find real Hawaiian music in a hotel – most hotels have Don Ho tourist crap music – unless you prefer Don Ho type tourist crap music.. On Friday night, the hotel provides an Hawaiian Luau entertainment/dinner package for I think a lot of money ($100?). We saw the entertainment from our balcony – it was sort of standard, tourist-type pseudo-Hawaiian entertainment with most of the songs in English, a dead giveaway that it is not the real deal. The guy doing the male Hula was terrible. The food is probably the same as that in the buffet in the Palm restaurant. My strong recommendation if you want authentic Polynesian entertainment is to go to the show at the Polynesian Cultural Center. Almost all the performers are LDS students at the BYU campus in Laie, and they are simply presenting the dances they have learned as part of their own cultures within Polynesia. It is pricey but is done really well and is worth it. The shrimp trucks – whoever thought this was a good idea? $13 for a handful of whole shrimp that you have to take the heads off of and peel yourself ? But Ted's Bakery cannot be missed. The bakery goods are huge, and quality is excellent, and the prices are reasonable. The glazed donuts were always warm and were luxurious. And their Chocolate Haupia Pie (sold in individual pieces) is really great. The Gold Standard for snorkeling in Hawaii is generally considered to be the Captain Cook Monument in Kealakekua Bay south of Kailua in the area of Kona, Hawaii, where I have snorkeled many times. I found the snorkeling in the little protected bay east of the hotel to have cloudier water due to the water movement (a no-brainer), fewer fish, but a greater variety of fish than at the monument. I saw maybe six different kinds of fish I had never seen before, and also was able to find a lobster, a turtle, and a four foot trumpet fish, none of which I expected in such an area. Of course, you can't go charging around kicking your swim fins and expect to see any fish.
