The resort has some kind of “standard” about when it is “safe” to loan out snorkeling gear – when it was overcast and windy, they would not let anyone use their gear (at least two days). I brought my own mask so it did not matter, and of course the fish are not really too concerned about the weather, but you may want to bring your own mask and snorkel if you have one. I have no idea why the resort does this, since safety is always the same. The hotel has trails along the coast going both east and west from the hotel with nothing there except ocean, beach, rocks, sky, and trees. On one beach we saw a monk seal, which apparently is quite rare and very endangered, and on another a crew filming for the show Lost, which I guess is equally endangered. It is really pretty if you are into nature walks. The surf was up for several days while we were there. There were nicely formed 12-15 foot waves directly north of the hotel, and twenty foot plus waves to the east. The waves were just spectacular. At Sunset Beach (four miles west) the waves were thirty feet. We had a view of the waves and the sunset from our room. Walking out to the point just to the north of the hotel, I had a great view of the sunrise (or the sunset for that matter) over the water. We would go back to this hotel in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great but I noticed many near misses...”
Reviews.Author: sortiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we are members of the 'Escape Club' and this was part of our package. Check-in was good, the staff were friendly. However, as a side note and our first near miss - we noticed that the couple next to us were not so lucky as their room was not ready because the previous occupants had a late check out and the front desk was not sure if the room had been cleaned yet or not. My husband and I managed to check-in, walk back to our car, re-park it and walk back through reception noticing on the way back that the same couple were still waiting. Our room was roomy with a very comfortable king bed. I had read other reviews complaining about the rooms being outdated but ours was clean and maintained. Yes, the bathroom cabinets were simple and dated but I honestly don't spend much of my vacation in there to really care as long as it is clean and has everything we need. Our room had a separate vanity with a sink in an adjoining dressing room which was convenient for my husband and I to both get ready at the same time. The grounds are beautiful and we sat at the pool bar and watched the sunset. The bartender didn't seem to want to serve us so we sat at a table and received excellent service from a waitress. As we hadn't made a reservation at any of the restaurants, we went to 'The Bay' bar and got some drinks and a pizza. Again, the waitress was fantastic, so was the drinks and the pizza was big. We only stayed there one night but here is the other near miss that we nearly encountered. We noticed in the morning that right underneath our room balcony, the staff were setting up tables and chairs for a wedding reception. I would not have been happy to have had to listen to a party and would have felt intrusive if I was to sit on the balcony while the event was taking place. Overall, very romantic and we really enjoyed our stay. The prices and resort fees have put me off staying there again even though we would have loved to have returned with our daughter and spend a few more days there.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is Totally Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MichelleB14
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at Turtle Bay twice and loved it both times. The first was in March of 2004. We happened upon the set of "Lost", becoming avid fans. Turtle Bay has beautiful, clean and very comfortable rooms. In '04 our room overlooked the beach, and had a "standing room only" lanai. Our next time we upgraded to a fantastic view of the open ocean. We would enjoy watching whales and turtles while sitting out in the sun,having our morning coffee on our lanai. Lei Lei's restaurant at the golf course is the best! The pool was enjoyable to be at. Horseback riding was great too. Everyone was most helpful from the bellmen to the concierge. I would call this a first class resort. The gift shops had everything you need and more. I purchased a turtle pendant from one and I am always receiving compliments on it.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort is truly paradise!”
Reviews.Author: syracuse123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our dream trip to O'ahu and were thankful that we chose Turtle Bay Resort! I was traveling with my husband and two kids as well as my mom and dad. We stayed at an Ocean Villa for the week and my parents were adjoining in their own room. The Villas are worth the money! We didn't mind paying the $25 daily resort fee, as it is better than paying separately for coffee for the room, Internet service, etc. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, service was exceptional. We found the people to be friendly and helpful from housekeeping, service on the beach and at the pool to the staff at the restaurants. Our room was decorated beautifully and the view was breathtaking. The property itself is well kept and made for enjoying. I was still on New York time so got up pretty early and would see the grounds being attended to before the sun was up. The location is a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, which we visited a few times during our stay and only a 45-minute drive. We enjoyed snorkeling, swimming, dining and sunning at the resort. A big plus about the North Shore/Turtle Bay location is that it is next to the Banzai pipeline where we stopped frequently to enjoy watching the many surfers catch some waves. My family and I are looking forward to returning to the Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic.”
Reviews.Author: Hubert_Cumberdale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Turtle Bay resort for 4 nights. Check in was easy and friendly. Rooms are spacious and clean but a little dated. Sleeping with the ocean breeze coming through the window was very nice. Catering staff organised a romantic candle lit dinner in our room at my request, everything was perfect. Special thanks to Marisa who made it all happen. Facilities at the resort are top notch. Plenty of outdoor and leisure activities. The resort itself was a 60 minute drive from Honolulu Airport. The grounds are immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, uncomfortable low quality rooms for the money we paid!”
Reviews.Author: PuyallupPenguin
Reviews.Content: Been to the Islands three times, have always been satisfied and had a great time...however, not when we stayed at Turtle Bay Resort on Oahu. Thought we would go ahead and spend the extra money and do the resort thing but were extremely dissapointed. We read that it was not kid friendly and catered more to couples etc. NOT!, there were kids everywhere..we were expecting a semi luxurious room for the money and got a room with uncomfortable old beds, cheap funiture and lamps that were falling apart, There was absolutely nothing to do after dinner, with at least five dining options you'ld think there would be some type of entertainment in at least one of them. We did however enjoy the food and buffets in the main dining room, also the food servers and housekeepers were friendly and did a great job. The bartenders and other staff seemed disgruntled and aloof.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not so great service.”
Reviews.Author: travelpal28411
Reviews.Content: We were not sure weather to book this hotel based on the reviews but know a few people who have personally been there, so we took a chance. We stayed here one night so that we could visit the North Shore a little longer. The hotel property is just beautiful, literally located on the edge of the ocean. The waves were so beautiful and very very loud. The pools are very nice as well, but again, not heated so they were very cold. (we have not found a heated pool in Hawaii). SERVICE: we did wait over 30 minutes to check in, as there was only one lady working the front desk. When we got to our room, we were very disappointed as we paid for "OceanFront" and got a view of the roof and could not even see the ocean. After two hours of trying to hear from a manager, we finally were moved to another room on the end of the hotel with a better view. The entire hotel is supposed to be oceanfront, but most of the lower floors have views of the roof, so ask for an end room, or better yet....just book the suite. We ended up there and it was very roomy and much nicer. The rooms are not as bad as what everyone says. Yes, they are older but it does have a certain charm about it. The beds were nothing to write home about as ours was not that comfortable but hearing the ocean at night made us not really care that much anyway. LAUNDRY: there are only a few coin operated machines on one of the floors. Not so clean but available for use in a pinch. FOOD: The restaurant that we had dinner at was on property (Ola). It was very good but service was slow and the wait was long for a table. We had breakfast at the Palm Terrace and ordered from the menu. It was good, as well. They also have a breakfast buffet in the mornings. In conclusion, we were glad to have visited the famous North Shore and recommend visiting the area if you are on Oahu. It is really not to be missed. We did not like the service at this hotel, but agreed that spending the night was worth it to spend more time on the North Shore. We will preserve the good memories from our North Shore visit and our time at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TD726
Reviews.Content: Deciding that a little getaway was necessary, we decided to head to Hawaii for a week to escape the cold of the Midwest. We had an absolutely lovely time and simply cannot wait to come back. Neither one of us golfs, but I play tennis and was able to participate in a few tennis clinics and the courses do look amazing. I've made a list of Pros and Cons, so if you're traveling to Oahu these can hopefully help you make up your mind! Pros: -The pools: Quiet, calm and serene and, best of all, enough chairs for everyone unlike at other resorts! -The beaches: miles and miles of them (5 to be exact) so you can get away from the hustle and bustle. Be forewarned that the beaches are, by law, public so there are people from the general public who use them. We never once found this to be a problem. -The staff: Everyone was warm and welcoming and greeted you with an "Aloha!" and a smile. -Nice mini-fridge in room to keep fresh fruit, drinks, etc. Helped when we went to the grocery store to stock up! -All rooms have at least a partial oceanview, which is great! -Quiet! Even though there are families with kids here, for the most part it's adults and the kids tended to hang out in the pool with the waterslide, which was far enough away from the main pool they weren't bothersome. Cons: -As expected, all restaurants on site are extremely expensive and there really isn't a town so to speak of to go to to eat without driving. We actually went to the supermarket down the street and picked up things for breakfast and lunch to keep costs down. As much as I love a nice, hot breakfast, I can't justify paying at minimum of $20pp for it. -Must rent a car. There's really no two ways about it, renting a car is really a must. -Resort fees. I booked our room through an outside site (Orbitz) and was unaware of the resort fee that's added on daily. At the end of the day it didn't break our budget, however I wish that they either included this in the room price (and therefore just raised the room price) or had explicitly stated that it would cost another $25 a day. Instead it says parking, internet, etc. included. Well, that's the $25/day fee. -Housekeeping. Often times we felt that housekeeping was not, um, doing their jobs. I spent a summer working as a housekeeper at a 5 star hotel, so I completely understand the job. However, often times we would find trash still in the bins or beds slopily made. Not the biggest deal, but they also kept getting room numbers screwed up and knocked on our door multiple times to deliver things at bad times (6:30AM (twice in a row just to double check) and 11:00PM). Location could be a pro OR con depending on your attitude towards vacation. We both wanted to be isolated and away from everything, so Turtle Bay was perfect for us. It's about an hour to Pearl Harbor and about 90min to Waikiki. If you don't mind being out of "the loop" then TB is great! Overall, I would not hesitate to stay at TB again. Even with the $25/day resort fee, it was still cheaper than a similar hotel in Waikiki. The activities were great and we had an amazing time. I seriously wish I could live there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location TERRIBLE SERVICE many surprizes...........:(”
Reviews.Author: qayaqer10
Reviews.Content: First off we checked in they wouldn't let us bring our own bags to the room...insisted on bellboy...well we had a great drink at the pool got to our room an hour later. No BAGS.. we called and said we were going to eat lunch and would leave the Tip on the bed..... patience is good...... so we went and ate got back 2 hours later STILL NO BAGS....but the tip money was GONE...called and said whats up?...... . we are still in our traveling clothes(we could have been sitting at the pool) well then about 45 min later we then got our bags........ then we called for Sat. night dinner reservations and were told because we were just 2 people we didn't need them... so after our walk we showered and dressed and went down to eat and found out it was going to be a LONG WAIT....??... So we went to the Bar lounge and had Pizza instead of Prime Rib we looked at each outher and laughed wus up?? I bought this Package online 7 nights includes LUAUL and one night free and Parking......$300 plus per night....HOWEVER they add on $25.00 per day for in room coffee fax availiability and phones WHAT The advertise as Hawaiis only all inclusive resort ...... at res desk they didn't give much info about Luaul and told us to see conceiarge well next morning we went down to set luaul they said it only happened fri nights.... turns out PCC LUAUL is every day there luaul here is fri night...so this is our last night we find out our res was for tues night only because we wanted to add my daughters family to the luaul.....and upon complaining they made us feel like we were dumb and it was clearly explained upon arrival......we checked out our paper work and it WAS NOT CLEAR the paper work mearly told us about the $20 fee extra most hotels give you that stuff any way..... So upon complaining AGAIN.. we got $5.00 knock off the $25.00 fee per day remember this is a $300.00 plus per night stay....... on the res sheet it CLEARLY SAID $20.00 per night .....WAS UP?..... Well all I can say is The pool was fun with the Grand kids thats all..... food was terrible in house ..... Ola's was okay but pricey and Lei Lei's was the best at the golf course.... HOWEVER IF YOU GO TO THE NORTH SHORE STAY AT SHARKS COVE you can always go to the PUBLIC BEACH right here at the resort and pay $5.00 parking they don't check room keys so you could probably use the pool anyway.......Mai Tai's are really strong at pool bar......I guess they want to keep you drunk while you were there so you don't notice all the extra consequentials.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvness746
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this resort. It is just so beautiful. The hotel is surrounded by water views everywhere. You can hear the waves at night from our hotel room. It is just so relaxing and peaceful. The restaurants are great. The grounds are beautiful. The pool is great as it is overlooking the ocean. This is really a place to go to just relax and play golf. We would definitely go back! Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place and a perfect resort to match”
Reviews.Author: Fam_of_4_BC
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Turtle Bay. The staff were helpful and friendly. There were lots of free activities at the resort and the location cannot be beat. The shops and spa at the resort make you feel so welcome and the prices are reasonable with the exception of the restaurants which are very inflated.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss on the Pacific”
Reviews.Author: bobbyhilldenver
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the ocean-front cabins rather than the main hotel. Sitting on the porch at sunset, looking out on the small expanse of lawn and the vast ocean beyond, listening to the surf; unbelievably relaxing. The large grounds of this resort are immaculate, with beautiful walking and horse-back riding trails. Superb (albeit pricey, of course) room service. Easy to lose track of time and cares. Excellent restaurant for breakfast. Would be nice to have a few more options for vegetarians on the restaurants' menus. Staff unfailingly pleasant, courteous, responsive. All the "paradise" cliches justly apply. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: danieldd04
Reviews.Content: I went to Turtle Bay Resort in February of 2009. Very modern, very spacious, beautiful rooms, gorgeous views. The resort was more than anything I could have hoped for. The price is very reasonable in comparison with other hotels around Hawaii. This hotel offers ocean views from everywhere. Love the open-air lobby. Hotel is away from all the noise and traffic and crowds that you might find around Waikiki and other beaches. Loved the views from our Lanai. Just walk outside and you are on the private hotel beaches. Ola restaurant offers an open beach dining experience. Loved the breakfast buffets. Loved all the food. Close to little old towns and fun to explore the quiet roads. Golfing at the Arnold Palmer course was an amazing experience. I got a cold on the plane ride down there so my first night I was very tired and gross feeling. I walked by the Palm Terrace to check the menu and they noticed I had a cold and gave me a free bowl of soup that they told me would help me with my cold. I felt much better the next day and made my trip much more enjoyable. Almost a year later I still love telling people about my experience at this hotel. I highly recommend this resort to my friends. Especially couples and people that enjoy the quiet relaxation you expect on vacation. I've convinced three people to take a trip here and no one had anything bad to say. Be sure to check out near-by waterfalls, historic areas, cultural center, etc. If you want some night-life you can always drive into Waikiki or Honolulu it took a little less than an hour on some uncrowded roads. Good to have a map or a good cell phone that can direct you which roads to take however. I am hoping my travel agent can arrange me something so I can afford to take both my parents in June, I will definitely be going back. Hopefully in June if I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic North Shore Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Steve48Texas
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect spot on the North Shore of Oahu. Very different than Honolulu and very laid back. Great views on 3 sides of the Hotel and property, great golf courses with great views. Very friendly staff and service is excellent. Definitely will come back again and again !!

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii luxury”
Reviews.Author: MOMW5yrold
Reviews.Content: Husband, 5 1/2 yr old daughter and I traveled to the north side after one day in Honolulu. We are SO glad we left the Sheraton and moved the rest of our vacation to turtle bay. It was open, uncrowded, and perfect. Only down side was the kids activities and club was closed the entire week. The stuffed animals they left on the bed were a big hit for our daughter. Also we upgraded to a beach cottage for only $80! Food was good and we loved that we could eat great food with our feet in the sand at the outdoor beach restaurant. Looking off the rocks we were able to observe sea turtles up close. Horse back ridding was also a big hit.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: lemingreeley
Reviews.Content: I thought I left this review last year but ...I didn't.. so it here it goes. The resort was great..rooms comfy and views wonderful. We were facing the ocean and over looking the pool..floor 4 I believe. (Ohhh and i love their shampoo,lotion, etc...smells great!! be sure to bring some home to elp you through Hawaii withdrawals). The snorkeling was GREAT. The sunset pictures were amazing and the food was good..(wish it was a little better,especially for the cost). I would go back and stay there anytime. Only downside we had was when my son lost his phone at the snorkel beach and they (staff) didnt seem like they knew how to communicate between each other to try to find it. They kept telling is to go to that person..etc.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card!! and be prepared to spend!”
Reviews.Author: gilesclan
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, and four kids ages 16, 13, 11, and 9 visited the Turtle Bay resort on Jan 10th. We had spent the first part of our trip in Waikiki and the last 3 days on North Shore. We had connecting rooms and were immediately dissapointed in the rust and mold on the door jamb between the connecting doors and some mildew in the bathrooms. The rooms are a little outdated, but fairly comfortable. If you are traveling with kids, this is NOT the place for you. The resort is at least a 15-20 minute drive from other towns so the hotel restaurants are your only choice. The one restaurant that actually had food my kids were interested in was a bar and no one under 21 was allowed. My wife and I tried to go to the hot tub later in the evening each night we were there, but every time we encountered groups of very intoxicated NON-Guests in the hot tub. From what we overheard, Turtle Bay is an easy place to sneak in to, drink at the bar, and sit around the hot tub for free. The last problem we had was with our credit cards. Upon checkout, we found that they were trying to charge us for bar charges that we NEVER used....one on each of the rooms. It took about 30 minutes of arguing to get them to remove the charges, but no explaination was ever given as to how the charges were put on my rooms in the first place. I wonder if the non-guests in the hot tub are allowed to charge drinks to rooms without having a room card??? Beautiful views. Horseback riding was AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: jstprincesskris
Reviews.Content: great hotel - got a free room upgrade, nice pool, nice view, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a little outdate, but overall excellent hotel... especially if you love LOST!”
Reviews.Author: On_my_way
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for our 4th wedding anniversary (mid-Dec/4 nights) & we liked it very much, but can’t say we’d be back anytime soon. The pool was closed for our stay for a makeover, but they warned guests on their website so we knew they were offering a free buffet breakfast each day in exchange for the inconvenience (the pool area looked great). The North Shore was also experiencing 30-50ft waves which were the biggest waves in 50 years or so we were told. The other islands were experiencing these as well when we were there. So, yes, the beaches were closed to the public all over the North Shore for 2 or 3 days. We found non-swimming activities to pass the time and still had a great time. The hotel itself looks amazing from the outside, but the rooms are dated and need a makeover too – although they are big, and we had no complaints about the bed, better than the Marriot Waikiki where we stayed the second half of the trip. Every staff member was especially friendly. We booked on a discount site so we got the room for a good price & we thought the breakfast food tasted great. We never ate there for dinner – went to Honolulu (45mins 1way) or Haleiwa (15mins 1way) for dinner. On the North Shore there are lots of nice beaches and the Waimea waterfalls (which were a lot of fun to swim in, but cold! & don’t try to go behind the waterfall – we got a little banged up, still a lot of fun). If you’re a Lost fan you’re going to love this hotel, they were filming there everyday we were there and we met some of the cast & crew. It was an experience of a lifetime, the cast & crew were so friendly, we got lots of pictures and we were even allowed onto a closed set by the banyon tree (which is worth the hike in itself). If you follow Lost you’ve got to visit the hotel before April when they said they were done shooting. We also met the Liaison young woman between the Lost crew & the hotel and she was very nice as well. A BIG thank you to all of the Lost crew & cast who gave us a behind the scenes look at the show it was the best anniversary gift we could have received. They were filming in the hotel as well and we got some pictures with actors there as well, everyone was so nice and they allowed us to watch from out of camera range. If you don’t follow the show I can see it being somewhat of a nuisance if they’re filming on the same floor as you, but we changed rooms because of pool construction noise so I’m sure you can do the same. In the end, the North Shore is much different than the Vegas like Waikiki area and there is lots to do in Oahu which is all worth visiting. Although, Waikiki isn’t our idea of Hawaii being lush secluded islands, with beautiful beaches and scenery and the North Shore as nice as it is – it’s probably better to stay in Maui or Kauai if you’re looking for that type of vacation. (We’ve been to Maui, the Big Island, and Oahu… Kauai is next!) But you should go to Oahu at least once to see all the attractions and the North Shore is great place to get some quiet time in… and Turtle Bay is the only resort up north, so, it’s the place to stay if you’re there & if you love Lost then go for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jmfitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our teenagers and everyone had a great time! We weren't looking to be entertained all the time and wanted to relax so this was a good hotel and location for that. One of the things we wanted to do was a Helicopter Tour which leaves right from the property but were unable to because the President was in town so all Helicopters were grounded. The family did golf right there which was nice and shopping was only a 20 minute ride. The Polynesian Cultural Center was only about 10 minutes which we went to for a Luau. We thought it was entertaining but too long. The food was good nothing that was outstanding. We stayed in a 3 bedroom Villa which was very nice! The location was really beautiful and enjoyed our stay but I wouldn't consider it a 5 star luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pashannen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at Turtle Bay and stayed for another 2 weeks for our honeymoon. Our family and friends all came along. Some stayed at Turtle Bay, some stayed in Waikiki and some rented houses form private owners. I must say turtle bay was beautiful. It was very peaceful and relaxing. Although we didn't go to their beach at all. There are way to many better beaches to waste your time at theirs. We had an excellent time. We would definitely go back. They were filming "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" when we were there so there was alot of painting, movie fliming, etc but the hotel was very good about accomodating any troubles that came from the filming. Everyone was very friendly. If your looking to party, this is not the place for you. Everything closes by 10pm on this side of the island, even restaurants. Its about 45 minute drive to Waikiki so it's not very practical to drive there for night life when you have such a long drive back after. Also the drive to Waikiki has a lot of traffic so you could easily take 1 1/2 hours or longer to get there. This hotel has more of the relaxing, island feel to it. Waikiki is way more "touristy." I have no complaints whatsoever. My husband and I got a couples massage in a cabana at sunset overlooking the ocean, it was great.. except for the surfers that could see us when we had to take our clothes off. :) I would recommend this hotel to anyone loking to see the island and relax and enjoy the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Service Horrible for a Resort - Stay anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: NoCalTravelBug
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a very fair individual who has read some of Turtle Bay's reviews prior to coming to Turtle Bay and thought that the poor service ratings may have been due to a higher expectation that comes with a fast paced way of life. Well, those who indicated that the service was poor to very poor here are absolutely correct. For the type of resort that Turtle Bay claims to be and charge, they should be embarrased by their service. Everything from missed reservations (twice - and for those who have stayed here you know that there are not many other choices in the near vicinity), to cancelled spa appointments, waiting for dinner over an hour on 2 separate occassions, never a good breakfast experience, and just plain waiting at pool side......and on a couple of occassions, never receiving a drink order from poolside bar. At one point while sitting at the pool bar for about 30 minutes I noticed that not only I was getting a bit impatient but others around me were waiting and complaining as well. Finally, I wondered whether service would be better if I called from my cell phone. They indicated on the phone that they would be right out and I thought I was on the brink of getting a drink but alas the people behind me who were complaining receieved their order and then the attendant went right by me to the new people who had arrived and stated that since "I did not have a menu" she skipped me. Now I get it as I am typically the one reading these reviews and thinking "well why don't you get up to the bar and order yourself."...it becomes the principle of staying at this type of resort that states that they provide pool side service that you would then like to get served a drink at pool side. There are so many more examples and that said I still have tried to take the perspective of taking a deep breath and remember that I am relaxing but really, really the service is just horrible and it is hard to relax when you are always waiting and having to do so much work while on vacation to ensure that your reservation has been made, the activities have been scheduled, etc. Now,Jayde who serves smiles, laughs and great drinks at Hang Ten Bar is a delight. the hotel needs more like her. Perhaps there is not enough staff and if that's the case I really encourage Turtle Bay to hire more people as this is not at all in the same league as other resorts that they indicate they are competing with - Service is similar to ---- a low end hotel much less a resort.

Reviews.Title: “It would be nice for a short - not long - stay”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastRiva
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Turtle Bay. Pros: There are some pretty good things about this place. The location is very pretty and allows you access to several scenic points where you can watch the waves and surfers. It is in close proximity to Waimea Bay and Sunset Beach, and we went to breakfast in Haleiwa (at Cafe Haleiwa, which was a nice, very informal spot). I think it would be nice to maybe spend two or three nights there as a base to explore the North Shore. Cons: I personally would not spend more than a few nights here again (we stayed seven). While the setting is beautiful, the resort is large and sticks out against the landscape, which detracted from the scenic environment. Although they advertise miles of coastline, most of it is not really where you would swim. They have two "swimming beaches" -- one of which is rather small and packed (at least in December), and the second of which is a 20-30 minute hike away and is pretty disconnected from the resort (no services there, so you have to haul your towels etc. out there). This is not the type of place where someone will bring you a drink on the beach, or even set up your beach chairs/towels. I did not find it very relaxing, but I am used to more isolated spots where I can just lie on the beach without interruption. This is a very family friendly place, which is great for families, but you should just be aware of that before planning a trip (I learned first hand after being hit with a volleyball because I was on a beach chair in the proximity of the beach volleyball set up). So, I would say this is more of a family place than a romantic getaway. Also, they are a little odd about towels -- they ration them out (it appears that they will give you one towel per person, which I don't like because I like to use one towel to lie on and another to dry off with) and you need towel cards to get the towels. It just seems kind of strange. I would also not categorize this as a luxury hotel. It is more like your run of the mill Hilton or similar chain, just placed in a beautiful setting. The bathrooms were not great and they don't give you bathrobes unless you ask (how odd is that?). When you do get a bathrobe, it is not the typical terrycloth robe -- it is a short thin robe that kind of reminded me of what you wear in hair salon. There is no minibar. The service was also on par with an average hotel chain. When we tried to get suggestions of things to do from the concierge, we didn't really get much help except to point us to the brochures directly across from the counter. I am used to having more proactive and helpful concierge experiences. Again, this wasn't horrible, but it just average. If you want to take a hike on the trails, I would recommend some closed toe shoes. On my hike to the second swimming beach, I learned that this was also a horse trail which means horse poop. I was wearing sandals, which was not the perfect choice! The food was pretty average and very expensive for what it was. I was underwhelmed with Ola, which was pretty bland. Finally, I would recommend getting a Premium room versus a Deluxe room. We paid in advance through a travel website and opted for the Deluxe room, which was more expensive, because it was supposed to have a bigger lanai. When we got there, our Deluxe Oceanfront room overlooked the ballroom first -- you could not see the shoreline and had to look over the ballroom to see the ocean. I was really disappointed in this, and we asked the front desk if we could move. They said yes and we moved to a Premium Oceanfront room, which had a beautiful view and no buildings in the way. This was a cheaper room, and we asked if we could have a refund of the difference in the price. We were refused, and told that we were "voluntarily downgrading." That experience was unpleasant and a bit insulting because our first room really was overlooking a ballroom and then, in the distance, the ocean. We asked the front desk about this twice, but they were firm. Note that we did not go to management so I do not know what would have happened if we did - we were kind of tired and didn't really want to get into it any further. Nonetheless, I would not characterize what we did as a "voluntary" downgrade. Overall, Turtle Bay is a decent place to explore the North Shore, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “$240 fee for cleaning”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyScher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, but my expierence was terrible with my $240 cleaning fee for having ashes on my balcony. I do not smoke. When I went to express my concern the staff was rude. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy with value. Wish we would have stayed in Maui longer.”
Reviews.Author: JudyK1
Reviews.Content: We are extremely unhappy with this property. It is not all that is says it should be for being part of the "Preferred Hotels and Resort" collection. The pricing was 5-star and the services were a 3-star. We paid $575 a night for a cottage and the cottage is very nice but when you get to the pool area the other services are less than desirable. It is no where near worth the price we paid. Very dissappointing. The work out room is aweful. It is small, very cramped and the machines are rusty. It does not take much to replace a few machines or extend the area. We arrived at the pool the first day around 10am and there were absolutely no chairs to be found. The response from an employeee was...."It's Christmas week, it is always like this..." Well, if it is always like this, why not bring in more chairs for the week. It is obvious that they are trying to run the property with limited staff but still charging full price. We will not return not will be suggest the property to others. We travel ALOT and can compare to easily to other experiences. This did not make the grade for us at all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: G8tors5
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Oahu and we started at Turtle Bay. Beautiful view from our room, loved the restaurants, the pool and the bars..it was a magical stay and cant wait to go back. Snorkled with turtles, Mai Tais at the bar, great meals.

Reviews.Title: “Get a beach cottage :)”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca027
Reviews.Content: I know it's more expensive, but get the beach cottage, I promise you won't be disappointed. Did first seven days here at Turtle Bay, could have been good with maybe four or five, and longer in Maui. Pool was open til the last day, it was posted on the website weeks in advance that there would be closures. Loved the breakfast buffet. Ola's was ok, same with Lei Lei's. Otherwise ate away from the resort. It was great for the first part of our honeymoon, because after the hustle of a wedding, you need to relax and this is the place to do it. There isn't much to do and that's the point. We loved it. Cannot stress enough about getting a beach cottage. It was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you like snorkeling, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: anon789
Reviews.Content: LOCATION BAD: Their literature claims that their protected bay is perfect for YEAR-ROUND snorkeling and swimming, but the beach was closed the whole 5 days we were there (red flag on beach). I was naive in believing the north shore was ok in winter, though the hotel should not mislead people even when they call and ask. On top of that the pool was closed, though we got free breakfast in compensation. FOOD GOOD TO AVERAGE: The breakfast was amazing; dinner so-so but overpriced. On a good note, the staff was very accommodating with my wife's gluten allergy. Do not got to Lei Lei because they want people in and out quickly. If you have food allergies forget it because they refuse to do special orders. I had their famous prime rib and I was not impressed. We complained to the resort about this because Lei Lei is a privately owned restaurant that the hotel lists in their directory. ROOMS NICE: No complaints, roomy and clean, and nice partial ocean view. Don't stay here for the bay. Also it is far from many of Oahu's attractions. Oahu isn't the best Hawaiian island. I suggest Maui or Kauai,

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, beds not....”
Reviews.Author: waileacapital
Reviews.Content: Staff was SUPER friendly and made the stay nice. But as beautiful as this hotel is, the beds are springy and hard. I had to check out early because of a back ache. Our kids were asking for a massage because their backs hurt too!

Reviews.Title: “A physical paradise, tranquil and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: har8cin5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for 4 days and 3 nights and I wish it was more. We have never stayed anywhere where we felt so relaxed and tranquil and not a worry in the world. The property is beautiful, the amenities are outstanding and something in the ocean air that is right at your finger tips lulls you into a state of peace and relaxation. Everyone we dealt with was wonderful and accomodating and there were crowds as we were there as part of a convention. The rooms are large and we were on the second floor facing the ocean and the massage hut and the sound of the waves crashing on the rocks at times was deafening. Our balcony could fit a small party and we would relax and watch the waves morning and night. We never heard any sounds from the hallway and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms are a little older but still maintained well. The bathroom was spacious and you have your own fridge and one whole wall of closet space. Ladies for those of you who enjoy top notch tolietries...you won't be disappointed. The tolietries here are from the Spa....by the way I had the best massage of my life at Spa Luana and I had a room with windows opening to the ocean. We ate everyday at The Palms Buffet with avariety of fresh fruit and their macadamia nut sticky buns...I still dream about. Don't worry still plenty of hot items for the men!! My husband and I rented mopeds and for $59.00 for 24 hours this is a great deal. We road all over the North Shore and to the surfing beaches and the town of Haleiwa. Please make sure if you goto Oahu that you make Turtle Bay a must stay! You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views”
Reviews.Author: BigHarleyDog
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative and so-so reviews regarding the rooms, hallways, furniture, etc. I staying on the 4th floor of the south tower and it is nice, it looks to me like fairly new carpet and paint, looks very nice. I'm staying in a jr suite, with a flat screen ty, sitting area, and it is nice, and of course the furniture has some nicks in the tables etc, but every hotel does, as people for some reason fail to treat a hotel like home or maybe they do, and they usually damage their own furniture. Palm Terrace for breakfast was good, buffet included since they are working on the pools that are closed right now. FYI, in room safe is fairly big, holds a laptop and my dslr camera. I think this is a nice resort, so far.

Reviews.Title: “Best views, friendly service, great martini's...”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMay48
Reviews.Content: I'm a single woman traveling on my own. Stayed at Turtle Bay for seven days. Every room has a fabulous ocean view. The staff, from the cleaning staff to the front desk to the restaurants, is friendly, helpful, and interested in the quality of your visit. Never felt singularly awkward except for one night in Ola's, a beautiful romantic seaside restaurant that is best for couples. As expected, the restaurants are somewhat pricey but are a variety of price ranges. The rooms are spacious, not over-decorated (fine with me) and very comfortable for a longer stay. Expect a very relaxed atmosphere and you will not be disappointed. Food and drinks were well prepared and tasty. I would definately recommend Turtle Bay for a single traveler who wants to relax. Not much night life at the hotel or anywhere on the North Shore unless you're 20-30 and into the surfing scene.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Fell Short Indoors”
Reviews.Author: fairwahine
Reviews.Content: This resort I am sure was built for luxury. The open spaces, the views, the amenities all speak to it. I was only here a couple of days and while thoroughly pleased with the outdoor environment, the inside of the hotel shows signs of aging. Large windows are everywhere to guide your eyes to the ocean views, and no doubt away from the carpet that was coming up at the seams in the hallway. Not every level was like that but a couple were. Some baseboards were chipped and not touched up. Doors didn't always open easily. Bathrooms had beautiful marble tiles and counters but cabinetry just looked basic and painted white. Wonderfully quiet at night but the beds were not incredibly comfortable. Lots of space in each room but my suite had what seemed like a wasted walkthrough area. It contained two large closets and a huge built in cabinet housing a small sink and tiny fridge, and small table with a coffee maker on top. It seemed way oversized for what the space actually functioned as. The staff was friendly and helpful, full of the laid back hawaiian spirit everyone talks about. The bus from the resort runs maybe every half hour (Hawaii time) and takes a couple of hours to get to Waikiki, but only about twenty or so minutes to get into Hale'iwa. According to the concierge, no shuttles to any of the island's attractions run from Turtle Bay. It's unfortunate when you have taken part in most of what the resort has to offer and you would like to try something else but would prefer to not rent a vehicle. What I will always love about the resort was the atmosphere, almost always being able to hear the ocean whether you were indoors or out. It has a calming effect that I cannot explain. The snorkelling is fun and included for one hour per day in your resort fee. Some people even got to see turtles in the mornings! (note: on days when there is high surf warnings the resort has a policy to not rent out snorkelling gear). The breakfast at the Palm Terrace was delicious. Horseback riding through tropical trails and alongside the beach was amazing. Everything else aside, waking up to the sunrise was what really made my stay. I love the surroundings at Turtle Bay, but I may not stay at the hotel again at its current rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Get Away from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Rao_NJ
Reviews.Content: Plus Points 1) Grreat location 2 beaches, good golf course, lots of activities, breathtaking views The Kamehameha Hwy on which this resort is located has lots of picturesque beaches and little towns, can catch a lot of surfing (-) Minuses The rooms though big seem old and need upgrade, Plus there is no free breakfast, There always seems to be line at the front desk, But this place is way better than anything close to crowded Waikiki,

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: Anne327
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of Turtle Bay, we had a good idea of what to expect. This is a very quiet area, which was great for us, but definitely not for the party crowd. It was a good 15-20 minute drive to any towns. The hotel is older, but I found the conditions to be much better than described in some reviews. We booked a Pikake Jr Suite - these are located at the end of each wing. Our room was very large, and had a huge completely private lanai/balcony with 2 chairs, table, a nice chaise lounge, and still a lot of space . The view was great, we were on the 4th floor and directly on the ocean. The room furnishings were nothing fancy, but very nice, king sized bed, full couch, 2 armchairs, nice dining table with 4 chairs, desk and chair, good quality TV with lots of channels, also a safe and good sized fridge. When we were there they were in the process of replacing the carpets in the hallways, which were a bit worn. The resort dining was mixed. Our first night we just wanted something quick so went to the Bay Club, advertised as a "sports bar". It was truly awful - bad atmosphere, cheap decor, and $18 for a frozen pizza that was really terrible. The pool bar was average, could use some updating. It was very windy the whole 6 days we were there, drinks would blow over unless we sat in a few seats at the bar that were protected. We really liked Ola, the bar/restaurant on the beach side of the hotel - good food and drinks, nice atmosphere and decent service, went there several times. The "Turtle's Den" in the lobby was great - a cart serving simple breakfast and lunch items to go, very reasonable prices. Overall the food/beverage costs were similar to other resorts we've stayed at, we didn't find them outrageous. Off-site, we loved Ted's Bakery, 3 miles from the resort, really good breakfast, lunch, dinner and desserts. We also liked Joe's in Haliewa, about 20 minutes away. We did not try any resort activities, spent most of the time touring around the area or on the resort beach. We had our own snorkels but the water was very cloudy in the whole area, probably the time of year as seas were very rough. There were some nice 1-2 mile walks on the property, the walk to the Banyan Tree from "Lost" was great, we passed a giant turtle sleeping on the empty beach just before we got to the tree. We thought the service at the resort was excellent overall. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff were excellent, our room was kept very clean. The maid accidentally took my beach towel thinking it was a hotel towel. When we called to ask about it, they searched through all the hotel laundry until they found it, then returned it to our suite washed, dried and wrapped. We thought this was very good service. As far as value, I think you're paying mostly for the location and surroundings, which were beautiful. We enjoyed our stay and would return to TB if we're in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hell! Don't go here....”
Reviews.Author: dudesscotland
Reviews.Content: We went here for our honeymoon in June 2009 after reading reviews and seeing the resort on line. Don't be fooled!! It was so bad it has made me write my first hotel review ever to warn other people. Lovely location with great snorkelling. We enjoyed the spa, gym, kayaking, surfing lesson and a bike trip but we were bored after 2 days. The hotel was quiet and we were the only ones in the bar at 8pm onwards. The restaurants were also very quiet. The girl at bike hire/snorkelling area was very, very rude. Staff in bar openly arguing with each other, it was dreadful. (Staff in the restaurants were lovely). Hotel outdated and needs upgrading, it was like something from the 80's. Disappointed is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - Very Tired Hotel/Property”
Reviews.Author: Courchevel
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is located in an amazingly picturesque location on Oahu's north shore. The location and the views from the property out on the ocean are really one of a kind. As for the overall resort, it is very very tired. Some money has clearly been spent on the lobby, but that seems to be the extent of renovations. For example, there are numerous tennis courts, but probably less than half are actually in good enough condition to play tennis on. Maybe two of the courts are in excellent condition, with the remainder exhibiting typical signs of neglect (lots of cracks and uneven surfaces). The pool area leaves a lot to be desired and looks like it was constructed in the 1980s, no swim up pool bar, tired pool deck. That being said, the scenery from the pool area (breaking waves etc) is very nice. Also, there are no resort organized activities such as surfing, dancing, etc. We stayed in one of the beach cottage which was very nice and I highly highly recommend booking this accomodation. The rooms are large, the beds are very comforatable, bathrooms have been updated (and large), have a shower stall and a seperate large tub and there is a small seating area in each cottage. The cottages are right on "turtle bay" which does not have a beach, but the views from the cottage porches are outstanding. Furthermore the cottages are exceptionally private considering you are on a large resort. Definately stay in a cottage. I did not see the rooms in the main resort building, but given the overall state of the resort (tennis courts and pool) it wouldn't surprise me if the rooms are a bit outdated. While at Turtle Bay for a week, we spend the vast majority of our time away from the resort exploring the island, returning to our cottage at night to relax and sleep. There was really nothing at Turtle Bay to keep me on resort - the pool area is old and not appealing and tennis courts are in tough shape. There are two golf course which I didnot play and horse back riding is available. We ate in the onsite steakhouse, which has nice views, but looks like something from the movie "Wall St" and is very very expensive for the quality (i am comparing this to steakhouses I eat in here in NYC). Overall, I would suggest this resort to someone who wants a gorgeous location in the country side of Oahu. I would warn them that they will need to turn a "blind eye" to the fact that substantial dollars need to be spent to upgrade the resort to its full potential and that they should seek entertainment and food off resort. If you want a drink late night, good luck. There is a lobby bar, but it is not open late. Turtle Bay is not a "party place", it is a quiet, very relaxed, secluded resort. While we were there in March, the number of guests seemed to be pretty low. I live on the east coast (NYC) and for my money and time there are many many other warm weather places that I would rather visit than Turtle Bay - that being said I enjoyed my time sleeping and lounging in the cottage, but spent my entire days away from the resort exploring the best the Oahu has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and breathtaking views!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at Turtle Bay Resort and were very happy with the resort in all. Here are the Pros: They upgraded us upon finding out it's our honeymoon and I can guarantee we aren't their first honeymooner rodeo. They comped a main dish because in their opinion it took to long to get out to us, without us even complaining. There is a very wide variety of buffet to dine at every morning and has an ocean front view. The rooms all look over the ocean, at least they seem to, and we have experienced views from magnificent sun rise to a beautiful rainbow. The service is really great and everyone is very friendly, which goes a long way with my husband and I. Cons: The rooms are nice, but a little outdated. Marble bathroom floors are great, but bath tubs are normal and specifically, ours does not allow us to bathe, just shower. These are very minor, but something to know that comes with the package. They come and clean twice a day and it is all very clean! Another thing to consider about the location is the North shore. We have really enjoyed being completely isolated from most of the tourism, and there is a great variety of restaurants here in the resort and the town Haliewa within a 15 minute drive that offers shops, beach fronts and several great places to eat, but it is a solid hour from Honolulu and Waikiki (with some traffic). So, it is just good to be sure that you want the isolation feel vs walking to a lot of different places in Honolulu. The beaches and views here are great and we have really enjoyed being on this side of the island and taking day trips to Honolulu, but the driving has gotten a little much at night. Hope this helps!! It has been nothing but a great experience for us!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location - Main Hotel Rooms Miserable - Upgrade to Cottages/Villas or Else Pass This One By”
Reviews.Author: JackA09
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long-awaited anniversary celebration vacation to Maui and Oahu. Did lots of research and planning, including a visit to the grounds and restaurants of Turtle Bay last year. While the location and grounds of this resort are outstanding, the rooms in the main hotel are just plain awful. The staff tried their best and actually moved us 4 times - each time the room had the same musty smell, beat up furniture, worn carpets, bathrooms that looked like they hadn't been updated since the late 70s or early 80s (I'm talking green tubs with old metal soap dishes), and old TVs (although a previous reviewer claims he had a flat screen - not so in the 4 rooms we viewed). The a/c vents were covered in rust and dirt. I wouldn't say that the rooms were dirty - just totally outdated with furniture, carpet and window shutters that were old and worn. Each room we saw was a king ocean-view deluxe and although they overlooked the ocean, they also overlooked the flat brown roofs of the restaurants or lobby. I've read that a lot of money was pumped into this place, but it certainly did NOT go into renovating the guest rooms in the main hotel. After viewing the 4th room we asked to speak to a manager. We expressed our concerns to him and he didn't seem terribly surprised. He told us an option would be to move to the more expensive beach cottages, and when he heard this was a trip we had planned for months and that it was our anniversary he charged us an extra $50 per night, instead of the going rate which would have been an extra $175 per night. The beach cottages were outstanding - huge, with modern marble bathrooms, flat screen TVs and patios with perfect unobstructed views of the ocean. Even if we hadn't been given a discounted rate at the cottages we would have moved anyway as we were miserable in the main building. All that being said, the staff was excellent, the golf courses were beautiful, the spa was wonderful. We enjoyed the beach, pool, bike rentals and restaurants. If you want to visit and stay at the North Shore this is pretty much your only option and while the grounds and facilities are beautiful, I would never consider staying in the hotel again nor would I recommend it to anyone. I don't understand the mentality of "we don't spend that much time in our room, so we'll just deal with it." When you stay at a "resort" you want all the amenities and luxuries associated with one and Turtle Bay Resort truly misses the mark. Opt for the cottages or the newer villas, otherwise get an early start and drive out there for the day. All beaches in Hawaii have public access so entry is there for the taking.

Reviews.Title: “the most beautiful place on earth”
Reviews.Author: hanavanski
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the turtle bay resort for 1 week, and i must say it was quite possibly the best week of my life. i have always wanted to visit hawaii, and i am pleased to say that i was not disappointed! the staff was very friendly and accomodating. the view and scenery was AMAZING ! the turtle bay really is " true hawaii" it is very quiet and tropical... the hotel was booked to capacity ( we were told) and yet there was never a line at the restaurants, there were always chairs available at the pools and on the beach. if you are a beach lover like me, you will love walking the beach for miles in either direction. the beaches were not crowded at all. this was the perfect place to relax with a tropical drink and watch the waves roll in ! the waves were spectacular ! we will come to turtle bay again!

Reviews.Title: “Forget anything you have read to the negative”
Reviews.Author: GABoy55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a once-in-a-lifetime celebration of our anniversary at the Turtle Bay Resort. After spending 9 months reading this and other review sites, we felt compelled to send our impressions of the resort. To begin with, as a traveler that spends over 80 days per year in hotels, the hotel is as clean and well kept as any I stay in. If you are familiar with the wear and tear that proximity to salt water can do to paint and carpets, not to mention that fact that beach resort visitors tend to add sand and grit to the carpets and furnishings, the staff at TB do an awesome job of maintaining the carpet, furnishings and paint throughout the facility. Yes, they do have flat screen TV's. Yes, they offer 30 or more channels of variety entertainment, (if you happened to get a sunburn and must stay in). All of the amenities are first class, from the six on-property eating establishments, to the Spa Luana, to the exercise opportunites, to the beach-side towel and snorkeling equipment. We were greeted by name in the restaurant for breakfast, as well as when we picked up our car from the valet. We were told by the reservations agent, and reminded in our paperwork about the Resort Fee, and simply considered it as part of the cost of staying at such a great facility. The internet, while a bit slow at times, was more than adequate to allow me to check in with my office once a day. And the in-room amenities from Spa Luana were fabulous. We ate at four of the six places on the property that serve food, and found all of them to be a wonderful experience. Yes, they were much higher priced than Pizza Hut or McDonald's, but having stayed at hotels in Chicago and Las Vegas recently, the menu prices were slightly lower than I found in those two facilities. The food quality was far better than any hotel I have stayed in recently. And the service was friendly and generally excellent, (as long as you didn't treat the staff as servants, which we saw some folks doing). Things to plan on while you visit, if you don't want to buck the traffic and drive to Honolulu: Definitely do the Luau and show at the Polynesian Cultural Center. Try the ATV's at Kualoa Ranch. Have lunch at one of the shrimp trucks! Take a break and have some dinner in Haleiwa,,,Cholo's or Haleiwa Joe's were both great. Snorkle in the bay. Get a couples massage by the waves. And did I mention to have lunch at one of the shrimp trucks? My wife and I have stayed in the best hotels in Las Vegas, Chicago, San Diego, Myrtle Beach, and all over Florida. Nothing compares to our experience at Turtle Bay and it will be a trip that we will cherish for the rest of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds, rooms in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: latraveler600
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are beautiful! You can walk the paths and find secluded coves, watch the sunset from your balcony, and swim in the two pools. But the rooms really show their age. I traveled with a few colleagues and we all had the same complaints: carpets either torn or worn, old beds that dip in the middle, peeling glaze on the tub, mildew smell in the room, and leaky a.c. If they'd update this hotel, it would be a great place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Peaceful - A great place to relax and enjoy life”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Natives
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place that was on the beach, where would could relax and still have activities to chose from. Turtle Bay was just what we were looking for. We spent 1/2 days out and about, then the other half relaxing at the resort. Our room was ocean view, which was incredible. We spent alot of time on our balcony just enjoying the sounds and smells of Oahu. I recommend the OLA restaurant. Good food and a great view. We rented a car and did several things on the North Shore. Last day we spent it Honolulu and I am so glad we were stay at Turtle Bay for most of our trip. We did not want to be in the city so, Honolulu was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: vez_9
Reviews.Content: We had a really chilled week here. The grounds are beautiful but the hotel and room itself was very dated. Restaurants were ok...best is at the golf shop. Be warned, it's very quiet at night. All the rooms have a seaview except the one's on the 1st floor, looking onto a roof. (check that because the sunsets are great to watch on your balconys) Only thing that was miffed by was there was no way of getting to the hotel from the airport....it's well over $100 for a taxi so we had to rent a car. An expense we weren't expecting. You are very isolated up there so a car is really handy. Your not tied to organised trips and it's worth a drive to the east coast.

Reviews.Title: “It is one of those things in life that you need to do at least once.”
Reviews.Author: mcabe
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best vacations ever. The scenery and people was remarkable. The resort was top notch and couldn't be located in a better place. The restaurants at the resort left a little to be desired. However, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Italynstallyn44
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 4 nights of our Honeymoon at Turtle Bay. For reference we are 27-28 years old. I was getting a little worried after reading some of the reviews on this page. Those worries all disappeared when I arrived at Turtle Bay. Most people say that the rooms are dated, and yes they are a bit on the dated side, but why are people being soo picky about little things in the room when you are in Hawaii. If your not showering or sleeping why are you even in the room??? The grounds of the resort are just beautiful. It was really fun walking around and recognizing spots of the resort from "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". Although they rearranged a lot of stuff in the movie, you could still tell. The beach was never really crowded, and you should take advantage of the one hour of snorkeling each day that is included with your $20 resort fee. I thought the pool area was really cool at the resort. there a a couple different pools with a water slide and waterfall. there are also a couple hot tubs. I agree the food prices at the resort are on the high side. The breakfast buffet at Palm terrace was awesome. Some mornings I even just got the continental buffet because their pastries were soo good. We had lunch and dinner a couple times at Lei lei's which was great. One night we went into Kahuku to the Kahuku grill. I got a local favorite called "Loco Moco". It was very good. We went to the Polynesian Cultural Center one day, which was really cool. I would recommend going there. I went golfing and the Fazio course, which was a blast. I actually shot my best round ever, which was a bonus. All in all, I would definitely recommend staying at this resort if you are going to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Turtle Bay -- the views were beautiful”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiHoneymoon09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay on our Honeymoon and had a great time. We loved to walk on the beach and watch the sunrises and sunsets. It was a beautiful place and we hope to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Waikiki, head straight to Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: angelmb
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and daughter(13), my sister and her 3 kids (15,19,22). We hired a SUV for a week. It took a little while to get the hang of driving on the wrong side of the road and on the wrong side of the car(we are from Australia) but it was smooth sailing by the time we got to Turtle Bay Resort which was about 1 hour drive from Honolulu on the north shore of Oahu. There was a little bit of road work at the entry of the resort but it wasn't an issue. The only disappointment was that we did not get leis on arrival, we had assumed that all resorts did this. The staff was very helpful arranging our connecting rooms so we all settled in really quickly and was by the pool within 10 mins. Oh and for those that do not know this, Turtle Bay Resort was the resort featured in the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" and is as beautiful as depicted in the movie. The food was fantastic on resort (can be a little pricey) and there are plenty of little 'shacks' a short drive away that sell cheap meals that even the locals go to (this is a good way to tell if its a good place or not). Even locals book into Turtle Bay Resort for a short break away. The kids did a free scuba lesson in the resort pool, we had free use of snorkel equip and there are 2 world class golf courses, horses and even a helicopter on site that you can book. Oh there's even pushbikes, mopeds and segway that you can hire for an hour or day to take a look around. Or you could book in to have a private surfing lesson. We spent a week here then went to Waikiki for a few days before we went home. I assumed that the kids being older would have been bored at Turtle Bay and would want the nightlife etc of Waikiki. But after 1 day in Waikiki they were asking to return to Turtle Bay as it was "heaps better". Annie at Palm Terrace restaurant in Turtle Bay made us feel at home and gave us tips on where to go and what to see, she made each one of us feel like we were part of the family. The only thing I felt missing was organised activities, they did have lei making and ukelele lessons etc but they didnt have a daily roster of things to do like some resorts. Even with this we would all love to come back, the kids didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Turtle Bay Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KailuaGal
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 children (14 & almost 11 yrs.), and I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for 1 night in October 2009. Although this is my first review on Turtle Bay, we have stayed there every year for about 5 years. Turtle Bay Resort offers something that no other resort on Oahu can offer – a beautiful, unspoiled view of the ocean on the north shore of the island from every room! The lobby is large with a open, Hawaiian feeling. While my husband and I check-in, my children usually go to visit the beautiful macaw parrots further down the lobby by the elevators. If you’re from out-of-state, they’ll generally give you a pretty kakui nut lei when you register. Each room we’ve stayed in over the year has been nice. This year was especially nice since we were upgraded to a cottage. We’ve stayed in the cottages twice now and thoroughly enjoyed it each time. Our cottage had 2 queen-sized beds, hardwood floors (except for the bathroom), flat screen TV, and a sunken area with a table, small refrigerator, and mini bar. The large bathroom has lovely white and gray granite tile and a large, jetted tub. My daughter and I enjoyed some quality time with a Mother-Daughter bubble bath last time we stayed in a cottage. My personal pleasure is the hammock in the backyard overlooking the ocean. I thoroughly enjoyed lounging and reading my magazines in the hammock while my husband played golf and my children (on the swim team) played on the water slide. There’s something for everyone. They even offer horseback riding. Over the years, we’ve also eaten at all their restaurants more than once. Without a doubt, our favorite is Twenty-One Degree North. It’s 5-star dining, but has never disappointed us in food or service. Although they don’t have a kids’ menu, they happily split an adult meal for my children. My son & I love their creamy tomato soup! The servers have always been very gracious to my children and even make them chocolate milk (I don’t give my children soda.). The Palm Terrace is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We’ve eaten all three meals with them over the years. They have a good breakfast buffet and menu to order from. Lately, though, we tend to get breakfast in the lobby area at the Turtle Den. They have several different coffee and teas to choose from, as well as hot chocolate, milk, and juices. I really like their coconut macadamia herbal tea. My kids love their hot chocolate with whipped cream. In addition to drinks, there’s a selection of muffins, pastries, bananas, apples, yogurts, nuts, and cereal. It’s Starbuck’s style where you pick out your items and pay at the counter. We then sit on the comfy couches and chairs surrounding the large square tables overlooking the ocean. As for lunch, we always eat lunch down by the pool (unless we’re golfing), though the food comes from the Palm Terrace. It’s pricey, $13 - $17 for a salad, sandwich or burger, but it’s good and you’re by the pool overlooking the ocean. The buffet dinner at the Palm Terrace is your most cost effective option. The Saturday of Father’s Day weekend, we enjoyed their buffet dinner. They had a large selection and the food was very good. This time, we ate at Ola’s on the beach for dinner. It has a nice menu and our food was very good, again, with a view of the ocean (Are you seeing a trend here?). My husband had steak and shrimp and I had the sea bass; expect to pay about $100/couple with drinks. My children opted for room service (pizza, milk, and lava cake) and movies. There’s a reason my family keeps returning to Turtle Bay Resort. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall experience in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWomanAtl
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is a luxourious resort on the secluded northern half of the island. Very quiet and relaxing and a beautiful view of the ocean on all sides. We had a suite so the rooms were very spacious and clean with turn down service. The staff was very polite and accommodating. No complaints about anything. Be prepared for pricey restaurants though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Rooms Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Lisaevil
Reviews.Content: This is a fun, nice resort with a lot to offer and on the quiet side. Definately reccommend at least once. The rooms are just OK. But all the other areas of the hotel make up for it. It's expensive so if I ever went again I'd only do so if there was a really great special, if I had kids, or if I could afford one of the nicer rooms in the complex.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at Turtle Bay Resort !!”
Reviews.Author: travelmyuniverse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and relaxing from the moment you drive onto the grounds. The lobby is beautiful, and just a wonderful area to relax on the very nice and comfortable furniture. The staff at the front desk is fabulous. So friendly and accomodating. Our room was a delux ocean front, and it was a very nice room, and very spacious. Nice large bathroom area with 2 sinks also. And large closet area...refrigerator, coffe, etc... There was also a very large balcony, with a wonderful ocean view. The restaurants were all fabulous..we tried all of them, and the pool area is just beautiful too !! A truly beautiful setting, where you really are out away from anything else, which gives you a whole difference experience of the Island...which is so nice, if you only want to do one island..you can have Waikiki, which is great, and then head upto the North shore for a day or two, if you want something more quiet...... A wonderful stay at Turtle Bay

Reviews.Title: “loved it all”
Reviews.Author: zbear420
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean and spaciuos. had every amenity. Was so close to the ocean without obstructed views of the beach and the ocean. it was calm and quiet in October, but it was still warm and sunny. The restaurants on site were all delicious and charming. there were alot of activities available on site. room service was great. the hotel was one of my favorites. I recommend our trip frequently. and we plan on going back

Reviews.Title: “Better after upgrade”
Reviews.Author: NanKC
Reviews.Content: When arriving at Turtle Bay from a day of traveling we checked in our room.The size of the room was good but out dated and not very clean. After eating in the hotel (quite expensive) my husband returned to the front desk and spoke to the manager about the room. We were staying 6 nights. They agreed to upgrade us to a cottage. They were lovely, great view,walk out to the ocean. The service was great, food expensive, beaches were not great. The shrimp trucks down the road were great. Turtle Bay was a little to far away from everything. Not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Would highly recommend & return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Lori L
Reviews.Content: We rented a 4 bedroom villa at Turtle Bay on the North Shore. We have a family of 6, along with my mother. We arrived late in the afternoon and met with the customer service at the hotel. She was very nice and escorted us to our villa. Opened the doors and WOW!. It was incredible. The view was perfect. We loved the kitchen, which by the way was stocked from the grocery down the road when we got there. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. The maid staff was great. They left us coconut macaroons every evening. I am a stickler for a clean bathroom and they did a great job! The hotel staff was very nice. We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel till we were about to pop! WE just loved everything about this place. Oh...the Luau was great too! It was not crowded, relaxing, beautiful grounds and surrounding area. I would highly recommend staying here. I hope to see you again Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: whirld2explore
Reviews.Content: After spending three nights in Waikiki, we checked out of our hotel, rented a car and escaped the madness. The North Shore is a breath of fresh air, and we pulled up to the Turtle Bay Resort to see if they had rooms. What a lovely, peaceful place. We stayed in one of the Bungalow cottages, and it was by far the nicest hotel accomodations we have ever seen. Total luxury! Our kids (15 and 10) could roam all around safely, buy ice creams at the general store..play in the game room..swim in the pool complete with kiddy slide. We snorkeled right outside our cottage and rested in the hammocks. The restaurants are fantastic. No complaints! Side trips to snorkel Shark's cove (a must see!) and Waimea Bay..shrimp trucks..surf lessons in Haleiwa...we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave and can not wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DirkVB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our honeymoon in Hawaii, and decided to spend a portion of our time at Turtle Bay. We spent the first half of our trip at Turtle Bay and loved every part of it. We arrived quite late in the evening but the front desk staff was very helpful and assisted us in getting everything taken care of right away. One thing that I was surprised about when we checked in was the reserve that they place on your credit card when you check in. That is, they said they would place a pre-authorization on our credit card of around $150 a day, in case we charged any activities or such to our room. While this was surprising, I have since found that it is common practice at all of the hotels we stayed at. While they said they would make this authorization, I never saw it hit my credit card so it did not cause any trouble. Either way, I will make sure to find out about these pre-authorization charges at any hotel I choose to visit in the future to make sure that I do not run into trouble. My wife and I decided to stay in one of the ocean front cottages and we are very happy that we did. The cottages are not stand-alone but are 3-5 rooms connected together. We were lucky to get an end room with no one in the room next to us for most of the stay. This provided us with what felt like a very isolated room. We were never bothered by noise of other people or their televisions. The cottages open up to a small lawn and the ocean and beach sit right behind this lawn. We even had a hammock right outside of our room. This area was a great place to take morning breakfast or to take a nap during the day. It was a very relaxing room. The room itself was very exquisite. The floors were all wood and the beds were large canopy beds. We originally reserved a room with one king bed in it but instead were provided with a room with two queen beds. When I asked about this at the front desk they told me that the king rooms were all taken but I could choose to move later if I wanted. After the first day though, we did not mind at all. The queen beds were great and we felt the room layout worked better and provided more room to spread out in as well. Every night, usually while we were out at dinner, there was turndown service and some sort of "treat" would be left on our pillows. These were either cookies, or chocolates and were a great surprise to come back to every night. During the day, fresh fruit and ice would be placed in our room which served as another great thing to look forward to coming back too. During our stay we received apples, oranges, cherries, and even bananas I think. The service was out of this world. The other offerings at the resort made the trip well worth it as well, even if you did not choose to get the ocean front cottages. The pool area was amazing. It was usually quite with mainly adults hanging around the pool catching some sun and relaxing in the pool. There is a bar area right by the pool and the waitresses will often walk up to you and ask if there is anything they can get you. We found the food to be decent snack food.
