I think we ordered smoothies and fries one day and a smoothie another day. The order of fries was around $4 or so and the smoothie was probably about the same if not a little bit more. I did not think this was too outrageous compared to the cost of such things at most restaurants or bars. We watched the sunset a few nights from next to the pool and it made a great view. Also, on Thursday night I think, a group from the Polynesian cultural center came and gave a demonstration of the different dances that are performed at the cultural center. This was great because we had been debating about going to the cultural center and just never got around to doing it. It was like a mini luau without the hefty price. The beach areas around the resort were wonderful as well. On one side of the resort is the cove that is used for snorkeling. We woke up early our first morning there due to jet lag at around 4-5am. We decided to take a stroll out and made it out to the tip of the cove just in time to see the sunset. Later in the week we took advantage of the free snorkeling gear that was provided with the "resort fee". You are allowed 1 hour per person free each day. We spent our hour out looking at all the fun fish and were forced inside right at the end due to a storm that was rolling in. I was surprised at the quality of the snorkeling since it was calm water and a large variety of different fish that we got to see. We only used the snorkeling gear one day but wished we had gone a few more times. As for food we never ate a full meal at the resort. The only thing we at the resort were the snacks by the pool and then one night after dinner we came back to the resort and enjoyed a great dessert at 21 degrees North. We were able to get a table right next to the windows as it was around 8-9pm and the restaurant was not that busy. For our other meals we drove to nearby restaurants and shrimp shacks. The best meal we had would be the one we got at Blue Water Shrimp & Seafood Co. It is a large blue bus about a mile or two up the road and had the best shrimp ever! We even felt it was better than the much talked about Giovanni's Shrimp. The people there were very friendly and the food was amazing. They also cooked up steaks there which smelled really good. Other restaurants in nearby towns provided great food as well. We also drove the local grocery store and picked up different food items there. This saved us a bunch of money over eating large meals at the big fancy restaurants. There was also a great place right up the road that served amazing breakfast and other baked goods. I think it was just called Ted's bakery. The only other place that I can remember was a little side of the road produce shack. They always had amazingly fresh fruit and steak cooked up on sticks. This little shack was extremely simple but was one of the best things we remember about our stay. It was the epitome of simple living. We stopped by every day and got things like grilled corn, pineapple, iced coconuts with a straw and mangos. A great way to pick up food for breakfast. After we left Turtle Bay we headed down to Honolulu and after our first night there we called Turtle Bay back to try and get any sort of room but it was Memorial Weekend and they were completely booked. The next time we go back we are spending most of our time back at Turtle Bay. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: fur13us
Reviews.Content: We stayed in turtle bay in Apr 2009. We booked a regular ocean view room. But they upgraded us to a balcony room free of charge. The room was neat and clean, and I got a micrwave in my room with a nominal charge of $10 per day. This helped me to warm milk for my baby. Ola restaurant had excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: marian m
Reviews.Content: TurtleBay was everything plus more than we expected. This was our third trip to hawaii first time at turtlebay. Every room has a ocean view which is breath taking. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help and make recommendations on things to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, lots of activities, in a quiet part of Oahu.”
Reviews.Author: firsttimeparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days in July with grandparents, adult children and three grandchildren age 13, 17, and under 2. There was something for everyone. We stayed in cottage with four bedrooms and full kitchen. Plenty of space. The views were gorgeous. Luau was a little disappointing because it is indoors but the dancing and music were good and it is convenient if a bit pricey. Surf lesson was fun and easy--right on the premises. Great to have a kitchen to save money on meals.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hidden away from Honolulu”
Reviews.Author: juli430
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for one week for our honeymoon and loved it! The room was great, spacious and clean, it overlooked the pool and the water. It wasn't very noisy but we were on a higher floor of the hotel. If you are noise sensitive you may want to be on the opposite side of the hotel that doesn't overlook the pool. There was plenty to do on the resort, and it is far away from the super touristy Honolulu area. We enjoyed all of the restaurants and the room service, all of the food was great! We also relaxed by the pool and beach and also used the spa services. Oahu is a wonderful place to visit, and being far away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu made this vacation very relaxing. We rented a car for the week and would explore the island. We have recomened this hotel to family and friends and would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: amicusofall
Reviews.Content: The web site & pictures make this place look so much nicer than it actually is. We were very disappointed with this property. For the price - it should be much nicer. Our room was dirty, worn out and just plain uncomfortable. The staff has an "I don't really care" attitude. The beach swimming area was small and not very nice either. Also annoying is a guard house you must drive past to enter. Not sure what they actually accomplish other than slowing down the traffic? If you arrive at the property late in the evening you may not be able to find a parking place. We didn't want to stay in congested Honolulu/Waikiki and thought a few days on the North coast would be fun. Well, the North coast is lovely but this place needs a complete overhaul. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: genevieveCa
Reviews.Content: My family of 12 spent 2 weeks at Turtle Bay villas staying in the Liotta's 4 bedroom villa, great ocean view on the ground floor. Two beautiful master suites with large soaking tubs, all furnishing are first class and working with Gina & Vince was a pleasure. We had age 80 to 5 years along on this trip & all had a fantastic time. Every thing you could possibly need was in the villa including computer & free phone service. A very special thank you to the Liotta's for sharing their great vacation home with us. Mahalo & Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Best on north coast - Great area for watching turtles!”
Reviews.Author: dankersoe
Reviews.Content: Make sure you make reservations if you want to eat at any of the resturants at the hotel. They get fully booked very quickly - We were unable to get a table in anywhere when we tried to book upon arrival :-( The location is great and it is beautiful on the north shore! We went on a small hike and saw a seaturtle having a nap on the beach - it was an amazing experience to see one of theese ancient turtles just laying there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the outdoorsy traveler”
Reviews.Author: Bill E
Reviews.Content: I've visited the various Hawaiian Islands about a dozen times and this was my first trip to the North Shore. It was nice to see a new part of paradise, but it was a bit remote for my tastes. Don't get me wrong, I loved unplugging at a previous stay in Hana, but at least in Hana there were some options for good food. The Turtle Bay resort is really nice - with excellent views from all of the rooms. Word of warning - most second floor rooms have no balconies, which is a shame because it's really nice taking in the views from your room - and it seems really odd that balconies weren't built for these rooms. The beach area and the pool area at the resort are great - my only complaint is that there weren't a lot of shade options. The trails surrounding the hotel offer some good walks - and anyone into tennis, golf, surfing, or horse back riding will be pleased. The lobby and common areas (aside from the pool area) are uninspired and don't encourage lingering and relaxing. Hammocks can only be found near the higher priced cottage lodging. Towels for the pool and beach area require that you submit a towel card. One card for one towel. If you'd like more, you'll have to argue with an employee who will sternly remind you that if you lose or misplace a card you will incur a hotel charge. The big downfall of the resort is food and drink. The mixed drinks at all of the hotel locations were weak. I'm a total lightweight when it comes to alcohol and none of the drinks affected me - so they were really weak. Food was expensive and mediocre. The wait staff is also under-trained. At one point the hostess at the beachfront restaurant sat us down and shook my hand during some chit-chat. (Where did I put that Purell?). While we didn't eat at the very high end restaurant at the property (because, really, who wants to pay $50+ for a steak?) - the best of the rest was LeiLei's at the golfing range. LeiLei's is a short walk from the lobby - though there seemed to be no direct path - as such we were forced to walk on the main drive and look out for cars. Am I glad I visited? Yes. Will I come back again? Probably not. I think I'd prefer either an over the top resort experience on the Big Island and the Hilton Waikoloa (on the Big Island) or Princeville (on Kauai) or any number of places on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: Tis_0y
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time here. We picked Oahu as the first island to go to because we wanted to experience the best of both worlds. We stayed at the North Shore because it's away from the hustle and bustle of city life but then again we wanted to see the city of Honolulu which is just 40 minutes away from this hotel. Our package included buffet breakfast every morning and the staff are the best in service and friendliness. The beaches are awesome and breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ChickonRules
Reviews.Content: This resort is gorgeous with a beautiful beach and pool including a water slide. The food and service is great. We only stayed here for a day and it was fun. It is very quiet and relaxing. If you want to get away from the crowds and noise, then go to this resort. Otherwise, it could be boring since there's no music or anything outside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtakingly gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: lindsayg8r
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! Everything you could dream of they offered! I even saw monk seals and sea turtles, got to ride horseback on the beach, scuba, surf, etc.! They have it all and the food, staff and location are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and that's all”
Reviews.Author: dcarajan13
Reviews.Content: We made reservation to stay at the hotel for three days, and even joined the Escape Club to recieve more discounts. When making reservations I reserved an ocean front deluxe with king bed. I informed the person taking the reservation that it was our anniversary that we were celebrating. She informed me that they will have a complemintary bottle of champagne in the room when we arrived, and she would note that on our reservation. When we arrived, they didn't have our room available (4:30pm) and that we would have to settle for a room with 2 queen beds. Upon entering the room, it was obvious that they didn't want to give us the room we booked because we were paying a low rate as an escape club member. First off, they put us on the 2nd floor looking at the trees and the ocean was barely visible. They missed the Champagned that they had promised, and the bathroom was really outdated. PLUS..if you are going to spend so much money on a hotel..the beds should luxuroiusly comfortable. The beds were DOUBLES, and they were hard. There were only 2 pillows on the bed. WASTE OF MONEY!!! We immediately asked to change our room and they barely went out of the way to get us another room on the 5th floor....MUCH better view, but the same 2 double beds. The fact that we had to remind the hotel of the champagne they had promised was rediculous, and BAD service for a 4 star hotel! And they even took 2 hours to respond and bring the bottle w/ flutes up to the room. Restaurants: Skip the expense. Go to Ted's Bakery down the street for breakfast or snacks. Foodland is close by, and it is a good idea to buy drinks there. The restaurants at the hotel pretty much all had the same menu with high prices. If you don't want a lot of seafood, then your choices are limited. The food I did have, was forgettable except for the breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace. So overall, all you're really paying for is the location. Location meaning...on the ocean. But there is no nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: RjMTkM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for three nights and loved it! We had an "Oceanfront Beach Cottage" and would suggest this to everyone. The cottage itself had a GORGEOUS view of the ocean---which was right off the lanai. Yes, there was a slight smell of the ocean in the room, but I don't see how that could be avoided---and after 3 minutes, we never noticed it again. The bathroom was huge and had a nice tub and a GREAT shower. The toiletries (which I normally never use and leave behind) were great. The room itself was very large and we liked having a step-down bar and office area. I saw NO issues with maintenance, etc.---and I'll say that I'm pretty picky. The check-in process was very efficient and the staff was friendly and helpful. There was a turn-down service nightly---with complimentary fruit and cookies. There was a daily resort fee, but I liked that better than additional fees for parking, internet and every other little thing. Great property and service----we would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lcm435
Reviews.Content: what I can say about this resort! if there was one place I would love to live this is the place..wow wow wow I have stayed in hotels all over the world but this resort has set the bar so high. and so far no other resort has reaced it. amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Dinner at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: samsnet
Reviews.Content: We came to HI for our daughters wedding, we did not stay at TB becuse we rented a large house nearby. My Son-in-Laws parents arranged to have the rehersal dinner at TB there were 14 of us and we all enjoyed the location. We found the service to be tip top and the waiters excelent. My daughter used the salon and the ladies used the spa for a day of relaxation and masages prior to the dinner and felt it was resonable for the location and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Made us slow down and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: ddffpp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 8/29-31, the end of 5 days on Oahu prior to 4 more on Kauai. Our room, a deluxe double, faced the pool (and the ocean) and was nice, clean, and comfortable. We were supposed to spend the day of 8/30 hiking elsewhere on Oahu but when we set eyes on Turtle Bay, decided to make it our resort day. We walked to a small bay, through some pretty deep jungle, and although the snorkeling wasn't very good there, it was a nice swim after a good walk. We had breakfast at Lei Lei's one morning - pretty easy as there are no choices other than breakfast croissants - and the seafood buffet dinner one night, which was only okay. But the day of hiking and enjoying the pool area was not to be beat. Traveling this summer was a huge bargain so some of the negatives - like the threadbare carpet in the hallways - were easy to overlook. Our room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and the outdoor spaces were delightful. We were able to check in right away and were allowed an extra 1-1/2 hours after check-out time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Nene809
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first few days of our honeymoon. We stayed in the beach cottages, definitely worth the extra money!! They did try to move us to the Presidential suite, saying they had overbooked the cottages. We refused, and they were able to get us into a cottage so it was only a minor frustration. What a place! It is serene and peaceful beyond anywhere I have ever been. The lagoon was great-perfect clear water and not too crowded. We loved the North Shore location, so much more relaxing than the Honolulu area. If we go to Oahu again, we would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Fan's of Forgetting Sarah Marshall”
Reviews.Author: scootersue
Reviews.Content: The week before we left for Hawaii, I read many reviews of Turtle Bay and was a little nervous about the condition in which we would find our room. I have to say we were pleased to find no peeling paint, no torn carpeting, and a clean bathroom! Our room was not the Kapu'a suite, but it was nice, roomy, and over looked Kuilima Cove. Our bed was very comfortable. The room was equiped with a hair dryer, coffee pot, fridge, safe, iron and ironing board, unlimited wireless access, and a television with selected satelite channels (CNN, HBO, the Comedy Channel, and Japenese broadcasting). We wish we would have packed our portable DVD player and a few movies to watch at night. The portions of the property we saw were clean and for the most part are in good repair. Currently, the road into the resort is under reconstruction, the bottom of the pools looked like they could use a fresh coat of paint though but are clean and the grounds are well cared for. We aren't golfers, but the courses looked nice and there were always people on the course. The parking situation is tight because the resort does provide public access to their beaches and the restaurants are open to the public. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the resort. We went to Foodland and bought items to keep in the room. My husband got oatmeal and heated water in the coffee pot. We were able to save a lot of money by eating breakfast and lunch in our room. The prices on the room service menu were ridiculous! We did buy 2 mixed drinks at the pool bar one night, and paid $19.00 for 2 Solo cup size drinks. Beer was $6.50 a Solo cup. We also bought beer and kept it in our room. This was a much more economical solution. We did enjoy looking around the resort to find the areas where certain scenes were filmed for Sarah Marshall. The lobby was rearranged for the scenes shot there and were able to find several more areas where scenes were filmed. We think we found the right cottage where Sarah and Aldous's room was but were not certain. I won't go on so others can have fun and try to find these places as well, but I will say Sarah Marshall's Turtle Bay was much prettier due to set dressing. All in all, we really enjoyed the resort and would recommend the hotel to anybody wanting to stay on the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Poor reservation management”
Reviews.Author: IrelandM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab location, gorgeous beach and the beach cottages are fantastic. The ONLY reason I rate this hotel as average is that we had done a lot of research on Hawaii for our honeymoon trip and specifically booked the beach cottages based on our research. When we arrived (2 days travel from Ireland) there were no cottages available despite us having booked over 3 months in advance and paid a DEPOSIT (most unusual for europeans). The only explanation given was that others had asked to stay longer and therefore there were none available. We were given a presidental suite in the main hotel which although nice, I wouldn't have cared if Obama himself and sent up to serve us coctails, it wasn't the vibe we were after. So be careful if you are coming all the way here for the cottages, the reservation management system isn't up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Treepalm
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for two nights. We found the hotel provided a good base for exploring the many beacheson the North Shore. We were a bit apprehensive about what the actual rooms may be like after reading the many varying reviews, but the deluxe room we had on the fifth floor was better than we had anticipated: It was large, clean and well done. I am pretty picky when it comes to design and finishing details and found the rooms to be above average. We found the beach to be good, not great. We were surprised by how few loungers they have available and even fewer beach umbrellas. I am an avid snorkeler and found the snorkeling to be very weak. Head down the road to Sharks Cove from some excellent snorkeling instead. We found the lobby area to be ok: a bit bland with low ceilings, but fine. The pool area was extremely windy which we have heard is often the case given the hotel's location. This leads to the air temperature feeling "cooler:. Couple that with the mostly cloudy skies we had and the somewhat chilly main pool (77 degrees), and we did not go swimming once. The pool with the slide was closed both days we were there due to bacteria in the water which was a bit of a disappointment. The water temp in that pool did feel warmer when I put my foor in. We had two very good dinners at the on property restaurnat called Lei Lei's which is a short golf cart shuttle or car park away. All in all I'd say we were pleased with our stay and would likely stay there again, especially if we wanted to base ourselves in the north shore for a few nights. Is it a five star resort - no way. In fact, I think that one's experience of this hotel has to do with their expectation and also what price they pay for their room (which can obviously influence one's expectation). IAs I had read many of the TA reviews before booking, I kind of knew what to "expect". If I could have given the hotel review a 3.5 rating I would have. One final note: I have no idea if this was typical or just by chance but we did find that the weather around the resort (it juts out at a point) to be cloudier than when we left the areas and drove tem minutes away in either direction. It also seems that in general or on average, that you will liklely experience more sunshine in Waikiki than up here so you may want to keep that in mind when planning a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel we have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: mikejforte
Reviews.Content: First thing, do not read the negative comments about mold and an unfriendly staff. Maybe they renovated it sometime ago, but everything looks brand new. We checked in and they had mixed up our room reservation, so we ended up with a complimentary upgrade. They were very apologetic and friendly. Ok, we got to our room and it is huge. The balcony had a gorgeous view. I do recommend reservations at the hotel restaurants, especially Ola. The concierge was very helpful. I felt bad we kept pestering them with all of our questions, but they were able to tell us where everything was. Definitely do the kayak tour with Shaka Kayaks. That was a ton of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Escape from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: merrick_cj
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my three nights at Turtle Bay. Here's a quick rundown of pros and cons of this resort: Pros: -Beautiful room lanai overlooking the ocean, you could fall asleep listening to the waves at night -Great location, recommended for anyone spending an extended amount of time on Oahu -Nice big rooms Cons: -Service was not great (had a weird experience at check in with a host with some sort of germ OCD) -Rooms were a bit haggard, paint peeling off some of the walls -$20 resort "fee" which didn't include anything that a normal resort wouldn't include with the room rate -Food was only OK and pretty expensive Specific Recommendations: -Rent a car if you're going so that you can take in the full beauty of the North Shore -Get a room with a full lanai (not the Juliet balconies) -The cottages also looked very nice if you want to splurge

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BlancoEssex_England
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Turtle Bay with excitement having read the Virgin Holiday Brochure and seeing the resort on the Film 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall'. Needless to say we moved out after 1 night back to Waikiki due to the disgusting condition of the Rooms and hotel(Damp and dirty) and clear lack of maintanance for years. My daughter suffers with asthma and this is no place for her so we went to the Hyatt Regency which was much better and across from the Beach. We were offered a suite upgrade which was just as bad. Lovely scenery and setting which makes the condition of the hotel a wasted opportunity. Virgin rate this as a 4 1/2 star hotel which is a complete joke - Most travel lodges in England have better accommodation! Shouldn't even be in the brochure. The Hyatt Regency is better and rated lower by Virgin!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Step Back in Time!”
Reviews.Author: PatandDiSpokane
Reviews.Content: Having been to Hawaii several times... outer islands as well as Oahu, this was such a delight. Since we have been married 50 years in February, we have been coming to the islands for almost that long. Tourism has taken it's bite out of every really lovely location, but Turtle Bay Resort and the general surrounding area is like stepping back in time to when the Islands were still quiet, graceful, peaceful and relaxing. I LOVED driving into the lobby where they whisked away our car to valet parking. We had a deluxe ocean front room that had a spacious lanai overlooking the ocean/bay. Room was beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, windows were being washed as we checked in with an apology from the window washer that it wasn't finished before we entered the room. Spacious dressing room with sink and closets that were separate from the bathroom. Fresh big soft towels every day. The friendliest housekeeping people we've ever encountered...up and down every hallway. Golf courses are every bit as good as they say they are. Spacious as well as some challenging holes. Beautiful scenery with every hole. Golf clinics every day with the pro's on sharpening your skills are just starting to learn to play. Food was good in every restaurant on the property. 21 Degrees North was elegant and beautifully presented dishes. Food was prepared to perfection. We had the Chef's 5 Course Dinner and portions were perfect to be able to finish the entire dinner. Lei Lei's at the Golf Course was casual and equally as good. Everything fresh and well presented. The beach side restaurant Ole was a wonderful ocean side experience. The menu is far from ordinary and again... everything fresh. Lunch was a beautiful setting with the waves breaking in front in the bay. Service in every restaurant was excellent. There was a non denominational church service at the small out building next to the water on Sunday. What a setting to appreciate God's creation and be blessed by the local Pastor;s sermon. Exploring the surrounding area from the resort.. don't miss eating lunch at one of the Shrimp Trucks, don't miss going to Ted's Bakery and eat everything on their menu, The small town of Halewa at the marina is a great walking/shopping/souvenier experience. Have ice cream at the only ice cream shop on the North Shore in the middle of town. And of course you shouldn't miss the Poloynisian Cultural Center right down the road... a whole day of expert entertainment that everyone that is interested in the South Pacific culture shouldn't miss. Plan to be there when they open so you don't miss any of the programs presented. It was the best Luau food we have ever eaten and the big show was amazing it was so well done! You won't find a better hotel or location in all of Oahu than Turtle Bay if you are looking for a quiet get away vacation. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Morgan_max
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location, and it did not let us down. We elected to hire a car to drive to Turtle Bay, which meant that we could drive to Haleiwa one night for dinner which was nice but we would not have been disappointed if we did not have that option. The beach at the resort inside the breakwater is very nice to splash around with the kids. It was fun to stand on our little balcony and look for the sea turtles who live in the bay. We also took a walk past the golf driving range and tennis courts to the stables, then on to the beach, which was very nice. Also gave us a great view back to the resort. We spent a day by the pool. The kids loved the slide, which is pretty tame but still fun. The pool side bar staff were also quiet attentive without being in your face. Apart from the location, my favourite element of the hotel is the staff. Everyone is laid back and friendly. The restaurant we ate at (the one overlooking the pool) is not cheap, but the portions are very generous. Our room could do with a renovation, but everything worked perfectly, it was a good size, had two comfortable beds and an amazing view. I would recommend this hotel for the location and the experience. If you want 5 star, go to one of the amazing resorts on the other islands. But if you are happy with a great location an hour from Waikiki and the airport which offers friendly staff, then Turtle Bay fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here two times. The first time we stayed in a regular hotel room. It was fine. The grounds are beautiful, the little side beach fabulous for those w/small children. Restaurants are ok - not outstanding, but the burger shack near pool and the restaurant by the beach are in great locations...makes the food taste better! We just returned last week from a stay in one of the queen beach cottages. Absolutely wonderful. Plenty of space - beautiful, large, clean and newly renovated bathroom. View from out lanai was spectacular. It was quiet. Actually could get back to room faster from pool area then if you have to go up in elevators. I will be back in a few years but i'll only stay in a cottage after having such a lovely experience. I really love this place. We have been to hawaii (maui, kauai, big island, oahu) on 10 different occasions and this is one of my favorite places (again, the cottage absolutely changes the experience). I highly recommend and it wasn't that much more - we paid about $425/night. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with lots of turtles”
Reviews.Author: humuhumunukunukuopaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is remote but worth it. We splurged and stayed in the beach cottages (they are running great deals right now) you walk out your door and are literally on the beach. The room was nice and it worked out great with our two boys. I can see how other people have made comments about updating the hotel. Our room had been updated but needed to be painted outside. The snorkeling at their beach is great and they give a complimentary hour per person per day. The pool isn't anything great although it is right on the beach so the view is nice. They do have a kids pool with a small slide so that made my 8 year old happy. We weren't really at the pool much because there are some incredible beaches by the hotel. There is also a beach called Turtle Beach that usually has a lot of turtles that you can swim with (off the resort). That isn't to say that you won't see turtles at the resort because their our plenty of them. They also have stables and you can go horseback riding on the beach. If you don't want to ride the horses you can walk the trail to remote beaches. As far as the food goes, I can't really comment . We only ate once at the resort and that was at the golf course, food was good nothing special. We usually went to Hale'iwa and ate, it is about 15 min away. There was a great mexican restaurant called Chollo's there. I would stay at this resort again however, after staying in the beach cottages I don't think I would stay in the hotel portion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Erin1Minnesota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon 15 years after our wedding. At 1st when we got in our room, I had some cleaning issues. I went to the front desk and everything was fixed and a bottle of champagne was left for us in our room. The room was very spaceous and we had a dressing area off the bathroom. We stayed in a Deluxe ocean front room. We loved the North Shore! We spent 1 day in Wakiki and that was enough! If you want peace and quiet the north shore is for you. We didn't have problems with locals coming when we were there. We felt never felt croweded. There is a $20 resort fee it is for internet, other hotels charge for this too, snorkeling, etc. The pizza in the Bay resturant is a good price and it is very tasty. I would stay here again! It was very beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sstDallas
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful and clean. The people at the desk were nice enough. The walk to the elevator was clean and scenic. That is where it stopped. The carpet off the 6th floor elevator was dirty and shabby. The room was horrible. It was dirty and the paint was peeling off the walls. The bed must have been from the 80's along with the decor and came from Motel 6. The beds that I have in my college condo rental were better than what they provided. The bathroom was dirty and old. I asked to be moved to a "newer re-furbished" room and was shown two that had a pool view not an ocean front. I paid for the ocean front and that is what I wanted. I declined the two other rooms and had housekeeping come up with bleach and an egg crate. You have to request a daily sheet change. I have a rash that appeared, questionable bed bugs? The house keeping staff is very nice and will do what you ask. The food is BAD and expensive. We went to Ted's down the street. There is a Thai restaruant in Haliwea. It was good and reasonably priced. There was a lot of emphisis put on the towel card. There is a $25 lost towel card fee. The beach towels were old and worn, but do not loose this card, you will be charged. The view is BEAUTIFUL. There were local people in the pool with their children. There is no hotel pool patrol there. Anyone can walk in and swim. The massage is VERY EXPENSIVE. There was an automatic 18% gratuity added and then another line for more gratuity. How much is enough? The internet is DEAD slow. The resort fee of $20 a day and I had two rooms was over priced. Not sure what this was for. Did not receive much for that $280 fee. Would I stay again? No, rent a condo and save the money. ha over and it was good. There is a lot of emphisis put on the $25 towel card. I am not sure why, they were nothing special, kind of old and worn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: slevent911
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time for 6 days at Turtle Bay. This was our fourth Hawaii trip and we stayed our first week on Molokai. The Beach cottage we had was private and well appointed. We rocked on the private hammock daily and went to the ocean beach and the pool daily. We took side trips to the Dole plantation, several small towns nearby and I snorkeled at Shark Beach a few miles down the road - it's possibly the best off the road snorkeling in the world. I played tennis several times and the instructor was attentive and professional. The food at the hotel was pricey but fair. Our package included the breakfast buffet which was more than sufficient. Everything in Hawaii tends to be expensive. The grounds and the surrounding areas are magnificent. The staff was very helpful with directions and everyone was professional. The hotel is slightly dated, but the grounds and other facilities more than make up for it. If you like glitzy - go to Las Vegas or Mohegan Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Location Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: Whitneydumaw
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Turtle Bay. It continues to be a perfect location for lovers of natural beauty and the ocean with crashing waves and great vistas. The hotel itself is somewhat on the shabby side and certainly could use upgrading. I could not recommend eating at the hotel restaurants since the food is mediocre and overpriced. The shrimp trucks nearby provided low cost, delicious choices. The rooms have refrigerators so breakfast and snack items can be ourchased at Foodland stores nearby in either direction. The staff of the hotel was most helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay there again, EVER”
Reviews.Author: kgw36
Reviews.Content: First the the good, Resort looks good on surface. Now the bad, Paint peeling in room, $32 Buffet really bad never at there again, Loud music from wedding reception on lawn outside our room at night, Very Dirty Jaccuzzi bugs debris, Bedd sheets dont fit bed,Sink slow to Drain,$20 a day hidden resort fee. I paid for and confirmed a deluxe ocean view room with two queen beds, When I got there I got a room with a King, Then a room with a terriable view then finally an acceptable room, But not worth the money.. Oh and you need to show your parking pernit to get in and out of the resort, I understand getting in but getting out plus the gate guard is RUDE and parking is terrible. Next time I will stay some where else on the North Shore

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nothing special, HORRIBLE food”
Reviews.Author: pchamp119
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon. We spent 5 nights in Oahu at the Turtle Bay Resort and from a hotel stand point it was nice. It's nice that most of the resort is ocean front and this may sound silly but it was great actually staying a place without having to worry about cockroaches or ants - can't get that at the beaches in Georgia that I have stayed at. The grounds were really nice and we loved the view of our room. We loved falling asleep to the sound of the ocean. As I stated, we were on our honeymoon, and we arrived to find that we got exactly what we ordered - a partial lanai oceanfront king bedroom. I guess I can't complain, but it would've been nice to have been upgraded. But if there weren't any rooms available, then I understand. It still would've been nice had they done something, like have some lays available or flower petals or something. But unfortunately there wasn't any "congratulations" gift. Not a big deal, just would've been nice, that is all. I was really debating between giving this place a 3 star or 4 star and was going to give a 4 star until we traveled to the Mauna Lani Bay on the Big Island and that place had 5 star written all over it, so I thought it would be an insult to the Mauna Lani to give this place a 4 star. The main reason would probably be because of the dining on the resort. The food at this place is just NOT GOOD. We ate the first night at OLA house and the presentation was nice and it was nice eating on the beach. I think my tuna may have been slightly over cooked, but the meal was good for resort food. Little did I know that the rest of the food we would order there would be much worse. We ate the seafood buffet on Saturday night and it was just ehhh with some of the food just not good. Then on two other occasions we did in-room dining because we were sick (not blaming Turtle Bay). Food was stale, especially the bread - couldn't even eat the bread (could probably break a glass window with it). Just unpleasantly surprised how bad the food was on such a nice resort. So overall - nice grounds, just don't expect any special treatment, and eat elsewhere. We really liked Ted's Bakery down the road, but we were sick for half the trip and didn't want to leave the room because of it. The other thing that annoyed me about this place were the doors. They shut EXTREMELY loudly if the person lets the door close itself. This gets on my nerves, so I would always shut the door myself quitely. The $20 a resort fee was well-known in advance, but for those unfamiliar it covers parking and internet and the gym. Parking can be quite the walk if you don't valet, which we didn't. Resort was nice, quiet (couple families, but not a lot of loud kids running around), and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: ChristianTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in April of 2009. We were fortunate to be able to reserve one of the cottages that is on the beach. In fact , it was the same unit where they filmed the movie, "Forgetting Sarah Marshall". Pretty cool! The cottage was awesome and the view of the ocean and mountains were amazing. The service and accommodations were first class! Entertainment is lacking, but the food is excellent. A great place to relax and enjoy your spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: I_wanna_go_to_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: I really didn't expect much going into our stay at Turtle Bay but was pleasantly surprised immediately upon arrival at this spectacular property! The hotel is older and somewhat dated - which was my prejudice going in. I do have to say that at check in they didn't have my reservation so I went to the business center to retrieve it from my email. Once I had my confirmation they sent me to a room which turned out to be a King room, because we were traveling with our children I had reserved a two Queen room so they had to move us. Also, the line at check in was quite long and the whole process took over an hour (not including the room changes). Luckily my husband was able to take the kids out to the pool during this time. At this point I wasn't overly impressed but that all faded away when I got to our room. It was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was wonderful. The sound of the surf amazing! Within a couple hours we were looking at our calendars in attempt to extend our stay! I recommend eating poolside, the pool service was great and food good - better than the restaurants on site. The kids pool with water slide was a huge hit! I had a fantastic beach side massage - it was a great experience! And my husband loved the golf course! We all loved seeing the turtles up close on the beach! (Please, people don't touch them!) There are so many family activities! A stay at Turtle Bay (once you get through the check in process) is the essence of a relaxing vacation! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “What dreams are made of......”
Reviews.Author: poolq2010
Reviews.Content: Beauty is all I can say. The staff were very friendly and courteous. We rented a jeep wrangler and the weather was perfect for a drive in the country. Turtle bay has been the nicest resort/hotel we've stayed at. Being on the north shore this keeps us away from the city and noise. We decided to drive to honolulu and forgot we were on vacation once we go in the city limits. It was hectic. While we were looking for a place to eat we asked a City hospitality guide where parking was and they were not too hospitable. As soon as we ate we left the City of Honolulu. Once we exited the city limits and were in the country. we felt relaxed and back on vacation. Being the only Hotel/Resort that is very luxurious on the country. we were very satisfied with our room. Our room overlooked the Swimming/snorkeling bay. I Believe all rooms have view of the ocean.We left the window open at night just to hear the soothing crashing waves. It's been over a year since we have been there but the memory is as vivid in my mind like it was last week. Like I stated if you have never been to Hawaii try this hotel first and you won't be disappointed. North SHore is awesome and still all natural. I noticed alot of bumper stickers that said keep the Country Country. Now I understand. They don't need a walmart on the north shore. All it will do is bring development which will ruin it. I think Turtle bay is fine the way it is. Not too big and not too small. Haleiwa is a small tourist town that needs to stay that way. The Natives are very friendly if your friendly to them. I noticed alot of tourist there that treated the locals as servants and this disgusted me(Being a Native American myself). Some of the things we did were, Helicopter tour, Massage at hotel,driving around island and stopping at alot of the N Shore beaches. For beautiful snorkeling at a low cost, try Hanauma Bay State Park. Very Fun and Beautiful. Strong Swimmers are recommended past the reef. Past the reef is where there is an abundant of wildlife. sea turtles, blow fish. Turtle bay offers their own Helicopter tour. We didn't take advantage of this and regret it. We had to drive into Honolulu/Waikiki and that was a real bummer. I almost forgot, TB has a great Golf Course. I don't play myself, but I noticed it quit a bit while walking the grounds in the mornings. Try hiking the W shore. There's an old WW2 Bunker there. All the pictures taken were from just your plain jane Canon elph 8mp digital camera. As is, no touch ups. I'll stop here and let you imagine how beautiful it is. GO Hawaii, Go North Shore and Keep the Country COUNTRY.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore heaven”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: Its large and can get busy but there are so many spaces its not much of an issue. Beautiful views and outlook, great staff, very good food and not outrageous. Try and catch the Chefs Cooking Demonstration on Fridays - it is fabulous and included a glass of wine plus tasting. The coffee cart is good but closes too soon! at least 4.30pm would be better. A fantastic base to explore the beautiful North Shore - a car is pretty much essential though.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Time”
Reviews.Author: hustoncs
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Turtle Bay after a 6 night stay. We enjoyed the hotel very much the staff was friendly and helpful and you can’t beat the location. The food and drinks at the hotel were very good and priced appropriately for a resort in Hawaii, so no surprises there. Yes there is a $20.00 resort fee, but this is a reasonable charge for parking, internet access, and a daily paper. On the Waikiki side there is parking and internet access charges in excess of this fee at most hotels. The grounds are very nice, but we spent the bulk of our time exploring the North side of the island. A great place for breakfast and to bring food back to the room is Ted’s Bakery close to Shark’s Cove. The room had a slight smell, but all rooms that we’ve been to on Maui, Kauai, and Hawaii “the big island” have the same problem it’s the humidity. Places to see that are an easy drive from the hotel are; Shark’s Cove, Waimea Beach, Waimae Valley Botanical Garden, and the Japanese Temple over at the Valley of the Temples. This side of the island has so many beaches so if you are a beach person this is the place. Just go out and enjoy. We would come back to here for sure. Also a nice touch in the room and so far the first that I have seen is a pretty good docking station for your Ipod to play back music. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Go for the great location, if nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: happyhappyhappy2
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort (TBR) isn't cheap. I think some people get disappointed with the resort because they are paying more than the average hotel and therefore think they should be getting a fancier room or resort. Turtle Bay is beautiful. It's surrounded by the ocean for goodness sake. The grounds are gorgeous. That being said, the rooms are okay at best. They are aged, and have a strange (and not very pleasant) smell. I rejected the first room we were given, in part for this reason. The second room had the same smell, but by the time we got to it, I was getting used to the smell. It did not bother me after a very short period of time. I wouldn't attribute the hotel smell to it being dirty - Hawaii is a humid place. That being said, the location of Turtle Bay is the best part of the resort. The North Shore is the best part of Oahu. I highly recommend the resort, despite the aged, stinky rooms. Oh, and there isn't a whole lot to do at night, but I highly recommend dining on the beach at Ola. The garlic edamame is so yummy! Also, we LOVED Haleiwa, which isn't far from TBR. They have the best sashimi at the Breakers restaurant and bar. I had enough room left over for shaved ice on the way back to TBR. So, the morale of the story is go to TBR to relax and eat well! :)

Reviews.Title: “So Relaxing!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachMama44
Reviews.Content: Like many others on the site we were going to Turtle Bay a little wary, but were relieved to find that many of the complaints or problems others experienced were, of no issue at all. We were well informed about the resort fee when we booked our vacation. We did book through an agent however, and she was able to get some great deals, like free breakfast at Palm Terrace every morning, and free admission to the Polynesian Cultural Center, Luau, and Night Show. Ok yes the food and drinks at resort are very expensive, but we had a car and loved exploring the little towns around the resort area. Our favorite place to go and eat was in Haleiwa. Lots of little eateries and restraunts that were delightful. We went to the nearby "Shark's Cove" for some amazing snorkeling. So much fun, so many fish and even some turtles. We loved that. Our room was clean, and newly renovated. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. Our view from our Lanai was amazing. We loved having our morning coffee out there every morning. We went to Wakikki one day to visit, and I was so glad we didn't stay there. The North Shore's laid back atmosphere, was exactly what we were looking forward too in a vacation. There is not much or any for that matter nightlife activities, but like I said drive into Haleiwa and you'll find lots going on. We mostly called it an early night most nights, and were up bright and early exited to explore, relax, or my favorite snorkel. We were there for 10 days and wish that we could have stayed longer. I miss it so much! Hope this helps, don't pay too much attention to the naysayers, if you go planning to have a good time you will! Most people don't know how to take a vacation anyway.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose, but will likely not be back”
Reviews.Author: Frannie A
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at Turtle Bary Resort (after spending 6 nights in Waikiki); we really wanted to go to the North Shore and this was really the only hotel option we had while booking through our travel agent. Resort is huge, its a bit dated feeling, so I was not completely wowed. We did splurge a little to make sure we had a room with a big Lanai - this was definitely worth it and our favourite part of the resort. We walked around the resort when we first got there and made reservations at the restaurant on the beach - dinner was very nice, but with only 2 other tables in use we didn't wind of having needed to make a reservation. Each night we made sure to enjoy the sunset from our Lanai, but other than that we did not spend much time at the resort. We used our rental car and spent the days and ate the majority of our meals in Haleiwa (also Sunset Beach Pipeline). We were in LOVE with Haleiwa and look forward to coming back another day and rental a vacation property in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: loves2ski
Reviews.Content: We took my 84 year old mother in law to Hawaii for her birthday. We found a great rate on Expedia, so we booked the trip. We were well aware of the $20.00 a day resort fee because we had read on other reviews about it. We were a little hesitant due to the other reviews that we had been reading, but we were EXTREMELY happy and surprised at how wonderful the entire stay was! We wanted relaxation, and we got it! We don't like people fussing over us, so we were also happy with the moderate amount of attention we were given. I will say, the front desk staff could have been a little nicer. Hawaii has passed laws since this hotel was built that do not allow a hotel to be so close to a beach. This is a WONDERFUL reason to like this hotel and appreciate the "old Hawaii" feel of it. We walked right out of the hotel and you are on the beach! That is hard to find in Hawaii for this price. We also loved the golf courses. This is where LOST is filmed, so we were excited (and a little spooked) driving our golf carts through the "dense" tropical forrests. There were flowers EVERYWHERE! The Arnold Palmer course is especially wonderful. I think it is hole #17, but just as we were driving up near the green, the sun began to set and the hole is SO close to the ocean. We admit, we lingered there and let the other golfers pass us in order to take that view and moment in! The restaurant at the Golf Club is WONDERFUL! Overall, I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE, but I would tell you to go to the local grocery store on your way in and buy snacks and soda pop/liquor to keep in your room's refrigerator. The cost of drinks at the Hotel is OUTRAGEOUS! One more thing, they allowed us a late checkout with no penalty! That was very nice, as we were able to get a little more ocean/pool time in, and take a quick nap before getting on the long plane ride home. AMAZING views!!!!!!!!! If you go here, enjoy the "Old Hawaii" feel! It is quickly leaving the island... : (

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTMENT after a 2 year wait”
Reviews.Author: cornney
Reviews.Content: This resort -- the surrounding grounds are beautiful. We saved for 2 years to pay for this trip and what a waste of our money it was. The 20 resort fee that was a complete surprise ... we prepaid for the room and found that out after getting there. The rooms are outdated, the staff rude, and the restaurants are OVERPRICED my goodness! The beaches while beautiful are dangerous in my opinion , there is only one place that you can walk without getting your feet pierced. To add insult to injury, there are horrible flies over your food in the dining room. The major place you can eat cost 32 per person including children for a meal. I was almost in tears by the time we left. WHAT THE? what kind of resort is this? A mistake in my opinion, I will NEVER go back NOR will I recommend it to anyone. Its so bad none of the activity places in the area will come there to pick you up. I am so disappointed that a resort that charges this much money in these times do not care about giving a better service and quality to its guest.. boo Turtle Resort boo hooo

Reviews.Title: “Not going back ...”
Reviews.Author: BellaScottsdale
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and views are lovely, but that's really all I can say. The hotel itself is OLD and VERY OUTDATED! The hotel staff wasn't friendly or helpful. The food was extremely expensive! $15.00 for a cheeseburger, $25.00 for the breakfast buffet. The Spa was really small, and really they shouldn't call it a spa at all! At night, watch out for the centipedes on the grass! They are extremely painful once bitten! To bad, we really looked forward to coming here, but it's doubtful we'll go back! The outside is lovely, but the inside needs a lot of work. Note: there is also a $20.00 daily hotel fee, so add that to your budget. You also have to keep a towel card, so if you don't return the towel, they charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Cottage was beautiful but thats it!”
Reviews.Author: cmarcoly
Reviews.Content: We have been to hawaii many times, many islands and stayed at some top notch properties so Turtle Bay was on our list to try. Having been here once just to check out the area we noticed then it was a gorgeous location but a very tired property. After hearing that it went through a renovation we decided it was time to try it as a vacation spot. Well thank God my husband booked the cottages because that is the memory we will take with us. The cottages are spacious, relaxing and pretty. We loved the hamocks and the view was breath taking however the rest of the property was such a let down. The Spa (if you want to call it that), was tiny, old and about the size of a closet. $140.00 for a treament and no great spa to enjoy before or after was rediculous. The restaurants were lacking good service and cleanliness. In the evening if you are going to charge $30 + for an entree add a nice tablecloth and it really gives a cleaner more evening feel. Overall the owners and management are really missing it! Put money into this property, hire younger employees and replace anything old and delapitated. Put in a great spa and then we would love to stay here again, but only in the cottages!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, but take a lot of money.”
Reviews.Author: amyanon
Reviews.Content: We came from the UK and spent the first three days of our holiday in the Outrigger in Kaui, which was fantastic, but we were expecting something amazing from Turtle Bay, where we went for a week, given the price of the rooms per night. When we arrived in our car, we had to park miles away from the hotel, as the resort rents out their carpark to the public using the beach/golf courses. If you want valet service it is 10$ a time plus tip. Our Ocean View Room had a view of the roof of one of the lower levels which was littered with cigarette butts. The room was adequate, but just a bit tired and in need of a rehaul. The swimming pool had loungers that were so close together it was like sardines in a tin. There are not enough loungers given the amount of families there and once there was just no space at the pool at all. There seem to be a lot of people using the pool that were not staying at the resort, and the staff do nothing about this at all and just let it happen. The thing about Turtle Bay is that the location is beautiful and deserted, but because it is deserted they feel justified in charging a fortune for everything. The most galling thing was the 20$ a day fee just to use the resort-hang on didn't we pay almost $5000 for this resort to begin with? The food is pretty good-especially at Ola, the beach restaurant which is romantic after dark with the tiki torches all lit, but at $33 for a steak and $7 dollars for a beer, we were averaging about $120 a meal at night. My advice, drive down to Foodland, buy some beers and put them in your fridge, and have a few before and after dinner! Having said that, seeing the sea turtles on the beach at the resort almost made up for allof this.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need renovating”
Reviews.Author: returnpost
Reviews.Content: The air handling unit sounded like we were still inside the jet plane that we took to hawaii. There was also a noise like it was raining or hailing inside the wall where the air handling duct was. The shower walls are in need of an update and there was some mildow around on the tiles in the shower. The pool does need to be resurfaced and the hallway carpeting needs to be replaced. The pools deep end is 11 feet deep and there are no lifeguards at the pool. If they do renovate this resort then it will be an amazing resort but untill then I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: lorianddon
Reviews.Content: We chose Turtle Bay Resort because we did not wish to be in the "big city" craziness of Waikiki. Friends of ours stayed in Waikiki and related the "not fun" trip they had because of it. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip mostly because of the staff, homey atmosphere and thorough enjoyment we had at turtle bay. We spent a lot of our time in Haliewa, ate at local restaurants as well as at Turtle Bay. We had the best people taking care of us at the hotel....we were well taken care of. I cannot say enough about the wonderful staff. They were always there and willing to help in any way they could. Bonus hint: book your trip through Orbitz...use their all in one, inclusive bookings. We booked our hotel, flights and rental car through Orbitz and got the best rates...again, stay at Turtle Bay....it is quiet, relaxing and wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice escape from the city”
Reviews.Author: lavrose817
Reviews.Content: I came here with my family and had a wonderful time. The room was comfortable and had a fantastic view. The grounds were kept immaculately trimmed and the pools and hot tubs were very clean and enjoyable. Although the resort itself is a little off the beaten path, it makes for a great place to getaway and relax. The staff was very helpful and arranged a horseback riding excursion for us. While a bit bumpy because of the trees and the sand, it was an unforgettable experience. We also went swimming on the grounds we saw the huge turtles that the resort is known for, as well as a variety of tropical fish. The warm waters were crystal clear. You can also see a variety of tropical fish. it was definitely a world away from Waikiki Beach, which was teaming with tourists. Being from South Florida I expected to be bored with the beaches in Hawaii, but I found this resort was a completely new experience. You felt secluded, but also like you could go into the main tourist area of the island if you desired. Definitely would return!

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: charlotte564
Reviews.Content: Pros: the scenary really is beautiful. But, it's on a public beach so you can get the scenary without having to stay here. Which leads me to... Cons: Where to begin? The room: we thought we were splurging with a 'deluxe ocean view room' but if that was a deluxe, I'm afraid of what their regular room is like. I have stayed in Motel 8s that are nicer. very dark bathrooms with slippery floors, TV and alarm clock from the early 1990s (I'm not kidding), beautiful view of a roof, no place to sit except one desk chair or the bed, etc. Then on the resort itself - nothing particularly special about it. It was incredibly crowded - some sort of chorus competition took place while we were there and there were about 400-500 10 year old girls for the first few days. The beach is small and has a lot of coral so you can't swim in most of it. It's public access and also shared with a condo community so it's always crowded. You can rent snorkeling equipment but it's incredibly low quality stuff - we went through a few pairs of goggles and fins and couldn't find anything that fit. On the other side of the hotel there are a series of pools - several are dominated by unaccompanied kids, and then the big pool attracts a motley crue of teenagers and unusual characters. I'd recommend bringing your iPod. We moved chairs a few times to avoid kids who sat down next to us and promptly went on speaker phone to talk with friends. Not to sound grumpy, but I don't want to listen to an hour-long conversation about waxing when I'm at the pool. Also, you really are a ways from restaurants so you have at least a 30 minute drive if you want to avoid the hotel's overpriced and not very good food. I really can't stress enough that this place wasn't worth the money or time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: trippen56
Reviews.Content: No knit picking here, Just returned from a week at Turtle Bay and it is a great resort. We stayed in a cottage and I recommend it over the hotel rooms although I was never in one of the hotel rooms I cannot imagine them being nicer, they are however less expensive. The pool and beach area's were perfect. On site snorkling is ok, Sharks Cove is much better but get there early (before 10 to miss crouds). My daughter and I took surf lessons that are given in the bay in front of the cottages and had a great time. I was told by another guest that the Kayak trips from the hotel were very good. I recommend Lea Lea's restaurant (TB golf course), the best food we had the whole week. Went to The Kahala Resort for swimming with the dolphins which was great. I am glad I decided not to stay at the Kahala as it's location is poor and it's amenities are not near what the are at TB. I recommend the PCC, Wiamea falls and The Kualoa Ranch tour. Don't head into Wiamea before 10:00 AM as nothing is open and all closes up except restaurants at 5:00 PM. Ted's bakery has good food and is close as is Foodland. This was one of the best vacations we've had and cannot wait to return to TB.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: warpig2
Reviews.Content: If there were one word to describe Hawaii for me it would definitely be OVERRATED. I understand many people go there never witnessing a tropical “paradise” setting elsewhere so they’d probably found Hawaii to be the best place ever. There’s no question Hawaii (especially Maui) is pretty. However, I’ve found MUCH better, MUCH nicer, MUCH cheaper and MANY more to do in some third world countries! The place is a textbook tourist trap with an extreme lack of variety: paying for parking EVERYWHERE, “aloha” attire as if it’s mandatory uniform, brochures page after page of the same activities over and over again such as luaus, hula lessons, mai tai cruises etc. All of the above contribute to a lack of an “unbeaten path” for the more adventurous and daring. When I did come across a new area to explore, a big “NO TRESPASSING” sign is posted. Many of the locals are rude and unprofessional. Go down to Chinatown and you can see many doping and dealing right in the pubic eye. There is a huge crystal meth problem and they still give off the impression that tourists are are “invading their native land” and creating “cultural genocide” probably not knowing that tourism makes up the majority of the revenue that Hawaii generates. The locals who are aware of the fact want the visitors to spend their money and leave. So much for “Aloha Spirit”… Traffic on the southern section of Oahu is hideous –it’s basically L.A. on an island. North Shore was supposedly away from tourists and less congested which is partially true when compared to Waikiki and Honolulu. But I still sat in long traffic lines on my way up to my hotel in North Shore because all the tourists wanted to hang out there. And speaking of the hotel… Supposedly a getaway from crowds and the best the island has to offer, Turtle Bay Resort’s slogan “True Hawaii” was well represented: expensive, tourists, a payment for everything and a total rip-off. The resort grounds were very nice but at $260+ a night you still had a room that consisted of a moldy stench that filled the room, a clogged air vent full of dust, feet sticking the bathroom tile (even when clean), mold growing between the grout, bed bugs, putting clothes in the drawer cabinets created mildew smell on clothing, outdated furniture and appliances and the bottled water in the room still wasn’t complimentary. It’s all stuff I normally wouldn’t mind in Southeast Asia paying $5 a night for but when paying $260+ a night, it left me heated. Not to mention a $30 resort fee… for what?! Everything was paid for upfront but I still got charged AGAIN. Eventually I was reimbursed after a couple days but it was still an inconvenience nonetheless. To top it off, during my stay there the resort was evacuated due to fire 2 doors away. It probably wasn’t the resort’s fault, but it didn’t make me enjoy it any better. If that was the best the island had to offer, I couldn’t imagine what it would be elsewhere. The typical scenario for a tropical vacations I’ve had consisted of sipping cocktail’s or a cold beer on the beach, getting massaged and fanned for hours. Not so in Hawaii; it’s illegal to drink on the beach. Just swimming or snorkeling on the beach can get a bit tricky with the inconsistent weather. I’d look out the door ready for the water, by the time I’d get there it would be raining and windy. I’m sure it has it’s long periods of sunshine, just not when I was there. Hawaii does have it’s scenic side and nice beaches but it lacked a “jaw dropping effect” that I’ve experienced elsewhere which I hoped I would get considering the price tag involved. In my opinion it just wasn’t enough to make up for it or lack of activity. The islands are small enough that once driven through or visited a few dozen times there becomes a lack of enthusiasm, a non existent things-to-do list and a huge presence of boredom. Visiting Hawaii as a tourist with lots of money who has never visited many exotic destinations prior would probably enjoy the place and may think they’re getting their money’s worth. But visiting as traveler or adventurer, I don’t think it’s the right place to go. If so, I think it may leave you feeling bitter and ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but could have better service”
Reviews.Author: FAFO58
Reviews.Content: wonderful resort. rooms are a bit outdated, especially the bathrooms, but the resort is lovely. the food at 21 north was wonderful. Ola was extremely overpriced and really less than average. The concierge is very little helpful! they say they have mail service, but what they really mean is that they sell stamps and send your mail, they dont know the prices of overseas mail, they wont weigh your mail. we got a free ticket to the polynesian cultural centre through our package, but had to arrange our own transportation as the hotel doesnt have a complimentary shuttle service. the concierge wanted to charge us 50 dollars plus taxes each way for the 5 miles trip.. ridiculous.....there is a city bus just outside by the parking lot, a ride is 2 dollars 25 to the polynesian cultural centre. the concierge wont even inform you about this possibility. but all in all it is paradise, the beach is wonderful, the views from the rooms astonishing....

Reviews.Title: “Come here if you don't understand the "pleasures" of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: Martha_FL
Reviews.Content: We chose Turtle Bay resort for our short honeymoon in Feb 2009. We wanted a quiet place, with nature close to us and budget options in terms of food. We based our trip on reviews from TripAdvisor. We stayed in a wonderful Oceanfront room (whichever type that has a balcony) with a breathtaking view at the lagoon. We never shut the window shields, and at any moment at night/morning we could see waves and sun from our bed. It's indescribable.... I guess we were lucky to stay in a renovated room, there was nothing to complain about. Everything was new, clean and shiny. We never ate at the resort after reading all the reviews. We shopped a few times for breakfast and snacks at Ted's Bakery (10 min. drive) and Foodland in Haleiwa, and ate around the island without really caring about it. We enjoyed walking along the ocean to either side of the resort. Coming from East Coast and having 5hr time difference we easily woke up at 7 am and did not have any company at the beaches. It was a lot to see and watch around, plenty of wild creatures and beautiful flowers and trees. We first considered staying at Waikiki and searched for hotels. When we came there from gorgeous Turtle Bay, it became sooo obvious we made a right choice. Crowds, shopping, boring-boring bay... And we were at famous North Shore, watched huge waves and crazy surfers and there were so few people compared to Waikiki... If you like to walk and enjoy nature, definitely take time to visit Waimea Falls Park (yes, several scenes of Lost were shot there), and watch the waves at the Waimea Bay - just 20 minutes from the resort. We'll come back to the resort, no matter what...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel Lacking in Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: altrbt
Reviews.Content: We live on Oahu so Turtle Bay Resort was a stay-vacation for us. Make sure to check out the property’s Web site because its advance payment options are less than kamaaina (local discount) rates. We booked an Ocean Front King Deluxe since the deluxe rooms are the only ones with full balconies. We were disappointed that our “Ocean Front” room overlooked a huge, massive rooftop, swimming pool and porte cochere area. Since half the view was the ocean, I suppose it did qualify since in Hawaii, an Ocean VIEW room qualifies if you can see the ocean by stretching your head around the side of balcony. However, with taxes and that ridiculous $20 resort fee, paying $300/night was way overpriced. The bathroom was extremely dated with a showerhead that shot straight to the back and did not move. The sink head is positioned so washing you hands causes water to flow onto the sink. In the bedroom area, the bedside drawers are old and scratched, along with the walls and the baseboards. Everything is just very worn. One thing I wasn’t expecting was how dusty the room was. I think they need to clean their filters because there was a layer of dust everywhere. At first I thought maybe housekeeping was a little lax, however, I left a black covered case out over night and in the morning, it too was covered with a layer of dust. The $20 resort fee is ridiculous and the reasoning of doing so by the hotel management laughable. They say that it is in result of comments made by past guests. Yes, I’m sure that past guests said to stop nickle-and-diming, however, I’m pretty confident that they meant the hotel should just include some of the amenities as complimentary as do so many other hotels – not to force a huge fee down our throat. The $20 resort fee covers overnight self parking, local and toll-free/credit card long distance access calls, wireless Internet, daily newspaper, self-serve coffee in room, in-room safe, one-hour of snorkeling equipment, one-hour of tennis court time and access to the fitness center. Resort fees are just another way for hotels to make their published room rates look lower than they actually are. • Phone calls: It is ridiculous to say that phone calls are a benefit since most people carry cell phones, many without roaming charges. • Parking: This is not Waikiki with limited land space and therefore, charging for parking is wrong. The Kohala Coast on the Big Island, for example is very expansive, and therefore, they do not charge for self parking. • Wireless Internet: It costs the hotel almost nothing to offer Internet service since they already have it for their business. • Room coffee/newspaper/safe: I mean, really? Might as well list the hairdryer and ironing board on the resort fee list too. • Fitness Center: There is nothing special about the fitness center. There is not full-time attendant on duty, no special amenities in the center. Many hotels include it as a complimentary guest amenity. • Tennis/Snorkeling: The hotel charges you if you go over the one-hour free rental time. Since you tend to lose track of time when leisurely snorkeling, this results in another opportune time for them to make more money off hotel guests. Regarding staff friendliness – the front desk and restaurant staff were pleasant. However, whoever mans the phones must do so part-time. At two different hours of the day, we tried to reach the operator. It rang repeatedly and we had to hang up and try again multiple times. At the pool, the attendants left much to be desired. They were nice when you went to exchange/return towels. However, their work stops there. Turtle Bay Resort is very windy. I saw several things laying on the pool deck because of the wind. The item that stands out is a diaper – it was new and must have dropped out of someone’s bag. It sat right in front of the pool attendant towel desk for an hour. I watched them point and stare at it. It eventually flew into the pool and stayed there until a hotel guest took it out and placed it on the side. When I left a couple hours later, it was still there so I just threw it away. I guess it must not be the pool attendant’s job or maybe they have strict union rules about not going beyond their job description. We also had some challenges with the pool food service. When we first arrived at the pool in the morning, we had someone from the pool restaurant come by a couple times in the next hour to see if we wanted to order something. However, after that, we couldn’t get anyone to come by our chairs for the next couple hours. We finally had to walk up to the restaurant and get our own menus, which they clearly did not appreciate us doing, and told us that they would come to us and take our order. A half hour later they finally did come by. However, after saying all the above, if you are looking for an Oahu resort outside of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, Turtle Bay Resort is your best bet. The only other option is Ihilani Resort & Spa, however, it is in the middle of nowhere. Turtle Bay Resort is near the must-visit Polynesian Cultural Center and Haleiwa surf town.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Nrizk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 14 years ago when it was an aging Hilton resort. I would gladly take the aging Hilton over this. The setting is spectacular but this cannot compensate for the rooms. I feel I've been ripped off. If this was a $100 hotel, I wouldn't complain. There is a sickening smell in the rooms (we tried two rooms). I don't know if it's mould, dampness or something else. We were promised "queen" beds. The beds are, in fact, double--and not very comfortable. The a/c grills are rusted. Paint is peeling in places. Furniture is chipped. The bathroom cupboards don't close properly. There is another unpleasant odour coming from the outer-bathroom / closet area. And...they have the gall to charge a resort fee! I would stay away. It is outrageous what they are charging to stay at what is--at best--a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jdkhunter
Reviews.Content: I thought the condition of the resort was good, I know some reviews touched on this but I have to say they must be picky or an unusual occurrence. The Daily resort fee was a joke. With that fee you get self parking which is open to the public. This caused several problems like trying to find a spot, walking a long way, security. It was so bad people were hopping the curbs to park on the grass. You could pay an extra $10 for valet parking. The food besides being overpriced (cheapest food was a hot dog $8+ tax) was only average. The best was the breakfast buffet (Barbara makes a killer omelet!!) Other reviews wrote to save a few bucks go to Haleiwa but just as expensive. In Laie you have McDonalds, taco bell, pizza hut, L&L barbeque and a food liner grocery in both directions from the resort. The amenities are great, snorkeling, golfing, beach, scenery. The beach is public so unless you get to the beach before 9 am forget about an umbrella. Despite all this I would come back again and recommend it. Just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT GETAWAY ON OAHU”
Reviews.Author: alacraft
Reviews.Content: Pleasant Holidays book this resort in a package deal from LAX to HNL including airfare, hotel and 5 day auto rental we paid about 2,600 for 5 nights. Perhaps a bit high, but it was booked 3 weeks before departure. The flight over was oversold, the plane was crowded. Hertz car rental was fast and efficient, the road to the north shore an easy drive and the resort-Turtle Bay- was beautiful. The 3rd floor of the south wing had a view of the snorkel bay. It's a shallow bay, not easy to do much swimming in but the snorkling was great. Saw no turtles, we went down the road a bit to see them, but saw plenty of fish.
