The room was clean, with plenty of storage. A small refridgerator allowed us to do grocery shopping and eat on our small balcony. The resort restaurants were fine, just a bit expensive, and I thought the food was just ok. Teds Bakery on the main drag had wonderful fresh pastry every morning and made eggs, and sandwiches to eat on their picnic tables or take out. The resorts, reportedly was 90% full but it was quiet, and clean, and I much preferred it to the Waikiki area where the surf was that week. So crowded and noisy I was happy to drive the 40 minutes to Turtle Bay resort. Did not play tennis or ride horses or take the helicopter ride, but did use the small gym and it was convenient. I would recomment Turtle Bay to anyone, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “True Hawai'i if not true luxury”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu10
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel. This is the place. This is Hawaii. We never even left the resort. The negatives expressed on other reviews are generally true. Yes, the hotel is a little worn in places. Sure, the rooms are laughably decorated in a horrifying tableau of greens. You won't have a state of the art TV (why anyone would turn the thing on while on vacation here is beyond me). The room renovations do seem halfway done as evident by the brand new green marble tile floor against the 1980s green tiled shower. The food and drinks are overpriced. The $20 a day resort fee is stupid. A staff member will be rude to you. Someone's children will annoy you. And...absolutely NONE of this will even matter because this place is a true paradise. We stayed in a second floor Oceanview Room (the cheapest available) and were awestruck by the view of the palm trees, the pool, and the bay outside the room. The hotel is built on a peninsula. There cannot be a bad view from any of the rooms. The rooms are suprisingly very large. There will be plenty of storage space. The room includes a small fridge and two sinks. All the important things have been updated - new carpet, new floor in the bathroom, new furniture, and comfortable bed. You will not be dissappointed in the room. The location of the resort is perfect. The property is absolutely breathtaking. It's tucked in a serene corner of the island about an hour away from Honolulu. The beaches are pristine and quiet. We hiked all around the property and found our own private cove where we can relax for an afternoon. There are sea turtles swimming on the coast. There are reefs teeming with beautiful tropical fish for snorkeling (you will have one free hour of snorkel equipment rental with your room). The swimming pools are great. Watch the sun set from a hot tub. It's a great all around getaway resort. We had no problems with the service at the hotel. The staff is very kind and helpful. You will spend about $70-$80 a meal on this resort, but the meals are exceptionally good with incredible views while you dine. Do avoid the barfood items (burgers, wings, pizza)...they are overpriced and not very tasty. There really is no other place like this on Oahu. You will not regret staying here. It was easy to overlook the minor flaws. In fact, I hope the resort doesn't go through another major updating because the likes of me could never afford it afterward. Let's face it. You didn't come all the way here from the mainland to shop or experience the nightlife. You can do that at home. You came for island relaxation...and this is it. Thank you Turtle Bay for an unforgettable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back for SURE”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlinsb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful family vacation at Turtle Bay and will definitely return. The highlight of our trip by far was the kayak tour of Kawela Bay - you can book it with Captain Scott right on the resort's website. A blast, and great to learn a bit about the ecology of the area. Snorkeling at the resort's own beach was terrific, as was the kid's pool with the waterslide. The views from the rooms are indeed amazing - after we put the kids to bed, my husband and I would sit out there at night sipping wine, talking, and listening to the waves. Tips: try Jamieson's in Hali'ewa for dinner - inexpensive and tasty and great view of the sunset. Eat shave ice anywhere you can find it!

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: carpetOahu
Reviews.Content: i read a bunch of reviews here and i have to say i've stayed here many times being a resident of oahu. the rooms are newly remodeled and the balconies all have a view of the ocean. great hotel. great golf, the best place to stay on oahu. waikiki is a joke compared to this.

Reviews.Title: “Thats the true Hawaii - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: kolliwiehl
Reviews.Content: Extremly good service, nothing was too much to ask for, we did not like our 1st room overlooking the busy pool and in NO TIME we could move to another room, East Wing is the best, just a relaxing lovely place in a great central location on the north shore. I don't know what people here are complaining about. Rooms are older (NOT old) but very spacious, bright and clean with super comfi beds and free high speed internet access. Breakfast price is a bit on the expensive side but well worth it. The OLA restaurant on the beach is a casual and romantic place to dine serving extraordinary good food. The hotel gets a little quiet at night so if you are a party animal go to Waikiki. We loved the well stocked bottleshop and a quiet drink on the balcony under a million stars listening to the surf. Luau on Fridays is excellent. What did we miss...?? More days to stay and please consider bottle opener, wine glasses and a bit more coffee for the rooms. Overall an extremely pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazaing!”
Reviews.Author: SBLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend at the time (now my hubby) and I stayed at Turtle Bay and it was amazing. We had a Ocean view room, which was nicely decorated, super big, and comfortable. I wish there would have been another dresser, but other then that the room was perfect. The room had a fridge which was great for keeping fruit, yoghurt, and drink nice and cold. There was a supermarket not too far down the road, which was on the way to the hotel anyways so we stocked up on water, yoghurt, and snacks for the week. They sell fresh fruit off the street which is also super cheap, thus no need to pay for breakfast. We never tried the breakfast buffet so not sure how good it is, but all the restaurants are amazing. We loved the little coffee shop cart in the lobby, always super nice service and Lei Lei's was our "go to" spot. The ribs and the steak in peppercorn sauce are delicious as well as the ahi tuna and all the desserts ;-) YUMMY! The pool was in great shape and so were the hot tubs, the hotel at had a beach super close which was nice and they have a little restaurant right there, which was pretty good not as good as others though. Definitely try some of the hole in the wall places in town such as grass skirt grill, soooooo good. They have inexpensive burgers and sandwiches which are super good. Also I forgot the name but it's close to the grass skirt grill there is another sandwich place which super good and there is more outside seating and stuff. We are huge LOST fans so Oahu was great as the show is shot there and we saw many of the backgrounds for the show. Overall the hotel and trip was 5 stars for sure. If you love nature and are not a big fan of being in a big city on vacation, the north shore is the place to stay. Waikiki is nice, the beach is over crowded and everything is totally crammed in one place. The north shore has beautiful hikes and is great for a tropical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “If only the buffet wasn't such a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: avbooks
Reviews.Content: Perfect reception at the front desk. Excellent room, clean, good bed, spacious balcony, wonderful view. Excellent pool area. The down point is the Palm Terrace. I don't mind spending 360 $ per night for the room. But if they try to sell you a handfull of Corn Flakes for 6 $ each and expect a tip, I balk. If I choose to pick my own breakfast at the buffet it costs 48 $ for two persons, and if I want to take a trip to the salad bar for lunch it costs 50 Dollars, drinks not included. And the choice of salads is mediocre, no croutons of any kind, you have to guess what dressing you are taking. There is another restaurant, 21° North, just next door to it, which offers delicious food a la carte for dinner. Tip: Drive 6 miles to the east to Laie. There is a Foodland store. Get your cereals or salads there. Good choice of dressings, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Getaway - don't be fooled by negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: diver89
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Turtle Bay and I must say that other recent negative reviews certainly missed their marks. I spent half my vacation in Wiakiki and the other half on the North Shore at Turtle Bay. Once you get tired of the crowds, sirens, traffic, and the hussle of a large tourist district, arriving at Turtle Bay is a real treat. Like everyone else has said, the location is breathtaking. It is the only resort on the North Shore so the hotel doesn't have to compete for ocean views like elsewhere. Each room will have a great view, it just depends on what you want to look straight down on - a pool, a beach, or the rooftop of their conference center (which by the way is nicely covered with dark rocks - no wires, pipes or A/C units to look at). I had a ocean front king room facing West (over the conference center but I hardly look down since I have a magnificent ocean to look at) on the top floor. I travel regularly to resorts so I was impressed with how large the room and balcony were. I found the room to be well maintained, though not brand new. The bathrooms haven't been updated so they don't look 4 or 5 star but were clean and spacious nonetheless. The room was nicely decorated in a modern style and I really appreciated the building's older construction since I never heard any noices from my neighbors (unlike the paper thin walls of the hotel in Wiakiki). I didn't feel unsafe or nervious about by belongings since I used the room safe for my valuables. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful but then I didn't have any problems to complain about. The grounds are very well maintained which may speak to why they had a wedding there every day of my stay. Like someone else mentioned, they have a towel policy (pretty normal), free parking, and several restaurant choices. I ate at most but really liked "Lie Lie" at the golf center for its seafood. The food and amenities (spa, tennis and golf) aren't inexpensive - you're in Hawaii. If you want cheeper eats, try the shrimp stands further east or drive 10 miles into Haliewa. Don't miss the shaved ice! Also, for a little over $200, you can get a helicopter flight that takes you all over Oahu (including Pearl Harbor) right from the resort's helipad. (see Debbie at Paradise - she's a star employee) Overall, Turtle Bay is a beautiful resort, well maintained, quiet, with gorgeous landscapes and views. Go there if you want to relax and get away. Vacation is what you make of it. If you want a brand new hotel at a discounted price, try Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tired in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: EdandJane
Reviews.Content: This was a small business industry meeting with spouses. On the plus side, if you've never seen north coast w Banzai Pipeline surf, its worth it and the beaches are beautiful and used by locals. You don't get an exclusive feel to that area and there is something nice about that. Also on the plus side, the golf courses were top flite. The coffee table in our room had all these golf and tennis mags featuring the pro matches and camps and the golf holds up but the tennis facilities looked like they haven't seen a good day in years. The food was good and the service staff happy and helpful. But, man, the rooms need a facelift. You can tell some owner has been draining the hotel and not doing maintenance. Finally, its an hour to drive back to Honolulu and there isn't much else to do out that end of the island. Finally, tourism in general is hurting in Hawaii now but Turtle Bay looked like the word is out on it

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnLSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Turtle Bay Resort. Read the reviews here at Tripadvisor before booking. I also agree that some of the reviews are overly harsh on this hotel. My wife and I are both seasoned travellers and found this hotel to be an excellent place to stay. Firstly, the location of the hotel is spectacular. It is located on the North Shores of Oahu and far and away from the traffic, the noises, and the hassles of Waikiki/ Honolulu. Most go to Hawaii to enjoy and take in the beauty of locale, not to be stuck in traffic nor to be in the mist of a busy city. There are miles of beaches around the hotel. You can drive to the other sites of the island as well. It will take you about 60 minutes to get to Waikiki if you so wish - the drive along Highway 83 is very scenic and well worth the time. Secondly, the service of the hotel is excellent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff is also very attentive. Thirdly, the room are in good shape. One of the biggest worry I had before booking was the condition of the room. As a result, I decided to stay at the Ocean Front Cottage. No regrets! They do cost more but in my opinion was well worth the money. The room was well furnished, clean and open to the beach. You can walk directly from your room out to the beach. Check out the movie " Forgetting Sarah Marshall" to see how the resort is like and especially the Ocean Front Cottages. Overall, the stay at Turtle Bay was a positive experience. I travelled to Hawaii more than ten times but have always till now avoided Oahu due to the hussle/ hassle of Waikiki. But staying at Turtle Bay and the North Shore of Oahu is a good alternative and provides a much different experience to a traveller to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Just keep saying to yourself, "Location, location, location"”
Reviews.Author: hjf46
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii. We chose the Turtle Bay Resort because everyone kept warning us to stay away from Waikiki (too crowded). Turtle Bay bills itself as "True Hawaii." You definitely avoid the crowds and big city feel of the southern parts of the island. The property is absolutely beautiful and every room has an amazing ocean view (this is possible because of the orientation of the hotel on a slight outcropping). The hotel is right on the beach and the atmosphere is amazing. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants because we were too busy exploring the island. The room was very large and the closets were huge. Unfortunately, this hotel needs a lesson in how to clean a room. The main parts of the room were clean (sinks, sheets, etc.), but the rest of the room was definitely not. It really needed to be deep cleaned. The doors were dirty, the closet handles were dirty, the light switches were grimy etc. You get the idea. This was definitely not resort-level clean. Fortunately, we were in Hawaii to be outside, not inside, so we just tried to focus on the good. One other negative is that the parking lot is a 5 min walk (free though!), so if you have someone who doesn't walk well, you would need to drop them off before parking or pay for valet. Don't miss the nearby Polynesian Cultural Center and be sure to eat at Kua Ana Sandwich in Haleiwa!!

Reviews.Title: “We were Burglarized at Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: VisitorToOahu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay Resort & Hotel. Somebody entered our room in our absence with electronic key card and burglarized us. We tried to contact Hotel management but they ignored us. Nobody was available. Police came, took report and we never heard from them again. Nobody wanted to investigate. Maid and towel boy were the only two strangers in our room in our absence. Nobody wanted to contact them for questioning. The same maid didn't show up for work the following day and days after, and until our stay was over. Head of Hotel's Security was a dishonest liar who should never hold such a sensitive position.. Every Law enforcement officer should be ashamed of him. Same night we were burglarized there was a women violated at the Hotel. Police was all over. What a terrible place ! We left for mainland with empty pockets, burglarized and w/o our possessions. We regret our decision to stay there very much. I guess, it all looks nice until something happens. Be very, very careful before you decide to sleep at Turtle Bay Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of room location!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pupepause
Reviews.Content: We booked our room 8 months in advance--Ocean Front. What a surprise to see we were overlooking two MAJOR SPRALLING roof tops. We were informed by the front desk there was no where for us to move since the hotel was 91% full. There was no way this was an ocean front. At our suggestion we asked about upgrading. They said we could upgrade to one of the cottages ($475.00 per night) For the first nights stay they gave us the rate we paid for our first reservation after I called two managers for this request. This is a “preferred” hotel but doesn’t match the service of many other “preferred” hotels we have stayed. The North Shore is beautiful and that is what Turtle Bay has going for it but you most certainly pay for it. You have your own private concierge while staying in the cottage and they are attentive but at almost $500.00 per night we were not inclined to tip them. The hotel needs a face lift---our bathroom had paint chips in quite a few places and our deck was much worse. If we are going to pay $500.00 per night I expect the room to be in excellent condition. If you are going to stay in the ocean front room make sure you request the side of the hotel that over looks the beach and has a long rock wall. This is the only side of the hotel that doesn’t over look roofs and pools unless you stay in the cottages which are truly WONDERFUL!!! (room 115)

Reviews.Title: “Drinks and great food by the beach is just perfect”
Reviews.Author: toddSFBAY
Reviews.Content: Went to turtle bay for a wedding and was just blown away. The web site with it's great pictures doesn't give you the complete picture. Here it is... laying on the beach with only a few people around (not like Waikiki) with a great draft beer, and perfect kid friendly snorkeling. Then lunch a few steps away with the best view and a nice windward side breeze. Great humorous service and very good food. You can actually go to this resort (pay $5 for parking) and use the beach and the beach side restaurant. I plan to do this every time I go now.

Reviews.Title: “Olsen Villas- undoubtedly would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: hem_iamy
Reviews.Content: Husband, 2 young daughters and I booked a one bedroom unit (302) through the Olsen Villas website for dates 4/25-5/1 and paid $260 per night, less than half the rate for a villa through the Turtle Bay Resort (Olsen Villas are owned and rented independently within Turtle Bay). Although the units' layout would be more aptly described as condominiums, parking for the villas has gated access as well as gated entry from the beach side (the first floor units have open patio areas, however). We were extremely pleased with the unit upon our arrival, with photos on the website accurately depicting the unit we had rented. Upon entry to the left was a large, tastefully appointed bath with travertine subway-type tile flooring and in the stand-alone steam shower (which was slightly smaller than I'd like personally, but the uber-deep soaking tub more than made up for it). We appreciated the neutral tones throughout, the updated trim, space-conscious pocket door for the wc, and properly-functioning stackable washer and dryer (detergent and dryer sheets were provided, no bleach however). The galley kitchen echoed the neutral color scheme with granite countertops/backsplash and high-end appliances. No dishwasher, but it really wasn't missed. Although the unit was studio-style, there was a half wall separating the bedroom and living areas, along with a large storage area/closet. The flooring in these areas was an attractive dark hardwood covered with neutral area rugs, and had comfortable furnishings. The mattress at first did seem a tad flimsy, but we had no problems sleeping through the night. Our girls slept well on their roll-out bed and pack n’ play (which was not present in the unit upon our arrival, but was delivered in a reasonable amount of time after we placed a call to the unit manager). The lanai was furnished with a wooden/cushioned chaise lounge, matching side table and round dining table with seating for 4; we enjoyed relaxing there during our breakfasts and whenever we weren’t out sightseeing. Unit 302 is on the top floor of the complex and had a wonderful view of the grounds and lagoon. The one somewhat major negative which I considered in my ratings of the unit (and not giving a 5 for everything) is that the views of sunrise and sunset were blocked by a. the eastern half of the villa complex and b. the taller main building of the resort, but we were often out and about at sunset. The unit was bright, well kept and was without any insect pests, nor did we hear neighbor noise unless we were outside. We did not require any maintenance other than for staff to bring the pack n’ play, as everything within the unit functioned as it should. 302 was very clean but not spotless (literally- some of the chrome fixtures/stainless steel had water spots, and upon closer inspection during the week we found the beginnings of mold on the ceiling next to the shower. One other idiosyncracy was that we would catch the occasional whiff of sulfur when first turning un the shower, but it would dissipate within a minute or two). All in all we had a great time during our stay and would not hesitate to book the villa again. The unit and grounds were beautiful, although construction was being done at the time of our stay along the entry of the resort marred the views there. Nathan Olsen was efficient and quick to respond to contact during the reservation process, and a handout outlining the details of the rental was emailed before our trip; we used the ‘contact’ function on the site for specific questions, all were answered within a reasonable amount of time and to our satisfaction. We saw between 30-50% occupancy of the villa complex during our stay, and noted that the online rates would decrease as the desired booking date would draw closer;- something to keep in mind for last-minute travel : ) Please have a look at my other posted photos of the unit (within profile- posted first, reviewed second!) Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Great time - know what to expect...read this”
Reviews.Author: bassdog65
Reviews.Content: First off, a little background, I have been to Mexico and a few place in the Caribbean, and the north shore of Hawaii is by far one of the most unique destinations we have found. It is great for almost everyone, but you have to know what you are booking before you go. I read the reviews on here, but I have learned to get a profile for people before accepting their review as canon. This place is quiet, and relaxed, and there isn't a ton to do on the North Shore other than hang out at the resort, surf, or drive around and go to shops. However, its a beautiful drive to Honolulu, and there is more than you could ever want to do in one trip in Honolulu, and you had to rent a car to get to Turtle Bay anyway, so one trip down to Honolulu if you are bored won't kill you. The Turtle Bay is great for couples, sure, but families would be great here too, there were tons of kids at the resort and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves...but there is also plenty of room to spread out and not have kids running and screaming into each other or you the entire time. One day a large group checked in on a business retreat, their conference rooms and facilities are huge, so I don't want to rule anyone out for this place, but know its not going to be the fast paced, everythign at your fingertips destination that is Cancun...not necessarily a bad thing. The one thing we missed from some other resorts is nightly entertainment put on by the resort, and being on the north shore, you are pretty far away from the options in Honolulu/Waikiki if you want to go every night...but that doesn't ruin it, this place is still fabulous to rest, relax, and drink a few! You do need to rent a car to get here, but its nice because it gives you a chance to drive up and down the North Shore, which is an adventure in its own right. The resort is beautiful, the grounds are immaculate, the whole North Shore is picture perfect. The staff was great, for everything. The rooms are simple, but they are well kept for their age, and they felt great to me. The villas are off on a secluded piece of beach, and looked nice from where we stayed, but it is a fair walk to almost everything at the resort from there, so keep that in mind. Sure, everything at the resort is expensive for food and drinks, but you are in Hawaii, and on vacation, and its no more expensive than any other destination. Meals will run you about $20-$40 per person with a drink, but its good food and great service, with lots of dining options. The shrimp shacks down the road are amazing, and fairly decently priced, and a must visit at least once if you like shrimp. For breakfast in the morning, the Palm Terrace lets you order food instead of doing their ridiculous $25 per person breakfast buffet, so don't be afraid to say, "we'll order from the menu" when they suggest the buffet. Breakfast items off the menu are $10 - $15 per person, and very well prepared. Also, a little secret, Lei Lei's is down attached to the Golf Pro Shop, and they serve breafast croissants and french toast for $8 a piece. It's a super short walk, and every morning we went there was no one in there except us, so most people must not realize it's there/it's cheap/i'ts open/it's good. I'm not sure why no one else ate there, but we had breakfast there 6 out of our 9 mornings. Alot of the other reviews have mentioned the Foodland grocery store down the street. For sure go this route to save a little money. We grabbed some sandwich meat, bread, cheese, and mayo, and a case of beer, and made lunch in the room and sat and dranka few cold ones in the middle of the day before heading down the the beach/pool to pay $6.50 a beer. They bring them right to you next to the pool though. The resort fee of $20 per day covers parking, WiFi (not necessary, your on vacation people), a newspaper everyday (read it...its fun to read about the island culture), and snorkel gear every day at the beach (definately go snorkeling!) I have heard people complain that it is a ridiculous fee, and while I agree they should build it into the room prices and just raise the per night rate, I understand why they don't, and everywhere on the island charges a per day parking fee, around $20, and it doesn't include any of the other resort amenities, so relax, understand it will be on your credit card when you check out, and just roll with it. If I didn't have a strict personal policy against going to the same place twice, this would be on my list of a must return destination. I loved every second of it.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced , nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bobthebuilderLondon
Reviews.Content: I had to pay 5500 dollars for a Villa for 8 nights as I was part of a wedding group and I had to stay on this appalling hotel. That did not include any food , any cleaners anything at all.!!!! There is no service as we suppose to have booked the cheap option so you are on your own.. The villa was nice but for 800 or so a night it is ridiculous and way over priced. The location is nothing special. The beach is sandy but there are rocks in the water.. I spend 3000 USD in Jamaica last June for 10 nights and that was all inclusive and the location was much better , the service was much better and the hotel was part of the luxury hotels of the world ( 5 stars hotel and the location was amazing). The joke was that the villa has a computer and printer for you to browse the net and so on.. Ha ha the computer is so under spec that its ridiculous to have it there.. What a joke of a hotel !!! This is my first and last trip to this resort...

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!! ALL THE WAY!”
Reviews.Author: KristenO
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Hawai'i and so glad we did one island for our first trip over. We had an excellent view and the room was very spacious. Very clean, and the housekeeping staff was awesome, we got turn down service every night. The staff was first class, very helpful and made sure we had everything we needed. The pools were great and the free snorkeling was great. Met some fabulous folks at the different bars and restaurants. Our favorite meals were at the daily breakfast buffet that was included with our room, the best waffles, fresh fruit, bacon we have ever had, and Ola and Twenty One Degrees North was fantastic, great seafood selections. We ventured out to the local beaches and had a fabulous piece of pizza from a local pizza van, which you can't miss, and a great quesadilla at Papuku's Grill by Foodland grocery store. We even extended our stay by 2 days we loved it so much. The weather was pretty good, windy at times, but very nice and warm! It rained pretty hard one night but did not ruin any of our activities. The Lu'a at the Polynesian Culutre Center was fantastic as well. They let you come back for up to three days for free. Also recommend the submarine ride from Waikiki for Atlantis Adventures, and Turtle Beach to see the turtles. We both recommend Turtle Bay and will be staying there again for sure. Perfect for family and couples!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Jadecat
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Turtle Bay Resort in Oahu, Hawaii. Although we won the trip and that alone made it great it would have been wonderful even if we'd paid full price. The location is stunning, the hotel public areas beautiful, the staff among the friendliest we've ever encountered and the food was very good overall (although terribly expensive). The breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace was one of the best we've ever had. The evening one varied from really good to fair depending on the night. The alcohol was expensive but we aren't heavy drinkers and there is a fridge in the room and stores nearby and the staff readily told us which ones sold alcohol. I found the gift shops to be reasonably priced and the staff very friendly. In fact everyone was! Alot of reviews we read made us wonder about everything but the views (universally admired). We aren't newbies at traveling and all I can say is the negative reviews must come from some very picky people. It does not reflect our experience at all. Yes the rooms are simply decorated and a little scuffed in places but they were spotlessly clean and the scuffs just weren't a big deal. Go prepared for a relaxing time (you want excitement, battle the crowds in Honolulu), do stock your fridge. Head down the road for some scenery and meals and you'll have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet... maybe too quiet”
Reviews.Author: JeanAlspaugh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (along with another couple) stayed at Turtle Bay as part of a 25th anniversary trip. The staff at the front desk, and the concierge, were wonderful. The hotel lobby is very nice with a wonderful view. The rooms were nice (considering the price versus the prices we paid in Maui and Kauai), but could obviously use a bit of updating.... especially in the common areas. The pool area was very (very!) nice, with a great view of the ocean. Jayde, at the pool bar, was truly a joy. This resort is fairly secluded with no night life at all. Not that we're real party people, but after 9 pm -- nothing! The restaurant Ola was pretty good (where Forgetting Sarah Marshall had a few scenes, I believe). We kind of preferred the restaurant at the golf course, not only because the prices were better. As far as golf goes, the Palmer course is by far the better and more scenic of the two courses. Overall, if I were to return, I would be happy to stay there, though I preferred Kauai over Oahu in general.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Romantic Place for Couples- Only for people with lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: TXAggieLady
Reviews.Content: Overpriced and the rooms were out of the 70's. I wrote the manager I sent him a letter. He replied immediately and he said they are upgrading the furniture and that people liked the avacado green walls and that we have to live with the flies at the breakfast bar. He did state he was training his staff to provide more supervision of the kids running all over the place and at the pool area. here is the letter I sent him. The walls were a sick green color which was not pleasant, the carpet had tears in it and it appeared that furniture was lacking or missing. In other words it would have been nice to have something other than the floor to put our suitcases on. There was only one suitcase stand in the closet but we had two bags. We liked the in-room fridge. We had problems with the wireless internet. My husband had issues with the head of your IT department but he said the IT technician was very nice…his boss wasn’t. There needs to be more clarity on setting the internet up with the business office for in-room internet service. The staff was very friendly and we really liked Joe Pack and most of the guys at the golf shop. However, we were a little put off because we booked two rounds of golf for ourselves on-line and decided to play a third round. The young man who booked us a tee time for the third round should have informed us that booking at the shop were going to cost 30% more than booking on-line. Had we known that we would have booked the third round on line from our room. My husband tried to show him our receipt from the previous day to show what we paid but he didn’t seem to care (he was the same fellow when we checked in that booked the reservation at the shop). We did not like having chemicals sprayed on us while we played golf on the Palmer course. The spray made us nauseous and I had to call the pro-shop to ask why they were spaying while we were on the course. We ate at the golf shop Café LeiLeia three times and it was good food at a reasonable price. I recommended it to everyone in the hot tub. A couple at the hot tub did not recommend your top of the line restaurant stating it was overpriced and her steak had to be sent back twice as it was overcooked. The older Hawaiian lady (Janet?) at the beach stand was awesome and friendly. She was the nicest person of everyone at the hotel. She made us feel welcome. I would add that the buffet for breakfast was OK for food selection (one day the bread was stale and the lychee type fruit was not cut open). I had to get the omelet chef to cut some open for me. There were too many flies at the fruit table. The unsupervised children running up and down while we were eating as well as crying babies made breakfast buffet an unpleasant event each morning. In fact I was dismayed at the number of children playing on the elevators and running up and down the halls of the hotel and in the lobby. On one occasion a naked baby was running at the pool level with no parent in site. I did not understand why hotel staff did not intervene and notify the parents that this behavior is unacceptable. The towel kids just sat around while this unsupervised baby is running around. It is very unacceptable for the amount of money people are paying. When I brought this whole problem of the noise / lack of supervision problem to their attention, the front desk staff shrugged it off. I figure it will take a missing or a drowned child on-site until the hotel realizes that unsupervised children in the hotel is something the staff needs to address with the parents. In fact we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for the third time the four days prior to Turtle Bay. We have also stayed at the Marriott in Waikiki. We paid $143/night at the Hilton and I think it was a much better room with nicer amenities at a much better value than your hotel. We were in Hawaii for our 20th anniversary as a romantic holiday. The Hilton made us feel like we were there for our 20th anniversary and it was quieter. Because of the large number of unsupervised children running around and the yelling and crying in the restaurant and lobby and hallways, Turtle Bay was not the romantic place as pictured in the brochures. In fact this hotel reminded me of Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gg1956
Reviews.Content: We reserved Turtle Bay through a package deal with Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays. It wasn't cheap, but we were looking forward to going to a "resort" where we could relax and be pampered a bit. The positives: the valets who greeted us were super friendly and helpful. The lobby is beautiful with a knock-out view of the bay through huge windows. The golf course is lovely and the trails are beautiful, too. We saw a large sea turtle on the beach our first day. The beds and pillows are comfortable and bathrooms are nicely laid out with a refrig but no microwave. Negatives: the first room we were given was a king room on the 2nd floor. The view out of the dirty sliding glass door was the reddish composite roof and there was no lanai. The room was sparsely furnished, the lamp hanging over the single table with two chairs was rusted and dirty. One picture on the wall. Dustruffle on the bed matched NOTHING in the room. Furniture is a mismash of styles. The walls were painted a light green and the paint job was v ery sloppy. After considering for a few minutes, I called the front desk and asked that we be given a different room. I was told that my reservation limited us to the 2nd floor and that the room we had had the best view. But she offered us another room on the same floor (2 queens and a lanai) which was slightly better - at least we could go out on the lanai with our cocktails to watch the sunset! We still need to look over the red composite rooftop to see the bay. Bathtub is all chipped, shower curtain doesn't reach all the way across the bathtub, lighting in the bathroom area is ghastly (especially with the green paint everywhere) The buffet breakfast and dinner at the Palm Terrace were nice though overpriced. The evening entertainment in the restaurant was sort of sad - several Hawaiian guys playing mediocre renditions of Brown Eyed Girl and Girl from Ipanema. The best things they did were the two actual Hawaiian songs. The servers in the restaurant were nice enough, but not anything to write home about. Lunch at Leilei's was good -nothing special but decent and not too overpriced. We asked repeatedly to have someone come to change the incorrect time on the clock (we're not idiots, but we could not figure out this particular model) but no one ever came to do this small task. Suggestions: Go to Ted's bakery about a mile south for good plate breakfast and delicious pastries. Go to the Superette in Kakuku for delicious ahi poke. Bring snacks to stash in the little fridge - you'll save alot over the in room service. The water from the tap is very good - don't bother with bottled water (and I'm a water snob). Spa services were way overpriced so we did not take advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids with an adventurous spirit!”
Reviews.Author: KJSMOM90
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort was GREAT for me and my 8 year old son! He is an animal lover and the tidepools at the resort were really all we needed for a great vacation. He discovered starfish, sea cucumbers, crabs, shrimp, sea urchins, mudskippers, and even several eels right in the tidepools. There is tons of land to explore at the resort and a huge stretch of beach. We were able to see whales from our hotel room in the mornings. Both pools were great....the kids pool has a great slide and waterfall. The room I had was nice (it was in the remodel section....I've heard that some of the rooms are not great). There was turn down service every night in which we came back to our room with the lights dimmed, leaf wrapped cookies on the table and ocean sounds playing on the sound system. It was very delightful. I love the peacefulness of the North Shore, but there is nothing to do in the evenings at the North Shore. Luckily we had our portable DVD player that we hooked up to the hotel TV and watched movies.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Northshore!”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryPrincess35
Reviews.Content: Please believe Oahu is not just Waikiki.Take the time for a beautiful scenic drive to the northshore and stay at Turtle Bay Resort.This was our 4th year stay.Very pleased with the new look.The front desk staff are friendly,especially the parrotts Ulu and Ikaika which are always surrounded by children.We booked a deluxe oceanfront room to avoid the rooftop view from an ocean view room we booked 2 years ago.The rooms ofcourse are comparible to a Sheraton,nothing spectacular,just clean.However,once you step out to your lanai,WOW!.Breathtaking and beautiful.Yes,like most resorts,they also have a fee which included free self parking,and 1 hour of beach rental snorkel and boogieboards,If we played tennis we also got 1hour of free tennis court time,not bad considering most resorts charge a resort fee and all you get is free self parking.We knew since the resort is famous on moveis that it would be spendy.$$$.However,can you put a price on Paradise?

Reviews.Title: “i would avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: chootiya
Reviews.Content: a bit of a let down. staff friendly and service okay. buffet is dated after the first day. watch out! they bill your credit card for things they unilaterally decide on after you have checked out and gone. And then it is your work against theirs. I would try some of the places in wakiki or honolulu

Reviews.Title: “North Shore Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NMom
Reviews.Content: My parents, son (age 9) and I recently traveled to Oahu for Spring Break. We stayed for a few days at Waikiki Beach,and also spent a few days on the North Shore at Turtle Bay resort. As this was a special occasion (my parent's 50th anniversary), I booked a couple of beach cottages for our trip. The cottages are beautiful, and the service is exemplary. We opted to dine at the onsite local restaurants (Palm Terrace and Ola) and were very pleased with our meals. The resort and location is breathtaking, and we loved walking along the beach and around the resort pathways. This was "true Hawaii"...and we have many wonderful memories from our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice facility”
Reviews.Author: RkCkJhk
Reviews.Content: We chose Oahu because we really wanted to see Pearl Harbor. We chose Turtle Bay because we wanted to experience the North Shore. It is an unreal location. You have high surf on the pool side and a calm cove on the beach side. Rooms are adequate, but mcmansion owners will find them lacking no doubt. Suggestions for travelers: Go to the market or Foodland in Laie for snacks/booze if you're looking to save a little $. We brought our own wine to dinner at Ola's and were not charged a corking fee per our waiter. Be sure to hit a shrimp trailer for lunch or dinner on the way to Laie. Suggestions for management: Please update the signage on the way in to the resort from the road. It's a little thing that will greatly improve the aesthetics and first impression. I don't get too hung up on the rooms, but carpet and fixtures need to be upgraded. The $20/day resort fee just pi$$es people off. Either build it in to the rate or nix it. Bottomline: This is a prime piece of Hawaiian real estate. They can take it to the next level with some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Located on a beautiful part of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: lovefreevacations
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing is the time of year that I went- beginning of March at this resort. It was very windy. If we left the resort to go to a different part of the island it wasnt as windy. I guess that it would be the location. The good things were almost everything- First we got to go here for free from airfare to lodging, car rental and breakfast and dinner daily. I guess that makes any vacation so much better. I couldnt have asked for a better place to go to. It was our first real vacation in over 18 years without children. I found the rooms very big- the bed and the sheets were comfortable The food at the Palm Terrace restaurant was good- it was much better than cooking and cleaning up at home.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacking”
Reviews.Author: lovejones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights for the beginning of a week long vacation. We wanted to stay on the North Shore for a few days to get away from the city atmosphere of Honolulu. When we pulled up we were very pleased with location, beautiful golf courses, open air lobby. We self parked because this fee is included in your mandatory resort fee so don't valet. We reserved a Pikake Jr Suite. This room is on the corner, very spacious. Has separate seating area and table and larger balcony. My husband and I love space so this was worth the extra money. This would have also been perfect for a family; so you may want to consider if you are traveling with smaller children. I agree with previous posters the rooms are very worn and are showing their age. They need to seriously update carpet, bathrooms, TVs, mattress, etc. Bathroom especially - tile very old - I wouldn't even want to think about taking a bath. The room did have a refrigerator so that was nice to keep drinks since everything is so expensive. There is a grocery store about 10 minutes away so you may want to stop there and get some drinks. We ate at Ola's first night. Nothing to brag about - just okay. Husband liked the salmon. On the beach so that was pretty. I think overpriced for the quality of food. My problems with the hotel began the next morning while eating breakfast at Palm Terrace. My husband had a golf tee time scheduled at 9:45. We went to Palm Terrace at 8 and ordered off the menu because we weren't that hungry enough for buffet. Well I think they forgot about our food because an hour later we didn't have our eggs and bacon. When I asked to speak to the manager this took an act of God. When manager, Mark ,finally came he wasn't that apologetic and told us to find him tomorrow if we come back to eat and he would see what he could do. Despite the fact that their poor service and error caused my husband to be late for his tee time they didn't even offer to take care of bill or bring us something else. I personally thought this was a poor reflection on management as I have had better service and treatment from IHOP. The following morning we returned for breakfast and asked for the same manager who told us to find him . He didn't even have the decency to come out and greet us and make sure everything was okay that day. He simply told hostess to take 20% of bill. I was personally insulted and again have received better service at IHOP. He could have at least come and talked to me in person! When he realized how upset I was he sent a bottle of champagne to me on my way checking out. Why would you send someone champagne when they are walking out the door. I can't take this with me on the airplane and I don't really drink much so this did not make up for the way I was treated. Also had dinner at 21 Degrees. Filet Mignon was excellent but again service just average. My husband and I are used to eating at restaurants and going to hotels with high level of service so were very disappointed by service. The most attentive person to us was the busboy. There are some nice restaurants about 20 minutes into town so you don't always have to eat at hotel if you have car. Beach area okay - no chairs around. Pool nice but we didn't get to enjoy because very windy when we were there. Used gym every day. Small but served it's purpose. I asked the conceirge for a listing of fitness classes offered at the gym and he said he didn't know this information. Again a higher quality hotel would have this information or get it very fast. We also had a couples seaside massage which was nice until I saw a mouse while waiting for my massage. The therapist was excellent and hearing the waves while getting a massage was very relaxing. Husband played the Arnold Palmer course and really loved it. Said the course was in pristine condition. This probably would be a good place for a golf getaway. Overall Turtle Bay was just average. Has potential to be a wonderful place as it has beautiful views and great location. They need to do some service training for employees and some major upgrades before I would come back. We spent the rest of our week at The Kahala in Honolulu and I enjoyed that much better mostly because of service and facilities. I did email general manager about my concerns when I got back home and he did contact me and was very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: WA_local
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at Turtle Bay in one of their ocean view King rooms at the hotel. Overall, we were really disappointed with the resort. It was very windy (gusts to 50mph), so we spent more time than usual in our room. The layout of the resort is nice and the location is scenic and the pool and beach also looked nice, but due to high winds we didn't spend any time enjoying it. The room was nothing special, kind of run down , dingy and sad, very uncomfortable bed, small tub/shower. The linens also felt cheap. We also ate dinner at Lei Lei's at the Golf Course one night. The food was mediocre, but with a few drinks and tax/tip, set us back over $100. I was very happy we only spent one night there, so we could move onto better accomodations. I will never return to Turtle Bay. It is overpriced and underwhelming. Also, to valet park our car, I think it ended up being something like $30-$35. Self park is $15-20.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: dammann1
Reviews.Content: Very nice, older but well maintained, A great vacation if you are looking for a nice remote quiet holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: renmackay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Beach Cottage for five nights of our honeymoon. It was one of the most beautiful and romantic places we've ever stayed. When we woke in the morning there were green sea turtles basking and swimming on the beach in front of our cottage and each evening we watched an amazing sunset over the pacific from our lanai. The staff brought us fresh fruit each morning and left lovely chocolates on our pillows daily. When we ordered room service they even offered to move it to our lanai table, so we could dine while watching the sunset. The grounds are also gorgeous and you'll find many activities to try. There were no disappointments whatsoever during our stay. I can't recommend the cottages highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowergirlWyoming
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful location if you want to be away from town. The hotels entrance is very nice and therefore misleading to what waits behind closed doors. When we got to our room we found it disapointing. The furniture was nice and fit the theme however, the mattress was pitifully old and worn out, the carpet was almost threadbear and the bathroom, although roomy, was old and worn out, too. It really needs remodling. The main restaurant, the Palm Terrace, has great service but the cushions on the booths are disgustingly dirty. The wait staff was wonderful as was the rest of the hotel staff. We especially enjoyed Annie at breakfast. The LPGA Tour was going on during our visit so we had to valet park our car as the parking lots were full. Ten dollars a day for that. It would have been nice to have a choice, but being on private land, we didn't. We would go back after they remodel but not before. Too expensive for a motel 6 look alike.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: HabitualHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 days and 7 nights at Turtle Bay for our honeymoon. Perhaps we are easy to please, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Turtle Bay. The positives were the hotel is nice and clean (we had an ocean view room that was upgraded for us and we were moved to a higher floor for a better view). The staff was nice, the all you can eat breakasts with freshly made juices were wonderful, and we enjoyed being able to say "we're on our honeymoon" and everyone be nice to us or upgrade us! We toured the island (went to various beaches and the nature park that isn't too far away), went snorkeling (a lot!), tanned on beaches, swam at the hotel, lounged in hammocks at the hotel, went on a helicopter ride, went on a boat snorkeling ride, had some massages, went to the Multicultural center, attended some luaus, and were going to go hiking but just didn't have enough time for everything! And - we stayed only on the North Shore! We ventured into Honolulu our last day before our flight out, but didn't like it at all compared to where we were. It was really crowded. One other fun thing was that there is a web cam on the property, so we got to wave at our family at home! The not so high points were the lagoon/ beach at the hotel. It wasn't the best there was to offer on the North Shore but nicer beaches were within a few minute drive and had ample parking. There were even some fun diving rocks. Though the pool area had chairs though that overlooked the water and it was beautiful. Like I said above, the breakfast was great, but for lunch and dinner there weren't many good options. That was our biggest challenge - finding good food (which is important on a vacation). We even went to the grocery store and got a few things one day. We also ate dinner in the hotel one night and while it was good, the prices were too high for overcooked lobster. We ate lunch at the golf course and also ate dinner at another restaurant on the property and at lunch at the poolside cabana - all were average and overpriced in our opinions (the cabana was actually the best probably). We even tried the local "shrimp trucks" but they weren't good either. Also, the massages were great, but the stones were pretty darn hot - so beware of that. Also we didn't see any sea turtles and that was a little disappointing. It's not too cheap though. We (thank goodness) didn't worry about money since we were on our honeymoon, but I think the total for the trip was about $8-$10k for everything (including travel, car, and souvenirs). We have said we will go back and we will to celebrate an anniversary, but there are so many other places to go too it may be a few years before we make it back. It's a wonderful place. True Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mtjaden69
Reviews.Content: My wife and 17 month old daughter stayed at the resort for 5 nights in early February 2009. I actually stayed here free because I used choice hotels points who are affiliated with Preffered Resorts and Hotels (ie. Turtle Bay Resort partners) First Impressions: We arrived at night so we couldn't really get a good feel of the surroundings and views until the next day. We were promptly greeted by the valet and bell persons. They were very curtious and unloaded all of our luggage onto a cart while I went to check in. To my disbelief we were upgraded from a deluxe room (which is there bottom of the line) to a beachfront cottage suite!! I had requested an upgrade because I am a Preffered Hotels and Resorts member (join this its free and you will always get somekind of an upgrade if it is available) I thought I might get a little upgrade but not the cottages. I have read many reviews and had never heard of anyone getting upgraded to a cottage so I wouldn't count on it again, but a really nice treat. Location: The location is incredible, definately the best part of the resort. Right on the tip of the island with bays on both sides (although only one of the bays is really safe for swimming). Can get a little windy but not too noticeable most of the time. Weather was great all but one day. Rooms: As I said we were upgraded to a beach cottage which makes it better. We went and looked at the other rooms and were pleased with them and would not have been disapointed if we had to stay in the main hotel. Furnishings were relatively new and linens were nice. There could have been a little more art or something, seemed like the rooms were missing personality. Overall pretty nice considering some of the reviews that I had read. The cottages are right on the ocean and have private hammocks and a grass area out your back door. Service: Nearly everyone at the resort were beyond helpfull and friendly. The cottages also come with a personal concierge which was awesome. Thank you Terry for all that you helped us with, you brought a real sense of the islands to us. We received fresh fruit and ice daily and pretty much anything that we could think of was handled with unbelievable promtness. Restaurants: This was probably the one area of our experience that was below our expectations. Lei Lei's: By far the best dinner we had at the resort. This restaurant is actually on the golf course and is pretty laud but the service and food made up for it. I had the giant on the bone ribeye steak...awesome! Ola: On the beach great location, very casual, service was mediocre at best, food was as expected, beach resort type of food, normal pricey. I would recommend eating lunch here as dinner seemed to be basically the same but twice as expensive. 21 Degrees North: This is there upscale restaurant. Great sunset, pricey but not outrageous, mediocre service, food was good but lacked a real distinct taste, not nearly as good as I had hoped. Palm Terrace Buffet: Did not eat here but past reviews were not great Drinks throughout the resort are very pricey $7-10 for a fruity island drink with very little alcohol. I don't quite understand some of the incredible horrible reviews given to these restaurants. Some comparing the food to Denny's (I don't know what Denny's you have been too but sign me up). Others saying the prices are insanely high. Yes the prices are not cheap but they are normal for a resort especially one that doesn't have much of anything around it for miles. Nightlife and Entertainment: Besides the Friday night Luau on the grounds entertainment seemed to be a drink and a good book. Not much of anything. But that was OK with us because having a 17 month old and waking up to watch the sunrise was much more entertaining! Local knowledge and tips: We ate all of our breakfasts on our lanai (saved us a bunch of money) there is a great Foodland grocery store 15 minutes south or 10 minutes in Kahuku. They have great sandwiches and fresh sushi. The fruitstands near the resort were the best fruit as the grocery store carried fruit that was not even grown in Hawaii. Teds Bakery 10 minutes south is great for breakfast and pastries. Try the chocalate macadamia rasberry tort...awesome. Sharks cove grill near the Foodland is a great place to grab a bite to eat and sit under the tent at night with the torches going. Best vegetarian burger I have ever had. Hukilau Cafe in Kahuku is a little on the shady side (poor neighborhood) but was the least expensive meal we had in Oahu and had one of the best burgers of my life. Overall impressions: Loved every minute of our trip. From the moment we pulled in till we had to drive away we were treated like royalty. This is a place to just relax, let yourself go, and take in the true Hawaii. Can't wait to go back. We headed off to Wikiki for 5 days after we left and were truly disapointed. It seemed like our vacation was over when we left Turtly Bay. Email me if there are any other tips I might be able to help someone with. miketjaden@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the right crowd”
Reviews.Author: Lonstarhusker
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Oahu due to Hurricane Ike hitting Houston. We had been in Kauai and Waikiki and were pretty tired of the islands. We were cautious of Turtle Bay due to some of the reviews but had the most fabulous five days there. The view from anyplace was magnificent, includung the lobby. The price was half of Waikiki, the rooms OK, and the staff friendly. The food was a little pricey but the pool was great. As the sun moved we just moved chairs and had a personal waitperson. We are semi-retired and the laid back atmosphere was perfect. Maybe a family would not appreciate it as much but it sure beat the Moana Surfrider and its hassel. Also, knowing we had no A/C and electricity back home made it better. Great place for the right crowd looking for affordable, laid back Hawaii. Looking forward to going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible and friendly”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMiami
Reviews.Content: This place is tremendous, the staff bent over backwards and the view is awesome. The food was some of the best we had in all of hawaii. I suggest for the litttle extra money stay in a beach cottage as this room is incredible, steps to the ocean. If ever in oahu again we will stay at Turtle Bay Resort Jim in Miami 2009

Reviews.Title: “much aloha!”
Reviews.Author: livaloha
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Hawaii for 17 years, and this was our first time staying at the Turtle Bay Resort. We have read mixed reviews of this property, but are glad we gave them a try. The room was clean and large, the bed was comfortable and the view was fine. Every employee we encountered was friendly and had plenty of Aloha. Great pool and the Ola restaurant is a winner! Mahalo nui to Auntie at the coffee cart ahui ho!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Cathryn08
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the lobby and saw the floor to ceiling windows with the surf just outside, we had big smiles on our face and said , "this is awesome". Our ocean front room, which you must book, on the 5th floor, sunset view was literally the best view I have ever had in my life (and I travel a lot). Watch surfers from your balcony. The grounds are very nice. Nice big pool with ocean views. Several restuarants to choose from. We saw sea turtles from the hotel beach, which was very nice and pretty. We took a walk on their other beach out to the point which was a very nice walk with great vistas. This was a GREAT place and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AWEFUL, just plain AWEFUL”
Reviews.Author: PYROMAN
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation at the Hyatt near Diamond Head for th efirst 5 days. We didnt want to compare the Hyatt to Turtle Bay until the end of our trip. They stated that the resort had just been completely remodeled. I think they may have meant they cleaned the pond water. The rooms were much smaller than the Hyatt, the coffee basket had mold in it, the bathroom was very dark and had no vent, beds were very hard, housekeeping would knock and then walk right in, and the windows were filthy. Now going to Hawaii everyone should expect to spend some money. I dont mind paying for a good meal here or there, however, the average meal for breakfast alone was $80, and thats with two adults, and two kids, and the meal wasnt very good. We went to the Cheesecake factory the week before, spent less for dinner, and had a full meal of leftovers for the next day. Not a family/kids friendly resort. Pool closes at dusk, no pool flotations or toys allowed, room was dark in general, and even though they were extremely over Staffed, they Staff was very unfriendly and not willing to help in any way. Not much to do there either as for activities. We did go snorkling, but the water was very merky. We ended up renting a car to go to WalMart to buy food for the week. $250 a day for 5 days was way to much to spend on just food. And the only pizza delivery was Dominos. One night of that is to much. There were only two positives to staying at Turtle Bay; The waves on the North shore were HUGE. Surfers had a very hard time surfing because the were so tired by time they got out there. And the ocean side massage for my wife and I was great, but most messages usually are. They did tell us to arrive at least 30 minutes early at the Spa so we could enjoy the steam room. Well, the steam room in the Mens locker room was under maintenance, which they knew about when they told us to come early. So we sat outside for 45 minutes waiting for the massage. I did sneak into the ladies locker room and use their steam room after our massage. Ladies were coming and going and my wife told them I was in there, and the girls were all very nice about it and it didnt stop them from taking showers while I was in there. Overall, if your going to Hawaii and want to have a great time, stay at the Hyatt at Waikiki Beach. Much better accomidations, shopping, street performers, beach is right there, shopping, activities, restaurants, and an overall better feel. I would recommend Turtle bay to Newlyweds or Retiree's, and thats it. We did watch the helecopters filming the TV show LOST from our balcony, so that was cool.

Reviews.Title: “overall amazing”
Reviews.Author: yerduamtl
Reviews.Content: We truely enjoyed the stay from Dec 28th through Jan 8th,,,,, The rooms although in need of some cleaning, ex grout in bathroom...and tracks for the wood blinds all the rest was amazing .The beds were comfortable and the views outstanding, we had 3 rooms and all 3 had great views. The restaurants are plentyful and a wide varity of prices can be found.....Don't want to pay a high breakfast buffet then don't , grap a coffee and a muffin. This was our first visit but will NOT be our last....The surf was up and the surfers a plenty...................The North shore is truley True Hawaii Helicoptor tour a must do. whale watching from Haleiwa a must....skip the resort Luau go to the cultural center instead.....

Reviews.Title: “Great views, peaceful spot”
Reviews.Author: Expat_wife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for Christmas week with our 2 children in adjoining rooms. This is a nice get-away for families. I loved the beautiful location of this hotel on the north shore of Oahu and spent hours watching the waves. I was disappointed that hotel wasn't more luxurious but the views are priceless and we paid a lot less than we do at other beach hotels. It's quiet but there is a lot to do if you want to be active. We went horseback riding (not the most exciting) and contemplated playing tennis but never got off our pool chairs. Golfers have 2 courses to enjoy. There is a beach & cove on either side of the hotel. One is sandy and has snorkeling. The other is popular with surfers and is too rough for your average swimmer. But the water was quite cold in December which surprised us. There was also a strong wind every day coming off the ocean which made the pool area chilly after 2 pm. Be sure to bring a light sweater for evenings in the winter. As for the hotel, this is not a 5-star resort and the rooms are showing their age. The lobby is lovely with the big windows overlooking the ocean in 2 directions, but other areas of the hotel could use a facelift as well. I understand it used to be a casino in the '70s which explains some of the funky architecture. We didn't see inside the villas but our friends highly recommend them. Our rooms were big and basic with balconies and great views. Our rate was reasonable but I was surprised by the state of the bathrooms. They were worn and small, with peeling paint, and small bath/shower combos. The staff is very welcoming -- everyone from the reservation desk to the maid were very kind and helpful. The restaurants are good and we had many nice meals, but the menus are limited when eating there every night. If you want to eat outside the resort, be aware that this is the quiet side of the island and there aren't many options, especially at night. The hotel's restaurants seem popular with the locals. Be warned that you should make reservations for Christmas dinner or brunch well in advance or you may lose out. We thought we could eat at the beachside grill but it was closed and everything else was full. We ended up in the bar which was a disappointing option on Christmas. It takes about an hour to drive to Honolulu so you are removed from the action which is a plus or minus, depending on your point of view. The cute town of Haleiwa is about 20 minutes away by car. My teenager would have liked to be closer to a town with a little more activity. Overall, we would stay here again but maybe for a shorter stay. Or we would opt for the villas so we could do some of our own cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Turtle Bay - Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: beachobsessed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Oahu to get married and honeymoon. I had heard mixed things about Turtle Bay, but the property looked so beautiful we decided to try it and we loved it! The people are great, the location is beautiful, the pool was great and the restaurants are great too. We stayed in both the cottages and an oceanside room. The oceanside room had a beautiful view - the only problem we had in the oceanside room was that the sheets were a polyester blend which was not too comfortable and seemed really strange for a luxury resort. The beachside cottages were awesome and they had better linens there - I think the cottages are worth the extra money. I would recommend this place for people who are looking for relaxation. We also loved the vibe on the North side of Oahu compared to Waikiki, which would not have been our type of vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: CarlSacramento
Reviews.Content: We were very concerned about booking this hotel after reading a number of negative reviews on this website however my wife and I were looking for a more authentic but still high end hotel on Oahu for a couple days/nights of romance and this more remote hotel seemed to fit the bill. We arrived at the check in time of 3:00pm. Room was not ready but just decided just to have a drink at the beach bar ( a very good Mai Tai). Room became available at 4:00pm and hotel offered a $100.00 credit after apologizing for being late- a nice gesture. Our room was a Beach Cottage. Really a beautiful room with dark hardwood floors, marble bathroom, deep tub and separate shower. Simple but elegant. Our lanai was maybe 20ft from the ocean. Room was very clean and in great condition. Had a great couples massage and used the decent fitness facility. Key to all this is that the people and service was great. The drinks were good but did not try the restaurants. Seemed a bit pricey. Went to Haliewa for a dinner but enjoyed really staying in the beautiful room and lanai and had appetizers and wine that we brought. All in all we had just a great couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother -overpriced and bad service”
Reviews.Author: Everflow
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Hawaii from Australia and decided to check out the Turtle Bay resort after a major storm blew in and our orginal accommodation was washed out. We were both drenched after catching the public bus and walking to the entrance to be told that th entire hotel was booked out....can you believe that in OFF SEASON all the rooms were booked out!!! Noone offerred us towels as we were dripping everywhere. We then decided to ring reservations and surprise surprise they had HEAPS of rooms....take note the staff obviously are told not to sell rooms to people that look a certain way as we had both lost our thongs in the water and were drenched. Food was VERY VERY over priced and rubbish, food staff were too busy trying to sell us tours through people they know than wait on our table. Rooms are 3 star standard if that, too many 'resort' style charges for what they actually offer. Unfriendly staff who all look like they don't want to be working and not one bit of Hawaiian music - unless you pay $100 a head to see the Lauu...isnt this meant to be the 'real Hawaii'??? Do youself a favour skip this place to stay and keep on going - bring on the other hotel developments and hopefully Turtle Bay goes broke.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Beautiful and with lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: senorgreg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our own holiday at Turtle Bay. Based upon reviews on this site I was not quite sure what to expect, but I was very pleasantly surprised. Our room had a spectacular view, and from what I could see, it would be hard to get a room without a great view. Yes, they could do with a refresh, but they are kept up very well and beds were very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Food is more limited than you might expect if you normally vacation in Poipu, Waikiki, etc, but then you came to this side of the island to get away! That said we enjoyed all our meals on property, with special nods to Ona's on the beach. Last but not least, the location and grounds are spectacular. Pool is much better than in the photos. You have a choice of beaches, two golf courses, tennis, etc. All this and you are not crowded onto busy Waikiki beach. I would stay here again over Waikiki any day. Overall, highly recommended. It is not a Four Seasons, but if you shop around, you should not have to pay a Four Seasons rate either, and I think you'll get much better value for your money in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!!!”
Reviews.Author: cracker115
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt one of the most fantastic resorts I have every experienced. The location is simply breath-taking. The rooms are a little worn but veryyy well maintained, and the beds are outstanding. But when are you in your room ?? It's Hawaii !!!! And the food was delicious. The poolside view is incredible and needs to be experienced. The front desk staff was simply excellent. Look...if you want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, Hilton Hawaiian village is where to stay, but if you want a peaceful outstanding resort on the North Shore, Turtle Bay cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: nigelbrighton
Reviews.Content: Food; Dennys quality but 5 star price, front of house-golf staff don't seem to care. Rooms 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Jawdropping Location Makes You Overlook The Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 3dayweekender
Reviews.Content: I agree that the piece of land that TB is situated on is "nothing short of spectacular." Because in this case 'the good', far exceeds 'the ugly' I'll give it to you in that order. We had spent a lackluster week on Maui prior to this 2 nights at TB and couldn't put our finger on what it was missing. When we pulled up to TB, we knew. TB 'feels like' True Hawaii, as they say. (sometimes I log on to the website while working because the music and sounds of the crashing waves take me right back to TB) You're literally surrounded with the ocean because of the way the hotel is situated there, so it's realistic to get an ocean view room for under $200. I just don't have words to transmit the overall impression that you get arriving at this place- honestly. The ambinece that embodies the website is acurate and then some. Every single employee we encountered was genuine and kind. Special kudos to Virginia at the Coffee Cart in the lobby in the mornings. We meandered and talked about specialty local coffees with her both mornings -imagine that a person serving coffee that KNOWS about Coffee :) The gentlemen who drove the golf carts were conversational and fun to talk to, the female concierge we encountered went out of her way to explain the ambience of the different restaurants when choosing for my b-day dinner. DINNER at Ola's was amazing, the best short ribs of my life and the next day lunch at Lei Lei's was honestly the best seafood salad of our lives too. The pool was comfortably heated on an overcast day- I find that many hotels skimp on this and "TB Managment, this doesn't go unappreciated." The water slide was a BLAST for me and my 55+ parents. We originally selected TB becasue its minutes from the Polynesian Cultural Center we were visiting but next vacation will be centered around TB! Don't miss a breakfast sandwich from Ted's bakery down the highway- I think of them often. If I would have left Hawaii having visited only Maui Marriott Ocean Club and Sheraton Moana Surfrider- I would have never planned to go back to Hawaii- but becasue of TB, the north shore of Hawaii will be our next big vacation. OK, so now for the ugly- and there is some. The prior reviews stating how worn and tired the rooms are, are completely correct. If these rooms were located in a different location- it would be a Motel. Small pillows, hard beds, bathroom from the 1970's. Usually I'm a snob about this kind of thing but truly, the transcendent experience that the location, staff, and common areas that TB gives- I overlooked the dated and ugly room. Our plan for next time is to spring for one of the 'Sarah Marshall' bungalows and enjoy this place thouroughly. I emailed my gushing compliments and constructive criticism regarding the old rooms to the GM and he responded saying that they have massive plans for room renovations in 2009- great news! On overcast bay area days the fog takes me back to the most wonderful birthday I've ever had- playing with my 2 year old and my husband in the warm pool overlooking the stunning, crashing waves at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Hono's house!”
Reviews.Author: arsenalrocks
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 6 days and 5 nights at the Turtle Bay resort. We arrived a few days after severe rains had flooded the area. Our room was very cute with a small balcony and a beautiful ocean view. We were very excited to stay at the Turtle Bay resort and the service was excellent. The food was great, the staff friendly, and the grounds were amazing. On our second day we played a round of golf there on the Fazio course. Because of the rain, a few of the holes on the back nine were affected by the flooding. But, you could see the staff working hard to restore the course. In spite of that, we had an awesome round of golf and enjoyed every minute! One evening, we attended a luau at the Turtle Bay. While it was smaller in scale that other luau's we had been too, it was still wonderful. It was held indoors because of the weather, but the food was incredible and the dancers, who were from the Polynesian Cultural Center, were even better. The evening culminated in a fire dance outside. This was the best part of the evening!! The surrounding area is quiet and picturesque. This area is what they consider the country and for nightlife you would be better entertained on the hotel grounds or in Honolulu. There are a few places to eat in the area off the resort. Our favorite was Ted's Bakery!! We ordered the Loco Moco to share. The place was packed with locals and tourists alike. Be sure to wait outside after you order. They will bring your food to you. This place is a must if you are interested in experiencing the authentic Hawaiian plate lunch. They also had a full bakery that looked so delicious!!! You won't be disappointed. We also spent some time in Hal'ewa. This is a cute little town with lots of shopping and eating. We also did the maze at the Dole Pineapple Plantation.
