This was fun, but we got a little dizzy following the maze! Tamura's north of Waikiki, is an excellent place to curb your Poke fix. We love the stuff and bought 3 different varieties. They make about 8 different varieties there. Overall, this was one of the best experiences we've had on our travels. We can't wait to return, and will definitely stay at the Turtle Bay resort again. The front desk, bell hops, valets, concierge, the golf attendants, the store clerks, everyone was very helpful, knowledgeable, and really seemed interested in making our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusable, Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: caocgal
Reviews.Content: Paid almost $400 a night for a room with a chronic ANT problem. The RUDEST concierge we have EVER encountered--we were robbed at Ehukai Beach Park and all we asked her to do (I was crying) was to assist us in finding a place where my husband could get eyeglasses i.e., lenscrafters, since his glasses were stolen. Her response was to THROW THE YELLOW PAGES IN FRONT OF US! She then took the yellow pages back saying that "you have one in your room" We did not expect sympathy from her (and we didn't get anything not even a n"oh, that's too bad"--it's not her fault we were robbed--but assisting us in locating services is part of her job as concierge). She made a big deal about not giving us reservations at 11 a.m. for the Sunday brunch and said we could only go at 11:15--we obliged and the place was half empty when we went. On another occasion, I was standing behind a man she was helping--she left the desk (never acknowledged me, didn't say she'd be back--she just left me standing there). Restaurants were good, but there is nothing, absolutely nothing to do after sundown--not even at the bar--they really should come up with something for night entertainment. Beach is good for snorkeling but the area is small. We did the hiking trail through their 880 acre nature reserve and a homeless looking DRUG addict high on drugs jumped out at us and started CHASING us (it is very far from the main part of the resort and noone would ever hear you scream). Thankfully, we got away because the guy was in such a stupor. We thought it was funny that the management of this hotel REFUSE (we asked) to provide golf carts to their guests or to transport their guests paying $400 a night to see the nature reserve--we have to make the VERY VERY LOOOOONG walk (non guests supposedly have to pay to see it) but a bum can hang out there! SO LET ME GET THIS STRAIGHT MANAGEMENT--YOU WON'T TAKE ME (A GUEST PAYING $400 A NIGHT TO THE NATURE RESERVE--BUT HOMELESS DRUG ADDICTS AND BUMS ARE WELCOME) It's a beautiful place, too bad it is run SO poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for a night to see the view”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed as part of our 25th Anniversary trip to Hawaii and found the view spectacular and the setting beautiful. However, the hotel roof leaks, maintenance is not what it could be, some staff are a little less than attentive or diplomatic, many of the meals are overpriced, there is little privacy around the pool and the walks round the beautiful beaches and golf courses are not signposted at all. When there is any wind this is a windy place, but the surf on one side and the turtles on the other are worth seeing. The resort tends to "nickel and dime" its customers, which is a pity. Most guests would probably pay another $20 per night just to avoid all the little charges. Stay for a night to see the view, then drive back to Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the view!”
Reviews.Author: DandGluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Every room in this resort has gorgeous views! The beach is nice, and there are other activities that you can do on the resort. The only thing I did not like about this resort is that the room I was in was not very clean. The linens, bathroom, and rooms had a bad smell, and the bathroom needs to be remodeled. Housekeeping does a good job keeping the rooms clean, but the rooms are old and need to be updated. Another thing I did not like was that it is very secluded and far from everything you can think of. Restaurants and shopping are about an hour away. Make sure you buy something to eat for breakfast to put in the fridge because you'll be starving by the time you drive to the nearest restaurant. Ordering breakfast at the resort can get very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views !”
Reviews.Author: djg28
Reviews.Content: This place is out of the way, so if your looking for night life this isn't the place. It is quiet, peaceful and relaxing. The rooms all have an ocean view and are clean and spacious. The hotel and property is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you play golf there is a golf course. The water is wonderful ! There is a busline and tours. I loved it here and would go back again !

Reviews.Title: “Real Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Bigred120281
Reviews.Content: I just treturned from staying at Turtle Bay, and Had a great time. I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews, but I had no reason to be. The resort is on the ocean and all rooms have a balcony and ocean views. The rooms are large with a split bathroom, and a refrigerator. The room decor is a bit outdated, but the room is clean. I enjoyed spending my time laying on the beach which offered great snorkeling, and I also enjoyed laying by the pool. The resort and grounds are beautiful! However the resort is in the middle of no where, and the restaurants at the hotel were very expensive and the food was not good. I suggest taking the ten minute drive to town, there were good restaurants there. This is an excellent place to relax, if you are looking for hoping nightlife this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: fabric85
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place, other than the food was absolutely terrible. It tasted like good airplane food, no joke, and was expensive 0_0 I was unhappy that we paid for $50-$100 for every meal (2 people) and got denny quality food. I'm all about the second chances, but six meals at this place was enough. In the end, the complimentary fruit and the free tea bags were better than what we had to endure. I stayed at the Kahala a year before. I recommend you guys to checking that out, if your willing to pay Turtle Bay prices. It was a stressful experience living there... we paid for 5 star quality and got the holiday inn. I'm never coming back here, because I left Hawaii feeling ripped off and hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location - lots of nice surprises”
Reviews.Author: LJHSViking
Reviews.Content: In spite of some heavy rain in late November, we managed to have an excellent time at Turtle Bay Resort. Our room was large with a split bathroom and small refrigerator, and we had a nice lanai overlooking the surf. We had to forage for food because the resort is isolated, but we chose from among the onsite restaurants, a shrimp truck up the road, and a couple of restaurants in Haliewa. The best treat was the excellent horsebackriding facility that is at the resort. For $55 you get a very nice tour of the beach and jungle, well narrated and on great horses. They have a very nice bayside beach and decent snorkeling. It's a bit of a haul to the east side of the island or to Waikiki, so we ended up driving, but the scenery was always fantastic. The hotel itself is large and nicely laid out, with attractive areas for the pool, spa and gym facilities. Another nice extra: the onsite gift shop is not a rip-off, which is always a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but lacks five star quality”
Reviews.Author: bumble88
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the rooms, we stayed in a beach cottage which is beautiful, the room is very spacious but lacks lighting. It is very well up-kept and extremely clean. The pool is a reasonable size though was very crowded during the time I went, full of kids screaming. The beach on the right of the Hotel was gorgeous, thats where i spent all my time. One thing i was very upset with was the food, it was terrible. They offer you five restaurants to choose from here that ALL serve the same American food at a big $$$. Breakfast buffet was over $20 and not worth it, the poolside had burgers and hotdogs for $20. There's also another restaurant that is not really part of the hotel but it obviously is, called OLA, not great at all, expensive and nothing special. Room service is gross, they charge $35 for a tiny steak and like 3 shrimps, total rip off. If your fine with eating American burgers, hot dogs and salads filled with creamy dressing then you might enjoy it, but for me i did not have one decent meal and i spent so much eating here just because the hotel was so far from everywhere else! The best meal i had was in the North Shore market at a Thai place, which is very reasonable and a MILLION times better than ANY food at Turtle bay. The hotel needs some renovations, the lobby and bar could be so beautiful but now just looks a little aged. Overall it was a relaxing experience, service was excellent, all the staff was polite and helpful but I don't think i'll be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic and relaxing visit to the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: tx_galAustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort for ten nights October 10-19th. Loved everything about the resort from the moment we arrived. The staff, the food, our room, the beautiful extensive resort grounds. We stayed in room 217 and had a perfect view. Our room was in excellent condition and fit the zen/modern aesthetic that we prefer. The bed was so comfortable and often left the sliding doors open at night so we could hear the waves. We could look down from our room onto the swimming beach, and had a perfect view of the sea turtles that were always feeding in the rocky shore area. Also, the self-parking was not a long walk at all and we couldn’t believe people complained about it. We really enjoyed watching the surfers while having a drink next to the bar, and strolling around the resort grounds. You can spot sea turtles in the bay at any given time, if you look carefully. They are everywhere at the resort. The sunsets views from the resort were also spectacular. The entire experience was positive and very romantic. We took long walks through the grounds and recommend walking along the trails to the resort’s deserted beaches, which are past the horse corral. I recommend that everyone who would enjoy a 2-3 mile walk to visit the Banyan tree forest along the trails. The trees are spectacular. We took surfing lessons at the resort, and loved our instructor Bobby. He was a great instructor. The waves were really big the day we went, and were a very tough workout. Watch out for that sharp coral sea bottom on many of Oahu’s beaches or you can get some nasty scrapes! Food: Our first night we attended the resort’s annual seafood festival, Chef’s Under the Stars night. Had absolutely fabulous food and drinks, listened to a wonderful authentic Hawaiian band, and enjoyed the beautiful weather. That was a great night. Our favorite restaurant was 21 Degrees North, followed very closely by Lei Lei’s. We enjoyed two fabulous meals outdoors at Lei Lei’s. I highly recommend the Caesar salad, ahi tuna steak entrée, and prime rib. It was possibly the best ahi tuna steak either of us had ever had. We also had their chocolate chip cookie sundae, and it was pretty good. We had two outstanding dinners at 21 Degrees North as well. Their specialty martinis were delicious and worth the steep price tag. They must have an actual mixologist on hand designing their drinks. They were wonderful. We have nothing but raves about the food here, which is made with many local and organic ingredients. We had the lobster bisque, tomato basil soup, heirloom tomato salad with spiced lump crab and mozzarella, grilled Caesar salad w/ pineapple and a lovely crab-crusted fish entrée. We recommend every dish and drink we ate there. Had decent bar food at the Tap Room, chicken fingers, fries and quesadillas. Our only restaurant meal disappointment at the resort (and during our vacation on the island) was Ola. We stopped there twice to review the dinner menu and both times found the hostess to be snobbish. She was willing to seat us for dinner, but when a casually dressed man asked to make a reservation for that night she turned him away? We ended up having lunch there once, and I got the slider trio, while my husband had an poke rice bowl. I didn’t care for the flavors of either dish. We recommend touring the North shore, including surf town Haleiwa, which was a scenic and relaxing 15 minute drive from the resort. We also recommend visiting the windward/Eastern shore, and the town of Kailua. Other recommended restaurants on/near the North Shore: Ted’s Bakery, Kono’s Grill, Haleiwa Eats Thai, Cholo’s, Grass Skirt Grill and Uncle Bobo’s (eastern shore).

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: broncko
Reviews.Content: Great place... I was reminded of it when watching "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" which was filmed at the hotel. Surfed in the actual Turtle Bay where you literally float around with dozens of sea turtles. We were there in the off season... so, we got a great room with ocean view. The locals don't like the resort and protest its existence.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Get-away”
Reviews.Author: btroxel18
Reviews.Content: Very nice alternative to the over-populated Honolulu area. Don't let the 45 min drive North steer you away. It was really quiet, great customer service, and romantic. The only downfall can be the wind at times. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “4 STAR and great for just unwinding - Great location (for relaxing)”
Reviews.Author: YPAnow_dot_com
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort is on O'hau's North Shore, 40 minutes from The Honolulu airport. Select this hotel resort if you're looking for a hide-a-way and don't select it if you want the shopping/tourist "Hawai'i" The hotel/resort is rated 4 star and appropriately so. I had found several very negative "reviews" on Trip Adviser, so I was very skeptical when my travel department selected The Turtle Bay Resort for me. I could find absolutely NO BASIS for the hammering that is found in the Trip Advisor, and I'm a very picky (and experienced) traveler. This is a place suited for those that want to quietly unwind, maybe play golf, ride a horse and/or veg out. The rooms, baths, showers, bedding were all in very good condition. Staff is friendly and helpful. I'd say “excellent”, as was housekeeping. Raymon (Front Office) was very helpful and accommodating. Activities include golf, horse-back riding (They have a stable) and water-related activities. The hotel is located directly on a large (and clean) beach. Valet ($10) and free self-park is available. The hotel charges a $20 per day resort fee. This also includes free local and tell-free calling and excellent wired and wireless high speed internet. (although it's unsecured) The hotel/resort is definitely value priced. (not so with "restaurants". Now enough of the Good and on to the Bad and Ugly. First, the not-so bad: The Palm Terrace is located in the main lobby and serves a good variety of breakfast, lunch and dinner at moderate prices. The charbroiled burger is great. They offer good buffets as well. Service is very good. You can expect to spend $20 for a full breakfast and $25 for lunch. I'd describe Palm Terrace as a cut above Denny's and a cut below Chili's but with a great view of a cove and consistently friendly staff. The hotel has an independently owned "Gourmet" (laugh, laugh) restaurant called Ola. On the beach itself and open on all sides, the location and view is perfect. The food, service and prices are a JOKE! My server was Raymond C and I'd say that he was rude, inattentive and unsuitable for a supposedly 1st rate restaurant. The prices ($100 per person) are completely out of line. For $100 one expects a 1st rate, world-class dining experience. I had: Mai-Tai ($11.50), Wild Mushroom Salad ($16), Scallops with added-on 8 ounce lobster ($45) and a class of Chardonnay ($8). Total without tip was $95 with tax. The salad was far from fresh. It was wilted and dirty ! There were no "wild mushrooms". Just not very fresh looking button and small portabella local supermarket-type mushrooms. The Scallops and 8 oz lobster tail were OK. Much like what you'd get a Red Lobster for 1/3 the price (and you'd have better service) Presentation...fah-ghet-about it ! On the scale of Denny's. Wine was served in stemmed water glass. On exiting, I gave my impressions, privately, to the "Manager" (Robert) who became rude and invited me to lease post-haste. Not too be completely deterred, and compelled by the outstanding setting, I returned for breakfast. Orange Juice was $4.50, Coffee $3.50 and Omelet was $16. Total $25 without tip. Breakfast service was OK, no presentation but the food was what you'd expect from a Denny's. Located on Golf Course the (the hotel can deliver you there via golf cart in 3 minutes) is the Lala restaurant. Moderately priced, excellent service, basic menu, akin to a 3 star local restaurant. The excellent service is attributable to Owner Ian's constant presence and vigilant eye. He clearly has a good handle on everything. I had an 8 ounce cut of prime rib. It seemed more like 10 ounces and was perfectly cooked. The bar tender was lazy and refused to provide a fresh sliver of lemon skin for my Gray Goose on the rocks. It's a pleasant experience and if you're looking for an on-site alternative to Ola, you won't be disappointed at Lala. The Hotel's high end restaurant is called "Twenty-One Degrees North", and was not open during my stay. I examined the menu and the decor. Although very pricey as well, it offered an upper end menu selection, better than average wine list. I would have like to check it out. Overall, I can recommend the Turtle Bay Resort as a beautiful, quiet place to relax without the hustle of a tourist trap. Recognizing this is a 4 star rated resort it is appropriately rated. Just have the proper expectation with respect to dining (there's a Foodland supermarket 6 miles away) There are several smaller towns located within a 20 to 30 minute drive that offer local shopping for island goodies and some local and diverse food fare. Would I return here again? Yes..if I wanted to just unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings ~ No Music”
Reviews.Author: kathyw66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I Just returned from an eight day stay at Turtle Bay. We came home with mixed feelings. First we stayed in the cottages. If you decide to stay in these be sure you know where your going. We were sent way down to cottage 125 and it is far from the hotel, pool and swim beach. Plus the ocean is kind of far from your cottage. We asked to be moved closer to the hotel and the water and ended up in 102 which is much more convenient and very close to the water and there are surfers right in front of your room every day. Complete privacy and a trek to pool and facility go higher in number for the cottages.....close go low numbers...they start at 100. The cottages are lovely, but I somewhat regretted our decision not to be in the main building on a high floor to take advantage of the location and stunning view. The cottages are not located on the swim beach so you can't just swim right out in front of your room. The swim beach is on the other side of t he resort. I guess our biggest complaint was the food and food options in the area. We didn't have a decent meal the whole time we were gone to be honest. All of the venues for food at the hotel were ridiculously expensive. Prohibitive in fact. For 2 hotdogs, fries, fruit and 2 drinks we paid $50.00 for lunch from Hang 10. We ended up at the local foodland to pick up sandwhich stuff, cereal and snacks, but for dinner you either pay$$$$ or you drive 25 minutes to the nearest town which was very crowded with little parking. Even the food we had at the resort was not good food. We did find the shrimp trucks but sadly were not impressed with those either. Ted's bakery is not just a bakery they do have food and it was decent, but not great. The other thing I noticed the most is that there isn't any music here of any kind. We were on Maui and Kauii last year and everywhere we went including our hotel there was either hawaiin music being played with a few hula dancers or it was being played on a stereo adding to the atmosphere of a hawaiin vacation. There was not one bit of music and it took away from our vacation. Music really makes a difference. It doesn't have to be obnoxiously loud, just background tropical music, for your tropical vacation. Someone on here mentioned a luau....which we discovered after we left is held only on Friday. We were there on a Friday and never heard one word about it. Nor did we even know where it was or hear any music that night either. Technically if you don't mind paying way too much for the food you get that isn't very good, you wouldn't need to leave the property during your vacation, but we were pretty dissapointed in our stay here. Lastly, the housekeeping staff ignores the do not disturb sign, so beware. The location is fantastic, but it doesn't make up for what it lacks. We won't return.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a resort on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler70
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is one of the most outstanding resorts on the Island of Oahu, HI. It is located on the North Shore and provides an amazing ocean view from every room on the property. This resort provides excellent facilities for golf, pool swimming, beach swimming, horseback riding, tennis, and restaurant & poolside dining. The staff is courteous, the prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere very relaxing. Due to the location of this resort, one must acquire transportation in order to be able to visit other parts of the island since it is 1to1-1/2 hours from Honolulu. I would recommend that one rents a car at the airport and drive to the resort. You then would be able to visit the Dole Planation, Pearl Harbor, Waikiki Beach, etc. at your own leisure. The property is also family-friendly. Be sure to visit this outstanding resort! It is a jewel located on the North Shore of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Gross Rooms”
Reviews.Author: waikoloasue
Reviews.Content: I spent a quick weekend at Turtle Bay for a wedding. I was frankly appalled at the condition of the guest rooms particularly the bathrooms. This is not a cheap hotel, with all the fees its almost 375 a night. There was obvious mildew on the ceiling in the room near the a/c vent. The carpet is threadbare and frankly gross and the bed was as hard as a rock. About the bathrooms, I could go on for hours. Let's just say, I spent extra money at the spa so that I could shower there. I am not that picky. There is the most horrific flourescent lighting I have ever seen, the grout is mildewy, the tub shallow and embarrassing. Again, this resort is not cheap. Now, on the good side. The service was good. There were no robes in the room, when I called they brought them right up. Everyone was very friendly and went above and beyond. The land that the hotel sits on is great, but the building and rooms are just so outdated and frankly sad and dirty that it is depressing. To sum up, I'd avoid this hotel for the price. There are many better options for less. I used the spa, which is also in desperate need of a refurbishing, it is nothing special and resembles a locker room at best. But the massage I had was great and the people were lovely. The restaurants are very expensive and only ok. The breakfast buffet was good but not for the price. 21 degrees north was also very overpriced for the food. Plus the resort is REALLY in the middle of nowhere and you are stuck eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and view, but otherwise stinks”
Reviews.Author: GatoRat
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful sixth floor room with a fantastic view. The snorkeling was a blast. That's it for the good news. The resort itself is very boring. The staff varies from good to poor. The pool isn't heated, which may not seem to be a problem, but with the rain we had, it was very cold. Every guest we overheard or talked to about the pool said it was too cold. The result was that very few people went swimming and those that did stayed in only a few minutes. Fortunately, the beach water was more tolerable. If this was it, I'd still give it a higher review, but it isn't: The food stunk. It was awful--barely fit for a dog--and very expensive. For breakfast, my wife and I ordered a classic double egg meal. Our eggs were cooked well, but the toast was overdone and cold, the hash browns were half raw, half-charred and had been sitting in oil for who knows how long. They almost made me ill. The orange juice was terrible. And this crap cost us $34, including the 20% discount the manager gave us after we complained. The next day, we tried a burger at Olas for lunch. It was disgusting. They mixed mushrooms and onions into the burger and added bad lettuce and an under ripe tomato. Even more hilarious, they gave us a nearly empty ketchup bottle--where you have to shake it to get the ketchup out and it tasted like it was a cheap generic brand in a Heinz bottle (I really do think it was.) The included French Fries were some cheap brand almost cold; you get better stuff from your grocer's freezer. Then there was the bad lemonade. And this cost us $28. (Let me put this in perspective; I hate McDonald's and they serve both better breakfasts and lunch/dinners than the restaurants at this place.) The resort nickel and dimes you to death (they charge a $20 resort fee a day--but then they charge extra for almost everything.) Phone calls to the mainland are EXTREMELY expensive--almost $1 a minute expensive. And the concierge was an ignorant fool who couldn't answer my most basic questions. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth in Kahuku”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTrina
Reviews.Content: If I lost it all tomorrow, I would be happy that I had stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort. I won't bore you with the sordid tale that lead to us looking for a room at the last moment on the North Shore. Suffice to say we had heard that the Turtle Bay was expensive, but worth every penny -- and one of the few hotels on Oahu's North Shore. Even though we did not have reservations, we paid $411 per night for a beachside cottage. The cottage buildings are non-descript from the parking lot, but once you get inside, it's a whole 'nuther world. The views were incredible, and my husband and I found ourselves wanting to just stay at the cottage, or walk along the beach and watch the sea turtles munching on algae near the rocks just offshore. Sunsets were exasperatingly beautiful. There are plenty of hammocks, big enough for 2, swinging in the breezes on the lawn outside of the cottages. We ate at The Palm Terrace, Ola and 21 Degrees North and were very happy wit the food and service. I want to go back. I would live there if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyelady
Reviews.Content: We were at Turtle Bay Resort for 6 nights for a conference. First, let me say, the staff was awesome and overly accommodating. Housekeeping staff was even very friendly. The rooms definitely need to be updated. The bathrooms should be updated and leave a lot to be desired. The beds are extremely uncomfortable and the sheets do not stay on the bed. The pillows are also uncomfortable. The resort itself is beautiful and has great views of the ocean and has a wonderful beach on-site. If your desire is to just hang around the beach and pool to relax, then this is a great resort for you! If you want some night-life, this is definitely not the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oneyearoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (October 4-6, 2008). The location, on a point on Oahu's North Shore, is exceptional. You can see one bay from one side, and a different bay from the other side. When we arrived, they first gave us a really dismal room, with a view of the roof of the facilities and then the open ocean. I complained, and got a much better room, overlooking the pool, the bay and the mountains all at once. That made a considerable difference in my opinion of this property. The rooms are pretty basic and functional. They also leave a stuffed animal on the bed, which I promptly put in a drawer. I don't like those kinds of things -- I always wonder who has been handling them. Yuck. On this trip to Hawaii, we had stayed at the Marriott Waiohai in Kauai and the Westin Moana Surfrider in Waikiki. The difference in quality between those top tier hotels and Turtle Bay Resort is evident. Maybe it's that the rooms are older and although upgraded, just can't match the quality of the other two. The air conditioning in the lobby is cranked up to Arctic levels. We tried to eat at their clubhouse type restaurant but it was just too cold. We ate in the restaurant by the pool for breakfast and had the best omelet I think I've ever had -- packed with vegetables. We also ate at the golf course restaurant -- so so. Summary: the setting has to be one of the most beautiful in the world. The rooms are functional -- but don't expect luxury. I'd go again, just for the chance to stay in such a spectacular setting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: MB123England
Reviews.Content: Matt & Sorina Oswestry UK Myself and my wife are from the UK and honeymooned at the Turtle Bay Resort between 16th and 22nd September 2008. As soon as we arrived via the long drive way entrance leading upto the main hotel, we knew we had made the right choice for our stay on Oahu. The hotel is awesome, we loved the open to the elements reception area as our first impression of the hotel. Booking in was easy even if our booking had for some reason been cancelled. Not a problem though, the hotel re-registered us as guests (as we had pre paid) and we got our ocean front deluxe room. Our first impression of the room was a bit of a let down. Soon as we opened the room door myself and my wife for some reason were just expecting something a little bit more deluxe than we actually got. We didnt think the room was poor, just not ultra deluxe as we were expecting. It was just nice but nothing more. The balcony and view were fantastic and to wake up each morning to the sound of the waves was so great. Only downside with the view is the flat roof that stretches out infront of all the deluxe rooms on the front of the resort. The Hang Ten bar was great. The ahi sandwiches were to die for. Drinks were not that expensive either. Myself and m,y wife loved the Monkey Lunchies cocktails. Well worth the $11 each. The Palm Terrace was our worst experience as the service was poor and the food was just ok. We ordered clam chowders to start. Mone had loads of fish and potatoe in it and my wifes had none!!!! The Pizza we shared for our main course, again was ok but they failed to clear the table of our half finished starters while we ate our main course. They had also run our of spoons for the chowder!!!!! I asked our waiter how he expected us then to eat the chowder and suggested we used the tea spoons!!!! We really didnt like this particular restaurant and to cap it off we lost our camera here. We left it on the table by mistake and someone nicked it as it was necer handed in. By far the best restaurant was Ola. Brilliant brilliant brilliant. We had two meals here, both of which were fantastic. Try the garlic shrips with pasta or if your a meat eater try the beef. It just melts off the bone. The taco meat starters are also fab. We just cant fault this place whatsoever. Service and Food were 10 out of 10. Not the cheapest place we have ever eaten but well well worth it. The Bay Club bar was also good for food and a great place to have drinks if you just fancy a few cheeky drinks after a meal at Ola. 21 Degrees North looked nice but the menu didnt appeal so we didnt eat here so cant really comment. The pools are great fun and the slide, even though its for kids is still good fun for adults too. I had 5 go's on it to my wifes amusement. Hot tubs are near by and are great also. As it was our honeymoon we splashed out and took a trip with Paradise Helicopters who are based on the resort. Well worth the money. The Oahu experience lasts for 40 mins and shows you all the points of interest over the island. The staff here were friendly and very helpful. Keep a look out for the pilots surfing dog!!! Yes a dog that can actually surf. All in all a fantastic hotel, great and helpful staff. Expensive but well worth it apart from the Palm Terrace. If your thinking of going........go........its paradise :-)

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay, RELAX, RELAX, RELAX”
Reviews.Author: JWAPO
Reviews.Content: Let me just say this was the best vacation spot! My husband researched everything prior to our trip, I would say thats a must when going somewhere such as Hawaii. We haven't been on a trip in 4 years (busy having babies) so we really expected a lot and wanted a different kind of trip, a RELAX only trip. Turtle Bay is the place to relax, there is no night life (go to Vegas for that) we didn't want night life, we didn't want noise and we got just that. I did find out the hotel is now owned by the state of Hawaii, so the few repairs our updating that needs to be done, I am sure is not a priority for the state. I would recommend to buck up and get a cottage (they are the newest part of Turtle Bay), that was the best part of my stay, we had excellent service and the room and views from the room were breathtaking. Take notice the hotel is "true Hawaii" its not completely brand new, it has a charm that makes you feel truely away from it all. We appreciate that. I would recommend, Lei Lei's at the golf course, best food we had. Skip Olas, terrible and not owned by the hotel. The food at the pool bar is very good (try the Ahi salad). Try Ted's Bakery, Pizza Bob's (try the wings, excellent) and Spagettini. We also got snacks at Foodmart, and some alcohol for our room. Made drinks and took them around the beach and pool. Saved us somedays from a 40-80.00 drink tab at the pool. Expect to pay a $20 resort fee, almost all hotels are doing that now. But I considered that I parked right in front of my room (cottage) so who cares about the resort fee. Everyone was friendly and nice, I couldn't ask for more. I wish to thank Eric and Terry. You ask, they deliver. Turtle Bay will always hold a special place in my heart and I wish to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed Local”
Reviews.Author: mknhi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking to get away from the huslte and bustle of town and decided to spend one night at Turtle Bay. Hoping to do just that...relax. Making the reservation was flawless, golfing was amazing, horseback riding, hopefully will be worth it (scheduled for tomorrow morning). First of all, the room we booked is an "Oceanfront Deluxe" room. When anyone hears or sees "oceanfront", one would assume (I know, I know... never assume) we would see the ocean. What we really got was a pool view with trees. NO oceanview. I asked the front desk manager (William)..."what am I paying for?" and his reply to me was "the bigger balcony". I was shocked...I will be taking this up with the General Manager, that's for sure. So, we decided to treat ourselves to a buffet dinner, which we don't normally get to do, living here in Hawaii. (it gets expensive, eating out). When we go to make our salad, the lettuce is floating in water. On the entree line, 4 of the 5 entrees are empty. 20 cooks behind the counter, nothing getting refilled. Crab legs were empty (5 minute wait for that). The prime rib, I was told, only had medium rare. They could not accommodate my well done order. When I finally got fed up with their 3 star service, I asked for a manager (that was another 15 minute wait). I ended up going to the front desk manager and he basically handed me off to the Food and Beverage Manager and all she did was take my plates off our table. NO discount!!! Management needs to be trained on customer service and fast...This is unacceptable service for a, supposed 5 star resort. I've had better service at a 2 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tranqulity on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: stefanw
Reviews.Content: We were here for about two weeks this September and really enjoyed the north side of the island. Note that if you want partying, Bulgari, and Cartier, this place isn't for you - head south east to Waikiki. However, if you want long white sand beaches, quiet days, and not another hotel for 15 miles, come to TBR. Pros: * Reasonable room pricing - you can get an ocean front room for around $225 in low season if you shop around * Well maintained facility - it's right on the ocean (I'm sitting 10 feet away inside right now), but they do a great job keeping the place fresh * Amazing grounds - 880 acres to explore - all on the ocean and beautifully landscaped * Super friendly staff - friendly without [--]-kissing * 6 restaurants on property - important because there is not much else around here * Rooms are fine - nothing five-diamond or amazing (altho i hear the beach bungalows are swankier), but clean, comfortable, and all with great views * Huge pool (actually 1 huge one, and two smaller ones for kiddies with waterslides) * Free wiFi thoughout the resort * Great spa treatments – right on the ocean in a little hut. * Lamonts (convenience store) – open from 7am-11pm right by the pool – super convenient Cons * The pool needs a bottom resurfacing - parts of the smooth plaster has worn away in places in the kiddie end, leading to more than one scraped knee as the kids go down to play. * The poolside drink service is terribly slow - once you order, it's quick, but finding someone to serve you $10 mai tais can be challenging - and that's just annoying * The food prices - just get ready to pay LOTS to eat here. Burgers are $15 and up, entrees average $28, starters $10-13. It's not that much worse than any other big city, but since there is nowhere else to eat unless you want to get in the car and drive to Lai'e or Haleiwa (both not too far away), every meal at these prices gets spendy. Most lunches cost us $70 and dinners were usually around $90-100. * The resort fee - annoying $20 fee that covers WiFi, parking, snorkel gear, etc. I just find hidden fees annoying. * Minor gripe - parking is a hike away. Easy enough to drop your wife or hubby off and you can go park, but it's a trek. Valet is an additional $10. Tips while staying here: * Stay on the side facing the pool, not the pacific if you want a lanai that is bigger than a postage stamp. You still get amazing views, but you can actually use your lanai. Anything on the pacific side has little juliet balconies - worthless if more than one person wants to sit out there. * Restaurants on property (in order of how much we liked them): • O'la (lunch + dinner) • 21 degrees (dinner - liked it more than Ola, but just pricier), • Lei Leis (dinner - golf course dining - but nice food and service), • Palm Terrace (dinner - was pretty good, but atmosphere felt like a cafeteria), • Bay Club (the bar on property - bar food), • Hang10 (lunch) - actually good food, but the service was so bad (slow) both times that the latter time we left and walked over to Ola - serves poolside fare. * Restaurants off property (in order) – • Hukilau in Laie - local place, cheap, and the burger will blow your mind. • Haleiwa Joes - in Haleiwa - on the water, good seafood, place for kiddies to run around. • Romy’s Shrimp Stand – they pull them out of the farmed pond behind the truck, cook them up, and you eat them. Amazing if you like peeling your shrimp. If not, pass. • Ai-something burgers in Haleiwa – big fresh burgers – not bad • L &L Drive Ins (lai’e and Haleiwa) – plate lunches – local chain • We’re going to hit Ted’s Bakery this AM –apparently it’s awesome and just down the road • Various fruit stands dot the side of the road – get some fresh coconut or pineapple or avocado. • Go to Foodland in Lai’e or just north of Haleiwa and stock up on beer, water, chips, breakfast stuff, etc. There is a fridge in the room that you can put stuff in (small, mind you). We ate breakfast on the lanai most mornings – cheaper and we didn’t have to get dressed. • There are a ton of snorkeling coves around with turtles and fish – ask the Concierge and they can direct you. I’ll let you find the rest out for yourself – but these are the highlights and lowlights of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: SUy81
Reviews.Content: I would have to say this is my worst experience in Oahu. My wife and I decided to stay at the North Shore this time and we decided with the deluxe ocean suite. First off, we only got 30% of the ocean view because we were on the third floor, and seen mostly the roof of the resort. The resort was so boring, we had to drive down to Waikiki area for a better enjoyment. While there, the only thing we did was the horseback ride, and it did not worth $90 per person. Our inner thighs ended up in pain from the ride, so we just ended up relaxing the last day. On the checkout date, we decided to go snorkeling before we leave. Well, the free rental was suppose to open at 9:00am, but it opened up at 9:30am. We were fine with that, until we got to the counter at 9:45am, and they told us they needed our towel card. A TOWEL CARD to check out snorkeling equipment which we left in our room. That would require a 15 minutes to get to our room and back. All in all, I would never go back there and stay at our usual hotel, which is the Hilton in Waikiki, or Hotel Renew.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: ifly747s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 wonderful days at the Turtle Bay Resort. The 880 acre grounds were exquisite -- there are tennis courts, golf courses, beaches, a great pool, wonderful hiking trails and views of the ocean from nearly everywhere -- including the open air lobby. The rooms were large -- as were the bathrooms. I felt the rooms seemed a little empty. They could have used 1 or 2 more chairs for relaxing in the room. The full sized lanai was nice for sitting out and enjoying the spectacular ocean views. I highly recommend spending a little extra, and getting a deluxe, ocean front room. If your room is facing the pool, make sure it's on a high floor or else you might be bothered by the pool noise. The restaurants on the property ranged from great to poor. At the beachfront restaurant, Ola's, the food was great -- the ambience was unmatched. You can actually get a table on the sand. The poolside bar & grill, HangTen, is a good place to grab some [tasty] lunchfare. My one and only complaint, was the hotel's breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace. It was failrly pricey @ $23 per person, and the food was awful. The selection of fruit on the buffet was not very good. I've eaten better breakfasts [for free] at the Holiday Inn Express. Overall, we loved the Turtle Bay Resort, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: rzngro
Reviews.Content: The resort location was as spectacular as I had expected, but the room was a bit of a let down. It was comfortable and clean. Great ocean view. But, you could say they were going for a vintage look. Or, you could say Time for an Update! The staff taking care of snorkelers and sun bathers were wonderful. But, otherwise, not a place I'd come running back to.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely return”
Reviews.Author: davidbh1453
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort is on a beautiful piece of land where the North Shore meets the Windward Coast, about an hour from the HNL airport. This place is a WORLD away from the hustle of Waikiki. The area is rural and quaint, with great roadside stands and fantastic beaches. The amenities - spa, golf, tennis, horseback riding, beach, pool, running trails, etc. were great. The restaurants at the resort are fantastic and the service overall is top-notch. The resort is on the ocean, but it was a bit cloudy and windy when we were there -- though we could easily drive five miles west for more sunshine and beautiful sand and surf! Try Giovanni's shrimp truck and Ted's Bakery outside the gates -- YUMMMM!!!! Our favorite area beach was Sunset Beach. The rooms need minor renovations, but overall the stay was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: redheadsoccermom
Reviews.Content: I will admit after reading some of the negative reviews I was getting a little nervous about staying there, however from the moment we arrived at the hotel till the day we left it was a great experience. The room was nice and the view was amazing. Our breakfast buffet for 4 was included and was a great way to start the days off. My boys loved the pool and my hubbie and I spent alot of time on the little beach. It was great being so close to the North Shore twice we went in to town for dinner, Cholos was pretty good and Haliwa's Joes which was amazing. But I have to say the best meal we had was at Ola's, sure it was expensive but the food was out of this world and eating dinner on the sand was one of the highlights of our trip. My only complaint I have actually has nothing to do with the hotel, was it rained alittle more than Im used to. However we would get in our car and drive ten minutes and we would be out of the rain. The staff at the Turtle Bay was so helpful and friendly. I cant wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay - The True Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: mchernow
Reviews.Content: After a night in Oahu on Waikiki, we decided to get away from the hustle and bustle. We went online and searched out properties on the North Shore, and came upon Turtle Bay. A quick call and we were able to get a 3-bedroom villa within 50 feet of the ocean, for less than 2 rooms were costing us on Waikiki (actually, 30% less). Even though Turtle Bay is away from most of the traditional sights to see on Oahu, it's worth the drive. The hotel is awesome, the food is awesome and the staff is awesome. The concierges at the hotel were among the best we'd ever encountered, recommending some off-the-beaten-path stops such as the Macadamia Nut Farm (which has very little to do with macadamia nuts), Papa Ole's eatery (so small I can't even call it a restaurant) and several others. Turtle Bay is still within driving distance of the Dole Plantation, Pearl Harbor, the Polynesian Cultural Center and Waikiki, but it's far enough away to be a quiet retreat. The three-bedroom villa was perfect for us and our 3 teenagers. It's equipped with a full kitchen, a dining room and a living room, and perhaps the best thing about it.....a washer/dryer. Since we were going to be in Hawaii for 2 weeks, not having to pay resort prices for laundry and not having to hunt around for a laundromat was a great plus. And the villa had a balcony with a view of the beach, perfect for a late afternoon reading spot. The villas are also a bit away from the resort and have their own private pool and hot tub. The food at Turtle Bay is great, especially Ola, which is located right next door to the villas. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet as well as Sunday brunch in the Sunset Room, which featured live music and a great view of the water. And Lei Lei's, located at the golf course, had some of the best fish we ever tasted. And the golf courses are world-class, the staff there was extremely friendly and the amenities top-notch. Overall, we couldn't have asked for a better place to get away from it all while still being within driving distance of it all. If you're going to Oahu and don't want to be right in the middle of the big city that Waikiki's become, stay at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: gingin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there July 13 - 16, 2008. There is only one word to describe Turle Bay Resort and that is "Paradise"! Even for me in a wheelchair everything - room, lobby, gardens and pool - was accessible (and you cannot take that for granted in all hotels). My teenage daughter had fun learning to surf and my husband enjoyed doing nothing except watching turtles and birds. If they built a ramp from cottage into the garden and offered a beachwheelchair, I would probably never have left!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ania80
Reviews.Content: Great place, simply breath taking. Stayed in July for 8 days for our weddingmoon, got a great deal on travelocity and could not pass it up. It was still expensive for us but we wanted to splurge, and we were so glad we did! We felt like royalty. The room is awesome! Wish it had a microwave and its own hammock right outside but we just walked over to our neighboors a few door down. You can hear the waves each night, best sleep ever and I am a light sleeper! You do see some people walk by but our window but everyone we encountered was respectful of our privacy. There is a curtain, which doesnt fit the rest of the room, its really tacky in my opinion. There is a great pool and beach right there, not crowded at all, oh and a 2 hot tub/jacuzzis. We did the Friday night luau and it was great, food pretty good too. The dancers from the polynesian cultural center perform, saved us the time and money of going out there. We did rent a car, which is almost a must if you stay longer than 3 days I would say, otherwise the restaurants are too pricey. We did eat at Ola's on the beach which was very romantic, food ok, not great. But we did eat really well at Ted's Bakery and Cinnamon's at Kilua. Got some snack ect. at a local Kmart and Foodland is close on the way to the resort. My sister and did the Sunday brunch and just loved it, wonderful according to her. Overall, check out Haliewa for food options, there are a lot, and cheap for Hawaii. My sister stayed in the hotel part, ocean view room, got a good deal, better than their website just by calling in and checking the difference btwn the partial view and ocean front rooms. They stayed on the 6th floor, it had a picture perfect view of the beach and Ola's, it was great. They were very pleased. Hotel is in great shape, don't believe all the complaints out there. This is a wonderful place and tons of things to do right there, no car required. It's Hawaii, grab a drink and watch the waves, go swimming in the pool, just enjoy it before its over- I wish I was there right now. :)

Reviews.Title: “4 great nights”
Reviews.Author: marvindog
Reviews.Content: Throughout our stay the staff were courteous and friendly. The room was very comfortable with a fantastic view over the bay and surf beaches. The six restraunts provided variety at reasonable prices. Plenty of resort activities including golf, helicopter rides, tennis, walking trails, horse riding, surfing and swimming.

Reviews.Title: “a little dated, a little expensive and away from the action”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for 4 days in December. It is a bit outdated and could use a renovation (outside had paint peeling, the rooms had old bedspreads and furniture), but our room had a nice balcony and we could hear the waves crashing at night which was nice. It was bit expensive for it being outdated, but I figure it must be because they have such a nice location. Turtle Bay sits on about 80 acres of beachfront on the North Shore. It's arguably one of the prettist areas of Oahu. It's also far away from Wakiki (about 45minutes to an hour by car with no traffic). So if you want to be able to walk to restaurants and shops, this isn't the place for you. That being said, there were some nice hiking trails and lots of beach areas where it was so seculded we were the only people around which was great. We drove to Haleiwa for most of our meals because they had good surfer food (read: good, filling and cheap) and it was pretty close. Ted's Bakery is also a short drive from the resort. Definitely relaxing not being in the hustle and bustle of Wakiki, but you have to pay a bit more for that luxury...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: taggsSydney
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my husband and I were very disappointed. Hundreds of school aged children were staying which made the hotel more like summer camp than a luxury resort. We even considered checking out the next day but luckily the group was at the end of their stay. Our room looked tied and in need of updating, however it was large and the dressing room off the bathroom was great. Our room was on the 4th floor east wing with views over the ocean but unfortunately a large brown flat roof dominated the foreground. I suggest requesting a room on the 6th floor facing the ocean. These rooms will not have the brown roof dominating the view. Overall, the wonderful location of the hotel endeared us and we would consider returning if we are able to request a certain floor and room or upgrade to the ocean front cottages. We ate at a number of restaurants located within the resort and were pleasantly surprised. Try the salmon at Ola and Lei Lei's. Other than the disappointing room standard and initial summer camp experience, we thoroughly enjoyed the North Shore location.

Reviews.Title: “Amzing large sea turtles everyday of our stay! really is Turtle Bay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nardone
Reviews.Content: Turtle bay is really turtle Bay! Everyday when we walked down to the turtle bay cove we saw three to 10 turtles come in on the surf and eat alge then turn around and headout with the surf. To get into the water you have to walk down to the far end of this cove if you wish to swim with them. No need to get in if you don't wish too. We couldn't believe how lucky we were. While you are there you can check out some of the locations that the filmed "lost" at. We were very happy with this stay-all rooms have oceans/cove views, their isn't a bad view in the place. I saw somene said that the interior was dated and I strongly disagree! It was painted a very soothing green which I think is great for the Japaness clients that they must have at times during the year. This hotel wasn't dated rather they appear to not fall into the desire to spend money on lots of trends that will be dated as well way too soon.I thought the hotel was classy with more of an understated flair that fit with the wyland design and the feeling. They had a wonderful buffet that was pricee-like all things in Hawaii. The Pizza place in town was great and the price was excellent, but you have to be ready to relax and wait, they are on Hawaiian time.They had live music and dance in the lobby and this would be a perfect place for a couple. They also had two large birds that all the children seemed to enjoy. I can't stress enough that all rooms have a water view, they also have bungelows that are right on the beach-what a treat that would be-The end of the hotel also has suites that span the whole end and have sliders on both sides. The hotel sits on a point so both sides of the hotel and see water, the cove views are very relaxing and it's fun to watch the beach and there cutie eatery by the water. We didn't golf but my husband really wanted to-- both courses looked amazing. The food was good we ate dinner in the bar and had great meal and service. Would love to stay here again when I just want to relax-if you want to do honolulu (the bustle and weirdos) this isn't the place- but if your children can swim and you want a maui vaction on ohau this is the best deal around. Becareful how many are in your party even if children-I got charge $400 extra by HOTELS.COM for an extra person. Which was my own child staying in the room. This is the hotels policy, but they don't do it themselves, I will be disputing this! (not really turtle bays problem!- but they have had this complaint before.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelar
Reviews.Content: Great place to 'getaway'. The North Shore is fabulous. I would highly recommend an upgrade to the Cottages or the Villas if you are a family. These are just lovely and wonderful decor and amenities. The standard rooms are fairly plain but all have balconies and great ocean views. Make sure you have cocktails at the bar/restaurant on the beach. Wonderful service and drinks! Easy to get to the supermarket down to the street to get some wine/beer to have on the balcony to watch the sunset. Fabulous spa facilities. Turtle spotting. Pool area great and fabulous service. I do agree it needs a bit of a facelift as the hotel rooms are fairly plain and overpriced but I think you pay for the resort facilities more than the room type. The room is MASSIVE and so is the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Wilcojoe
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from a six night stay, which she had won on the Regis and Kelly show. We had a wonderful time. The resort was wonderful. A little worn in spots but with such a perfect location and great views, you wont even notice. SInce my wife was six months pregnant we were mostly limited to swiming and snorkeling but that was fine with us. We do however highly recommend the North Shore Shark Adventures. That was an absolute blast. All of our meals in the Palm Terrace were paid for by the show. The menu items are average at best, but the breakfast buffet cant be beat. As good as any I have ever had. You cant go wrong with all the great fresh fruit. Despite my efforts to try and bribe the front desk agent with a hundred dollar bill (hey it's worked before) to get us upgraded to a cottage room, we were very pleased with our sixth floor view in the east wing. With such gorgeous sunset views every night, you will hardly notice the rooftop below you. The agent let us choose either an ocean view sunset room or a view of the pool and mountains (with limited ocean view), but we decided on the ocean view and were not disappointed. I dont think there is a bad view in the whole place. The pool area was great, especially the waterslide. Tame enough for my pregnant wife but still very fun, nonetheless. Be sure and try the Mai-Tai's at the Hang Ten Bar by the pool. The best I have ever had. My wife was very envious, but that didnt stop her from taking the occasional sip here and there. Loved the parrots in the lobby. In fact when we left, we felt like we were leaving our babies behind. Very sweet and sometimes hillarious little buggers. All in all, one of the best trips of our lives. Course it doesnt hurt that airfare, hotels and meals were already paid for. Though we still managed to drop over $1500 on convertible, (a must), drinks, golf (Palmer Course now my number 3 favorite resort course of all time.. Right behind Pebble Beach and the White Whitch in Jamaica), off site meals, and the Shark Adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: MichiganCookies
Reviews.Content: We had just one night here. Lovely location, all rooms have balconies w/ ocean views. Nice dinner at '21' - would have preferred to try Ola's but it wasn't listed in the hotel's directory so we thought it was gone! Perhaps this is a good place if you surf or golf, but I was surprised at how quiet it all was. The lobby is big and empty, the rooms are big and empty. The directory lists the resort attractions as if they were sites at some other location - nothing seems to be going on save for the pool (rather plain) and beach (which is, as all HI beaches, public) so I'm not sure why anyone would stay - other than to get away from Wakaki if Oahu is the only island you are visiting. We weren't there on a weekend - when you can spend more money and attend a luau - but still . . . offer something. Oh - and you'll pay for everyTHING - including 3.50 for the bottle of water in your room!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TJBSt_Louis_Missouri
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is worth every penny. My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon and it was relaxing and beautiful. Every room has an ocean view, and our particular room looked out over the beach. The Resort includes two golf courses (which my husband enjoyed) and a day spa (which I would highly recommend). The service is efficient and friendly. If I had one complaint, it was the food. Our meals were adequate, but not excellent (despite a resort price tag). There are places in the north shore towns that are not bad, but you need a car to reach them. The drinks, however, are excellent. Also, the snorkeling off the hotel's private beach is superb. A wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Presidential suite”
Reviews.Author: engadget1
Reviews.Content: I am a loal that lives here on Oahu and Turtle Bay is one of the only hotels that gives you an experince outside of the city (Waikiki), Waikiki is indeed fast paced and isn't as laid back as Turtle Bay Resort. We stayed here during the weekend. We rented out the Presidential Suite for 2 nights to host a 18th Birthday Party. The room can fit up to 30 guests and our room had one king sized bed (we also rented another room with an extension to the Presidential suite that could sleep another 4 guests), an enourmous living room, wet bar, 2 bathrooms with a jacuzzi and his and her showers. The dining room could seat up to 12 people and you have 3 balconies over looking the ocean and mountains. The service was great, we had no complaints. We did a catering ourder of Sushi to be delieverd in our room at 6 PM sharp and it the doorbell rang exactly at that time. The service was great. One of the most dissapointing aspects about this room is the "technology" the room offers. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, but for a $2,800 nigh, we expected the room to have Flat Screen Televisions or at least Wide Screen Televisions. Instead the room had a 26 inch or so Philips televison that was during the 90's era. I'm assuming this wouldn't be a problem for most people that stay in this room because they would probably spend most of their time outside their hotel room. Also, since the room was so large, the AC didn't really make the room cold, as other rooms. The party didn't end till 5 in the morning and we wanted called front desk to give us a wake up call. It took more than 20 rings for the attendant to answer the phone, this wasn't a problem but I expect them to answer the phone in less than 3 rings. This is indeed an expensive hotel afterall. The brunch at Turtle Bay was great. One of the main attractions in this buffet were the omlete station and prime rib carving station. There was also a performer entertaning bunch guests. We were given champainge and apple cider. We rented out 3 other regular suites and the rooms were cold at 60 degrees, in the Presidential Suite 60 degrees felt like 69.

Reviews.Title: “The Cottages saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: moorejel
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Turtle Bay, and without the upgrade to the cottages, our trip would have been doomed. Last year we stayed in the deluxe ocean front rooms and the entire hotel seemed to be in great shape. This was not the case the second time around. Upon arrival and after check in we proceeded to our room. After we passed the tattered carpet in the corridors, we entered our room and all I could think was "groady"! The carpet was wet and sticky, the duvet cover was tattered, the walls were dirty and the smell in the room was musty. If it wasn't for the spectacular view I would have thought I was in a Motel 6. I went down to the front desk to explain the situation and requested an upgrade (at my cost) to the cottages. After one failed attempt due to the front desk lady who would not take any less than $300.00 per night for the upgrade, I finally spoke with another front desk clerk that gave us the upgrade to the cottages for $150.00 per night. We arrived in the ocean front cottages and IT WAS HEAVEN!!! Take my advice, if you can splurge the extra dough, you will not be sorry...we will definitely come back to stay in the cottages. Restaurant recommendations: at the resort: 21 Latitude is excellent! Go for the yummy filet! Watch out for unwashed lettuce at Ola's...I found a worm in my salad and they didn't even comp my lunch...ridiculous!!! In Haleiwa: Pizza Bob's is YUMMY!!!!!! So is Killer Tacos for carnitas tacos and Cholo's for mexican food. Other than the room situation, it was great and it truly is old hawaii..I miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Yucky rooms - overpriced”
Reviews.Author: airportnut
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights early July 08 in an oceanfront deluxe room. For the rates that you pay, this hotel is overated. Apparently, the hotel has had $35m in renovations but you'd never know it!! The rooms in the hotel are pretty ordinary, particularly given that the room cost more than what I paid for Sheraton Maui which was LOVELY. The rooms have this hideous green colour interior, the carpet is a very yucky brown and the bed made me feel like I was staying in a motel. The bathroom has a pretty silly layout with essentially two rooms (one which has a sink, fridge and robes and the other is the actual bathroom with another sink, toilet and shower). Hideous light green tiles around the bath. Made me feel like I was back in the 80s. If they had done the soft renovations properly, they would have opened up these 2 rooms to make one big bathroom and changed the tiles. On the plus side, the bedroom is quite big and the views were great (if you disregard the horrible brown roof tops visible from the restaurants etc below - who on earth thought the beautiful ocean views need this brown roof top in the picture???? Loved the views from the poolside where big waves sailed past and we could watch people surf past us. Its on a really lovely spot, its just that the resort is still dated and after staying at the Westin Moana Surfrider and Sheraton Maui, it was a huge disappointment. Other positives are that the service was pretty good and the Ola restaurant was really nice, we had a table right on the sand. Overall, I think 4 nights was way too long. 2 nights maximum (unless you surf) is what I think was needed if you want to stay up this way. As its the only resort up that way, its a good base to explore everything and again the views from the pool and walking around the hotel are pretty amazing. But DONT expect much from the rooms and the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous resort fee”
Reviews.Author: wildcat139
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid for our two nights at Turtle Bay. When I received my bill I had 2 charges of $20 as what they call a "resort fee". They say it covers parking, internet access, and tennis. We didn't use these. We had one car between two couples but both of us were charged the $40. I plan on disputing the charge with my credit card company. The restaurant food in the resort was also highly overpriced. The OLA restaurant was good and reasonable for a resort but it is not run by Turtle Bay. The room and view were good but overpriced and we paid less than $210 per night. Some were paying $450 per night and higher. Jim Kentucky

Reviews.Title: “Great Cottage Room- Not so great service”
Reviews.Author: pparasher77
Reviews.Content: My husband, me and our 3 yo son just returned from a seven night stay at turtle bay resort. My husband and I consider ourselves seasoned travelers and have stayed at great hotels including many four seasons and ritz carltons so we were expecting a lot for 800.00/night. The cottages on the property were beautiful. I didnt see the other rooms but the main tower didnt look great. Our cottage was directly on the beach which was great as some are farther away. We had booked a king cottage but upon check in were given a queen one with two queen beds. Was kind of upset but it worked out better having two queen beds since our son was with us. The first day we returned to the room around 1 pm and the room was not made up. We didnt receive turn down the first 2 nights. The third I called before we left for dinner and asked for turn down. We returned 2 hours later around 8:30 and had no turn down, I called housekeeping twice and the front desk twice and finally got it. I called the manager and he assured us it would not happen again and it didnt. OUt last day there my son cut himself on a glass he broke in three places. he was bleeding quit profusely and i called for some bandaids. After two calls and 30 minutes i received them. I called and asked why it took so long and was simply told there were very busy since it was july 4th. Kind of annoying. I wasnt very impressed with the service. The beach area was nice but again it was difficult t get someone to set up chairs for you. They kind of expected you to do it. I also didnt like that they didnt come around with water since it was very hot. The pool was nice but can get very overcrowded. The restaurants was not so great especially the breakfast buffet. THe lady that sat us for the buffet was very weird. she told us one day that the air quality was bad and we should stay in since we had a child. i overheard her telling someone else that if the tourist keep coming they would not be any aloha. Um lady, tourisim pays your salary and keeps the state going. Strange that they would have someone like that working there. The food at Ola was actually quite good and loved its location. All in all it was a good stay but were going to the four season maui next year where my 7K hotel bill will give me great service on top of a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined by too much growth”
Reviews.Author: deborahj62
Reviews.Content: I last visited Turtle Bay when it was a Hilton property back in the 80s. Considerable development of the area has gone on since then, and it now feels a bit hemmed in. While we were there, I read that the state is considering buying out the remaining developable land in the area to prevent additional development. We did not stay at the resort but went for an afternoon visit to have massages at Spa Luana followed by dinner at Ola restaurant. The parking area was packed to overflowing so it seemed easiest to use valet parking. The valet got huge brownie points (and a big tip) when he was willing to run back to the car to pick up the folder containing our SpaFinder gift certificates (hint: you can buy these at a discount through Costco and use them at Spa Luana). Finding the spa itself was confusing. We had to wander through a maze on two levels, which could've been improve by signage. Its location seemed like an afterthought. Then, our massages, while adequate, seemed a bit rushed. We paid extra for the "beachside" massage in a small outdoor hut, but we ended up with the massage therapists knocking at the door urging us to hurry while we were dressing because it was going to rain. And it did! ...enough so that the leaky roof at Ola restaurant, which is not at all as upscale as the Web site might imply, left water dripping in. It also seems like an afterthought, in a glassed-in enclosure adjacent to the hotel and beach. Again, thanks to the valets: they loaned us an umbrella! The floor was cement and sandy from the day's diners, and the food and atmosphere certainly did not command the prices. Our waitress was one of those sort who had perpetual bad timing and interrupted our conversation numerous times in a fairly transparent effort to sell us more drinks. As I said, I haven't been there in a long time, but after this experience I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: adc4f
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for our honeymoon last October. We loved the resort and we will be going back the first chance we can! We did the horseback riding and it was beautiful. It was well worth the money. All the restaurants at the resort were amazing! The only complaints we had was they gave us the wrong room the first night. But they cleared that up by our 2nd night. And both rooms we stayed in were great! Very well decorated. I loved the pool and the slide. My husband is a music man so he had to participate in the Ukulele lessons offered free at the resort. That turned out to be really fun! I loved how the resort was secluded from any other resorts. We went to Pearl Harbor one day and the resort staff gave us directions they had printed for anything you could possibly need. They even gave us a print out for the nearest Wal-mart. You could also see the sea turtles from our balcony. I would recomended getting the package with the breakfast included. the buffet breakfast was the best i have ever had. It was perfect to just go down each morning and have this wonderful spread of tropical fruits and juices! It really was just a perfect trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Upper Mid-Range Resort”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: There is a lot good to say about this hotel and a few things that are not so great. The disappointing thing is that the hotel is so close to being a great hotel, but it is not quite there yet. That is not to say that this is not a very nice hotel. Even though many people complain on this website about the cost, the reality is that a resort which charges $200 - $300 a night is NOT a high end property in Hawaii! Take a look at the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, or St. Regis. You will not find a $200-$300 rate. Thus this review will be from someone who expects service and the physical structure to be equal to a Marriott, Hyatt, or Westin….. Not a Ritz Carlton. I’ll give you examples of everything and you can make the decision for yourself. I do not like the craziness of Waikiki Beach and I don’t even like the touristy row of beach hotels on Maui (Kaanapali). This hotel is VERY isolated, which I liked very much. The nearest town is 5 miles away! It is an ocean front property, which is very nice. I love to hear the ocean when I wake-up in the morning. I was on the top floor at the end of the south wing. The room was very large, had a large marble bathroom, and got lots of morning sun (it was a little dark in the afternoon). I would recommend a 6th floor room with an even number in the east wing, if you like afternoon sunlight in your room. The higher the number in the east wing the closer you are to the peninsula. The staff was very helpful, because I was being picky. I got to my room and I realized that it would not have afternoon sun and I called down to see if I could change to the east wing (even number room). They were very nice and gave me the keys to a room on the 4th floor for me to take a look at. I when to the room and quickly realized how lucky I was on the 6th floor. The fourth floor room had a view of the banquet facility’s roof. I returned to room 629 with a greater appreciation of the room that I had been given. The hotel is a little tired (warn down). It is not terrible, but it needs a little work. For example, when the elevator doors opened to the 6th floor, the first thing that I saw was a bunch of wall paper that was pealing back at the seams and the carpet was very warn down in the hall, and the furniture in the common areas was a little dated. The good news is that the room had fresh carpet, newer furniture, and beautifully painted walls. The entrance to the hotel is also uninspired. It is a long street that comes in from the highway. It is dark and boring. They should take a trip to the Desert Springs JW Marriott in Palm Desert, California and take notes. Both have long streets in from the main road but they are worlds apart. The “Drive” (covered valet area) is also too understated for such a large hotel. The bottom line is there is no “WOW Factor” when you first arrive. After flying for 6 hours and driving for an hour from the airport, it would have been nice to have a moment of excitement when I pulled in. First impressions shape the visit. This, however, may not matter to you. I had a “pet peeve” (which was shared by many guests) that may not matter to you. They are shamelessly selling EVERYTHNIG in the room. Which in itself is not so bad, but next to everything there is a comment card informing you that if you remove the product from your room you will be charged. I felt that it was juvenile, almost a threat. Here is an example: Part of the resort fee is in-room coffee. Ironically, there are no “to-go” cups in the room and next to the nice Turtle Bay cups that you MUST use and, of course, they want you to buy, there is a note saying that if you remove the cup from the room, you will be charged $5 for the cup. HELP, I am held hostage in my room! I can not leave until I finish my morning coffee! It is a beautiful place to walk around in the morning, to-go coffee would have been nice. There is also a towel card, and in parental fashion it says that “you will be charged $25 for a towel if the card is not returned with your room keys”…… what resort does that? The answer is none. In fact, after talking to the front desk I learned that this resort does not even follow through on this obnoxious threat. One comment about the resort fee: I do not mind that they charge the $20 resort fee, I just want them to give me something in return. They should include valet parking in the fee ($10 additional) or have a appetizer during happy hour (they make the money up on drinks anyway), and the wireless internet you get with the fee was NOT HIGH SPEED internet. It is 50-100KB per second, which is medium speed (I think of it as the internet on “Hawaii time”). Don’t try to download files or send attachments unless you have plenty on time, which ironically, you should have plenty of at this isolated resort. Overall, I liked the hotel a lot. I think that you need to come here with expectations that the hotel is more of a middle-aged Marriott than a Ritz-Carlton or JW Marriott, Etc. Finally, the resort is for couples and families with young children (under 13). I was in a large group and everyone who had teenagers, had BORED teenagers. FINAL COMMENT: If you are a honeymooner and feel that you are still the center of the universe, DO NOT COME HERE! I have read so many reviews from honeymooners who have unattainable expectations. I have a tip for the honeymooners, and it is this: On your wedding day you were the “Sun King” and the entire galaxy revolved around you…… But there is a “day number 2” and that is when you become one of us…. The common folk. If you can accept your new reality then you will enjoy your vacation at this very nice hotel located in a beautiful setting. I am sorry my pictures are not better quality; I forgot my camera and used my phone. THE GOOD: Location is great, Ocean-front LARGE rooms with very nice Bathrooms, very friendly staff, easy check-in, in-room refrigerator. THE BAD: A little warn-down, unimpressive physical appearance, in room coffee needs to-go cups and improved condiments (the condiments consist of powdered “Coffee-mate” and sugar), pool is boring, like any nice resort food is expensive (be prepared). TIPS: Get some waters and half-and-half (for coffee) at the “foodland” market 5 miles west of the resort, Buy a mug (either at foodland or the resort) so you can enjoy your coffee outside your room, GO TO CHOLLO’S in Haleiwa! It is the best Mexican food on the island, by far! GOLFING TIP: Play the Palmer course NOT the Fazio course (it’s not Tom Fazio it’s George Fazio????). The Palmer is perfect the Fazio is a dog track. Play at 2pm for twilight and save $50. If you play twilight, start with the back nine then do the front nine, that way you will get all 18 in no problem. By the way I hope very much to return to this resort.
