We went hiking using their trails to the left of the hotel. We hiked to the beach way past the WWII bunker. We did get to see a turtle right on the beach! It was quite a distance and we really don't recommend going to that beach because the one right by the hotel is better! The WWII bunker was really great to hike to. I must warn you though that the trails are not well marked at all. They have trees occasionally marked with a small amount of spray paint on it...you could miss it. We had to turn around several times as the supposed "trail" would just end. We would suggest taking the guided horseback ride instead. The concierge was very helpful while we were there and the front desk too. Everyone was extremely friendly!! We did have the seaside couple massage. It was quite expensive but worth it! We went to the luau offered at the hotel which was a lot of fun. The only thing we didn't like about it is that they seat you. We were there quite early to get a good seat but they seated us so we didn't get to sit where we wanted. The food and dancers were fantastic! Definitely worth going to. Of course, the people on that side of the hotel just sat on their lanai and got a free show. So, if you are on that side just watch from your lanai for free instead of $85 each. (unless you want the food which was really good) We went snorkeling every day. Take advantage of the free 1 hour snorkel equipment (free because it is included in the $15 daily resort fee which they add to your bill). We didn't see a lot of different fish but maybe we didn't go out far enough. We did get to see a sea turtle which was awesome. It kind of scared us though because it was about only 2 feet in front of us! Very unexpected, but great!! Like I said before, the beach right at the hotel was fabulous! Get there early, as all the umbrellas are taken by 9 am, especially on the weekend! We were a little annoyed on the weekend as all the lounge chairs were gone by the time we got there at 10:00 am because a lot of the locals had taken them. I do think that you should have to check out the chairs with your hotel key like they make you do the snorkeling equipment. That way only the hotel guests get the chairs. We only had that problem once but it was quite annoying! Overall, I would definitely stay here again as opposed to Waikiki where we stayed 7 years ago. It is so nice and peaceful there. There aren't as many places to choose to eat as Waikiki but the view and the accomodations are definitely worth it. We hated to return home! You will not be disappointed if you choose Turtle Bay Resort. We plan to return in 5 years with our children. It's a vacation of a lifetime!!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of attention to detail/filthy bathrooms/great view”
Reviews.Author: KinyaWaldo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from TBR - felt good to finally take a shower at home (& my 50 year old bathroom needs to be ripped out). We were afraid to walk on the mold stained grout in the bathroom so lined it with bath towels. We were in a non- smoking room but kept getting smoke in our faces when on the lania - when complained to management they called back and said Security was outside our room and wanted to come in to find out where the smoke was coming from - kind of ruined out room service dinner and scared my child. To sum up the resorts problems: unprofessional Management team, guest rooms need a desperate remodel job, restaurants feel fake, pool and hot tubs smell funky and need to be upgraded. Sum up resort good points: Spa Luna has killer massage room views and had a great massage (of course the lack of maintenance can be spotted here to - peeling paint and mold in the shower) Horseback riding is reasonable and beautiful (ofcourse your out of the resort so how can you go wrong?!) Room service has pretty darn good food - expensive but prices about the same as other resorts. Spectacular views from lanai - but have to give nature credit for that! Hmmmm, can't think of anything else good. Really wish I would have researched this place better!

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: wrenibird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Turtle Bay Hilton for our honeymoon last week and it was HEAVEN. The northshore has an incredibly relaxed, beautiful, preserved quality to it and it was a pleasure to experience it while staying at this resort. The rooms were clean and beautiful, the view was breathtaking, and the service we received was unmatched. Take advantage of the secluded jacuzzis, the delicious breakfast buffet, the free daily snorkle rentals, and the beautiful pool! We extended our stay an extra day because we loved it so much. We finished off our honeymoon in Waikiki at the Outrigger and we were incredibly disappointed after our dream stay at the Turtle Bay. A few MUST DOs include: Polynesian Cultural Center (the night show is the best) A visit to the Mormon temple visitor's center Lunch at one of the shrimp trucks! So delicious! Buy some fresh pineapple Waimea Park (short hike to the waterfalls where you can swim!) Waimea Beach (jump off the rocks with the locals!) **Matsumotos shaved ice on your way to Kahuku from Honolulu Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to rela”
Reviews.Author: smlworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this fabulous hotel as part of a Classic Vacation Package. The hotel had a guard at the gate who gave you you're parking pass which contained your name so that as soon as you drove up to the hotel you were greeted by name. Check in was quick and efficient. I found all the staff to be helpful and friendly. The spa was resonably priced and their masseuse know what they are doing. I had mentioned that I was going to Pearl Harbor to the receptionist at the Spa and she was very helpful in printing out directions from the hotel to get to Pearl Harbor. Room service was delicious and cost just as much as dinning at the on site restaurants. Getting around the North Shore with a rental car was no problem if you want to find cheaper food. The shrimp shacks are about 10 minutes down the road on the east side. We ate at Romy's Shrimp Shack and you could see people fishing in the ponds behind. The food was delicious and you could buy 1 lb of freshly caught fish which they will cook for you for about $14, this comes with rice and two types of sauces. If you head west from the resort you will end up in the town of Haleiwa which has plenty of places to eat along with stores for shopping. Overall my stay at Turtle Bay was very pleasant. I would stay here again. This is a great place to go if you want to just unwind and relax but still have the option of a nearby city, Waikiki, to keep you occupied. The Polynesian Cultural Center is about 15 minutes away and a great place to spend the afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Go if you have kids!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights July1-3, 2007. We booked a deluxe oceanfront room and requested the top floor and a quiet area. The front desk obliged us with Room 648, overlooking the convention room roof. Not too bad of a view, but other views are better (try the south wing overlooking the beach area.) Spent the first day of our vacation listening to an unending game of "Marco Polo" at the pool. Good if you have kids. Spent the next two days on the beach--it has public access--and really enjoyed ourselves reading, snorkeling, swimming, etc. Gotta get there early for an umbrella & nicer lounges. Buffet breakfast on the weekdays was great--service on Sunday morning a bit uneven (had to ask for cream after my coffee was served????). Good value for the money if you are feeding a herd. Best omelettes anywhere. Pool bar service fantastic, smiling, friendly and good smoothies. Food--so-so. Room was average, but bathroom area was large by any standard. Shower fixtures were loose and circa 1978. All clean and neat. Mattress was excellent and A/C adequate. Generous lanai at this level pricing. Noise from next door occupants was audible at times, and there was a great party going on across the hall when we checked out! Plus factor=no late checkout; however, "hospitality room" offered to us so we could shower before our late flight to the East Coast. Nice gesture on hotel's part. Every request me with a smile. Hawaiian warmth abundant in the staff! Only an hour or so from H'lulu Int'l. Easy ride. Go if you have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii6
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at Turtle Bay Resort from 09/05 - 12/05/07 and had a great time. This was my second stay at Turtle Bay having stayed there last year with my husband and 13 year old daughter. We had an deluxe ocean front room on the 5th floor in the west wing and had a lovely view of the ocean and grounds. Each morning we had the breakfast buffet in Palm Terrace and also had a lovely dinner in the restaurant called Ola which is situated right on the beach. Our main reason for staying at Turtle Bay was to visit the Polynesian Cultural Centre which is located about 15 mins away. Don't miss this amazing place, we had the best day out there!! Turtle Bay is a great place to stay if you don't want to visit another island but want to get away from all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Around the resort there are plenty of trails you can walk, snorkle the different coves and beaches or just relax by the pool. I love staying at Turtle Bay and will definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience, but not a solid 4-star”
Reviews.Author: sasima
Reviews.Content: Perusing all the TBR reviews would indicate that this hotel has a mix of 3- & 4-star qualities, and you either love it or are disappointed. And that is what we found. We got what we expected, as such, our experience was excellent. WHO IT'S FOR If you want quiet, this is not the place. It's a true family place. There are kids of all ages everywhere, and some wake up early, so don't hope for peace even early in the day. Forget any peace near the pool before 8/9pm. Generally, if you stay away from the pool - which we did - you can easily have a relaxing time. SERVICE Service itself is true 4-star. The staff itself is 5-star. You get a true feel of the natural Hawaiian hospitality from the staff. Everything runs efficiently (service is fast & prompt at the restaurants, valet is quick to get your car, etc). ROOM We had the ocean front room. It is spacious. Plenty of closet space. Some wear & tear (aka lack of maintenance) put parts of the room into the 3-star category. But overall, I would say it's a low 4-star. Try to get a room on the 4th floor or higher for a better view. PRICE & LOCATION Well, the location is unbeatable. But it's the only game in town, so price is a tad high for what you get. But it beats having to drive up everyday from Waikiki... Sharks Cove is 10min away, shrimp trucks 5min, Haleiwa town 20min. We loved it for what it is. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found on North Shore”
Reviews.Author: SupertrampSF
Reviews.Content: This vacation was about serious rest and relaxation. I wanted luxury, beautiful surroundings and peace. The Turtle Bay Beach Cottages have it all. I was greeted at the cottage by a concierge with a glass of icy guava juice and fresh fruit and oriented to the resort's offerings. Peaceful "yoga" music was playing in the room when I arrived. Although there are many activities available, all I needed were the miles of connected beaches for exploration, a hammock tied to a palm tree for relaxation and some pampering. The cottage was spacious and nicely appointed. Wood floors. King bed with good pillows and comforter. Big marble bath with separate shower, huge soaking tub and nice toiletries. A split-level living area with a wet bar and refrigerator and desk/dining table. Internet included in the room charge. The room opens to a lanai which is just steps from the beach or the nearest hammock. [Note: These are not stand-alone cottages: there are three or four units per building. So you do have neighbors close by.] The resort staff were totally accommodating, from cottage concierge to room service to the front desk. I requested a cottage change on my second day and was accommodated. This saved the vacation. A noisy family with at least 10 members (at 10, I stopped counting) moved into the cottage next to me. Literally, moved in with sleeping bags for the extra guests and bags and bags of groceries (there is only a small refrigerator, no kitchen). I noticed one other huge group (mis)using a cottage this way. Happily, I was able to move away and continue quiet enjoyment of the property. The landscape around the cottages is beautiful, with exotic flowers, trees and greens. There were natural wonders everywhere. I spotted sea turtles in the water just outside my cottage. On a beach walk east of the resort, I encountered a sea lion sunning itself on a beach. Also to the east, I came across a beach with several lovely small shells. There was one secluded beach after another. The surf was tame and the water perfect. On the 4th of July, the resort put on a good fireworks show. Cottage dwellers had front row seats. After six days at the Turtle Bay cottage, I went down and spent a night at the Halekulani in Waikiki before coming home. My room at the Halekulani, while comparable in price (i.e. pricey), was small and the furnishings were old and tired. Waikiki was crowded and commercial. Who travels to Hawaii to eat at the Cheesecake Factory? I missed Turtle Bay. [In fairness, the Halekulani staff were every bit as good as the Turtle Bay staff; and the Halekulani's spa is much nicer than Turtle Bay's.] On previous Hawaii trips I have been to Maui and the Big Island. Oahu's North Shore ties with Hana for my favorite Hawaii location. The splurge on a Turtle Bay beach cottage is worth it. I'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, relaxing stay!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: garnerl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Turtle Bay Resort was a fantastic, relaxing stay! I had heard about the resort from my brother who went with his wife and two teenagers a few years ago. They raved about how great the hotel was and they weren't kidding! I went with my teenage son and daughter and my mom who is in a wheelchair. The hotel accomodated us with two rooms to choose from and gave us free valet parking. The hospitality here was incredible. Those who say there is not very much to do with children are not telling the truth. There are beaches galore to go explore and since we have come home we realize that we wish we would have stayed around the hotel a little more and relaxed. The restaurants were pricey, but we knew that going into it. All of us loved all the food we had. We tried every restaurant at the hotel and even ordered room service one night and were never disappointed. We visited Waimea falls and the beach. We even jumped off the rock with the locals! What a blast!!! We visitied Halaiwea, Shark's Cove, Sunset Beach, Pipeline, Goat Island etc. We went into Waikii and shopped around and we went to Pearl Harbor, but got there to late to take the tour. Getting there before 12:00 is the key. One of the highlights of our trip was going to Aloha Stadium and visiting the swap meet. I highly recommend this for souveniors. We bought an album at the hotel for $20.00 and found the same album at the swap meet for $10.00. Bracelets at the hotels were $5.00 and at the swapmeet a $1.00 to $2.00. Terrific savings! The swap meet takes place on Saturdays and Sundays and is the place to go for your souveniors. It was a lot of fun! Anyhow, I hope that I have encouraged you to try out Turtle Bay it is a trip that we will never forget and hope to go back to soon. We can't stop looking at our pictures and wishing we would have stayed longer! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: mspups
Reviews.Content: Really had a wonderful stay at this resort. Expensive, yes, but 5 short days of pure heaven. Watch the internet to find your best price for an oceanview room with a balcony. Most amazing sunrises, and heavenly to hear the surf lull you to sleep at night. I've heard others complain about the cost of food but it seemed in line with other resort prices. Stay away from room service, very expensive! We didn't eat at the hotel all that often anyway, as we traveled up and down the coastal areas near the hotel to visit different beaches. Here's our hints re food. First, there's a nice sized refrid in the room. We went to the market at Shark's Cove (called something like Foodmart, it's right on the highway on the way there) and got milk and cereal, sushi, beer, readymade salads from the deli counter, alcohol and mixers, then stashed it in the fridge. Ate cereal with fruit every morning. They leave you Lion's Coffee for your coffeemaker (get extras from the maid's cart) and had wonderful cereal and fruit breakfasts in room every morning. This resort makes very good mai tais. Weird thing is they charge a couple bucks more for the mai tais at the pool bar than they do for the identical drink at the beach bar. Anyway, had a great time here, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very Outdated, Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: SoonerDallas
Reviews.Content: We have previously been to Maui and the Big Island. We had a one night stay on Oahu and heard that Turtle Bay was the best resort on the island. Seriously? If this is true (and the price would indicate the hotel thinks so as well), then my advice is do not stay on Oahu. Far better vacation spots on other islands. After looking at Turtle Bay's website and paying the outrageous price for the room, I was expecting much more. The decor is very stale and extremely outdated. The room had an ocean view, but it was very plain and the bathroom was disgusting! I have paid the same price and stayed at luxury resorts on other islands that would blow Turtle Bay out of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Is Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: melissamk222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on Sunset Beach and stayed at Turtle Bay resort. They upgraded us to a bigger room since we were honeymooners and gave us free t-shirts and a bottle of champagne. We loved our room but although the view of the ocean was nice, the roof of the building was below us and it felt like we were sitting on the roof. I was a little disappointed and went to the front desk to see if it was possible to get another room. We didn't want to cause a problem but figured that we were staying for 9 nights and it would be worth a try. The front desk representative immediately changed our room with a smile and no questions asked. We had the most incredible view which overlooked the pool and the bay. We could watch the surfers from our balcony. We had the most incredible time. We went snorkling almost every day. There is a $15 resort fee for each day but we did not mind paying this because it includes 1 hour of snorkling and equipment, among other tthings. We saw beautiful salt water fish everywhere. In fact, one day we drove all the way to Haunanma Bay because we heard the snorkling was the best there, but we only stayed for 1 hour because it was better at the resort! There is a grocery store up the road, about 10 minutes away. We were able to grab things like chips and salsa to eat on our balcony. There was a small refrigerator in the room so we could store some snacks there. The restaurants are all very good in the resort but are spendy, which is expected. Our favorites were Lei Lei's and Ola on the beach. We often got drinks at Hang Ten on the beach as well and would drink them in the jacuzzi. The resort has a lot to do. There are many hiking trails and you can go on horseback rides or even a helicopter ride (we did not). We mostly had fun just hanging out and relaxing. The service was the best...everyone was so helpful and friendly. They were filming a Universal movie there during our trip, it was called Forgetting Sarah Marshall. We saw Mila Kunis from that 70's Show roaming the resort often. She always talking on her cell phone! They also filmed a tv show earlier in the week...it did not seem uncommon. I've heard of many celebs staying there. We loved the North Shore. It was perfect for us. We wanted nothing to do with Honolulu on our honeymoon since it was so crowded. However, it is only 45 minutes away so if you wanted to visit, it isn't that far away. We did see Pearl Harbor and I would recommend going early because the tours fill up. Drive into Haleiwa...it is the cutest town and they have Matumatso Shave Ice! It was delicious! The Thai restaurant was so yummy as well. There are many shrimp shacks around that are tasty. My huband and I agree that Turtle Bay is our favorite place on earth. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. We are already planning on coming back for our anniversary. I read some of the negative reviews and honestly have a hard time swallowing it. We can't see how anyone would be unhappy at Turtle Bay. Check it out...you won't be disappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel221
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Turtle Bay. Loved the resort. Staff very nice and friendly. Did the valet parking the whole time and never had to wait more that 2 minutes to get car. Check in and out when smoothly. No unexpected charges on bill. As stated before resturants were expensive but overall good. Ate at Ola's first night and dissapointed that they were out of the ribeye steaks at 7:00pm but had the short ribs which were good. Ate at 21 north on Thursday and can't say it was the greatest. Not all the resturants fault. Please if you have little children, please don't take them to such a nice place. Had a screaming little one for most of the meal. Only at one breakfast there and it was good but not sure worth all of $21.95 per person but knew the price going in so no big deal. Had room service one night and it was the best of all. Beach was great. Went early each morning so we were able to get an umbrella each day. Neither my wife or I are sun worshipers so really needed the shade. Very glad we didn't stay in Waikiki. Went there one day just to say we were there and couldn't wait to get back to the peace and quite of the North Shore. Beware of the traffic starting about 3:30pm each day in the Honolulu area. Overall stay very pleasant and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Vacation just what we needed, peace and relaxation. Also had massage and it was wonderful. Did seaside couples massage and worth every penny of it. We went with the mindset that this would not be a cheap vacation and was willing to spend a little more that usual but also understood that this might be a one in a lifetime trip so it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: liparijo
Reviews.Content: While the view is admittedly spectacular and the rooms are clean and comfortable, the resort had the feel of a government operated compound. There was nothing romantic or exciting about it. The decor was dated, the staff was unbearably curt and aloof and the price gauging was tacky and infuriating. For instance: 1) 25 dollar towel deposit. 2) 15 dollar fee for "complemetary" services that include a morning newspaper and in room coffee maker. 3) Bottle of 8 ounce water in the room for only $3.50. 4) No complementary breakfast. An apple and coffee at the "snack cart" will run you about $4.50. 5) Another fee for "complementary" valet parking. The supposedly high-end restaurant, 21 degrees, is closed on Sundays and Mondays and the other restaurant, Palm Terrace is the equivalent of a Holiday Inn buffett restaurant. The outdoor restaurant, Ola, is a bit cozier but the food is weak and overpriced. My wife and I felt trapped in an overpriced, overbearing gated vacation community. It really sucks the life out of you when you comb your feathers, throw on a nice pair of pants, head down to the only Turtle Bay restaurant that isn't booked solid and then you stand in the buffett line with the hoards of nine year olds waiting for a hefty serving of potatos and pizza squares. Luckily we absconded and found a couple of nice places in town. Not once did we hear anything like "welcome," "where are you from?," "enjoying your stay?" "what brings you to Hawaii?,"etc. We only encountered gaggles of disgruntled employees indistinguishable from the ones you'd see in any mainland DMV. Lipari, Brooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: “awesome location, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgorto
Reviews.Content: Great resort beautiful views from the room. This was the nicest stay we have ever had. It was our honeymoon and we checked out of the hilton in waikiki after 1 night. Turtle bay was aswesome, big pool , waterslide and many restaurants and a great bar inside. North shore is a must see for everyone. unfortunately developers want to build more on north shore . if it ends up anything like waikiki that would be a sin. We even got to use a hospitality room after checkout for showers because we had a late flight. We cant wait 2 go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: l0ngwayh0me
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 1st time to Hawaii and was a little worried about staying on Oahua and still getting the true Hawaiian experience. We found the location of the TB resort to be perfect. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and near all the activities that we wanted to be near. We went to Haunama Bay and Wakiki one day and couldn't wait to get back to the North Shore! The resort is beautiful and the staff were great. The view is great no matter where your room is. Food is expensive, but there is a refridgerator in the room and a Foodland market 10 minutes away and the shrimp trucks are also only 5 minutes away. We hardly ate at the hotel. The hotel was centrally located to everything we wanted to do: Luau at PCC, kayaking at Kailua, visiting surf town Halewa, and exploring Waimea Beach and Waterfall. Our kids had a blast at Waimea beach and the snorkling was much better there than anywhere else. The drive along the windyside to Kailua was also very beautiful. We had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views In a Peaceful Spot!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTam
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort! It's on the north side of Oahu, so it gets the most beautiful amazing huge waves, and is on a part of the island that is not overly developed (like Honolulu), so that you actually feel like you're on an island. The view is literally breathtaking. It is about a 1 1/2 - 2 hour drive from the Honolulu airport, but it's beautiful to drive up the coast. It has a great pool area (with a separate fun kids pool for those of you with little ones). It also has a beach area that is protected from the huge waves so that you can safely enjoy the ocean (again, including kids). It's a very well done mid-range resort in a five star location with excellent restaurants and a great gym (with peek ocean views). If you're looking for high-end luxury or space for a family, rent one of their beach cottages - they looked beautiful. As for restaurants, our favorite by far was Ola - a nice thatched roof place on the beach. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STM65
Reviews.Content: My family and I liked this hotel, it is solid. The staff is great. And the facilities are very good, the views excellent. However, since there is no competition on the North Shore the hotel is very pricey. And I was expecting more for that price. This is only an average 4 star. TIP: Always ask for the rooms on the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jp4travel
Reviews.Content: My stay at Turtle Bay has me wanting to go back for more! My family and I stayed at turtle bay for five days, we had a three bedroom villa which had so much room..The bathrooms are my favorite thing about my villa, they are the biggest ones I've seen in a hotel and the beautiful marble helped as well. Every morning you wake up to the always perfect weather, and a patio where you can sit out and enjoy the cool breeze and beachfront access with your cup of coffee. The local people are extremely friendly and the hotel staff is always there to reserve anything from golf on one of their two courses to horse back riding to surf lessons, after a filling breakfast at their sea side resturant. If its the nightlife and shopping central of the lsland your looking for, I suggest taking the rental car about an hour away from your hotel to see what wakiki has to offer. That town is so full of high end botigues and dinning along with all the turisost that infist them, it was nice to come back to the north shore and unwind with a drink and a quick dip in the enormous pool and spa which have cascading waterfalls flowing for the cool slide..I definatley can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Cyberj10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one week at the Turtle Bay Resort for our honeymoon during the last week of May and we had an amazing time. I have read a lot of the reviews here and while most of them are positive there are a few them that are negative. While I am not discounting anyone's negative review (everyone is entitled to their own opinion) I am definitely adding my vote to the positive column. First off, let me just say that if you're used to Ritz Carrolton type of service, chic, and ambiance this is probably not the place for you. While I do think the resort is beautiful and the rooms nicely appointed, this hotel is certainly not a 5 star hotel/resort. That being said our room was larger than I expected, comfortable, clean, and came with a FANTASTIC view (we were staying in a Deluxe Ocean Front Guest Room with a Large Lanai). I definitely believe that people’s personal experience with this resort is largely based on their expectations. If you’re just an average middle income to upper middle income couple or family you will have a wonderful time. Now that I got some of the caveats out of the way let me get to some of the specifics. My wife and I were not expecting as many families to be at the resort as there were (we thought it was more of a honeymooners location) but there were quite a few present. We however did not let this spoil our time and at no point were we bothered by someone’s obnoxious children. We laid pool side just about everyday and the atmosphere was very relaxing and not the least bit noisy. Now, it was not as quiet as the pool scene you might find at an exclusive spa but if you’re looking for total complete silence that is probably where you should go anyway. We found that the onsite restaurants had very good food (especially 21 Degrees North) except for the Palm Terrace. The food at this restaurant was completely sub par and couldn’t hold a candle to the others yet it costs just as much. Speaking of costs, all the restaurants on this property are far from cheap but given that it is a HI resort isolated from just about everything else it is what we were expecting. If you’re staying at this resort for any extended amount of time and have a rental car I strongly suggest checking out some of the local restaurants in the quaint little town of Haleiwa (pronounced Hel-lev-a I believe). This town is located about 10 miles south of Turtle Bay and I strongly recommend dinning Haleiwa Joe’s. The seafood is out of this world and it is very reasonably priced ($20 - $25 average entrée) compared to the Turtle Bay Resort. The whole town of Haleiwa is worth checking out and you can easily spend half a day checking out all the little shops and stores that are in this charming modest town. Also, a must on the to-do list is going to Ted’s Bakery which is located about 5 miles south of Turtle Bay. They seriously have some of the tastiest pie’s I have ever had and their food is fantastic as well. You know a restaurant is good when all the locals eat there as well. While the décor isn’t by any means upscale this little deli-type eatery has food that is to die for and considering that is in HI, is down right dirt cheap to boot. Well, I hope my review of this wonderful resort has been beneficial to you all in helping you make your decision. During our stay we found the staff to be polite and courteous, the grounds exemplary, and the overall atmosphere breathtaking. This was truly a little slice of paradise and was the catalyst for us having an absolutely unbelievable honeymoon. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “A local's perspective”
Reviews.Author: ariana
Reviews.Content: I'm a native of Honolulu, and go to this resort several times a year to get away from city noise. All rooms face the water, and the first thing I do is open my lanai door (which turns off the AC), so that I can listen to the sound of the waves. The hotel seems better managed than in years past, with an exceptionally friendly and accomodating staff -- from the front desk to the pool and restaurants. The resort is a major employer on the North Shore, which is still very rural. All rooms come with a fridge (and some have microwaves) so I generally bring some groceries for light meals, and splurge at the delightful Ola restaurant for lunch or dinner. Most of what they serve is from local farms and ranches. The food at 21 Degrees North is also excellent, but it's a dark room, and feels out of place to me here (plus it is very expensive). The lanais, rooms, and bathrooms are all roomy. I like the bathtub shelf for magazines -- parents would find it good for bath toys. There are always honeymoon couples, and families with kids of all ages, who all seem too find plenty to do. Beyond all the recreational activites, the site can't be beat for beauty. One caveat: as Turtle Bay is very popular with TV and film producers, it doesn't hurt to ask if there will be filming on site when you plan to come, and if so, if any facilities will be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: lawlass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for our honeymoon in May and we found it loaded with fruit flies, found a roach about four inches long, two inches wide in our bathroom, and were generally disappointed with the resort in every other way. The pool was small and very crowded with children in the off season -- I was shocked by this fact. Forget relaxing at the pool; it won't happen here. The rooms left much to be desired -- bathrooms that were small and in dire need of updates, rooms that didn't look any better than your average Holiday Inn. Our lani was small although the view was nice from our room. Housekeeping was disappointing.The bug situation was a problem even in the dining areas. We found Oahu to be disappointing in general after a stay on Maui for the first week of our two week honeymoon. We stayed at the Fairmount Kea Lani on Maui, which was fabulous. Turtle Bay Resort was such a letdown after staying at a great hotel first. I think the people who have flattering things to say about Turtle Bay Resort must not have been to higher end hotels on other islands; I have no other explanation. I'm an attorney, my husband an engineer, so we had money to spend for something nice. Boy did we goof in booking Turtle Bay! It's a shame really because with some updates to rooms and the pools, a good exterminator, and some new chefs, this place could have the potential to be great. Right now though, it's a total disappointment. Let me tell you, it's no fun to end your trip by shaking out your clothes in the garage to make sure you didn't bring home any roaches. What a disappointment! Don't waste your money at Turtle Bay Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise For Kids & Great For Families!”
Reviews.Author: OahuJ
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay is SUCH a gem - it's too bad that most guidebooks haven't updated their reviews in the last 5-10 years (when the property was wearing down) because it's one of the best resorts on Oahu. The room was immaculate and charming with nice marble bathrooms. The view of the balcony was breathtaking as we were almost right over the reef and could hear the big waves crashing all night. We went with our 3-and-4 year olds who didn't want to leave. The pool complex is heaven for kids, especially with the waterfall and waterslide. There is also pretty good snorkeling in the bay as well as great hikes up deserted beaches - it's one of the only places on the island that you can have a huge stretch of white-sand beach to yourself (granted, the waves are pretty strong). The buffets were great and at $20-$30 very reasonably priced for the island - I couldn't believe how authentic the Italian dishes were for being in Hawaii and everything was simply delicious and fresh. Service was great and actually it's getting better every time we come back. Also, there are always TONS of celebrities at this resort looking for a low-key vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the North Shore!”
Reviews.Author: DzyCarolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at TBR for our honeymoon May 20-26. I was nervous about it because of the things I have read on here and even considered changing our reservations to stay at the Ihilani where a close friend of mine stayed, but decided to risk it. I was glad we did! We arrived to a bottle of champagne in our deluxe ocean front room and a lovely view though not as high up as I would have liked (3rd floor). The room was pretty though a tad worn but any hotel that isn't brand new and does the kind of business TBR does is going to show a little wear and tear. It was nothing horrendous though. My only complaint of the room is that the shower/tub is standard and small. The bathroom itself is large. The first night we ate at Lei Lei's...I got a fabulous shrimp cocktail and ceasar salad, my husband got a filet mignon he said was the best steak he ever had (the fact that he was starving didn't hurt I'm sure haha). The following day we walked to the Turtle Bay beach (good snorkeling), and went to Kawela Bay which is beautiful without a doubt but I found the water to be annoying because it is shallow unless you go VERY far out. Like knee deep shallow, waist at best. The thing I noticed is that nobody has really mentioned how close some amazing things are to TBR. Waimea Bay (you MUST go there!), Sharks Cove, and Sunset Beach are all a short drive (Waimea Bay Beach Park is about 8miles away and that's the furthest one). Also it always sounds like Foodland and other stores are so far away that it would be a chore to leave TBR to go back so you have to stop on the way in...not so, it's right down the road. Time here like anywhere depends on traffic which was rarely heavy on the north shore. We did the horseback riding morning ride at TBR and enjoyed it so much we went on the longer afternoon ride the next day. It was very enjoyable, the horses have their own personalities, so amusing. We also did a snorkel cruise with North Shore Catamaran that was arranged for us by the concierge. We turned out to be the only people signed up that day so we got a private trip that was a blast. Wednesday we drove to Ko Olina and had dinner at Roy's. Dinner was great and worth the trip, and while we were there I saw the Ihilani and the not so pretty area surrounding it and confirmed I was glad we chose TBR. Our package included breakfast buffet at Palm Terrace each day and I have to say if you can't find something you like on that buffet you must be very picky or just not like breakfast! I DO NOT however recommend the dinner buffet...gross and left me spending the night and following day very ill to my stomach. Breakfast is safe though and yummy. Dinner at 21 Degrees North was expensive but that is to be expected and still came out cheaper than I expected. I got the lobster, husband got the ahi tuna...it was fabulous. Also try the strawberry smoothies at the Hang Ten bar by the pool....sooo good. We went to Pearl Harbor and made the mistake of not getting there early, parking was a hassle and we had to wait almost 2hrs to go out to the Arizona Memorial. It's worth a trip to see it but get there early! Also if you stay at TBR definitely rent a car. We rented from Alamo and lucky for us we didn't have any problems like a previous poster mentioned. All the staff we encountered were polite and helpful, the pools were great. I would definitely stay there again especially to avoid the crowds of Honolulu/Waikiki. There are a lot of kids but they didn't bother us at all. We still had a lovely romantic honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away if you want a GetAway!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thetruthbetold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Turtle Bay Oceanside Cottages at $600/night, thinking we would have a romantic getaway. Instead, we were treated to an Oceanfront Common Area with screaming kids in diapers, guests taking their tables and chairs out onto the Common Area in front of the Ocean to have Pizza Parties while their kids jumped on every hammock and Lounge Chair on the premises... It was a nightmare. The concierges did nothing to stop this, and the owner basically told me they aren't responsible for the behavior of guests. If you want an unrestricted playground for your kids- great expensive place to do so! If you want a romantic getaway- find another place! Caveat Emptor!

Reviews.Title: “The Hawaii that you dream about”
Reviews.Author: Traveler39
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending a week at Turtle Bay. My husband and I had one room, our two grown sons had the room next door. We were there for a corporate event and extended our stay. I'll admit it that I am picky and rarely pleased, but I'm having a hard time coming up with a criticism of the resort. We had heard warnings about the labor issues and the previous dilapidated condition of the resort, but as far as I could tell those have all been resolved under the new ownership. The resort was immaculate and well maintained. The staff was friendly and attentive. We ate at several of the restaurants and had banquets for the events and all of the food was fresh and good. This being said - this is NOT a place to go if you are looking for the Waikiki nightlife. Turtle Bay is peaceful, relaxing and luxurious. It is fun to be close to the famed north shore beaches, but this time of year don't expect big waves. The snorkeling and swimming is great in the calm summer waters. A movie was filming while we were there, but the resort grounds are so large that we had no issues from that distraction. My boys did enjoy seeing a few stars around the pool bar. Overall my recommendation is to go as quickly as possible! I just wish that I was back there.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Beach Cottages”
Reviews.Author: tideswest
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at Turtle Bay. We were in Honolulu for a business trip and escaped to the North Shore for some relaxation. We stayed in a King Beach Cottage #107, which was in a fantastic location close to the water. We left our lanai door open at night and fell asleep to the sounds of the ocean. Make sure to ask for a cottage close to the water. Some are far back and it would be a disappointment to stay in one of those. Our concierge, Terry, was wonderful - low key but attentive. We booked a package that included a rental convertible and breakfast. A good deal since the breakfast buffet is expensive (about $23) We hiked the great trails and spent lots of time on the secluded beaches of Kawela Bay. We drove to Haleiwa for the shave ice and ate at Haleiwa Joe's which we heard was good but we thought it was just average. Rosie's Cantina had great shrimp tacos. Back at the resort, we ate both evenings at Ola. It has a beautiful setting right on the beach and both food and service were excellent. The movie filming at the resort was a fun "extra" without being inconvenient at all. We saw some of the stars hanging out at the Hang Ten Beach Bar. Most of the hotels on Oahu look a bit dated and Turtle Bay is no exception. The cottages look newly remodeled with beautiful contemporary furnishings and luxurious bathrooms with separate showers and huge tubs. But the lobby and Palm Terrace restaurant look old and outdated. Since this is billed as a luxury hotel it is a bit of a dissapointment to arrive expecting more. I would stay here again and was thrilled with the cottage. It is so worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “peace in paradise”
Reviews.Author: nicla
Reviews.Content: ~ beautiful lobby ~ clean rooms, resturants, etc. ~ wonderful view from the room with a "wall of windows" ~ didn't have a balcony, but didn't really need one because the windows included a sliding door type of feature ~ extensive walking trails-- look around & you can recognize areas where LOST is filmed ~ the beach isn't the best (rocky), but the water is safe for kids & non-swimmers ~ wonderful sunsets on the west side of the resort

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: Leavita
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is a beautiful hotel--correction--it is a beautiful experience. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted and treated warmly. The rooms are spacious with lovely views from the lanai's (balconies). The concierge staff provides superior service, especially the Concierge Manager, Roy Nacapuy. He made our visit absolutely wonderful. There are excellent dining choices and a multitude of activities available on the property. The location on the North Shore provides beauty and tranquility. I see why this hotel is referred to as "true hawaii." It really is.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it so much I am considering moving to the North Shore now...”
Reviews.Author: JasmineWong
Reviews.Content: I had one of the most amazing vacation experiences while vacationing here. I feel obligated to write one because I was absolutly obsessed with reading all of your reviews before embarking on this journey and boy am I sooooo glad that I decided to make Turtle Bay Resort for my romantic destination for my boyfriend and I. Renting a convertible (through Advantage rental cars) is an absolute MUST and so is bringing along 'Oahu Revealed' travel companion book. (This was like our Bible the entire trip). I also recommend not bringing very much clothes, you'll only use flip flops, swimsuit, shorts and a t-shirt the entire time you are there. SO pack light, and don't bring too many shoes, long pants or jackets/sweaters-you'll be lugging alot of extra unnecessary weight. Our arrival at Turtle Bay resort was absolutly breathtaking, not to mention the drive there on Kamehameha Hwy you pass by some of the most beautiful beaches including Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach and Turtle Beach. Keep the convertible top down and soak in the cool ocean breeze and sunshine. Valet staff were very courteous with helping with luggage and everyone greets you with a warm smile and 'aloha'. Checking in went very smoothly and we were given a great room on the 6th floor facing Sunset Beach, swimming pool and the cottages. I had heard that if you were a 'I Prefer' member, you could get an automatic upgrade to the suite, if available. Unfortunately, the hotel was booked and this was not availabe to us because of all the rooms that are booked for the film crew and actors that are staying there for the filming of 'Forgetting Sarah Marshall' but they treated us with a cold bottle of champagne and 2 flutes a few minutes after we got into the room. What a wonderful delightful treat! I also loved and fought over the coconut macaroons they put on your bed every night at turn down service. We had a large lanai with the most breathtaking view of all the swimming pools, sunset beach and the beach cottages. Room #622!!! I have heard that ALL the rooms have GREAT views unless you are on the 2nd or 3rd floor where your primary view is of the roof and the beach is obstructed by tall palm trees. Ask for an upgrade to the Pikake suite or at least a room on the 6th floor (best view on top floor). Bathroom was large with double sinks and large double wide closets. Room decor was very modern, sleek, tropical and relaxing. The ONLY qualm I have was of the bedding, I read about this in other reviews and I can confirm that I do treasure my nice plushy mattress back home with soft pillows which guarantees a good night sleep. The mattresses in the room were thin and springy and need to be replaced VERY badly. I also had to request 'softer foam pillows' because the 4 very large firm pillows were very uncomfortable and will give you neck cramps. Guest services are very gracious with providing these for you right away. Spa services were very expensive but if you have the money, very good Pedicure services and facials. In the facial I think they try too hard to sell you the products they are using and take away from the quiet serenity of your facial. They also have couples massages in a beach bungalow, very romantic. Book them ahead of time!!!! Perhaps before you leave for Hawaii. We utilized all the tips in the Oahu Revealed book regarding North Shore excursions. We ate at Ola's for both lunch and a dinner, both very good but as expected, expensive. They have a variety of seafood, steak and pasta selections with excellent service. Ola's is literally on the sand on the Kawela beach side. We also ate the breakfast buffet at Palm Terrace ($20/person) which has a good omelet made to order bar, smoked salmon and selection of hot foods and pastries. In my opinion the Palm Terrace Dinner buffet ($30-40) is NOT worth it, especially if you go later in the night, King Crab was rubbery and cold and prime rib was kinda fatty. Also the 'Hawaiian Fish' was tasteless as well as the Salmon filet. Best meal at the resort has to be at Lei Lei's, valet service will shuttle you the short distance in a golf cart to the restaurant. They had the most amazing seafood pasta, salads and very good solid service as well. The atmosphere was romantic, dim and candlelit. I would like to have eaten there again but didn't get a chance. Our last night we made reservations for 21 degrees north. Very formal dress and requested a window seat, but doesn't really matter at night because the view is black with night. $200 for 2 people including wine. They had a very good chef's special including a 5 course meal with wine pairings with each course. Very good service and courses come as soon as you're done with the previous one. The berry creme tart was very cheesecake tart-ish and decadent. The prime rib and crab encrusted mahi mahi was savory and satisfying. Overall it is alot of food but well worth the $76 for the 5 courses. We spent most of our days on the North Shore except the day we went to Pearl Harbor and the Aloha Bowl Swap Meet. You don't have any other reason to go back down to the south area because there is SO much to do in the North Shore. The North Shore is very secluded, quiet, serene and everything you would want out of a relaxing and romantic vacation. Don't waste your time with the Polynesian Cultural Center luau. Complete waste of money for bad cold tasteless buffet style food and a less than mediocre luau show. They pack over 600 people into a small area, you feel like a prisoner in a prison cafeteria. They do have a good Twilight Show afterwards with fire dancing and well coreographed dancing. Other MUST Do's include: Eat at the Kahuku shrimp trucks, Romy's has the best garlic prawns (except they're hot you might burn your fingers when peeling them). Eat at Haleiwa Joes- they have the best Lava Flows, can't taste the alcohol at all!, Matsumoto's Shave Ice, VERY good breakfast at Haleiwa Cafe. Order the Teriyaki Chicken sandwich at the Hang Ten Bar poolside while you're laying out and relaxing- VERY GOOD! I also saw actress Mila Kunis having a drink at Hang Ten. Shop for snacks at Foodland about 20 minutes away, and stock your refrigerator! Rent your snorkel gear from the Surf Shop across from Shark's Cove- $25 for the week for snorkel, fins and goggles. Snorkel at Shark's Cove and the cliff jumping side of Waimea Bay, you'll see alot of turtles and tropical fish! Shark's cove can be kinda reefy and sharp, be careful entering and exiting. Go Jet Skiing at the Haleiwa boat harbor. They let you jet ski around in the open ocean as oppossed to on a set track. SO MUCH FUN! Rent one of the RED ones that have more horse power. $65 for half hour, believe that's enought, it's more exhausting than you think! Also take advantage of the Catamaran snorkeling tours and Sunset Dinner Cruises out of Haleiwa boat harbor. Don is the owner of the company and has alot of good stories and is very enthusiastic about driving his boat and showing you a good time. Make sure he brings along a bucket of fish chum to hand feed the Galapagos sharks. They also have North Shore Shark Adventures, go in a shark cage and feed the sharks from your bare hands! Jump off a 40 foot cliff, snorkel and swim around the cliffs at Waimea Bay and basque in the sun on this beautiful beach! It is my absolute FAVORITE beach in all of Hawaii. If you have time go to the Waimea Bay Audubon Center and hike to the waterfalls, you can swim underneat them! Took the drive up Round Top and Tatulus with the most stunning and amazing views of the South Shore including all of Waikiki and Diamond Head. Bring a laptop and take advantage of the free wi-fi in your room, you'll use it to look up resources, make reservations for adventures and at restaurants. But the concierge would suffice as well. Other things I wish we would have time for in the very short 7 day trip was: surf lessons, horseback riding on the beach, kiteboarding, explore other sides of the island such as Hanauma Bay, Makapu Point, Sandy's Beach, Secret Beach, Chinaman's Hat, kayaking in Kaneohe Bay, jump off La'ie point, eat at Breaker's for good ol American food or at Cholo's for good Mexican food, and explore the secret caves at Shark's cove, scuba diving and wished we went to Germaine's for the luau instead of the PCC. that's all for now, have fun and use LOTS of sunscreen even when you think you're so naturally dark you won't burn, YOU WILL!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Time at the Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: jycnyc7
Reviews.Content: My husband, three year old son and I stayed at this resort earlier this year. We stayed in a beach cottage for two nights, but wish we could have stayed longer! The accommodations were amazing. The cottage was very roomy with high ceilings and had a lovely four poster king-size bed. There was a sweet sea urchin stuffed animal sitting on the bed when we first arrived, which was a gift for my son. That was a nice touch. The bathroom was huge, with a soaking tub and separate glass shower. A friend said that the tub was the biggest she's ever seen. But the best part about the cottage was the location. It was situated on a lawn right in front of a beach. We had the most amazing view of the beach and ocean from our room, and we also had a lanai where we could sit and soak in the view and listen to the sound of the waves. And the sun sets right in front, so we saw the most incredible sunset from the comfort of our cottage. The only drawbacks of the cottage were (1) not enough seating -- it only had chairs that you couldn't really lounge around on. With that much space in the cottage, they could have included a sofa; and (2) people were able to traipse back and forth in front of our lanai, so we didn't have much privacy and had to keep the curtains drawn in the cottage if we didn't want people looking in, and then we couldn't enjoy the view if the curtains were drawn. The cottage also included special concierge service which I didn't quite understand. The concierge greeted us when we first arrived with drinks and free t-shirts, and got us ice once. Other than that, we never saw him. The rest of the resort was mixed. The grounds were nice -- especially the pool area, the main beach (on the other side of the resort) and the views of the ocean from the path that ran along the resort. The public areas and restaurants in the main hotel looked quite ordinary -- it used to be a Hilton and they really haven't done much to upgrade the decor. I took a quick look at a junior suite in the main building. The room itself was nicely furnished and had an incredible view, but the bathroom was nothing special. We did not deal much with the resort staff, other than check in, requesting towels, and ordering food to-go at Ola's, the restaurant by the main beach (the food there was very good, by the way). The staff we did deal with were all very friendly. All in all, we had a wonderful time at the Turtle Bay. My son loved it the best out of all the hotels we stayed in Hawaii. He loved having such easy access to the beaches and he still talks about the "big hotel room." Even my three year old could tell it was special! I don't know if we would have loved the Turtle Bay as much had we stayed in the main building. Definitely splurge on a cottage if you can afford it. We definitely would love to go back and next time will try to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie7374
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hawaii - - a lifelong dream - - and it surpassed our expectations. We discovered the Turtle Bay website when first researching where to stay, but thought we wouldn't be able to afford it, as we were originally planning a trip during the summer. But changing the dates to April made all the difference! We were there from April 22 - 27, and it was fabulous. The staff was fantastic, the food was great....the Ahi fish plate at Lei Lei's is WONDERFUL....and the grounds are absolutely incredible. There is a view everywhere you look. Our only complaint was the lack of transportation available -- we tried to coordinate an early morning deep sea fishing trip from the docks in Haleiwa, and didn't want to rent a car for the day just to have it sit in the dock....so we tried to hire a taxi, but it was nearly impossible to find a ride. The guys at the concierge desk weren't much help - - they had one number to call, and just kept telling us, "He's not answering." We went on a tour to Pearl Harbor, and our tour guide, who lived in Kahuku, volunteered to be our "taxi" to the dock the next morning, which was so sweet (anybody needing transportation should call Walford "Tui" Lolofie at Island Transporter - - he's wonderful), but due to the strong trade winds, the fishing charter was cancelled. It was pretty windy the whole time we were there, but enjoyably so (it made the waves even bigger!) We went to the Polynesian Cultural Center for the luau and evening show.....both very good, although next time, we'll stay at Turtle Bay for their Friday night luau (we left on Friday, so weren't able to do it this time.) The walking trails are great - - we strolled along most of them, and there are private beaches all over the place, if you want to get away from everything, although the main beach at the hotel was never crowded. We had read in the reviews about the pool being too cold, but I didn't find that at all - - it was refreshing, and I have to admit I went down the slide in the kids pool quite a few times....what better time to act like a kid than on vacation! The mai tai's at the Hang Ten bar will knock your socks off....one is a must....and two is too many! We did order a room service pizza, based on other reviews written on this site, but didn't find it to be anything spectacular, although it arrived in less than 15 minutes! We had packed a bunch of snacks, etc., in our luggage, since we had heard how expensive everything was, but the little store by the pool had everything you could possibly want, and we didn't think the prices were outrageous - - higher than the mainland, yes, but that's to be expected. Basically, the things that "cost" are alcohol ($9 for a mai tai at the Hang Ten....$8 for a glass of wine at the Bay Club), and transportation (it cost $100 each way, including the tip, to get back and forth from the airport.) But, hey, it's heaven on earth.....and was worth every penny. We're already saving to go back, and when we do, we're going straight back to Turtle Bay! (Tui gave us a tour of Waikiki Beach and Honolulu after our Pearl Harbor outing, and we were SO thankful we weren't staying on that side of the island.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: JackieGHouston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Turtle Bay and loved every minute of it! Some of the previous reviews had me nervous but we had a great time. Yes, everything is pricey but it's Hawaii! The rooms are spacious and clean, the views are incredible and the service outstanding. We had a late flight out and they let us use a room for 30 minutes late afternoon to get cleaned up before our flight. Not much nightlife but that was quite alright with us, we were looking for peace and quiet - this is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: KKJ323
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently visited the TBR between April 26-30. I have been to both Maui (Fairmont Kea Lani) and Kaui (Hyatt) on previous trips. I was nervous about going to Oahu, because I knew I wanted to get away from crowds and just relax. The Positives: The location is just stunning, and we enjoyed morning hikes on the hotels 13 miles of trails. The drive up along the coast takes an hour, but the views are better & better at every turn. We enjoyed the hotel's beach for swimming, and thought it would be good for our kids had we brought them with us. The room had a full ocean view for about $250/night--you would pay triple that for the same view on Maui. We loved Hale'iwa town--fish tacos at Cholo's . Also drove to Ka'ena Point with a stop at Mokulei'a beach--saw not a soul. So relaxing and we can't wait to go back. The just okay: The breakfast buffet was all right, not great, overpriced. The not so great: As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel's bathrooms are in need of rehab. I found a hair in the Mr Coffee. The bedside light didn't work. If you really want a luxury resort hotel experience, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “3.75 stars in my book”
Reviews.Author: CAJacklyn
Reviews.Content: I can't give this hotel a top rating because the beds are terrible and need upgrading soon. VERY, VERY uncomfortable! I read that in other reviews and now, I will confirm. They should upgrade their soaps and shampoos also. On the other hand, everything else fell within my expectations. Staff are nice and efficient. The North Shore, does not have too much in terms of restaurants or nightlife so if that is what you desire, Waikiki is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “The feel of another island.”
Reviews.Author: Fredrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the TBR from April 17-19 before heading over to busy Waikiki (See my Waikiki Marriott Review). We have been to Oahu many times before and I really like this resort. You get the feel of true Hawaii there. I didn't feel like I was in Oahu here. The resort is very big with it's own beach and golf course. I'm not a golfer but from what I seen the course is very beautiful. On this side of the island, the winds can pick up a lot. This is why on this side of the island, they have the famous north shore waves (the pipeline). Everyone there is friendly, of course they are, it's Hawai'i. We got the Local Discount (Kamaina Discount). The rooms are very room with a view of the ocean. The Lanai was big and my lil daughter love going out there. We also got them to put a crib in the room but the cribs are very small for a 22 month old. No problem, the bed was big that we all slept on the bed. The pool is big enough for those who don't want to swim at the beach. Food is pretty pricey but that is expected. There are small little places to eat outside the resort like the Island Shack. And it is what it is, a Shack. If you want some fancy dinning then stay at the resort. Plenty of restaurants there. But as others say, go to Foodland outside the resort and stock up on some food you can eat cold and drinks. You can even buy some pre-mixed Mai Tai mix and some rum that can last you a while. And drink some local beer.....your in Hawaii. Budweiser stays at home (Budweiser is nasty anyways). Back to the room, there is wireless internet there for those who have that power with their laptop. We stayed on the second floor where we thought there was a big wedding going on. They were actually filming a NBC Universal production movie called Forgetting Sarah Marshall staring Mila Kunis (That 70's show) and Kristen Bell (Veronica Mars). We found this out because they accidently slip a "Shooting Call" note under our door thinking we were one of those part of the crew. I saw Mila Kunis and Kristen Bell at the fitness center working out with their trainer. Got to talk to Mila Kunis real quick but didn't really wanna bother her. By the way, the fitness center is small but is it works. Some times it can can get pretty packed in there. So get there real early then you can enjoy the rest of the day. The beach by the resort was very nice. We actually saw a turtle about 10 feet off of shore. We ordered drinks at Ola and brougt them down to the beach. The pool has a fun slide and pictures of turtles at the bottom of the kids pools that my daughter loves. The shop next to the pool is very expensive for souvineirs. Don't buy souvineirs here or at the ABC stores or International Market in Waikiki....go to the Aloha Bowl swap meet that goes on Wed, Sat and Sun. Thumbs up for the Turtle Bay resort....I would return again!!! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: stepjo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Hawaii and TBR was recommended by 3 different friends. More expensive than Waikiki but we wanted a NICE place so we decided to spend the extra money - however... not what I expected. While the location is difficult to top, the rooms themselves are nothing to get excited about: marble in bathrooms is stained, grout dirty, fingerprints on the walls, no bathroom fan, clothesline is stained, track of sliding glass doors to "lanai" filled with dust, furniture scratched/chipped... not horrid, or disfunctional but the room was just not as nice as a comparably priced hotel in say, Vegas or LA. Our room would do well with a bathroom remodel and fresh coat of paint, some new colors and better lighting. On the plus side, the rooms are large, and the views of the ocean are very nice. Food is relatively expensive (compared to nearby towns), but was good without exception. Pool, beaches are lovely and very clean, staff is friendly/helpful. I might come back if I hear the rooms have been updated, or can splurge for a cottage (assuming they are better kept than the hotel rooms). All in all, I'd say TBR is worth a try, but proceed with caution: just because you are paying more than other hotels on Oahu, don't assume you are going to get a first class room - ours was squarely average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the beginning of the month. I found Turtle Bay on the internet when I was looking for a place to get married. At first, there was a couple of snags and I was a little nervous to get married there, but when we arrived, the setting was breath taking. We were upgraded to a suite which was enormous. I didn't find the room outdated, but I wish they had a separate shower and tub. The robes were soft and comfy and the house keeping staff was polite and referred to us by name by the second day. The hotel provided us some complimentary champagne and strawberries which just added to the romance. My wedding couldn't have been more perfect and the wait staff more awesome. If you are considering a destination wedding, this is the place to go. We ate a Giovannis (yum) and the daily buffet which is so so and Lei Lei's was great for our rehearsal dinner. We ate at 21 degrees north our last night, and while the food was good, the service was horrible, maybe it was an off night or something...We were very happy with our stay and will definitely go back. My only complaint is that they were a little chinzy with the towels. You're provided a towel card which is one per person and you have to return the towel at the end of each day or you'll get charged $25. I think for the $15 a day resort fee, they can be a little more generous with the towels. There was a landslide while we were there so we were only able to go to Haleiwa one time and we ate at Haleiwa eats for some great Thai food and it was really in expensive. Overall, this was a great place and great people.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: cdar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an wonderful family vacation in Oahu. Rather than visit another island as our time was only a week, we chose to spend a few days at the Turtle Bay Resort followed by the Outrigger Waikiki. Its very hard to add anything to previous reviews. The room was huge and beautiful, the view incredible; crashing waves, surfers, whales, rainbows. We found TBR to be perfect for our family with 2 teenagers. The huge dressing room with a sink was perfect for 4 people attempting to get out the door; not that we were in any rush to go anywhere. The view makes it pretty easy to wait on the stragglers; or to just sit on the balcony read a listen to the ocean. No one ever turned on the TV. The dressing room has a door, you can close it, the coffee maker is in there, and not disturb the rest of the family, big enough to bring chairs in if you wanted to read later. I loved being able to see the ocean from the bed! We had the buffet breakfast each morning in the main dining room. Yes, food is expensive, and it was excellent, we found it more reasonable to chose the buffet over the menu and we didn't need to eat again until late afternoon. It wasn't on the menu; but when our waitress realized a couple of us weren't wanting the hot things on the buffet, it was about $15 for the continental part only; which in itself was a huge amount of food. The full buffet was $22 (the beautiful Pink Palace on Waikiki is more in the $29 range). Sitting outside, enjoying the view, over a leisurely breakfast was heaven. We ate at Ola's on the beach and it was good too. A car is simply the cheapest way of getting to TBR; we only left once for the Polynesian Cultural Center; we choose to just do the later day admission and show. I would have preferred better seating and those options are there, they were sold out; book in advance. We stopped at the G shrimp truck, and yes they were good; but I've had yummy ones on the mainland too, and I'm not crazy about having to remove all those yucky parts first. My daughter loved the garlic hot dog there! The Resort Fee - self parking included - this is a bargain. Waikiki wanted $25 night!! I also liked the beach towel service. Each person receives a plastic card that you exchange for a towel. You return the towel, they give you a card back, however many time you want in a day. Very easy. And you can return these cards at the gate when you leave if you still want to enjoy the beach after check out. We would return again to Turtle Bay; for three nights at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Turtle Bay....”
Reviews.Author: kim_65
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Turtle Bay Resort... We stayed for 8 nights. We had room # 381, like everyone say's, we had a great view! We had the Ocean front deluxe extreme escape room. Which mean's, the bigger balcony. Which I knew we would want. The large pool is not heated...a little too cold. Maybe in a month or so it will warm up. The kids pool is heated with the slide and water fall. Everyone there is really friendly. We had a rental car the entire time, which I would recommend. It is VERY windy there....so if you want to do any water sports, or any excursions...(jet ski, bannana boats, catamaran activities)...you will have to go to Waikiki, or somewhere else. ( I didn't know that). So if I could do it over again, (because of our 2 teenager's)..I would have stayed either at Waikiki first, (or another island)..to do all the different activities. Then just relax at Turtle Bay...

Reviews.Title: “Great place, just needs come competition”
Reviews.Author: lknight26
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay at TBR (3/25 - 3/28). Pretty much as others have stated the views from here are amazing and that's what you're paying for. No night life, but we had a car so we drove into town for that. Didn't eat on the proprety but the menus did look very appetizing. We were upgarded to a deluxe room for free which was nice, however, my only complaint is that you get more bang for your buck in waikiki. As others has stated TBR suffers from no competition. Stayed at Outrigger Waikiki prior to arriving here, and paid less money per night, but felt we got more for our moeny there. $15 resort fee each day is irritating since it doesn't cover much considering the Outrigger Waikiki included free coffee, newspaper, and phone calls and internet service included in their rate. Probably won't stay here again, but will definately make the trip to North Shore on my next visit. Staff was very nice and all, it's just very expensive and to me you don't get much for it. Did go to Giovanni's shrimp truck and they were awesome. Haleiwa Joe's was so so, but dinning in waikiki was awesome!!! You'll definately need a car if you stay here. It's very peaceful though, however, my next trip will be a few nights in waikiki and then I can go to Maui (Four Seasons Wailea) for peace and quiet for the remaining portion of my vacation. Rooms were somewhat dated, but very comfy. However, overall we really enjoyed ourselves here and feel that you should at least stay here once. We just won't be back until more competition comes up there.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort definitely has it's place”
Reviews.Author: Brandigrl
Reviews.Content: OVERALL Overall the hotel is less crowded and has more of a laid back vibe than any of the Waikiki hotels. And this is really the only resort on the north shore. The customer service is fantastic. The resort is very clean. The views from every angle are fantastic. Access to the beach is super easy. There are lots of shops in the hotel if you forgot anything. We had a wonderful time at TBR recharging our batteries. We hung out there and also cruised all over the north shore exploring. You'll definitely need a rental car to do that. We are really happy with our experience. Having said that, I'm not sure I could have stayed there more than 5 days. It's just a tad more sedate and as lots of people have mentioned, the rooms are expensive and the food is expensive. While everything was wonderful, I’m not sure we'll stay there again. We will definitely go back to the North Shore but we'll rent a house next time. ROOM Amenities: Waffle bathrobes, slippers, coffee (dried creamer kind of a downer), fridge, nice shampoo/conditioner/body wash/q-tips/cotton balls/sewing kit/bath cap, HUGE double closet, extra sink in dressing area, nice books and magazines (for the ultra wealthy who can afford what's in them or those of us who like to day dream), hairdryer THE UPSIDE Stunning view. Our room was less than 25 feet from the shore. Aside from the view, my favorite was the sharper image radio/clock do-dad that was set on a pre-programmed setting of Asian ambient music when we arrived. It also had a connection to plug into your iPod so you could listen to your own music. The room was updated and SUPER roomy. The entire wall facing the beach was a series of sliding windows with giant sliding wooden shutters which allowed controlling your environment. Nice. Nice comfy furniture Large patio Super nice housekeeping staff Great turndown service. The first few nights the put chocolate covered macadamia nut out for us, the last night they put homemade macaroons wrapped in fresh banana leaves. VERY NICE touch. ROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT While the bedding looks sumptuous, for the caliber of resort that they portray themselves as being, the bed was kinda disappointing. We weren't uncomfortable but I have stayed more than my share of nights at Hilton and Marriotts who have upgraded their beds/bedding and are ultra comfy. The TBR bed was kinda springy, the pillows were disappointing. The down comforter was a nice weight but the duvet had sort of a "been washed way too many times" feel too it, and not in a good way. No full length mirror Have to call the front desk so they can unlock your account to order movies. The dried creamer DINING We ordered room service our when we checked in. I had the best burger of my life. It was also the most expensive at $18.00. The b/f ordered pizza which was very good also. Generally I'd say the food was good but like others noted, very expensive. We ate 4 meals at the resort. I think each meal ran us $100.00 with 1 drink each. Sunday brunch was good and they had a local singer there singing tunes. He was very good. Nice background music. Something to consider is that they are focused on wanting you to have reservations. We bought snacks and beer at a market that's nearby. That worked well. We ate at Giovanni's shrimp truck which is out of this world. My mission next week is to try making the garlic/butter shrimp myself. Bring your own beer (they don't sell it), order the garlic/butter shrimp and a side of hot sauce. You won't be sorry. (We also tried Macky's for a comparison and we were sorry. Giovanni's all the way). POOL The pool area (there are 2 plus a few hot tubs) are really nice and overlooking the ocean where the surfers take their lessons. It's really relaxing. It's not crowded and much smaller than hotels in Waikiki. BEACH The beaches near the hotel are of wonderful white sand. I've been to Maui before and was pleasantly surprised with how many wonderful beaches there are (seemingly EVERYWHERE) along the north shore. You won't be disappointed. The cove on the resort (near Ola's restaurant) has a sundries stand where the attendant will drag out reclining chairs to the beach for your sunbathing pleasure. If you get out early, there are also a several preset umbrellas to hide under. We had read about the $15 per day resort fee. I’m not really sure why they carve this out separately from your hotel room rate. It basically gets you free wifi and towel service for the pool/beach. It may be that there are condo owners on the property and they want to charge them that rate also. Dunno. We sucked it up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view ...that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: debphoto
Reviews.Content: It's hard to add anything different about Turtle Bay Resort (TBR) than what other TripAdvisors have already said. Yes, breathtaking view from just about every room but that's about what this place has going for it. The rooms were "updated" but sparse and the food/drinks are unaffordable. TBR suffers from the "only game in town" syndrome. We had just come from staying at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach where just about everything (except food and drink) was included with the room. The Outrigger even had FREE calls to the mainland! That was really nice. But enough about The Outrigger, back to TBR. We didn't eat a single meal at TBR unless you count the small plate of French Fries and a bottle of beer for $9. The best place to eat is the "Shrimp Shack" or the "Island Shack" (look for the tiki god). Foodland is a MUST for munchies and drinks. The pool at TBR was delicious; we loved the Jacuzzi and slide. In retrospect it was a lot pricier to stay there than we were expecting (all added up) but it was a nice retreat. However, we'd never go back again though.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Cottages are Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: prospectivetraveler
