Be sure to hit the little shopping center, also on your left as you head towards Foodland from the resort, with the big totem pole and little shops. You can't miss it - probably about 2 miles and a huge totem pole. Cool place with great deals. There is a booth directly in the front with great bead bracelets for $1 each. Ted's Bakery - About 2 miles from resort heading towards Foodland on the left. Go for breakfast but you MUST go early or you won't get in - if that happens at least go by for pastries and good stuff for your room - OMG. Whatever you do DO NOT eat at the burger stand directly across from Sharks Cove. 99% sure it is called Sharks Cove Burgers - The worse burger I have ever had - it was cardboard on a stale bun, with old lettuce. Mayonnaise and Mustard packets sitting out in the sun, warm when put on burger – yuck. My hubby got the Ahi sandwich (or some fish sandwich - they only had one) and it was bad but he ate it. Such a guy. Snorkel Sharks Cove – lots of fish and turtles too. Crystal clear, beautiful water but not the easiest of descents down the hill to the shore. You should wear river shoes for sure and entering the water is a task also. Due to living in San Diego we snorkel a lot but even with all our experience you must be careful at Sharks Cove. The water is crystal clear, full of rocks, ledges, and people. It is safe but you must be aware. Waimea Bay – famous in the Beach Boys song – you must go. The softest, most white sand with sailboats anchored bobbing in the waves. Picture perfect with a great cliff top park too. Then go to the Waimea Audubon Society Nature Preserve directly across the street from the Waimea Beach parking lot. The hike is a short ¾ mile walk through the preserve, beautiful grounds and they have a great gift shop, as well as food stands. Big Macadamia trees right by the parking lot with birds in the road waiting to eat the nuts after a cars goes through and breaks the shells. I think those are the hardest shell in the world and my hubby used a vice for the nuts from our macadamia tree at our old house. We do not have a mac tree at our new home – sadness sets it – let us move on. I also bought 2 fantastic Island Scrap booking Kits that are all island themed, in at the gift shop. Shaved Ice from Matsumotos (not sure on spelling) or Aoki in Haleiwa- both on right as you come in to Haleiwa. Be sure to add ice cream and Azuki beans to the bottom to make a real Hawaiian Shaved Ice – can you say yummy. Haleiwa is a great town. Haleiwa Joe’s gets rave reviews on this site so we went while in town. We sat 10 minutes without a glass of water, menu or acknowledgement from the waitress so we got up and left. Yes, they were busy but we were in the bar and the bartender was right there, seeing us and not even nodding a hello. There is not a place in this world that is worth being ignored and there are just too many choices to be ignored around the north shore. Garlic Shrimp from Giovanni’s Shrimp Truck – They have 3 types of shrimp but they were out of their Lemon and their Spicy - but I hear they are incredible too. That was ok because we wanted the garlic anyhow. The Smoothie shack that is next to Gionvanni’s is great and perfect accompaniment to garlic shrimp. When you get to the end of the TB driveway to leave going somewhere you will make a left heading towards the town of Kahuku and it is a mile or two on the left. You will pass other shrimp trucks and Romi’s is good too from what we hear, but Giovanni’s was so good we never made it there. Just keep a look out for the sign and the truck. Dinner - 21 Degrees at TB - make sure to have the peanut coconut curry shrimp – omg. All food, appetizers, drinks and service were perfect. Hang 10 Bar – poolside at TB – great Mai Tais, hamburgers and garlic fries - Tell Eddie hi and order your Mai Tai from him, he makes the best and we tried them all – LOL Helicopter tour with Josh at Paradise - on TB resort - do the 1 hour Oahu tour - take your camcorder as they do not offer a video for purchase. On the way out the coast will be on the person seated behind Josh the pilot for your picture/camcorder opportunities. Horse back ride - on TB resort - do the morning ride. Ask for Jerry the horse – he was in Open Range with Kevin Costner and my husband had him on our ride. I had Casper, a big, gentle sweet horse with mind of his own when it comes to grass! You go past the world’s largest Banyan tree (larger than the one on Maui that is world famous) and is the Banyan tree that they hid in on the t.v. show Lost when the polar bear was after them all. A lot of the show Lost is filmed at TB and the whole series is shot on the north shore from what I understand. They had just removed the plane wreckage before we arrived but we can not wait for the new season so we can see that tree again. Just saw the tail end of Open Range the other night and saw Jerry at the end of the movie he is pulling a wagon across a meadow and then the movie ends. Lei Lei’s – TB Golf Course – They will take you down from the resort in a golf cart and then you ask your server to call for them to pick you up. We went our first night and I did not like their Caesar Salad (ice box cold as if it had been made for a long time to get that cold, and it was slightly wilted) or the Coconut Shrimp which was dark brown from over frying as well as old oil and did not good taste at all but my hubby loved his seafood scampi. Believe it or not they had bad Pina Coladas but great Lava Flows and Mai Tais. We had to go back a second time and hubby had the seafood scampi again as it was all he thought about it all week. That is how good it was and I had the vegetable scampi, add grilled chicken and it was fantastic too. Ola’s – on the beach at TB resort – really great food, great service, open air dining with no walls only a roof. Everything we ate was good and it is directly on the sand to the side of the resort. Their Yukon Gold mashed potatoes make you want a whole plate load they are so good. Their filet mignon is to die for. Palm Terrace – we never did any eating there except to do the breakfast buffet which was included in our deal but it was incredible and changed every few days. That was nice since we were there so long to have more choices for breakfast. They made one of the best made to order omelets I have had! The Bay Club – in the lobby of the TB resort had the worse Hawaiian Pizza we have ever eaten. Besides being cold it was not good. Came to find out they order it in from another place and have it brought it. Fun place though with pool tables, shuffle board and darts Having trouble with the pictures but I will attempt to upload again in this review. I was trying to upload 10 so I wiil try just the three in the spaces provided while doing the review. It did not work last time but I guess you get a link in the email from TA once they uploaded the review and i am not even sure it went through so I am doing the review again with this paragraph added. This review may actually be on the Oahu forum twice when all is said. I will get pictures here as I was also to on the Maui forum last year but I can not seem to get it to work today.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found; Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: jason.tucker
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for for crowds of people, traffic backups, restaurants that can be found on the mainland, and shopping that is no different from suburban malls, than the North Shore of Oahu and the Turtle Bay is NOT for you. However, if you desire solitude, a warm ocean breeze, quaint local shops, miles of uncrowed beaches, and a resort that is second to none, then the Turtle Bay Resort is for you. After spending the day in Waikiki, it made me realize how glad I was that I decided to stay at the Turtle Bay. The 40 minute drive from the airport was well worth it. Waikiki, although packed with the majority of Oahu's hotels, is like any other crowded beach city in America. If you're thinking of staying in Oahu, do yourself a favor and plan to stay at Turtle Bay. Although located 40 minutes from the airport, the North Shore is quitely inhabited by local shops and stores that will provide you with all your needs for a 7 day stay. Great local restaurants and small stores in Haleiwa and Kahuku, especially Cholo's Mexican Restaurant in Haleiwa. Great food, cold beer, and cheap prices. And as far as Turtle Bay is concerned, everyone is friendly, they treat you great, the accomodations are outstanding. My wife and I stayed in the beach cottages, and if you're able to, I recommend staying in one. The Hoop'ika (personal concierge) will cater to your every need. Overall when I go back to Hawaii someday, It will be to Oahu, and it'll be to the Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ctkdo
Reviews.Content: We have spent annual vacations in Hawaii in Waikiki and decided to stay on the North Shore for a change. What a big mistake to stay at the Turtle Bay. We paid over $300 per room through Expedia that should have included the breakfast buffet. When we arrived, the front desk personnel informed me that the reservation did not have the buffets included even though my printed reservation stated such. We had to contact Expedia. After 40 minutes, Expedia finally picked up part of the tab. It was $20+ per person for brunch. Another annoying charge was the parking. We had a mini-van for the six of us that took ONE parking space. Since we had two rooms, we were charged for TWO spaces. It was $15 per spot per day. The resort charged a fee for tennis court and snorkel gear use for 2 hours. It was $12 per room per day. It did not matter that we brought our own gear and did not use the courts, we had to paid $24 per day for both rooms. Since we stayed for six nights, the extra charges added up to be $240. About the room, don't touch the stuff animal turtle. My daughter thought it was a welcome gift and took the tag off. I think we were charged another $25 for it. We had reserved rooms that were in the "Premium Ocean Front Delux" with 180 degrees ocean view. Don't bother doing that. Most of the hotel has an ocean view. Furthermore, even though we were on the higher floors (not too many floors at this hotel) we overlooked a patio cover. The hotel would not move us. Even though the property was nice. With the extra charges, tax and surcharges, we paid over $700 per night for two rooms. Even though it's not outrageous, the nickeling and diming aspect of the hotel was annoying. Local places, Waimea bay is nice in the summer. In the winter, the undercurrent can be dangerous for some-and definitely for kids. Lots of drowning so be aware. Pipeline surfing contest is fun to watch. For snacks and drinks -Foodland market is great. Waimea Park is great for first timers. Lots of birds and local plants and flowers. As for attractions and dining in Hawaii, pick up THE ENTERTAINMENT BOOK- HAWAII EDITION. We've visited the Polynesian Cultural center a couple of times. I think it opens at noon or one. The first time years ago, we booked the tour, luau, and show with the package price of maybe $100 per person. In 4-06, we used the entertainment coupon that saved us 25 percent per person for the Admission and show. I think we paid $35 per person. We left the facilities and had dinner outside of the center since there was a gap of about 1-1/2 hours between tours and show. A local recommended the L&L BBQ (fast food place) with great Mahi Mahi and, Teriyaki beef/chicken or burgers-$5 per person-no kidding. The food was great, but the place was a dump. Not a good place for people who want great atmosphere. When we attended the luau the first time, the food was awful-not worth the price. The dancing at the luau was a duplicate on a smaller scale as compared to the show at night-fantastic and shorter recently that when we saw it for the first time years ago- thank goodness. After a while it all looked the same. Other places to eat are at the hotel, prices were okay $30-$40 per person for dinner, lunch was reasonable $8-$15 for an entree. The town Haleiwa has a couple of good restaurants, $25 per person for dinner-great food. Other hot tips for Oahu with the entertainment book: PARADISE COVE LUAU: Cheaper to drive than to do the bus tour if you have a big party. The book gives a 25% discount up to four people. Only thing is that traffic is awful going to the west side of the island, so leave early. We booked the tour directly with the Paradise Cove and got the middle package (flower lei, 4 drinks pp, and preferred seating. Since most people booked through the bus tour companies, we had great seats-one row behind the premium group that paid a lot more. They reserved our seats so it was not a problem that we arrived late. Once you are there, get in line for the canoe ride if you have kids, otherwise you will not be able to do it. The tour on the USS Arizona and the MISSOURI- great prices with the book and save. Get there by 9am or you will have a problem with parking. Nautilus submarine: Buy one, get one free ($80+ per adult). This was great. Restuarants in the book - MATTEO'S (yummy), KOBE's TEPPAN- (like a Benhana's but 1/2 the price). I came here as a kid and had fond memories. My children love this place. If you get in before 6pm, meals are cheap $12 instead of $20 for the basics. You can also use the entertainment card and get one meal free for the fancier items. A bunch of places at the Hilton Hawaiian Village are in the book. Fun, great food but pricey. The card helps. For big families/groups you can use up to three if you are not too shy. Just hand the card(s) to the waiter at the end of dinner when you ask for the bill and they will adjust off up to 3 dinners/meals. Not in the book- The Shore Bird at the Outrigger fun for families. DON"T MISS this place: JOHN DOMINIS Sunday brunch. $29 or $35 per adult and $14 for kids. We always come here. Amazing food. Dinner is very pricey $90+ per entree. Make reservations. STUFF TO DO: Go to Hanama Bay. Beautiful place to snorkel. The fishes will swim up to you. Parking can be bad so leave early. The attendants for the parking can be morons. They don't check to see if spaces are available and will wave you away. So park down the hill on the residential street and walk up- It's about 1/2 mile uphill. The price is $5 for entrance. For the windsurfers, Kailua on the East side is fabulous. The beach is beautiful. For the surfers or kids that want to learn, "Mad Dog" who owns a shop between the Hilton Hawaiian and the Outrigger was great. After my daughter's one-hour lesson with him, he gave her permission to hang out if she wanted to and get tips on surfing when he gave other lessons. One hour lesson $50 or $60. Another hot tip- The OUTRIGGER HOTELS: Before we bought our timeshare at The Hilton (due to the terrible experience at the Turtle Bay) we stayed at the Outrigger frequently. It was a little more than 1/2 price with the entertainment book depending on availability Instead of $225-$250 per night. It ranged from $139-$169. There are four restaurants on the premise. Good food for cheap. Call them directly or go to the web site under specials and click on travel club rates ( better than AAA by $$$$) Thanks for your attention. There are lots more in the Entertainment book. Get it on Entertainment(--)or stop by Borders on Nimitz HWY and pick one up when you are leaving the airport for you hotel. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: whitenackers
Reviews.Content: We went to Turtle Bay as the first week of our Hawaiian honeymoon. There was a little trouble with getting our room at first but after about 10 minutes they had it worked out. There was a basket of fresh fruit in the room waiting for us. We were over the pool, which wasn’t our preference but it was actually fine as you can still have a great view of the ocean. The room was very nice and clean. There is a small refrigerator for drinks. There were many people surfboarding, which was entertaining. We are tennis players and used the courts every day. We went horseback riding which we highly recommend. It is there at the resort and a beautiful trail along the beach and into the woods where Lost was filmed. You need to have long pants and closed toe shoes to horseback ride so be sure to pack accordingly. We snorkeled there at the resort; they have equipment that is free for an hour to guests. They also supply beach towels for the guests. We had the breakfast buffet at the Palm Terrace every morning. That was something we enjoyed very much and never tired of. We also had dinner at Lei Lei’s and burgers, nachos and drinks at The Bay Club. Both were good. The large pool was rather cool and not many people used it but the smaller pools were warmer. We went on one of the hiking trails and saw a monk seal, mongoose and many beautiful sights. There are several hiking trails and we would have done them all had we found them sooner. We had read some negative reviews of this resort so were a little apprehensive of what we’d find but were very happy with it over all. We hated to leave to go to Maui, as we felt we would surely be let down after Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I decided to surprise my wife on our seven year anniversary to our first trip to Hawaii. We first booked with the HIlton on Waikiki. When we arrived there we were shocked at the crowds and noise at that resort. It was literaly a city within a city. So we immediatley checked out of there and called Turtle Bay to reserve a last minute stay for our 3 nights at Oahu. We grabbed a rental car and headed to the north shore. The drive was awesome especially when you get out of the Honolulu hustle and bustle. We were totally blessed by the goodness of God when we saw 5 rainbows on our drive north. We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room on the 6th floor(ASk for this floor) The rooms were clean, beautiful, with spectacular views. The pools were beautiful, the snorkeling was great. We walked to Kawela BAy-- the best secluded beach on the north shore that we visited. ON our last day there we booked a couples massage for me and my pregnant wife on the spa's ocean side deck. Highly recommend this! All in all I hightly recommend this place. Definitely get a rental car to come here. There is so much to see and drive to with 20 minutes of the resort. We loved it and were very thankful we left Waikiki to come here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: brv08
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Turtle Bay Resort the last week of June 2006. This was our first trip to Hawaii. My first impression of Hawaii was horrible! Honolulu is so BUSY. With the rental car companies offsite from the airport, getting our rental car was a nightmare. Could not get a shuttle nor a taxi to take us there. Getting around the island was somewhat of a challenge at times. There seemed to be road construction on EVERY highway we traveled. Upon arriving at Turtle Bay, it changed for the better! I was pleased with our Dlx Ocean Room with the large Lanai overlooking the pool. Our view was spectacular. If you are looking to get away from it all, Turtle Bay is the way to go. With plenty of activities on the North Shore, you will find plenty to do. Unlike previous reviews, I never encountered an unhappy employee. Everyone treated us nicely. We ate at all of the restaurants except for 21 Degrees. Most of the restaurants had the same type of menu, however the food was good at all of them. We had a bad experience with Room Service when they messed up one entree and did not return with the correct one for 30 minutes. When we received the meal, nothing was done, not even a free dessert. After contacting the front desk, they apologized and took care of the bill. We had the breakfast buffet each morning because it came with our package. It had a nice variety of fruits, pastries, juices and hot items. If you plan to go snorkeling, we found a great place called "Three tables". It was even better than Hanauma Bay and only 10 min from resort (across from Foodland). I would definately stay at Turtle Bay again. The family enjoyed all Turtle Bay had to offer and when returning to Oahu we would only stay here. Waikiki was too busy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully secluded.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that my husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay for our honeymoon and we both loved it. It is gorgeuos. Neither of us like alot of traffic and we dont really care for the big city. Turtle bay was perfect. When I think of Hawaii I think of tropical lush tropical forest and that was more like Tutle bay than anything else we saw. We did drive into Hon. and Waikik a few times for some different activities but there really was enough on the North shore to keep us busy. We stayed for a full week. Our room was very nice and confortable. Very large and we had a wonderful large balncony over looking the ocean. We were on the top floor in the corner. The food was good but a little high for our tastes. We ate in Haliwa which was nice and you really have to try the shirmp stands. We had the breakfast buffet in Palm Terrece every morning because it came free with our package....and talk about some of the best fruit I have ever eaten. Everyone was very nice and helpful and the golf courses were great. Cheaper then we expect...which was nice. We do suggest renting a car and bringing your own snorkel equipment. Overall we had a wonderful time and loved Turtle Bay. It was alot more Hawaii then Waikik or Hon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TexasAggie423
Reviews.Content: My new Husband and I booked this hotel as the last night of our honeymoon after a 13 night, Tahitian cruise. We were a bit worried about the drive to the hotel from downtown Honolulu. Luckily, it was very scenic and entertaining. When we arrived at the hotel we were there before check in time. The Hotel was happy to accomodate us. Unfortunately, they sent us to a room that had gotten mixed up and had yet to be cleaned by housekeeping. I promptly called down to the front desk where the lady was incredibly appologetic. She told us they were going to upgrade us, free of charge, for the inconvience. The bell hop picked us up in from of the hotel with our luggage loaded into a beautiful golf cart. The beach cottage was amazing. Hard wood floors, veranda, huge bath tub, gorgeous shower, hammocks and tiki torches and the fluffiest beds I have ever stayed in... and I have stayed at some fabulous hotels! We also had our own personal concierge, who brought us local juices, water and champagne. That night the staff came and did a turn down service and left cookies by our bed. This hotel was absolutely incredible! Make sure that you book a beach cottage, it really makes a difference in your stay. - On the downside, there seemed to be a lot of children and families, and for honeymooners, not the right atmosphere in June. The Beach cottage offers a large amount of seclusion, which is fabulous. And the golf course was great. My husband played the Palmer course at twilight and I drove the golf cart and kept score. I know nothing about golf what so ever, but had a great time watching the scenery and drinking Lei Lei's Lemonade from the cart girl and the club house! A MUST STAY IN OAHU!! SKIP WAIKIKI BEACH'S HUSTLE AND BUSTLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the turtle bay with another couple from may 29th,06-june 5th,06,this was our first visit to oahu and will be our last.the resort is beautiful but it's all a facade.the employees are very unwelcoming and unfriendly with a few exceptions.the beach cottages are not cottages but like row houses lined up along the beach,we had booked a cottage for the week but were very disappointed so we moved into the main hotel after the 1st night.the cottages are very plain and we were eat up with bugs on the cottage patio.our rooms in the main hotel were also very plain,not what i would expect in hawaii,especially after visiting maui the year before.we had a nice balcony with a good view but i can get that in naples florida.the breakfast buffett was ok,nothing to brag about.for the prices they charge i was amazed at the attitude of most employees,most are not happy in their job and don't mind letting the guests know.the only place i have encountered more unfriendly people was in freeport bahamas.since i have returned home,turtle bay sent me a survey to fill out,i was quite frank just as i am being here,needless to say i have not heard a word from anyone there about our very disappointing stay nor did i expect too.the guest is not their main concern,it's the guests'wallets.i must also mention that we spent about 1/2 of a day at the front desk trying to get rooms in the main hotel.the desk clerk could not seem to understand the type of room we wanted nor did she care,she made no secret of her displeasure of trying to find rooms that would accomandate our needs.i have been to maui and now oahu,there is no comparison,oahu will never get another dime of our hard earned money

Reviews.Title: “the other side of Oahu”
Reviews.Author: northbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort sits on the windy north shore far away from the crowds at Waikiki. We liked the rural feeling and traffic free highway. This is the only large resort on this coast. The staff treated us like family and gave us their personal recommendations where to walk. The blue water view from our room was lovely, the only downside was the bland decor. The lobby could use some comfy furniture. Golfers could call this a destination resort, course looked nice. We don't golf and spent our time testing out all the beaches and visiting quaint Haleiwa. The food service was standard for Hawaii, nothing special, but reasonably priced and fresh. There's a Starbucks and good take out at Foodland nearby. Just down the road on the way back to Honolulu is the Polynesian Cultural Center which was very entertaining. The hiking on the windward coast is spectacular. We used the Oahu Trailblazer to locate the trails and sightsee. We also carried a map of Oahu along. We would stay at this resort again and would next time request a room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned form my honeymoon at Turtle Bay Resort and must say it was fabulous! The location is perfect- away from the crowded beaches of Waikiki. The rooms were very nice and didn't have any of that tacky rattan "Golden Girls" furniture. The rooms were very clean amd had a great view. We were greeted with a lei made out of beads and seeds which was beautiful and a great keepsake since it wont wilt like a flower lei. They knew it was our honeymoon and when we got to our a room a complementary bottle of champagne was waiting for us. The pools were fabulous as were the miles of pristine, private beaches. the hotel staff was very friendly. The food at all of the restaurants was great, as was the room service! I'm not sure what people have found to complain about this hotel ; it was our honeymoon and we were expecting a lot and we got it. I assume those who found problems would find problems anywhere they stayed. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights of our honeymoon in Hawaii and loved it! Excellent service! Loved the fresh fruit by the pool. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which I highly recommend. The view was beautiful and the larger balcony is a must! O'la and LeLe's are great restaurants on the grounds. I was sad to leave and come back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location-outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fla4ever
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is located in one of the most beautiful areas in all of Oahu. The scenic views, beaches, and coves are among the nicest we've ever seen. There are hiking trails on the property which take you to sites you'll recognize from the television show Lost. Also trails will lead you to a gorgeous secluded beach (Kalewa Bay) where you may find yourselves the only people on the beach. There is also a very nice cove at the resort (Kuilima) with great snorkeling. The onsite restaurants were for the most part very average. Ola's had the best food and drinks, however service can be very hit or miss. We had better luck in Haleiwa at Haleiwa Joe's, Cholo's, and Pizza Bob's. All of the previous postings which refer to the seclusion of the resort are correct. It doesn't take long to explore all of Turtle Bay and if you have an active family you may want to explore other beaches in the area, eat out, and shop. If so, then you absolutely need a rental car. We used Turtle Bay as our base and spent each day at a different beach on the North Shore, ate and shopped in Haleiwa. Lai'e Town is nearby, and has restaurant's and a Foodland Grocery Store as well. Everything is fairly convenient but you need a car to access it all. Now with all this said let me express what a disappointment the actual hotel itself is. We had a Deluxe Oceanfront room and I was hoping for something special. The view from our lanai truly was spectacular, however the room itself fell short. I knew that it was an older property, but heard that it had undergone a major renovation just a few years ago. I don't know where the money was spent, but it sure wasn't in the actual hotel guest rooms themselves. The beds were old and not comfortable. The furniture itself had all seen better days. The rooms are all painted an institutional shade of green with two unattractive pictures of what looks like a science book depiction of bacteria. Old lamps, old carpet and a general look of old and tired. Housekeeping trys very hard to keep things tidy, but it is run-down. There are large glass windows everywhere that offer panoramic views which are marred by the stips of tape over the cracks. The lobby furniture is stained, and all the carpet in the public area has stains. I was very disappointed in the general look and feel of the hotel. The hotel will never be a world class resort due to the inattention to details. I also didn't like the fact that guest parking which is included in the $15 daily resort fee is not guaranteed. You are directed to a general lot that is shared with public access, so many times you will circle the lot or be forced to go pay for valet parking because there is no actual 'guest' parking. It is also some distance from the hotel, so plan on this if carrying heavy items. The hotel also 'includes' in the fee complimentary snorkle gear. Well the fine print limits this to one hour a day for up to two people. Plan to rent elsewhere for your stay, or purchase. Either option is cheaper than the extra $ at Turtle Bay. Also, the tennis courts were closed during our recent stay, so that may be worth inquiring on if you plan to play. The most irritating thing of all is the infamous 'Towel Card'. Each guest must have a towel card in order to obtain a pool or beach towel. Once you return the towel you get the card back. Lost cards are fined $25. This policy is widely derided by the guests and staff alike. The towels used are worth no more than 50 cents each, so your $25 will buy Turtle Bay alot of new towels. It's the little things like this that differentiate quality lodgings, and Turtle Bay's management needs to work on that. All in all I would say that Turtle Bay Resort is a 2.5 star hotel at a 5 star location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jene
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Turtle Bay resort as part of our honeymoon. Absolutely loved it. Very secluded and relaxing. It is a little expensive and the resort does die down after 10:00, but we didn't mind either as we were seeking peace. Staff was extremely helpful with the most Aloha of anywhere on the island. Wish we could have stayed another night. Grounds, pools and rooms were immaculate. We ate a la carte breakfast at Palm Terrace and found it average. Room service was good and prompt. Lei Lei's restaurant was excellent. A short hike gets you too a beautiful secluded beach on TB property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blue
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent three nights at the Turtle Bay Resort and loved it! The staff was always friendly and responsive. The location was excellent and our room was spotless all under $300.00 a nigh. It is the only place on Oahu that I will consider staying in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bealll95
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. We really loved our rooms. We got married here and had our honeymoon here. We were blown away by the shear beauty and we had so much fun. I would read everyones reviews and get tips for your stay. Like Giovanni's and Haliewa and stuff like that. Feel free to email me and I'll give you more pics and tell you the tips.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED our stay at Turtle Bay.”
Reviews.Author: gratefulmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Turtle Bay on April 6th for the first three nights of our Hawaiian trip (followed by six nights on Kauai). We loved our room (and it was under 300 dollars - "on a whim" a month in advance online). The beds were wonderful with white down comforters. The bathroom looked almost new. We had zero noise issues. The view was fantastic. My husband and 9-year-old son enjoed the Fazio course. We didn't ever do the breakfast buffet, however we ordered room service our last morning there. Except for the high price (which is to be expected) it was fantastic (two meals easily fed the three of us). I had an enjoyable massage at the Spa and I found no complaints with the facilities. We had an amazing dinner at Lei Lei's. The service was wonderful and the food and drinks were the best. We also enjoyed the live music in the evening in the Turtle Bay lobby. We recognized the parking issue when we got there, so we did the vallet (added to bill each day) and it all worked out for minimal cost. We had no complaints. Not one. If we ever come back to Oahu, it's Turtle Bay 100%. We found it a great place to start the day and to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “pesty problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used TB to marry and honeymoon on OAHU. We expressed this to TB on booking, not for an ungrade as we already paid for a deluxe ocean front room, but just for info and understanding. Anyway, the first room was great except for the horrendous noise coming from in a wall in the room and the fact that this wall shook with vibrations. I called reception and they changed us to a room across the way on the same floor (6th). This seemed fine until night fall when the noise started again, and kept me awake. I called for a manager this time and asked for the noise to be investigated, the engineer explained that the extractor fan for the kitchens ran through the walls of both the rooms we had stayed in. This clearly wasn't good enough and I expressed this to the manager so she suggested a smoking suite for us, however on inspecting this room one on the shutters was derailed on the balcony so this wouldn't do either. We finally settled into a great suite on the 6th floor again, we stayed here for nearly two nights. On the second night the bugs in the bed that I had seen the night before reappeared and bit me! These bugs were in the bed, on the bed and there were approx thity of them under a piece of TB paper on the bedside table. We had dismissed the couple of these bugs we had seen the day before as being something that had possibly flew in when the window was open. However the window had not been opened at all the whole day on this day. Again I spoke to a different manager and he settled us into the presidential suite, which was perfect and also offered us dinner for two at the palm terrece restaurant. This is actually my next problem as we paid for the buffet breakfast here everyday of our stay and were disgusted to find that all the food except the covered hot food was uncovered and swarming with flys. On a couple of days TB decided that they could combat this by lighting citronella candles, which were useless. Parking is pretty poor too and if you arrive late at night are faced with parking a good walk away in a dimly lit space. The spa is also very overpriced. The over bath shower area is very poorly lit. Not sure about security - hot tub closes at 11pm - however between 1am and 1.30am a group were using the hot tub and shouting across the resort and was only stopped when I called reception to complain, they then said that they would send security around. GOOD POINTS great location - best hotel friendly and helpful staff nice pools beach was nice, however a little small

Reviews.Title: “Great location but so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: dada1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Turtle Bay Resort on the north shore of Oahu. We had a great time despite the very average hotel. First as has been said by many reviews, the location is absolutely fantastic. Located on the north shore an hour from Honolulu, it is as beautiful a place as anywhere I have been in all the islands. Don't be fooled that Oahu is too crowded etc. Once you leave Waikiki and the city behind, you are in as beautiful an island as any in the state. Back to the hotel, it is a very tired, seventies looking building, made from cinder blocks and is totally without any character whatsoever. The rooms are boring, with only two non descript pieces of artwork over the bed. Guys get a clue, some hawaiiana throughout the hotel might help a little! The bathrooms are motel quality, the tile in the shower /tub combo is painted with pastel green epoxy paint, nice touch! I know they have spent a lot of money on the place in the last couple of years, but I can't figure out where it went. The lobby is huge and vacant, the hallways institutional and everywhere is in need of maintenance. Just look around and there is rusted paint and crud everywhere. Check out the huge picture windows outside of the elevators on each floor, fantastic views of both beaches, that is if you could see through them, I don't think they have been washed in years, gross! The Hang Ten pool bar is a prime example. The bar is without any sense that you are in Hawaii. No palm fronds, Koa wood, music etc. All the bartenders and waitresses are mainlanders, not a local among them. As another reviewer pointed out, they even re-use the plastic food baskets without washing them, which by the way they also serve food in at the Bay Club, nice touch guys. If you go to a similar priced resort such as the Fairmont Orchid on the Big Island, you get a beautiful open pool bar, with sand to wiggle your feet in, tropical feel etc. with locals with a smile on there face, food on plates, with cloth napkins and silverware. And talking about the pool here, you will have it all to yourself! That's because the water is so cold almost nobody will dip their toes in it. That is except the weekends when the pool is overrun with non paying locals and their kids which the hotel seems to feel is fine. Stupid! The management is really dropping the ball big time at this place. The breakfast buffet is ok, but not of the standards at other hotels I have stayed at, I want some lime with my papaya! Lei Leis is a nice restaurant as is Ola's. What's up with the crappy reggae music at Ola's played by two young guys that have written the same song twenty times, when every night there is a great father and son Hawaiian combo playing to nobody in the lobby! Want a massage outside against the ocean? Sure thing, but everyone and their uncle can see you, no privacy whatsoever, and get this, the massage table is at the windiest part of the property, and you get to have a ugly dead, half cut down coconut palm stump right next to you! I have never seen another hotel with dead palm trees. Replace them dammit! Again, the management is braindead here! If it was'nt for the fantastic 5 star location, which is really what you are paying for, I would rate the hotel 2 stars. On the other hand if you want to see Oahu, I can't think of anywhere else I would stay, Honolulu is a zoo! Improvements needed: Lei greeting would be nice at checkin Hawaiana Artwork throughout, especially in the hallways Heat the pool Maintenance needed everywhere Spice up the landscaping with more color Rebuild the pool bar Put loungers on the lawns around the property so people can get some peace and quiet Hire more locals or at least more friendly mainlanders Replace the management!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Resort was truly "Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: JDenise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from six nights at Turtle Bay Resort. I was not sure what to expect, as I had read mixed reviews from "hating it" to "loving it"! We asked friends and acquaintances who had been to Oahu where they suggested we stay, and every answer was "Turtle Bay". Our flight arrived late, so we opted for the first nights' stay closer to the airport in Waikiki. I can truthfully say that had we stayed in Waikiki the entire time, I would have had a miserable time, rather than the wonderful time I experienced at Turtle Bay on the North Shore. Our "ocean view condo" in Waikiki was smaller than our bedroom at home, and the ocean was blocks away. There was not a lot of "lushness" in the skyscrapers, shops and wall to wall people in Waikiki. The beach was crowded, and you could not tell where one hotel started and one hotel ended. It was just a big city and a crowded stretch of beach with no real personality. We left that afternoon for Turtle Bay where we passed through quaint towns and villages, and the further north we got, the more tropical it became. I had read a negative review about all of the signs saying to boycott Turtle Bay due to employee problems, but we passed only one such sign, and we witnessed no evident employee problems during our stay. We pulled into the resort and were greeted by valet help, concierge clerks, bellmen and more! No one seemed unhappy about working there as one review had said. They were all cheerful, helpful, and very pleasant. We arrived at our room which was on the second floor and it did not have as great of a view as I had hoped for. The bellman immediately called the front desk, and they moved us to an upper floor which had a fantastic view of the bay, open ocean, mountains, and pool area....couldn't have been better, with a large balcony to sit out on and relax and take it all in. The room was immaculate, the bathroom was large, and the view was spectacular! There were hiking trails, lush foliage, beautiful beaches, a great snorkeling bay, and just about every amenity you could ask for. The Ola Restaurant on the beach was very good, and after long days of exploring the beaches, and swimming in the pool or the ocean, room service was great to come back to! We travel often and I consider myself "picky". I found Turtlle bay to be a relaxing, beautiful resort that I would recommend to all! We saw huge sea tortoises barely off shore on our daily walks, and we enjoyed watching the surfers from our balcony each evening. Turtle Bay and the North Shore is perfect for those who want to experience the serene beauty of Oahu, rather than the hustle and bustle of just another big city like Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews we thought we knew what to expect, but nature took a lot of the expectation away. We are a middle-aged couple and we spent our honeymoon from april 10 to the 19th at the Turtle Bay. If you had read the papers, the beaches were contaminated around the island because of a sewage spill in Waikiki so we chose not to go in the ocean or eat the seafood. The hotel and our room and bathroom were clean and the staff accomodating. We were surprised to have a very small lanai with one chair outside in what was supposed to be one of the better rooms. And although nice, the room was just nice, a clean place to lay your head and beautiful view of the ocean, but (for the price), inside, nothing overly exceptional. The trails at the hotel were fun, provided a glimpse of a mongoose, a monk seal sunning himself on the beach and yes, sea turtles. We had the buffet breakfast at the Palm Terrace which was 19.95 a piece. The food was good but depending on what you are used to paying for breakfast, we thought kind of high. We also had dinner at Lei Lei's and the staff again were very accomodating and the filet mignon came with a very healthy leafy salad and sliced squash with mashed potatoes or rice. Each dinner ran around 35 dollars plus our drinks. We had drinks at the two outside bars and 21 degrees north, mai tais ran $7 and beer ran $5. We chose the place because we wanted a quiet laid back atomsphere, I don't know if it was the Easter holiday or what, but there were many families with children. No problems, but just not what we expected. We had and would advise a rental car because of the location and worth it to see the island and sights. Overall we enjoyed our visit, the turn-down staff were really accomodating and sweet, the staff in general were friendly. It just was not the resort we were expecting. It was our first visit to Hawaii and we saw an Oahi that is very commercialized and you could sense it, and that part made it somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. It was my 8th time to Hawaii and her 1st. For all the places I researched, it was by far the least expensive. And therefore we got what we expected. There was construction on the property (which I hope is completed by now) the beach was pretty small for the size of the hotel. The food was good enough, and we had no complaints as we are not really picky eaters. The hotel staff was helpful, but not always as nice as we would hope. But since we are explorers and spent most of our trip driving around the island, and into Honolulu, we pretty much used the resort as our 'base' and our place to sleep. We probably would not go back, only because we have been there before and are interested in trying other things.

Reviews.Title: “4 days and all Smiles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are staying at one of the private Ocean Villas that are right next to the Turtle Bay hotel. The villa is fantastic, three bedrooms, full kitchen, private pool, and twenty feet from the public beach on the cove here at Turtle Bay. There is a small rock wall that separates the villas from the beach so our porch is very private. The cove has been great to snorkel in, lots of fish and gentle water. We have eaten at the restaurants at the hotel, all great, Olas is right on the beach right next door. :) The hotel pools are nice too. We have also hiked quite a few miles of the trails here, one follows the shoreline for several miles, great views the entire way. Each day we have taken a short road trip to a local site. The northshore has lots to offer, the Polynescian Cultural Center, Waterfalls, Beach towns, etc. Turtle Bay is wonderful, if you want a place to relax then come here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit”
Reviews.Author: ondrums
Reviews.Content: TURTLE BAY CONDOS, Turtle Bay Oahu, HI We just returned from a week at the Turtle Bay Condos on the North Shore of Oahu. We had a very pleasant stay. The accommodations were very nice. The rates varied depending on the facilities one required. The rental agent was found through ---alohalion---. I would recommend the services, as the location is very serene and is easily accesible to both the windward and leeward shores. We paid 110.00 a night which was very reasonable for a 1 bedroom 1 bath condo. The Turtle Bay resort is within walking distance and has restaurants and very nice beaches. I would highly recommend the Hukilau Cafe and Papa Ole's in Laie, as well as the Polynesian Cultural center. Jamisons's in Haleiwa is another very good retaurant. Oahu is filled with adventures and activities for all ages and interests.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a family of two children (ages 4 and 8 ) The Turtle Bay Resort was a different experience from the other Islands ( we have been to Maui and Waikiki ) but my husband and I wanted to enjoy the North part of Oaho. We all enjoyed the resort. beautiful beaches, nice pools, nice rooms, great service and friendly staff. I recommend anyone staying there to have a car and simply drive to other areas of the Island. Unforunately, the island had more rain than usual but, we all had a great time.Out from the resort, you will find other choices of resturants and beaches that are breath taking and watching the surfers is awsome! I also, prior to going to the resort, read the reviews and I must say that I had to have an open mind about the resort and the North Shore is an experience one must see to appreciate. As a special bonus, you will find incrediable muruals Wyland, an artist, has inside and out on the resort, the sea turtles and Wyland has a gallery in Haleiwa which is a must see. I would go back to the resort again! Pauline Allred

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous2B50
Reviews.Content: This was my 12th visit to Hawaii and I have stayed on all of the islands multiple times. Even though I was attending a medical meeting, I prepaid for the hotel through Costco for a better rate. I would have left after the first day, but since there is nowhere else to stay nearby and my meetings started at 7am every day, we were stuck there. Thank God we had a rental car. We had reserved a Pikake suite and needed 2 beds and were confirmed for that. On arrival, we were told all they had was a suite with a king bed, or they would be happy to charge me $75 more a night to go to a beach cottage as it had 2 beds. I told him to guess again and recheck his rooms, that I should not be charged any more than I was already paying because they did not fulfill the confirmation that they had guaranteed. I had 3 adults and a teen with me, and I was paying too much to have to bring in 2 rollaway beds! When he realized he couldn't cheat me by trying to make me pay more for a cottage, he suddenly found a 2 bed Pikake suite. He still cheated us though as it was a handicapped room with a gross bathroom- very slanted tile floor, only 1 sink, no bathtub. For the price I was paying, I should have had a tub and a shower, and definitely 2 sinks. Th bathroom was VERY worn and dated. They never ran the air conditioning in the hallways to save money. Resort was not grossly dirty, but not sparkling clean either. It is truly showing its age. Spa was just okay and overpriced and small. No ambience. Food was overall good, but quite overpriced, even for Hawaii. Nothing for teens to do there as we were in the middle of nowhere, and even having a rental car, any other activities are nearly a full day trip, which cuts into beach or relaxing by the pool time. Hard to relax outside anyway, due to the extremely small area around the pool for lounge chairs, so of course there were tons of people having to sit on the wet grass (we had soaking rains while there) on towels as there were also not nearly enough lounge chairs for the number of guests. Not to mention constant jackhammers all day long around the pool area replacing a walkway. The Hang Ten bar by the pool was also dirty, and I noticed the waitresses dumping the plastic food baskets that only had paper liners inside the trash cans to empty them, then not cleaning them and reserving these contaminated baskets to new diners who ordered food. All they did was place a new paper liner in them.(Hope the paper was not recycled from ealier diners!) I could go on and on, but it just makes me nauseous. The closest town to the resort, Haleiwa is described as rustic. It is just gross, run down and dirty and so were the restaurants there. The only reason this hotel survives is on conferences and honeymooners and school groups invading the breakfast buffet in the morning. Parking was also a nightmare If this had been my first trip to Hawaii, I would not have known any better, but I am very familiar with all of the islands and this is the worst trip I have ever had there. This is not a 4 or 5 start hotel. It is an average 3

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Go With Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five days at Turtle Bay, booked for seven but left early. Resort is nice, not posh by any means. Beautiful location. Staff friendly, but took two days to fix the air conditioning and they couldn't find a fan. Rooms okay, a sofa would have been handy, shower terrible, double sink area a helpful touch. Trouble is it is isolated with not a lot to do that doesn't cost $$. Expect to spend a lot on meals, you don't have much choice unless you are willing to drive or eat at shrimp carts. Teenagers were bored without much beach action - no good swimming areas right there. Tried surfing lessons $225 for three and instructor was quoted "Don't really know how to tell you to turn, you turn it like a surfboard, dude!" Got better tips from the waiter at Ola's. A good place to go if you like to sit by the pool, read and order drinks - not saying that is bad, but not a good place for active, hungry teens. Parents with small kids would be happy with the pool. Spent the remainder of our stay at the Outrigger in Wakiki, not as pretty but lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lei Leis and the horseback ride”
Reviews.Author: mamarosa
Reviews.Content: We slept to the sounds of the waves crashing against the rocks. Even at night I could see the water which was illuminated by lights provided by the resort. Yes, the resort could do with some upgrading and maintenamce. Compared to the staff at the Moana Surfrider (Waikiki) there could be improvements. That said, our room was large and the staff was polite and unobtrusive. We loved dining at Lei Leis which is not owned by the resort but located on the golf course nearby. The food and sevice were on a par with the best restaurants we have experienced. Try the tuna or steak and any of the appetizers. We ate there most of our stay. We found the food at the resort to be ordinary and expensive. One of our highlights was the horseback ride along the beach. Texas Tim was very informative about the plants and animals we saw and he even took pictures of us so we could be in the same picture.He was fantastic! His talents include birdcall imitations, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When the most you can complain about is the weather, a resort is doing something right. We just spent a week at Turtle Bay with our 2 children 8 and 10. Unfortunatly we almost never saw the sun due to the weather. It has been raining for 3 weeks. Even with overcast / rain we had time to walk the beaches and search for shells, sit by the pool and absorb some rays. The kids could care less about the sun and played in the pool or arcade as much as they could. The food was good. We spent most of our meals at the Palm Grill with a buffet and affordable meals. $10 burger to $27 buffet. Ola's is great by the shore and Lei Lei's was a nice change. Do not forget about the Shrimp trucks! (outside resort)Giovanni's is heaven. 12 Shrimp Scampi, covered in butter and garlic and 2 scoops of rice. YUM $12 per plate. (Shrimp also comes lemon or spicy) Also has hot dogs for the kids. (Out gate turn left go 1-2 miles look for Truck covered in writing on left) The staff was great at Turtle bay, just remember this is Hawaii. HANG LOOSE! I would advise a car to get out some. (less than 1 hour to Honolulu / Pearl Harbor.) Pearl harbor was great, Honolulu was way too crowded / commercial. (They took paradise and put up a parking lot) If you want quiet / quality time with your family you cannot go wrong at Turtle Bay Resort. Ken, Chandler, Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the waves?!”
Reviews.Author: Ratbag
Reviews.Content: Rather bland and anonymous, which was a bit disappointing. The pool bar was great and they have a good cocktail range. The restaurant (21 degrees) was expensive, but worth it for a special occasion, and the service all round was great. The breakfast buffet look good, but we felt a little ignored when we wanted a la carte stuff, although it tasted good when we got it. The room (deluxe ocean front) was pleasant enough, with a comfortable bed and good sheeting, a great bathroom and a nice lanai to sit and watch the waves (although I came here expressly to see big winter waves and saw none!) It was nice to be free of the hustle and crowding of Waikiki/Honolulu, although a little alarming to discover how the management plan to take over virtually the whole of the North Shore. There is a residents' campaign against this, although it seems quite passive so there's no placard-waving protesters although you will see plenty of bumper stickers and signs about the proposed development. I think it would be a shame as it would spoil the character of the North Shore and quite frankly the infrastructure would need blowing away and starting from scratch! The main road is only 1 lane in either direction and floods out in heavy rain. All in all a generally OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “March Trip to North Shore”
Reviews.Author: KBrooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for 5 nights. I had read all the reviews before going and looked at their website extensively. We were happy with our decision. We enjoyed staying on the North Shore away from busy Waikiki. This is the only hotel on the North Shore. The lobby is awesome...full view of the beach as you check in. Our room was nice and BIG! We had an amazing ocean view of Turtle Bay. The decor was nice, the bathroom was big and the bed was comfy! We spent a lot of time around the hotel. We ate dinner at Lei Lei's and the new Ola on the beach...both were excellent! We had dinner in our room one night because it was pouring rain and it was good! We also had the Island buffet one night and it was also good. We spent time at the pool...you can sit next to the pool, watch people surf and drink a Mai Tai all at the same time. It is pretty windy though. The Hang Ten bar at the pool was a lot of fun and the drinks were price well ($4 beer, $7 Mai Tai's). Breakfast at the hotel was not the greatest...so we ate at local places like Ted's Bakery and Kona's in Haliewa....yum! Also the Bay Club isn't that great to eat at. The hotel was doing construction on some of the walk ways updating the paving to flagstone...it was a little annoying, but it will look better when they are done. We used the fitness center and it was nice. They had just the right equipment and it even had an ocean view. you can sit on the terrace outside the gym and exercise as well. We used the trails on the large property and walked out to the bays and through the jungles where LOST is filmed...it was nice to walk forver and not be surrounded by other hotels. You can also go to the beach and the hotel provides snorkel equipment...but due to all the rain we had, we didn't get to. I would stay there again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: SierraMadreMember
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to this resort in five years and not much change in that time, resort is in need of upgrades to justity price. however, the north shore is great, the golf is great, the beach is great and our dealings with the employees was great. enjoyed the new choices in resturants and bars on the property. didnt like seeing the recent developments of new housing/condos and more plans for expansion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time there.Stayed 7 days. The protected cove (Turtle Bay) has nice for swimming and snokling even when there were big waves.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Disgruntled”
Reviews.Author: DMNWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before attending a convention in Waikiki. We have a mixed review and were fairly disappointed with several aspects of the hotel. First, the Good parts: The setting is spectacular! The views are amazing and there is plenty of access to the beach. Nearly every room must have a great view. We got an Ocean Front Deluxe and got a great rate on Expedia (even when the hotel said it was completely full). The sound of the waves crashing was so loud that we couldn't hear the TV if the door was open. The hiking trails are great and take you to secluded beaches where you can swim, kayak, or sun bathe. The daily resort fee of $15 includes parking, one hour on the tennis courts, an hour of snorkeling, and other extras. The food at the Palm Terrace was very good and inexpensive. The food and service at Ola was exceptional (possibly because it is not affiliated with the hotel). There are also several other great places to eat in Haleiwa. You don't have to spend much money on food, unless you want to. Now, the Bad parts: This hotel is OLD and DATED! Although the room had new paint, carpet, and linens, the bathroom was really old and dark and a little creepy. The room also looked worn and the doors actually had rust showing on them. There isn't much furniture in the room so there are lots of empty spaces. Someone else referred to it as "the bowling alley," we thought it was "room enough for square dancing." The resort itself doesn't look well maintained and the whole place just felt a bit dirty and unkempt. We saw alot of trash all over the property - in the hallways, outside, on the hiking trails, in the common areas - and it remained there day after day after day. The worst part was the fitness center that was just a big joke. It might have been okay for a moderate hotel in a city, but not for a "luxury resort." There wasn't much equipment, it was shoved in a small room, it wasn't clean, and it was very obvious that no one maintained it. There were only two treadmills and one was broken the entire 5 days we were there. The two elliptical trainers squeaked and rattled, but we didn't dare say anything about them or they'd slap an "Out of Order" sign on those too. There also wasn't any disinfectant to clean the machines. The bottle was empty. When I asked for them to refill it, I got several nasty glares from the employees who disappeared and never returned. The next day, the bottle was half full - with straight rubbing alcohol! The weight machines were rusty and didn't move well so we didn't bother. The equipment just wasn't safe to use. Now, for the Disgruntled part: I read the reviews from several months ago when making our reservations and saw something about "labor disputes" and problems with employees. Since they appeared to be resolved, we decided to stay there. Based on our experience, the disputes are NOT resolved and there is a definite tension here. You can feel it. Although we had very good service at Palm Terrace and at the hut where you rent snorkles, the other employees were not pleasant and definitely did not go out of their way to be pleasant or helpful. They are definitely unhappy and I think you have to ask why. The waitresses at Palm Terrace were wearing red buttons that said "Unified" which apparently refers to the labor squabbles. These buttons matched red signs we saw posted on the way there that said "Boycott Turtle Bay Resort." I also saw "trash" on the beach that was actually a couple fliers telling people to boycott Turtle Bay. I didn't read all the details, but saw one statement that said they'd only received 70 cents in raises in the last 10 years. The whole situation made us feel a bit unsettled and interfered with our enjoyment of the resort. It was a marked contrast from our stay at the Hapuna Beach Prince Resort on the Big Island in September. At that resort, the employees love their jobs and go out of their way to be pleasant, helpful, and accommodating. Bottom line: We were glad we went to the North Shore. It is beautiful and restful and totally unlike Honolulu and Waikiki. However, the lack of maintenance and the labor unrest here will keep us from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Cats!, I want to go again and again”
Reviews.Author: danaucpe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the Beach cottages. It was awesome! Morning walks along the beach, great fresh breakfast. Free scuba introduction on Tues and Fridays, Surfing lessons, Cottage Concierge. The list of good things just goes on and on. I have never had so much fun at a beach vacation. If you love the night life, this may not be your place, but if you just want a beautiful place to get away to, than you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: trvlNstyle
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a short getaway from the west coast and did not want to have to connect to another island so Oahu was our only choice. We did not want to stay in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Turtle Bay was the perfect choice. The resort is exceptionally clean and well maintained and everyone we came in contact with was incredibly friendly. We were only there for two dinners and ate at 28 degrees north which was good and at Ola's (adjacent to the hotel) which was outstanding. The beach is not spectacular but you can walk on their hiking trails to some nicer locations. The pool was nice but cold. Rooms were clean and modern but the bathrooms could use an update. Linens were decent (nice duvets but just average sheets). While there we got massages at the spa which were great, took surfing lessons and went horseback riding and enjoyed all of them. I highly recommend Turtle Bay as a getaway for a few days. Any longer and I might consider going to another island.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: LisaF0401
Reviews.Content: WE just loved Turtle Bay. Went with our children ages 7 and 10 and found it to be the best part of our recent Hawaii vacation. Sadly, we only stayed one night. We wished that we had stayed longer. The pools are wonderful, staff is terrific and the beaches are beautiful. Well worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: clane200
Reviews.Content: Located on the North Shore away from the crowds. As allready stated a rental car is a must. We could make the trip to Honolulu in about 35 minutes. We didn't eat in the restaurants much as they were a little to pricey for us. I recommend trying a meal at one of the road side shrimp vans. Also 1 trip to the Flea Market at the Stadium in Honolulu is the most reasonable prices to get t-shirts and other Hawaii items. I recommend a 1 day trip to Waikiki and the outdoor market across the street. Take another day to see Pearl Harbor and visit the Dole Plantation on the return to Turtle Bay(you drive right by it.) We also went to Diamond Head, which is an extinct volcano in Honolulu. Be warned it is a good 1 hour hike and about 15 minutes is pretty steep. But it is the most beautiful view on the island when you get to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There ie not much to say. It is one of the most beautiful hotels and locations I have ever been to. The rooms were very nice, clean and big. The views are unbelievable. We slept with the door open so we could hear the ocean. Make sure you have a car, and make sure you go to the Turtle bay at some point. After 5 days on Waikiki, this is the way to end your Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love the cottages”
Reviews.Author: dorian10
Reviews.Content: My family wife and two kids stayed at the cottages for three nights,the day after christmas. We usually stay at 5 star hotels. This was a 4 star, but it is my kids new favortie. The cottages are 6 stars, they are beatiful, great beds, views, baths, etc. There was a hammock avail. for use in the oceanview greenbelt by the cottages, we used it every day. There is limited choices for food, but they just opened "Ola's"on Dec 1 which is on the bay side of the hotel. Ola's in on the sand, no walls, just beatifull, we ate there everynight. The hotel needs to be updated, pool, resturants, bars, to be considered a 5 star. That said, the physical location of the proerty is unmatched in natural beauty! We will stay here agian, only in the cottages!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews on Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore, we were slightly anxious about spending our Christmas break there. But, from the minute we arrived until we checked out, we were treated like kings! The sixth floor room was lovely, the sound of the surf was fantastic, the view was great. The grouds were gorgeous-- several hiking trails, nice beaches, pools were super, and not super crowded. We ate daily at the Palm Terrace Restaurant for breakfast-- only one grouchy waitress on one day. The buffet was adequate, chefs were all very accomodating. We dined one evening at Lei Lei's at the golf course-- had the best ahi caesar salad ever! The location is remote-- you need to have a rental car. The Polynesian Cultural Center is a few miles away. Several small "towns" are within a few miles as well. The surrounding beaches are great-- only a few miles to the Bonzai Pipeline, Sunset Beach, Waimea Bay, but be sure to have a rental car. Overall, an excellent vacation. It is pricey, but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Beach Cottage”
Reviews.Author: MaryinPgh
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Halekulani for the first part of our vacation, we moved over to the Northshore and stayed at Turtle Bay Resort from 10/4/05 to 10/7/05. This side of Oahu is one not to be missed! It was beautiful and exactly what you picture Hawaii to be - not the sidewalks full of shops/people like in Waikiki. It took a little getting used to the staff here - not that they weren't friendly - it just wasn't the treatment we had just experienced at the Halekulani. We stayed in one of the Beach Cottages and if you can afford it - DO IT!! They are incredible and the cottages have a "cottage concierge" who greated us with refreshments and other goodies and checked on us during our stay. Our cottage was ocean front and after watching the sunsets from our private lanai - it just doesn't get much better. The negative to this hotel (which is also the best thing) is the location - not many places to eat and the hotel food isn't that great (except for coffee and scones from the coffee cart - the woman who runs the cart is a delight and made the best lattes!) - so we ate at a shrimp truck (fun) and in Haleiwa for lunch/dinners. If you want to experience what Hawaii should be, visit the Northshore and stay at the cottages at Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had a dream wedding and better expected honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at TB early (long town car ride from the airport - but our driver was exceptional! We were married on October 20, 2005 at Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore of Hawaii! It was a one hour ride from the airport in Honolulu, and well worth it. We stayed in their beach cottages and had a stunning (oh my god! type stunning room) with a 4 poster bed, mahogany floors w/ a step down sitting area, a great bath and sliding doors that opened right on to the spectacular beach/ocean area. It’s near the surfer’s pipeline and people came from everywhere to see the waves. The hotel offered a concierge service - and that's what put our wedding over the top. An incredible guy name Terry and his team helped us w/ our plans and made the entire experience incredible! It was truly a dream come true and then some! We had a delightful and colorful pastor that you will see in the photos- Pastor Ron. He advised us every step of the way - and gave us Jim Creed's name -our photographer - He did an exceptional job. Our wedding started at 3:30 and Jim stayed with us thru sunset and dusk (which you will see). We scouted out a wedding site about 20 mins from the hotel (by way of golf carts and horse paths). It had every glorious exposure imaginable. I had my own transportation (a 2nd golf cart and driver), and actually kept my wedding dress hidden from Jay until the ceremony started. Thru all of their efforts and these wonderful photos - we can share our day with you and keep it vivid forever! We stayed at Turtle Bay 6 nites and moved to Kahala Mandarin Oriental for our last 2. That was a nice change- but I am so glad our wedding was at TB! The last photos are of an area used in the filming of Lost- It made for an exceptional finale! We were truly blessed! FYI___________________________________________________ Photos of our wedding are finally on-line IF YOU HAVE ANY DESIRE TO SEE THEM???Please go to www.pictage.com you will need to enter our event name EXACTLY like this Jill and Jay's Wedding (you may want to copy it right from here - to sunset in to the box on their web page). You will have to register w/ them - but there is not much info they require- name, email, etc. I edited the 123 total photos and you can now view 44 we picked to show a capsule of our Wedding. Once it opens our "folder" page - Please click the spot where it says "wedding open this folder" to view the 44. It is toward the right hand side- ______________________________________________________ The entire staff cared every step of the way and felt soooo special and important (which you should for you wedding) and I can only recommend it 3000%! We could not have had anything better! This place is there for service and quaility and we LOVE THEM AND WANT TO GO BACK BAD!!! TB WE MISS YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Real hawaii and True aloha........Stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adampsy
Reviews.Content: After spending several months looking at reviews and wondering where to stay......and for how long.....we chose Turtle Bay to begin our honeymoon. The place is downright breathtaking. The whole region (north shore) is a gorgeous, wilderness filled area that just can't be found in other regions of oahu and as we found later, not in maui either. The rooms are nice, clean, and offer a heavenly view. The location is perfect if you want to get out of normal civilization and hustle and bustle. There are plenty of places to eat within 20-30 minutes and the 21 degrees north resteraunt at the hotel is top-notch. service was great as well. If you're seeking somewhere very nice, yet not pretentious and tourist ridden, this is it folks. A magical place with a heavenly vibe; give it a shot. Nothing like waking up to the waves crashing below the rooms, sipping some coffee........then driving 10 mintues down the road to watch surfers at Bonzai pipeline! a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “How could you not love it here?”
Reviews.Author: MZR
Reviews.Content: Completely enjoyed our Mid-November stay. Entire staff was most pleasant, with special props going to the surfing instructors (way cute too!) and the snorkeling attendant. At check-in we were upgraded from an ocean front to a deluxe ocean front room, but really the only difference is the balcony size and view. But every room has a great view so there's no reason to complain no matter where you're placed. Slept with the balcony (lanai) doors open and listened to the waves crashing all night long - so loud (in a good way) it was like thunder. The quantity of food at the Palm Terrace breakfast buffet was plentiful, but the quality was hit and miss. Most of the prepared foods were just average but the to-order omelets were great. Clientele was a really great mix of folk - retirees, families with kids, newlyweds, singles, a few gay couples - all seemed to enjoy themselves as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, serene and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visit Hawaii 2 to 3 times per year and have family that lives there. We have stayed in numerous locations on most of the islands in Hawaii. Our recent stay in the cabins at Turtle Bay Resort can only be described as extraordinary. At check-in we were given a room different than what we had reserved but that situation was remedied early the following morning. The cabin we stayed in was spectacular. The furnishings were beautiful, the view was awesome, and the service was wonderful. The beaches and resort grounds were great. The restaurants and other amenities at the hotel were excellent, especially the surf school! I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to get away from the frenzy that is Waikiki. I have stayed at other resorts on Oahu, and while they are nice, I am looking forward to staying at Turtle Bay again in the future. The individuals that give this resort a bad review appear to want the big hotel hustle and bustle, not the quiet and slow pace that occurs on the north shore of Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Not everything was working”
Reviews.Author: emeril
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay in Nov. The resort is pretty, restaurants good, staff friendly; however, the heated pool was not heated and one of the whirlpools was not working. As the hotel was crowded the 1 working whirlpool was always full of children.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: nonamenoplace
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to the islands and don't have to go to Oahu, skip Turtle Bay Resort. It's a nice change of pace from Waikiki, but you'll have a much better Hawaiian experience if you go to a resort on another island. The service left a lot to be desired. Check-in staff were down right cool. Supposedly we were to get a map of the sprawling complex with our room keys. Two visits to the lobby and a phone call (where I was repeatedly asked, didn't you get one when you checked in?) later, we hurried down to the concierge who said he 'thought' he had an extra and that he was getting ready to close up. It was like the managers were away, and no one cared. Lei Lei's at the golf course is the way to go for lunch and dinner at the resort. At the hotel: Would you like a wine list? Here's the dessert list. The menus were worse for wear, with rips and tears. It was off putting. The location and scenery makes up for a multitude of problems. The furnishings are awfully spare. I'm okay with that, but you have to make sure the existing furniture isn't scratched up, the walls aren't marked, and the carpet is installed correctly. The hallway lighting was very institutional-the national parks do a better job at their hotels. Ted's Bakery is a good spot for local-style breakfast and lunch, and is the closest eatery outside the resort, heading west. Romy's has great shrimp - don't bother eating anywhere else before you hit this place heading south.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unimpressed...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly unimpressed with the TB Resort. The entire resort is dated, the dining and bar options are limited and way overpriced ($6 for a boiled hot dog at the pool bar), and there is simply not much to do there. The beaches are truly beautiful there to look at but it is near impossible to swim or snorkel because of the constant wind and rough surf. One bright spot was the Palmer golf course at the resort as it was top notch. We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua on Maui which was absolutely wonderful so coming to TB was a big letdown.
