We were so tired of TB after 3 days we cancelled the rest of our stay there and drove to the J.W. Marriott at Ko'Olina (about and hour away in West Maui) for the remainder of our trip. I highly recommed it as it is sunny and dry all the time and the resort is excellent. If you want to see the North Shore for a day trip I would say stay at Turtle Bay for maybe one or two nights. I would highly recommend not planning your entire trip around TB.

Reviews.Title: “Devilish beds”
Reviews.Author: hawaii98
Reviews.Content: I made reservations with some hesitation due to the posted reviews. However we had stayed at the Turtle Bay when it was still a Hilton and knew the location was gorgeous. Figured since it had had an expensive renovation and the rates had tripled that it must be nice. The location is still gorgeous, but these beds were horrible. I sat down on the bed not long after I entered the room, and it sounded like a spring popped and was horribly uncomfortable. It was even worse when I lay on it. Tried the other bed in the room and it was equally uncomfortable. Called down to the front desk and they sent a bellman up with a key so I could "try another room". Those beds were just as unacceptable. Went down to talk to the manager who was totally unconcerned about my complaints. I asked her whether these were unremodeled rooms and she told me the beds in all the rooms were the same (so why the guise of sending me to another room to check out the beds?) She did assure me that if I checked out I would not be charged. Luckily we found a room elsewhere for the night so I checked out. We have never had to check out of a hotel, let alone due to poor bedding. Noticed as I was waiting for our car that the large floral display in the lobby was in sad need of replacement; lots of dead and browned flowers in it. This was not the way to start our vacation and definitely not an upscale resort.

Reviews.Title: “No better resort view!”
Reviews.Author: daPro
Reviews.Content: Great location on the North Shore. Each room has a wonderful view, although the rooms are just above average. You have the standard coffee pot, fridge, iron/board, etc. The great thing about this place is that it is a RESORT. You never have to leave the property unless you want to sight see...the resturants (they have 4 or 5) are all above average on quality of food, but just a tad pricey for what you get. There is a Tiki bar at the pool which is nice as they serve lunch as well. The Buffet inside is pretty good but gets old. Latitude 21 is an excellent choice for a romantic evening without the kids and they have a sports type bar as well that opens in the evening. The pool area is very large with a water slide area for kids and hot tub for adults. Best place on Oahu for sunsets!! My wife and I were there for 5days/4 nights and loved it. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best resort that we stayed in ever. I never felt so pampered at any resort until I set foot at Turtle Bay Resort. The staff was so friendly and earger to please us. The landscape is just breath taking. If you are looking for a secluded romantic resort that is away from the hustle and bustle of Downtown Honolulu...this is it. This resort has so much to offer that you may not even want to leave the resort. The rooms are emaculate. The resturants are very elegant. They are a bit pricey but well worth the money. The golf courses are a golfers dream. You may just catch glimpses of some celebrity Pros honing their game while you are chowing some delicious drinks and dishes at Lei Lei's bar and Grill. Lei Lei's had some fairly resonable prices compared to the other resturants at the resort. Ohhhhhhhhh, and the Spa was excellent. We also met up with this really cool local (Turtle Bay staff member) that worked in the mini Mall there at the resort named Denise who treated us like family. I could go on for hours about this place. If you ever go to Oahu, you absolutely have to stay at Turtle Bay. You will not want to leave this place.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: anono
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the turtle bay resort with 3 kids, 9,7 and 2 and booked the ilima suite as we were told we couldn't be garanteed of 2 ajoining rooms. We paid $750 US dollars and found the accomodation very average. We were told their would be a kitchenette which I required for my kids, upon arrival the kitchenette consisted of only a sink and empty cupboards-no micowave, cups, spoons, plates or even a kettle to boil water! They charged us $10 us p/n for the microwave but couldn't find a microwavable dish to give us. When we requested for some cutlery we the staff suggested going to foodland to purchase what we needed. The staff were very snooty and unfriendly towards kids. I would definetly not recommend this resort for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Oahu- lukewarm on Estates @ Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Estates at Turtle Bay on the North Shore for one week. First trip to Oahu. We had read a fair number of reviews and were trepidacious about our accomodations since many of them had very bad experiences with the living conditions. Our unit was Kuilima Estates West. The grounds are gorgeous, meticiulously maintained, lush and flowering. It is just down a paved road from Turtle Bay Resorts which has beach access. Braced for the worst with our condo, we were actually quite surprised. It had a fully furnished kitchen which saved us a lot on meals. The main bedroom was the only one with a small AC unit and the loft was uncomfortably warm at night. But it was quiet and peaceful. Not too far from Sunset Beach and other destinations. Our only complaint was upon arrival there was only one clean towel for our party of four. We arrived on a Sunday of a holiday weekend and no one was available on the grounds to assist us and the off-site office was closed. We found our towels wet and in the washer. The floors were grimy and had to be mopped on the first day, the VCR was broken as was the clock in the kitchen and the screen door to the lanai was broken and off the tracks. The showers ran cold on a consistent basis. The porch light was also broken which made it dangerous at night in the rain, not to mention unsettling because the grounds are not well lit. Upon contacting the management (about 20 min up the road) we found them less than helpful and unpologetic when we explained the problem. She grudgingly gave us more laundry detergent (said we were responsible to buy more) to wash the towels but offered no apology and blamed us for not calling the office. Frustrating. Overall, we thorougly enjoyed the convenience of our condo which included kitchen, W/D, sofa, etc. - a quiet, homey place to get away from the hustle of Waikiki and day-tripping. Oahu is absolutely breath-taking. If not for the inept management and maintenence on the condo, I would highly recommend staying on the North Shore if you want a feel of the small community. The Estates offer plenty of touristy attractions as well including restaurants on the grounds and gift shops. I'd suggest a different management company though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Turtle Bay Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is absolutely beautiful! The most beautiful place that I have ever been. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are clean and comfortable. I was lucky enough to be married and have my honeymoon there at the resort and it was more than I ever imagined. We are planning on visiting again and often.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Secluded Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This beach is hidden behind the resort, most tourists don’t know about the PUBLIC beach. It was beautiful; white sand, blue and turquoise water, fantastic waves, warm water, palm trees and even grass if you don’t like sand. I was surprised how few people were at this beach it was by far my favorite beach we visited.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Wismergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort in mid-July and absolutely loved the place! I took my kids there to attend the Pacific Rim Children's Chorus Festival and was amazed that even with over 300 kids the hotel did not seem crowded. The huge lobby which overlooks a beautiful beach with clear blue water was awesome. The kids particularly enjoyed the pools & waterslide. They had so much fun climbing atop a small hill and slid down the waterslide to the beautifully-landscaped man-made lagoon. The main pool was great too, it's right beside the ocean. What a view! The room was very spacious and clean, the ocean view with palm trees was amazing. It's a pity that the food was only average. The Resort lies in the northern tip of Oahu & it took us over an hour to drive from Honolulu. Without a car it's just impossible to move around. The spectacular & famous Polynesian Centre was nearby (about 15 min. drive) and the villages & the night show were well-worth visiting. If you don't like the hustle & bustle in Honolulu, the Turtle Bay Resort is definitely a most relaxing place to spend your vacation. Otherwise, you'll find it quite monotonous.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jeff liddicote
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent 8 days in mid September and it was excellent. Great views, excellent service, good food and drink, lots of golf on two great courses, pool and bar fun, hardly a crowd except for Friday and Saturday. The Polynesian Cultural Center just a few minutes away was the highlight of our trip...the Arizona and tour of the Big Mo running a close second. The hotel folks very helpful and great source of information for finding the less traveled sites. The surf was up and many surfers putting on a show. Rooms very nice, cleaned promptly. I'm going again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful North Shore”
Reviews.Author: Dianachka
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our 8 day trip to Oahu (September 17 – September 25) and here are my thoughts based on previous reviews of this resort and our own impressions: 1.Location - Some of the reviewers complain that Turtle Bay is located in the middle of nowhere and while it is located 1 hour away from Waikiki I would not call it “In the middle of nowhere” Turtle bay Resort is surrounded by the most beautiful beaches and scenic roads on Oahu. If you enjoy snorkeling you simply can’t do better then Shark’s Cove (5 min away). Hanauma Bay (an hour and a half away) is listed as a great snorkeling spot but 20 million tourist all trying to snorkel at the same time make for not so great snorkeling so save yourself the $5 entrance and go to Shark’s cove. 2.Hotel’s Beach – Yep it’s true the beach is not that great but other beautiful beaches are only a minute drive away. Why would anyone insist on the very crowded and noisy Waikiki is beyond me. 3.Services – Most people were friendly and we got upgraded to a deluxe ocean front room. The only time I experienced problems was by the pool area. We ordered MaiTais and the waitress took awhile to bring them…. 4. Food – Food is not bad at all at this Resort with the exception of Palm Terrace…stay away from $20pp breakfast buffet there. Rosie’s Cantina in Haleiwa is so much better and cheaper. After exploring the island for a few days me and my boyfriend both agreed that there is no need to leave the North Shore it has everything you need for a perfect island getaway and nothing you don’t ( lot’s of tourists, malls, and everything you can find on the mainland!) I will happily recommend this resort to anyone going to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit and We Are Planning Third”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Turtle bay twice. The first was May of 04 and just recently 09/07/05 - 09/16/05 and we are planning third for next February for our anniversary. We have also stayed in Waikiki at the Sheraton and loved that hotel also but the TB is fabulous. Let’s start with the drive to the TB. It is wonderful. As you drive down the Kam Hwy through the middle of the island you pass valleys and view rainbows and homes on the mountain sides. One word: Gorgeous! As you drive you enter miles of pineapple fields. Again beautiful views. You pass the Dole Plantation. I recommend a visit there just for the experience. The maze was fun and the Koi pond is great. After passing the Plantation you come to a fork in the road and you have to turn left to go towards Hale'iwa. As you go into your turn you drive up a hill and as you crest the top pull over there is a spectacular view of the ocean. As you drive past Hale'iwa there is a beach just past the turn off on your left. Park your car on the right side of the hwy. (You will know you are there because there are cows in a field usually.) I recommend time near sunset. My wife and I sat there taking pictures and watching the turtles come to shore. As you leave Hale'iwa you will pass the North Shore beaches and then there is a sharp left turn. To the right of the turn is Waimea Valley and Falls. Recommend two hours spent wondering. The TB it self: As you turn off the road and enter the resort you will notice how beautiful and well the lawn and shrubs are maintained. The lady at the gate just asked my name and said to enjoy our stay. From that point on she always greeted us by our names whenever she saw us. Parking was fine. You have to consider you are on a resort and other people stay there also. The lobby is huge and beautiful with a huge glass wall facing the ocean with comfy couches. The front desk staff was courteous and new our names and greeted us with the Aloha Spirit. The staff was courteous and seemed genuinely happy see to us. We had a deluxe ocean front room. The room was clean and up to date. The lanai was large enough for us to have two chairs and sit and watch the waves. The bathroom was clean and mold free. Our room was always cleaned by 5 PM everyday. Perhaps it was because we tipped the house staff $5.00 a day or maybe not. I called and asked for more towels on our third night there and maid was there in 10 minutes. Again I tipped $5.00. Wow $5.00. Big deal. I recommend drinks at the pool in the evening. The bartender was great. I also recommend you and your loved one go to the beach at night and sit in one of the cabaña chairs and just sit with each other watching the ocean at night. But be careful walking back to the hotel because of the little sands crabs. My wife is afraid of small crawly things. Shocker it is a beach and there were crabs. We ate every morning at the Palm Terrace. The buffet was included with our room. Service was great. The food was great. Loved the omelets. Again $5.00 or $10.00 tip works wonders sometimes. Think people. We recommend getting a map and doing the tours yourself. Do not take an organized tour unless it is the Shark Dive in Hale'iwa. You will save a bunch of cash. Example: Drive to Pearl Harbor and parking is the only thing you pay. You have a car anyway so use it. Another example when we went to Waimea Valley and Falls the tour would have cost us $60.00. We drove and parked and it cost $18.00. Here is a shocker people prices of everything there, food, gas, restaurants, etc. are the same there as in most of states. We live in Northern Virginia 20 miles from Washington DC and found prices the same or cheaper than here where we live. Restaurants we recommend: Pizza Bob's great deals and great food. The Crouching Lion on the Windward side of the island. The Hanohano Room at the Sheraton Waikiki. Make sure you go at sunset and watch the sun set against Diamond Head. The House Without a Key at the Halekulani lunches were expensive but hey you are on vacation. Take an afternoon or morning and walk Waikiki and people watch. Browse and shop. The main thing is you are in Hawaii. Enjoy it. Experience it. Love it! There is so much to do. The North Shore Shark Dive $120.00-The Valley of The Temple $4.00-The Punch Bowl National Cemetery Free-Waikiki Aquarium $12.00-The Bishop Museum $36.00-Queen Emma's Summer Palace $10.00-Pearl Harbor Free-Finally just drive around and enjoy! If you have any questions that you would like to ask me about Oahu please free to E-mail me @ mrtwill3@aol.com and I will answer. Aloha and have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “don't worry, you'll be happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my Hawaiian honeymoon and we spent five days at Turtle Bay Resort. Like most of you out there, after I booked I read many negative reviews over the six months prior to my departure and I became quite worried that I had made a mistake. As it turns out, it was not a mistake at all. Turtle Bay Resort has a fantastic location on the North Shore. We checked in 3 hours early and then went for a walk to familiarize ourselves with the resort, when we returned there was a bottle of chanpagne on ice in our room which was a nice touch. The Room: Our room was an ocean front deluxe. It was big with a large lanai and a big comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was also large. The safe is a great addition to the room and is included in your resort fee. The room comes with a small fridge which is great to hold a few beers, orange juice, etc. The maids do a great job on a daily basis. The Pool Area: I disagree with those who say the large pool is too cold. It is perfect as far as I am concerned...a little warm according to my wife. It is not crowded, but then again we were there in low season. The hang ten pool bar is great with very friendly bartenders. I found the wait staff around the pool to be a little slow, but they were friendly. The smaller pool is warmer and great for a dip in the evening when the slide is closed and the air is a little cooler. The Food: We found the food to be good but a little overpriced. The Palm Terrace was ok and I reccommend ordering off the menu for breakfast instead of the buffet. The food at 21 degrees is quite good but way overpriced. Go there once if you must and sit outside and watch the sunset and the surfers. As many people have mentioned before me, Lei Lei's is where you want to eat the majority of your meals at the resort. Good service, good food, great fish.....and yes, a little overpriced. Activities: For those who say that Turtle Bay does not have enough for you to do, I disagree and suggest you go to Disney World if you feel that is the case. We had no problem filling our five days with different and fun activities. The tennis was free every day for an hour, I golfed, she spent time at the spa, horseback riding, hiking, swimming and sitting on our balcony with a bottle of wine watching the sunsets...we were exhausted after each day. Final comments: I would recommend Turtle Bay to anyone, but especially honeymooners. It is a little quieter than most resorts but that is part of its charm. As far as the service goes, we were quite happy with all the staff. Don't worry, you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED TURTLEBAY”
Reviews.Author: don_anneCapeCoralFl
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay at turtle bay,pools and pool bar are excellent, nice restaurants, lobby view is spectacular with entertainment,the resort is quiet and relaxing-this is truely hawaii at its best-room view was excellent and staff very nice-will recommend this hotel to all we meet

Reviews.Title: “Completely different side to Oahu”
Reviews.Author: seasue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the condos at Turtle Bay for a week. We had a two bedroom/two bath condo overlooking the golf course. We walked to the cove on the right of the resort every day for great swimming and enjoyed the use of the lounge chairs. There was also plenty of shade from the palm trees. We saw turtles in the cove one day while we were swimming and the rest of the week we saw them on the left side were it's more rocky. We had pizza one night at the Bay Club which had live music and good service. Another night we had the buffet at the Palm Terrace and our teenage son loved it, but we thought it was overpriced for the quality of food. Our best meal was a Lei Lei's at the golf club. Service, food and the setting were fabulous. Haleiwa had some good restaurants as well: we liked Cholo's, Pizza Bob's and Joe's. We also enjoyed shaved ice with ice cream at Matsumotos and Aoki's (didn't see a difference between them). I would highly recommend a visit to the Waimea Audobon Park. It's well worth the $8 admission to see such beautiful plants and flowers and well as the waterfall (which you can swim in, but we chose not to).

Reviews.Title: “True Hawai'i...”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Turtle bay and we loved it. They have a sign on the resort that sayes "true Hawai'i" and I would agree. It is not a busy resort, with lots of action and crowded pool or beach. Just come and enjoy weather and views and relax. We found a deal through costco travel for a 5 night vacation with Air and Car. You will need a car in this location. Would be great if you can get a deal that included breakfast each morning, because there are not a lot of options close by and then you don't have to worry about spending the $20+ on the breakfast buffet. We were treated very nicely during our stay and did see any signs of the "labor" issues that other reviewers discussed. Only thing was a few of the "Palm Terrace" restuarant worker did wear a "settle now" button. They seem to be the least pleasant of the employees. We had an OceanFront, small Lanai, room, which had 2 Queen beds. The room was very nice with down covers and pillows. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was large, with a dressing room that included a large closet (could store all your luggage away in there), Table with coffee maker, Fridge, Sink and vanity. Then another room with Toilet, Sink and Shower/Tub. The soaps were premimum and had a nice scent. This made it easy for someone to get ready in the morning , while someone else had to use the shower or toilet. The Lanai was very small with room only for 1 Chair. But we rarely spent time in the room and when we did, we had the door open so we all could enjoy the view and sound of the ocean. For several days we could see Turtles in the water right outside our window, but when the surf picked up, then the water became less clear and we could not see the turtles. So yes, turtles do exist there. The pool area was very nice, with a large pool (cool water) (went from 3 to 11 feet). It had a good view of the ocean and the surf. You could watch surfers from the bar or large pool area. Then another smaller pool area that was about 4 feet (warmer water) with a waterfall and a slide that the kids loved. They also had a small hot tub, that could hold about 3 couples. The pool area was never busy and the bar staff does not come around bugging you too much as a matter of fact, they tend to forget about bringing you the bill, but they will call your room and ask you to come and sign for the bill later. We only ate a few places, your choices are limited in this area Hang Ten (good Fish Tacos) Palm Terrace (not that good, only there for breakfast and Lunch a few times. Not a resort quality restuarant) Shrimp stand outside the turtle bay gate (excellent, coconut shrimp and the lemon pepper shrimp). $11 for a good size plate of shrimp, rice, salad. Lei Lei - Good and much better dinner menu than Palm Terrace. Very limited menu for Breakfast (3 items - French toast, fruit plate and Egg sandwich). Limited lunch menu Papa ole's for breakfast - just on the southside of Poly Cultural center in a strip mall. Good quality and value. Cheeseburger in paradise - Cheeseburgers work in this chain. Very busy We were hungery and down on the strip. We did look for a luau and missed the one at the resort. It is only offered on Friday nights. Really did not want to go to Polynesian Cultural Center, because of some of the poor reviews I had read online and was not in givening out a hugh amount of money to a church run estabishment (LDS). Every other Luau was so far away and would require at least 45 minutes of driving. We finally elected to go to the PCC for their twilight Alai Luau. This would be our 4th Luau in the past 10 years. It was very good and the Luau was short and Dinner well run. Now as far as the food goes, it is like every other Luau I have been to and maybe just not as much Poi or raw fish, but they know the average tourist will only just taste these items. Nothing really special about the food, except the staff was on top of things in the buffet line. Nothing was ever empty and the area was kept clean after each set of guests when through the line. They offered the same corney jokes and same "family" atmosphere, just without the drinks and sexual humor. The Luau is only about 1.5 hours with Dinner. Then you can go to the evening show, which has more of the performances you are use to an a Luau only with better view. This was a good show of what we saw, we had to leave after intermission. If you want a relaxing and non stressed time and a "True Hawai'i" choose Turtle bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for golfers or surfers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well its a nice quiet place for relaxing. Its more for surfers, golfers or lonely quiet times. Its a clean hotel with nice decor and style. But its not for a family with little ones that want to go to the beach (beaches have coral and rocks - bring shoes if you want to swim). Otherwise its a nice place.. Try the shrimp place close to the resort (main street) the garlic shrimp are very good. Pizza-room service is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you like seclusion, quiet beauty and relaxation . . .”
Reviews.Author: lightbulb03
Reviews.Content: this is the resort for you. Our objective was to find a hotel on Oahu away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki for a pre-cruise stay. What a find! At this resort you will find comfortable rooms, great service poolside, walking, hiking, horseback riding, tennis, swimming, etc. Or do nothing at all. Another fantastic hotel where the staff welcomed us warmly as one of their own family. This hotel has a laundry facility on floor 2 and 3. This was a welcome amenity although one dryer was broken and the soap dispenser was out of soap. No problem, pool side gift and sundry shop had a supply to buy. We walked to the banyan tree, swam in the pool, ate lunch poolside, had massages (my first, fantastic), went sight seeing and saw rainbows. We booked an Ilima suite (2 bedrooms, wetbar and living room ). The A/C was temperamental, but we got around it. The rest of the room was fine. I'd stay here again absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay Aug 20-27 2005. We had to look for the turtles.They are not as abundant as the name reflects.The room was nice with a soft comforter. Bring your own pillow if you do not like firm thick pillows.The food at the hotel was ok. Lei Leis at the golf course was much better. We ate in Haleiwa at Jamesons ( so so).. Haleiwas Joes ( much Better) and at Haleiwas Eats Thai ( the best). Things we did that were well worth it... Shaved Ice at Aokis and Matsumotos and the tour at the macadamian nut farm , this was excellent. It does not look like much, but the tour (12.50 per person) is well worth it. We played golf both at the Palmer course and the Fazio Course. Very wide open on Mon, Tues , Wed and Thurs. If You start early like 7:00 or 7:30am, You can replay either course with plenty of time for $30.00.Palmer course is harder due to the blind pins. Fazio is pretty straight forward. We did take a ride out to Coral Creek and to Ko OLina. Coral Creek personnel was on the rude side. Course looked average. Ko Olina similiar to Kapula or Poipu. Very resort course. Seemed to be a bit more crowded. Dole plantation tour was so so. You can either read the signs for the tour or take the train with a verbal tour. Only if time permits would we recommend this tour. Waikiki is crowded. We went to the Magic show at the Beachcomber. For 44.00/person we thought this was worth it. The Beaches are not as great as Kauai or Maui. We went to Hanaumu Bay. Go early. They close the parking lot after they fill up. Arrive by 9am. Must go to Leonards in Waikiki for the malasdas, They are the best hot.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable, loved the Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: missabmw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Turtle Bay Resort on the lovely, quieter side of Oahu, the North Shore. Check in went smooth, staff was super friendly, we had a beautiful ocean front room where we could hear the waves crashing below. We had a standard king, with a small balcony, and the entire wall that faced the ocean was glass. The bed was comfortable w/ a down duvet and down pillows. This resort is truly a solid 4 star hotel. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, so I can't comment on their food. We did do the afternoon tea in the lobby and that was nice. They serve tea, fruit, cheese, crackers, wine and desserts. We did order room service and the server was super friendly (a surfer guy), and the food was very good. I dont know if it was a slower time, but although they said the resort was filled to capacity, we never felt as if there were people all around. We usually were in the elevator alone and elevators arrived almost instantly. There really aren't any other resorts in the area, but I would recommend staying on the north shore at the Turtle Bay Resort if you want a more relaxing, quiet visit to Hawaii. It's completely different from busy Waikiki; there really isn't any nightlife, things close relatively early, but if you are looking for a peaceful trip, I highly recommend the Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Away from it all”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: Nice resort away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The hotel was booked to capacity but it never felt that way. Very quiet and away from it all. Only drawback was the construction, noisy and limited the access to the beach. The choice of restaurants were poor. Best restaurant on the resort was Lei Leis. Food is definetely better in Maui and Kauai. Resort is nice, water was a bit cold. Rooms were nice, great view but we had booked deluxe ocean view rooms. Bell Captains were nice and knew us at the end of the trip. Sunset beach and Waikiki were good for boogie boarding. Beach was limited at the resort, no bar or food. Tennis ws nice but every other light was out. The breakfast buffet was too much the same for a week and got to be very boring. Tea and sandwiches were nice and portions were generous. You could see turtles in the bay, which was fun. Macademia nut tour is awesome don't miss it. It is a treasure. Roys was ok, food and service was great but noisy. Magic show was excellent. Worth the price! International bazaar is fun to shop in but you need to bargain. the kids loved it. Jamison's was okay a bit dated Bazai Sushi was awful, service and food. Hailawa Joes was ok but hot and stuffy. Pizza bob's was good for lunch. Matsumoto shave ice was better then Aoki's worth the wait. Aoiki's melted too quickly.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it - a nice change from Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: akavienna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort 08/08/05-08/13/05. Enjoyed the stay. Had deluxe ocean view through Costco Travel (best price) and it was the closest I've ever been to the water. As soon as you walk in, you see the ocean through your doors. Nice place, beautiful grounds. Food okay. Better food at Lei Leis on the golf course. Beautiful sunsets, perfect weather. My only complaint is that there isn't a lot of choices for food. Had to go down the road and get snacks and sodas from the local store but there was a small fridge in the room for same. After being very spoiled in Maui in November, thought I'd give TurtleBay a try. The beach is not the same, not as soft, more rock there, but good snorkling and it was okay with rock/surf shoes on. Not good for boogie boards - Kailua was perfect for that. The big plus of this location was Turtle Beach about 20 minutes away. Actually able to swim and snorkle with sea turtles in their natural habitat. It was incredible and completely made the trip. Turtle Bay Resort is a nice resort and a complete breath of fresh air after staying at the Miramar in Waikiki - what a dump! Not Maui, but for half the price, it was quite a nice little vacation. I would recommend it, just know that the beach is small and rocky. Golf course was nice, and you're only about thirty to forty-five minutes away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Family of eight loves Turtle Bay Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed our vacation on the north shore of Oahu! We enjoyed the lunch buffet and found all the wait staff to be very helpful and polite. A family with six children can generate alot of luggage and the bell staff did not blink an eye, Jay was professional, helpful and very informative. We recommend the Hertz counter at TBR, our agent was very helpful and proffesional. The protected cove was a wonderful snorkeling introduction for our children. We enjoyed the great stories about Hawiian culture and really appreciated the snorkeling advice from the attendant at the beach. We loved the interesting information about the beach flowers and the reason they are only half a flower when they bloom. The rooms were large, beds very comfortable, nice large closets and dressing area has its own sink and large counter. Good size for a family. The view was wonderful from the fourth floor and what a pleasure it was to see the big beautiful sea turtles swim in the bay! We love that the shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and lotion are made in Hawaii! Go try a plate of Kahuku shrimp scampi from Giovanni's big white truck. Its about 2 miles into the town of Kahuku, they park on the left. You order at the trucks window, $12.95 gets you a big plate of big sweet shrimp covered in garlic and two scoops of rice and a lemon wedge. Get plenty of napkins a cold drink and sit down at the covered picnic tables and enjoy. Locals and tourists agree Kahuku shrimp are delicious! We saw the staff at the hotel work very hard to provide a excellant experience for all the guests from the Disney crew to newly weds and familys in between. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Picket Lines”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not be swayed by their beautiful website. I ignored all the postings about the labor relation issues. We got married in Florida and left a beautiful beachfront hotel in Sunny Isles to be at Turtle Bay (which cost twice as much as the Florida hotel). All the staff walked out during our stay. You could not rent equipment, eat, get a pool towel, etc. We learned our lesson. The next time we will stay in Diamond Head and visit the North Shore for a day trip. It's not worth the money or the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesom!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay from July 30 05 thru Aug 4th, 2005. It was absolutely awesome. The service was excellent. We spent breakfastes on the patio over looking the ocean. Room service was really reasonable compared to the resturants in the hotel. We only ate at Lei Leis by the golf course one nite. All other meals were in town or at the shrimp trucks that line the Kamehameha Hwy. I had read a few negative reviews about this resort and was pleasently surprised when the staff was friendly and curteous at every level. Melissa in reservations was particularly helpful when it came to getting our room changed when they only had a King be in our suite. The delux ocean view room with full balcony was amazing and large. The view was like looking at a postcard from the room and all around the resort. We went down to Waikiki and was happy we stayed on the north shore as the city was overly crowded and Turtle Bay was private and intimate. I would stay there again and again and plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not What Expected; Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nyobi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay for a business conference. The Conference turned out to be excellent, and the hotel did a wonderful job of accomidating the conference. We were looking forward to this last leg of our Hawaiian Vacation. When we arrived at the hotel the staff did not seem to be in the swing of things, they all seemed a bit confused. After waiting around in the lobby for a few hours we were finally able to check-in. When we opened the door to our room we were extremely dissapointed. The room was painted a dark green with dark green shutters and a wonderful view of a red roof! The hotel room was no better than a Motel 6, it had a very depressing feel. The beach was not very swimable at all, there was only a small section where you could swim and it was public access, however I think the locals had better beaches than this hotel. The main pool area was very plain and boring, however there was a very small kiddie pool with a slide which was a little bit nice as it was shaded; was not impressed. My recomendation is stay at a hotel such as the JW Marriot at Ko Olina, cheaper, larger, and much nicer rooms. I would not recomend this hotel, but if you insist on staying I would not get anything less than the cottage. Another problem we had with this hotel is we had a package overnighted to us, the Hotel insisted for 3 days that it never arrived, finally we checked with Fedex and they said it had already been delivered on time, finally they sent us to the security department at the hotel the guy that answered the phone there just laughed, said "Oops, we'll send it up" no apologies or nothing, it was overnighted for a reason. Like I said before stay elsewhere the hotel is really not that nice, dont say I didn't warn you. Besides there's almost absolutely nothing to do around there.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic North Shore Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon to Hawaii. We did a little hotel hopping and are so very glad we stayed here. We heard some mixed reviews about this resort..but let me tell you- If you are looking to get away to a place that is romantic, beautiful and relaxing, then this is the place for you. We stayed for four nights in the oceanfront cottages. The room is spacious, with a king sized poster bed, high vaulted ceilings, a soaking bath tub, private lanai, mini-bar with sink,etc...everthing looked fairly new. (the room is exactly like the picture shows on their website) The view was magnificent, a huge grassy yard behind our cottage was filled with hammocks scattered throughout the trees...just an unbelievable ocean view, which you were able to get to just by stepping out your back door. The resort has a nice pool, the water by the beach is pretty much all rocks, so that made it hard to go in the ocean water. (I don't like the ocean water anyway, so I didn't mind) We walked on the rocks, which I think were lava formed....did the horseback riding trail, which was excellent! We saw turtles in the evening poking their heads up for air in the water. As far as the food...it was good, nowhere to really eat besides the hotel and a nearby town. (which we didn't try) The service was excellent! In the cottages you have a personal concierge, ours was Eric, he was awesome...anything we needed, he was a step ahead of us! (so delightful) Everyday we were greeted with complimentary water, fresh squeezed juice of the day, and a fruit of the day. After our stay here we headed over to the other side of the island, Waikiki..it was a huge mistake. We went from peacefulness and beauty, to the hustle, bustle and crowds of tourists! Yuk..well atleast we know for our next visit! We would without a doubt recommend Turtle Bay Resort...if you are looking for romance and quiet then go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Crowded Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: lescas
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights last week 7-12, the resort was packed with several large school groups for a competition? had reseved a double, got there all they had was a King, so four of us slept there, two dds on the floor, all that money and no bed :) Is a beatutiful place, right on the point of the ocean, we had an delux ov room, very nice, hotel location is out of the way, 10 minutes drive either way to get food, shops. Staff was not friendly at the front desk, when asked about a different room. I heard from the guy we rented snorkle equip. from they were still having some work issues at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but service glitch spoiled everything”
Reviews.Author: mparel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Turtle Bay from 4 - 9 July. We reserved a Pikake suite at $495. per night. On arrival, we were given room 431 that looked nothing like the Pikake pictures that the resort has on the web site. The suite was moldy smelling, had dirty carpet, some of the furniture was obviously missing, and the bathroom needed a good cleaning. I complained to the front desk and was told they were sold out, so check back tomorrow to see if another suite was available. I did, and met wonderfully helpful Melissa. She worked for about 30 minutes to find us another suite and came up with room 256---truly the best suite in the resort. It has a huge, fully furnished, direct ocean-front balcony where we enjoyed private dinners and amazing sunrise breakfasts. Each time we saw her, she asked if everything was O.K. and could not do enough to make sure we were comfortable. Even our housekeeper, Violet, bent over backwards to get everything we needed. This was our second stay at the resort. The first time we stayed here, it was a Hilton hotel and none of the employees was as helpful as Melissa or Violet. On our next to last night, we decided to have a final dinner on the balcony which turned into a disaster. The server, Jarel B, arrived with a single tray piled high with some of the food we ordered and the bottle of wine. 1 entry was missing and the dessert was uncovered . I asked what hapened to the table with table cloth, napkins, candle, water, bread service, etc. He looked at me and smugly advised that the order was not big enough to bring a table and all the extras to the room: that type of service was reserved for "higher dollar" orders. Now, for all of us room service types, you already know that with a bottle of wine, this dinner was a "higher dollar" order. I was speechless yet furious, and simply signed the check. We called the in-room dining manager who sent someone to complete the service. In fairness to the resort, the next morning, we received a call from the Private Dining manager, Allen, who wanted to "make it up" to us, but because we were checking out the next day, there was nothing he could do. I imagine that Jarel B is operating as usual. Maybe this is nothing, but that incident put a very bad taste in our mouths. As we left Turtle Bay, we decided not to go back. We then spent 6 nights on the Big Island at the Mauna Kea Hotel & Resort where one has to ask for nothing and where the aloha spirit continues to thrive.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the cottage!”
Reviews.Author: nbtraveller2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay for four nights in June 2005. We had booked a Maele Suite but we were very disappointed when we checked in. Furnishings and finishes were dismal. We immediately switched over to one of the oceanfront cottages. It was a night and day difference. The cottages are beautifully appointed(decorated by Michael smith) with wood floors, sitting area and lanai. Short but beautiful walk to get to the main hotel. The pool area was nice , beach was just okay. Staying in the cottage made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: loveadventure4
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to the islands. Each time we have stayed at a different resort on a different island. This trip we decided we wanted to be able to visit the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but still have the tranquility and natural beauty of Kauai or the Big Island. We found perfection at Turtle Bay. The grounds and views are spectacular. Each morning we attempted to greet the day on our lanai with coffee and the newspaper, but were constantly distracted by the rainbows that appeared over the mountains in the distance. We never quite got used to the fact that there were no other resorts, or businesses, to block our view. The resort itself is very pretty. The rooms are attractive and extremely clean, but do not have the quality of furnishings of a resort like the Maui Hyatt. The view from your room more than made up for any deficiency in furniture quality. Except for a somewhat disinterested clerk at check-in, all of the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The food was good, though we limited our onsite meals to the breakfast buffet, Hang Ten Bar for lunch, and one night at LeiLei's. We LOVED the Kahuku Sweet Shrimp from the truck right outside the resort grounds. We quickly became regulars there!

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: profeAlamo_CA
Reviews.Content: I can't find a place to post about Turtle Bay Condos, so I'll use this. In many ways it applies to the whole resort. There are two condo rental companies; we use Turtle Bay condos and have stayed there several times. The condo has always been clean, fairly well furnished, but not luxurious. If you are concerned, ask for the best, or cleanest or whatever you want in the condo. They are fully equipped, most with A/C, and very comfortable. It's so much less expensive than the hotel, only a 5 minute walk to the beach or the hotel poolside bar where sitting and watching the sunset while sipping a drink is a delight. We enjoy hiking the the absolutely beautiful area, but for swimming, we like to go to Waimea Beach Park, a 15 minute bus ride down the road. Yes, it's isolated and very quiet, but that's why you go to the North Shore. If you don't have a car, the Circle Island bus stops there and is great fun to ride. It will take you anywhere on the North Shore you wish to go. We usually eat in Haleiwa or Kahuku (Giovanni's shrimp is great!) and/or buy produce from the many vegetable stands on the road. That's where you get the sweetest pineapple, wonderful corn, coconut and other tropical fruit, and it's fun to talk to the local people. (Our dinners are often take-out from Giovanni's and the local produce.) This is one of my favorite places in the Islands, very much local flavor, the closest you can get to old Hawaii on Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: JK-Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Our family of four and my mother-in-law rented two bungalows for four nights from June 4-8. We loved the place and would definitely like to return. The bungalows are pretty expensive ($550/night) but are very nice. (Pictures of the bungalows are on the website.) An added bonus is that you can park your car right behind the bungalow so that you don't have to worry with valet parking. Service was very good and everone was friendly. The kids had surfing lessons which were provided at the resort. The pool was nice and chairs were readily available. Most of the beach near the hotel was rocky, but you could walk to some very nice, private beaches. My wife and mother-in-law golfed on the Palmer course. They were impressed by the course, but surprised that few of the holes were on the ocean. We ate a few meals at different restaurants at the Turtle Bay. Overall, the food was very good - much better than I had expected based on some of the reviews. Compared to other places where we stayed in Hawaii, I didn't think that the food prices were that bad. (E.g. fish taco at lunch was $10; nice breakfast buffet was $18.) If you plan to eat at both the hotel and in Haleiwa, I would eat at the hotel on the weekend and eat in Haleiwa on weekdays. Haleiwa was very crowded the weekend that we were there. On Tuesday, the traffic was much better and we didn't have to wait for a table at the restaurant. If you reserve a bungalow, you should be aware that some are closer to the ocean than others. Also, there are quite a few of them so you should consider asking for one closer to the hotel. A few miscellaneous points. The hotel had washers and dryers on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Intenet access was free and available to children, an important feature for my 12 and 14 year old kids. The mini-bars were half full so you could stock them with beer, milk, etc. They also have a little convenience store - prices at the store are high but not outlandish. During the course of our vacation, we also stayed at the Four Seasons on the Big Island and the Hyatt in Maui. At the end of our vacation, we all agreed that the Turtle Bay was our favorite. It wasn't quite as nice as the Four Seasons, but we liked the location better and thought that it was a better, overall value. (The Hyatt came in a very distant third.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place......our family stayed on the North Shore at Turtle Bay for a week. The people are tremendously helpful and nice and the rooms are great. All rooms have an ocean view. Keep in mind the food is expensive.....but everything is expensive in Hawaii. There is a grocery about 5 miles from the hotel. We stocked up on water, drinks and snack food and used the frig in the room. The room is already stocked with coffee. The pools are tremendous and watching the surfers right next door was fun. It's a short drive from the most famous beaches in the world....Sunset and Bonzai PipeLine. There are several great places to eat in Haleiwa: Jamisons, Haleiwa Joes, and Haleiwa Cafe. Stop by and see Patti at the souvenir shop across from Sun and Sea. Also, in the other direction from Turtle Bay, try Hukilau Cafe in Laie, Hawaii. It's about a 10-15 minute drive and has a great breakfast and lunch. They are open Monday thru Saturday. We will stay at Turtle Bay Resort again!

Reviews.Title: “How could anyone not like this place??”
Reviews.Author: RaiderEd
Reviews.Content: I honestly have no idea how anyone could possibly not like this place. The resort grounds are utterly amazing! You could stick a Motel 6 on this property and it would be 4 stars worthy. Location: Seemingly a million miles from civilization. The nearest town rolls up the streets by about 9 p.m. This can be a curse or a blessing based on your vacation expectations. This place is for rest & relaxation. Look elsewhere for any type of action or nightlife. Property: As picturesque as any hotel you can find. The surrounding beaches are some of the best and are nearly empty most of the time. Turtles are easy to spot at a variety of areas throughout the resort. The sunset and sunrise views are unsurpassed (actually caught a double rainbow one morning). The pools are good and large enough to accomodate everybody. The bigger pool is absolutely huge and very deep (a little cold, but refreshing). Nice that kids generally stay in the kids pool which is really warm and has a short slide for a little entertainment. The grounds were clean and generally well maintained. The hiking trails are fantastic and not to be missed. Rooms: Nothing to get excited about but far from poor. Rooms are large and easily accomodate a roll-away. A little sparse in furnishings and a little dated in the bathrooms. Water pressure in shower was absolutely pitiful. Nice to have an empty mini-fridge to store some drinks & snacks. Bed was quite comfortable. Carpet and furnishings were in good shape. Lanai was good size with great views. Service: Mostly friendly and responsive throughout our stay. The folks staffing the pool seemed preoccupied most of the time but it didn't really matter much. Food: Lei Lei's was quite good. Their prime rib is really excellent for a golf course restaurant. The place is definitely not a secret and does a brisk business nearly every night. A little expensive, but no more so than any other typical resort restaurant. Room service was better than average and reasonably priced. Keep in mind, that this resort could take you to the cleaners on food bills if they wanted to since the nearest food is a minimum of 20 minutes from the resort and even that is of limited selection. Overall: I felt like I got my money's worth which is not often the case in hotels costing $300/night. This resort must have been unparalleled back in the '70s. Even today, the property is some of the best you can find in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay on Northern Oahu is an absolute retreat. It is far enough from Honolulu to be peaceful and really is a little more of the true spirit of Hawai'i. The local resaurants and beaches are anything but touristy and the atmosphere is relaxed and beautiful. We got married on a small beach and stayed in the beach cottages, which are well worth the extra money. The staff was not necessarily super-friendly nor were they rude, but they stayed out of our way and simply did their jobs. There was no construction and it was not crowded at all. There were some children around and the night-life is very relaxed, so if you're looking for a more adult crowd and like to party, you probably want to stay in Honolulu. However, if you like to watch the sunset and see sea turtles, the North Shore is the best place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and Shaved Ice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 7 excellent nights at the Turtle Bay Resort. I'd read many of the previous reviews and have to admit I was prepared to keep the suitcases packed and ready to jump to another island if the resort was as bad as some have suggested. I also have to agree with a previous reviewer that some of the other reviews could not have been written about the Turtle Bay Resort we just visited. My wife and I spend a vacation every year on one of the islands, more often than not on Maui at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua or the Four Seasons Wailea. They are both grand resorts with first class amenities. This year we decided to revisit Oahu and Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore. First the location: Neither the Ritz Carlton nor the Four Seasons have the spectacular grounds, views or number of close, easy to access beaches that Turtle Bay has. A short 1/2 mile walk away from the resort and we were on clean, white sand beaches with not another soul in sight. Sea turtles floated by right at our feet, occasionally bumping into us (so much for not disturbing the turtles) as we waded in the crystal blue water. The waves around the hotel were not as big as we're told they are when the winter storms roll in but we enjoyed watching the surfers ride whatever set happened to catch their fancy. It was 89 every day, sunny with light trade winds. The Resort Staff: Everyone from Ricardo our Bellman, to Malia at the spa, Virginia at the Coffee bar to the front desk, housekeeping, restaurant and pool employees were very polite. The Hotel: Our room was on the 4 th floor, Deluxe Ocean view. It was very clean, large and had a good size balconey perfect for watching the sun set. The furnishings were in good condition and decent quality although the amount of furniture and quality weren't up to Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons standards. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Restaurants: We ate most of our meals on the property, Lei Lei's was as good as advertised with excellent service, the Palm Terrace food was fair but again service very attentive and we liked the buffet breakfast. We ordered room service dinner a couple of times and found the food to be very good. Spa: I had two massages and my wife a facial and Scrub. While the Spa is small compared to many others we've been to you didn't feel rushed as you sometimes do at the big resorts, where you are just another body going for a treatment. I can highly recommend a massage from Malia. Sightseeing: Since we've been to many of the islands, we didn't do much sightseeing. Visited a number of the local towns and beaches and went to the nature center. The nice thing about the North Shore is you feel as though you're experiencing old Hawaii. Golf: We played 3 rounds of golf. Two on the Fazio course and one round on the Palmer course. Both are entertaining but the Palmer course was alittle more challenging and in better shape. The pro shop staff was polite and while our golf was fair the rounds were fun. Summary: If you are looking for a mega size resort with malls and shopping go to the other side of the island or to another island. If you want to enjoy some of the most beautiful, unspoiled scenery, white sandy beaches at a clean, comfortable resort try Turtle Bay. Remember at the begining of this review I was the guy ready to keep the suitcases packed in case it was as bad as some of the reviews indicated. We enjoyed our vacation at the Turtle Bay Resort and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cottages Beautiful! Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Sonpeg1
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nites here after 6 nites on Kauai @ the Sheraton - Much more expensive for cottage as compared to hotel room but room was beautifully done, hardwood floors/large glass shwr & deep soaking tub (all new); very clean! maids came in 2 times a day!; Ocean view beautiful (but couldn't beat Sheraton's!); Lanai large & private (even included wooden rocker!) But, not as private as we had hoped..people used back of Cottages as a walkway - and other adjoined "Cottages" utilized same yard area - back of was grass 'lawn', short hedges, and 'drop' to rocky beach..so, that was a negative. We had hoped to have much more 'privacy'. The grounds are beautiful and $26 resort fee covered boogie board/snorkel equip; tennis usage and free lesson of tennis - so, wasn't too bad there. Beautiful walkway in front of cottages to main hotel & pool area - we did not use but only once - was very nice area but closed at 7pm..kind of early! (we snuck in at abt 8:30...nobody there..was grea! Although found cups laying around and alot of sand in hottub. Sandbar was least expensive place to eat although food was Great @ Lei Lei's on the golf course. Didn't like the fact brkfst so expensive - we bought cereal & milk @ local market, water & juices, 1/2&1/2..etc. Fridge small but after removing the "stocked items".. ours fit just fine. Never saw any bugs until the last day...praise God! They seem to be right on top of that. Noted: not enough lawn chairs per cottage, not really 'private' enough, beach not as good as in Kauai although plenty of good ones a short drive away. Loved the 'non-city' atmospher! Waikkiki visiting for 2 days was enough for me..really enjoyed coming "home" to the Turtle Bay, my 'turned down bed with a little gift on it' and wonderful Hawaiin music CD on my night stand! Workers very polite (english a little broken); very clean rooms; Cottages have "Ho Keepa" (sp)? that takes care of bring 'ice' and the like..maids to clean (2) times a day, Concierge, bellhop when you arrive...all require tipping. (Joke between my husband and I... workers are always driving around on sidewalks in quiet little golf carts...at times.. reminded us of 'cockraoches' running all around! ;) Sunset Horseback riding...cancelled when found it went out and was back around 5:30/6pm...sunset was always @ 7pm!! (guess it should be renamed!) I had looked forward to that but that was a wash - Helicopter ride cancelled on us because they were fighting fires on other side of island which left me no time to reschedule any other activities before we left the island...that was very disappointing...You have to sched 48hr in advance for them to guarantee flight for only 2 (found out mininum was 3 - if third person not book same time..you pay for a third body! @ almost $200 p/person..I don't think so!) of course..when the morning came..they cancelled on us..seemed a little suspicious, (especially seeing the news said later that nite that only 1 helicopter was needed that day...) maybe was true but really goofed us up and nothing was offered to 'compensate' nor were they able to 'work out something anywhere else for us to get into, so.. not too impressed with that) Think if were to stay again (even though the room was fabulous! .. even got to use (2) robes and slippers for the week!) we would check out a room on the pool side with Ocean view... Overall - place was beautiful but still needs upgrading by new owners..which seems to be happening... noted they were working on older beach side of the hotel and upgrading some beautiful Condos or ??? like, 2, 3 bedroom units... now..want to talk about 'pricey'?? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon enjoyed at here ”
Reviews.Author: k.s-l.Brampton
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! Instantly upgraded us to a full ocean view room. Absolutely gorgeous view! Not too busy much more of a secluded feel! Great scenery! HUge resort including golf courses, horseback riding and scuba diving. Great restaurants but most are pricey. Free bottle of champagne ! ASTONISHING rooms that are spacious and clean and modern. The only prolems we encountered were that YOU NEED YOUR OWN TRANSPORTATION IF GOING OFF TEH RESORT!!! If you have other activities planned and you may want to head upto Wikiki you need a rental car. (We were not told that by our agent) And its quite far out there also the resort pretty much closes up around 10.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old daughter and I just returned from a week's stay at the Turtle Bay Resort in Oahu's North Shore area. We loved this place. Of all the hotels on all of the major Hawaiian islands that we've stayed at, this was my absolute favorite. First, the location of this resort is unbeatable. The views from our balcony were exceptional. Theres'a beach on each side of the hotel, one perfect for swimming and snorkeling in, and the other primarily for surfing and turtle-watching. Both were relatively uncrowded, but by walking along the beach for less than 10 minutes on either beach, you'd have the whole area to yourself. Standing on the lanai (balcony) we had the most spectacular sites, and the floral scents that the winds brought each day were better than anything out of a perfume bottle. The resort itself was very well landscaped. Beautiful palm trees everywhere. Low key luxury seemed to be the theme. Nothing to take away from the natural beauty. Some well placed hammocks and additional plumeria trees would have been a welcome addition, but other than that, it was perfect. We read a lot of reviews that were critical of this resort, in particular the unfriendly staff. Overall we've stayed at places in Hawaii that had friendlier staffs, they had the aloha spirit where it was most appreciated, in the pool area. The pool staff consisted of very friendly young women and men who all seemed to enjoy their jobs and were great with kids. Most of the time the servers from the Hang Ten Bar were very prompt, and we rarely had to wait for very long, even in the kid pool furthest from the bar. The musicians and performers that appeared nightly were very gracious and interactive. My daughter's favorite part of the resort was of course the pool. They had a terrific keiki (kid) pool area, with a slide and very warm water. We had a tough time dragging her away each night. There were also two jacuzzis, one in the general area, and one tucked away in some bushes that was probably ideal for honeymooners. Our one complaint here would be the food. The primary restaurant, the Palm Terrace, served bland food and the buffet was selection was very boring. Strangely, though, we found when we ordered from room service, the food was much more flavorful. One money saving hint for families - the Keiki menu offered a nice selection, the portions wer HUGE, and most were around $6. We ended up splitting two items from the kids menu (the chicken pieces were yummy) and dessert, and spent about $30 for dinner each night, a tremendous value for this area. We heard people raving about the upscale restaurant and Lei Leis which was on the golf course, but never made it there. For anyone looking for the perfect place for families, this is THE place to go. There were lots of honeymooners there too, as the sunsets at the bar were very romantic, and the proximity to deserted beaches would be a nice draw for this set, so it's a great resort all around. But for families with kids of any age, this really is a nice choice, and one that we will return to again, hopefully very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Turtle Bay because it was one of the only hotels on the North Shore and away from the hussle and bussle of Waikiki. We were a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews that stated that there were rude employees and construction all of the time, but we never saw any of that. The rooms were recently remodeled and were absolutely beautiful! The bed was really comfortable, the room was very clean and the view from the room was breathtaking. The entire hotel was very well kept and absolutly beautiful. The $14/day fee was a bit steep but we took advantage of it by using our free snorkel rental everyday. Snorkeling at the beach by the hotel was great, free and just as good as Sharks Cove, if not better. The staff were very kind and accomodating, the pools and beaches were beautiful and we will never stay anywhere else when we visit Oahu since we loved it so much. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. The only thing we wouldn't recomend is eating in the resturants there, the food was not worth the price and was gross. Lei Lei's on the golf course was a really good place to eat, but pretty pricey for dinner. Drive into Haleiwa and get great Thai food at Haleiwa Eats and while you are there don't miss Matsomoto's Shave Ice!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, when we desided to stay at Turtle Bay, I wanted to know everything! First off, yes the food is expensive but it IS Hawaii and EVERYTHING is expensive unless you figure out how to do Hawaii. Turtle Bay rooms have smal refridgerators. Perfect for milk, muffins sandwich meat makings. We paid for one meal per day at a restaruant. We chose either lunch or dinner. We would eat muffins and fruit and free coffee for breakfast and sandwiches for lunch or dinner. We tried the buffet. Food wasn't so great for the price. We also tried lei lei's. Food was good but still expensive. We got away with ordering prime rib off the childs menu (we did have our two kids with us) $10. You just gotta use your immagination and make it a game to see what you can get away with. We had a sanwich at the sand bar (ours were better). Couldn't ever get help at the pool bar (those waitresses are territorial and if we weren't in their section we didn't get helped. So...... a few bad parts. Remember THIS waitress she had reddish hair and lots of freckles THE RUDEST PERSON IN THE WORLD. Ok none of the bad stuff really was even noticable with everything else. The rooms were beautiful and the maid service was the best ever!!!! Also the coffee cart lady was THE BEST EVER. She had been at the hotel for 20ish years! She loves working for these people so don't even try to say anything bad about the hotel. I loved her! The grounds are beautiful. I just wished for a bathroom off the trails somewhere, its a long walk back. There are two laundry machines on each floor. I think it was $1 each and $1 for detergent. Don't believe anyone about the hotel staff. The people of Hawaii are the nicest of any place I've been. (side note...the redhead waitress at the bar is not a hawaiian person, she must have been paid extra by one of the Wakiki hotels to be rude to Turtle Bay vacationers). Speaking of Waikiki. Why anyone would want to stay in that dirty town is ....... Might as well stay home then stay there. We also went to Giovanni's shrimp truck and few times and I've copied the receipe so e-mail me if you want it mommysew1@aol.com. We renewed our vows right on the beach at the hotel (free if you use the beach $500 if you use the grass). Taking pictures on the hotel grounds is free. We used hawaiiweddings------ Great people great photos!!! The one here was taken in the grass. You could see this spot from our room. Our room also overlooked the glass wedding chappel. Too expensive to use but nice to look at. All in all the Turtle Bay was my best favorite vacation ever and I will go back and back and back. E-mail me if you want to know ANYTHING!!!! mommysew1@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice. But not quite there”
Reviews.Author: lepreshaun
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a beautiful spot. The buildings themselves were supposedly renovated 2 years ago. Not our room. While this is the "quiet side" of the Island, this is not the Hotel for you if you are looking for peace and quiet. Rooms are underinsulated, allowing conversations and TV noise from the adjoining rooms to permeate the walls. And the ever present noise of slamming doors is sure to wake you early in the morning. We found the staff to be almost universally polite and responsive. The only thing I would observe is that the wait staff in the Palm Terrace is clearly geared toward the buffet. Should you want to order from the menu, good luck! One of the waitpeople, when asked how the nightly fresh fish special was prepared, replied "I don't know, I don't like it". When asked to find out anyway, she disappeared and returned 15 minutes later with "are you ready to order now?". I would agree that the "resort charge" is ridiculous, you get nothing for it that is over and above what should be included in the already expensive daily rate. All in all out vacation was ok. However, if you want to be away from Waikiki, this is pretty much your only choice. Essentially an average, 2 and 1/2 or 3 star place pretending to be a 4 star resort. Sorry, but the location can only cover for so much.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is Great”
Reviews.Author: Tenst
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Turtle Bay the week of March 19-25. This was our fourth trip to Hawaii. We were a bit hesitant because of some bad reviews. However the service and hotel could not have been better. The location is the most picturesque on Ohau. From our room we saw whales jumping each day. The food is outstanding. We then moved to the Outrigger Reef on Waikiki with an ocean front view. I'll take Turtle Bay any day. We definetly plan on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelinme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay March 23-27 and all I cannot complain about one thing. I think the people who posted negatively on here are just big complainers!! How can you complain about a heavenly vacation like this! Ugh, people are just negative. We kept the door open the entire time, and spent many happy content hours just staring at the waves and best of all, listening to them crash against the shore. It was spectacular. We stayed on the side opposite Kuilima Cove, just over the lobby and I understand that is the better side to stay on because the other side has construction... Our side also had a longer expanse of ocean and views of the cottages too. The pool is right below that side, so if you think that traffic will bother you, think about the Kuilima Cove side. We however really liked being able to people watch if we wanted, and then for the majority of the time look over and past the pool and bar, out into the horizon. You just get hypnotized as the waves crash against the shore! Anyway, it is a beautiful place and worth every penny. It actually wasn't super expensive, ( I thnk we paid around 250/night through Costco) I considered that a great deal!! I was so surprised how nice this place actually was. Casual and unpretentious, but still elegant. It was clean and modern. Our room was great, with a fridge and a very comfy bed.. Bathroom was great.. Yes it's true there are a lot of kids around, to be fair--- if that is a problem for you, just know it in advance. But Hawaii is one of those places people take the kids. It just is! The fact that families are there enjoying a vacation together shouldn't get in the way of your own personal ability to have a great time. I just don't really understand that. We don't have children and didn't especially sit around thinking, gee let's go to a resort that has a lot of kids staying there, but the fact that there were kids around didn't get in our way at all. Again, I think people are just complainers. But anyway. We ate in the fancy restaurant one night (21 degrees) and it was great. My husband requested a table with a view as it was my 30th bday. When we arrived they had a booth right next to the window for us. The waitress wished me a happy birthday right away, they had made a note of it. And she brought me a delicious souflee as a surprise, on the house. The food was EXCELLENT. We can be food snobs and we were not disappointed. It was expensive but not overpriced. We would have eaten there every night if we could have afforded to. We also ate at Lei Leis and the food was awesome. Highly recommend it. I snorkeled in Kuilima Cove daily despite the fact that it was windy and rainy. I saw plenty of fish and I was usually the only person in the water! It was a great place to snorkel. We loved going for walks around the property. And my husband isn't particularly a "Let's go for a walk" kind of guy, let me say. But he was saying that when we were there! There is so much to explore. The Hang Ten bar is the best place ever to sit and sip a Mai Tai-- They make a great Mai Tai and they don't skimp on it either. After one you definitely feel it! The sun is setting, people are surfing, it is quiet, beautiful and the Aloha spirit abounds. The staff were so real, not overly kiss ---- just nice and pleasant and helpful in a genuine way. Hawaiian to the core. I loved every second of my stay there, the only change I would make is that I would stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Big meeting, big success!”
Reviews.Author: rmwalls
Reviews.Content: OK, I read the reviews, and, though they were positive on balance, many were negative, albeit in a nit-picky way. I ran a medical meeting for physicians, and we consumed over 250 room-nights. What a great experience. The staff were outstanding, from the bellman at first arrival through every single person we encountered. Even the young people serving at the golf club restaurant (Lei Lei's -- great, by the way) were poised, kind, and genuinely friendly. We stayed in a beach cottage, looking due west. What a treat! We sat on our lanai each night, sipping a cold rum and tonic, and watched the sun slip into the Pacific. Paradise. The cottage was beautiful, worth the extra $$, if you can afford it. The food was great. We ate in 21 degrees north, and asked the chef to come out for congratulations. Although there are plenty of restaurant options only 15 minutes away by car, we found ourselves usually choosing to stay and eat in one of Turtle Bay's restaurants, and were never disappointed. The golf was also fabulous, although the Palmer course is pretty unforgiving. If you tend to be erratic, try the Fazio course. We have stayed literally all over the world, and my wife and I would both rank Turtle Bay, in comparison with the splendid places we have stayed, as "wonderful!!!" We stayed five extra days after the meeting ended and were all the better for it!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the most negative reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: ElyseEA
Reviews.Content: Oahu is certainly full of hotels, but actually there are few outside of Waikiki. Turtle Bay is your best choice on the North Shore. Although it won't compare with some of the most exceptional resorts across the islands, it offers many pleasures on the North Shore, and will certainly be popular with golfers. First, know that the North Shore is a little wilder, more surf-town than busy Waikiki or polished Maui. During the winter, the waves will be rough, water colder than you might be looking for, and wind fairly constant. If you will love surfing, or watching the surfers at Sunset or Pipleline, it's great. Riding, hiking, and some swimming depending on weather is also good. But you might be looking for another kind of Hawaii for your vacation. Turtle Bay resort sits on a stunning promontory with two coves, one on either side. As a building, it is not visually compelling, but pretty much every room will have a view of the ocean. Watching the waves and the sunsets from your room may be the most wonderful aspect of the place -- perfect for relaxation. The rooms are simple and soothing; restaurants are adequate, but not fabulous, and priced like all resort restaurants. (The North Shore is more the place for eating roadside shrimp or packing a lunch for the beach.) Like other reviewers, I recommend room service on your balcony or LeiLei's at the golf course if you eat onsite. There are two pools, one heated; two hot tubs seating about 8 each; and good snorkeling in one of the coves when the weather is good. Note that summer on the North Shore brings very calm water, so plan when you travel based on your preferences. I'd agree that the service is not brimming with aloha spirit, but no one was ever surly or indifferent during our trip. If you can find a reasonable price on your room and understand the kind of area that you are visiting, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, bad tudes!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel is on a beautiful piece of oceanfront, but the service stinks. We stayed in a cottage which was about 30 feet from the beach, away from the main hotel where they pack em in like sardines. Staff is insolent and rude...and they're not "laid back"-more like "laid out" and lazzzzy. Buildings are old, room accomodations average and grounds are a mess. The only jacuzzi fits 4 people...count them..."4"...so you pretty much have to wait your turn or visit the pool by moonlight.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews of Turtle Bay, I was frightened to sink my money into the trip---but did anyway. We were not disappointed. The room was clean and did not smell; the view was beautiful. I had read that the food was terrible and/or over-priced. The items are expensive, but, come on, it's a resort----if you are spending $250+ on a room, they expect you'll pay for the food as well. We did breakfast one morning and a couple lunches, and they were all good. The negatives of Turtle Bay are picky, but there. The $14 a day resort fee is a ridiculous addition to the already pricey cost of the room. Also, the trails are not very well-marked. For a runner, this is a big deal. We lost the blue trial one morning and ended up out on the golf course with an extra 20 minutes added onto our already long run. We liked the green trail better and figured out the loops to take. There is some really nice scenery out on the trails. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting that dream vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not so new & improved”
Reviews.Author: hawaiichick
