Reviews.Content: We live on Oahu & just spent the weekend at Turtle Bay for a wedding. Yes, the views were wonderful, and the wedding was very nice. That said, the hotel was not only noisy with guest children but was overrun with local young people who treated it as their own hangout party spot by showing up for drinks and to apparently hang out waiting for surf teacher friends to finish. They were inconsiderate of other guests, brought a few young teens whom they didn't supervise, and generally made it unappealing to spend time along the water. Also, the oceanside mai tais were not as delicious as they used to be and service was much slower than it used to be, albeit friendly. The rest of the service was a mixed bag - a few staff were wonderful, but others were indifferent, including the manager when we asked for a room change. We did get the room change despite a busy weekend, so we can't complain too much. The food at the new restaurant has received some rave reviews here locally and we looked forward to trying it. Not recommended, particularly for the price, but if you don't want to drive all the way to Haleiwa Joe's it's not a bad option for a "real" dinner on the North Shore. And service at the restaurant was the best in the hotel. Overall, I didn't enjoy it and wouldn't recommend it unless you're out there for a wedding or other party.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: gerry17_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at Turtle Bay (President's Week, Feb 19-26th). We had been there about a year and a half ago when the hotel was under reconstruction and we were pleasantly happy to find the results were as good as we expected. The Ocean Villas adjacent to the beach were still under construction but the noise was not a problem for us on the beach. We have been to Hawaii many times in the past and we have tried many different locations including The Big Island of Hawaii (the Orchid at Kona, now a Fairmont property), Maui (Grand Wailea formerly Grand Hyatt Wailea and the Marriott Kannapali), Kaui (Embassy Suites at Poipu) and Oahu Hyatt Waikiki. But for a one week trip from New York and for sheer beauty this was really great. We did not bother with the meals except for the Golf Course Restaurant (Lei, Lei's) which was quite good--we picked up our meals at Costco in Honolulu and at the local the Foodliners on either side of the hotel (wine, freshly prepared salads and fresh fruit) and ate on the balcony overlooking the beautiful sunset and the beautiful waves. For those of you less inclined to Costco and Foodliner for take out on vacation or for honeymooners we would suggest room service on the balcony overlooking the beautiful waves and sunset. We ate most of our breakfasts either at Ted's Bakery in Waimea or at the Hukilau Cafe in Laie (try the Beef Stew for Breakfast and you most definitely will not be disappointed). We had a few half days of rain but overall the weather was quite good. I went in the ocean and found it a bit cool but not uncomfortable-- there were many, many children and adults frolicking in the water or snorkeling for long periods of time. The hotel was full with the golf open but never seemed at all crowded. The unheated pool was cool side but the heated pool and the hot tub were great. The staff and rooms were wonderful. I rented a Chrysler 300 from Dollar at Honolulu airport and was very pleased with the car.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and myself have just returned from our 10 day stay at The Turtle Bay Resort, on arriving we were informed our room which we booked was unavaliable until the next day. After talks two free buffet breakfast tickets were given as a gesture of goodwill regarding the room. The Hotel itself is beautiful and extermely clean, the staff are really helpfull espically the Conceige and valet men, who are always ready when you pull up in your car. One thing our travel agent did not tell us was that theys a Heitz rental on the resort so you don't need to book alternative car hire just get a transfer from the airport and rent the car from the Turtle Bay, much easier believe us. The Food in the actual hotel was not brilliant considering the rating, the breakfasts buffet consisted of various things but we found any pototoe item tasted of old pototes which was not very nice. The only place we found excellent for food was Lei Lei which is situated on the resort by the golf course, it is privately owned but the valet boys will take you down in a caddy, but it is only a five minute flat walk. The food really is good, we tried nearly everything on the menu. but apart from the food The Turtle Bay resort was a lovely place to be and made a wonderful holiday, its just a shame that the food offered let the hotel down. Our kids loved the water slide, and to be honest so did we, again the only problem was that the big pool was freezing as it is not heated, however maybe in the summer it would get warmer it was only 80 when we were there !

Reviews.Title: “Oahu's North Shore....Go for the Waves, Not the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on Oahu Dec. 19 - 22 as the second part of our Hawaiin honeymoon. Upon arriving at Turtle Bay Resort, we checked in with a friendly staff member but were disappointed at the lack of a lei greeting. However, the biggest disappointment occured when we walked into our room and realized that it wreaked of mold and mildew (and this room was supposedly and upgrade). Our bellman turned on our refrigerator and made the statement that the room hadn't been used in some time....obviously! We cranked up the AC, left the balcony door wide open, and left for six hours. Upon coming back, our room still was repulsive. We proceeded to go to bed in bedding that felt damp. After five minutes of this, we switched rooms. Our new room still had a moldy smell, but at least it wasn't upsetting our stomachs. We filled out comment cards for the manager during our stay and were surprised that we never heard anything back from him while we were there. Turtle Bay offers amazing views, but that was all that the property offered. The beach was small and the soothing sounds of the waves were overpowered by the sounds of construction equipment that was building time shares on the property. They brag about the extensive remodeling project that has recently taken place. I'll have to make sure that I never use their decorator! The bathrooms were well lit, but the rest of the room just felt dark (and the mildew smell didn't help matters). Upon returning back to the mainland, we followed up with the manager regarding our stay at Turtle Bay Resort. We still have not received any sort of response in two months. We can't wait to get back to Hawaii, but we will never step foot into Turtle Bay again. The North Shore is beautiful, but it is really worth a day trip only and not an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: SRW31
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews here almost makes me doubt we stayed in the same place. My husband and I just returned from a stay at Turtle Bay and we can't find enough words to explain just how wonderful it was. We splurged on a beach cottage room and it was worth every penny (the front desk staff was wonderful and helped us find a special rate that made it more affordable for us). Cathedral ceilings, gorgeous furniture (including a lovely four poster bed), a huge soaking tub, a private lanai on the beach with table, chairs, and rocking chair, fresh coconut cookies left on our bed at night...the list goes on and on. The food at the resort was wonderful -- we had a room service dinner that far eclipsed the famed Roy's restaurant outside of Waikiki. The pool area was beautiful and peaceful...a few kids here or there but all were well behaved. And most of them hang out by the pool with the slide -- if you want silence, head over to the other pool by the beach. Or try one of the many beachfront hammocks lining the shore...just like a dream. True that the resort is isolated, but that is the point here...this is "true Hawaii," as the resort says. The locals are incredibly friendly and there is plenty to do in the neighborhood...we highly recommend Happy Trails Hawaii for horsebackriding and ---- for their sunset whalewatching cruise. Also nearby are the picturesque Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach, and Shark's Cove. And only 15 minutes away is Haleiwa -- such a great little town to wander through. Try Haleiwa Eats for great Thai food, Cholo's for wonderful Mexican, and Kua Aina for sandwiches and fries. All in all, we're3 only sorry that we wasted part of our trip in Waikiki. If we ever have another opportunity to go to Oahu, it's definitely Turtle Bay and the North Shore all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay Golf Courses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the staff of the Turtle Bay Golf Courses to be unfriendly, rude and unprofessional. I have played golf around the world and never experienced such a horrible experience. I could never recommend anyone playing golf at Turtle Bay. I was surprised at the lack of professionalism displayed.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to be on Oahu!”
Reviews.Author: olleee
Reviews.Content: Forget crowded Waikiki beach. This is THE place to stay on Oahu. The resort offers everything one could hope for. It has an outstanding location right at the ocean, with a surfing shore to the left and a snorkeling beach to the right. The rooms are elegantly decorated, the staff was extremely helpful. There are several restaurants on the property. We had dinner at the Lei Lei's and breakfast on the terrace restaurant, both of which were really good. With the $229 for a deluxe room, there is really nothing to complain about. The night before we stayed at the Marriott at Waikiki Beach, which costs about the same for a decent double room. The service, the room and the surrounding was far worse at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “not for honeymooning couples”
Reviews.Author: diver1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay after getting married at the Sheraton Moana in Waikiki. The pictures on the website depicted quiet, romantic spots that looked serene. The reality was quite different. The only way to find peace was to stay in our room. The resort was overrun with children, jumping into the pool, screaming and running all over the place. Every breakfast was noisy as well, with children throwing tantrums and that sort of thing. Also, the food was pricey but not great. Our best meal during our stay at Turtle Bay was in the nearby town of Hailewa, in a restaurant called "Hailewa Joe's." On the positive side, the room was beautiful and clean, and the view was unbeatable. The staff was polite, attentive and even knew us by name. If you want a family resort, come here. But if you're looking for a private, romantic getaway, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE !!”
Reviews.Author: queeney2
Reviews.Content: Shame on you Turtle Bay for calling yourself a 5star resort !! You have the potential but definitely not the leadership to take you there!! I guess you colud say my stay at at Turtle Bay was a nightmare from the time I tried to park the car on my stay 11/24-11-29/04. First the good . Yes there are some nice things at Turtle Bay, the property. Oh and LEI LEI's the restraunt at the golf course; which is not ran by Turtle Bay but a great guy named Rich. When we arrived wit was around 6:30 pm we went to our room and came down to get some lite fare it was about 7pm. Good luck the evening front desk mgr. told us if we didn't want to eat at the full service restraunt (which by the way served no lite fare) then drive out of the resort one way or the other and I'd find food, but Subway was to the left. Now that's some kind of customer service. When we returned with our subway, I read the list of events for Thanksgiving the next day. I called and made dinner reservations. I was told they were full, but since I was a guest and they had "outsiders" coming in, they were sure to serve me. Well, at 8:30am ,phone call-no dinner! I went to the front desk explained what had happened the nite before as well as what had just happened. Oh with sincere apologies,I am sure I can get you in the mgr said. I'll call you @ noon with the time. I had to call her, needless to say no Thanksgiving Dinner there. If I wouldn't have met Brenda @ the beach snack bar, who got my family in to Lei lei's , we would have had no Thanksgiving and no one cared. Yes my room had mold in the closet as well . You could see where they were doing some upgrades so they can sell those .5 million dollar condos next door, that the neighbors have signs up and are boycotting. There are no screens in the sliding doors if you are facing the snorkeling lagoon. I called the front desk and said mine was missing because I wanted to listen to the waves that nite and was told none of the sliders have them any longer. Little did they know they were going to have to move me across the hall to the rooms facing the pool ( same exact room) but with sliding screen. My power went out in our room the evening before we left, I called and maintaince responded promptly. The wiring was done inproperly when they remodeled, can't fix, need to move. They sent a door key and told me to take my stuff across the hall. They kept calling for the other room key though. I finally had to tell them I had dinner reservations that I was running late for because I had to pack my whole room and move it across the hall, and get showered. Were there any type of apologies? NO!!!! Any compensation for my of any kind for being put out, NO!! I was told by someone @the hotel that there are labor relation problems and management is trying to do both jobs. If that's the case, TurtleBay is in big trouble. I should have known something when I found out Hilton sold this property!! Also don't go in the winter and risk not being able to swim in the protected coves as we were not 3 of the 5 days. The water was way too rough to snorkle and you couldn't even surf unless you were semi pro. Sorry it was long. Lots of anger built up I traveled 13hrs and nearly lost 5 days of vacation had I not driven out of the resort each day. By the way if you prepay like through a trvel agency, forget about leaving, without losing your money. Another lady told about that who tried , then I did, forget it. Queeney2

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the views are awesome from a huge percentage of rooms here. Unlike many Hawaiian hotels, ocean view here really means you get to view the ocean. The pool area is nice and the beach is one of the calmer ones on the North Shore so if you have kids who want to swim in winter, that's a good thing. However, service was very spotty -- bell boys were very helpful and friendly but room service and restaurant service as well as poolside service was mediocre at best and downright awful much of the time. Spa wasn't very great -- seemed a bit hectic and mis-managed when checking in and the locker room to change in was a mess. My biggest complaint, however, was the construction that's going on and the accompanying noise. We were there late December 2004/early Jan. 2005 and construction began at 7 a.m.!! Noisy beep-beep-beep-beep of heavy equipment backing up combined with jackhammers are not what I like waking up to! When we complained and asked to be moved to the other side of the hotel, we were told they were all sold out and were offered a $50 credit towards food during our stay. Hardly seems like a drop in the bucket with the price of the rooms. With rainy weather, being cooped up in the room was really annoying in light of the construction noise so I researched other possibilities on the island. When I discovered the JW Marriott had similiarly priced rooms with no construction, I asked the manager to move us there. Suddenly, there was a room available elsewhere... Anyway, if you are going to Turtle Bay anytime in the near future, they are building villas on the side where the main beach is, so make sure to request a room on the pool side (unless you enjoy construction noise). Nice setting but I wouldn't go back. Especially given the limited food options in the area (which you care about since the hotel food is pretty bad and high-priced). Two restaurants in nearby Haleiwa had run out of food by 8 p.m. on a Tuesday night!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: beautiful location. we stayed dec 21 and 22 '05 The north shore waves were the biggest in years and we had a bird's eye view from our 6th floor room. the staff was more than accomodating at every turn. we had room service both mornings and it was perfect and served beautifully. I had read a few bad reviews and wondered if we would run into any of the problems. If there was a union worker -employer problem it was not evident. We did get someone to talk about it but she said "I need this job" we would love to return and saw nothing but a wonderful resort that promotes relaxation. It is the only hotel on the north shore and it is 40 miles from the airport. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “North Shore Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived at Turtle Bay on December 23rd, 2004. This was our second time on Oahu, and knew not to stay on Waikiki with the kids. From the bell boys to all of management at the resort, we were greeted with the true Aloha spirit. The one time that we had a problem with our dinner, management apologized up and down, and even gave us a certificate for a free brunch later in our stay. Our room was clean, and the food was good. Our next trip to Oahu will certainly include Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but a great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort for our honeymoon from November 14-November 23, 2004. Unfortunately I do not have anything but complaints about our hotel stay. Our room had an overwhelming mold odor and the tiles in the bathroom around the bath tub were full of mold. The windows in the hallways leaked during rain showers, including down the hall walls. There was a maximum of 2 dining choices for each meal every day. We had to "pay-off" the pool-side waitresses to serve us, and the service we received was far from acceptable. After complaining to management, they advised the hotel did not have enough rooms booked to keep the restaurants open and offered us a room upgrade-from an ocean view room to a beach shack view room? When questioning why they would do such a thing, they replied that they were booked solid? That was our third day there and we never heard from any employee of the resort again. They had filming crews there for a tv show, blocking entry to areas of the resort for paying guests. We have for 3 years and will continue to travel to the islands of Hawaii once a year and have never experienced anything like this and will never stay at the Turtle Bay Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The deluxe ocean view 6th floor room smelled very moldy the minute we walked in the room. We couldn't store our cloths in the dresser because it smelled moldy too. A few hours after enjoying the ocean view, my husband had a headache, and our toddler was coughing. Even though the hotel wasn't crowded, the only rooms they offered were on the 3rd floor with a partial ocean view, and a great view of their convention center roof! It was not worth $330 a night. We think they cater to the convention crowd, versus families. We got room service because at 5:30pm it was the only way to get any food that day. The fish was ok, but the hamburger we ordered was raw in the middle, but we had tickets to the show at the Cultural center, so we didn't have time to send it back. My husband got sick from eating the hamburger. All in all, the mold in the "deluxe" rooms made it a place that we will never return to.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the resort December 12-17. This was our first time to the north shore of Oahu, and the resort was a very relaxing break from Honolulu/Waikiki traffic and crowds. The scenic views from our room lanai, and from all parts of the resort are beautiful. The resort grounds, and golf courses are very well maintained. We enjoyed our walks on the quiet beaches, swims in the bay & cove, in the resort pools, and seeing the turtles in Turtle Bay. The food is a little pricey, but well prepared. The staff that we dealt with were very professional, and helpful. We will return to the resort the next time that we come to Oahu - Our time there was great, and we ejoyed it completely. Your time here is what you make of it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing with great views!”
Reviews.Author: BelindaRosevilleCA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort Dec 13th - Dec 17th. It was our sixth visit to the islands, our first to Oahu. The property has excellent views. Our room was Dlx with a large balcony. The sunsets were breathtaking. We loved Lei Lei`s. The fish there is excellent, together with strong cocktails! Also, we booked through Costco, which included the free buffet breakfast, that we enjoyed. I would have to say though, that overall, the food was a let down. The property markets itself as a 'luxury resort,' and it is not. I guess that it would not be an issue if other options were close by and available, but a drive is required to almost anything. The staff were efficient and friendly. The pool area is beautifull. I noticed that the kids had great fun with the water slide. There is also a larger pool which nobody uses as its freezing. In short, this hotel has lots of potential. It could be great, its just missing a few ciritical elements.

Reviews.Title: “very good place for first time visitors.”
Reviews.Author: desert2ocean
Reviews.Content: First off the resort itself is great. I dont get the comments that the staff is clueless. when we walked in they upgraded us to a deluxe suite. Everyone there was very helpfull and nice. we were there dec 8th to the 13th. wed thur sat it was like our own pvt resort. Sat the honymooners came rolling in. but still did not seem crowded at all. We went on a horseback ride there were just us and one onther person. our guide was great. IT was our first time to hawaii so everyone gave us pointers. One complaint... the food. we are not big eaters so an all u can eat breakfast buffet is a waste. especially for 25 bucks a person. We had room service and 2 omletes for 50 bucks. I actually dont care about the price but the quailty should be much better. for the quailty the buffet should be around 12 to 15 bucks. dinner was roughly 100 bucks waiter never brought us drinks even after reminding him. The food was avg at best. all in all the staff is great the food lacks but who cares. We just went into haliewi (bad spelling sorry) they have plenty of resturants that are just fine. Haliewi joes jacobsons the haliewi cafe and a few local burger joints. Also there are shrimp stands everywhere. i dont know what your looking for but we found what we needed. RELAXATION. For our first time on oahu it was what we needed they took care of us told us where to go. now that we are comfortable knowing were things are we are going back in march. staying in haleiwa. On our last day we went through honolulu....could not believe how relieved we were that we didnt stay there. also check out eco tours the guys there and pat who runs it are great. snorkel with turtles and fish see dolphins its awsome. for 75bucks you will not have a better day. we cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Turtle Bay Dec. 17-22. Unbelievable views, in fact hotel was awarded best views on oahu (also awarded best Mai Tai on the Island in the hand ten bar by the pool). Found the rooms spacious with comfortable beds and nice linens. We had a small private deck to gaze at paradise. We slept with the lanai doors open and fell asleep to the crashing waves. My mother and I enjoyed the walking trails, the trail to the west was better than the eastern trail, offering more ocean views, better maintainance (markers, garbage pick-up) and more tropical foliage rather than forest. My step father played golf many times. The golf fees are pricey, but the employees clued him in that after 2pm the fees drop to half the normal rate. My husband snorkeled in the beach cove located directly under our lanai. The beach was all but private, most people seem to prefer the pool area. We had no problem finding chairs in the shade everyday. We went in to waikiki for a day and regretted ever leaving out hotel. Waikiki was overcrowded and not worth it. However if you are looking for a fast paced, night clubbing type vacation you would probably prefer to be in Waikiki. We found all the staff very friendly and helpful, we could not have been happier with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but resort needs help”
Reviews.Author: Shreddie
Reviews.Content: Being the only game in town, meaning the only resort hotel on the North Shore, Turtle Bay should be lock. The property has a spectacular location, albeit in winter time, a windy spit of land. We found the rooms very pleasant, beds comfy and views spectacular. We had to change rooms however after a malfunctioning air conditioner unit made the first night unbearable. After it was "fixed", we moved up one class of rooms the second night as it went on and off all night long. The large pool is sadly not heated so you have many people lounging poolside, but over the 6 nights we stayed, I saw two children get in it for about 5 minutes. Otherwise, no one used it. The smaller pool is comfortably heated but not configured for those who want to swim laps or use the pool for exercise. The worst knock is the food. While the Hang 10 was good for outdoor light eats, the hotel's other restuarants were WAY expensive for the quality. The food at dinner at the Palm Terrace was no less than horrible, the service, abysmal (and this on a slow night) and though I'm sure it was just our bad luck, a dead fly in the wine glass did nothing to warm our hearts. When management only credited back the glass of wine and threw in a free desert, we knew we were done. The sports bar is apparently only open on weekends which is a big faux pas as there is nowhere else casual to eat in the resort. Plus no place open for breakfast without spending a load on an overpriced buffet. Lei Lei's was also shut for renovations the day we tried to eat there, though it seemed to be open later in our stay. It is also not in the main complex but near the golf course. We checked out a day early after the surf competition we came to see was scratched for a second day, and returned to the warmer envirorns of Waikiki. My husband golfed both courses. The Palmer was a good challenge. Tough and fun. The Fazio is much easier, wider fairways etc but they had sanded the greens which is not much fun. Haleiwa had some great spots for eats, mainly the Heleiwa Cafe, Breakers and the Coffee Gallery. We just got used to making the 12 mile drive for meals. All in all, I expected more from such a pricey resort. They've got the best location, wonderful acreage and comfortable rooms but you get the feeling they are trying to cut corners and squeeze the customer. With a little help this place could be great...and perhaps for a shorter stay, the flaws wouldn't show so much.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at TBR from 11/24-11/29/04. We usually stay at the Kahala Mandarin but wanted to try something new this time. It's not a five-star hotel by any means---but once I focused on the positives, the charms of TBR slowly grew on me. First, the positives---even though we had an "oceanfront room" (vs. the more expensive "deluxe" ocean front)---the view was simply amazing--you could look out of the hotel room and onto the ocean with a view stretching to forever. The oceanfront rooms had a balcony for only one chair (vs. deluxe where you get 2 chairs and a table). To get a room with such a view anywhere would have cost 4 times as much! The rooms were very clean. The bathtub was small and leaked, with low shower pressure. But, it did have cool amenities (the shampoos/conditioners/soaps are made in hawaii with hawaiian ingredients!) No mini-bar, which was ok with me, since I usually don't use and are overpriced anyway, but the hotel provides a mini-fridge in the room, which is great because there's a Foodland about 15 minutes from the hotel, and we stocked up on fruit juices, milk, beer and bottled water. Also, there are washer/dryers on the premises---a necessity when traveling with messy toddlers on a long vacation. The pool area was fun--try to go on a weekday when it's not crowded---when it's crowded as it was on Saturday and Sunday, it's not as much fun because all the chairs are practically touching and it's uncomfortable to sit so close to strangers and hear their mundane conversations. The large pool was chilled (?)(according to the manager when we complained) and it was to the point of being uncomfortably cold. My husband couldn't swim in it---it was that cold. So, most of the swimmers converged on the smaller heated pool and it was too crowded to do any swimming, while the larger pool even on the crowded days had only 3 or 4 swimmers at the most. The jacuzzi was also crowded and the water was tepid and on the weekdays, when there was less of a crowd, wasn't heated at all. The ocean was swimmable but it was rocky with sharp coral---and the sand was littered---I think they should spend some money to have staff groom the sand every now and then. Unlike some of the other hotels, there is definitely friction btw. the management and the staff---and it shows by the attitude of the staff. They all seem unhappy. They are polite and cordial but unhappy. The staff would even vent out to me about it (how mgmt are subcontracting employees and how the staff has to pay for meals when practically good food from buffet have to be thrown out, etc.)(it's not an aloha spirit at all when the staff is being mistreated and as a guest I feel badly about it. Foodwise---very limited. The poolside had the typical cheeseburger/french fries/greasy selection. We had breakfast vouchers for the buffet every morning which saved $18.95/pp (ask for it if you are booking through costco's)---and there was so much food (fresh fruits, made to order omelettes, etc) that it got us through pretty much most of the day). I recommend Turtle Bay---you just have to go with the expectation that you are not staying at a four star or a 5 diamond hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate for the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: SarahASeattle
Reviews.Content: We came to Oahu on Sept 23 - Oct 2nd. We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 4 days and then we were really excited to head up to the North Shore for 4 days and stay at TBR for some quiet relaxation. Instead - we should have just gone home... Turns out, there was a Miss Hawaiian Tropic Beauty pageant going on at TBR the exact days we were there. This would have been nice to have known about. Upon our arrival (and that of the 200 others who were there as either participants in the pageant, family members, or photographers), we were greeted everywhere by signs promoting the pageant, flyers posted all around with their daily schedule on it... Overun... it basically felt like an MTV beach party meets college dorm... not something I would have paid what I paid to be there for. We should have left the hotel and gone somewhere else, but I kept thinking it had to get better, a hotel like this wouldn't let this event interfere with the stay of their guests. Little did I know there were only a few other people NOT there for the pageant... I started out with an open mind and kept giving the hotel the benefit of the doubt, it is a beautiful location, but this event and what it resulted in is more to the liking of a cheaper hotel chain... absolutely terrible. And the few guests, like ourselves, that were there vacationing, were not treated in accordance with the prices we paid and the ordeals we suffered. The pools were overrun every day by around 1:00 with 50 models doing photoshoots. Music and loudspeakers and never knowing what to expect at any moment. It was all in very poor taste. Dinner in the restaurant was a zoo every night since the groups just took up huge tables and walked around mingling at all of them. Made it quite noisy. It was a very negative experience and after talking with management, we realized how ineffective this hotel is and the reason for its lower rating. It is not at the level it prices itself at. But as the only hotel on the North Shore they get away with it. North Shore wasn't as spectacular as that. We should have left - but for sure we will never return to this hotel again. The price wasn't worth it for the service and staff, and the prices should have reflected the event because certainly, the folks there for the pageant didn't pay the same rates and yet the hotel bent over backwards to protect the 'event'. Very disappointed in this hotel, even if the pageant hadn't been going on, the hotel is less than spectacular. The views are great, but you can get the same thing for the same price on Maui and it's much more relaxing and the service on Maui has always been terrific everywhere we've gone. The rooms were not cozy, although the bed was comfortable there was no sitting chair or couch and there was plenty of room for it. The decorating is done in a rather cold manner and overall could use some updating. We ate in the really nice restaurant, Lei Lei's. It was really pricey, and not very full. The food was good and frankly it was worth the money to get away from the pageant people. This hotel could be first rate, it's the only one up on the North Shore and has the structure and location to be a first class operation. But it doesn't have the leadership to effectively carry that out. Overall, I know what my money is worth, I've stayed at many hotels over my travels and this experience was simply lame.

Reviews.Title: “Close to being a great resort”
Reviews.Author: usa352
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon on Oahu and the Big Island. Stayed at the TBR the last three nights of the trip. TBR is really the only resort on the North Shore, that’s why they charge more than everybody else. We stayed at nicer resorts during our stay (Mauna Kea Beach Hotel – Big Island), but they were in a more competitive region and couldn’t charge as much. The resort seems to be finishing a makeover, and I think they are trying to get close to making it worth the price. Positives: --Great area. The North Shore is fun and has lots of cool things to do and just watch. --Resort grounds are beautiful. --Front desk gave us an upgrade and bottle of champagne b/c we were on our honeymoon. --2 nice pools that weren’t crowded when we were there. The large pool is nice and deep. The smaller pool is heated and had a slide. --Hang Ten Bar is perfectly located for watching surfers and people watching in the pool area. Good drinks to. --I could watch the waves all day long, from my room or somewhere else on the grounds. --Leis Leis was a good selection for dinner (about the only choice-see below). It was raining that night and they had a covered golf cart running people back and forth. --One on One surf lessons are truly worth it! Lots of fun and an experience you need to have on the North Shore. I had Drew, nice guy who helped me out when I got tired! You never realize how much paddling is involved. --Staff is very friendly. Negatives: --The beach bar (Sand Bar) is horrible. My wife and I had lunch there while lying on the beach. We both got sick from the chicken wraps. They were disgusting! Beach and beach bar are also being overshadowed by a large resort construction project. Not easy to relax with the sound of power tools and with construction workers staring at you and your wife while you eat and relax. --The beach area in general stinks. The sand is porous and the atmosphere is not that of a beach. Waikiki and the Big Island had much better beaches and were a lot more fun. --You pay a lot of money for what you get, and then they close ½ the resort b/c it is ½ full. The Palm Terrace was never open for dinner while we were there. The Sports Bar always had a “limited menu.” Hang Ten closed early. 21 Degrees North wasn’t what we were looking for, as this was the end of our 2 week honeymoon and we had eaten at plenty of 5 star restaurants. We just wanted a casual meal. We were forced to drive into town each night. --Filming of the ‘North Shore’ television series can get in the way, especially in the pool area. Again, you pay a lot not to get pushed around by some producer’s schedule. It wasn’t too bad when we were there, but I can see how it could be. --Resort fee is stupid. We stayed at 5 different places while on our honeymoon. Most were nicer than TBR, all were less expensive. No other place had a resort fee. Unnecessary and I consider it gouging. --Room was in need of some spackling and fresh paint, especially around the air duct. The view from outside the room is awesome. Again, you pay a lot of money and expect the inside of the room to look better than an older Holiday Inn. All in all, the North Shore is a must do while on Oahu. The TBR is close to being a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon..”
Reviews.Author: Married_on_Kauai_04
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Turtle bay was there 11/8-11/13 We was married on Kauai 11/6. Turtle bay is the only resort i would ever think about staying at again on Oahu. We was on the 5th floor with excellent views in our ocean front room. Rooms were excellent with down comforters and pillows. 1 flaw was the green paint on the walls. We didnt have trouble with parking we paid valet upon arrival for all 5 nights. 1 phone call and the car was there before we could get to the lobby. Front desk, Concierge, bell desk, cleaning people, bartenders to the shopkeepers had excellent service skills and kept us happy all week. The snorkeling beach was a nice touch perfect for children and plenty of reef and fish out there too. Food sucks though and is overpriced. We ate away from the resort after the 1st day. Down the road though is giovanni's shrimp truck. pretty good just stay away from the super hot shrimp, believe them when they tell you that they are hot. Haliewa Joes was the best place i have eaten in my life . My wife and I ate there 3 days in a row. From 4:30-6:30 they have aloha hour. Try the fire peel and eat shrimp appetizer youll end up ordering another after you finish the 1st plate. We went to the south part of the island and was very disappointed it was dirty. Reminded me of downtown L.A with the graffiti, traffic and towering hotels with no parking. Beaches on the north shore were beautiful. We tried the Shark encounters tour. It is a must very majestic down in that cage. There was about 20 (12 footers down there) and one about 25 foot long. Dont wear your wedding ring in the water. I lost mine in the ocean. (luckily i reordered a new one once we got back to the resort.. My wife didnt beat me too bad. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Turtle Bay as our big splurge at the end of a 2 week vacation in the Islands. Boy was it worth it! The room was beautifully decorated, the bathroom large and just perfect to get ready in. The ocean view from our room was just unbelievable, you could literally open your balcony door and hear the waves crashing to shore. It was incredible. The pool was large and beautiful with a smaller cozy pool a few steps away that had a slide. And we went down that slide many times, so much fun (even though we're grown ups)! The hot tub was nice at night with the winds coming off the ocean. The poolside waiters were great and the prices were reasonable for sandwiches, snacks & drinks. You don't need to leave the resort, cause there's so much to do there, from horseback riding, tennis, snorkeling, surfing or just lounging around. And their breakfast buffet is not to be missed, it was excellent! That was a little pricey but we paid more for less at a resort at Waikiki Beach. It was so good we ate there 2 mornings in a row, in spite of the price. Over all just a really wonderful time! And a little tip for people staying in that area, Sunset Pizza at Sunset Beach, 10 minutes West of the hotel had to be the best pizza I've ever had in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from our Honeymoon 11-7-04 to 11-14-04”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our honeymoon at the resort and we both loved it!! The staff were all excellent and were there for any needs you could have. We were upgraded upon check in (no extra charge) and had a great view of the pacific from the second floor with a large balcony. If you are looking for a place away from the busy city life this is it! This was both our 1st visit to Hawaii, and both of us were sure glad we stayed out of the south end.....we visited 1 day and that was enough (super busy and a tourist trap..you need to hit Pearl Harbor 1 day though...a must). Turtle Bay offeres a ton of stuff to do without leaving the resort grounds...helicopter rides, snorkeling, golf, spa, swiming, surfing, a beach, and horseback riding on the beach (which is great with very freindly guides.) You are also only minutes from all the north shore beaches (sunset/pipe line, sharks cove, etc) The hotel rooms are beautifull and clean with plenty of space..you feel like you have a small condo. The cleaning staff does a great job and our very polite. We had a mini fridge in our room which was also great. The bathrooms are large and the bed was very comfortable. The grounds of this resort are amazing...clean and offer views you see on post cards. It seems that all ages have fun here from young to old. (i'm 27 and my wife 29) If you want the relaxing vacation/honeymoon this is the place for you..if your more into clubs. nightlife, action then you might be happier in the south end of Oahu. The only problem we ran into was that parking was a BIG problem. The hotel is resurficing the lots and did not leave much open to park..this made parking (at night) a problem. This was a very minor problem that didn't hurt our stay. Food was great (breakfest buffet is excellent with an amazing view!) but don't waste your $ on 21 degress north..this is the resorts high end restraunt that we went to one night for a dress up night..food is just ok and not worth the very expensive price tags...eat at the buffet or the golf club. If you need to use the salon (my wife chopped off her hair for fun) they do a great job!! She loves her new cut and so do I. In all you can't go wrong with this place! We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Fabulous, Peaceful... Can't say Enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutley beautiful! If you are looking for a peaceful, enjoyable, romantic get away. Then this would be the place. My husband and I spent a week here for our anniversary. The rooms are comfortable, the views are gorgeous and there is so much to explore at the resort. If you are looking for some peace and quiet and just sitting back enjoying the views and the sounds, it is the perfect place for that. We even saw a Hawaiian Monk sleeping on the beach. My husband and I explored, went snorkeling and sometimes just sat and listened to the ocean. The last night we got stuck at the airport and they put us up in Waikiki. We hated it!!! It was loud, we couldnt sleep, we had just gotten so used to all the quiet and waking up opening up our patio doors and listening to the ocean. If you don't think this place is absolutely wonderful, you have to be crazy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone at Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: doularose
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at TBR we were there from 11/1/-11/06. If one of you enjoys relaxing at the pool with a good book while the other, swims, surfs, paddles, golfs, horseback rides, and snorkels then stay here. The food was great, the staff was excellent. We also drove down the road to Giovannis White Shrimp truck and had two hugh plates of Shrimp Scampi for $11 each. Stopped by Foodland and brought home two bottles of coconut syrup for pancakes. Went to the swap meet on Wednesday and found plenty of bargins. Go and stay at the TBR A+

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights 10/30-10/31/2004. Loved it!!!! If you enjoy the sounds of the ocean at night....then this is your place. What a peaceful retreat!!! The grounds are gorgeous!!! There is SOME construction...but thats how things STAY gorgeous. Rooms are nicely decorated, bathrooms huge. Recommend getting the Breakfast buffet with the room rate, buffet was GRAND!!!! Had dinner at the Sandbar....GREAT Kabobs....some live music....barefoot on the sand!!!! If you NEED dress shoes, the sandbar isnt for you. Good drinks at HangTen, and the Sandbar. Make sure to take your camera and go "explore" the shoreline.....simply amazing!!! IF we go back to Oahu (we loved the big Island) we will most definately go back to the Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Cottages beautiful; services inadequate; staff miserable”
Reviews.Author: tetheredincolorado
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (boys ages 12 and 15) just returned from our first trip to Hawaii. We Stayed at Turtle Bay on Oahu for 4 days followed by Kona Village on the Big Island for 3 days. Truly, we wish we had stayed at Kona Village the entire time as Turtle Bay did not meet our expectations. We stayed in Cottage 100; the one closest to the main resort complex. It was beautiful. While the hotel is generally rated as a 3 star, the cottage seemed much more in line with other 4 star accomodations in which we have stayed. The bathroom was huge and beautiful, and the room, with its vaulted ceilings, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, and excellent location directly on the beach was spectacular. Sadly, that's where the good part ended. I'll give a brief day by day replay of our experience so you can understand what I mean. None of our problems were that huge, but the total impact of them has left us unwilling to stay there again... Day 1- We arrived at about 4 pm. Check-in went quickly. We were told, however, that the bellmen did not deliver luggage to the cottages. Not particularly a huge deal, we didn't think, until we had to spent about 15 minutes looking for a place to park and ended up lugging our stuff about 1/3 of a mile to reach the cottage. The surf was up you see, and on the north shore, that means surfers. So many of them that even the fire lanes of the parking lot had cars parked in them. The parking lot for the cottages even had cars blocking one of the two entrances. Trust that I have no grudge against the locals' use of the beach there, but the hotel should certainly reserve SOME space for the guests and enforce it. That night we were completely over it, had a pleasant meal at Lei Lei's and were looking forward to our stay. The next morning I was awoken at 5:30 by voices outside our room. Turned out there was a surfing competition planned for that day and the registration tents and PA system apparently had to be less that 30 feet from our door. I don't want to complain too much about this, as it was interesting to watch the competition, and I had a few interesting conversations with the competitors' moms. I imagine some people would have been furious, though. The hotel would have done well, I think, to have given us some type of a heads up. The rest of the day went well, and I really didn't mind sharing the pools and spas with the competitors and their families. The next day, we explored the island, so no complaints until we returned to the hotel for dinner. As cottage guests, we had been invited to a 4 pm tea in the lobby. So, we cleaned up for dinner and headed for the main part of the hotel to attend. When we got there, there was an employee with a little cart of liquor and various wines. We told her we had come for the tea. She then explained that they had decided to stop the tea receptions that very day. So, we asked if we could have a complimentary glass of wine instead.- No. Ok, could we charge a glass of wine to the room?- No, it was cash only. Please! A little frustrated, we headed over to the Palm Terrace for the Buffet we had read about in our in-room folder. We were told that the hotel was only at about 50% occupancy so they would not be having the buffet, and that we'd have to order off of a limited menu instead. We were hungry so we stayed. The meal was so, so. The service was very good, though. Day 3- The next day was extremely rainy. After breakfast at Lei Lei's, we managed to sneak a hike in before the deluge hit. Being on the North Shore in the rain is no fun at all as there is absolutely nothing else around to do that is indoors. So, we gave the kids money for the arcade at the hotel before eating lunch at the Hang Ten Bar (which had glass walls for protection against the wind and rain). Sadly, we had to endure the staff complaining about management; a regular occurence there. Heck, by that time I had a few complaints of my own! We returned to the cottage and paid for a couple of in-room movies to keep the kids and ourselves occupied. Then, around 4 or 5, it dawned on us the the World Series was going on and we could watch the game and grab a bite at the hotel's sports bar, The Bay Club. Thus began a series of small diasappointments which ultimately left us VERY ready to move on to the big island the next day. We got to the Sports Bar, had a drink and enjoyed the game for about an hour. Then, when we asked for a menu, we were told that they were not serving food that evening due to the occupancy rate of only 50%. Pretty dumb considering the rain had stranded so many of us and, duh, the World Series was on! We were pretty hungry, so we proceeded to the Palm Terrace hoping for the buffet but figuring we'd get the limited menu again. NOT! We were told that due to the hotel's occupancy, the Palm Terrace was CLOSED entirely, leaving only the expensive 21 Degrees North open. That's when we began to get pretty frustrated. The kids did not want a fancy, expensive dinner and neither did we. We decided to run across the parking lot to Lei Lei's. We arrived, soaking wet as the hotel had no umbrellas for us to borrow, only to discover that we would have to wait for a long time to be seated. (Duh, again. The hotel had closed all but the most expensive restaurant! Lei Lei's is independently owned which is why it was open, I imagine.) By that time, we were so hungry that we decided to go back to the room and order room service instead. Running back to the cottage, we all decided that a simple pizza, as was listed on the room service menu, would suit us just fine. Can you guess what happened next? That's right! They weren't serving pizza that night due to the occupancy rate. In the end, we were forced to go off property, in the rain, for a meal! Ridiculous. To sum up: The accomodations were great. The management is pretty darn unsavvy, though. It shows in the attitudes of the employees and in the experiences of guests like us. In the end, 50% occupancy or not, we were paying full price for our cottage room- over $400.00 per night. If they are going to slash the the availability of food, they should have also slashed the price of the room. Won't ever go back unless I hear that the management has changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, very nice, helpful and friendly. The location is terrific with lots of trails and beach front and rooms are nicely appointed. For us, the only downside was food - buffet's were a big hit here and we find those are usually too much money with too much food. Meals were also large with very few options for nice appetizer's and drinks for dinner. We did find fabulous food at Giovanni's Shrimp truck - the garlic shrimp were amazing! We also had fantastic food at Haleiwa's Joe's - lots of local things and a great deal of variety with nice salads, appetizers and smaller items, although wonderful large dinners too if that's what you want. We'd return to the resort but would probably eat most meals away just because there were no nice, but ligher options. There is evidently a labor dispute; we saw picketers one evening. I'm not sure what the issues are, but their staff is certainly wonderful and I'd encourage the resort to end this as soon as possible. The resort is nice, but the staff really make it a place to enjoy, they are genuinely warm and friendly rather than aloof and stuffy. One last note, Waimea Beach, especially early morning is worth a visit or two.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip and I hate to say it but our stay at the Turtle Bay Resort was just average. We had just come from Maui where we stayed at the Sheraton and were thrilled so we weren't horribly sad to leave Maui as we knew we were headed to Turtle Bay, but we ended up being disappointed. Our room was oceanfront as promised but was over a ugly roof and the balcony was zilch.....you could stand out there but it had no room for a chair. The room itself seemed to be missing furnishings. By the balcony door there is usually a chair to sit in but there was just a big space with nothing and the walls seemed blank with just one picture. I thought I was just being girly about it but even my husband mentioned it so I knew something wasn't right. Also the room seemed dark. Weird. Anyhow- other than that, I know the property was just fixed up and it is....the rooms are clean, the hotel itself and the restaurants are all nice. The pool is OK. The whole property is just missing that extra "wow" we thought we would get for the $$ we were paying each night. This place is a place to stay for people that just want to stay put on a property. For others like us that like to leave and explore, get ready to see not much....well, other than great surf. If you are a surf freak like my husband you will be fine, if you aren't you will get bored with the outside surroundings of the property. We left alot and went to the only near town South of Turtle Bay for dinner and one day while exploring in another direction we accidentally ran across where "Lost" is being filmed on the beach. (Which first scared us as we thought we just ran upon a plane wreck!) But other than that we just wished we stayed on Maui longer. Hate to say we were disappointed but we were.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the North Shore”
Reviews.Author: coastermeister
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here 10/4/04 to 10/9/04 and we loved every peaceful, beautiful moment. This place is great and what a perfect location. The North Shore of Oahu is true Hawaii. In planing the trip we did a lot of reading and research and decided that Waikiki was probably not for us. If tropical New York City is what you want then by all means stay in Waikiki but if you like peace, solitude and beautiful surroundings then go to Turtle Bay Resort and the North Shore. The resort staff all went out of their way to help make the stay wonderful and everyone we encountered was friendly and cheerful. In planning the trip we were torn between spending the extra money for one of the cottages or to just go with a room with the large lanai. After having been there I can say we made the right choice by not getting the cottage. The cottages are not individual cottages but actually quad-plexes. Being that they are all single story and ground level the view is much more limited. We had room 626 which is on the west side of the south wing and the view was incredible but all the rooms have good views. All the extras at the resort are expensive but the kids program was reasonable at $55 and they got a meal, a visor, a tee shirt and a very nice turtle backpack. The only meal we ate at the resort was the evening barbecue (grilled items) at the Sandbar on the beach. The food was very good and the atmosphere being right there on the beach was wonderful. The meal was reasonable at $18 which included appetizer, main course with rice and dessert. Our other meals were at locals hangouts on the North Shore which saved us big bucks and we had some very good meals. Be aware that staying on the North Shore requires a lot of driving to get around and see the island so if you're accustomed to having everything within 5 minutes of the house you might not be happy here. The North Shore with its farms, ranches and beautiful parks is the place for me.

Reviews.Title: “are you sure the first reviewers stayed here?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first stay at Turtle Bay Resort on Oahu from 9/2004-9/8/04 was a joy to experience! I shared a room with a longtime friend, and the room was very spacious, clean, with 2 full closets, one for each of us, an iron, hair dryer, toiletries, clean sheets, towels, room with a gorgeous view of the ocean overlooking the pool, and a great lanai. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly, going out of their way to advise us of good local spots to see, and dine at (try Giovanni's fish truck!). We took advantage of the $50.00 room meal credit, and found it more than adequate to pay for both of our dinners nightly. There was free poolside entertainment every night, the lobby is magnificently decorated. I can't say enough about the courteous staff at the desk, and at poolside, where fresh towels were provided at a moment's notice. Yes, there were some local people in the jacuzzi and pool, but they were very friendly. Oh, also, the food/chefs were phenomenal, providing great variety, and fresh food nightly. Perhaps some people might not like locals, and require a mint on their pillow, or help within one second of their request, and perhaps I am more laid back than some of the reviewers, but I found everyone to be happy, courteous, and friendly. I love Hawaii, and relish the laid back lifestyle, without the hustle and bustle, and find the slow pace relaxing and enjoyable. If the prior reviewers didn't have a great time, maybe Hawaii altogether is not for them! This was my 3rd trip to Hawaii, and the first stay at Turtle Bay, and I would highly recommentd it to all. Keep your mints, give me happy people, great food, and a real sense of Aloha anytime! Oh, and you can have the tourist influenced Polynesian Village, too! THAT is NOT the Hawaii I have come to cherish! Aloha and Mahalo Hawaii for your heart!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Peaceful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGirl01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our fourth trip to Hawaii the first week of September. We spent three nights at the Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore to try something new. The grounds are beautiful, the pool area is spectacular - it has a slide and separate pool for the little ones and a big, deep pool right on the edge of the ocean with a great bar (Hang Ten Bar) for drinks and a lunch menu right at the pool. The beach was nice and water was ok, lots of coral and rocks. The rooms were very nice and the restaurants were great. The one complaint I would have is that they claim EVERY room (and I quote) has "picturesque views of the Pacific Ocean"....not exactly true. We had a Delux Ocean FRONT room, but when we got to our room, the view was pointing back towards the mountains and overlooking the bay infront of the cottages, you couldn't even see the open ocean or the sunset for that matter (we were assured on checkin that it was a sunset room). We tried to switch rooms and no one went out of their way to help...we waited in our room for calls back from managers and the front desk that never came. We were completely ignored when it came to having a problem, we were extrememly frustrated, especially having been assured on checkin that this was a perfect room with full ocean view and sunset view. Finally the next day a new manager was more than happy to help and got us a better room. The funny thing about this resort is that all the Delux rooms face the pool area and the mountains, and all the Premium rooms (with a smaller lanai) face the ocean and have much better views. But overall, it was a great hotel and we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Ughhhhhhhhhhhhhh...”
Reviews.Author: YoungDallasCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turtle Bay in early September 2004, and were very disappointed. Beyond rude staff, horrible 1960's hallway/room decor, and extremely slow help, the thing that bothered us the most was that the resort was completely overrun with locals. They took over the pool area during the day so chairs and room to play were scarce, and they completely filled the two hottubs every night despite signs all over the place that said "hotel guests only". Once, a staff member came by and asked if we were all guests and what room number we were in, but the nonguests just made up room numbers and snickered after the guy left. It was annoying to come all the way to Hawaii and spend a fair amount of money to not be able to use the pool and hottubs at the resort. Some of the staff were genuinely friendly (chefs and front desk people), most were "forced" friendly and some were just plain rude. For example, there is a desk at the pool area where you can acquire towels for the beach/pool. When I asked for a towel around 8:30am, the two women at the desk gave me a dirty look and curtly told me that they were in the wash, then they "dismissed" me and rolled their eyes at each other. I guess I was out of line to ask for a pool towel at the pool. Our experience here was negative overall and we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Vegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for two nights. We booked a cottage thru costco travel at a lower than the advertised internet rate. Check-in was not a good experience. We arrived @ 3:15 pm and our room was not ready. We also asked for a king and we got 2 queen beds. not a big deal. We had to ask for a drink coupon while we waited. We came back 35 minutes later and it was still not ready. So we waited another 10 minutes while they fumbled around with the phones. They did not offer us another drink coupon ( they should have). They finally gave us our keys and we were off. We had to walk thru the parking lot to get there, no transportation offered. At least they delivered our luggage. When we got there, the cottage was still being cleaned! Had to wait on the grass for another 10 minutes. But once we got in the room, everything got better. The cottage was very clean and spacious. In fact I would say it was great. nice beds and decor. We had a butler (more like a on-call conceirge), He was very cool and not pushy. Service was definitely much better now and would continue to be. We had cottage #111. very close to the water, nice patio. We had the last cottage in the building, so we only had 1 neighbor. There was a grass and plant area to our other side. very private except for one thing. There was some foot traffic between our patio and the bushes in front of the water. Instead of walking on the beach, they would walk infront of our patio. not alot of traffic, but enough to mention. We ate at the restuarant by the club house. It was good and reasonable. The grounds are nice. The pool is nice and deep. A rarity these days. Although, the deck area is small and was crowded. The drinks at the bar are reasonable as well. The bay is very nice and the water was clear. We saw lots of turtles. The beach is not so good. In fact, we would leave the resort to go to the better beaches just west of Turtle Bay. The parking area is bad. It is a free for all. They should have assigned parking near the cottages. I believe this is the only resort in the North Shore area so you don't have alot of choices. It is worth a stay if you have never been, but it was pricy and there is room for a lot of improvement. I love the North Shore and next time, I will stay longer and try to rent a private cottage or house. After all it is all about the beach and the resort misses on that note.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall - Important tips for those visiting in Early-Mid Sept.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want a more relaxed Hawaiian island feel on Oahu, without having to go to Maui, Kauai, etc. The views are incredible!! (Important info for those visiting between now & Sept. 17th, 2004.. see my notes below) Pros: - Turtles! - They are easy to see and will float right by the shoreline. - Complimentary Wireless Broadband. This is great, however the bandwidth got a little bogged down around 5pm, so FYI - A couple of great servers by the pool, especially Taryn & Lisa, very friendly, good Customer Service, Also the bellmen were very helpful. - Pool Convenience Store: Prices were low like ABC stores, which suprised me as you are basically isolated at the resort, so this was a nice suprise and snacks & drinks & beach gear were reasonable. - Close to all the North Shore Beaches if you want some variety. - "Hang 10 Surf Bar" by the pool is a great place to relax and watch the sunset. Also, on Wed & Fri's at sunset there is a 15 min luau type show from the Polynesian Cultral Center, so it's good if you don't have time to catch an luau. (**see my note about the pool below) Cons: - Main Pool Maintenance until Sept 17th!: Main pool is closed (being resurfaced) from Sept 7-17th. We left on the 8th, so it wasn't a big deal for us, but they did not mention this at check in and did not tell us until we got a letter under our door on the 6th. The water slide pool and child pools (smaller) are still available. Also, b/c the larger pool is closed so is the "Hang 10" Surf Bar :( If you are a pool person & would use the main pool area between now and the 17th this may be a big deal for you. - Customer Service Level really varied from staff member to staff member. Front Desk staff overall were very complacent, so don't assume anything and ask if you are unsure on anything. - Restaurants: A little $$-$$$ and the food was ok. You may want to drive in Haliewa (~15 min) for some variety. FYI: Starbucks is across from Sunset beach by Foodland. (~5-10 min away)

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: mvina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week's trip to Turtle Bay Resort and couldn't have asked for a better stay. The resort was beautiful. We loved the walking trails throughout and even happened across a sea lion one day just basking in the sun. It was amazing! We had an ocean view room. It was big and spacious compared to other hotels that I have stayed at with a large bathroom and closet area. We loved leaving our window open at night and listening to the waves breaking. Clean and spacious. The only problem we had was we had no safe in our room. We brought it up with Guest Relations and they said that we could switch if we wanted to. We decided not too and in the end they waved the $12/day resort fee! Everyone there is super nice and accomodating. Always a smile on everyone's face. We didn't eat at the resort too much. We had complimentary breakfast buffet vouchers to the Palm Terrace every morning since we booked through Expedia and it was so nice. Breakfast was great and they had a plentiful spread for all tastes. We had lunch at Hang Ten a few days and also grabbed something quick for lunch at The Sandbar by the beach. We also ate at Lei Lei's one night but spent the other nights in town at Halewia. A definite must! You need a car when you stay out here to drive around since the hotel is far from Honolulu. In Halewia you have to eat at Cholo's Mexican Restaurant in the North Shore Marketplace. We loved it so much, we ate there twice! Also try Jameson's and Halewia Joe's for dinner and to watch the sunset. I loved being at Turtle Bay because you were so far away from the hubbub of the city life. It is so secluded and a piece of paradise. The pool area is beautiful with a great view of the surf and you can sit and watch the surfers all day. If you are a beach person, there really isn't a big beach to sit at with chairs. We didn't mind that and enjoyed sitting at the pool, but if that is something you are looking for, keep that in mind. There are three pools at the resort. A large pool, a kid's pool and a medium sized pool with a super fun water slide that even the adults were trying! There are also 2 jacuzzi's. Everywhere you look while at the pool area, you can see the beautiful surf and landscape. If I know of anyone that is traveling to Oahu, I would only recommend staying here. Waikiki and the hotels down there looked like a mini Miami Beach to me and crowded. Smack dab in the center of the city. The JW Marriott is next to a huge plant. (We went to the Paradise Cove luau next door. A must!!!) The Turtle Bay Resort is the only hotel away from it all. Scenic views, beautiful landscapes, a bit of local Hawaii. Clean, friendly, and a true piece of paradise. A+++ to Turtle Bay. I would def. return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is Red Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Turtle Bay Resort on a day trip to check out all the hub-bub. After touring the facilities, pool and beach areas we were nicely impressed. In fact, I was seriously considering staying here on our next trip to Oahu until...."RED BAY". Upon strolling down the beach and being fascinated by the rugged coastline and various sea critters, we happened upon an apparently man made river of red mud dumping into the ocean. The red river mud was so pervasive it discolored the entire bay area for at least 1/2 a square mile. We don't think it to be a pollution problem as such - but what an ugly eye-sore! And what an absolute shame that something like this would have to ruin our very nice opinion of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our stay...and most enjoyabel two days”
Reviews.Author: GTHER
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel of our nine (9) day stay (End of July). We enjoyed it the most! Rooms were clean, fresh and well furnished. Free wireless Internet was a double bonus for late night emails with the mainland. If you are really looking to get away from it all, this hotel is great….there is nothing else around. Our favorite times of the day were early morning and sunset. Sitting on the point, drinking a Hawaiian Mai Thai, listing to the rolling waves splash against the rocks and watching the sunset was just short of amazing. The name Turtle Bay is well represented. We experienced giant sea turtles during our whole stay. You could watch them casually swinging throughout the bay and even come pretty close to them while snorkeling. We ate both nights at Leila’s (sp not sure). Food was very good and reasonably priced. The only shortcoming was a shortage of lounge chairs at the pool. They could really ad another two dozen or so…or make sure they are reserved for hotel guests only. We will definitely come back and next time will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay was great-I would actually rate is about 4.5. We are a family of four-with kids ages 6&9. This is the place to stay if you want an uncrowded, beautiful setting. We stayed in a beach cottage, which I would highly recommend. There is a lot of walking because the property is so big, but we don't mind that. However, you can always call for a golf cart ride form the beach cottages (Ithink we did that twice). Highlights: Turtles feeding every evening infront of our cottage. They are at the waters' edge about 25 feet from our patio door. Hiking was great. The beach was good, and we loved the pools- we thought there was a good separation for adults w/o lids-there is a separate pool and Jacuzzi away from the kids pool. Pool slide was great, and pool temp was perfect! Our beach cottage was beautiful. Houekeeping weas great, tropical fruit each day, and macaroons wrapped in tea leaves each night. Food at the resort was O.K. I did not think it was any more expensive than most resorts. Breakfast was excellent, and included in our room deal which made it even better. We ate at 21 Degrees one night while our kids were at KeiKei camp- the food was pretty good- apps and salads-excellent, the fish dishes we ordered had a little too much going on. Too many flavors, not really fused together. However, the hawaiian ceaser and lobster bisque were excellent! LeiLeis was good- the food was very good, it is a bit noisy, but OK with the kids. We found our best eats in Haleiwa (pronounced ha-LI-va). Haliewa Joes is great! Sunset Pizza on the road just outside the resort is amazing! We should have done Take-out from there and dined on our patio. Giovannis Shrimp truck has phenonmenal shrimp scampi-don't be put off by the "truck" style ktchen and picnic tables- it was a wonderful dining experience! ALSO, Shark's Cove cafe- another casual roadside eatery is great! They have burgers, excellent fish kebabs served with local, fresh salad and corn, and wht or brn rice. They have many other items, too. Other highlights: Shark's Cove was good for snorkeling, but we LOVED "3 Tables"- great swimming beach, and great snorkeling. 3 Tables is just past Shark's cove. We also swam at Waimea Beach- beautiful! Don't miss Mr. Bill's Original Glider rides! That was the best! We loved it! It is a must do for anyone! My husband and older son went with a very daring pilot and had the thrill of their life, and I went with my younger son and had the more tame, but funny and friendly Mr. Adrian for our pilot. This is a not-to-be-missed thrill! Polynesian Culture Center was great, too. However, it was a bit warm when we went. Also, the buffet was a bit of a "cattle-call"- I would eat at their stands around the park, or get the menu dinner, although I don;t know if it was any better. The guided tour was O.K. You may be better off getting there when they open at 12:00, and taking yourselves around- you would probably see more, and get to do more of the hands-on things- our guide steered us mostly to the dance demos- which you get plenty of at the evening show. Still, hats off to the Church of Latter Day Saints - they have created something really special, and not to be missed. Loved North shore and Turlt Bay. I wpould go back in a heart beat. Oh, Horseback riding looked awsome- but my younger son did not meet the age and height requirements (7, 4foot4 inches)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, plan your meals carefully!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay from 7/24 - 7/28 and had a very pleasant experience. Pros: A great escape from Waikiki/Honolulu, nice pool area, fabulous dinner at 21 Degrees North, great location to access snorkling, scuba and culture in Hawaii, comfortable rooms - though not what I would call LUXURY. Cons: All food is OVERPRICED - and this is coming from a New Yorker! You have a couple options though: 1. set a high dining budget; 2. pick up lunch & snack items at the local Foodland; 3. drive to Hale'aiwa for breakfast or dinner (15 mins away). Overall, it is a beautiful location with a friendly staff. If money is no object, stay in one of the beach cottages and eat at 21 Degrees every night!

Reviews.Title: “Like Hawaii used to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two kids, ages 10 and 13, just returned from a fantastic trip to Turtle Bay. Conde Naste traveler listed it as a "find" and I tend to follow their recommendations...I was not disappointed! Go to Waikiki if you want crowds, jet ski noise, shops and night life. Come to Turtle Bay if you want "old Hawaii" where everyone treats you like a local and there are street vendors who sell you shave-ice from their little stands or delicious "hula" chicken right off the spit! The resort has beach cottages that are a short walk to the main resort amenities like the pool and restaurants (when the walking bridge is finished it will be even better). Even with two kids, we had more than enough room with a huge space with 2 fluffy queen beds and wood floors and hot towels when you checked in. The best part of the beach cottages was that the turtles would feed right off the reef right below the cottages. They were there every day and it was an awesome experience to watch them peak their heads out of the water! We will definitely go back! Not one complaint...the place was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Go to Turtle Bay to relax”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 day stay at Turtle Bay Resort after staying 2 days in Waikiki and 7 days on the Pride of Aloha cruise ship. What a relaxing time at Turtle Bay. I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The grounds were beautiful and the view from our room was fabulous. Water everywhere around you. The room was large. The staff was extremely friendly. You definitely have to have a Lava Flow from the poolside bar. We will definitely come back to Turtle Bay but stay more than 2 days next time. I recommend you try the Polynesian Cultural Center (about 10 minutes away) when you visit Turtle Bay. We had an excellent time and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Still going strong”
Reviews.Author: Cobramom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with another couple, stayed at Turtle Bay from 7/1/04 to 7/4/04. This was our second stay and we would definitely return again. The rooms are large, clean, with very comfortable beds and linen. Plenty of amenities (soap, shampoo, lotion, bathgel, iron, ironing board, fridge, inroom coffee). The service was impeccable, no signs of labor disputes as previous reviews have mentioned. You do see some "Boycott Turtle Bay" signs in front yards along the highway near the resort though. PROS: Great rooms/service/spa/hair salon, fantastic views, ate twice at Lei Lei's by the golf course because it was so good. Huge grounds to walk, plenty of things to do - snorkel, horse back ride, golf, hike - it's just a georgeous place to stay. Well worth the drive from overcrowded, overrated Waikiki. CONS: Pool hours are far too short. The pool/jacuzzi closes at 7:00 so forget sitting in the jacuzzi at sunset. When it is open, it's filled with screaming kids most of the time, so forget about swimming any laps too. Don't get me wrong, I like children but it would have been nice to have some "adult only" hours (like 8 to 10 PM) so you could go relax in the jacuzzi without someone doing a running, screaming cannonball 5 feet from you, or wailing that their brother won't stop splashing them, etc. NOTE: Rooms come with two different lanais.
