The deluxe has a lanai the width of your room with two chairs with a wide ocean view; the next step down is a smaller lanai with one chair that overlooks the ocean and public beach/snorkeling bay. You can save yourself some money and go for the smaller lanai if you don't plan on spending hours out there. It's more than comfortable to sit and read, but for laying out you'd be more comfortable on the beach. While the price difference between these two rooms can be up to $30/night, the views are only marginally different.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay -- Too awesome to describe!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Turtle Bay from June 26- July 1 for our 10 year anniversary. It was absolutely fabulous. I visited this website quite often when trying to decide which hotel to stay at. I hope this will help someone else, too. Hands down, we were so glad we made the decision to stay at Turtle Bay. It was gorgeous. Room 512 and all other rooms on that wing have gorgeous ocean views with a view of pools and landscaping as well. Pools and hot tub were great. Breakfast buffet was out of this world. Poolside food was also delicious. For beach, I would suggest 1.5 miles down the road to Sunset Beach (awesome!). For snorkeling, we would get our equipment every day at Turtle Bay and then drive a few miles down the road to Shark's Cove -- best snorkeling we found. The drive to Honolulu was not bad -- about 50 minutes. We were definitley glad we did not stay in Wakiki. Extremely crowded! Turtle Bay was beautiful, plush, and away from the hustle and bustle yet plenty of things to do. I hope to return next year. P.S. Paradise Cove luau was one of our best attractions -- don't miss it! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay vs. Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: R0bot
Reviews.Content: I was a Turtle Bay resident from 6/13-6/20/2004. It's a great place to stay! I went there for my honeymoon (which was great by itself but this is a review of the hotel, not the honeymoon!) The hotel has a scenic location & plenty to do; trails, horseback riding, snorkeling, tennis, golf, helicopter tours, and even a paddleboarding competition when we were there. If you are looking to come to Hawaii & do nothing but party, go to Waikiki. Enjoy the crowds, the traffic, and the summertime heat. If you are looking to party PLUS relax, see the rest of the island, and have a 'complete' Hawaii experience, go to Turtle Bay. It's one of the only places on Oahu you can do all those things. Some people get put off because it's a drive from Honolulu airport. If you have a drivers license don't let that stop you, the drive alone is great and not that far (about 40-50 minutes). Everyone I encountered at Turtle Bay was very friendly & helpful, no exceptions. The North Shore is the best place to visit in Hawaii, hands down. And I looked at all of them on Oahu. There is plenty to do & the most friendly people on Hawaii. Other places make you feel like either an intruder or an alien. Turtle Bay costs a little more than Waikiki hotels but it's well worth it. This was my first trip to Hawaii & I wanted to make sure it was a good one. It was; I'm glad I made the choice I did.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at Turtle Bay served our group with a constant goal of only the highest professional standardsl. The staff sought me out to ensure that our needs were being met throughout our 3 day event there. During our stay there was no evidence of any type of labor dispute that ever hindered our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Almost 2 weeks ago, after spending 4 days in Waikiki, we checked into the Turtle Bay Resort. We love Waikiki, but have now discovered a new favorite in the Turtle Bay Resort, we even extended our trip to stay there a couple of extra days. Gorgeous sunsets and sunrises could be seen from anywhere, including your hotel room. The kids and us absolutely loved the oceanfront pool area, it wasn't supercrowded and very relaxing. In response to some of the neg. posts, not sure why some would let a lil construction disrupt their vacation experience, but the closed pathways that the other poster described only meant you had to step a few feet away onto their lush lawns to get around in some areas. To be honest, the hotel, the coastal scenery, the pools and the beach were so beautiful we didn't notice the construction going on. As for the resort fee, well how hard is it to pretend that the room was $212 instead of $199, etc. Every other hotel charges the extra $10 for parking and time to use services like internet, etc. anyway, so it's a wash. The rooms were spotless, modern new decor and the beds were the most comfortable we slept in on the trip. Some of the lanais are very small but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. For food options, 2 adults and 2 kids spent one day at the pool, had a lunch from the poolside bar and grill, including a few Pina Colodas and Mai Tais (which were really good), along with some beers, the tab was $80, not bad considering all the cocktails. Because the Resort's restaurants were expensive, the rest of the time we went to nearby Haleiwa for dinners and bought our own breakfast and soft drinks at the nearby grocery store (10mins away) and kept it in the mini-fridge. A note about the staff. They are exceptionally friendly and helpful here. They seemed to go that extra mile to make you feel special, everytime we called the front desk, Lydia greeted us warmly and by name, Carol gave me and my daughter fresh flower leis on our departure. We have vowed to get back to Oahu again some day and spend more time at Turtle Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay is Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! We had a wonderful stay at Turtle Bay!!! It was perfect!! The resort is breathtaking with the ocean views and setting. Our room was larger than we had thought and well designed. We enjoyed our view of the ocean from the room and hearing the waves each morning on our lanai. The staff was awesome. We were so impressed! We ate at Palm Terrace every morning (excellent buffet!!!) and the staff was right there if we needed anything and very friendly. We found the same with the pool and beach staff, maids, front desk staff and those working in the gift shops. Siena who worked the security gate even loaned us one of her CD's of Hawaiian music when she heard we were interested in the music! As far as construction, I did not see any going on in the resort itself. Our room was always very quiet and peaceful. The only construction we saw was by the beach where the condos are going in. We didn't mind as the beach area was nice and not many people. We were too busy swimming and snorkling to notice. My husband really liked the snorkling at their beach, me too!! We saw a lot of various fish, different from those at Humna Bay. It was nice having that so close!! We plan to return to Turtle Bay without hesitation! It was the best!

Reviews.Title: “View is gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Linn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Turtle Bay and really enjoyed the view, but also experienced some of the other problems posted earlier. Construction going on so many walkways blocked off & pool slide was closed. We also found the food to be mediocre & overpriced. Breakfast at Lei Lei's was pretty good, though. We also thought the $12/day charge should be part of the daily room charge instead of giving you the feeling of being nickled & dimed. Our lanai was overlooking the ocean, but was only large enough for one sideways chair! Room was nice, bathroom was large.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Turtle Bay Resort is awsome.......... The scenery, the views, the sense of quietness and peace. I felt like I was part of nature with the luxury of great accomandations at my beck and call. Cocktails at dusk sitting at the pool bar listening to the waves crash against the rocks just 15 feet away was one of my favorite times. Dinner at the restaurant ( I believe 21) was the best meal we had while in Hawaii. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who desires a sense of peace and quite while being pampered by a great staff. Two Thumbs Up............ Gloria

Reviews.Title: “Great time a Turtle Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the setting the golf and the surf were outstanding the staff were working hard to please us and they succeeded we love the place we looked at the new condos being built on the beach the prices seem low compared to oceanfront on maui and on the mainland we are considering buying one they definitely are going to escalate beautiful setting

Reviews.Title: “Regarding Labor Dispute”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha! Just spent a week-end a Turtle Bay. As owner of a Destination Management Company handling groups to Hawaii, I was pleased to report the group I was working with was delighted with the hotel, as was the President of another company who was siteing the property for a future group booked for 2006. No sign of labor dispute what-so-ever

Reviews.Title: “Great Find: The Turtle Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Referred to Turtle Bay by a former business associate as a convenient place to have a business meeting but without the crowds and noise of Waikiki. I was very pleasantly surprised both by the lovely "North Shore" of Oahu as well as the terrific service and amenities of the Turtle Bay Resort. Two great golf courses, horseback riding, near the Polynesian Cultural Center, wonderful beaches, very relaxing atmosphere, helpful and caring staff, very adequate meeting facilities and an excellent value. I found room rates to be almost half of Waikiki and a much more pleasurable atmosphere! Even after the 2 day business meeting, most of our attendees opted to remain at Turtle Bay rather than to go into Honolulu or to another island for the vacation part of the trip! I would recommend without hesitation and would definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Turtle Bay Resort twice in the past two years, and the second time was even better than the first! The rooms are beautiful as are the spectacular ocean views! The pool area is very tropical and the beaches are some of the best on the island. The waves are incredible especially in the winter time. The staff is very friendly, the food is excellent, and we truly enjoyed the laid back attitude of this fantastic resort. My time in Oahu wouldn't have been complete without my stay at the Turtle Bay!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Turtle Bay Resort....The most True Hawaii in Oahu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While on a recent Travel Agent Conference in Oahu, I took my neice of 19 and sister....While most of the conference was in Waikiki and we saw some wonderful hotels and did some great shopping We none felt like this was Hawaii until we went to a dinner on the north shore at Turtle Bay Resort....it was so awesome, peaceful and beautiful, we ended up changing our air and stayed two more days at Turtle Bay...we all agreed it was the most fabulous of all hotels...The food and ambiance was excellent (especially at 21 Degrees North) the staff so efficient and friendly....as a travel agent I will say that this is the Resort I will send my clients to in Oahu...it is great for Honeymooners, Weddings, & Families.... It has everything for everyone, horseback riding on the beach, beautiful golf course, superb spa facilities, private beaches and just so much more...the grounds and pool area are beautiful as well....I left having fallen in love with Turtle Bay and all of the wonderful people there!! It is a place I will return to often...

Reviews.Title: “Worth it to splurge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here May 5 and 6. We wanted to visit the Polynesian Cultural Centre but avoid the long drive back to Waikiki and Turtle Bay was really the only close option. Even with their cheapest rate - a $199 spring special plus the resort fee we knew it was going to cost us over $650 Canadian for 2 nights - 3 times what we would normally pay for a hotel at home. Once we got to Turtle Bay, the money became meaningless - what a beautiful location. We were upgraded to a premium room with a balcony without asking. The room was oversized with a fridge, separate powder and bathrooms, it was spotless and had extra special touches like Q-tips in the room, free little flower petals at the front desk and live macaws in the open air lobby. Waikiki was fun but this felt like real Hawaii - very tropical grounds, lovely pools, one with a waterfall and slide, surfers in the ocean, no end of beaches and areas to walk around, etc. We didn't eat in the restaurants but chose to get groceries in nearby Laie, take advantage of the fridge and eat on the patio a a fraction of the cost. They were filming the new Fox series "North Shore" at TB while we were there. Now that we're back home in cold Canada, we'll definitely be watching Turtle Bay on TV this summer and remembering those 2 fabulous days and glad we made the decision to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “potential management problem”
Reviews.Author: goldendeal40
Reviews.Content: I was interested in booking a vacation at the turtle bay resort in September, I called my travel agent to make some inquiries on the hotel and rates, I was told by my travel agent about some potential problems between management and staff. Turtle Bay Resort is in the midst of an escalating labor dispute with its 250 long-term employees. Due to the hotel’s failure to agree to a new contract with acceptable job security provisions, Turtle Bay workers are urging guests to boycott the hotel until a contract settlement is reached. Any stay at Turtle Bay could be met with pickets and demonstrations at any time. With this information I have made the decision not to stay at this resort at this time. My travel agent tells me there are signs near the hotel that read "Save you a headache and support the Turtle Bay workers and the North Shore community. Don’t stay, dine, or drink at the Turtle Bay Resort" If you have interest in staying at this resort, here is a web site set up for up dates on the continuing dispute and negotiations.http://---------------------------------------------------This really seems like a nice resort, id like to stay here but not under these circumstances, I hope all can be worked out before my trip in September, if not, I will have to find another resort. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “True Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking for true romance this is it! We got married at the Turtle Bay in the beautiful pavillion. It could not be a more romantic getaway. It is peaceful and calm, the opposite of Honolulu. Food was good but expensive. Service was excellent and were treated like true guests. Horseback riding was amazing. My new husband says the Arnold Palmer PGA golf course was like no other. The rooms were clean and contemporary and the ambiance was great. We would definately go back to Turtle Bay. If your looking to get married do it here!

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are used to Hyatt, Marriott, or Westins - Turtle Bay will not measure up. If you like Radisson, Holiday Inn, Best Western, or Hiltons' - then this is your place. Rooms: We upgraded to a suite, and were very disappointed. Much of the extra space is dead, literally unused. The paint and carpet are in average / poor condition, and cleanliness is average. The soaps/lotions are mediocre as well. The advertised large lanai can barely fit 2 chairs - they are turned to face one another to make room. The air conditioners work, but are extremely loud - tv must be turned way up to hear it. To pay these prices, and also endure a $12 daily resort fee (for self parking, coffee, newspaper,…), one can't help but feel ripped off. Food: The food is average, the prices are high. We've paid these prices before; but it comes with excellent service, knowledgeable waitstaff, and culinary preparation & presentation justifying the economics. What you get here is average. Pool: The smaller heated pool is filled with kids, and has but a few places to sit. The larger pool (relative term) is unheated, and just a concrete patio. Beware the pool nazi's. Many Hawaiian resorts ensure you are a guest in order to obtain pool towels. This place also makes sure you return them. Apparently we were off by 1 towel during the stay, and they charged us for it. When challenged, it was promptly removed… but it's evidence of the poor management and policies in place at Turtle Bay. Also, beware of moving a lawn chair onto the grass - they don't like that either. The location also seems to be heavily frequented by locals. Public beach (the cove area) is next door, which could explain the heavy traffic. On balance: The gym is decent. The location is amazing. Commendations to the staff, most are very pleasant. The weather is unpredictable. One can find rain, wind, clouds and sun all in a single day. However, one can golf, surf, snorkel, play tennis, walk the beach, drink and sun all in a day too. Eye's open on booking this hotel. Turtle Bay presumes to be a 1st class resort, but it is not. It is away from the zoo of humanity at Waikiki, but not luxury. Glad we went and experienced the north shore, but next time it's back to Maui or Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation WAS as Good As We Hoped!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe how much we enjoyed the Turtle Bay Resort. We were a little apprehensive with all of the conflicting reviews for the past months but the room was fantastic. We left the lanai doors open so we could feel the breeze and hear the waves at night. The bed was so comfortable and whomever cleaned our room did an amazing job - especially when you consider the amount of sand we probably dragged in from snorkeling every day. We had never snorkeled before and so we enjoyed learning how there at the hotel. The water was perfect. We actually enjoyed snorkeling there at the hotel more than Hanauma Bay (too many people) and Shark's Cove (too dangerous). We LOVED the North Shore. We actually hated having to go to Honolulu and Waikiki to do the tourist things (Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, etc..). We enjoyed going to the Swap Meet at the Aloha Stadium. We found the BEST prices anywhere for gifts to take home. We spent 1/2 a day at Waikiki Beach and were glad we did, but preferred the North Shore. We enjoyed eating at Giovanni's Shrimp Truck and at Kahuku's Shrimp Truck. We had the Shrimp Scampi, BBQ Shrimp, and Hot & Spicy Shrimp plates. They were a bargain at $11.00/plate. They were the best seafood we had there. We also ate at Halewia Joe's, which was good. Our favorite dinner was at Turtle Bay - Lei Lei's. It was fantastic - great food and not as expensive as I would have thought! Our least favorite dinner was also at Turtle Bay - the Palm Terrace. It was overpriced and not very good. We also recommend Mazsamoto's in Halewia for the BEST shaved ice. Our favorite lunch was at Shark's Cove Grill. The BEST cheeseburgers and fish sandwiches with a great view of the ocean (from across the street) while you eat. Would we go back to Turtle Bay - I dream of the day we can go back. We were there from April 8-April 15th and really would have liked to stay another week to do everything that we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location, gorgeous beach”
Reviews.Author: swimswithsharks
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the gorgeous beach here on a previous trip to Hawaii, and decided I would stay here someday. Well, my someday came in March, and I couldn't have been happier with the hotel. This used to be in the Hilton hotel chain, and I've heard that it has lost business since it lost that affiliation. That's a shame, it's still a very nice hotel with a perfect beach. Well, perfect for me, since I am a photography nut. It's not much of a beach for swimming though , with a rough coral bottom and strong waves. That's why there are pools scattered across the deck behind the hotel. It's the most peaceful place you can imagine, though, way out at the end of the North Shore. You can get there on the City Bus cheaply, if you just want to check out the location. We saw whales in the distance from our hotel room, which looked out on the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay was Great”
Reviews.Author: Kiane01
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Turtle Bay Resort and it was such a wonderful place. The staff was great and the food was delicious, although very expensive. I found Haliewa prices to be much better and it is only about 10 miles. The food is very inexpensive, but stay away from the gift shops. One of the best things about the Resort was that they have music in the lobby every night from 6-9. Winter is the best time to go there because the waves are the biggest. What is really unique about Turtle Bay is one side is the bay where the water is calm and the other side by the pool area are the big waves and there is a nice pool side bar to watch the waves from and at night the waves are illuminated with spot lights. It is just beautiful. The Polynesian Cultural Center is right down the road and a must see. I took their Super Ambassador package which gives you your personal tour guide and a front row to everything. It is just fantastic. I can't say enough good things about the north shore in general. It is so nice not to be in that Waikiki tourist area. You won't be sorry if you stay at Turtle Bay!

Reviews.Title: “The Green Sea Turtles Reign Supream-the hotel-is only so-so!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Turtle Bay Resort from 3/25/04- 4/2/04. We arrived at 1:30 am-the open loby is breathtaking upon arrival. Our room the first night was fine. Buffet breakfasts-if they are complimentry are a great value (ours were included in the package), however they are overpriced if you pay out of pocket-go to Sharkes Cove Grill (inexpensive, 5 miles down the road) and better food. The hotel meal service was very good if not outstanding during the breakfast buffets! Hotel service otherwise was nothing to rave about-ever. The airfilter in our room was CLOGGED with soot-we requested several times to have it cleaned and it was not done. As a result the airconditioner sounded like a air compressor going off every 30 seconds all night long-we could NOT sleep-finally has to open the deck door all night to let the waves stop the noise. Room cleaning service was ok, however somewhat hit and miss with daily floor cleaning being there was a lot of sand dragged in, it was not vaccumed or swept up. Pillows were very nice-beds a little hard. Sheets weere see through thin. Decor was nice. This resort is in a lovey location-THE BEST SPOT ON OAHU-NO QUESTIONS ASKED. The facility generally is very good. Overall food service is not that great for meal options besides the breakfast. Lei-Leis is terribly overpriced for an EXTREAMLY poor menu and mediocre food, service in completely unknowledgable--DONT BOTHER going to Lei-Leis! Of special note-you will be charged an outragous $12.00 rooom fee to pay for newspapers, in room coffee, and local phone service-this also covers use of the fitness center and snorkel equipment-its a rip off, it should be build into the room fee, after all its a resort! Also-if you need to leave early (our flight was at 6:00 am and the airport is an hour away)-bring your own alarm clock as the room alarm clock was broken, we requested a wake up call and never got it. When we woke in a panic-we could not get a bell hop to answer the phone to help obring bags down, and the end of our story was crawling over the front desk in the empty loby to go wake the night desk clerk up-he was sound asleep-and could NOT stay awake to check us out. We still dont have a final bill-this was upsetting to say the least. Nice location-the turtles are really there-beside Anna and Annie and the lovel woman that serves at the coffee kiosk (these three staff members were execellent, world class) the service otherwise is terrible! We enjoyed our stay because the location was great and the property is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “The Opposite Of Waikikki Indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Turtle Bay Resort since it appeared to be isolated from Honolulu and the rest of the world. This is a beautiful resort that is indeed nothing like ALL of the other resorts on the island. Waikikki is like New York City- there is wall-to-wall traffic, panhandlers and trash....all competing for a few feet of beach. One look at a photo of the Turtle Bay Hotel communicates all that you need to know. This is paradise at the edge of the world.During our stay, FOX was filming a television show. This made for limited/compromised access to some areas on some days. I brought this to the attention of The Managing Director of the resort. I was very satisfied when he responded to me and made things right. All of the staff were friendly. This is not a low-budget vacation spot. It is well worth considering cashing in some of your IRA monies- sometimes you have to invest in your present in order to make it to your future.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay-a gem on North Shore Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Ralph1955
Reviews.Content: The Turtle Bay Resort is a real gem in paradise. I only got to stay there for 2 nights but I really wanted more. The ocean views from each of the rooms are magnificent and you really feel as if you have escaped from the stresses of everyday life. We were welcomed with style, with fresh flower leis and smiling faces. The lobby is very open aired and the furnishings are minimal, making for a truly zen-like experience. The color scheme is easy on the eyes, so the ocean (the main attraction) doesnt have to take back seat to loud hibiscus Waikiki style prints. The service is thorough and unobtrusive. We had no problems with check in, check out, bell or valet service. Rates are high however, but its worth every penny. Since the hotel occupies several hundred acres (almost as much as Waikiki herself) you are very isolated. You will have to drive out and search for other things to do if you arent the stay-in-the-room type. Hollywood celebrities such as Adam Sandler, Jennifer and Brad, Bruce Willis, and Ricky Schroeder are all frequent guests. There are 2 pools; one is heated and contains a very fun slide for kids. The propery is promoting itself as a Pacific Rim meeting and convention center. The millions of dollars of recent rennovations were well spent. Plasma screen TV's, a business concierge desk, ergonomic chairs are all standard, as well as fantastic ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: QuahogBay
Reviews.Content: . We planned only 2 nights at Turtle Bay and wish we'd planned longer. This is a lovely resort and the people are very friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and had a great view. The bathroom was huge. The only trouble was there were 4 of us, and they would not bring in a roll away. They do have big feather puffs on the bed and gave us another one of those with more blankets and the kids took turns sleeping on the floor. They liked it. We really liked the north shore area.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd trip to Turtle Bay the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: Fidalgo Sue
Reviews.Content: I had been to this resort twice before about 7 years ago when it was a Hilton property, and it was spectacular then. My agent had given me Waikiki packages, then told me about an alternative way to see the best of the island on the North Shore. I loved my stay at Turtle Bay Resort so much I took my mom for a quick getaway a couple months later. I just returned from the newly-remodeled resort, and it is amazing. I had a very reasonable Costco package that gave me $205/night for 7 nights, with the 5th night free and complementary breakfast buffet (way worthy breakfast food). The rennovations are superb - glorious room accomodations, new pools, jacuzzis and cabana chairs, with building facelifts inside and out to reflect a Hawai'ian seafaring feel. There are many new little shops to browse with unique items, not just the usual touristy fare. The new spa is awesome, and so is the fitness center. and they still have the 2 parrots in the lobby! There are 6 places to eat, and most are very pricey, so it was handy to have the breakfast in our package deal and then go out for a late lunch/dinner, or make sandwiches in our room and eat on the lanai. The staff were so sweet to us! Our lady from housekeeping, Adela, was so great and remembered me from my previous visits - she's workded there 25 years. All the desk people, concierge and Palm Terrace restaurant staff were gems. After reading some of the reviews, people should remember: aloha is like a boomerang - show aloha and it comes back to you. The drive to the resort is a real treat - take the H3 East and connect with the Kam Hwy and enjoy the beautiful coastline and tropical fruit roadstands along the way. I would highly recommend this resort. Any questions or to see pictures of my trip, feel free to email me at @suzlen@comcast.net.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 2_gemini
Reviews.Content: We spent about $280/night which was supposedly half off rack rate for a spacious room overlooking the pool area with an ocean view in the distance. The setting of the resort can't be beat. So far so good. BUT the hotel towels were actually threadbare and smallish, the soap bars were minuscule. This theme was carried over to the food portions which were skimpy and although generally quite good, were overpriced. Service was spotty, the worst was when we waited a good 45 minutes for our lunch at poolside. The beds had down comforters. Hello! This is Hawaii! It doesn't get that cold even in January which is when we were there. Speaking of temperature, the airconditioning had two settings, frigid and off. We sandwiched two days at Turtle Bay between two timeshares one on the Big Island and one in Waikiki. Loved the timeshares. Were disappointed in our splurge at Turtle Bay.

Reviews.Title: “loved the area”
Reviews.Author: vinnyjake
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 days in Feb. 2004 Hotel remodeling is just about complete and the hotel is in fine shape. The staff is friendly but not as well trained as you find in most comparable hotels. We only ate in the hotel once and the food was average and the service was less than avergae. The parking lot fills up as it is open to the public. They had a wedding reception there one day and the parking was horrible. Stay here if you have a car and are willing to drive a distance for good restaurants and other activties. The area is rural, on the opposite side of the island as most Oahu hotels. This area is great for R&R; the golf, tennis, horese back riding is superb. We will return (but will avoid the restaurants) at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: Bayturtle
Reviews.Content: This hotel renovation missed the mark. Scratchy poly-cotton sheets, cheap furnishings in some areas, and poor, but overpriced food led us to cut our stay by 1/3. We made a quick escape to the Mandarin Oriental--which lived up to expectations and was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooned there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband honeymooned there a year ago, and I did not use Tripadvisor then, or I would have posted when we got back. The hotel was really great, they were still undergoing the remodel, but everyone was so friendly and helpful, any inconvenience we may have had was negligible in comparison. We were given a great room that had a spectacular view of the ocean and the bay...the room itself was very nice, very nice bed, decor, and very clean. We ate at the restaurant in the main building several times, and the food was always very good. We had reservations to try out some of their other restaurants, but when it came time we opted to try the restaurants in nearby Haleiwa instead, which we enjoyed tremendously. All in all, it was a great stay, and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon there. I'd actually give this rating a 4 ?. The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is a few minor problems we had with the room itself. The main one being the air conditioner (which is in the ceiling) leaked continuously whenever it was on. Their only solution to the problem was to put a hand written sign on the climate controls stating, 'Do not turn on'. Whatever...we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. If you want a laid back atmosphere in the middle of paradise away from busy Honolulu, then this is your place. I really don't understand some of the negative reviews on this site. We thought the place was fantastic. The hotel was first class. The view from the room was incredible. Every staff person we dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful with any requests we had. The pool/hot tub area was really cool, with the ocean waves rolling in just 20 feet from the pool...great view. Word of warning however, the pool is extremely cold. Maximum shrinkage factor. I found the ocean to be warmer. Tip...if you are interested in scuba diving for the first time, they offer a free course every Friday morning in the pool area at 9:30 to learn the basics and get used to the equipment. From there you can decide if you want to do an ocean dive. My wife and I did our very first dives from there and loved it. Stu the instructor was the best. Tip 2...drive down the coast to Haleiwa for dinner. There are some great places to eat at in this small surf town (Haleiwa Joe's or Jamison's By The Sea being two of them).

Reviews.Title: “Good location...Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I knew form the moment we started our drive down the entrance way that this hotel was not what it seemed like on the internet. Great lobby and Great staff! Really must give kudos to the staff they were very accomodating. Our room was okay like every other 3 star hotel out there. Bed was great, furnishings were sparse and the paint job was awful. Where this Hotel fails miserably is its food, every meal we had was terrible words couldnt describe how bad! Considering that this hotel is far away from everything they need to do something about this. Unfortunatley the hotel is in such a beautiful location its kind of a waste.

Reviews.Title: “This feel like t remodeled Hilton in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not that bad for the price! Our room was overlooking the beach where we could swim and we loved the view! We had one of the rooms with the smaller balconies which was find for two to sit on but no more. The balconies on the pool side are large enough to lounge on and have a meal. The service at this resort was very spotty, granted we were there the week after Christmas and they were completely booked and slightly under staffed for the crowd. The large pool was not heated and none really swam in it. The service at the pool bar was sort of sloppy at times and it seemed like the workers where some of the original people that worked at this resort when it was a Hilton. This caused most of the children at the resort to swim in the smaller pool that the slide dumps into. This was sort of disappointing that the crowd could not really swim in the larger pool. Getting our chairs by the pool was difficult until we learned that after breakfast we needed to go out an claim our spot. Problem with this process is that there were chairs by the pool that no one used most of the day but they left their things there to save their spot. The game room for the kids was sort of on the older side and not well maintained. The front desk was severely under staffed and we had to wait 20 min in line to check into our room. The restaurants at the resort were very kid friendly definitely a plus. We were very impressed with the snorkeling right there at the beach by the hotel, we did not expect to see much in that bay. Not sure we would go back but again it was good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We have been to the Turtle Bay 3 times and will continue to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Turtle Bay 3 times since 1998 and have loved every minute we stayed there. Each time we spent 8 nights and we didn't have one complaint. Our rooms were always clean and what we expected and the views? We were always overwhelmed. The service was supereach and every time. However, we are not picky and were just thankful we are able to afford to go where we were surrounded by such beauty... Yes, the food is expensive, but we found that most any place you eat in Hawaii is expensive with the exception of McDonald's. We aren't big eaters so this wasn't an issue with us. Frankly, the only thing that even remotely bothered us was the parking fee. Finally, last year we ventured to Maui (instead of our annual trek to the Turtle Bay) and we stayed at the Embassy Suites. Yes, the rooms were great; however, the views and the ambiance of being on your own secluded island was missing. Thus, back we go to Oahu and the Turtle Bay this coming May. Why mess with paradise and perfection?Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Location, Very Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For those fo you who have never been to the northshore of Oahu, it is a truly magnificent land of pounding surf, magnificent landscapes and country people. I love the northshore and was so glad that Turtle Bay was getting the renewal but what a disappointment! I stayed over the weekend and I have to say the management of this hotel is appalling. It seems like when a mistake is made (and there were lots of them, especially in Room Service and at the front door), everyoe gets involved in a huge round of finger-pointing. Well, I know this business and apparently the management company does not. The staff is friendly as ever, and clueless. I never ever saw a manager around...seems they were too busy with paperwork (told this multiple times). Now about the renovation....this place is being built out like a big aircraft hangar. Blazing lights in the lobby at night...what is the story? The Bay CLub is still a dump, the Palm Terrace is so huge you could get lost, but I liked the food and service in 21 Degrees, just too expensive for every evening. Try dinner on the beach...it was great, or go to LeiLei's. I don;t think this hotel is ever going to make it. and even though the renovation is a major improvement, they need a company like Hyatt to set things right. Someday, the Hyatt Kuilima may come back....wishful thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: islandkine
Reviews.Content: For as much as they charge for these rooms I expected to be really impressed. Actually, the rooms were just average. I stayed at this hotel when it was owned by the hilton and the only difference I can see is that they slapped on new paint and raised the price by a couple of hundred dollars. (I do admit the new lobby has a breath taking view. Too bad my room wasn't in the lobby.)The rooms are not as nice as some of the rooms I have had at the Sheraton, Marriott, Raddison or Hilton at 1/3 of the price. And to top this off they inform you that they only change the sheets every third day. A concept that I don't usually have a problem with but not when I'm paying premium price. And not even a mint on the pillow. The ocean view was partially blocked by the roof of the floor below. The bell boys waited for me to take all my luggage out and put it on the dolly then I tipped them to take it to my room. In my opinion this hotel has alot to learn about running a first class hotel. Maybe they should send someone to visit the Marriott at the Warner center in California or the Radisson by Disneyland to see how first class hotels are run.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Greatly improved since the rennovation. The new decor is simple, sleek and comfortable. The beds and bedding are SUPER comfortable (something most Hawaii hotels lack). The pools (especially at night) are wonderful. The views, and proximity to the ocean -- amazing. Almost every room has an incredible view. The staff was also friendly and welcoming. THE NOT SO GOOD: Lack of food options. The hotel has several restaurants, but not a lot of variety in the food selections. It was either extremely pricey dinner selections, or overpriced burgers and pizza. Quality was a real issue. We ordered several meals that came to the table (or our room) cold, undercooked, or overcooked. Better bet for food, drive to Haleiwa to eat, or drive into Honolulu for special dinners. While the decor is beautiful, due to some of the designer choices, it was already starting to show some serious sign of wear and tear (after only a year). If the hotel is going to continue to charge 4 star rates, they're going to need keep the hotel better than they appear to now. OVERALL: This is the place to stay if you love the ocean, and Oahu's North Shore environment, a great place for people who are familiar with Hawaii and want something mellow. This is not a place to go if you want easy access to activites, and great food, or easy beach access. It's a place to take a book, sit by the pool and drink mai tais.

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Bay - leave the little ones at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at Turtle Bay with our two children - 8 months and 2½ years. The staff was wonderful -- very friendly and kind. The resort is absolutely breathtaking. It could not have been more beautiful. The flood lights on the ocean at night completed the resort's beauty. The rooms were spacious and clean -- we had two queen beds. The white duvets on the comfy beds proved how clean the room and linens were! I think every room has a view of the ocean. Our room overlooked the pools, ocean and beach. We had an adequate-sized lanai with 2 chairs and a small table. Unfortunately we spent most of our time in our room and on the lanai. No one's fault but Mother Nature's that it rained for the majority of the days we were there. This was not your typical Hawaiian rain either; we were drenched if we ventured two feet out of shelter! I would definitely recommend this resort for a couple who wants some relaxation. I would NOT recommend this resort for those traveling with infants or toddlers -- like us! We were too confined when it rained. There was no where to go for shelter and the resort really did not cater to the very young. They advertised babysitting services, but we never were able to utilize one. As for the restaurants, the food was good and there was a large selection. The prices were occasionally fair -- if you could locate the price beforehand. We enjoyed the Sunday buffet at the Palm Terrace, but did not enjoy the price at $30 per person! (We could not find the price advertised.) Great selection of martinis at 21 North, but the bartender needs to fill the glasses. Highly recommend Lei Leis down the road. The food and service were excellent, the portion sizes were more than generous and the drinks are awesome. I agree with the consensus... the $12 resort fee at Turtle Bay was odd. Would I return? Maybe... but without the kids... We just had bad luck with the weather and were stuck inside most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Turtle Bay Resort from Oct 27 - Nov 4 2003. I was worried by some of the reviews I read in Tripadvisor, but if you are planing on going to the Turtle Bay I just want to give you a heads up: The hotel is amazing! 800 Acrees of natural beauty, private beaches where you are going to be the only one around, trails for hiking or horse backriding, an outstanding golf course (We don't play but you could tell..) Our room had the most espectacular view! They wanted to move us to a cottage, but we refuse to change our room! the pools are great, you are swiming in the pool while watching the sea in the horizon! romantic. The food is expensive, yes! but it is worth every dime! If you are honeymooners I recommend that you do a private chef tasting in the beach, they arrange a table close to the beach, you have private service and 7 courses of the most espectacular food. The chef (Michele) is one of a kind! I wrote him that I expected food in heaven to be just as the one in Turtle Bay. Also visit the 21 North restaurant, it is just the best food you can get. At lunch, don't miss the Ahi sandwich by the pool! If you want activities, ask Nilma Hunter in the desk! great help! Everyone was very helpfull. It is a beautiful place! If you stay in Turtle Bay you must go many times to Hailewa. A great town with great stores and great restaurants! ( Caffe Notte! wow). We went one day to see Waikiki, however, after that we realized that everything we wanted was in teh North Shore in the hotel. Thanks Turtle Bay, it was a great Honeymoon.
